author: {'steamid': '76561198008360449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1590706239}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist zweifellos ein Juwel in der Krone des Point-and-Click-Adventure-Genres. Dieses zeitlose Meisterwerk von LucasArts hat nicht nur eine treue Fangemeinde √ºber Jahrzehnte hinweg begeistert, sondern stellt auch heute noch einen H√∂hepunkt der Spielekunst dar.

Die Geschichte von Day of the Tentacle ist so skurril wie genial. Als Spieler schl√ºpft man in die Rollen von drei ungew√∂hnlichen Helden, die sich auf einer absurden Zeitreise befinden, um die Welt vor einem b√∂sen, lila Tentakel zu retten. Die Dialoge sind voller Witz und Charme und die Charaktere sind so liebenswert wie schrullig, was einen unvergesslichen Eindruck hinterl√§sst.

Die Grafiken m√∂gen zwar pixelig sein, aber sie haben nichts von ihrem Charme verloren. Jeder Schauplatz ist mit liebevollen Details gef√ºllt, die die surreale Welt des Spiels zum Leben erwecken. Die Cartoon-√Ñsthetik verleiht dem Spiel einen zeitlosen und einzigartigen Look, der auch nach all den Jahren noch begeistert.

Das R√§tseldesign von Day of the Tentacle ist einfach brillant. Die cleveren Kopfn√ºsse und das innovative Zeitreise-Mechanik sorgen f√ºr eine herausfordernde, aber nie frustrierende Spielerfahrung. Die R√§tsel sind logisch und einfallsreich und regen die grauen Zellen an, ohne jemals unfair zu wirken.

Die Steuerung ist intuitiv und benutzerfreundlich, was Day of the Tentacle zu einem perfekten Einstieg in das Genre macht, sowohl f√ºr Veteranen als auch f√ºr Neueinsteiger. Die M√∂glichkeit, zwischen den drei Charakteren zu wechseln und ihre einzigartigen F√§higkeiten zu nutzen, verleiht dem Gameplay zus√§tzliche Tiefe und Vielfalt.

Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle ein zeitloses Meisterwerk, das auch nach all den Jahren nichts von seinem Charme verloren hat. Mit seiner genialen Geschichte, seinem skurrilen Humor und seinem cleveren R√§tseldesign ist es ein Muss f√ºr jeden Liebhaber von Point-and-Click-Adventures und ein zeitloser Klassiker, der noch viele Generationen von Spielern begeistern wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348368557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1585757511}
review:
Un viaggio nostalgico nel cuore dell'avventura

Day of the Tentacle Remastered √® una gioia per i fan del genere avventura punta e clicca, e un invito irresistibile per coloro che amano i classici del passato. Questa versione rimasterizzata di un titolo cult del 1993 offre un'esperienza di gioco che √® tanto fresca e coinvolgente oggi quanto lo era all'epoca del suo debutto.

Fin dall'inizio, ti cattura con il suo umorismo affascinante, il design del mondo bizzarro e i personaggi indimenticabili. Il gioco trasuda charme e creativit√† in ogni sua parte, dalla trama avvincente all'umorismo intelligente che ti fa sorridere anche nei momenti pi√π difficili.

Gli aggiornamenti grafici sono stati eseguiti con cura, mantenendo lo stile unico e vibrante del gioco originale mentre lo portano al passo con i tempi moderni. I colori brillanti, le animazioni fluide e i dettagli affascinanti rendono ogni scena un'opera d'arte interattiva.

Ma √® la trama che √® il vero punto forte di Day of the Tentacle Remastered. Viaggiare nel tempo per risolvere enigmi e impedire al malvagio tentacolo viola di prendere il controllo del mondo √® un'avventura avvincente e coinvolgente che ti tiene incollato allo schermo fino alla fine.

Il gameplay punta e clicca √® intuitivo e gratificante, con enigmi ben progettati che richiedono un mix di logica, creativit√† e un pizzico di follia. La variet√† di personaggi giocabili e le loro abilit√† uniche aggiungono profondit√† e diversit√† all'esperienza di gioco.

In conclusione, Day of the Tentacle Remastered √® un capolavoro rimasterizzato che cattura perfettamente lo spirito del gioco originale mentre lo porta verso nuove vette di eccellenza. Se sei un appassionato di avventure punta e clicca o semplicemente desideri rivivere un classico intramontabile, questo gioco √® un must-have assoluto. Preparati a immergerti in un viaggio nostalgico che ti riporter√† indietro nel tempo e ti lascer√† con un sorriso sul viso per lungo tempo dopo aver terminato l'avventura.

review:
Pure nostalgia. It was great to play in '93 and just as fun in 30+ years later, remastered with improved graphics to make it playable in the modern day and age. I have always been a big fan of the 90's point and click adventures. A lot of fun to play and added directors commentary are quite interesting to hear how things came together.
Purchased in a steam sale at a reduced price, even with my love of this game i'm not sure I'd pay the full price of ¬£10.99 for a game from the 90's.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006004632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1710257616}
review:
Possibly the best Lucasarts point and click adventure game, and therefore possibly the best point and click adventure game ever made.

Hoagie, Laverne and Bernard travel through time and cause havoc in the 18th Century, the present day and a tentacle-ruled dystopian future . The original boasted fantastic graphics, hilarious off the wall humour and challenging but ultimately gettable puzzles.

The remastered version has all this, plus tastefully updated graphics and soundtrack (if you're old like me and prefer the originals you can switch between these and the remastered ones), developer's commentary and a fantastic gallery of the original background sketches and paintings by Peter Chan & co. 

It's a nailed on, cast iron classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995519602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1473574996}
review:
Wow, was f√ºr eine Zeitreise in die Kindheit mit Day of the Tentacle, Monkey Island, Full Throttle, Baphomets Fluch, den ersten Sam & Max Teilen und was es so gab.
Ich bin so dankbar, dass diese Spiele nochmal neu aufgelegt gekommen sind.
Wie schnell mein Hirn sich auch noch an alles wieder erinnert hat und damit fast schon zu schnell durchs Spiel gekommen bin. Das sah damals noch ganz anders aus - da war f√ºr das ein oder andere R√§tsel sogar ein L√∂sungsheft notwendig.
Insbesondere Personen, die das Spiel fr√ºher noch nicht erlebt haben, kann ich dieses Spiel empfehlen. Allein der Humor ist einfach grandios und einiges davon w√ºrde wohl wegen "political correctness" und anderen Themen heute so nicht mehr ohne weiteres umgesetzt werden.
Wie eine interaktive humorvolle Geschichte mit ein wenig Point & Click.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006580562', 'num_games_owned': 583, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1658618709}
review:
Auf dieses Spiel habe ich mich gefreut, wollte nach so langer Zeit dieses mal wieder Spielen. Habe noch die alte CD von damals, aus dem Jahre 1993. Der Nachfolger von Maniac Mansion, der damals wie auch heute im Remastered wieder als Vollversion dabei ist.

Spiel 8 von 10:

Auch heute noch ist der Humor dieses Games einfach super. Man spielt Hoagie, ein Metalfan der in die Vergangenheit zu George Washington festsitzt und wieder in seine Zeit m√∂chte. Bernard, der Streber sitzt in der Gegenwart und m√∂chte nat√ºrlich seine Freunde wieder hier haben. Und zum guten schluss noch Laverne die in die Zukunft geschmissen wurde und wieder zur√ºck m√∂chte. In der Zukunft haben die Tentaclen die Welt an sich gerissen und Menschen sind ihre Haustiere. Man steuert alle drei um die R√§tsel zu l√∂sen und die Tentacle in der Gegenwart zu hindern die Welt zu erobern. Gegenst√§nde werde dabei √ºber die Klo Zeitmaschine hin und her geschickt. 

Musik 8 von 10:

 Die Musik ist wie man sie aus den 90er Jahren kennt und untermalt das Spiel sehr gut. Passt zu der Art von Spiel und ich finde das sie nicht zu sehr nervt.

Gameplay 8 von 10:

Das spiel wird wie man es gewohnt ist bei Klick and Point Adventures per Maus und / oder Tastatur. Benutze das mit das oder sprich mit dem. Damals war das durch z. B. Maniac Mansion und Zack McKracken eine Neuerung. Die Figuren kommentieren, alles was man so von den m√∂chte, meistens mit sehr ironischen und lustigen Kommentaren. Nach ein paar Minuten hat man den dreh raus und es geht einen total leicht von der Hand. Das Spiel selbst ist circa 6 bis 10 Stunden lang, wer Maniac Mansion 1 spielen m√∂chte geht in der Gegenwart mit Bernard in das Zimmer von Fred Edison an seinen PC. Da kann man dann den Kompletten ersten Teil spielen. Nett, das es auch im Remastered so geblieben ist.

Grafik 7 von 10:

√úber die Grafik m√ºssen wir uns nicht wirklich unterhalten, sie nat√ºrlich nicht Zeitgem√§√ü. Auf Knopf druck kann man in die Grafik von damals und heute wechseln. Die neue Grafik hat das Spiel nur angepasst und es nicht in die heutige Zeit geholt. Bei dem Spiel, aber auch nicht so wichtig. Es ist heute, wie damals Comic Artig und Skurril, sehr detailliert und voller kleiner Easter Ecks. Alles im allen sehr gelungen und vor allem sehr h√ºbsch aufgefrischt. 

Wer Spiele aus den 90er mag und Retro Fan ist wird mit diesem Spiel, welches auch komplett Deutsch Synchronisiert und Vertont wurde, eine Menge Spa√ü haben. F√ºr Retro Fans ein have must. Mir hat es auf jeden Fall sehr viel Spa√ü gemacht. Gut wusste ja auch viele R√§tsel noch, deswegen war ich schneller durch. Kann es nur empfehlen, die Firma hat sich sehr viel m√ºhe gegeben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114662499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1708797128}
review:
Decades later, Day of the Tentacle is still holding its own, now as a remaster. It is definitely one of the better point-n-click games. The remastered version allows switching between the new cleaned-up graphics and the old way more pixelated visuals, providing a choice between a modernised or the old-school input scheme. Bonus developer commentary, game art as well as the included Maniac Mansion are appreciated.

Day of the Tentacle Remastered is one of the easiest recommendations for me.

review: Un clasicazo de la epoca dorada de los juegos de aventuras graficas. La remasterizaci√≥n es simplemente perfecta, y la opci√≥n de cambiar entre el aspecto clasico y el remasterizado es lo mejor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025103501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1707524811}
review:
Great remaster of a classic adventure game! Played this remaster with my daughter to introduce her to classic adventure games and she loved it. 

The option to flick back and forth to old and new was really appreciated, as well as all the little bonus features.
I admire the respect they put into the visual update - everything was redrawn but they kept all of the original artwork, colours and design without changing anything, so it just looks like a beautiful crisp upscale rather than some ugly 'modernised' redesign. Made me notice details that were always in the original scenes, just difficult to make out in the original pixel graphics. 

The sound restoration and re-recorded score was wonderful (the uncompressed dialogue is so crisp now)!

Though I would have liked an option to retain the classic verb interface, I can see why the change was needed, and the expanded wide-screen graphics more than make up for the occasional fiddly right-click options. 

Weird obtuse puzzles are all still there... We even got stuck a couple of times, which was a pleasant surprise for a game I've played half a dozen times. I appreciate the restraint in not adding a hint system.  

Strong recommend.

review: Como eu gosto de Adventures Point & Click, eu gosto muito desse cl√°ssico dos anos 90 e recomendo para todos interessados. N√£o s√≥ para aqueles que conhecem e amam o g√™nero mas tamb√©m aqueles que querem se aventurar nesse tipo de game pela primeira vez. Recomendad√≠ssimo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981494710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1707751086}
review:
Sch√∂ner Point-and-Click-Klassiker. In den 90ern ist [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] leider total an mir vorbeigerauscht, aber auch 30 Jahre sp√§ter im Jahre 2024 ist das Spiel ein angenehmer Zeitvertreib f√ºr ~4-8 Stunden.

Ich hab es ausschlie√ülich im Pixelmodus gespielt und nur ab und zu mal in den neuen Modus gewechselt. Der neue Modus hat mir leider nicht gefallen, daher finde ich es gro√üartig, dass der Wechsel [i]jederzeit[/i] bei DOTT Remastered m√∂glich ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076290934', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1707677731}
review:
Una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas de todos los tiempos remasterizada.

Day of the Tentacle se trata de un videojuego point and click de la antigua y querida Lucas Arts con un gran sentido del humor y una aventura bizarra llena de gags y viajes en el tiempo. Es una secuela del antiguo Maniac Mansion el cual no es obligatorio para entender este pero se recomienda jugar primero.

Esta versi√≥n remasterizada trae un lavado de cara que mejora los gr√°ficos del juego original y trae mejoras en la jugabilidad. A√∫n as√≠ se puede jugar el original sin ning√∫n cambio con solo apretar el F1.



Para quien no conozca este juego, pues se trata de una aventura gr√°fica protagonizada por tres personajes los cuales deben salvar el mundo de ser invadido por unos malvados tent√°culos.

Y esto lo har√°n viajando a trav√©s del tiempo: Bernard en el presente, Hoagie en el pasado y Laverne en el futuro. Tres personajes que controlaremos en el mismo escenario pero en diferentes lineas de tiempo.

Lo que diferencia a Day of the Tentacle con el resto de juegos del mismo g√©nero es que aqu√≠ deberemos hacer que estos tres frikis se ayuden mutuamente de forma que lo que ocurra en el pasado afectar√° al futuro y deber√°n pasarse objetos entre ellos para resolver los puzzles, lo que amplia la escala de un escenario bastante grande y lleno de detalles a tres escenarios grandes y llenos de detalles.



Es una historia muy absurda, pero tambi√©n muy divertida.

Day of the Tentacle viene a ser uno de estos juegos que no se toma en serio a si mismo y sabe crear escenas muy graciosas mediante di√°logos desternillantes, as√≠ como escenas muy absurdas y puzzles rid√≠culos que vuelve el juego un festival de risas.

Y todo sin necesidad de recurrir a humor est√∫pido que d√© verg√ºenza ajena ni humor escatol√≥gico de mal gusto que trata a sus jugadores como si fueran tontos. Porqu√© aunque Day of the Tentacle est√© dirigido a ni√±os, no significa que los trate como idiotas. Es un juego para todos los p√∫blicos y todos los p√∫blicos se divierten por igual, raz√≥n por la que muchos adultos con nostalgia les siga gustando este juego.



Ahora bien, la parte mala del juego es que sigue siendo una aventura gr√°fica antigua y se nota demasiado. Y no lo digo porque el juego se sienta anticuado, sino porque a d√≠a de hoy su dise√±o es inaceptable.

Por mucho que moleste a los jugadores veteranos, este juego a d√≠a de hoy es indisfrutable si no juegas con una gu√≠a que te diga lo que tienes que hacer. Sus rompecabezas no siguen ninguna l√≥gica y todo es adivinar por pura suerte lo que los desarrolladores hab√≠an pensado para resolver un puzzle.


Por ejemplo: para desbloquear a Laverne (futuro) tienes que cortar el √°rbol en el pasado. Eso lo tiene que hacer George Washington, pero solo corta cerezos y el √°rbol que est√° colgada Laverne tiene naranjas. Soluci√≥n: Pintar las naranjas con un bote de pintura rojo.

Y este es todav√≠a de los f√°ciles. Imagina cuando tengas a los tres personajes desbloqueados y debas transportar los objetos en las diferentes l√≠neas de tiempo para resolver los pr√≥ximos puzzles.


Vamos, que es un juego que solo puedes hacer dos cosas:
- O probar al azar los diferentes objetos con otros objetos y elementos del escenario, incluidos los NPC.
- O verte una gu√≠a para saber que es lo que tienes que hacer.

Obviamente esto antes era aceptable porque no hab√≠an tantos juegos como antes y 1 solo ten√≠a que durar mucho.

Igual pasa con el tema de la dificultad artificial que antes era aceptable pero ahora sabemos diferenciar entre un juego dif√≠cil y uno injusto.


Day of the Tentacle es un juego que ha envejecido bastante mal. Y me sabe mal porque me gusta mucho sus chistes, personajes, gr√°ficos (tanto los originales como el remaster) y banda sonora.

Pero las cosas hay que decirlas claras. A d√≠a de hoy un juego que no ayude a los jugadores a terminar su historia principal (el contenido secundario opcional no es necesario, podr√≠an ser Easter Eggs escondidos o chistes ocultos que fuesen dif√≠ciles de encontrar) no puede ser aceptable a d√≠a de hoy. 
Esto no es alta dificultad, es una p√©rdida de tiempo.









En resumen:

De las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas junto a Monkey Island y Grim Fandango. Ahora con un buen lavado de cara.


Day of the Tentacle, al igual que su primera entrega Maniac Mansi√≥n, no ser√° de las aventuras gr√°ficas m√°s populares, pero si de las m√°s queridas por ser de las m√°s divertidas y tronchantes.

Pero como ya dije antes, si eres un jugador nuevo que nunca jug√≥ antes al juego original o, peor todav√≠a, una aventura gr√°fica, ve con la consciencia que este juego, pese a formar parte del g√©nero de rompecabezas, no sigue ninguna l√≥gica y deber√°s depender de una gu√≠a a no ser que no te moleste perder el tiempo en resolver puzzles sin sentido.


Gracias por su lectura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872047952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1707480398}
review:
Sadly this game is very overrated. Its just an average game. Not good, not bad. Just okay. 

My biggest problem with the game is the setting. You stay in the same house trough the entire game. This kind of game needs more variety.  

Also its very short. Amanita games for example are much much shorter. But they offer a much bigger variety in characters, places and backgrounds. So you feel that there is much more contend made. In day of the tentacle you have lots of back tracking and need to switch your items around between 3 characters, which makes the play time much longer, without adding new content. 

The story plays in a house. Which is the most borring setting you can choose for a point and click adventure. Just a big house. Nothing special. I mean come on its called "Day of the tentacle". Everyone who reads this title thinks automatically about Cthulhu and all the cool places HP Lovecraft wrote. Like pyramids, antarctica, forgotten temples, swamps. Everything scary. And then you play in a normal house. Not even a spooky mansion. Most of the rooms look very normal. 

You have 3 characters they all go to different time periods. So you basically go trough the same house with all 3 characters just in other time periods. The house of course looks different in each time. But its still the same house. In stead of this, the game makers could have made different backgrounds to wonder around in. To me this feels like they reused the same assets to make production easier. This would not be a problem for me if the game would be much longer and we would later get to other places. But it stays in the house for the entire game, 

The humor most of the time does not work for me. Most of the characters feel very cartoony but fail to be funny. Like you meet the founders of america but none of them really say anything funny. I do not understand why they where in this game at all. All other characters are more interessting. 

The three time periods made the backtracking much longer. Because you always have to go to the time machine with both characters you want to exchange itmes. This takes away a lot of time. And if you are stuck you really dont want to sent any item to very time period to try it out there. This would take to much time. So people are much more likly to use a walktrough. Which is a bad thing. There should be a shortcut for sending items or to get to the time machine.

Like I said at the beginning its not a bad game. I only pointed out the negative points. Because the other reviews are mostly very very positive and I found this game on high spots on lots of best point and click adventure lists. And dont think it should be in any top 10 list. Because I played lot of point and click adventures which much more interessting settings and characters. That didnt have this much enoying backtracking. 

The story is fine. The main characters are funny. Some of the side characters didnt entertain me at all. Others where interessting to talk to. The game has some good moments, some average. I would buy it on a discount, not full price.

review:
Day of the Tentacle es una de las grandes aventuras gr√°ficas que hicieron grande este g√©nero, junto con The curse of Monkey Island. Tendremos que volver 1 d√≠a al pasado para evitar que el Tent√°culo morado beba agua contaminada y se vuelva inteligente y despiadado, para que no conquiste el mundo.

Sin embargo, un peque√±o error de c√°lculo hace que nuestros 3 protagonistas acaben en el pasado, presente y futuro, lo que nos llevar√° a tomar decisiones que generen paradojas temporales y as√≠ poder restablecer el orden del mundo. Una historia divertida, tensa y fresca.

Una joya atemporal que llega remasterizada, aunque tambi√©n permite la opci√≥n de jugarlo con los graficos y jugabilidad original. Esta aventura gr√°fica es historia de los videojuegos, ¬°No te la puedes perder!

author: {'steamid': '76561198200563011', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1440, 'last_played': 1706783608}
review:
[h1]Three teenagers against a tyrannical tentacle[/h1]

If you played the original Day of the Tentacle way back in 1993, you are already aware of how beloved it is in the point-and-click adventure community. If this is your first time playing, then I envy you. This game will always hold a special place in my heart, having watched and helped my dad complete it when I was young. It's one of those titles where everyone who enjoys adventure games should play at least once. Here's why this remaster needs to be checked out and why you should revisit it.

[u][b]Positives[/b][/u]

+ You can easily toggle between the remastered and the original graphics. The art in the remastered version has been redrawn, moving on from the pixel art from the original. The new detailed high-definition 2D visuals look absolutely glorious.

+ You can switch between the remastered and the original audio. In 1993, it was MIDI, but the remaster has CD quality, which means the voice acting is smoother and of higher quality.

+ The humour still holds up. There are numerous gags and the comedy is diverse enough to satisfy a wide range of players. The slapstick and zany-esque humour I gravitate towards. 

+ An updated interface. There is now a scroll wheel instead of a cluttered list of actions and verbs like the original. I personally much prefer the scroll wheel, but you can switch to either.

+ You can mix different settings together. For example, enable remastered graphics, but the classic audio and interface.

+ You can choose to turn on the developer commentary, which gives more insight into the making of the game from Tim Schafer and others, which I always appreciate. I would recommend not turning this on the first time for new players.

+ An interesting and captivating plot backed up by loveable and engaging characters alongside some of the best dialogue you'll ever come across in an adventure game. This game has soul.

[u][b]Negatives[/b][/u]

- There is no hint system implemented. Depending on the sort of player you are, you may see this as more of a positive than a negative. I wouldn't say the game is that difficult. Some puzzles might come across as a little more obscure than others, but overall, it shouldn't prove to be too much of a challenge.

[u][b]Conclusion[/b][/u]

Day of the Tentacle has certified legendary status when it comes to point-and-click adventure games. If you had a blast playing the likes of Full Throttle, Grim Fandango and Monkey Island, then you NEED this in your life. Playing the remastered version only made me appreciate the game even more than I did previously. You can tell it was only handled with love and care from the original creators. Do yourself a favour and get it now!

[h3]üí¨ Comments üí¨[/h3]
[h2]Short Game Description[/h2]
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a classic point-and-click game that features the story of three friends who have to save the world from the domination of an evil tentacle while travelling to the past, but they will encounter in their adventure many adversities.
[list]
[*][h3]Positives[/h3]
Discussing the positives, first of all, the overall gameplay feels solid; it's a point-and-click that has some original and revolutionary mechanics in the genre, such as playing three different characters with each of them in different frames, where they will occasionally need the help of the others to solve difficult and original puzzles. Secondly, even if it's a remaster, it aged well; the art style achieves a great setting supported by the music and sound effects that hold up well until today. Thirdly, the story is interesting; even if it's a bit childish, it achieves a short and enjoyable adventure with light touches of humour. Additionally, it features achievements that are interesting and fun to do.
[*][h3]Negatives[/h3]
On the negative side, I didn't find anything noteworthy.
[/list][h2][u]Conclusion[/u][/h2]
In short, the game is probably one of the best point-and-click games out there that has unique mechanics of gameplay that make it special in the genre as it features a fun story with light touches of humour. The game is an 8.25/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198976354869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 32, 'playtime_at_review': 1200, 'last_played': 1712448207}
review: This game is wonderful. From the goofy story to the clever timeline-altering puzzles, this is a great remaster of a classic. In my opinion, this is one of, if not the best of the classic point and click adventure games. The puzzles are challenging, but not to the point of frustration. Whenever I figured out a way to progress, I had a sense of completion rather than frustration due to the absurdity of a puzzle, a problem in most puzzle games. If you're looking to get into these types of games, this is a great place to start.

review:
Good stuff, brings back memories of 90s point and clicks. This one holds up surprisingly well despite just being primarily a graphics overhaul with some QoL stuff.

My only complaint is they never patched an annoying audio bug that crops up after an hour or two sometimes, and you've got to restart the game to get rid of it. 

Definitely worth the few bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561199043060818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1674419842}
review:
The Lucas Arts classic!  Remastered.  A must play for anyone who wants to experience one of the cornerstone adventure RPG.  
Switching between characters is a Double Fine trademark that adds another wrinkle to the experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043967856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1703765751}
review:
Never played or heard of the original and went in with no expectations, maybe seeking that ye olde gam experience.  But ended up using a guide to complete it without having to waste time navigating ridiculous puzzles.

Pros:
- interesting animations to seek out in the environment
- much of the dialogue is witty
- art style is endearing and gives ye olde art vibes of computer programs and games of the era

Cons:
- Puzzles start ok but you could make a strong case against several of the item usages.  Sometimes the absurdity is part of the fun - but sometimes it is also fun not to have to click every item on every object in the world to find out what it was "supposed" to do.  It really shows how far games have come in modern times
- Voice acting and recording is poor quality

author: {'steamid': '76561197961114362', 'num_games_owned': 1408, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1487810951}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist ein klassisches Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspiel, das urspr√ºnglich im Jahr 1993 ver√∂ffentlicht wurde. Es wurde von vielen Spielern und Kritikern als eines der besten Spiele seiner Zeit gelobt.

Das Spiel bietet eine einzigartige und humorvolle Handlung, in der die Spieler drei Charaktere steuern, die in der Zeit reisen, um die Welt vor einem b√∂sen Tentakel zu retten. Die R√§tsel sind kreativ und herausfordernd, und die Spieler m√ºssen oft logisch denken und verschiedene Gegenst√§nde kombinieren, um voranzukommen.

Die Grafik und der Sound des Spiels sind im Retro-Stil gehalten, was dem Spiel einen charmanten und nostalgischen Touch verleiht. Die Dialoge sind witzig und die Charaktere sind liebenswert und gut geschrieben.

Es ist wichtig zu beachten, dass Day of the Tentacle ein √§lteres Spiel ist und einige Spieler m√∂glicherweise mit der veralteten Grafik und dem Gameplay nicht vertraut sind. Wenn du ein Fan von klassischen Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspielen bist und den Retro-Stil magst, k√∂nnte Day of the Tentacle eine gute Wahl f√ºr dich sein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043905366', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1701868001}
review:
I've never played Day of the Tentacle in it's heyday those many years ago, but I have heard it's name tossed around a lot as one of the most recommended adventure titles to play for the PC. Like a lot of LucasArt-related games, it's got a lot of character to it and I remember LucasArts more for having done Zombies Ate My Neighbors before knowing the rest of their catalog.

I came into this game very blind besides what little I've seen of it in action. I do grasp it's charm even though a fair bit of it was over my head. I chose not to play this game with it's remastered visuals because really it felt like I was watching a flash cartoon from the early 2000s and it put me off, so I played the game with it's originally intended visuals.

The thing that kept putting me down from enjoying the game was three things. First, I knew that music played in this game but it didn't for the opening sequence. It also didn't recognize my input when I tried swapping characters after I've exhausted the main one in the lobby for options. And it appears that this game is very sensitive to being alt-tabbed considering when I went to look up something for it and came back, it crashed me to desktop.

These few things made me skeptical in what else I could expect if I decide to delve into this game further. It doesn't take away from it's own legacy, it is an established title that's remembered fondly. But the remaster is doing it a little disservice by not ironing out any problems it had which makes me teeter this game towards the field of just remastering it for modern controls, give it a slight facelift, push it out and make money because people can now play it on modern systems. Not really much of a good look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126171008', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1698597821}
review:
La regola d'oro del retrogaming?
Se qualcuno vi dice che "gioco X √® un capolavoro"; DIFFIDATE, SEMPRE.

Day of Tentacle, a mio malgrado, cade proprio nella categoria di giochi che non merita la fama che gli si addice oggi giorno.
Purtroppo NIENTE si salva per me in questo punta e clicca.

La storia √® di una semplicit√† veramente banale e, per quanto non sia cos√¨ GRAVE, non ti spinge molto a continuare a giocare, soprattutto contando gli altri problemi che ha. Cio√®, √® carino che l'antagonista sia cos√¨ strano, e devo ammettere che mi √® piaciuto l'accenno "finale" al motivo per il quale sia cattivo, ma tutto viene rovinato da un finale che pi√π clich√© di cos√¨ non si pu√≤.

I personaggi sono veramente uno spreco di potenzialit√†, soprattutto perch√© non interagiscono quasi MAI tra di loro, e quelli con cui puoi interagire non sono per niente memorabili ed o interessanti (anzi, spesso sono cloni di altri personaggi). Mi √® piaciuta la dinamica dei tre protagonisti contemporaneamente, sia chiaro, ma secondo me poteva essere fatta DECISAMENTE meglio.

I puzzle sono a dir poco ridicoli, a volte sono la cosa pi√π banale e logica del mondo, altre volte invece sono completamente insensati. Inoltre, passare oggetti da un personaggio all'altro √® tedioso a livelli immani dato che devi farti strada per met√† mappa OGNI SINGOLA VOLTA solo per provare un oggetto che poi non funziona comunque.

Davvero, non so come faccia la gente ad elevare questo gioco cos√¨ in alto. E c'√® da dire che Sam&Max: Hit on the Road era 10 volte meglio, nonostante fosse uscito praticamente lo stesso anno, e dalla STESSA IDENTICA CASA DI SVILUPPO.

A chi non ci ha ancora giocato, vi dico semplicemente: non fatelo. Davvero, non √® quella madonna che vi raccontano, e non vi perdete NIENTE a giocarlo.
Piuttosto prestate attenzione, ed interesse, ad altri titoli della Lucas Art (come il precedentemente menzionato Sam&Max o Grim Fandango).

Magari all'epoca poteva essere decente visto che la concorrenza era praticamente nulla, per√≤ adesso √® VERAMENTE mediocre.

Voto: RuttoDiOagie/10

review:
Als ich damals mit 14 Jahren Maniac Mansion und ZakMcKracken auf dem Commodore 64 spielte, dachte ich nicht, dass es nochmal ein Adventure geben w√ºrde, das an die Kreativit√§t und den Witz dieser Spiele ran kommt. Doch Day Of The Tentacle ist ein w√ºrdiger Nachfolger. Ein absolut tolles Point-And-Click-Spiel, das einen fesselt. Besonders klasse sind auch die deutschen Synchronsprecher.

Es w√§re wirklich sch√∂n, wenn mal wieder so etwas von Lucas-Arts k√§me. Das waren noch richtig gute Spiele, in denen nicht nur darauf Wert gelegt wurde, die beste Grafik zu haben. Was n√ºtzt einem die beste Grafik, wenn das Spiel schlecht ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561199261855025', 'num_games_owned': 1338, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1699212084}
review:
Day of the Tentacle - remastered or not, it's great to have it back. There's always a risk with games like this that nostalgia can overload everything or that rose-tinted glasses don't work as well up close, but in this case, neither is the case here. It's every bit as well-crafted now as it was in 1993. I won't say that it'll ignite a new love for the genre if you don't already have it. Adventures games are what they are, and they're not for everyone, especially one that leans this far towards traditional puzzles instead of even as much story as other similiar games. Go into it expecting it to blow your mind or convert you and you'll probably be disappointed - though at the same time, hopefully amused and pleasantly brain-tickled.

PROS:
‚úì Curvaceously colorful graphics
‚úì Sprightly animations
‚úì Fantastic comedic writing
‚úì Memorable offbeat characters
‚úì Creative era-spanning challenges
‚úì Remastered eclectic music
‚úì The ability to quickly switch between the remastered and original versions
‚úì There‚Äôs a tentacle trying to take over the world, what more do you want?!

CONS:
- Some tough puzzles may stop you in your tracks
- Controls do not work well with a gamepad
- Maniac Mansion remained in its original version

author: {'steamid': '76561198007364080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1594569077}
review:
This remastered version of Day of the Tentacle does a great job on improving the graphics of this Lucasart adventure game. Compared to the original, the difference is really noticeable. The new interface is also good, though I do miss the old SCUMM system of command verbs.

Overall, a good title to revisit if you played the original; don't forget to find that easter egg that links to the prequel game to this. XD

review:
Just great. 

Some voice acting is not my taste but it doesn¬¥t diminish the the game too much in my eyes. 

The new interface works, but sometimes it¬¥s anoying to open a menu first, then switch Character. There might be a shortcut key, that I don¬¥t know about, but thats it for mouse controlers, anyway.

The Music is often really great. My favourite is in the colonial timeline in the entrance hallway. The Music cousin Eds room in the future had me headshaking and the are many other nice musical moments as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561199027180015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1696146513}
review: Day of the Tentacle is rightly a classic and labor of love. For those who want to play Maniac Mansion and want to appreciate the similar game mapping and layout, inventory items/usage, and character-switching design (with many of the same characters), the game can be played on the computer in Ed's room (third floor, right room). Bonus: [spoiler] Unlike in Day of the Tentacle, the hamster can be microwaved in Maniac Mansion. [/spoiler] Overall, despite what a wild ride you end up going on, nothing ever felt too absurdist (perhaps because you start off the game trying to stop an evil purple tentacle by going back in time and end up getting stuck scattered in the past, present, and future thanks to a toilet time machine, so the idea of sending inventory items by flushing, going down the chimney like Santa, partaking in a human pet show, adding the right to a vacuum in every basement to the constitution, and much, much, more feel natural). 7.5/10

review: A certified classic. You really can't go past Day of the Tentacle for a nostalgia hit. With the signature Lucas Arts wit and ridiculous item combinations that of course make very little sense except in hindsight, this is classic adventure gaming at its best. To be fair, I have a real soft-spot for this style of game - and this game in particular. I enjoy it now as much as I did the first time around on DOS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037088421', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 621, 'last_played': 1694256488}
review:
[h1]If you want to save the world, you gotta push a few old ladies down the stairs.[/h1]
LucasArts adventure games hold a special place in my heart. 
I discovered their gaming catalog in the late 90s through Curse of Monkey Island. What made LucasArts so brilliant is their unique approach to adventure games. Colourful and whimisical art style, humor and puzzles that demands to think about how you solve them. The puzzles aren't unforgiven but they can be quite  hard some times and i find that's part of the charm. 

Considering dying isn't a part of lucasarts games it give you much freedom to explore, try and take part in funny and witty dialogue  with the characters in the game. Within the game options you can choose between remastered settings or if you  rather play it with the original 1996 settings. The LucasArts remasters of Day of the Tentacle, Full Throttle and  Grim Fandango is masterfully done because it's an improvement yet it feel exactly how i felt playing back in the day. This is what an remaster should be all about, improving graphical, sound and smaller quality of life changes but keep the aestetics and feel of the game because nostalgia do sell. 

Personally i'm an advocate of remastering old games to new system if and that is a big if, they do homage to the original game rather then doing a cash grab. I hope Tim Schafer gets to remaster more games from the LucasArts gaming catalogue. I would love to see remasters of Sam & Max, Outlaws, Curse of Monkey Island, The Dig and so on.
If you want to get into LucasArts, Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a great place to start.

[b]Highly recommend.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006879847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1458859005}
review: "Day of the Tentacle Remastered" is a delightful journey back to the golden age of point-and-click adventures. The game's quirky humor, mind-bending puzzles, and memorable characters have been beautifully preserved, with updated artwork and animations that enhance the experience without sacrificing its original charm. The option to switch between classic and remastered graphics, along with the revamped user interface and streamlined inventory system, make solving puzzles and navigating the time-traveling plot a joy. The voice acting and reimagined soundtrack add depth to the game's already stellar storytelling. As a fan of the original, I'm pleased to say that this remastered edition captures the magic that made the game a classic in the first place, offering both nostalgia and a new way to experience the whimsical adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068458152', 'num_games_owned': 3594, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1693519938}
review:
The Lucas Arts Classic hand repixeled by  Tim Schaefer and Dave Grossman themselves. Full Audio remaster thanks to the Lucas Arts Archieve fund, lots of Bonus Drawings can be unlocked. Renewed controller compatible Interfaces modernizes the game. A reason to get this one.

Uhm... You prefer the old pixel art? No problem. There¬¥s a retro button that switches back he the original 1993 Interface and pixels. Now stopreading this and buy it if you haven¬¥t already.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447470563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1690223411}
review:
A very well done remaster of the DOS original. The graphics are beautiful hires rendition of the VGA originals of the 90s. Everything else is also on par if not excelling the quality of the original, with a special mention going to the voice acting, crystal clear and as funny as ever.

For those who do not know the original and consider playing Tentacle for the first time, I can wholeheartedly recommend this version.

The story is not timeless, but the time travel element makes sure that it is not just obscure 90s in-jokes. The puzzle can be a challenge. I would not be judge you for using a guide. You will still get 2.5 hours of game time minimum and there is no reason not to explore all the dialog trees and wander around the environs before making for the main story puzzle locations. Going through the game blind it will take around 7 hours if actually go down to the level of combining everything with everything. 

The original Maniac Mansion - prequel to Tentacle from the 80s - is also in this remaster as it was in the original as a bonus, so in theory you get another 2 - 5 hours of gaming.

All around a very nice package.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815610495', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 726, 'last_played': 1692473066}
review:
Day of the Tentacle es una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas de la puta historia. Lanzado en el a√±o 1993, ahora su versi√≥n remasterizada nos permite una vez m√°s volver a vivir la divertida aventura dentro de la mansi√≥n Edison. 

HISTORIA 
La narrativa nos trae a 3 peculiares personajes: Bernard (el nerd), Hoagie (el gordo rockero) y Laverne (adicta a la coca deshidratada). Bernard recibe un mensaje de su amigo Tent√°culo Verde donde le cuenta que Tent√°culo P√∫rpura se volvi√≥ malo y quiere conquistar el mundo. A causa de esto, el Dr. Fred Edison los encerr√≥ en la mansi√≥n y planea matarlos. Bernard, junto a sus 2 amigos, parte rumbo a la mansi√≥n para salvar a los tent√°culos.  Al llegar, las cosas se retuercen porque Bernard deja libre al Tent√°culo P√∫rpura y este se escapa con la intenci√≥n de volver sumisos a los humanos y conquistar el mundo. El Dr. Edison manda a Bernard y a sus amigos al pasado para evitar que P√∫rpura se vuelva malo, pero se ve que en este juego todo sale mal porque la m√°quina del tiempo se rompe, provocando que Hoagie quede atrapado 200 a√±os en el pasado, Bernard queda en el presente y Laverne viaja 200 a√±os al futuro. 
De esta manera, nuestros personajes deben buscar la forma de volver al presente y salvar al mundo. 

GAMEPLAY
Como toda aventura gr√°fica, se trata de un point and click, es decir, dirigimos a los personajes y las acciones que deseamos que hagan con el mouse.  Vamos a dialogar, y mucho, para resolver los diversos puzzles que nos brinda el juego. Los personajes pueden hacer distintas acciones y transferirse objetos por la Cron - O - Letrina a trav√©s del tiempo, provocando que las acciones en el pasado tengan consecuencias en el futuro.  De esta forma, provoca que los puzzles sean muy ingeniosos y debamos estar atentos a cada detalles y pista de la mansi√≥n para resolver los mismos. 

APARTADO GR√ÅFICO Y BANDA SONORA
Usando el mismo motor gr√°fico del a√±o 93, los sprites de los escenarios fueron todos renderizados en HD. Por lo tanto, las acciones y movimientos de los personajes son iguales al juego original pero en mejor definici√≥n, un regalo excelente <3. Por otro lado, la banda sonora es magnifica. Inspirada en los dibujos animados de los a√±os 80 - 90s, le da un plus al juego para que cada l√≠nea c√≥mica se complemente a la perfecci√≥n. Definitivamente Day of the Tentacle es cine. 

CONCLUSI√ìN 
Day of the Tentacle es un juego bastante corto pero muy entretenido. Sin dudas, esta en la c√∫spide de las aventuras gr√°ficas gracias a su humor de caricaturas, sus personajes tan carism√°ticos y su alocada historia que enamora al instante. Un juego que recomiendo mucho si te gusta el g√©nero donde te vas a re√≠r mucho. Si no jugaste a su versi√≥n original, te envidio sanamente, porque vas a descubrir una obra que no se consiguen en el mercado chino. 

Gracias por el espacio.

review: This is a blast from the past for me and even after all these years the puzzles are still challenging. I got to play my second play through listening to the commentary and loved ever bit of it. I work in animation so to listen to how this game was made was like looking at a museum piece, it full of awesome animation and gaming history. The art style alone has influenced my own style and i cannot stress enough how great of a whack game this is. If your looking for a first click and point look no further this is maybe one of my top games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979953970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 490, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1691319106}
review:
When I was a teenager and started discovering the fantastic world of classic graphic adventures (in the late 90's, so after their glory years) I was always more of a Sierra fan than LucasArts, but Day of the Tentacle was, in my opinion, the culmination of all LucasArts had learned from their previous big 2D successes (alongside Full Throttle). It's a very well made game, sure of itself and masters all of the genre core mechanics.

This remaster is fantastic, it has that seemless transition from the original and enhanced graphics with a press of a button √† l√° The Secret of Mokey Island Remaster. Great stuff, always love when devs do that.

author: {'steamid': '76561199476307905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1050, 'last_played': 1691346583}

author: {'steamid': '76561198115762014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1691195380}
review: Still a classic after all these years and among the best of show from the golden age of Lucas Arts adventure era. The remastered graphics and retouches brings this classic to the modern audience and it doesn't disappoints. The humor of spot on, the plot is as crazy as ever, the controls work wonders and the gameplay is fun and amusing. Being from the old era it does suffer still from the pitfalls from old adventure games such as pixel hunting and leap of faith logic puzzles, not as bad as many out there but there will be moments. If you are nostalgic then yes this is among the games you can always go back to, if you are new its the best of the best of its genre of the era and worth your time for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989766649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1624374069}
review:
Of all the weird Lucasarts point-and-click games that came and went, Day of the Tentacle is one of those that really hit a sweet spot for me. It might not beat the campy jokey tropes of Monkey Island nor the unhinged insanity of Sam & Max yet it managed to place itself right in the middle of the pack with clever puzzles, an extremely pulpy plot, quirky characters cemented in stereotypes from the early 90s and one of my favorite villain of all time, the purple tentacle itself! 

The game takes place in a mansion of madness, actually the very same mansion that hosted the previous game, Maniac Mansion, and revolves around a previously friendly tentacle that by drinking some toxic waste grows tiny limbs and a maniacal flair to its previously rather chill persona. To stop the tentacular plan to conquer the world the heroes arrive at the scene and end up in 3 different timelines. They must now, through a series of weird interconnected paths, shape time and space to suit their and their comrades' needs in order to end the terror of the tentacle uprising..

The gameplay follows the standard formula, just wander around and interact with stuff while trying to figure out why the spoon can be assembled with the stuffed animal you found three acts before, and as always the puzzles can range from cleverly designed to outright mind boggling. In this game I think a neat balance between insane and clever has been reached that makes puzzling things out truly enjoyable. 

All in all Day of the Tentacle is a charming adventure game that has aged ever so slightly but the remaster truly brings it back from the dead. Of all the remastered Lucasarts this might be the best to begin with. It is tight, charming and demented in all the right ways..

author: {'steamid': '76561197963754875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1492700896}
review:
Day of the Tentacle was a classic back in its day and still holds up extremely well against its contemporaries of its time. Offering classic point-n-click gameplay, as you solve various puzzles across three timelines, the past, present and the future. Unlike many of its other contemporaries it isn't too obscure either, which was a pitfall of many of the older point-n-click adventure games from the same era.

The remastered version offers redrawn and detailed 2D graphics and a robust technical level.

Day of the Tentacle is a remastered classic from a bygone era, which delivers a comedic story that is still enjoyable to this day.

review: Day of the Tentacle es la secuela de la aventura gr√°fica Maniac Mansion. Nunca jugu√© a Maniac Mansion ni a la versi√≥n original de Day of the Tentacle, pero esta versi√≥n remasterizada me ha parecido maravillosa. El argumento se construye mediante tres narrativas diferentes (una por cada personaje protagonista) que se van desarrollando en paralelo. Los hechos discurren en el mismo edificio pero en tres √©pocas diferentes y esto es lo que provoca las relaciones entre los personajes. Es una aventura gr√°fica de corte cl√°sico, relativamente extensa, muy divertida, con un dise√±o de personajes excepcional y un apartado art√≠stico excelente. Comprendo que, a√∫n despu√©s de tantos a√±os, siga consider√°ndose uno de los mejores juegos de este g√©nero.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303490620', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1688241079}
review: This is a good game with a lot of charm.  Its age shows, though.  A lot of the puzzles are far too cryptic, and funnily enough the game doesn't do enough "hand-holding" in my opinion.  A lot of games have the opposite problem.  A proper hint system would've been a lot more satisfying, as it can get VERY boring searching for the specific thing you need to interact with in order to progress.  I'd still recommend it though, just be prepared to look up a walkthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062884834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1687458008}
review:
The remastered visuals improves on the cartoony feel of the game, yet feels just like the original. Every once and awhile I would turn on the original to remind myself, just to appreciate the enhancements. I've played this game before and it was nice to relive it. 
Not many of the 90s point-and-click have aged well, finding solutions to situations/puzzles can be a frustrating waste of time. Where this game really excels is the zany encounters with weird people in a wacky cartoon world. It was fun to relieve the game, and I got through it much quicker than the many years before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155602285', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1687717778}
review: First played this game in the mid-1990s and completed it without any hints or online guides, took me a while too.  Played through countless times since then, and even now almost 30 years later I'm still finding new things I hadn't noticed before.  What an absolute masterpiece of a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211727760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1685876571}
review:
After playing this game to full completion, I can safely say that it was an interesting point-and-click adventure. You control three characters, in three separate timelines, which sounds great, but quite honestly, you'll probably be looking at an IGN walkthrough for both the normal game and achievements, rather than figure out the puzzles by yourself. The story had a lot of potential and was funny every now and again but ended up tripping on it's own shoes, becoming and experience you just want to end and pass on to another game. The following paragraphs contain two spoilers.

One big plus, i have to say is, during the game they reference a lot another game, Maniac Mansion (Which you can buy on steam but wait, there's more!) and the great part about that is that on the  3th floor, inside the room to your right, there's an old arcade game with a fully playable version of MANIAC MANSION, saving you like 5 bucks or so, pretty neat.

Probably the biggest plus of all is that, being an european see, you get to know quite a bit of the american history, and finally rewrite what's wrong with it, like having a flag with two flaming hot babes and a rad skull with machine guns. Also you get to s*it on washington, which is another plus.

I rate this game a 6/10, buy it on promotion or do it like me, go to HumbleBundle (Not sponsored but I wouldn't mind) and purchase a bundle with this, donate all to charity, non to the developers since they have f-you disney money now and be a better person. Namaste peeps.

review: As a big fan of graphic adventures, I can say that this is the best one I have ever played. The puzzles in this game are the best I have ever seen and the jokes are very good. In addition, the story, apart from being relatively short, is easy to understand and fun. Despite being a sequel, it is not necessary to have played ‚ÄúManiac Mansion‚Äù to understand and enjoy this game. I definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256246921', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1697319403}
review:
This game is a childhood favorite of mine. It's right up there with the likes of Sierra's King's Quest games and Freddy Fish. If I wasn't playing the harder more puzzling King's Quest games on my computer as a kid then I was playing Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle. I'm glad this game got remastered. The updated/remastered graphics makes the game more vibrant and colorful, and the comedic charm still holds up today. The only thing I have to complain about it that sometimes when a character is speaking the dialogue will either be skipped entirely or a character will be stuck on repeating a word for a few seconds but it didn't delay the game. I think my old laptop is to blame for that (even tho I have everything updated). 

If you dont mind a point and click adventure game that has no "bad endings' or game overs than this is the game for you. It has a lot of witty charm that carried over from it's predecessor and prequel, Maniac Mansion. And the voice actors in this game did a great job. This game is a solid A+, It's almost like playing a Saturday Morning cartoon with just a bit of adult humor sprinkled in.

review: A very cool remaster of the game, especially the fact that you can transition from the new enhanced graphics to the original pixel ones, whenever you want. First time playing through this game (when I was small), I remember that I lost myself, did not know what to do and just forgot about it. I do not judge myself for that even today, as most of the puzzles are absurd but also really funny and fun to solve. Either way, superb game, I highly recommend it for adventure game fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022973862', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1683317030}
review: The Remaster version of Day of the Tentacle is a true success! As a fan of the original game, I was delighted to see that the developers managed to recreate the gaming experience while adding modern graphics and sound improvements. The characters are just as funny and endearing, the humor is still great, and the puzzles are still challenging. I loved revisiting the wacky universe of this cult game, and it brought back many pleasant memories. If you enjoyed the original version, or if you're just a fan of classic adventure games, I highly recommend checking out this Remaster version of Day of the Tentacle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198267841454', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1700617156}
review:
Als Fan klassischer Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspiele war ich begeistert, als Day of the Tentacle Remastered angek√ºndigt wurde. Und ich muss sagen, dieses Spiel hat meine Erwartungen mehr als √ºbertroffen.

In erster Linie sind die √ºberarbeitete Grafik und der Sound absolut umwerfend. Das aktualisierte Artwork ist dem urspr√ºnglichen Design treu, aber mit zus√§tzlichen Details und Tiefe, die das Spiel wirklich zum Leben erwecken. Die Sprachausgabe ist ebenfalls erstklassig, wobei die Originalbesetzung ihre Rollen wiederholt und urkomische und unvergessliche Dialoge liefert .

In Bezug auf das Gameplay beh√§lt Day of the Tentacle Remastered all den Humor und das L√∂sen von R√§tseln bei, die das Originalspiel zu einem Klassiker gemacht haben. Die Zeitreise-Mechaniken sind brillant ausgef√ºhrt und erm√∂glichen es den Spielern, R√§tsel zu l√∂sen, indem sie Gegenst√§nde durch verschiedene Epochen hin und her schicken. Die Charaktere sind alle einzigartig und einpr√§gsam, jeder mit seinen eigenen Macken und Pers√∂nlichkeiten, mit denen es Spa√ü macht, mit ihnen zu interagieren.

Ein weiterer gro√üartiger Aspekt dieses Spiels ist die Einbeziehung von Entwicklerkommentaren, die faszinierende Einblicke in die Entstehung des Spiels und die Herausforderungen bieten, denen sich das Team bei der Erstellung gegen√ºbersah. Es ist eine seltene und wertvolle Erg√§nzung, die einem bereits gro√üartigen Spiel noch mehr Tiefe verleiht.

Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle Remastered eine erstaunliche Hommage an eines der gr√∂√üten Point-and-Click-Abenteuerspiele aller Zeiten. Mit aktualisierter Grafik, Sound und Entwicklerkommentaren ist es ein Muss f√ºr Fans des Originalspiels und Neueinsteiger gleicherma√üen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1681631911}
review:
An opportunity to replay (or play) the 2nd best Pn'C from LucasArt, with a visual quality worthy of today.

Old annoyances are still present, like some inscrutable solutions (an infamous trademark of the brand,) a couple of gross moments, or backtracking abuse with a lack of fast walk. The latter should have been added; it wouldn't affect the game content.

Great story, generally good cartoon humour, great sound and voicing, It's an enjoyable adventure.
This version doesn't lessen the old memories, and is even more recommended to newcomers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255461651', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1681078947}
review: Ah, it's good to revisit a classic from  my childhood. Personally I'm not a fan of the remastered aesthetics, so I'm flad DFP went with the option to switch between the classic look and the remastered one. One thing I'm not a fan of though is the hiding of some achievements, I tend to be a bit of a completionist myself so making some non-obvious achievements hidden meant I had to go back and forth and replay the game in order to get some of them that I got locked out of. Regardless, this is a gem I recommend all to play. You will not regret spending money and time into this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057680429', 'num_games_owned': 1126, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1680458102}
review:
If you're thinking of playing this you probably already know what you're getting yourself into. Yes, there are plenty of obscure puzzles and it's nice to have a walk-through ready when you get stuck.
 
You shouldn't feel too ashamed for looking up solutions to puzzles since this game was very much made in a time where people would spend weeks trying to figure it out (and they would be happy to do so). I personally wouldn't be happy for it to take up that kind of time from my life when the answer is easy to find online.
It was worth playing through nonetheless for the charm of the setting and characters, interesting developer commentary and cool time-travel shenanigans.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976202334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1680284607}
review:
DotT Remastered ist einfach klasse. Erstmal freue ich mich, dass man √ºberhaupt die ganzen alten Games wieder zocken kann und DotT hat mich schon echt oft und lange in meiner Jugend begleitet.
Ich kann mich nicht erinnern, dass es damals eine Tonspur gab. Ich hab es immer nur mit Texten zum lesen gehabt. Die Stimmen sind etwas gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig, aber immer noch alle Male besser, als gar kein Ton. 
Die Grafik wurde nochmal aufgepeppt und die Farben sind noch satter. Das Gameplay wurde ebenfalls angepasst so dass man alle mit der Maus "on-Point" bedienen kann und nicht immer runter zum Befehlsmen√º r√ºber wischen muss. 
Die Musik fetzt wie eh und jeh und die Witze und Dialoge sind einfach immer noch zum weg schmei√üen. 
Auch die Entwicklerkommentare fand ich wirklich interessant und witzig.
Einziges Manko waren Grafikfehler, die ich √∂fters mal hatte, wenn ich die Figur bewegt habe und in einen anderen Abschnitt gegangen bin und die Kamera mit geschwenkt hat, dass ich ganz merkw√ºrdige Grafiken aus ganz anderen Bereichen im Bild hatte. Das war unsch√∂n und hat schon was genervt. Das Game war aber trotzdem noch spielbar. 
Die Errungenschaften sind tats√§chlich was schwer zu bekommen, da man auf manche Sachen echt nicht kommt, es sei denn, man spielt das Game zum ersten Mal und bekommt die ein oder andere Errungenschaft, weil man eh am rumprobieren ist. Aber bitte...wer dr√ºckt den bitte mit Bernhard 100 mal auf die Klingel im Foyer?!

review: Day of the Tentacle hat nach √ºber 30 Jahren f√ºr mich nichts von seinem Zauber, Witz und Unterhaltungswert verloren.Mittlerweile haben es meine eigenen Kids durchgespielt und dank des Grafik- und Steuerungsupgrades gar nicht als Spiel der 90er empfunden. Auch die  komplette Sprachausgabe ist (noch immer) Klasse. Die (alte) deutsche Syncho halte ich noch immer f√ºr gelungen, im Englischen macht's aber auch viel Spass. Besonders toll finde ich den zuschaltbaren (englischen) Audiokommentar der Entwickler,  der Einblicke in die Entstehungsgeschichte des Originals und des Remasters gibt.Die versteckten 58 Belohnungen haben meinen Spielerehrgeiz auch noch mehr angeheizt. Alles in Allem eine tolle Umsetzung des Klasikers. Ich w√ºnsche mir mehr davon, gerade was Lucasgames angeht! Indy 3 und 4 w√§ren doch mal was, oder die Special-Editions von Monkey Island auch in der deutschen Talkie-Version...Gern gespielt!

review: Other than Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis (Can we please get a remaster of that, please), this is the greatest Lucas Arts adventure of all time. Yes I could include the Monkey Island games, but they were playing on the tropes from games like this. And no, please don't ask me about Loom, wait, wrong game.  Anyways, this game is amazing and always remember it always seems to rain right after you wash your car. It's sad the impatience most modern young gamers have for a beautiful project like this, but what are you gonna do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201646755', 'num_games_owned': 1755, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1678590469}
review: There is no doubt that Day of the Tentacle and Maniac Mansion paved the way for both adventure games and point and click adventures alike. However, I've not until now played either of those games, so I can look at Day of the Tentacles Remastered with a modern lens instead of with rose-tinted glasses. As someone who really does enjoy both point and click and adventure games, there's quite a few things I liked about Day of the Tentacle, like its charming three heroes and the personality both they and the game's art style just ooze. Everything else kind of blows though. The music is pretty middling, the main villain's kind of boring, the puzzles rife with adventure game logic, and the overarching story is just awful. If you have nostalgia for Day of the Tentacle I'm sure this is a safe purchase, but otherwise I cannot recommend this game to new prospective fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038293797', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 128, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1711986592}
review:
Now, if you're a fan of the genre, then you're probably already familiar with this game. But if you're not, then let me tell you, this game is an absolute gem.

First off, let's talk about the humor. Day of the Tentacle is hilarious. The writing is clever and witty, and the characters are all memorable and unique. It's the kind of game that will have you laughing out loud at every turn.

But it's not just the humor that makes this game great. The puzzles are challenging but never frustrating, and the game is full of creative and interesting mechanics. And the art style is timeless. Even though the game came out in 1993, the graphics still hold up today. The animations are smooth and the colors are vibrant, and the game has a charming cartoonish aesthetic that is just as appealing today as it was back then.

But what really sets Day of the Tentacle apart from other point-and-click adventure games is the time-travel mechanic. The game takes place over three different time periods, and you have to manipulate objects and characters in the past in order to affect the future. It's a brilliant mechanic that adds a whole new layer of complexity and depth to the game.

In conclusion, Day of the Tentacle is an absolute classic that every fan of the point-and-click adventure genre should play. The humor is top-notch, the puzzles are challenging but never frustrating, and the time-travel mechanic is a stroke of genius. And even though the game is almost 30 years old, it's still just as enjoyable and charming today as it was back then. So go ahead and give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181861549', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1675533185}
review:
Oh boy... I feel like I might make some people mad here--if I'm not mistaken, this is a bit of a cult classic? Fair enough, I can see the appeal. It's certainly got a lot of... [i] personality... [/i]  

I tried. I really tried. But suddenly, after several hours, I just couldn't take it anymore. The obnoxious, braindead characters. The flat, bland artstyle. The irreverent, frequently unfunny humor. Hoagie [i] burping [/i] all the dang time. It's just... UGH. I kept telling myself, "I'm invested in the items, they were hard to get and I want to see what ridiculous things they get used for," but after a while they just weren't worth all of the everything else that is this game. It is, after all, a Point & Click that falls headfirst into the classic pitfalls of the genre: puzzles with solutions so bizarre and obscure that more often than not, you find yourself stuck, aimlessly trying anything on everything without any real hope of making progress. Honestly, I'm used to that with Point & Clicks, and am usually willing to put up with it for some element or another--the story, the characters, the world--[i] something. [/i] But not here. There's nothing for me here. It's far from a terrible game, but I just... I just [i] can't, [/i] man.

review: Reminds me of the ISpy and other point and click computer games we played in the early 2000's. Brings back good ole elementary free time days too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1675267317}
review:
pros

+ good-looking, cartoony, and colorful hand-drawn background artwork
+ a funny and cartoony story. Playing this game feels like watching a Looney Toons episode.
+ well made cartoony cut scenes
+ a diverse, wacky, quirky, humorous, and colorful cast of characters¬†
+ playable three main characters. you can easily switch and exchange items with them.
+ easy to use point and click interface
+ good character animations
+ decent voice acting
+ A good soundtrack perfectly fits the game's whimsical style.
+ there is auto save

cons

- there are plenty of obtuse and unintuitive puzzles with nonsensical solutions.
- there is no hint system for obscure puzzles with nonsensical solutions; therefore, generally, you don't know what to do. a hint system would be really helpful.
- the game has crashed a few times.
- characters' slow walking speed
- maybe too childish and juvenile for adult gamers

Despite the fact that I mostly dislike puzzles, I enjoyed this game's amusing story and characters. After playing this, I can understand why this game is considered a cult classic. It was also a well-made remaster of a cult classic adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039647286', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1675199881}
review: Classic, funny, timeless.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983550311', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1674881863}
review:
A pinnacle of Point-and-Click.  Not just a fun game, but a piece of history.  I remember when the game came out and my computer wouldn't run it, so disappointed!  (Cue Kevin Sorbo)  Commercials were everywhere, and even the evening news reported on how it was ushering in a new era of computing games.

Remastered has better everything.  Graphics, quality of life - while maintaining everything about the origina; release.  It was so well done, I thought I was playing the original for awhile.  But that was the nostalgia effect, and the sleek new animations became apparent soon enough.

Unfortunately, I had several crashes, either going into or coming out of cutscenes.  The SCUMMvm version is still much more stable on modern computers.  Despite this one drawback, I would definitely recommend this game at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175275669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1675031546}
review: This is my all time favorite game, i've played it a million times and i always enjoy playing it again some time later. The story is just the best story of all videogames ever, the gameplay is unique, the voice acting is perfect (laverne's voice actor deserves an oscar), the graphics are eye candy and the music well fitting. This HD remaster makes it even better. I just miss the part where for the anti copy protection in the old days you needed to look at a plan for the super battery and adjust it ingame and you cant do it in the remaster, it was fitting to the story. If you never played this game this will be the best $4 you ever spent in your life!

author: {'steamid': '76561199085919414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1674846989}

review:
Juegazo cl√°sico, una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas de la historia. Llena de humor y absurdos, se me hizo muy amena. Algo dif√≠cil, necesit√© ayuda al final para un par de puzles.

Pros:
- El lavado de cara de los gr√°ficos le sienta bastante bien, permitiendo volver en cualquier momento a la interfaz original.
- El sentido del humor es muy caracter√≠stico.
- Los tres periodos temporales, maravillosos.

Contra:
- Sigo siendo m√°s fan del sistema de verbos original que de las ruletas que se est√°n utilizando en las remasterizaciones de SCUMM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116403301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1672008437}
review:
Fantastic remaster. I was afraid it might not feel like the original, but nope, same great game with improved graphics.
You need to have very very very basic knowledge of American Revolution history, and science for Hoagie's part. Very very basic. And at least a very very very basic sense of humour. This game has some of the most ingenious puzzles in adventure game history. I was also afraid I would miss SCUMM, but nope, I got used to the new control system really quickly. Can't recommend it enough (especially for anyone who enjoyed it 28 years ago).

author: {'steamid': '76561198053940839', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 730, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1670103365}
review: Day of the Tentacle ist und bleibt eines der besten Adventures aller Zeiten. Das gilt f√ºr das Original genauso wie f√ºr diese traumhafte Neuauflage. Die Story rund um Zeitreisen und machtbesessene Tentakel ist herrlich verr√ºckt und die Dialoge verspr√ºhen immer noch den typischen Humor. Wer hier nicht zumindest ein bisschen schmunzeln muss, ist innerlich tot. Vor allem aber muss man sich immer und immer wieder vor den Designern verneigen, weil sie es geschafft haben, selbst f√ºr die beklopptesten R√§tsel erschreckend logische L√∂sungswege zu pr√§sentieren. Diese Erkenntnis ist fast sogar ein bisschen gruselig, wenn man realisiert, dass all der Bl√∂dsinn, den man mit Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne in Zukunft, Vergangenheit und Gegenwart anstellen muss, tats√§chlich jedes Mal Sinn ergibt. Der Grafik und auch der Steuerung hat man einen neuen, modernen Anstrich verpasst. M√∂chte man auf die klassischen Verben und das Bildchen-Inventar im unteren Drittel verzichten und den verr√ºckten Knobeltrip lieber im Vollbild erleben, kann man auf eine alternative Steuerungsmethode zur√ºckgreifen. Dabei bekommt man eine kontextsensitive Auswahl an kleinen Piktogrammen rund um den Cursor, sobald man sie an entsprechenden Objekten per Knopfdruck √∂ffnet. Das Inventar ist dabei auf einem separaten Bildschirm untergebracht. Man hat beim Remaster eine exzellente Arbeit geleistet und den Klassiker an genau den richtigen Stellen modernisiert und sogar noch aufgewertet. Das Meisterwerk von damals hat definitiv nichts von seinem unvergleichlichen Charme verloren. Die grandiosen R√§tsel, die schrulligen Charakteren und die herrlichen Dialoge suchen absolut ihresgleichen.
