review:
[b]Vielen Vielen Dank an Double Fine f√ºr das Remastern dieses epischen Meisterwerks der Point& Klick √Ñra![/b]

Nachdem sie schon Full Throttle von Lucas Arts wiederbelebt haben jetzt DoT!

Sch√∂nes Grafik-update [i](wobei man staunt, wie OK das fr√ºher einem erschien)[/i] und das Beste ... deutsche Sprachausgabe! Daf√ºr gibt es richtig Punkte bei mir!

[b]Alles in Allem:[/b]

absolut schr√§ges Point & Klick Advanture der alten Schule mit einer skurrilen Story, die drei "Helden" auf die Reise schickt um die Welt vor einem Lila Tentakel zu retten.   
Ganz in der klassiker Manie wie Sam & Max & Monkey Island gehalten, mit schr√§gen Dialogen und "super logischen" Kombinationen, arbeitet man sich hier √ºber die drei Zeitebenen Vergangenheit, Gegenwart und Zukunft durch um sich die jeweilige Realit√§t so zurecht zu biegen, wie man es eben braucht. 

[spoiler] Ein Trockner brauchte damals so um 90 min f√ºr ein Waschladung, wenn das Ger√§t 200 Jahre lang l√§uft (was den Absolut-Galaktischen-Hersteller-Rekord entspr√§che und man f√ºr eine Nutzung 0,50$ einschmei√üen muss, dann hei√üt das, dass 200 Jahre = 105.120.000 min /90 = 1.168.000 Trockenprogramme   erg√§ben. Und das wiederum mit 0,50$ multipliziert bedeute, dass man aus dem S√º√üigkeitenautomaten 584.000$ rausgeholt haben m√ºsste ... wei√ü nicht, klingt jetzt nicht soooo relaistisch [/spoiler]

[b]Resum√©:[/b]

‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ (5/5)

Absolute Kaufempfehlung, nicht nur f√ºr Nostalgiker!

Ich w√ºnscht Sam & Max - Hit The Road g√§be es noch eine Remasterte Version und von The Legend of Kyrandia ... epische Games!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048754893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1669330794}
review:
I played Maniac Mansion in the 80`s and it`s one of my first video game memories. That`s not to say that it was my first video game, far from it but it`s definitely one of the first actually memorable ones. Years later when I actually got  aPC I played this gem in it`s original glory and also have very fond memories of it.

So where am I going with all this nostalgia shit? I mean to say that I definitely recommend this game to people who have played LucasArts games in the past and enjoyed them, but not necessarily to younger people or modern gamers that have no nostalgia for them.

Don`t get me wrong, this is a fantastic remake. The redone graohics look great, it sounds great as well, it basically looks and sounds like you remember it looked and sounded like not how it actually looked, which is a great feat by itself. The cherry on top of it is that it also comes with a commentary tracks by the original creators of the game and a shit load of concept art that they pulled out of their boxes that have never seen before.

Great right? Yeah but with all the cool shit there also comes all the bad shit. The game itself feels incredibly dated and all the annoying things like illogical puzzle solutions, missing stuff because you can`t tell background apart from interactible items and especially the dated humor and pop culture references are there too and they are here to stay.

That being said, even though my humor evolved, the game still got chuckles out of me and I think there`s even people alive today now who find the game hilarious. If you`re new to 90s point and click adventures, grab a guide and play the game for the story. The gameplay is shallow and frustrating anyways and you play those games for their off beat humor and to see where the story and its characters go anyways.
It basically a visual novel type game of a bygone era and it`s one of the best of its time.

review:
Not really understanding what made it a cult classic. I grew up during that time but could never afford a computer until I was older, so I was looking forward to seeing what I missed out on. Sadly it's just a bit juvenile for me. Some of the puzzles had me questioning my existence- the solutions to a few of the problems were so obtuse I can't imagine anyone got the answers on their own.

But then again I'm just really bad at puzzles so take my review with a grain of salt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977904226', 'num_games_owned': 1151, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1668383873}
review:
[h1]A day of point n' click to remember[/h1]
I grew up playing classic Lucasarts adventure games. The first of them I touched, in fact, happened to be Maniac Mansion on NES, which I was too young to know better about and beat. Fast-forward to the recent times and Day of the Tentacle was the reputed classic I have never touched before. What's the excuse for a fan of such games to not engage it, especially when it came out remastered?

Three friends are tasked to stop Purple Tentacle from taking on the world. Thanks to Dr. Fred, they get split up between the past, present and future in a time-traveling mishap and have to work together achieve their goal of saving the world. The strong point for me is that this game manages to make all events happen in a single house, with time differences adding to the freshness and variety throughout the gameplay. At least it's easier for me who got a bit burnt out on exploring places in adventure games, occasionally.

Puzzle solving applies a less common method of transfering objects between playable characters by using the, well, time toilet. Such liberty allows for the player to think up possible ways to a solution outside the box, courtesy of Lucasarts' adventure game trademark. What bothers me about the puzzle aspect is that trying stuff around has me find myself solving problems before I even knew what the obstacles really were, more than often.

In its remastered format, Day of the Tentacle sets an excellent example why it became a point n click adventure to follow for the future generations. With a colorful cast (besides the cringey voice acting of Laverne), unorthodox puzzle solving and persistent comedy value to go by, I am satisfied having it finally ticked off my bucket list. Fans of the genre should do themselves a favor to add it on their list, as well.

review: A great remastered version of the Day Of The Tentacle. I remember playing the old pixel version many years ago and it brought back lots of memories. Still the typical dialogue and characters that you'd expect from Ron Gilbert. There are options for game play, you can choose the classic bar of verbs, or a dial. (Right mouse button) It took me about 11 hours in all to complete the game, and  was enjoyably foxed, by more than a few red herrings or puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155533431', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1669479251}
review:
Classic LucasArts point-and-click and a pretty decent remaster here to boot. Visuals retain the same cartoony style, where everything has that fluid cartoon physics, and characters wouldn't look too out-of-place in something like Looney Tunes. Aside from some very rare and minor visual bugs, like one where Weird Ed's forehead has purple pixels over it, the graphics are pretty much spot-on in the remaster. The remastered soundtrack is also really well-made too, and faithful to the original tracks.

In terms of new players coming into the game who don't have any nostalgia, I'd say the game is well worth it. Backtracking is never really a huge problem as there aren't many places to go to and there's a lot of quality-of-life features, such as the way giving items to the other playable characters is automated. I was stumped on quite a few puzzles, but when looking up the solutions I never thought it was absurd or seemed like moon-logic, it all made sense and it seemed like I was simply overlooking something. Quite possibly some of the most well-designed puzzles of the earlier LucasArts point-and-clicks, honestly.

One flaw of the game, that wasn't even really a flaw at the time but is really showing in the modern day, is how poor the voice acting is. It's mediocre at best honestly. For its time, just having voice acting at all was on a whole new level. And having them be like actual voice actors too, instead of just LucasArts employees? It was something else. It was LucasArts' first game with voice acting, and one of the first video games with full voice acting overall. But yeah it hasn't aged all too well if I'm being honest. Some lines feel really under-delivered, some seem like they've been improvised but without any real context of the in-game situation, and some voices really just don't fit the characters.

Overall a great point-and-click remaster, and the original game has held up well in most aspects. Buy when you can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302208299', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1055, 'last_played': 1669196193}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is considered a classic Point & Click Adventure game, originally released in 1993.  It a sequel to the game 'Manic Mansion', another classic.  I did not play either of these games when they were originally released, only the new remastered edition.  If you want to play both the games you only need to buy this 1 game as there is an in-game version of Manic Mansion on a computer inside one of the rooms.  

Since I never played the original release I can't comment how the remaster compares with it, but I can judge how well it performs on newer systems.  I have a newer laptop with a 4K screen and this worked perfectly.  I didn't have to make any adjustments to scale it or anything.  It opened and ran perfectly.  The graphics , though clearly still very much in line with the original have been updated and cleaned up to make the graphics cleaner and more modern.  They now look very much like a 90's animated cartoon.  

In addition to the graphics update the user interface was updated as well.  It's my understanding that the original utilized the classic Lucas Arts style with action verbs selectable on the screen and inventory items listed that you could interact with.  The new interface is instead a wheel type menu activated by right clicking on hotspots and inventory items.  While I found the original style cumbersome, I find this a moderate improvement.  I think there could have been additional work to combine actions like the open and close button into single action buttons, but overall I found this an improvement to Lucas Arts original system.  It was highly innovative when moving from text-parsers to true point-and-click games, but doesn't age well.  This remastered UI is a reasonable replacement.

As far as the game itself goes, its moderately entertaining.  It has a somewhat goofy sense of humor which makes it fun to play and a decently written story that keeps you engaged.  The puzzles in the game are a little more out there featuring several difficult 'moon logic' puzzles which become more difficult by having to switch between 3 characters who exchange inventory items.  If you don't mind having occasional moments where you will be randomly trying every inventory item on every available hotspot and then repeating with 2 additional characters each in a different setting, this won't be a problem.  The game isn't overly difficult, but it does take some time due to the walking back and forth from locations and waiting for dialogues and animation sequences.  If you've never played the game before I'd estimate it takes about 8-10 hours to complete.  If you've played it before you may be able to play through a little quicker.

If you're looking to play classic P&C Adventures, definitely give this a try, it remains an entertaining play the delivers some laughs and won't be over too quickly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198422199704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 431, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1665432315}
review:
This is the remastered version of [b]"Maniac Mansion 2"[/b], which itself is the sequel of [b]"Maniac Mansion"[/b] from 1987, a game that is almost reaching its vintage age. For those who didn't know or too young to know, these are made by the same guys who later made the legendary [b]"Monkey Island"[/b].

Maniac Mansion is included in this remastered version as well and you can find and play it on a PC inside the game so you won't miss out anything if you didn't played the 1st game before.

And since both Maniac Mansion 1 & 2 are present in this remaster, i might as well review them both.

[h1]Maniac Mansion[/h1]
This game is one of the earliest genius design game from 1987 that introduced a real time exploring simulation that is very very rare back then...

To put it short for the newer gamer generation to understand, it is very similar to the not long ago viral [b]"Hello Neighbor"[/b] game, merged with the good old school [b]"Simon the Sorcerer"[/b] point and click layout in game UI wise...

It has multiple play-able characters, multiple endings and of course, choice matters that defines the route and branches in the game. It's a short game in overall with tons of solving methods so you can play the game over and over again with different combinations and ways to reach the ending, each filled with their own old school humor and each play through can be very different. So the replay-ability is very high and will probably take more time than the actual "Day of the Tentacle" itself if you went all out for a full completion testing out all possibilities... 

[h1]Maniac Mansion 2: Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/h1]
The remaster is true to the original, but with all the artwork remade in HD. The cartoon-ish humor and all that really bring out a lot of laughter and childhood memories. Puzzle is still fun after all these years, and gives a lot of the "oooh" moment when they finally make sense... It can still be considered a masterpiece even when compared with recent point and click games. 

So, if you are a point and click adventure game lover, or if you played Monkey Island or Simon the Sorcerer before and loved them, you will surely love both Maniac Mansion in this remastered version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103732873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1665393522}
review:
This is a great game. I played parts of the game when I was young and remembered that the game had some super original puzzles in it. And having played it through now, I must say that the remastered edition is absolutely great. The graphic looks very good, the voices particularly of purple tentacle are great, and quite a number of puzzles are truly brilliant, some of them also hard. (Typically solutions to puzzles are easy if you think of them ;-))

Some people said in their negative reviews, this game only has ratings as high as this out of pure nostalgia, but Day of the Tentacle is a great game on its own. The controls have been modernized and are state of the art, so you don't have the problem that you have with some old games that you have to adjust to controls that seem out of time.

Some people claimed the puzzles are illogical, which is definitely not the case. You might not think of all solutions to the puzzles (in which case just look them up in a walkthrough), but seeing the solution, you should also recognize the logic behind it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198204888712', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1664735722}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered es una versi√≥n actualizada del cl√°sico juego de aventuras lanzado originalmente en 1993. Desarrollado por LucasArts, esta versi√≥n remasterizada presenta gr√°ficos y sonidos mejorados, junto con otras caracter√≠sticas adicionales, como comentarios de desarrolladores y una interfaz mejorada.

La jugabilidad de Day of the Tentacle sigue siendo tan divertida y desafiante como lo era en el juego original. Los jugadores controlan a tres personajes diferentes mientras exploran el mundo del juego, resuelven acertijos y tratan de salvar el mundo de una amenaza tentacular. La mec√°nica de los acertijos es l√≥gica y desafiante, lo que significa que los jugadores deben usar su ingenio y creatividad para superarlos.

La historia de Day of the Tentacle es divertida y emocionante, con una narrativa humor√≠stica que se desarrolla a lo largo del juego. Los di√°logos son ingeniosos y est√°n llenos de humor y sarcasmo, lo que hace que la experiencia de juego sea a√∫n m√°s divertida. Los personajes son √∫nicos y carism√°ticos, lo que los convierte en algunos de los m√°s queridos en la historia de los videojuegos.

La presentaci√≥n visual y sonora de Day of the Tentacle Remastered es impresionante. Los gr√°ficos mejorados son detallados y coloridos, y la animaci√≥n es fluida y suave. La banda sonora es igualmente impresionante, con m√∫sica pegadiza y efectos de sonido realistas que ayudan a crear una atm√≥sfera √∫nica y envolvente.

En conclusi√≥n, Day of the Tentacle Remastered es una excelente remasterizaci√≥n de un cl√°sico juego de aventuras. La mec√°nica de los acertijos es l√≥gica y desafiante, la narrativa es emocionante y divertida, y los gr√°ficos y la m√∫sica son impresionantes. Este t√≠tulo es una excelente opci√≥n para cualquier fan de los juegos de aventuras y los juegos de acci√≥n en tercera persona, y sigue siendo una experiencia de juego emocionante y divertida incluso despu√©s de todos estos a√±os.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104732194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1664550842}
review:
amazing game, all in all it's high for people who love adventure games.
in my run i used 3 hints (1 i do not think i would find myself, 1 i was blind to see an item and the last is an error (IMO) on a vcr button [spoiler] the aquare button is stop and the circle button is record, c'mon ppl [/spoiler]. Besides that the humor was solid, the puzzles were all logical (even the one i think i would not solve myself. The voice work is... ok, but it gets the job done.
pick it up on a sale it's a fun experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086336193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1623169243}
review: Possibly the best point and click adventure game ever made? I played this back in the day when it was first released. This remastered version looks simply stunning, although I remembered most of the puzzles from the old game so didn't blow me away like the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198968361120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1663885829}
review: A nice little story with an enjoyable cartoon aesthetic, so it's a shame that actually playing the game isn't fun. Obtuse isn't a strong enough word to describe how illogical and nonsensical the puzzle solutions are in this game. Some of them make sense, but then you've got the ones you'll only find by trying every item on every interactive object until you stumble upon the solution. That's more brute forcing than puzzle solving.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012481544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 654, 'last_played': 1662903731}
review:
This game is absolute perfection*. Out of all the games I‚Äôve ever played, DOTT stands out simply as a masterpiece. When I first played it over 20 years ago I instantly fell in love with this game, and picking it up again this year I was pleasantly surprised to find that not only did it stand up to the test of time, but the remastered version was so faithfully done, filled with much love and care.

*Now DOTT may not be my favourite game, as that title remains squarely with the Monkey Island series, but one thing that puts DOTT above the rest is that there is simply nothing to complain about. From start to finish this game is just‚Ä¶. Perfection.

review: Aventura gr√°fica divertida, con premisa interesante y personajes entretenidos. Tiene cadencias en cuanto a la l√≥gica de ciertos puzzles, pero si juegas aventuras gr√°ficas es lo que te esperas ya.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003919468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 3944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3944, 'last_played': 1661729093}
review:
A highly humorous and slightly unhinged tale of simultaneous causality, interacting in cartoon logic's over 3 time periods, bringing new dimension's to the cause and effect of point and click video game! A master piece in the intellectual age of silly. Very funny Lucas Arts classic adventure game, remasterd sound and fx nicely by double fine, with added bonus of being able to hit f1 for the original pixels! oh and if you missed maniac mansion its actually complete in this game, on a computer within a computer...whaaaa??
Excellent voice over that stands the test of time and tentacles!
Dr Fred, A cataclysmic global event in a lab coat and iconic scientific role model to all.

review: 10 von 10 in jeder Hinsicht. Von einem kleinen Team wurde der Klassiker wiederbelebt. Wer dieses Spiel fr√ºher schon liebte, dem schl√§gt das Herz vor Freude bei diesem fantastischen Remake. Das Spielsystem, die Gags, selbst die Stimmen lassen Erinnerungen an das Zocken vor vielen Jahren instant aufkommen. Retro-Spa√ü f√ºr jedes Alter. Absolut zu empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302970410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1660502462}
review:
Bon bah voil√†... J'ai √† nouveau torch√© ce jeu pour la √©ni√®me fois... 

C'est un remaster digne de ce nom. Il ne poss√®de pas un simple lissage des textures mais a √©t√© totalement retravaill√©, tout en gardant la patte graphique et bien s√ªr chaque action et sc√®ne anim√©e est identique. Il y a d'ailleurs la possibilit√© de passer du mode retro au mode "retravaill√©" avec une seule touche et cela ne coupe pas les animations puisqu'elles sont identiques. 

Le jeu en lui-m√™me est sans doute l'un des meilleurs point'n'click (si ce n'est le meilleur... Avec Toonstruck et Sam et Max quand m√™me). L'ambiance est dr√¥le, la difficult√© bien dos√©e. 

Un jeu culte en somme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388402355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1673900069}
review: I grew up playing the Pajama Sam series of point and click adventure games, but needed something a little more challenging as an adult. I will admit I had to use a guide a few times. Some of the puzzle steps don't quite make sense, and others rely on you picking the exact dialogue to make something happen. Finished the game in about 6 hrs. There is little replay-ability unless you forget about the game and play it once a year. A nice casual/comedic point-and-click finish-in-a-weekend game overall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000313700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 813, 'playtime_forever': 2134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2134, 'last_played': 1657217656}
review:
Vorsicht, lieber Leser, es geht wieder ab ins wundersch√∂ne Nostalgie - Hausen!

Das liegt gleich neben "Romantisch Verkl√§rte Vergangenheit - Stadt" und nur ein ganz klein wenig oberhalb von "Rosa Rote  Retro Brille - Burg". 

Da mach ich manchmal Urlaub, wenn die stressige Realit√§t (B√§h, die konnte ich noch nie ab!) mir wieder mal einen Kurzurlaub voll von wundervoller Wirklichkeitsflucht und Sch√∂nwetter-Gaming-Gute-alte-Zeit-Schwelgerei abn√∂tigt.

Aber ich will Dich nicht mit Fachbegriffen langweilen (sondern lieber mit einem mal wieder viel zu langen Review und dadurch, dass ich hier noch ewig weiter tippe, wirds irgendwie auch nicht besser... puh.), stattdessen nehm ich Dich in diesen tollen, aber manchmal ach so wichtigen Kurzurlaub einfach mit.
Nett von mir, oder?
Und heute gehts auch an ein ganz besonders Ziel. 
Wir reisen ins Land der Tentakel und nein, nicht in so ein obskures Asia Tentakel Spiel, wie Du sie immer heimlich zockst, wenn keiner hinguckt...
... wir reisen nach Day of the Tentacle, dem Nachfolger von Maniac Mansion und genauso verr√ºckt, liebenswert und schrullig, wie auch schon der Vorg√§nger es war.

Und ja, so war das damals, Point and Click Adventures waren DAS Ding schlechthin, grafische Wunderwerke in ihrer Pixeligkeit unerreicht und der PC Speaker Sound piepte aus allen Nicht-Boxen. Sogar von echter Musik und Vertonung munkelte man gar. Nur hinter vorgehaltener Hand nat√ºrlich, man konnte geistig fast nicht mehr mithalten mit dem ganzen technischen Fortschritts-Wahn.

Was man aber wusste und da waren sich alle einig, war, dass Humor ein elementarer Bestandteil einer guten Adventure Story sein musste. Ein Glaube, der sich heute sogar noch bis in zahllose witzige bis peinlich bl√∂delige Indie Perlen durchzieht.
Und weil ja damals immer alles besser war, so wars dann eben auch der Humor. Schenkel klopfend und nach Luft japsend sa√üen wir dicht gedr√§ngt vorm Bildschirm und versuchten, irgendwie den Lachflash zu √ºberleben, von dem wir noch nichtmal ahnten, dass er so hie√ü.

Und ja, Lucas Arts war die Speerspitze all der Kom√∂dianten und Witzchenrei√üer in der gro√üen, weiten Adventure Welt. Das waren echte K√∂nner und Kenner ihres Fachs. Da sa√ü jede Pointe und z√ºndete jeder Gag. Kein Auge bliebt trocken, aber hoffentlich jede Hose, auch wenn bei derartigen Lachattacken nie eine Gew√§hr √ºbernommen werden konnte.

Und dann war irgendwann einfach Schluss und Ende und aus und finito.
 
Es hatte sich ausgelacht und von da an begann eine tr√ºbsinnige √Ñra des Spiele-Ernstes, die grau und bleiern bis heute jeden Anflug von Humor in jeglichen Games erdr√ºckt. Punkt!

Zum Gl√ºck keimen ab und zu dennoch die kleinen, zarten Pfl√§nzchen des Lachens hier und dort immer mal durch, aber im Gro√üen und Ganzen war genau zum Zeitpunkt der gro√üen Lucas Arts Produktionen die Hochzeit des Spielehumors erreicht. 

Und hier kriegst Du wirklich ein Paradebeispiel. Die Story um die drei absolut liebenswerten, weil endlos beh√§mmerten Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne spr√ºht vor Charme und Witz. Purpur und Gr√ºn Tentakel sind bis heute Kult und jeder kennt den Wahlspruch der Familie Edison in und auswendig...

Zuviel von der Geschichte mag ich gar nicht vorwegnehmen, aber Du wirst die drei Deppen in verschiedene Zeitperioden begleiten, in Echtzeit und je zweihundert Jahre in der Zunkuft und Vergangenheit R√§tsel l√∂sen, bei der Grundsteinlegung der Verfassung herumpfuschen, die Menschheit retten und und und und und....

Der Grafikstil ist auch heute noch eine wahre Pracht, nat√ºrlich ein wenig angegraut, aber das hei√üt dann einfach "retro" und damit ist jeder, ders nicht mag, automatisch ein Banause. 
Aber bisschen pr√§chtiger gehts trotzdem noch, Du kannst auch in eine High End Comic Version umschalten, dann aber auch mit modernerer Bedienung. 
Vom Sound fang ich nicht an, sonst komm ich nie aus den Begeisterungsst√ºrmen raus, die Synchro ist einfach der HAMMER (Linksh√§nder-Hammer, das ist wichtig, wie Du im Spiel lernen wirst.) und die Musik dudelt Dir noch Tage nach dem Zocken lieblich durchs Hirn.

Und da stellt sich nun die Frage: H√§tte man denn unbedingt ein Remake rausbringen m√ºssen?
N√∂.
Schadet es, das gemacht zu haben?
N√∂.

Alles gut also in Tentakel - Hausen, Der Urlaub von der Wirklichkeit kann also losgehen, aber stell Dich auf knackige, meist logische R√§tsel und ein F√ºllhorn extrem charakterstarker, um nicht zu sagen: verr√ºckter Typen ein, von denen jeder und jede einzelne Dir noch lange im Ged√§chtnis bleiben werden.

Und beim Entdecken oder Wiederentdecken dieses wundersch√∂nen Tollhauses voller Ideen und Esprit (und nebenbei eines meiner Top 5 Spieler aller Zeiten √ºberhaupt) w√ºnsch ich Dir wie immer...

... viel Spa√ü  ;-)






Und hey, wenn¬¥s Dir gefallen hat, ne Runde von mir zu lesen, dann klick hier
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41622336/
und da gibts mehr von mir auf meiner Curator Seite. Schm√∂kern for free: Also stell Dir nen Tee bereit und viel Spa√ü beim lesen...

review: A fun and colorful adventure game that is unfortunately still an adventure game. The world is fun, the characters all funny and engaging. most of the puzzles can make you feel like the cleverest person alive, while others even knowing the solution feel designed by an alien. It is truly one of the greatest in the Point and Click genre and deserves praise for what it is, but the genre has died out for a reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068473335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1656738353}
review:
Hace casi 30 a√±os que jugu√© Day of Tentacle y las sensaciones no cambiaron, es un cl√°sico, una obra s√°tira divertida con humor de otros tiempos, el aspecto audiovisual est√° al d√≠a con esta remasterizaci√≥n, todo lo que est√° bien para hacer una aventura gr√°fica se encuentra ac√°. Quisiera ver muchas m√°s experiencias as√≠ en los tiempos actuales con tanto clon.
Un tema es que el enfoque de la narrativa (sin spoiler) puede no ser para todos los gustos. En mi caso por la edad que ten√≠a cuando lo jugu√© originalmente no comprend√≠a la relaci√≥n de los personajes con la historia, hoy lo disfruto m√°s en ese sentido.
Una recomendaci√≥n para este juego y cualquier aventura similar, NO mirar absolutamente nada en internet, no buscar ayudas y si es posible ni siquiera iluminar los objetos interactivos del escenario que viene de f√°brica, dejarte llevar en el absurdo y a veces incomprensible pensamiento que resuelve los acertijos es el conducto para pasarla bien.
C√≥mprenlo, juegos as√≠ valen la pena y fueron el germen de la inspiraci√≥n para muchos productos en la industria.

PD: Este a√±o vuelve el Monkey!!!!!!! (Por favor no lo arruines Ron !!!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198042687424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1656769294}
review:
Loved the original and was looking forward to this... but this game was BUGGY as hell!!!
Art was glitching at many places; i would see just half a screen or part of it was the graphic of a different location with character models strewn over it - the game just seemed unfinished... but then came the worst part:
The first time a 'newspaper sequence' showed up, the last beat of the musictrack just replayed EVERY 6 SECONDS after that, over the normal soundtrack THROUGHOUT THE REST OF THE GAME! I tried reloading, switching to the old version via F1 (still there in MIDI) or just triggering anything in the game that would stop it. Never have I ever experienced promised 'highquality' in such a bad state...
I'm also writing this so someone might give me a hint how to fix this issue, because apparently not everyone has had this problem. But for now I am not recommending this version!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026322890', 'num_games_owned': 977, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 165, 'last_played': 1656445447}
review:
Leider ist das Spiel deutlich schlechter gealtert als die Monkey Island Remasters und anders als mit purer Nostalgie kann ich mir die extrem positiven Bewertungen nicht erkl√§ren.

Nicht nur, dass das Spiel an der typischen Comedy-Adventure-Krankheit leidet, dass R√§tsel schwer nachvollziehbar sind (Beispiel: Einen festgeklebten Kaugummi mit einer Brechstange vom Boden l√∂sen) und h√§ufig um mehrere Ecken gedacht werden muss, auch der Comedy-Aspekt selbst ist f√ºr die heutige Zeit doch sehr... begrenzt komisch. Ein paar Mal musste ich durch die Nase sto√üartig ausatmen, aber das war es dann auch.

Ab der H√§lfte meiner Spielzeit musste ich dann auf ein Walkthrough umsteigen, weil ich schlicht keinerlei Anhaltspunkte hatte, was ich wie machen muss. Im Walkthrough ging es dann, simplifiziert, nur darum, Gegenst√§nde durch eine Zeitmaschine an die anderen Charaktere zu schicken. Das f√ºgt eine zus√§tzliche R√§tsel-Ebene hinzu, was diese teils nochmal deutlich schlechter nachvollziehbar macht.

Es hilft nat√ºrlich auch erst recht nicht, dass ein Doppel-Klicken auf einen Ein/Ausgang nicht sofort zum n√§chsten Raum springt. Man schaut also konstant den Charakteren dabei zu, wie Sie langsam durch die Hintergr√ºnde spazieren. Das macht das omnipr√§sente Backtracking nervt√∂tend.

All dies hat dazu gef√ºhrt, dass ich irgendwo zwischen gelangweilt und genervt sein pendelte.
Wer Interesse an den √§lteren Adventures hat und, wie ich, die Monkey Island Spiele toll findet, sollte definitiv doppelt pr√ºfen, ob Day of the Tentacle die gleiche Kerbe trifft. Denn ohne Rosa-Rote Nostalgie Brille kann es hier ganz schnell √§tzend werden.

review: this game manages the impressive feat of "not being fun to play", "not being funny", and "not being good to look at", which were all three things that critical reviews of the game have made clear were points in its favor. moon logic puzzles, anti-jokes written by people who read too much Far Side and delivered by "voice actors" that had no interest in trying to make them funny, and confusing environments where key items easily blend into the background. i'm starting to wonder if i downloaded a bad copy of the game.

review:
Una premisa absurda que en ning√∫n momento se aleja del humor en sus situaciones. Mantiene un nivel simp√°tico sin grandes chistes pero no son pocos los que se pasan por alto por ser referencias de Estados Unidos o estar lejanas en el tiempo.

El gran factor diferenciador de sus puzles es separar a los personajes en pasado, presente y futuro por lo que algunas veces se tendr√° que tener en cuenta para que nuestras acciones afecten al resto. Muchos est√°n bien pensados y planteados aunque como es habitual en los juegos de este g√©nero en la √©poca... siempre hay alguna resoluci√≥n rebuscada casi imposible de deducir sin una gu√≠a. No ocurre hasta que se ha avanzado bastante de ah√≠ que pille tanto por sorpresa.

Como remasterizaci√≥n cumple suavizando los gr√°ficos, m√∫sica menos electr√≥nica, galer√≠a de bocetos y comentarios de los desarrolladores (que en ocasiones tapan a los del juego).

Dieses Spiel bringt auch Einfl√ºsse in andere dieser Spiele was es zu einer ziemlichen Ikone macht.
Durch die Zeit mit den dreien zu Reisen und Amerikanische Geschichte zu lernen ist zwar nicht direkt meine Hauptbesch√§ftigung.
Aber es ist durchaus Spannend verschiedene R√§tsel zu l√∂sen und die Geschichte zu durchleben.
Ich hatte keine gro√üen Bugs gefunden was √∂fter bei anderen/√§lteren Spielen passiert.
Deswegen w√ºrde ich dieses Spiel gerne Empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024423322', 'num_games_owned': 1307, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1652025851}
review:
Ich bin froh, diesen Klassiker der Videospiele endlich gespielt zu haben. Das Remaster sieht schick aus und bleibt dabei meiner Meinung nach dem Stil des Originals treu. Der Stil selbst ist genauso wie die deutsche Vertonung am Anfang etwas gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig f√ºr mich gewesen, aber mit der Zeit habe ich es zu m√∂gen gelernt. 

Der Aufbau des Spiels war spannend, da man mit drei Charakteren gleichzeitig unterwegs war. Was mich gest√∂rt hat, oder womit ich Probleme hatte, war, dass ich ohne Hilfe aus dem Internet auf einige L√∂sungen wahrscheinlich nie oder erst nach viel Trial and Error gekommen w√§re, auch wenn sie im Nachhinein Sinn gemacht haben  - an dieser Stelle w√ºrde ich gerne auf uhs-hints.com verweisen, die nicht gleich die L√∂sung spoilern, sondern stufenweise Hinweise geben.

W√ºrde ich Day of the Tentacle Remastered empfehlen? Definitiv! Der Humor ist klasse, die Charaktere interessant und gut geschrieben und dank des Remasters sieht es wie ein modernes Spiel aus.
W√ºrde ich es Einsteigern von Point 'n' Click Adventures empfehlen? Wahrscheinlich nicht. Daf√ºr ist es meiner Meinung nach etwas zu schwer, weil manche Sachen zu gut versteckt oder manche R√§tsel etwas zu knifflig waren.
Ein gro√ües Plus √ºbrigens noch daf√ºr, dass es ein Spiel im Spiel gibt, denn Maniac Mansion ist auch in dem Remaster versteckt.

review: Maybe I am too nostalgic (and too old) but I still find these games a lot more fun than many currently available. author: {'steamid': '76561198966855837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1650831288}
review: Tappa obbligatoria per tutti gli amanti del genere ma che potrebbe risultare un po' duro da digerire per chi non ha mai toccato un gioco punta e clicca in quanto non c'√® alcuna possibilit√† di avere dei piccoli aiuti quando si rimane incastrati in qualche enigma e talvolta le risoluzioni possono non essere particolarmente intuitive costringendo il giocatore pi√π svogliato, me compreso, a guardare una guida online e aver spoilerato pi√π del dovuto. Altra critica che faccio stavolta alla remastered √® il commento degli sviluppatori che molto spesso si buggher√† con l'interfaccia in game non permettendo al giocatore di disabilitarlo all'interno delle cutscene, esempio molto fastidioso, non capendo bene a cosa corrispondesse iniziato il gioco l'attivai ed ebbi la cutscene iniziale completamente rovinata dall'overlay dei commenti degli sviluppatori che oscuravano totalmente i dialoghi e che per l'appunto non era possibile disattivare se non a scena conclusa. A patto di questi piccoli difetti rimane un gioco estremamente divertente e stimolante, con una moltitudine di oggetti ed ester eggs ai monkey island che consiglio di giocare quantomeno il primo prima di imbattersi in questa avventura per familiarizzare al meglio con il genere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075146545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1650623828}
review:
Spa√üiges Adventure, die Point und Click Steuerung ist einigerma√üen komfortabel und die grafische aufh√ºbschung macht es ganz ansehnlich.
Man kann im Spiel Maniac Mansion spielen, wem das gef√§llt.
Wenn man diese Art Spiele mag wird man hier bestens versorgt, die R√§tsel sind interessant und teils knifflig, aber man kann wohl nicht in einer Sackgasse landen.
V√∂llig unlogische, bzw. fast unm√∂gliche Dinge gibts nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036524507', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1520790139}
review: Eines der geilsten Adventures aus der guten alten Zeit. Ein chemikalisches zeug dass im Abwasser geraten ist landet im Bauch eines dahergelaufenen Tentakels, der dann eine merkw√ºrdige Wandlung durchmacht und davon besessen ist die Welt zu beherrschen. Eine Menschengruppe soll die Welt vor diesem wahnsinnigen retten, wobei jeder Mensch seine ganz eigenen Rollen spielt, dabei findet man so einige Szenen und Sachen vor wo man sich immer wieder kaputt lachen k√∂nnte. Wer sich an Monkey Island erinnert: ja genau so in diesem Setting ist auch Day of the Tentacle. Einfach nur herrlich schr√§g und vorallem witzig. Diese Spiele kommen noch aus Zeiten, wo Unterhaltung deutlich mehr wert hatte in der Spieleentwicklung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788488', 'num_games_owned': 747, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1650048365}
review:
[h1]Day of the Tentacle ‚Äì Remastered[/h1]
...is a point & click adventure. Purple Tentacle has become more intelligent and has vowed to take over the world, so it is up to Bernard and his friends to return to the Maniac Mansion and save the world.

[h1]‚öô [u]Game Description & Mechanics[/u] ‚öô[/h1]
A remake of the Lucas Arts classic from the golden age of point & click games, you move your character around fixed 2D screens, going in doors, up and down stairs, and other passages. You control three different characters across time: Bernard is in the present, Hoagie is 200 years in the past, and Laverne is 200 years in the future. Things you do in the past may affect object placements or availability in the future, but it's best not to overthink the time travel and paradox.

On your way, you collect items you store in your inventory. This can be used on specific locations in the environment or with other objects, or given to other characters you come across. Using your Chron-O-John time capsule, you can send items to other characters, but once you've done so, you can do it from the menu without actually needing to travel all the way to the time capsule to send or retrieve them.

Depending on the item, person or interactive environment element, you can specify whether you want to open, close, push, pull, use, or talk to them. The answers aren't always straightforward or logical (this is a cartoony comedy, after all), and the game expects you to experiment using objects in different ways until you come across something that works, even if you don't know what it'll be used for at that time.

[h1]‚ò∫ [u]What I enjoyed[/u] ‚ò∫[/h1]
I can't stress how faithful the devs have been to the original game. Some might want to argue that translating a 320x240 resolution game to modern resolutions could really look like anything, but the entire game was recreated based on the original 1992 and 1993 concept arts used in the original game (which are unlocked once the game is completed). Even the audio is taken directly from the limited-edition CD-ROM version of the original game. And if you really want the original game, the option to play on the original 320x240 resolution (adapted to modern monitors) is available as well!

The game is packed full with slapstick and goofy humor. The characters are weird caricatures, the environments are deliberately twisted and exaggerated, the script is full of corny jokes. The use of objects is ridiculous, with a bunch of hidden achievements from misusing them (here's a free one: [spoiler]using the coffee with the decaf mug will get you the "And then the world explodes" achievement![/spoiler]). Even the very premise is ludicrous: a pet tentacle drinking toxic waste grows two arms (no hands or fingers mind you, merely two small stubs), and that's enough for it to feel empowered enough to attempt and succeed at taking over the world.

[h1]‚òπ [u]What bothered me[/u] ‚òπ[/h1]
It feels like the game was short, a lot shorter than I remember it to be (my playtime includes being AFK for a few hours, and replaying multiple times to get missed achievements). This is without a doubt because I remembered what to do from my past playthrough, but that might just be it: the game heavily targets the nostalgia of gamers who played this game and others like it some 30 years ago, but doesn't have anything new or novel to add to them. It feels like when those old VHS movies were ported to DVD for the first time and they were trying to enhance it with additional content that fell flat. Here, you get images of concept arts, you can turn on a commentary voiceover while playing, and that's about it. I'm not saying I have better ideas of my own, but still...

Some of the mechanics haven't aged well at all. Even back then, having to clarify whether you're pushing, pulling, or using the object was slowly being phased out of point & click games. It's somewhat tedious to have to clarify that I wish to PUSH the button, or that I wish to OPEN the door. I clicked on it, isn't that enough? I understand that the original game was like that, so of course, they kept it here, but that doesn't change the fact that it's a mechanic that aged terribly and may annoy anyone that isn't playing this game with rose-tinted glasses.

[h1][b]My Verdict[/b]: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ - [i]"Next on your list!"[/i][/h1]

There isn't much to say about [i]Day of the Tentacle ‚Äì Remastered[/i] except for what an absolutely perfect remastered edition it is. It has everything it should have: an impeccable port of the original game for modern computers, an aesthetically faithful modern resolution with the optional original resolution kept for posterity. It is the best possible way to introduce new or younger players to point & click classics.

[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197995788914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1463031934}
review:
My favorite point-n-click adventure from my childhood, Day of the tentacle (DotT) is a super interesting game that offers puzzles from three different timelines (Past, Modern, Future) where you'll need to solve problems using creative solutions from items that exist at different time, trying to change a terrible future from happening. Sure, you'll probably affect causality along the way, and cause other... weird changes, but that's fun, right?

The game has no fail-state that I know of, being from an era where experimentation and screwing up was part of the fun, rather than a reason to punish players. It's why I love it so much.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996999492', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1647365642}
review:
I was a teenager when the game was released. LOVED it and was probably of of my favorite of all times.
I guess when you're a certain age and with all the walkthroughs available a fingerclick away, you dont have the patience anymore for all the weird puzzles. I remember DOTT was easy. Almost 30 years later, i had no patience for this.
It is still a great game and a marvelous remake but i guess my fond memories were better than playing it today.
I recommend it and its an important game to teach all gamer generations but today i enjoy other adventure games more:
Sam & Max, Gabriel Knight 1,2, and the Dig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054279933', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1646930582}
review:
Puzzle games are fun, especially those humorous ones. I really like them.

This however is not fun. The puzzles are pure nonsense and the humour... well, if you think a fat guy scratching his belly and burping is hilarious and the word 'toilet' makes you giggle, this game is definitely for you. I however was not amused.

The game is known to crash occasionally but I was lucky enough not to experience it so perhaps you too can play it through if you have patience and you actually like to do it, even for the achievements - which are also mostly moronic; you even get an achievement for idling (and cursing the day you bought this game though this is purely optional). And yes, of course you need to watch every painfully idiotic cutscene to get another achievement.

Voice acting, if you can call it that, is beyond terrible though I must admit my acting would also be terrible if I had to utter sentences that stupid over and over again. At least the actors were paid unlike us poor idiots who paid to play this game.

I played this halfway through, solving stupid obscure puzzles one after another until I just gave up and finished the game with a help of a walkthrough, and have absolutely no plans to play this Double Fine Mess ever again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030334206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1648848779}
review: A masterpiece of point-and-click adventures. If you like puzzles, humour, and madness this is the game for you. Unlike some old-school adventures, in DOTT you cannot accidentally lose any vital item and make your playthrough unwinnable. So jump right in :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991507400', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1645653558}
review:
I remember playing this game back in the day. So here it is a newly remastered version let's see what it brings.

So when I finally sat down and played it .... it was okay. Like all point-n-click games of the time, it suffered the same "What next?" problem. These days if you get stuck you just go online and within minutes you have an answer (usually.) Back then, you usually had to wait for some gaming magazine to publish a walkthrough, and when you live in a small town your options in that regard are limited. However, this is what made point-n-click games so compelling. The challenge. DOTT in this regard was far too easy and I remember this was one of the few games I didn't need a walkthrough. So my criticism is that it was too easy.

Graphically the game was colourful and pretty, making it stand out from other games of the genre. The cartoony graphics were a bit refreshing, with a noticeable Chuck Jones feel to them. Voice acting was pretty good for the time.

So, what do I think of the remaster? Well, it gives me hope. This game has been so well remastered to current-gen systems that it gives me hope that more old LucasArts games get the same treatment *cough* Fate of Atlantis *cough*. Hint, hint, wink, wink.

Visually the HD remastered graphics are great and you can almost forget how old the source material is, however as another reviewer said, they can be a bit bland and lacking detail. However, this is just in contrast to current standards, back then it was detailed.

Story-wise, DOTTR is as funny as it was back then. A few dated jokes that the younger generation are unlikely to get, but otherwise it holds up.

Overall:
Day of the Tentacle remastered is a fantastic remastering of a cult classic for current-gen systems. However, if I had to be honest, this game is primarily aimed at its long time fans. Newer/younger gamers are likely to not get a lot of it and hold it on par with an interactive cartoon (whether that is a good thing or not may vary depending on personal taste.) The bottom line is this is a great game with which I had a lot of fun, both then and now.

Side Note:
Don't play this game with a walkthrough or trophy guide on your first playthrough. Get any missed trophies on subsequent playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234547376', 'num_games_owned': 1753, 'num_reviews': 291, 'playtime_forever': 1159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1159, 'last_played': 1645380815}
review:
Day of the Tentacle eines der Klassikern unter den Point & Klick Genres wurde  als Remastered aufgeh√ºbscht. Purpur-Tentakel will die Weltherschafft an sich rei√üen und die Menschen versklaven f√ºr ihren "Menschenshow!" Drei Spielbaren Charakteren sind hier vertreten: Bernhard der Nerd, Hoagie ein Rock Musiker und Laverne eine Medizinstudentin. Deren Ausgabe es ist, diesen fiesen Purpur-Tentakel aufzuhalten. Dr. Ed Edison ein Verr√ºckter Wissenschaftler, wie all seiner Vorfahren ebenfalls Wissenschaftler waren erschuf er einen Zeitmaschine in einer Toilette! Durch Neugier wollten Bernhard, Hoagie und Laverne sie testen...Ungl√ºcklicherweise wurde Hoagie in die Vergangenheit geschickt. Laverne in der Zukunft, Bernhard blieb in Gegenwart. 

Lob an die Entwickler f√ºr das Handgezeichnete Remastered Liebevoll & guten Design Wahl! Die urspr√ºngliche Grafik aus den 1993 ist auch enthalten f√ºr die Retro-Dudes!

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2749525802

Pro:
+Humorvolle Story
+Switchen durch alt/neu Grafik
+Wechseln an Charakteren um manche L√∂sungen zu l√∂sen
+Deutschen Synchronsprecher TOP
+Maniac Manision spielen (ein Spiel in ein Spiel)

Con:
-Subtitles sind langsam
-Maniac Mansion leider kein Deutschen-Untertitel

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197964761231', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1644489273}
review:
Amazing remaster of one of the best puzzle adventure games of all time.

The gameplay is peak LucasArts, using the 9-verb interaction system with inventory visible on screen.  You can swap between 3 characters in the past, present, and future, and share (most) inventory items between them.  Actions taken in the past will cause changes to appear in the present and future.  The puzzles are clever and the situations are hilarious.

The graphics are perfect.  The original art style is completely preserved in the new high resolution widescreen graphics, unlike some other remasters that made questionable art decisions.

The music is good too.  It sounds like very high quality MIDI, and works exactly like the classic iMUSE system in synchronizing with onscreen events.  I do wonder if it might have sounded better with real orchestral recordings, but the MIDI-style playback is rather nostalgic.

One complaint:  I had to add --DisableFMODDSP to the launch options to fix choppy sound and music.  Apparently this has something to do with Realtek High Definition Audio, which is very common on motherboards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044030747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1642270528}
review:
La cr√®me de l'humour Lucas Art de la grande √©poque. Mais.. 
C'est aussi un point and click qui vous laisse dans une zone immense qui repr√©sente pratiquement l'entieret√© du jeu d√®s le d√©but avec un quasi acc√®s √† tous les objets ce qui peut √™tre pas mal perturbant, se retrouver avec un inventaire de 20/30 objet au bout d'une heure et pas la moindre id√©e de quoi faire avec, c'est du jeu √† l'ancienne quoi. Heureusement qu'il existe une certaine logique dans les √©nigmes qui fait que les objets reste relativement √©vident √† utiliser (pour la plupart).
L'interaction temporelle entre les 3 personnages est super, surtout quand le fait de changer un √©l√©ment du pass√© se r√©p√©rcute dans le futur. Et l'humour est au top du top avec des dialogues super qui reste dr√¥le des d√©cennies plus tard !
Je recommande grandement pour tous amateur du genre cherchant √† faire les classiques !

author: {'steamid': '76561198000211939', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1580945442}
review: A very good remake, you can change between the classic view and the remake at any moment pressing F1. A classic point & click adventure of Lucasarts. The puzzles are difficult to solve if you don't follow a guide, you have to explore a lot and try a lot of combinations, but that's the way it was designed to be. If you like this kind of games you'll loved it, if you don't have the patience to play like this you can always follow a guide and it may also be enjoyable. Also, it works in old PCs, that's a plus.

review:
This graphic adventure has probably the most interesting concept ever seen: the three characters interact in the same location but in three different ages and everything they do in the past can influence the future. This settings allows several absurd and funny solutions for the puzzles.
If we add cartoonish graphics, great voice acting, funny dialogues and the return of "Maniac Mansion"'s cast (the game itself is included as an easter egg), we have a definitive product!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067371366', 'num_games_owned': 2090, 'num_reviews': 584, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1640991711}
review:
A classic! If like me you played and loved the original back in the day, believe me, this remastered version is its worthy tribute. The graphics are top notch, the remastered music too, the gameplay is smoother (wheel of actions)... An excellent upgrade to a classic game without ruining it or changing it too much.
Now, if you have never played it, this remastered version is worth a try, it does not look like an old game at all! Just old school style. This is a traditional point and click, with many items to look at, many places to explore, an insane scenario with quirky characters and absurd dialogues, tons of items to gather and combine, loony music, super clever narration with time jumps, but most of all: a crunchy taste of humor that still holds up to nowadays standards. Do not expect a huge game, this is a little gem, and you have to accept the derisory tone and slow pace of typical 90s good old quirkiness. When on sale at a few bucks, this is a steal that any gamer should do, as it is a piece of gaming history!

author: {'steamid': '76561198087475757', 'num_games_owned': 1643, 'num_reviews': 154, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1564261035}
review:
Not a game for me: Mediocre story and characters, obscure and convoluted puzzles in three different timelines with lots of riddles and no clear solving order. I read a guide to proceed to the end since I realized I didn't have any fun solving these puzzles, there are only a few gotcha moments but lots of "what?" reactions after "solving" them. 

However, this remaster's commercial success still makes me glad that adventure genre is thriving and has evolved, so we can have various sub-genres in adventure games to choose from. Here are some of my favorites: What Remains of Edith Finch, INSIDE, Danganronpa, Unavowed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961161335', 'num_games_owned': 441, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1459019466}
review:
I played this game in the 90's originally on floppy disk, then the CD version came out that ran on the millennium edition of Windows. Safe to say it was probably the first point and click game I ever played; and the first I completed from start to finish without a guide.

You'll probably see a lot of nostalgic reviews here on steam, and they absolutely have their place. But if we look at this game from the point of view of someone who didn't play it back in the 90's it still has a solid story, interesting mechanisms to solve and a great art style. Well worth a play whether you're coming back to it or if you're trying out for the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996134990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1694963965}
review:
I played but did not finish the original version of this game.  The remaster really updated the graphics and engine.  It is an adventure/puzzle game and definitely casual.  This is one of those games that you don't get killed if you make a bad decision, you will simply not advance or be put back where you just came from.  Dialog is voiced nicely and tone of the game is fun.

Recommended if you enjoy lite puzzle adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004234335', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1590159142}
review:
One of the greatest gems of the LucasArts point-and-click era (Sam & Max, the Monkey Island series), this DoubleFine remaster is painstakingly perfect.

The animation is literally redrawn (google a video to check out the incredible attention to detail) and the audio has been cleaned up; an interface "wheel" has been added (and it's great) - but if you don't like any of that stuff you can play with any of those options in the original format. As a bonus you even get Maniac Mansion for free!

Day of the Tentacle has lost none of its personality and charm in the decades since it was released and this remaster just helps cement it as a timeless classic.

review: I loved this game as a kid long ago.  And playing it again all these years later didn't disappoint.  Even my kids like playing it.  My 8 yo daughter has already watched me play all the way through it and now she wants to play it through herself.  They just don't make games like these anymore.  You all can have your over-engineered Cyberpunk games that requires thousands of dollars in hardware yet full of glitches and problems.  I'll take classics like these any day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198849702948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2714, 'last_played': 1701037188}
review:
Do you have a young child in your life that you would like to introduce to classic computer gaming in the safest, most enjoyable way possible? If so, this is your game!  I remembered it fondly as one of the funniest, goofiest computer games I had ever played, so when the remastered version popped up on sale for $4, I snapped it up. Played it over a Christmas visit with my 5-year-old granddaughter and it was a great bonding experience. 

It was still funny, but I had forgotten just how tedious those old point-and-click adventure games really were. But when you have a child copilot, that's no problem - little kids LOVE repetition. She needed help with the dialog trees, but quickly mastered the clunky controls and memorized the layout of all 3 versions of that old house in Philadelphia. So I'd help her figure out the next step and then let her run back and forth and up and down the stairs, switching characters, and chucking random objects into the time travel toilet while I looked up the answer to the next ridiculous puzzle in a walkthrough. Yes, I played it before, but it was 15 or 20 years ago, okay? And I'm pretty sure even at the time it didn't spontaneously occur to me to paint the fruit on the kumquat tree red so George Washington would chop it down  (oops, sorry. Spoiler). 

The remarkable thing about this game is that the humor works on so many levels that it is equally funny to a preschooler and a grandma. For an adult the replay value is limited, but as a collaborative game with a small child there is no limit. When we next saw each other a year later, Little L (now 6) could hardly wait to play it again. This time she could read more of the text herself and remembered the solutions to a lot of the puzzles, but not all of them, which gave Grandma something to do. So playing it again was still a bonding experience and still fun for both of us. And a great introduction to the Founding Fathers, right?

If you are a young video game player you should really give this game a go as a way to step back in time and enjoy old school fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014242486', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1635454638}
review:
Day of Tentacle Remastered is obviously the remastered version of the famous adventure by LucasArts. I was lucky to be a gamer during the golden era of LucasArts and this game was one of the brilliant examples of how an adventure game should be constructed. The remastered version makes it accessible to a new generation of gamers without making any compromises.

Pros:
+ excellent humour (skillfully integrated in the whole game), dialogs and writing. 
+ Excellent voices and music. 
+ Puzzles and riddles are really clever and all make sense as long as you manage to understand the general spirit of the game. The ability to change characters in past, present and future is working flawlessly. 
+ Cartoonish style of graphic and environment is very well executed.

Cons:
- Duration is a bit on the short side.
- As in all similar adventures you may get stuck in some puzzles trying  endless combinations.
- More save slots could be welcomed (especially if you are achievement hunter).

All in all a masterpiece of adventure game. It is a pity that such games are not available any more. I may not have now the time to invest in getting stuck in a puzzle (and internet and steam guides can be very helpful in this respect) but I definitely appreciate the talent and effort behind this game. In a nostalgic note these games helped me even improve my English a couple of decades ago: I still remember searching in a dictionary what fake barf is.  
Can we please have remastered versions of the Indiana Jones adventure games?

author: {'steamid': '76561198064436569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1632706249}
review: An all-time classic of the Adventure Game genre, Day of the Tentacle REALLY shines in this remaster. The art looks amazing, the dialogue is enough to distract you from ever finishing the game, and the quirky completions to the puzzles make just enough sense to keep the typical Adventure Game Nonsense Frustration low. For older players it's an amazing nostalgia trip, and for newer players it may be a key ingredient into understanding and enjoying adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031018398', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1631956537}
review:
[b]TLDR[/b] DOTT still holds up pretty well with or without the remaster, but if you are a newcomer the updated UI will prove less intimidating. [20/20‚≠ê, 8hüèÖ, 3/5üí°]

[b]Context[/b] Disclaimer: I've played the original version several times so I'm not able to actually assess its difficulty. I'll try take off my nostalgia goggles. I play a lot of these classic adventure games, and many (most?) of them feel outdated. That's not the case of DOTT (regardless of the remaster). 

[b]Writing[/b] In DOTT, you control 3 characters that have to time travel to prevent a mutant tentacle (who developed arms!) from taking over the world. It‚Äôs all senseless, and it‚Äôs also one of the funniest game I‚Äôve played. The jokes are timeless (pun intended) and I still feel this is one of the smartest uses of (cartoonish) time-travel in a game.

[b]Aesthetics[/b] The game has a cartoonish style that fits perfectly the overall tone. The voice acting is pretty decent for its time. As for the remastering itself, the updated graphics/sound are a matter of taste. I had some issues with the synchronization of the audio and subtitles.

[b]Gameplay[/b] Gameplay is quintessential point-and-click adventure: you have a set of actions to interact with the environment and with the items you collect. The puzzles are actually quite "logical" if you realize what you need to accomplish. The new UI in the remaster provides a more modern, lighter feeling to the game (although I was constantly annoyed by the pointer moving to the default action). The cursor highlights interactable objects when hovering, so there is little pixel hunting (already the case in the original game). There are no gameovers nor deaths. You can save/load at any time and autosaving is implemented, but for some reason the number of save slots is limited (inconvenient if you miss achievements along the way).

[b]Value[/b] It took me 8h to complete the game, which is fair for a game of this kind, although this also includes achievement hunting time. You cannot revisit previous chapters. Achievements force you to explore interactions that you might have missed, actually adding value. Since there are multiple save slots, they don't require multiple playthroughs if you keep saves at previous points of the game. The plot is linear, but DOTT is replayable just for the jokes.

[quote][i]For more puzzle-game reviews and curated lists check out the [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43326007-The-Clueless-Adventurer-Puzzle-Trove/]Puzzle Trove[/url].[/i][/quote]

review:
Un immense classique du point & click, sorti √† l'origine par LucasArts en 1993 et l'un des jeux les plus dr√¥les de tous les temps ! Pour sauver le monde d'une tentacule m√©galo vous alternerez entre trois jeunes gens coinc√©s dans un manoir √† trois √©poques diff√©rentes. Qu'est-ce qui pourrait mal tourner avec un pitch aussi loufoque ?

Absolument tout bien s√ªr ! Cependant, malgr√© des situations et √©nigmes capillotract√©es, il y a toujours un fond de logique aux idioties que vivent les personnages afin de ne jamais bloquer trop longtemps et de toujours trouver une voie pour faire avancer l'intrigue.

review: A Lucasarts Point and click classic adventure. Got this game when it was released because I knew it was a sequel to maniac mansion. Bernard the nerd makes his return followed by new characters Hoagie a heavy metal roadie and Laverne a wacky medical student. The mansion and Crazy Dr. Ed and co. also are in the game of course. The three kids are stuck in different time periods and it‚Äôs up to you (and Dr. Ed) to help them stop an evil purple tentacle from taking over the world. Brings back a ton of memories of playing DOS games, definitely a classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976743513', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1696951390}
review:
....It's ok. Better than Full Throttle's remaster for sure. MOST of everything is here, plays well, no clicks pops or breaks in any of the music so great on that. However, as someone who still has a working win95 machine I can tell you exactly the bits that are missing and don't work properly, THANKFULLY it isn't many.

The intro's and by extension, the time warp swirl do not play right on new aged systems. My guess is due to refresh rates on monitors but it barely looks like it swirls anymore, numerous sound effects and areas COMPLETELY missing reverb and echo, once again the time warp sequence is a BIG example of this... there is no spacey echo on ANY of the characters voices anymore, even Edna's laugh is supposed to have an un-nerving echo to it as she disappears down the screen. It is also as usual with so many lucasarts "remasters" missing ALOT of sound effects, no birds chirping in the intro anymore, various cutscenes are missing the tentacle suck sound, the door creak noise on the cron-a-jon's opening and the list goes on.

The remastered soundtrack is extremely hit and miss, as well as the new remastered sounds (the tentacles sucker sound is ATROCIOUS compared to the original, there is nothing to it, barely sounds like they are moving atall), while the older music is using a modified MT-32 soundtrack, I know it's modified because I have 2 different MT-32 synths and they both have differing soundbanks compared to this release). 

I guess this one is more worth the money for sure, but as usual no time has been spent remastering it's sound and getting THAT working properly, but it isn't enough to ruin the experience entirely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059280749', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1626531631}
review:
What's supposed to be so good about this? Even after reading some of the "most helpful" reviews I still have no idea. Even after playing for almost 2 hours I still have no idea.

Gameplay - Your goal is to do something, and the game doesn't tell you what. Basically "interact with everything until something does something". 
Story/art - Comedy-esque. No relationship to the gameplay.
Overall experience - Incredibly boring.

I hope to all hell I didn't pay full price for this. This is at most worth $2, even if the game were enjoyable to you, the main selling point is the humour and the style of humour is self-parody.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977277922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1626065497}
review:
I first played this game back in the 90s as part of one of the famously great LucasArts packs (it also came with a demo of Full Throttle, and Sam and Max Hit the Road). This game is the pinnacle of point-and-click games. If you ever played Maniac Mansion, it follows some of the same mechanics (using all three characters to accomplish the task). The difficulty isn't what it was in Maniac Mansion - a first-run playthrough might take you six hours before you get the all the puzzles solved (there are some tricky dialog puzzles, like any LucasArts point-and-click). I was impressed after twenty-five years that some of the humor still holds up, and even more surprised at how much I remembered from my first attempts to beat the game at ten or eleven years old.

Added bonus, this game comes with a full playable version of Maniac Mansion as a game within the game (just go to Ed's room and use his computer).

review: Great game. I'm not a fan of the character design or art style, but the game still won me over. author: {'steamid': '76561198129411711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1625784731}
review:
Taking place about five years after the events of [i][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/529890/Maniac_Mansion/]Maniac Mansion[/url][/i] (1987), [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] has the evil Purple Tentacle trying to take over the world following an incident with toxic waste that altered him. Dr. Fred Edison, a mad scientist, plans to stop him by killing him and the good guy Green Tentacle. But Green decides to recruit help from a trio of housemates: Bernard, a stereotypical nerd, Hoagie, a roadie, and Laverne, an unhinged medical student. When Purple escapes, Dr. Fred figures the only way to stop Purple is to send the trio back in time before Purple had a chance to consume the toxic waste. However, a problem with the time machine results in Hoagie being sent 200 years into the past to early America, Laverne being sent 200 years into the future where the world is under the domination of the tentacles, and Bernard being stuck in the present. From there, they must figure out how to stop Purple's evil plans while returning Hoagie and Laverne to the present.

This game is a classic point-and-click adventure game and a sequel to 1987's [i]Maniac Mansion[/i]. Originally released in 1993 and often hailed as one of the greatest adventure games of all time, this specific Steam release is an updated and remastered version featuring improved graphics that was released in 2016. For the purposes of this review, I played the game with the remastered graphics, though an option does exist to play it with the original, early 1990s-era pixel graphics.

To start with the artwork, I found it to be excellent in this release. The developers who updated the graphics for the modern gamer did a great job of enhancing everything while retaining its iconic colorful and cartoony appearance, much of which takes inspiration from classic American cartoons. The graphics even contribute to the game's zany premise and comedy with many sight gags.

The sound design is another excellent aspect as well. There are plenty of musical tracks to listen to during the course of the game and all of it sounds great. I was impressed with the variety such as how some of the tracks from the early America segment of the game evoke traditional American songs. In addition to the music, this game is also fully-voiced. The voice acting all around is superb. The voice actors did a great job imbuing the various characters with unique personalities from Dr. Fred's mannerisms as a stereotypical mad scientist to Laverne's bizarre speech patterns as part of her strange personality.

If the above mentioned aspects were not good enough, where this game truly shines is in the story and writing. Befitting its rather cartoony presentation, this game's writing focuses on comedy with a healthy dose of slapstick and absurdity. It is pretty obvious playing through this that the developers really tried their best to cram in as much humor as possible and I found that it worked well in this game. The game never takes itself too seriously and it contributed to my enjoyment of it. I found myself wanting to continue playing when I should have been doing something else if only to discover the next sight gags or hilarious lines of dialogue. It often makes it worth it to talk to every character and exhaust every possible option to discover more of the humor.

As a point-and-click adventure game, most of the actual gaming is puzzle solving. This includes collecting items and figuring out how to use them. Unlike some other adventure games of the era, including [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] itself, there are no dead ends nor bad ends here. Therefore, the player can try any number of things to get through puzzles without fear of creating a no-win scenario. I did find that some trial-and-error was involved in solving puzzles as some solutions are rather unclear or obtuse. Still, I did not find any puzzle in the game to be unreasonably difficult.

[i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] is an undeniably classic video game and a seminal work of the adventure game genre. Even if you are like me and have never played [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] (though that game is included with [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] as a bonus), people that like adventure and puzzle-solving games will be sure to enjoy this with its excellent, remastered graphics, great sound design, and hilarious writing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308518676', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 1251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1191, 'last_played': 1669638773}
review:
El juego de 1993 remasterizado 23 a√±os despu√©s.

Es una aventura gr√°fica, en la que has de volver a la mansi√≥n Edison a liberar a un amigo que hicistes en la entrega anterior (Maniac Mansion). Mientras lo liberas, dejas libre (sin acordarte) a alguien muy malo.
La √∫nica soluci√≥n, cambiar el pasado.

Necesitar√°s ingenio y usar/mezclar objetos.

[h1][u]PROS[/u][/h1]

La m√∫sica es excelente respetando la original.

Gr√°ficos muy muy mejorados respecto a la versi√≥n de 1993.

Tecla para jugarlo como antes, con sus gr√°ficos e interfaz antigua.

Situaciones muy divertidas y frases jocosas.

[h1][u]CONTRAS[/u][/h1]

Ninguno en particular.

[h1][u]CONCLUSI√ìN[/u][/h1]

Muy buen juego para comprar con rebaja.
As√≠ que lo marcar√© con el pulgar hacia arriba.

[h1][u]RECOMENDACIONES[/u][/h1]

Como siempre, recomiendo ir haciendo copias entre sesiones de juego del directorio de saves.

[u]Linux[/u]
~/.local/share/doublefine/dott/savedata/

[u]Windows[/u]
<path-to-game>\savedata\
