author: {'steamid': '76561198849991142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1621824795}
review:
Lo jugaba de chica y lo ten√≠a en ingl√©s, no entend√≠a un huevo.. pero llegu√© lejos!
Lo volv√≠ a jugar en el celu hace unos a√±os atr√°s con el emulador ScummVM para Android, lo pas√© con un poco de gu√≠a porque es un juego bizarro que te sorprende siempre por su forma de llegar a resolver varias situaciones que no voy a spoilear.. 

Y ahora super feliz jugandolo nuevamente, recordando algunas cosas, la versi√≥n remasterizada est√° buenisima, algunos bugs pero es jugable.. 

Los puristas dir√°n que prefieren la versi√≥n original, pero a veces se pierde un toque la magia en cuanto a lo que recordabas del juego siendo ni√±o/a, porque al volver a verlo luego de muchos a√±os dec√≠s "wtf", la versi√≥n remasterizada est√° buena para safar de esa pseudo "decepci√≥n". Igual te permite jugarlo como original y mezclar entre remasterizaci√≥n y original (lo pod√©s jugar con dibujos remasterizados pero con m√∫sica 8-bit por ejemplo).

Este juego es re contra rejugable, siempre descubr√≠s cosas nuevas, tiene un humor √∫nico, personajes encari√±ables y no es necesario haber jugado al anterior para disfrutarlo.

10/10 por 100pre

review:
I wonder if I really have the patience for these old school adventure games anymore. With a lot of games nowadays if I try something 3 or 4 times and it‚Äôs not working I tend to start thinking I might be wasting my time and maybe start looking for solutions online.
This is also a very different feeling for me then a couple other adventure games like Grim Fandango. This one is meant to be stupid and silly so I didn‚Äôt really find the story quite as engaging. There are some legitimately clever puzzle solutions in here though and I appreciate the fact that you‚Äôre encouraged to apply cartoon logic to your problems but overall I appreciate playing a piece of gaming history, even if it‚Äôs a bit underwhelming by modern standards.

review: This game is wacky fun and is coincidentally the very first game I ever played with my dad growing up. It's cleverly written and the story is engrossing; it's like watching a movie while you're playing the game. You can select between each character whenever you want and there are many different ways to beat it. So if you love point-and-click games, you will like this game lots!

author: {'steamid': '76561198393370650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1278, 'last_played': 1620251252}
review:
This is definitely one of the best point and click adventure games ever made. This remastered version is very nice and easily adapted for playing with gamepad as well. It also offers an user-friendly and intuitive menu when we wish to play with kids. My daughter could easily select the options to interact because the images were clear for her.
I strongly recommend to players of all age and particularly for those parents who wish to show to their kids one of their favourite games of their childhood (adolescence). 
I also recommend to play Maniac Mansion (the first one) that is included in this game. You can start the game from the computer located in Weird Ed Edison's room (in the present).

author: {'steamid': '76561198031084474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1682342055}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960388853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1622822704}
review:
The visual upgrade is the best out of these Lucasarts remasters, because it holds true to the original style. Unfortunately the same can't be said about the sound effects and some of them are quite bad, much more weak and lacking of proper bass. Good example is the suction cup noise the Tentacles make. It's more squishy and watery compared to the original.

I hope they remaster The Curse of Monkey Island or Sam & Max Hit The Road, but depending on the ownership rights, that might never happen :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198807980414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1683510677}
review: Animal!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991465987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 278, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1619981596}
review:
What a weird ride it was to replay one of the best adventure games of all time after nearly 30 years! While the remaster certainly did a lot to make DoTT enjoyable in 2021, the core gameplay, which wasn't really changed, stood the test of time surprisingly well. The wacky humour is just as fun as it was in 1993, and while many of the puzzles are really weird, there are quite a few subtle in-game hints on how to approach them. Additionally, you need to do a lot with each character, and you can do a lot that in parallel, so if one of them puzzles gets you stumped, you can move on to other stuff and let your subconscious work on the blocker. The first 75% of the game went by really fast, the final part was a bit struggle-y, but still fun.
Kudos to Double Fine for making this remaster work so well - this one was nearly perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002450835', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 424, 'playtime_forever': 332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1619895433}
review: Day of the Tentacle is a nostalgic adventure game whose humor holds up reasonably well with time. You'll want to have played Maniac Mansion before this one, which you can do from inside this game after a few minutes. It's much less stressful than its prequel in that nothing permanently bad can happen to you, though you'll probably want to look up the random sequence of steps required in a few spots rather than be frustrated for long stretches. With that in mind, it doesn't overstay its welcome.

review: Another one of the Lucas Arts games that I played on my Macintosh as a child. I love the humor, it got better as an adult. Sad to see adventure games like this die out to games like Call of Duty. Still, like a good book, nothing beats another play through for Nostalgia sake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002601884', 'num_games_owned': 995, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1619454374}
review:
I have been playing Day of the Tentacle for so long now, that I can't imagine having a gaming collection without it. I originally played the game when it came out and have played it through various means over the years, this remaster easily being the best of the bunch.

Day of the Tentacle has been superbly remastered with fresh looking high definition graphics and lots of remastered audio, including voice acting and music. There has also been a change in the way the game controls. Some may think that the old way is a bit old fashioned and there for there is a new control system. It's a nice new inventory system for those young kids who can't handle things without menu's and controller support. It works very well, but isn't any better than the original. For those who liked that original design, you can still use it and with the original graphics too. All you need to do is hit F1 in the menu.

As a game, it's not the easiest of point and click games but easily one of the more amusing. The story results in three different characters being stuck in three different times in history and you're tasked with guiding them back to their original point in time. It's an interesting idea and works very well for the most part. It certainly helps that all three characters have very contrasting personalities. You've got a nerd, a oddly passive female and the third being a most excellent and chilled roadie. It's the usual pick things up and find out where they go sort of puzzles. But the twist here is that you can sent certain items over to the other characters. It can make things a bit confusing, especially for first time players. But it's quite unique and still holds up well today.

The dialogue is a highlight of the game. Each character has a very distinct personality and it really comes out in the script and voice actors work. They've been very well written and the jokes surrounding each character is very funny. I personally love playing Laverne. She comes across as quite harmless, until she comes out with certain hilarious lines. There's a darker side to her, that's for sure. The music and use of sound effects are also quite strong but it's very clearly from years gone by as no one uses audio like this in games anymore. It does sound date but doesn't reduce the overall quality, thanks to the great remastering.

I love Day of the Tentacle. It's a very unique game in the point and click genre. It has a very distinct look and style that should appeal to fans of the genre. I couldn't recommend it more, especially for the fairly low asking price. It's a classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040106431', 'num_games_owned': 912, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1619364764}
review:
I've only played the current remastered version but there is the option of playing the older version from within the game by pressing F1. The game is a point and click adventure with zany and fun characters. The graphics are colourful and well done. Some of the puzzles can be a bit obtuse but nothing that can't be solved given enough time and brainstorming.

Recommended for fans of old school point and click adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049452840', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1619241127}
review:

Gra ma dosyƒá ciekawe rozwiƒÖzanie je≈ºeli chodzi o samƒÖ rozgrywkƒô bo w tej produkcji wcielamy siƒô w trzech bohater√≥w bƒôdƒÖcych w jednym miejscu ale r√≥≈ºnych okresach. Co powala na "zabawƒô" czasem i przekazywanie sobie przedmiot√≥w przez dziurƒô czasoprzestrzennƒÖ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159835077', 'num_games_owned': 2057, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1619037230}
review:
Antes que nada dejemos una cosa clara, Day of the Tentacle es una obra maestra atemporal, y si no lo has jugado en casi 30 a√±os pues qu√© quieres que te diga... primero que te mereces una colleja y luego, que corras a jugarlo ya mismo. Gran continuaci√≥n de ese Maniac Mansion con un sentido del humor sublime y unas situaciones hilarantes que har√°n que te partas la caja unas cuantas docenas de veces mientras lo juegas.

Dicho esto, y sin pretensiones de analizar un juego del que ha hablado hasta mi abuela, creo que lo interesante aqu√≠ es hablar de este Remastered y los cambios que ha sufrido (y que hemos sufrido nosotros) desde que sali√≥ el original.

Por un lado, est√°n las mejoras gr√°ficas que a mi personalmente, no me gustan. Los gr√°ficos pixelados del original pasan a un estilo que pretende parecer dibujado a mano pero que parece m√°s como jugar a un emulador de Super Nintendo petado de filtros y "shaders". Algo artificial para mi gusto y que en est√°tico es result√≥n pero que en movimiento pierde mucho. Por otro lado, est√°n los cambios jugables, que dejan el famoso SCUMM por un sistema de men√∫s radiales que facilitan un poco las cosas, ya que por un lado en todo momento podr√°s resaltar los objetos con los que interactuar y por otro, solo aparecer√°n las opciones posibles. En este caso, todo un acierto que (en teor√≠a) facilita un poco las cosas. Digo en teor√≠a porque algunas cosas son tan absurdas que no se te ocurrir√≠an ni en mil a√±os...

Y eso me lleva al otro punto de vista de la rese√±a, y es en como hemos cambiado nosotros desde que sali√≥ el original. En su momento nos pas√°bamos horas y horas intentando buscar la soluci√≥n al siguiente puzzle e intentar avanzar un poco m√°s, cosa que por desgracia ya no es as√≠. Hoy en d√≠a tenemos mil juegos por jugar y un internet que, a golpe de clic, nos da la soluci√≥n que buscamos en cuesti√≥n de segundos, por lo que es importante tener en cuenta el tipo de juego que tenemos delante. Si est√°s dispuesto a volver a los 90 y revivir la experiencia de entonces, con la paciencia que eso requiere, adelante. Si vas a utilizar gu√≠as porque de paciencia andas regular, mejor juega a otra cosa.

review:
One of the first games I played on my uncle's PC, along with The Monkey Island I & II. Even today, when I think about this video game, I remember the hours I spent spellbound by the drawings that appeared on the other side of the screen thanks to a simple floppy disk (God ...) that simply had little.
Great remastering, which only improves the original. One of those games that even those who are not fans of graphic adventure game should play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994796062', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1580327438}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 43.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062206693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1611385677}
review:
[h1]A 90‚Äôs cult classic returns in remastered glory for modern enjoyment[/h1]
[b]This review contains no spoilers.[/b]

[h2][u]Overview[/u][/h2]
[i]Day of the Tentacle ‚Äì Remastered[/i] (DotT) is the enhanced edition of an old-school point-and-click adventure game from [i]LucasArts[/i].  This studio is no stranger to the genre and had produced classics such as [i]The Secret of Monkey Island[/i]. [i]LucasArts[/i] had maintained their well-respected reputation with the release of DotT a few years later. In this game, three friends must stop an evil sentient tentacle. Just a typical normal day, right?

[h2][u]Story and Characters[/u][/h2]
The player controls three characters: Bernard, Laverne and Hoagie. Bernard is a stereotypical nerd, especially as portrayed by media in the nineties. Laverne is a crazy-eyed goofy girl with a heart of gold. Hoagie is a total bro and probably my favorite. Dude is totally chill and quite fond of addressing anyone and everyone as ‚Äúdude‚Äù. While they may seem like a group of misfits, they‚Äôre all lovable, quirky and clearly care for each other. Each character has their own unique dialog in which their personalities shine through. Hoagie is especially hilarious with his casual demeanor toward the highly unusual, as if everything happening is no big deal. Bernard surprises me with his dialog options. He is more than just a stereotypical nerd; you can play him as a total clown if you want to. Laverne tends to think outside the box, even for a point-and-click game. She has a very memorable and silly puzzle which really exercises her imagination as she makes use of the most odd combination of items. I also like that she has a soft spot for animals.

As for the story ‚Äì the characters must all come together to defeat a sentient tentacle who is appropriately named Purple Tentacle. It‚Äôs totally a silly premise and the game knows it. But damn, does it own it and make it work. I mean, it is called [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i]. You got to expect some tentacles and other zaniness, right? What a crazy day the protagonists get themselves into ‚Äì it is just full of surprises.

[h2][u]Gameplay[/u][/h2]
The player only controls one of the three friends at a time. They click around the screen on any object they can discover. Otherwise, they may click on the ground to maneuver the currently controlled character or progress to the next screen. They may then send any of the items they claimed to either of their companions not currently controlled. It is up to the player to pick up on hints through dialog and visual cues and piece together what must be done to progress. Really, the entire game is a collection of interconnecting puzzles.

All of the characters have challenges to overcome and some of the puzzles can really exercise the player‚Äôs brain. Many are also rather humorous in nature, which is a plus, especially anything centered around Hoagie‚Äôs interactions with other characters. Most of the puzzles require transferring items from one playable character to another in order to produce a desired result. For example, Hoagie may find an item but the player may determine he has no use for it. Instead the player can have him send it to Laverne to utilize. It sounds tedious, but item transfer is actually rather quick. Thankfully, it is as simple as dragging items over a portrait of a character rather than walking all the way back to any specific drop-off location.

There are more than just objects to interact with. Plenty of colorful characters are scattered throughout the game for all three playable characters to converse with. Such non-playable characters (NPCs) are often the key to producing new objects to interact with. Otherwise, they may also assist in progression through an event or new scene. There is also plenty of humorous fluff giving a lot of life into the game. Dialog is hands down the best part of this game. Even though the jokes are from 1993, they still hold up today and do not heavily rely on pop cultural references of the time. Anyways, when the player interacts with another character they are given a menu of responses or questions to select from. Once chosen, the character delivers the selected line and the NPC then responds in kind. Often, the character provides humorous commentary or berates the player for asking something stupid and trivial. It‚Äôs pretty funny. Only certain conversations and options are required to complete the game. Really, it‚Äôs quite fun to purposefully choose incorrect options or just irritate NPCs with a barrage of questions until they refuse to talk to you anymore. I swear I don‚Äôt do that in real life.


[h2][u]Presentation[/u][/h2]
Smooth cartoon graphics replace the original‚Äôs pixelated artwork. The style works seamlessly with the zany atmosphere of the game and the comical tone throughout the narrative. All sorts of weird objects are scattered about each screen. Everything is drawn super clear ‚Äì I never once questioned what an object was supposed to be.

Every piece of dialog is voice acted along with optional subtitles. As someone with hearing difficulties, I always greatly appreciate the closed captions. Though, the voice work was well done and I did not always need the subtitles to follow along. Each character sounds quite distinct and the audio is crystal clear. The standout in my opinion is Hoagie and his excellent sarcastic mannerisms.

I don‚Äôt quite remember all the music so it doesn‚Äôt stand out too much. However, I do distinctly remember at least two tracks. One is an extremely loud rock track ‚Äì loud enough to shake the house. Literally. It‚Äôs totally headbanging. The other was a theme that played for a NPC that was just so fitting I could not help but grin from ear to ear. 

Graphics and sound both still hold up very well in this remastered edition. The upgraded art is most definitely an upgrade from the original; it is so much cleaner.

[h2][u]Specs[/u][/h2]
The original game may be from 1993, but the remastered edition is relatively modern. The game shouldn‚Äôt be too demanding on a PC. It‚Äôs just an enhanced version of an old classic. That said, I do still run Windows 7 and can confirm the game works fine on the system.

Operating System: Windows 7
Processor (CPU): Intel Core i5-3570K CPU @3.40GHz
Graphics Card (GPU): NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070
Memory (RAM) 16 GB

[h2][u]Summary[/u][/h2]
DotT is a bit expensive at fifteen dollars for a three to six hour game, so I would suggest to wait for a sale. However, it‚Äôs a beloved cult classic for good reason. I have no real complaint about the game ‚Äì the remaster does a great job bringing it into the modern age. The writing and jokes are timeless and do not date the game ‚Äì it‚Äôs super funny and a good kind of weird. Puzzles seem appropriate for a general audience. They aren‚Äôt so impossible that only an adult could solve; but they are also not so simple that a young kid would fly through the game at record speed. There will be some brain teasing. Most importantly, there‚Äôs a ton of fun along the journey with tons of humor abound.

review:
Remaster d'un grand classique du genre.
 Comme les Monkey island cette nouvelle version permet de jouer avec de nouveau graphisme... Ou pas vu qu'une touche permet de garder le mode pixelis√©.

Le nouveau mode supprime √©galement le syst√®me de verbe propre aux jeux de l'√©poque et le remplace par un menu-contextuel via le clique droit.

Day of the tentacle est clairement un jeu √† faire, mais la bizarrerie, loufoquerie m√™me des √©nigmes risque d'en rebuter plus d'un. (Au point de devoir trouver une solution.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198119517149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1636644073}
review:
This game actually really surprised me. When I first started it and played for around 10 minutes I regret buying it, but after a week or so I gave this game a second chance and I am really glad I did. 

This game is truly amazing if I may say so, I played this game for 22.9 hours as of writing this review and I did two playthroughs. One to enjoy the full experience without a guide and the second one to collect all the achievements I missed. The achievements added a whole new dimension to the game and stimulated the player to explore the environment. I really liked that the same areas looked completely different for different time zones. The old house is in my opinion my favourite.  The game is pretty long for a point and click game which is a good thing. The graphics are on point and really drag you into the game. The game is full of silly humour and little easter eggs. 100% worth your time and money. The only con that comes to mind is that some puzzles are quite difficult, I got stuck around 3 times in total and had to use a guide to help me out. 

TL:DR: A must buy for every point & click adventure enthusiast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308470936', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1587953191}
review: I love this game. Before steam was even something I knew about and way before I got into video games I used to play this shit on repeat. I put at least 40h into a game that takes me as little as 55 minutes to get through. When I found out that there was a remastered version on steam I almost screamed. I shouldn't be this happy about a game being remastered but I was. I watched all the cut scenes again, played it with original graphics then again with remastered graphics and I loved ever minute of it.  tried to get some of the hidden achievements which has been fun and I've tried beating Maniac Mansion (and have failed every time thus far). Don't be surprised if I play it again because to me Day of the Tentacle is one of the most re-playable games ever.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000000237', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1613427394}
review:
I know it's an old game, and it's very high on graphic. 
but it was a game that I had when I was a kid and I had difficulty to progress on it as i was around my 14s. I never could finish it because the computer having it got broken and didn't had the disks anymore. so I decided to retry an older game and see if I could manage this time. finishing it in an afternoon so it wasn't that hard but it was still fun and a cool story to go through. 

yeah I enjoyed it after all thos years and it helped me pass an afternoon a bit less wondering about stuff to help me relax. 
so, yes, I would recommend it to people enjoying "point and click games" that you have to use your brain but also have to think in a cartoon style and not like Mist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140801438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1612629457}
review: The story and concept are nice, but the puzzles are way too convoluted and not that intuitive. There are also some red herrings mixed in with the clues found in the game in order to misdirect the player, and it doesn't help that there are different forms of interaction with objects to choose from (push, pull, use, pick up). I doubt that the majority of players are able to finish the game without guides or hints. I can just imagine how much a kid would struggle! The humour is also hit and miss. The game does have its charm, but I fail to see why it is lauded as one of the greatest PnC adventure games of all time. It does not hold up to the more modern games of the genre. Colour me disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966812756', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1609279761}
review:
DOTT is the best of the classic LucasArts adventure games. It's a blend of the nerdy humor of Dave Grossman, the subtle hints of Tim Schafer, the wild artwork of Peter Chan, and all the magic of the legendary LucasArts team. This game has all the good stuff, like mad scientists, tentacles, time travel, IRS agents, bowling, and much more. Now it's beautifully redrawn in high resolution, with remastered audio, and developer's commentary. The only reminder that this is a 30 year old game is the low frame rate of the animations.

Like the original DOTT, this remaster also contains a fully playable Maniac Mansion, but it's just the VGA version without any remastering. MM was the first point-and-click adventure game, the namesake of the SCUMM engine, and the first game to have "cut scenes". MM is an ancient game, but it's still fun to play, and it has multiple different endings depending on which kids you bring along. Beware: it's easy to get into an unwinnable state in multiple different ways, for example by using the paint remover on anything other than the intended target.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980563719', 'num_games_owned': 1881, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1646312709}
review:
In some ways, this game, and its brethren, are masterpieces.  But in the modern sense, their only kin, from what I've experienced, is something like the Phoenix Wright games, where they follow a certain logic, but that logic isn't strictly [i]logical[/i].  I love these games, and I'm sure some will find this to be a personal fault for me, but I just don't think the gang back in the day, like the developers of PW titles of the current century, really had a tight logic that was implemented through smart clues.

I guess the best example, and this is a spoiler, is [spoiler]the wine getting turned to vinegar.  I'm almost into my 30s at this point, and I really only learned that wine is a crude base for vinegar thanks to a recent video about vinegar on youtube.[/spoiler]  That's something that is specifically acquired knowledge through life, and in no way hinted in the game.  I'm not saying that this makes it a bad game, because frankly I love this title, even if I was only ever able to beat it years after I first played it as a child (probably around high school).  I'm just saying that if you plan to beat these games without ever resorting to a guide, good luck.  Perhaps there's a better hint system within the remastered version (I've only played through the og mode, using remastered audio), but I don't believe this is true.

As much as I complain though, I still think these are wonderful, approachable adventures titles.  These are games that I think could lead people into less approachable titles, since even earlier titles lack even the few training wheels this does.  If you even have an inkling of an interest to play these games, please, do so...just pack a guide book for when you get stuck, or play it with some friends, maybe those who have beaten it before.  I think that's part of the issue with games like these: back in the day, you had magazines to give you hints, and friends to talk about the game with, whether in real life or on a BBS.  But these days, those are all deemed slight forms of cheating, and while I'm sure people exist who beat these games with no hints or discussion whatsoever, I have to imagine they are few and far between.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963509361', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1611426075}
review:
Recommended - but overall I would say it's not one of the best LucasArts point and click games. I was actually a bit disappointed after playing it. I admit my first foray into the genre was Grim Fandango (when first released) and Monkey Island 2 and felt this was weaker, but in terms of the story and humour. The puzzles are a bit more straight forward (for the most part) than the Monkey Island games and it is quite a bit shorter. It also removes the possibility of character deaths.

I did have this on Steam for years before playing due to all the technical issues when it was first released. I would definitely recommend this for fans of the genre but would suggest the Monkey Island games first, which some may think odd given that this was generally considered (at the time) as superior to Monkey Island 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964524379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1612016429}
review: Que decir de esta gran obra maestra de Lucasarts. Es el Day of the tentacle de siempre pero remasterizado en imagen y sonido. Con un nuevo sistema de control y gestion del inventario. Se puede elegir si jugar con los controles y el inventario mas actual o con el antiguo, al igual que jugar al juego original con el encanto de sus pixeles o remasterizado. Una de las mejores aventuras graficas de la historia, con un humor desternillante, puzzles ingeniosos y dificultad a la altura de las aventuras de aquella epoca, imprescindible, un juego de 10. Ojal√° algun dia los creadores de esta joya puedan hacer un Maniac Mansion 3, el talento de gente como Ron Gilbert, Dave Grossman, Tim Schaffer y c√≠a es increible, no os lo perdais, seais jugadores jovenes o veteranos, os va a encantar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081249868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1611409299}
review:
Estamos frente a una obra que no da puntada sin hilo, llena de imaginaci√≥n y humor. Nada sobra y todo est√° puesto por un motivo. Hasta aqu√≠ nada que no se sepa. Mi principal problema con El D√≠a del Tent√°culo es que es un juego de su √©poca. Bebe mucho de los dibujos animados y de su absurdo, lo que lo aleja de las l√≥gicas a las que nos tiene habituado el anodino mundo real (qui√©n podr√≠a imaginarse esto cuando el argumento gira en torno a salvar el mundo de un tent√°culo malvado mientras viajamos a trav√©s del tiempo). Esto se ha traducido en que me hubiese sido infinitamente dif√≠cil pas√°rmelo sin gu√≠a. No porque ofrezca pistas trampas o carezca de l√≥gica en la sucesi√≥n de los puzzles -al contrario, el juego no quiere hacernos perder el tiempo-; sino porque las reglas con las que juega difieren demasiado de los razonamientos planos y aburridos a los que estoy acostumbrado. Por eso, la resoluci√≥n de seg√∫n qu√© puzzles se me hac√≠a inimaginable hasta que no miraba la receta y asent√≠a ante el ingenioso razonamiento de los desarrolladores.

Si, como yo, no has salido nunca del gris√°ceo ABC de la vida real tendr√°s que devanarte los sesos si quieres completar la aventura por tu cuenta. Ten en cuenta que TODO est√° ah√≠ para ser usado en alg√∫n momento, da igual qu√© rocambolesco m√©todo uses para tratar de resolver los acertijos, prueba. No trates de usar la l√≥gica normal. Esto es un parque de diversiones y estamos para pensar como ni√±os.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968379289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 620, 'last_played': 1610682528}
review:
I had played some point-and-click adventures back when this originally came out, but not this one.  This game is a blast.  The remaster is top-notch and cleans up the visuals, interface and audio.  The puzzles and are really clever and often funny, though I had to consult a walkthrough a couple of times as I was at a loss for what to do next.  I love the interplay between the three characters' stories and the interesting ways they can help each other.  Some of the jokes fall a little flat for me, but overall it was quite funny.  

I played through the remaster, and then speed-ran the classic version with the creator's commentary on.  I think there was a couple of issues with the classic version as I couldn't get to a menu to save or exit, and there were only about five or six scenes where I heard any commentary.  There were about ten other times where the screen showed "Press 'A' to hear commentary", but pressing 'A' did nothing.  Also note that when commentary is playing, if you leave a room the commentary will stop when the next room loads and you won't be able to go back to hear what you missed.

Good times!  Would definitely recommend for fans of the point-and-click genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1510581089}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is the re-release of the cult classic point and click adventure game from LucasArts.

Story:

Set 5 years after the events of Maniac Mansion, the purple tentacle drinks some sludge from a river next to Dr. Fred's Lab, grows arms, his intelligence increases and he plans on taking over the world. A group of friends Bernard, Hoagie and Laverne, get a call from green tentacle about his brothers plans and set out to stop his plan of world domination. 

Day of the Tentacle plot is absurd, but it's also insanely hilarious and charming to say the least. the writing is top notch and every character you meet is weird, crazy and absolutely hilarious. You can definitely see the reason why when talking about the funniest games of all times, Day of the Tentacle always comes up. The writing is top notch and while there are jokes that don't land, there's always one that will come up soon that will land.

Graphics:

The remaster cleans up the original games low resolution art style and from a pixel-y look, it looks like a cartoon from the 90's and since I absolutely adore that style, I love the art style of Day of the Tentacle. It's such a good looking game, all the colors are bright and pop out at you, it's a really eye pleasing game. Each environment is good looking and it's fun to explore and look around, there's a ton of stuff to see and do.

The character designs are also really good, they are simplistic, but everyone has such a distinct look, which is something I really appreciate. For some this new art style might be a bit too much, but don't fear, you also have an option to revert to the classic look of the game, which awesome for someone like that never got to experience the original version.

Audio:

The audio is also cleaned up and sounds much clearer than the original. The original, had this very Lo-Fi sound which was common for the time, so the music and voice acting was cleaned up for the remaster. There's nothing wrong with the new one, but I really prefer the original version of the audio as it's really much more appealing to me, since I played a ton of 90's adventure games. But again if you prefer it, there is an option to turn the audio back to the original version by playing the classic version of the game.

The voice acting is great, everyone does a great job with their characters. They really nail the crazy characters, like a demented med student, boneheaded rock dude and stereotypical nerd. Even the side characters are voiced incredibly well so that was awesome to hear, since like most 90's adventure games, the voice acting does not stand the test of time.

Gameplay:

Day of the Tentacle is pretty stock standard Point and Click adventure game. Walk around environments, pick up items, talk to characters and solve puzzles. I absolutely adore the genre, it's easily in my top three of favorite genres, however I always had a bone to pick with 90's adventure games, simply for the cryptic puzzles most of them have and sadly Day of the Tentacle is no exception.

A lot of the puzzles are incredibly fun to solve, albeit they are without a doubt leaning on the crazier side, it almost requires to adapt to the games crazy type of thinking to be able to solve the puzzles and I'll admit a lot of them are easy given the context of the story at that particular moment, however a lot of the time the puzzles are really cryptic, considering there's three timelines for you to go through. Each character is stuck in three different points in time and have to send items to each other to help solve puzzles, which immediately makes it much more complex to figure out who needs what, so it requires you to go around the environments and think who might need what from your inventory.

One thing that I have to mention is that this game is a package that includes multiple games for you to play. It includes Maniac Mansion, the original version of Day of the Tentacle and the remastered version of the game. I really liked the fact that I had the ability to play the original version as well as the new one to experience the game like it was in the 90's with the massive HUD that was common to the genre and not to mention play Maniac Mansion. 

Verdict:

Day of the Tentacle is a great adventure game, that I have no trouble recommending to anyone that is even remotely a fan of the genre, this game is simply amazing. It's hilarious, tons of fun and a really cheerful game, that I had a blast going through. Even if you don't like the genre, I still suggest checking out Day of the Tentacle. 

Final Rating:
9/10

Pros:
+ Hilarious story and writing 
+ Great art style
+ Includes original version of the game for those that don't like the remastered version
+ Some fun puzzles....

Cons:
- ....But quite a few cryptic ones too

If you liked this review please consider following our curators at https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198002082616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1607115422}
review:
[quote=Bernard Benoulli (1993)]Sometimes I do stupid stuff, and I don't even know why... as If my body were being controlled by some demented, sadistic puppet-master...[/quote]

I think this quote pretty much sums up the game experience. Also, I'd like to point out this game strongly suggests that [spoiler]killing the hamster using the microwave oven in Maniac Mansion is cannon[/spoiler].

[hr][/hr]

So, how did the remaster come out? It's OK. The new graphics are fine, but the animations limitations are way more obvious in HD. The music is nice, but not as big an improvement compared to the original when played through a high enough quality MIDI soundfont (also it's pretty broken in the current version and some cues play over and over instead of once, a pitty). The SFX is provably what has aged the worst (I really missed some sound ambiance and general sonorization).

Do I recomend it? Well yes of course, it's such a classic. It may be hard to understand how impresive this game is for new audiences, but it's still really fun. You may consider keeping a guide close by though. The game is actually better signposted than I remembered (you may find some very useful tips in item descriptions and conversations) but it can be pretty obtuse sometimes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201613371', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1608222857}
review:
In Day of the Tentacle you play as three characters, Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne. You must time-travel back to yesterday to stop Purple Tentacle from gaining arms via drinking contaminated water and attempting world domination! This, naturally, is more difficult than you would expect. Especially when the crystal breaks mid-transportation and sends Hoagie 200 years into the past, and Laverne 200 years into the future. Also, why is the IRS at the door? Doctor Fred? Doctor- HEY! 

I very much enjoyed playing Day of the Tentacle Remastered. While a lot of people seem to be playing for the nostalgia factor, I don‚Äôt actually remember how this showed up in my library nor have I played it before. While I didn‚Äôt particularly like the music, the humor, some of the puzzles, and the whole situation you get yourself into is pretty funny. I can see why it has positive rating and I recommend you give it a go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084223806', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1607811200}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is one of the classic Lucas Arts games, with its crazy characters, trademark humour and puzzles requiring unconventional solutions.
I haven't played the original game, but it seems that this remastered version made by Double Fine is faithful to its source.
The key element of Day of the Tentacle is that you (almost the entire game) control three different characters thrown into three different time periods, but the characters can exchange items using... a toilet. This creates tons of possibilities and makes puzzles so interesting and creative.
This game is so much fun that, if you like humorous point-and-click adventures at all, there is not a single reason why you shouldn't play this game.

P.S. Actually, in this case you get two games for the price of one, because you can play the original Manic Mansion game inside this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150281233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1606688397}
review: Excellent point&click adventure. Having three characters scattered throughout different time periods demands a lot of creative thinking to solve the puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202431291', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1607544079}
review:
[h1] Is it true about you and the cherry tree? [/h1]
Day of the Tentacle is among the best adventure games from Lucasarts, and to see it passionately preserved and updated by most of its original creative staff is great! 

The game itself is really fun, with odd and sometimes obtuse puzzles, great animation, memorable characters and stellar art by Peter Chan.

The character switching mechanic was really well explored too, although sometimes a bit excessive, it was really fun trying to see what could be done in the different time periods! 

The addition of a concept art gallery and developer commentary is incredibly insightful onto how the game was made, I very much appreciate it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198332070155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1607283666}
review:
Yup, that game is good stuff.
Not too easy, not too hard, no tedium walking all over the place or clicking pixels. Day of the Tentacle takes the best of the genre and avoids common pitfalls.

I am personally not a big fan of the art and beauty is in the eye of the beholder or so I heard :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198091494295', 'num_games_owned': 865, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 1080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 721, 'last_played': 1629619201}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is one of those great LucasArts games that's a good time, with the usual fun characters and humor, puzzles that are just right, and some fun artwork and music that lends into the simple yet cartoony charm of the world as well. If that weren't enough, Maniac Mansion is also included, so one can also play the sort-of prequel.

The system of puzzle-solving in different time periods leads to some unique and challenging puzzles to solve, yet the solutions are almost never that obtuse when one explores the world a bit and when using the object highlighting feature. 

There really isn't much to be said: Day of the Tentacle is one of those good LucasArts adventure games that, while not ground-breaking or anything, is still really well-made, and that‚Äôs all it really needs to be. Day of the Tentacle can be fun for anyone willing to sit down and do some creative thinking, and the remaster improves practically everything already great about the game, making it easily worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260401907', 'num_games_owned': 1964, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1606145790}
review:
[b]"Day of the Tentacle" is another masterpiece coming from the golden era of the point & click adventure games genre back in early 90s'. In fact it is iconic. It is one of the best Lucas Arts' games that set some new standards. The story is unique, the puzzles are really clever and its humor is pure art. With this facelift it gets even better. The remastered cartoonish graphics, the sound and the gameplay feel up to date again. You can't miss it.


Manometer: 10/10[/b]


The good
 - This game is hilarious. Fantastic sense of humor. It packs some of the best dialogues and jokes ever written for an adventure game (something you should expect, if you consider that the main goal is to save the world from an evil tentacle).
 - Nice aesthetics. Good cartoonish visuals that keep the spatial deformations of the original game.
 - Puzzles are great. Some of them are really clever. Don't expect the solution to be obvious. You will need to think hard and try many different things to solve them.
 - The whole concept is so smart. The simultaneous development of the story in three points of spacetime is a unique idea (has a lot in common with the "Back to the Future" movie trilogy).
 - The gameplay decision to control multiple characters (as well as exchanging things between them) was not something ordinary at the early adventures games.
 - Nice music that sticks in you mind.
 - The characters are unforgettable. You will love them all. 
 - There are some distinctive smart political comments.
 - You will find some extra content in this version. There is a gallery with a bunch of concept art images. You can also enable developers' commentary while playing the game.
 - You can play the whole "Maniac Mansion" game (another Lucas Arts' masterpiece) from an arcade machine inside the game. What a nice addition.
- This remastered version respectfully refreshes the original version. It keeps the vintage experience of a good 90's adventure game.

The bad
- You can't double click somewhere and go faster. You can't also double click and go to the next screen immediately so walking around may get boring sometimes.
- The puzzles are already hard to solve and they get even harder because the original gameplay system with all these commands (push, pull, pick, talk, open, close etc.) is too complex and obsolete. I'm not sure, but It may should get simplified in this remastered version. On the other hand this change could easily ruin the original experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198990784417', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1689787463}
review:
[h1]Ein Meilenstein des Genres [/h1] 

"Day of the Tentacle" (DOTT) ist vollkommen zurecht in jeder ordentlichen Adventure-Hitliste vertreten. Eigentlich war das Original von Lucas Arts schon ein zeitloser Klassiker. Double Fine hat mit der Remastered-Version aber einen noch zeitloseren Klassiker kreiert, der auch noch in den n√§chsten Jahrzehnten mit seinem Look, Witz und Charme die Spieler begeistern wird. Egal ob jung oder alt.

Als ich DOTT das erste mal spielte, gab es noch kein allgemein zug√§ngliches Internet und auch noch keine Komplettl√∂sungen. Weder im Printformat noch digital, so wie man es heute kennt. In der Regel gibt es im Internet diverse Komplettl√∂sungen zu einem Spiel. Damals hat man an diesem Spiel noch wochenlang gespielt. Man hing fest, man gr√ºbelte und knobelte, oder fragte Schulkameraden nach einem Tipp, wie man denn wohl weiter kommen k√∂nnte. Ach das waren noch Zeiten...

Da ich DOTT schon so oft gespielt habe, sind mir eigentlich alle L√∂sungen direkt wieder in Erinnerung gekommen. Also habe ich heute einen Samstagnachmittag daf√ºr gebraucht, wof√ºr ich bei meinem ersten Durchspielen ohne eine Komplettl√∂sung Wochen brauchte.

Der neue cleane und klare Comic-Look in Fullscreen mit moderner Men√ºf√ºhrung, optimiertem Sound und der heute noch erstklassigen deutschen Sprachausgabe macht DOTT heute wie vor 25 Jahren zu einem der besten Genre-Vertreter. Nostalgiker und Pixel-Art-Fans k√∂nnen mit einem einfachen Tastendruck auf "F1" zur Urversion wechseln.

[b] Fazit:[/b] 
Ein tolles Spiel! Wer es noch nicht kennt und gespielt hat, dem sei DOTT w√§rmstens ans Herz gelegt!

[b] Bewertung:[/b] 
Meine Bewertung: 95 %
Bewertung GameStar: 90 %
Bewertung 4Players: 91 %

review:
A weird and wacky point and click puzzle adventure involving sentient mutant tentacles, mad science, time travel, famous historical figures, a dystopian future, and the IRS.

If interested give it a shot with a hour timer and see how you feel when it goes off. Or check out a video of the game and see if the humour and gameplay is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126470078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1663105162}
review:
Great, classic game, definately my favourite one by LucasArts. I bought the game just to support the genre and hopes that Disney may someday resurrect the franchise(which I doubt will ever happen but...)
There's so much potential here.
The remake itself doesn't bring much new to the table... Graphics look like they've been auto-smoothed and anyway, don't really appreciate it so played it in one sitting, with original artstyle and music. Look MI Special edition, those remakes are worth it. 
I recommend the original game(which you can get on ScummVM), but this remake is just for hardcore fans

author: {'steamid': '76561197967459353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1604871374}
review: Day of the Tentacle a classic from what I consider the golden age of adventure games, and this gussied up remaster is probably the best way to experience it. Just keep in mind that, as is typical of adventure games of that era, some of the puzzles operate on bizarre moon-logic that you'd never guess in a million years without a walkthrough, so expect to need to consult a guide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148725040', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1527375839}
review:
Classic Point and click game from the 90s, made by Lucasarts before they became Disney, it has charm, humour and a short game for any completionist that wants to 100% it.

To compare to the original, it's totally the same game with improve graphics, i would liked new content or extra gameplay after beat it or new events/puzzles to resolve.

In the end the game is great and was a enjoyable ride for me that played the original DOS game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049213193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1635643257}
review:
I love this game.  Way back in the day, this was the only point and click I'd ever completed.  Mostly because it was on my cousin's computer so didn't have huge chunks of time to play, but still.  I loved it then, and love it now.

I find the remaster fantastic.  It looks, feels, sounds and plays great, and the fact you can press a key and go back to the old school format is very fun.

I really feel this has been handled well overall and can't recommend it enough.

review:
L'avventura grafica che pi√π preferisco in assoluto. Il mio sono sincero non √® un giudizio completamente imparziale, √® un gioco che mi ha accompagnato da quando sono bimbo. Detto questo la trovo una delle migliori avventure LucasArts: Assolutamente bizzarra, personaggio sopra le righe ed enigmi ben equilibrati (non √® il pi√π difficile del suo genere).

Questo remastered √® fatto piuttosto bene, Ma l'aumento di risoluzione e grafica mostra in modo pi√π palese i limiti del gioco originale. Parliamo di animazioni a 10frame in un ambiente che va a una velocit√† di molto superiore, il che rende tutto un po' strano. Ottimo remaster anche delle musiche che risultano pi√π pulite e perfettamente fedeli alla versione originale in MIDI.

Purtroppo per questo gioco niente doppiaggio italiano, ma solo sottotitoli. Se non sbaglio i sottotitoli sono quelli realizzati dalla CTO all'epoca, e se cos√¨ fosse diciamo che non √® proprio accuratissima.

Nota QUASI negativa: Maniac mansion (gioco che si pu√≤ trovare nascosto nel pc in camera del figlio degli edison) √® solo in lingua originale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063328110', 'num_games_owned': 2366, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1596983881}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

author: {'steamid': '76561198326068736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1633777678}
review:
This game takes me back. Finished this years ago when it first came out in the 1990`s. So why buy it it again, so i can do it all over again.
This is mainly a point and click game, but there`s fun to be had, it`s funny, you`ll get a few laughs while you play it, the voices are just as they were before, but the graphics compared to when I last played this are much better, so much clearer and smoother than the 90`s version

author: {'steamid': '76561197966760304', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1602332204}
review:
I love this game. And old school 90s adventure games. Especially LucasArts/Film & Sierra games. 

I originally played the 'non-talkie' floppy disk version of this way back in the golden age adventure games. I have finished this game numerous times pre-steam (imagine that) and, having not played it for for about 15 years and I still remembered about 90% of it.

Can't recommend this game enough (and ones from this era), these guys had a winning formula back around the early-mid 90s with Loom, Sam n Max Hit the Road, The Dig, Monkey Island, Indiana Jones Fate of Atlantis.

SHOULD I BUY IT: As a remaster in the 20Xs, it holds up really well - story is great, characters are likeable, puzzles aren't stupidly obscure and graphically it runs well on an ultrawide monitor (although with black side bars) but sometimes the audio and text lines would come out of sync - and once I had to reload a save due to being stuck in a 'cut scene' near the end of the game. And coming from ye olde schoole, some of the modern sound effects didn't quite suit compare to it's MIDI counterparts, but this was VERY rare.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970359185', 'num_games_owned': 1332, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1478330580}
review: Au contraire du (pourtant excellent) Grim Fandango - dont la version Remastered s'av√©rait un peu d√©cevante - Day Of The Tentacle a b√©n√©fici√© d'un lifting √† la hauteur de sa l√©gende. Il est vrai que la mission √©tait grandement facilit√©e par les graphismes cartoonesques en 2D l√† o√π Grim Fandango proposait un jeu pour partie en 3D et s'√©cartait parfois de la maniabilit√© classique des jeux d'aventure (ce qui n'excuse en rien la finition d√©sastreuse et d'avoir conserv√© certaines faiblesses de l'original). Mais Double Fine a vraiment mis les petits plats dans les grands : d'une part les graphismes remast√©ris√©s sont magnifiques et l'utilisation d'un menu radial permet √† ceux-ci d'occuper tout l'√©cran et d'autre part les bonus (commentaires audio, dessins pr√©paratoires) feront plaisir aux fans. L'aventure reste ce qu'elle √©tait : un monument d'humour, de situations inventives et farfelues, et de puzzles retors - qui flirtent parfois avec la limite du n'importe quoi sans jamais vraiment la franchir (et les raccourcis sont suffisamment nombreux pour ne pas s'√©puiser en vains allers et retours) - pour la plupart li√©s au fait de contr√¥ler trois personnages √† trois √©poques diff√©rentes d'un m√™me lieu. Un pur bijou en terme d'√©criture, sign√© de la dream team du genre. Seule l'animation, exceptionnelle √† l'√©poque, accuse aujourd'hui le coup mais sans venir ternir l'excellente impression laiss√©e par ce Day Of The Tentacle.

review: Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a classic old-school LucasArts adventure game that is a must play of all adventure game fans! You'll be playing as 3 different characters in the Past, Present and in the Future to stop the Evil Purple Tentacle! This game is a bit more difficult than other LucasArts adventure games with lots of items, different options and some obscure puzzles. The game has a good story, awesome music, sound and gameplay, highly recommended! I love the nostalgic feeling and the Remastered version retains all of it. Plus, Maniac Mansion is included within the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029608584', 'num_games_owned': 341, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1600646539}
review:
[h3]Hell, did people SOLVE this in 1993?[/h3]

I'm amazed how much time and patience we had in our childhood and youth. I didn't play this back then (rather a fan of Monkey Island and Indy), but lots of friends did.

Playing this now was
[h3]a lot of fun[/h3]
but I seriously couldn't have done it without the guide. Seriously: Who has time for this?

Short list of pros and cons:

+ Relatively small game world (same house, 3 "time zones")
+ Funny characters
+ Great dialogues
+ Antagonist with World Domination F√ºhrer-complex

- Music is rather annoying than atmospheric
- I'm not a fan of the abstract style backgrounds

Both cons are actually a matter of taste. The game is great in the bottom line. Sooo much to do and to try. Experiencing the story myself, was a nice walk down memory lane back to my childhood years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233456184', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1600591923}
review:
Il giorno del tentacolo rimasterizzato si aggiunge alla lista delle avventure Lucasarts riproposte per dare la possibilit√† di giocare (o rigiocare come nel mio caso) un classico intramontabile. Stesso iter di The Secret of Monkey Island, anche Day of si presenta ben pi√π di una remastered, ridisegnato da zero pur mantenendo i tratti originali (animazioni e ambienti), si potr√† tranquillamente vedere la differenza ingame premendo F1. Rifatte con la stessa cura anche le musiche mentre inedito il doppiaggio, solo in inglese (sottotitoli in italiano presenti). La scrittura √® da manuale con il suo humour surreale ricco di gag che ancora oggi funzionano, il gioco √® lo stesso di oltre 20'anni fa quindi nulla da aggiungere se non qualche curiosit√† come essere la prima avventura che vede Tim Schafer e Dave Grossman alla direzione, assieme agli immancabili Ron Gilbert e Gary Winnick (tra l'altro curatori dell'episodio precedente, Maniac Mansion). Parliamo del team creativo che ha dominato le avventure grafiche degli anni '90 e Day of ne √® una delle massime espressioni.
Nel complesso l'operazione √® riuscita, a corredo troveremo immancabili bozzetti e commento degli autori originali, cloud save e obiettivi.

In conclusione vorrei spostare l'attenzione su alcuni problemi in cui sono incappato per quanto riguarda le musiche che sostanzialmente a volte vanno a volte si fermano, dovuto a qualche incompatibilit√† con windows 10 stando ai forum della community, dovrebbe essere sufficiente modificarne la compatibilit√†. Ben pi√π grave il recuperare un paio di dll (msvcp110 e msvcr110 entrambi in versione 32bit e copiarli nella cartella di gioco) perch√® nonostante sia installata la versione necessaria di Microsoft Visual C++, il gioco non la becca e non parte. Fastidioso come workaround ma risolve la situazione.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988613991', 'num_games_owned': 520, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1599407943}
review:
First off, a disclaimer for all those old-school white knights out there: I'm not saying the game is bad. I'm saying it's not for everyone.
------
With all this game's charm and humor, with all that "critically-acclaimed" stuff and the reputation of "one of the best quests in video games history" we forget that all this was valid over 20 years ago, when literally anything was much, much worse than Day of the Tentacle and often ‚Äî pretty ridiculous. Back then game design was usually so bad that we were supposed to make progress in quests not by using logic and wits but via pixel hunting and guessing.

Unfortunately, Day of the Tentacle, having many nice traits that made it stand out in the past, is still one of those quests where you might not be satisfied when you solve a puzzle. The infamous "sense of accomplishment" is not what you feel when you accomplish something *randomly*, only after you have run out of choices and just kept using random items on random objects. And with all the possible combinations (that sometimes make no sense even when they work), you'll get tired guessing pretty quickly. While some puzzles are obvious, other can drive you mad shouting "Really?! How were I supposed to--".

It is often unclear if you are supposed to interact with an object/NPC at all or it's just a decoy because out of dozens of possible interactions none actually work. It is often unclear what you are supposed to do at all. With the slow process of transferring items between characters you'll lose time just doing mechanical work.

You know, what spending time with little to no progress despite the person's best effort called?
Waste of time.

If you have plenty of it, go on and enjoy. I can't just ignore the fact that thousands of people played and enjoyed this game. I believe this is possible.

If you expect making progress only because you are smart, that just might not be enough. You'll HAVE to waste time doing random stuff and praying it does something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004404059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1480111475}

author: {'steamid': '76561198023508607', 'num_games_owned': 328, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1591635801}
review:
L'id√©e du voyage dans le temps est g√©niale pour un jeu d'aventure et brillamment exploit√©e ici.
L'humour Lucasarts est √† son pinacle et la stupidit√© des dialogues et de l'univers font mouche.
La version 2016 transcende l'ambiance cartoon du jeu d'origine, qui reste graphiquement honorable vis √† vis des standards actuels.

Seul v√©ritable d√©faut : certaines √©nigmes sont tordues, mais moins que celles de Monkey Island 1&2.
Il reste par moment ce c√¥t√© frustrant : "j'ai plus d'id√©e, je tente toutes les combinaisons d'objets possibles au pif" mais heureusement pas trop souvent.

Si vous ne devez jouer qu'√† un seul jeu d'aventure Lucasarts, c'est celui-l√†.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016045299', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1598734704}
review: Finally played one of the most important classic poinnt n click adventures out there. What can I say - it absolutely lives up to its reputation of being a masterpiece! The visuals wouldn't even have needed redrawing: The classic pixel-version is timeless and I even preferred the verb interface over the context wheel.

review: There's not much I can say about this game.  It's an incredibly faithful reproduction of a beloved classic (and it also includes classic mode).  The puzzles are doable but require thought.  There's comedy and inane sillyness everywhere.  You seriously can't go wrong.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029312407', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1503959781}
review: I played this as a kid, so when I saw it was remastered I had to get it. I'm a sucker for nostalgia. Anyway, it didn't disappoint. It is still the same story line with maybe a little better graphics, but still with the clever sluthing and puzzle solving as the original. I enjoyed it then and enjoyed it again. Took me a lot less time to complete this time around and it isn't a game I'd play over and over again, but it was worth the price to relive my childhood for a moment.

I got this on Humble Bundle for dirt cheap and enjoyed every second of it.  It's a fun point and click adventure with a lot of humor that flew over my head as a child.  Took me around 6-7 hours so it isn't very long but it is enjoyable.

review:
Worth your time if you love the golden age of Lucas Arts. Its a very weird story with weird characters, so it makes it a very unique experience and one that you'll remember forever. 

I played Day of the Tentacle back on my Mac when I was very young. Seeing it remastered was going back to my childhood honestly. Its really a good time if you like Point and Click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137293738', 'num_games_owned': 1638, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1596989614}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered ist eine Neuauflage des gleichnamigen Titels von 1993.
Mit viel Witz, Charme und einer geh√∂rigen Packung Selbstironie r√§tselt man sich durch dieses gelungene comic look art style pnc adventure game durch.

"Genau genommen sind es sogar 2 games in einem, da man am PC von Ed den ersten Teil komplett nochmal spielen kann, sollte man diesen verpasst haben und nachholen wollen (leider aber nur als englische Version)."

Den ersten Durchlauf hat man in ca 2-4h, je nach dem wie schnell man auf die richtigen L√∂sungen kommt, geschafft.

Ich habe, auf der Jagd nach allen Achievements, das Spiel ganze 3x durchgespielt und habe mich dabei keinesfalls gelangweilt.

Ich kann es nur jedem empfehlen.

review:

La version remasteris√©e de Day of the Tentacle est un v√©ritable coup de ma√Ætre ! L'√©quipe de Double Fine Productions s'√©tait engag√©e √† nous faire r√™ver les yeux grands ouverts et l'objectif est atteint !

Retrouvez Bernard, Hoagie et Laverne pour de folles aventures √† travers le temps comme.. au bon vieux temps !

author: {'steamid': '76561197997358197', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 799, 'last_played': 1596925694}
review: This is a classic point and click adventure in the LucasArts style.  Enough challenge to keep you from walking through without stopping to think.  Enough oddball humor and puns to make it interesting.  Most of the solutions make sense.  (I'll admit I had to reference a hint for one of the puzzles that was an interface issue)  No pixel hunting for items.  Playing through Maniac Mansion within the game demonstrated how far these games had come.
