review: I absolutely love this game. i played this game when it first came out on PC many many years ago and still have the original CD (unfortunately don't have the cardboard box it came in). The remastered version brings back the nostalgic feel but with updated visuals and audio. i have played this game that many times, i know all the puzzles of by heart. double fine studios have done a great job on this remaster. i hope there maybe a sequel at some point. if your into point and click games with dumb comedy fun, then i can't recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088033314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1595508652}
review:
[h1][b]This must be that Woodstock place Mom and Dad always talk about.[/b][/h1]

[h1][b]Full review at [url=https://gamedragons.net/viewtopic.php?f=6&p=266]GameDragons.Net[/url][/b][/h1]

[b]Presentation[/b]
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is an overhaul of 1993's LucasArts classic, bringing this almost 3 decades old game to modern hardware with graphical and control improvements while still keeping the appeal and humor of the original untouched, something that is still worth experiencing today. If you've never played or heard of Day of the Tentacle, the original game itself is a sequel to 1987's Maniac Mansion which follows Bernard Bernoulli and his friends Hoagie and Laverne as they attempt to stop the world from being taken over by an evil tentacle. As the tentacle has already set his world domination plans in motion the trio decides to help Dr. Fred Edison, a scientist responsible for the creation of the tentacles, by going back in time to the day before it happens in order to stop it. As that being a success wouldn't set off the premise for an interesting plot spanning more than 5 minutes, the time machine malfunctions sending each character 200 years apart in time from one another, leaving Hoagie stuck in the past during the time of the US' founding fathers and sending Laverne 200 years into the future in a world where tentacles have become the dominant species and humans have been downgraded to being their pets, while leaving Bernard in the present.

By doing this the game spans three different timelines all of which take place in the same location, Dr Fred's mansion, which as you will find out is used for various things in the past and future depending on who inhabited it, but as it is the same location doing different things in one timeline will affect the outcome in another and based on that the game creates intriguing puzzles that require you to send items back and forth in time. Once you get past the introduction you will be able to switch between characters at will and while each timeline has puzzles of its own, many of them require you to pass items between characters using the Chron-o-Johns, which are toilets with the ability to transport items between timelines, allowing Bernard to send items to Hoagie or Laverne and the same thing in reverse for those characters. Each character has a quirky personality that fits the humorous tone of the game perfectly and sets up the stage for many jokes and references which are still funny and relevant today despite the game's age. There is a little bit of humor infused into every part of this game starting with dialogue that even though doesn't influence the outcome of conversations in any way, allows you to respond in various ways and ask other side characters outrageous questions that often lead to funny punchlines.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
The interaction system has various options depending on the item you click on, as you can close and open doors, pull or push objects or more basic options like looking and using which are available on most items, but despite the many options you have when clicking on an object that is actually not the part that makes Day of the Tentacles' puzzles confusing because they often make sense from an approach perspective, instead the problem comes from the large variety of items that you can gather in each character's inventory and have to find a use for later on, but remember that you can send items between characters, so picking up an item with one character in one timeline doesn't necessarily mean you will use it there, so you never quite know what is supposed to be used where especially because just like any other early LucasArts games item interactions are often illogical. This is once again not a problem for people who have played the game previously or enjoy this constant exploration aspect for your next movement that clicks, but it will likely be a problem for players who aren't used to this methodology in game design and the remaster doesn't do anything to address that issue, which could've been fixed with a hint system. Even if you are generally good at puzzle games you will most likely end up looking up a guide at some point because the interactions required to progress forward are always something you wouldn't normally think of and the fact that you never know which timeline has to make the next move expands on that problem with more options than you might have the patience to try out.

Unlike some other games in the LucasArts portfolio, Day of the Tentacle never really had camera issues because despite using the same technique and camera system as some of the other titles, the scenes in this game are small in scale, with each room in the mansion being a different scene that you will transition to when you walk through a door, so the action feels smooth and fluid and passing items between characters is easily done using a single menu that opens up your entire inventory which has replaced the chaotic text based system of the original, allowing you to drag and drop items to the other character's icons to the right of the menu in order to send them. 

[b]Graphics[/b]
The graphics have been drastically improved, showcasing the true artistic direction the game was originally going for, but was limited by the early 90s hardware and if you want to compare there's also an option to switch between the remastered version and the original, which gives you a nice perspective on how modern non-pixelated design has such a big impact on the look of the game without omitting anything from what made the original so unique. While the characters and scenery have been reworked into something incredible the effects have received a somehow superficial overhaul with smoke effects for example looking better than the original, but still a bit off compared to the standard in modern visual effects.

[b]Audio[/b]
All of the original actors are still here with Denny Delk taking on the roles of Hoagie, the tentacles and George Washington, while Jane Jacobs takes on the role of Laverne and Richard Sanders plays the role of Bernard and even though they haven't rerecorded their lines for the remaster, the work Double Fine has done on the audio side is enough to bring their voice work up to modern standards, but don't expect anything fancy like Dolby Digital or spatial audio. The soundtrack still hits the same highs it did back in '93, but just like everything else the tunes have been reworked to come as close as possible to modern standards; on the other side the effects range in quality, some seem to have been replaced or reworked while others seem neglected, but it's always something minor like the sound of a drawer opening.

[b]Extras[/b]
If you knew what you were doing from top to bottom you could finish this game in less than 4 hours, but if you've never played this before and want to go through it without a guide you could spend much more than that just trying different item combinations in order to move forward and even with that in mind you might still give up at some point and look up a walkthrough regardless. There are some extras included with the remaster such as concept art and developer commentary, but those are mostly for fans of the original game who want to find out more about the game's development.

[b]Verdict[/b]
Day of the Tentacle Remaster is an amazing redesign of the 1993 classic which still stands tall today in terms of jokes and character design, but has been completely obliterated by the passage of time in terms of gameplay as players nowadays are used to always knowing what the objective is, something that may come as a hurdle for anyone looking to get into this game now, but if you don't mind using a guide or spending many hours looking around trying different combinations, this game is still worth it for the humor and characters alone.

[u]Rating: 6.8[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970394126', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1594842342}
review:
I guess I'm getting old. I picked up the remastered version of [b]Day Of The Tentacle[/b] during the summer sales and realised it's been 27 years since I bought the original version of this game. It's at least 25 years ago since I last played the original but when I launched the game I still remembered all the intro dialogues. The game is even funnier than I remembered, mostly because I didn't get all the jokes and historical references back in the day.

[b]Day Of The Tentacle[/b] is a classic [i]point and click[/i] adventure game with a great story, wacky humour and lots of time travel. When they try to stop a megalomaniac tentacle that is trying to take over the world, three friends are separated in time by a malfunctioning time machine. One character is sent back 200 years in the past, one remains in the present while the third one ends up 200 years in the future. The puzzles are very cleverly designed and quite a few of them rely on the whole time travel aspect of the story.

This is actually a sequel to 1987's [b]Maniac Mansion[/b] but apart from a couple of microwave and hamster jokes, you don't really need to know what happened in the first game in order to enjoy this sequel. However, if you are eager to learn what did happen, you can always play [b]Maniac Mansion[/b] as a game-within-a-game. Being able to play the first game on a computer that you find somewhere in the sequel to that game is exactly the kind of thing that set this game apart from the competition more than two and a half decades ago.

I really enjoyed playing this game again after all this time. The graphics were state of the art back then but have been completely redrawn for this remastered version. As with most (if not all) remastered LucasArts games, you can switch between the original and remastered graphics, which is a nice bonus.

If you've never played this game but you enjoy [i]point and click[/i] adventures, go buy this game. You won't regret it.
If you did play the original game but you haven't played the remastered version yet, go buy it as well. You won't regret it either.

review: A classic point-and-click advenure remastered to look great on today's hardware. Great humor and lots of funny references to the real world. You can even find the original Maniac Mansion to play for a nostalgia bonus within this game. Great story and interesting puzzles. Overall, a must-have whether you played it back in the day or not...Recommended 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198357862916', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1533679331}
review:
What can I say that hasn't already been said about this timeless classic? 

Just as when it was released back in 1993, Day of The Tentacle continues to remain as one of the best crafted, comically written, point and click adventure stories ever released. From the opening credit sequence to the epilogue, you will find yourself enjoying some good laughs as you spend more time with each of the unique personalities from the main cast, while navigating them through the constant eccentricities of all the supporting characters.

Double Fine Productions did an outstanding job remastering and preserving this game.

"Damn good coffee!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197996685479', 'num_games_owned': 2386, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1458926161}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is among my favourite P&C adventures from Lucasarts. I love the art style, I love the whacky protagonists (especially Laverne, she's a treasure) and I love the idea of having 3 different timelines to play with.

The puzzles aren't something impossible to figure out, but I wouldn't say that they're obvious. They're a good, balanced challenge.

What we get in this remastered version is higher quality sound and 16:9 cartoon-y art, instead of the original pixelated 4:3. The original was already stellar, so this remaster is nice, but not revolutionary.

It's a game I'd recommend to anyone, especially to those who like P&C adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969749884', 'num_games_owned': 2459, 'num_reviews': 1422, 'playtime_forever': 15562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15562, 'last_played': 1593940066}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered brings one of the funniest adventure games of all time back in a way which does not induce eye bleeding while completely retaining the spirit and feel of the original.

There's literally only one thing I can negatively say about Day of the Tentacle. It's neither Curse of Monkey Island nor Grim Fandango, but that's it for criticism.

Well and by today's standards it's a tad short, to be honest. Still, this is definitely worth playing, being one of the major games which impacted the entire genre for the decades that followed after.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007312861', 'num_games_owned': 1364, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1593816911}
review:
‚≠êExtreme Makeover‚≠ê

Day of Tentacle, sorti en 1993... plus de 25 ans... √† l'√©poque, j'√©tais jeune et innocent, pas un cheveu blanc, la truffe humide et le poil soyeux... Et que vois-je un remaster¬†? Et la question que je me suis pos√©¬†: est-ce que le studio Double Fine a su soigner ce chef-d‚Äô≈ìuvre du Point and Click de ma g√©n√©ration¬†? Oui parce qu'on ne va pas se mentir, il faut dire que la version originale a pris un coup de vieux et pique les yeux. Alors sommes-nous face une qualit√© qui permet de c√©der aux chants des sir√®nes¬†?

D√©j√†, je vais rassurer les vieux clous. Le studio a laiss√© intact les dialogues ainsi que l'histoire. Pourquoi modifier ce qui, √† mon sens, constituer d√©j√† √† l'√©poque l'un des plus gros point fort du jeu¬†?

Un jour sans fin¬†?

Vous vous retrouvez √† diriger Hoagie, Bernard et Laverne, trois personnages aux personnalit√©s bien tranch√©es. Nos protagonistes vont partir dans l'espace-temps via des chrono-wc pour sauver le monde de la tentacule pourpre qui suite √† une exp√©rience se voit dot√©e de pouvoirs extraordinaires¬†!

Malheureusement rien ne fonctionne comme pr√©vu et nos trois compagnons se retrouvent bloqu√©s dans trois √©poques diff√©rentes¬†: l'un 200 ans dans le pass√©, l'autre dans le pr√©sent et le dernier 200 ans dans le futur.

Fracture de la r√©tine et double rupture du cristallin

Clairement on constate que les gars du studio n'ont pas ch√¥m√©. Les textures ont √©t√© retravaill√©es et le pixel est plus fin, plus propre, plus agr√©able et flatte l‚Äô≈ìil. Mais ils n'ont pas boss√© uniquement sur un retexturage, ils ont √©galement planch√© et retravaill√© l'interface afin de proposer une sorte de roue d'action. Au d√©but d√©routant (oui, je suis vieux...) mais finalement, le syst√®me est plaisant et facile √† prendre en main.

Est-ce que je recommande cette refonte d'un jeu de plus de 25 ans¬†? Oui, oui et oui. Le jeu de base √©tait parfait et ici, le studio Double Fine lui rend ses lettres de noblesse sans changer ce qui faisait la force des jeux Lucas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992438116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 497, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1591519533}
review: Day of the Tentacle est une l√©gende. N'ayant pas eu l'occasion de faire ce jeu √† l'√©poque de sa sortie, je me suis lanc√© dans l'aventure sur cette version Remastered. Le jeu propose de basculer entre les graphismes d'origine et les nouveaux simplement en appuyant sur la touche F1. La d√©marche est appr√©ciable car elle permet de voir le travail r√©alis√©. Et c'est une r√©ussite. Les graphismes sont r√©ussis et color√©s dans le style du jeu d'origine. Le jeu est plein d'humour et on s'attache √† ces personnages compl√®tements fous. Un must have pour tous les amateurs de point & click. Ceux qui ont connu le jeu √† l'√©poque de sa sortie initiale seront heureux de voir le superbe travail r√©alis√© et ceux qui comme moi d√©couvrent le jeu pour la premi√®re fois auront le plaisir de d√©couvrir cette p√©pite du jeu vid√©o.

review:
This is a nicely remastered version of the classical Day of the Tentacle ScummVM (Monkey Island, Indiana Jones) classical point and click adventure.  Guide three "nerds" through a time travel adventure to stop a pair of intelligent tentacles created by a mad scientist from taking over the world.

The remaster works nicely on modern PCs and for fans of the old game or for people who never played it, it might be worth picking up, but not for the full retail price Double Fine are charging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024995538', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1711072277}

author: {'steamid': '76561198079795608', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1591815741}
review:
I basically got through it in one swoop.
My memory had all the bits still saved. Sorta sad, sorta convenient.
I still love the humor in this one.
As much as I didn't connect with Grim Fandango, this one is brilliant.
Not sure if it's due to better puzzles, my nostalgia for it or the absolutely wacky nonsense going on.

I don't know if I'd suggest anyone to try it as a game, but as the memory that I love it for, I sure do.
I never solved puzzles, I merely remembered them.
So my judgement on the quality and logic of the puzzles doesn't work.
It's done in a way that makes the story funny and wacky.

I'm very thankful that they offer a quick change-switch for the old version.
Some of the new orchestrations are bad, so switching to the iconic sound of the nineties was very welcome.
Good nostalgia, done right. I enjoyed it a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138124077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1591518738}
review: I played DOTT as a child back in the 90s on an old MS DOS pc, where voice-over hadn't yet been invented (whaoh!) and sound was limited to MIDI. These where the days where you had to choose your sound card before starting the game (sound blaster anyone??). I fell in love with the game in seconds, and it paved the way for my obsession with LucasArts adventure games for years to come incl Sam & Max, Indiana Jones, Grim Fandango, and all the Monkey Island series. The nutty jokes, the personable style, the hairpulling puzzles. It was only able to beat the game until much later, since walkthroughs weren't a thing just yet (neither was the internet). Still. This game captured my imagination to the max, and has been perfected in this remastered version. It takes everything I loved and made it 2020 incl beautiful art design, voice over, and I love the commentary by the original LucasArts designers. Point and Click at its finest.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198854140232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1662854784}
review: An absolute favorite of my childhood, this remaster is done very well. Deep down I will always prefer the pixel graphics and grainy audio, but it's nice to an update done well when others have failed so miserably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068639706', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1591665719}
review:
This game is simply legendary and defined the Adventure Game genre.

TONS of humour, beautiful art, perfectly balanced difficulty with the puzzles.

Some puzzles might look hard, but they always have a logical explanation. The game's life expectancy is directly tied to you figuring out those on your own. A single clue taken from a walkthrough can remove quite a few hours of gameplay and this game has no replayability, so up to you if you choose to go that way. We used the walkthrough way too much back in the days and I regretted it immensely.

Every gamer should try this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032387023', 'num_games_owned': 1899, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1588546426}
review:
I generally dislike adventure games with illogical puzzles. Many people would consider one of the Monkey Island titles their favorite adventure game, whereas my favorite ones would be Sanitarium, Beneath a Steel Sky or the first Broken Sword. My preference generally falls outside Lucas Arts‚Äô scope, but I nevertheless loved Day of the Tentacle.

Similar to its prequel, Maniac Mansion, you control three different characters interchangeably. Your goal is to save the world from the evil purple tentacle! Day of the Tentacle is easily one of the most hilarious video games I have ever played and I thoroughly enjoyed it, despite not appreciating several puzzles.

One word on the perfect remaster. Tim Schafer did an amazing work with this and enhanced the visuals without losing the game‚Äôs spirit. You can also press F1 anytime and enjoy DoTT with the good old graphics and audio.

PS: You can access the original Maniac Mansion from within the game too.  

[b]8.5/10[/b]

review: Grandes personajes en la aventura gr√°fica m√°s extra√±a de LucasArts. Por momentos muy dif√≠cil, pero compensa con otros momentos hilarantes. Excelente arte tanto en su versi√≥n original como en su versi√≥n remasterizada. Si te gustan las aventuras gr√°ficas, las historias sin sentido y pensar fuera de lo com√∫n, este juego no aburre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002442896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1589661523}
review:
Esta cr√≠tica es una de las m√°s sencillas de escribir ya que hablamos de un referente en el g√©nero. Una pieza legendaria. 

Est√° remasterizaci√≥n supone la fantas√≠a cumplida de todo nost√°lgico de la √©poca ya que permite disfrutar simult√°neamente tanto de la versi√≥n cl√°sica como de la modernizada con un estilo de arte exquisito dejando la posibilidad en todo momento de cambiar de un estilo a otro a criterio de cada uno. 

Adicionalmente y para deleite de los incondicionales se pueden activar las voces de los desarrolladores para escuchar sus comentarios mientras se avanza en la historia. Este a√±adido por si solo es, si es que necesitaban alguna, la excusa de cualquier fan para rejugar este cl√°sico atemporal una vez m√°s. 

El nuevo apartado visual es sobresaliente, una clase magistral de como presentar una remasterizaci√≥n sin alterar nada del juego original. La interfaz se ha simplificado para hacerse accesible tanto a nuevos jugadores como al uso con mando que es otra de las novedades a destacar. 

Sobre el juego como tal no hay mucho que decir a estas alturas. Hablamos de uno de los mejores juegos que se han hecho hasta la fecha en su g√©nero. Un t√≠tulo obligado para cualquier entusiasta de las aventuras gr√°ficas o de los videojuegos retro en general. Una aut√©ntica obra maestra marca de la casa (Ron Gilbert) que sigue siendo igual de divertida que entonces. 

La historia es desternillante y algunos chistes y puzzles memorables. Los personajes son historia de los videojuegos y creo que la dificultad est√° en el promedio de este tipo de juegos con algunas combinaciones locas de objetos que los que vengan de otras aventuras de LucasArts no se sorprender√°n en encontrar.

Como detalle no menor mencionar que se puede jugar al Maniac Mansion original que abri√≥ el camino al resto de aventuras con motor SCUMM desde cierto lugar dentro del juego. Un auto-homenaje y un regalo para el que juegue esta secuela de aquel juego primerizo. Un dos por uno en toda regla. 

En resumen est√° versi√≥n remasterizada es la guinda a una obra que marc√≥ la infancia de una generaci√≥n a la que el boca a boca y los a√±os han convertido en eterna. Uno de los mayores √©xitos que se recuerdan de los a√±os dorados de LucasArts en los '90. 

Injustificable no figurar en cualquier biblioteca decente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048498273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1599774520}
review:
TL;DR - One of the best (and funniest) point 'n click adventure games from the most productive era of Lucas Arts.

At Length - This is a true classic in the point 'n click adventure game canon right next to the Secret of Monkey Island. A sequel to the OG Maniac Mansion done in the updated style of the 90s and one of the main reasons Tim Schafer, and now Double Fine is even a thing. This port works really well at bringing the experience to modern PCs with updated visuals for higher resolution monitors and some achievements to help push your playthrough into some interesting directions you might not have realized existed. 

All in all, it's a simple package. But there's good value since Day of the Tentacle is downright hilarious, the puzzles are pretty forgiving but still engaging, and if you press into the game a bit, you also get the OG Maniac Mansion as a bonus, just like you always did. Hard not to recommend to anyone who likes humor. 

Which, is . . . everyone? I hope.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983887008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1588177332}
review:
One of the best adventure games of all time... but has it aged well? I think it has and the added commentary is great.
I wonder how well the game translates to newer players. I remember this taking longer on my first playthrough years ago, but now it's like a 2-3 hour playthrough because I know all the puzzles. I wish game developers would get on that selective memory erasing technology so i can get more replay value out of this ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198264305879', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1585410746}
review:
This game (and Maniac Mansion) has been somewhat of an obsession for me since I was old enough to play computer games in the mid-90s. My neighbors had the copy of Maniac Mansion before we even had a computer (my parents were weird), and even if we did have one I doubt they would've bought the game.  Eventually as I grew up, my brother supplied me with a plethora of games, including Day of the Tentacle. Which I'm sure most know actually has the full Maniac Mansion game as an Easter egg inside of Day of the Tentacle.  That said, I've probably played Maniac Mansion and Day of the Tentacle more than any other computer game I've ever owned. 

Maniac Mansion came out in 1987, and Day of the Tentacle came out in 1993, but was later remastered (this version). With that being said, the game play is a little more challenging than today's puzzle type computer games because there was not necessarily several ways to progress through the game, and you had to do specific things in a specific order sometimes.  However, that doesn't mean these days you can't get a little help from a walkthrough ;-) 

The sense of humor in the game is somewhat...rare, but hysterical.  The art style is fantastic, but that may be in the eye of the beholder. It definitely appeals to me. It may be my bias talking, from said obsession since I was a kid, but I genuinely do love this game and I would recommend it to anyone who likes The Cave or Thimbleweed Park, etc. because they are incredibly similar and fun games to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119477704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 596, 'last_played': 1478630245}
review:
Points positifs : 
- L'univers. Le jeu a beaucoup d'humour au niveau de ses personnages loufoques et ses situation rocambolesques. 
- Les graphismes. En normal ou en remaster, le jeu est beau et fourmille de d√©tails. 
- Le gameplay. Si vous avez toujours voulu exp√©rimenter l'effet papillon, ce jeu est fais pour vous. En effet il repose sur le fait d'avoir 3 personnages √† 3 √©poques diff√©rentes : le pass√©, le pr√©sent et le futur. Par cons√©quent, certaines √©nigmes pourront se r√©soudre qu'en pensant en 4 dimensions. 

Points n√©gatifs :
- La difficult√© variable. Comme beaucoup de jeux du genre, certaines √©nigmes s'av√®reront assez tarabiscot√©e.

review:
Sch√∂ne, lustige Animationen und Spr√ºche bringen das komplette Spiel √ºber Spass. Und wie man es nat√ºrlich aus anderen Lucas Arts Produktionen kennt, fehlen auch hier nicht die Verweise zu anderen Lucas Arts Spielen.
Manchmal sind Animation und Sprache nicht synchron und zeitlich etwas versetzt, was aber das Spielgef√ºhl nicht beeintr√§chtigt.

Kleinere Fehler mit eingestellter Sprache (Audio) "Deutsch" festgestellt:
- W√§hrend Sequenzen sollte man nicht den Rendermodus wechseln, denn es k√∂nnte passieren, dass das Bild verschwindet und man dann nur noch den Ton h√∂rt.
- Intro > Hamster klingelt "Ding Dong" aber statt eines Klingelsounds spricht Hoagie: "Ich glaube, den brauche ich f√ºr die Band, Laverne... Du wie√üt schon, wir k√∂nnten ihm den Kopf abbei√üen oder so."
- Sequenz Jefferson, Washington oder Hancock springen durch das Fenster, weil der Kamin qualmt: Anstatt dass Sie Feuer w√§hrend des Sprunges rufen, ert√∂nt von Washington: "... wer war der Idiot, der das Feuer gemacht hat?"

Absolut empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159557111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1685123750}
review:
(Test √† retrouver sur https://canigeekit.blog/)

Il est difficile de juger un jeu qui a berc√© son enfance. J‚Äôai jou√© √† pas mal de Point and Click avec mon p√®re quand j‚Äô√©tais gamin, et Day of the Tentacle √©tait l‚Äôun de mes pr√©f√©r√©s. Je l‚Äôai fini en quelques heures et je me souvenais encore de quasiment tout, 20¬†ans apr√®s. Autant dire que √ßa rentre mieux que les r√®gles grammaticales.

Day of the Tentacle nous propose de suivre les aventures de 3 potes atypiques et relativement cr√©tins, appel√©s par un scientifique cingl√© pour sauver le monde de tentacules mutantes et mal√©fiques. Rien que √ßa. Apr√®s une petite erreur technique, nos trois amis se retrouveront dans la m√™me maison, mais √† trois p√©riodes temporelles diff√©rentes. Il faudra trouver un moyen pour que tout le monde rentre dans le pr√©sent, et botter la ventouse de ces envahisseurs visqueux.
On a affaire √† un v√©ritable classique du Point and Click : c‚Äôest la suite du pionnier Maniac Mansion, d√©velopp√© par les mecs qui ont fait Monkey Island ou encore Zak McKraken. Les mecs qui ont pos√© les bases du genre quoi. On retrouve donc l‚Äôhabituel d√©placement √† la souris, l‚Äôinventaire infini, le curseur qui vous indique les √©l√©ments du d√©cor, la sauvegarde manuelle. Version remast√©ris√©e oblige, certaines vieilles m√©caniques de jeu ont √©t√© d√©poussi√©r√©es. Ainsi, les classiques verbes d‚Äôaction sont remplac√©s par une roulette d'ic√¥nes autour des objets utilisables et des PNJ. Un bouton vous permettra √©galement de passer en surbrillance les objets. Une bonne chose pour les novices du genre, que le gameplay original aurait pu d√©stabiliser.
La difficult√© du jeu est par contre bien d'origine. Vous devrez vous creuser le cr√¢ne et √™tre patient pour finir le jeu sans regarder les solutions. Il faudra fouiller les tableaux de fond en comble, √™tre bien attentif au d√©cor pour ne rien louper, bidouiller vos objets entre eux, et dialoguer avec tous les PNJ pour ne louper aucune information. Day of the Tentacle demande de faire preuve d'imagination, d'ing√©niosit√© et de perspicacit√©. Et si la r√©ponse pour d√©bloquer la situation n‚Äôest souvent pas √©vidente √† trouver, elle n‚Äôest jamais vraiment tir√©e par les cheveux non plus, ce qui est un d√©faut inh√©rent √† de nombreux Point and Click. Le jeu n'est pas sp√©cialement long, mais fait donc preuve d'une r√©sistance qui lui donne une certaine esp√©rance de vie. √Ä noter qu'il n'y a pas de Game Over ou autres temps limit√©s. On est tranquille pour r√©fl√©chir, c'est d√©j√† √ßa.

Le contr√¥le des trois personnages se fait tr√®s facilement, puisque l'on passe de l'un √† l'autre en un clic. Malgr√© leur √©loignement, ils pourront s'envoyer des objets (de mani√®re tr√®s classe) et devront agir dans la timeline des uns et des autres pour avancer. Les √©nigmes temporelles sont vraiment bien ficel√©es, et trouver la solution seul est assez gratifiant.

Une des grandes forces de Day of the Tentacle est son univers totalement barjo. Le sc√©nario n‚Äôa rien d‚Äôint√©ressant en soit, mais la situation que vive les protagonistes est un terreau fertile pour des situations absurdes et des rencontres historiques loufoques. Les graphismes et le sound-design sont parfaitement cartoonesques, l'OST un peu vieillotte mais pertinente et rigolote, les personnages compl√®tement tar√©s, les dialogues bien √©crits et tr√®s dr√¥les, sans oublier les doublages compl√®tement dans le ton. On savait se marrer dans les 90's.

Cette version remasteris√©e est l'occasion parfaite de (re)d√©couvrir un grand classique des Point and Click, avec une prise en main simplifi√©e et des graphismes qui piquent moins les yeux. Je ne peux que conseiller d'y aller. Et j‚Äôesp√®re que vous y trouverez le m√™me plaisir que j‚Äôai pu ressentir, il y a bien longtemps. #Lancien.

(Pour info, il est possible de jouer √† la version compl√®te de Maniac Mansion dans Day of the Tentacle ! √Ä vous de la trouver, c'est pas si bien planqu√©).

review:
Faithful remastering. Obviously it's best enjoyed with lots of nostalgia, but I think it's pretty decent point & click adventure even if you haven't played the original game. Considering the original was released -93, the game design is kind of amazing. 
There are couple annoying, nonsensical puzzles but comparing to other games from this time period, I think the puzzles are mostly well designed and can be solved just by trying stuff out and think a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241192086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1584711972}
review:
Das Original ist ja schon etwas √§lter und das merkt man an vielen Stellen im Spiel auch.
Das macht das Spiel nicht schlechter, es ist nur etwas ungewohnt, wenn man eher Point&Click-Adventures der neueren Zeit gew√∂hnt ist. [spoiler] Z.B. gibt es keine Funktion, die einem alle Hot-Spots in der Szene anzeigt. Des Weiteren verbleiben benutzte Gegenst√§nde, die man nicht mehr ben√∂tigt, trotzdem im Inventar. Ebenfalls eher ungew√∂hnlich und dadurch verwirrend im Vergleich zu Adventures der letzten Jahre. [/spoiler] 
An sich hat mir das Spiel gro√üen Spa√ü gemacht. Der Humor ist sehr speziell, aber auch √§u√üerst kreativ. Die R√§tsel sind nicht unbedingt offensichtlich l√∂sbar und dadurch zum Teil wirklich herausfordernd, aber dennoch logisch in dieser Spielwelt mit zum Teil doch sehr kreativen und humorvollen L√∂sungswegen. 
Besonders cool fand ich, dass man hier drin auch den allerersten Teil, also Maniac Mansion spielen kann (wobei der vom Gameplay noch um einiges anstrengender ist). 
Auf jeden Fall klare Kaufempfehlung. Sehr unterhaltsam und K√∂pfchen braucht man auch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021187376', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1584506546}
review:
I'm not a big fan of adventure games and their illogical puzzles, pixel hunting, and item hoarding. But I've gone back and played a handful of The Classics (most recently Loom and The Dig) and was able to find some entertainment in them. Day of the Tentacle is way worse than all of them and after an hour and a half I could tell it wasn't the game for me.

The humor is fairly juvenile and nothing I saw got even a slight smile from me. The real killer though are the nonsensical puzzles. There's a point early on where you need to collect oil, vinegar, and gold in order to save the world. There are a half-dozen people around to talk to but none of the conversations are about any of those things. There is a "gate" and the only way forward is to find some red paint, paint a kumquat tree red, tell someone that it is actually a cherry tree, then bet him he can't cut it down. What does any of that have to with finding oil, vinegar, or gold? Other than wandering around the entire house, clicking on every single thing, trying every single item combination, and going down every pointless conversation tree...why would you even think that's something you should do?

I did not look forward to several more hours of "puzzles" like that, so I uninstalled.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999450193', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1462682065}
review:
When I was a kid, my uncle bought me a LucasArts game pack. It was an incredible gift with a plethora of games, one of them was this one. It had me fully immersed, attempting to figure out the puzzles this wacky and bizarre game had to offer. I had never played Maniac Mansion, but that didn't prevent me from being fully engrossed in the story and characters. 

I'd spend hours trying to figure out how to progress and there was no guides online, and the game steers away from common sense with it's hilarious and strange puzzles. It was one of the most satisfying feelings eventually figuring out something and I got to experience it multiple times. 

I can't comment on what it would feel like for someone brand new coming in to play this game, as I knew how to do everything from memory. But it's High Definition rendition made me feel nostalgic, to the point where I called my parents to see if they'd kept it in my old stuff. 

10/10 Would have paid double.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205199873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1583277168}
review:
Ein Klassiker unter den Point & Click Spielen und LucasArts in H√∂chstform - Ein muss f√ºr jeden Genre Fan!
Spielzeit lag bei mir bei ca. 9 Stunden.
Die Remastered Version verleiht dem Spiel einen neuen Glanz, so dass man es nach mehr als 25 Jahren erneut spielen kann, ohne Angst den Augenkrebs zu bekommen oder die Maus wegen original Steuerung nach 10 Minuten entnervt gegen die Wand zu werfen. Wer auf Schmerzen steht, kann das Spiel per F1 jederzeit in Original-Modus umschalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561199015756989', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 603, 'last_played': 1582923519}
review:
Six years after Maniac Mansion, LucasArts mustered up all they had learned about making great adventure games, merging witty humor with interesting and fun conundrums.

Time travel really is a valuable feature here, not just some thoughtless addition, since the game mechanics are nicely tied into the overall premise. The puzzles were still quite hard, but very often after finding a solution to a problem, it suddenly all made sense and a feeling of accomplishment took over my sense of pride for a few seconds before realizing the next obstacle was just moments away.

On top of that, the remastered version only made the game more enjoyable and if you‚Äôre ever going to pick up one of the classic adventure games, you should strongly consider Day of the Tentacle.

[b]Rating: 76/100[/b]

[b]Video Review:[/b]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ofav09oHaHk

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1582119507}
review:
In questa remaster del classico Day of Tentacle, ritornate ad impersonare un trio composto dal nerd e unico personaggio proveniente da Maniac Mansion: Bernard. Il nuovo personaggio batterista e metallaro Hoagie e infine dalla studentessa Laverne. Storia: Dopo aver ricevuto una lettera dal pacifista tentacolo verde, che li avverte che tentacolo viola √® diventato pi√π malvagio del solito dopo aver bevuto delle sostanze tossiche. Ha deciso a conquistare il mondo. Il trio in questione parte verso la villa dello scienziato pazzo Fred Edison. Una volta arrivati vanno alla ricerca del suo laboratorio e una volta trovato, Bernard spiega la situazione e lui li invita ad andare indietro nel tempo per la precisione il giorno prima, per spegnere la macchina che produce rifiuti tossici. Peccato che grazie ad un diamante falso utilizzato per far funzionare la macchina del tempo. Spedisce i tre in tempi diversi dello stesso luogo, Hoagie a 200 anni nel passato, Laverne nello stesso lasso di tempo ma in futuro, per finire Bernard √® rimasto nel presente. Ora il trio dovr√† trovare il modo di ritornare nel presente e ritornare il giorno prima trovando anche un vero diamante. Questa remastered √® fatta veramente bene graficamente e anche il nuovo sistema dell'uso dei comandi, fa diventare Scumm veramente obsoleto. Ma non vi preoccupate, se vi mancano quei tempi, potete sempre scegliere di giocare con la grafica originale, ma solo se lo selezionate nelle opzioni. in pi√π con il tasto f1 √® possibile cambiare grafica tra la versione classica e quella rimasterizzata. I punti di forza di questa avventura sono gli stessi dell'uscita originale con scene divertenti, enigmi a volte fuori di testa, tipo quando lavate il carro che puntualmente si mette a piovere. Anche in questa Remaster c'e ovviamente la possibilit√† come nell'originale di giocare a Maniac Mansion, peccato che non hanno voluto usare la nuova interfaccia anche qui. Ma essendo un bonus, non ci si pu√≤ lamentare pi√π di tanto. Le pecche di questo titolo sono poche, per lo pi√π di contorno, tipo che in alcuni casi il parlato finisce mentre i sottotitoli ovviamente in italiano, continuano e vediamo il personaggio continuare a parlare senza dire nulla mentre continuano i sottotitoli. O qualche bug grafico del crono binetto che si trova nel futuro e pochi extra, solo il commento degli sviluppatori e le bozze del gioco. Per finire, se volete rivivere un classico delle avventure grafiche, specialmente se non lo avete mai giocato, questa versione √® quella che fa per voi. Altrimenti lasciate perdere specialmente se non siete amanti delle avventure grafiche.

P.s: E' possibile giocare il titolo con il joypad.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971788120', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1581115735}
review:
This game should not be missing in any serious collection!

DOTT happens to be the first video game I ever played back in 1993 when I was just 9 years old! I remember how fascinated I was about the fact that I was able to interact with the characters for the first time and by doing so proceeding the story step by step. This was a whole new world to me. I also recall myself laughing sitting infront of the screen of my fathers first personal computer that was running on Windows 3.1 with 8MB of RAM and a hard drive with 200MB capacity. Don't get me wrong here, I was not laughing about the system specs, because this system was the bomb back in the days! I was laughing because of how funny and entertaining the story was and how rediculously funny the puzzles where which I was able to solve by giving absurd commands to the characters.

When I saw that the game was remastered I was sceptical at first, because the game was pretty amazing already when it first came out and the visual style is still beautiful until this day. But when I saw how respectful the developers proceeded to preserve the essence of the game by just transforming it to be a little bit more polished without changing the spirit of the game, I had so much fun again today and I got a bit nostalgic when I started to remember some of the combinations one has to find out to proceed in the game. This game is not only beautiful, funny and surprisingly intelligent but very well executed and was way ahead of its time as it is a timeless master piece today! I am looking forward to share this wonderful game with my son some day so he can hopefully have the same experience when he gets old enough to play.

A big THANK YOU to everyone who was involved in the making of the orignal game and all the developers regarding the remake of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067157220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1498872978}
review:
A long time ago, in galaxy far, far away, George Lucas had a game studio.
Which must have had a restraining order or something against him, or something, because otherwise he never would have let them release a game even half this good.
Classically wacky point and click action and a bizarre story come together to make something most developers today can only dream about - a simple, fun game that people can enjoy playing without breaking the bank.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152174860', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1532272912}
review:
Day Of The Tentacle √© um jogo de aventura, lan√ßado pela LucasArts em 93, e √© a continua√ß√£o do jogo Maniac Mansion (de 83). A hist√≥ria do jogo ocorre cinco anos depois do seu antecessor, e come√ßa com o Tent√°culo Roxo tomando esgoto t√≥xico e desenvolvendo v√°rias habilidades e uma vontade insasci√°vel de dominar o mundo. Doutor Fred, o criador do tent√°culo, tenta matar o Roxo e seu irm√£o bom Verde para resolver o problema. Verde pede a ajuda de Bernard Bernoulli e seus amigos Laverne e Hoagie para conter a amea√ßa de seu irm√£o, e salvar a sua pele. Contar mais √© spoiler. 

Uma mec√¢nica interessant√≠ssima desse jogo √© o uso de um banheiro port√°til (chamado Chron-o-John) para as viagens no tempo, ideia do Dr. Fred para combater o Roxo. Pode-se controlar os tr√™s personagens durante o jogo, e v√°rios puzzles dependem disso e da capacidade de se viajar no tempo para serem resolvidos. Fora isso √© um jogo point-and-click normal da LucasArts, com seu humor acertado, gameplay simples e intuitiva, e seu estilo art√≠stico peculiar.

A vers√£o remasterizada, que √© a vendida aqui na Steam, foi totalmente melhorada. Os gr√°ficos foram refeitos a partir das artes originais, a trilha sonora foi revisada, e voc√™ pode mudar para a vers√£o original sempre que quiser.
Com certeza, esse √© um dos melhores jogos de aventura j√° feitos pela LucasArts, e ainda vale a pena ser jogado.

P.S. O jogo Maniac Mansion pode ser jogado em um dos c√¥modos da casa do Doutor Fred, em um computador que parece um Commodore 64.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115199273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1578549597}
review:
Day of the Tentacle; a great traditional point & click adventure with a couple of fun jokes to boot.

This remaster improves on all tech levels whilst still retaining the charm of the original. Great Cartoon Style Graphics, Improved sound quality and overall better quality of life enchancements (e.g. U.I & Character Action Menu).

The story of the game is unaltered with the nice addition of developers commentary. The story is about Purple tentacle drinking radiated slug which gives him enhanced intelligence, arms and desire to rule the world. It's up to Bernard, Laverne & Hoagie to all work together throughout different time periods to prevent Purple from achieving world domination.

I Highly recommend this game to anyone who likes story heavy games, point & click adventures or anything Luca-Arts or Double Fine Studios makes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969527004', 'num_games_owned': 867, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1558989688}
review:
Of all the remasters of older games I've played so far, this one is my favourite. It's a faithful 1:1 remaster where they upgraded everything that needed upgrading, namely the visuals and audio, and the end result is just gorgeous.

What makes it so good is the addition of an old-school mode whereby the original graphics and audio are restored at the touch of a button. Press F1, and boom, I'm back in 1993 again... which my old-school heart really, really appreciated.

And best of all the game itself is just so utterly charming and laugh-out-loud funny, that even jaded modern gamers who may never have played a point & click adventure before will find a lot to love.

Thank you, developers, for such an amazing remaster of one of the nineties' very best adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038981648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1475413518}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061892853', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1578261975}
review:
Ein wirklich sch√∂nes Spiel, war ein netter Nostalgie-Trip zur√ºck in meine Kindheit.
Die moderne Umsetzung ist recht anst√§ndig geworden.

Es steht dem Spieler frei, zwischen Original und Remaster zu wechseln und dabei getrennt die Grafik, den Sound, die Vertonung und die Verb-Steuerung einzustellen. Bei den Verben steht eine Option wie in Monkey Island 3 zur Verf√ºgung, au√üerdem nat√ºrlich die alten, anklickbaren Verben und eine Art "Automatik", mit der ich mich aber nicht besch√§ftigt habe.

Die neue Grafik sieht bei mir in Full HD super aus, aber in einer anderen Rezension erw√§hnte jemand, dass es ab 4K Probleme geben soll. Zum Sound und zur Sprachausgabe kann ich leider nichts sagen, da w√§hlte ich die altmodischen Optionen.
F√ºr neue oder ein wenig √ºberforderte Spieler gibt es offenbar eine M√∂glichkeit, Objekte grafisch hervorheben zu lassen.

Wie auch im Original, ist hier der erste Teil der Maniac Mansion-Reihe im Spiel enthalten und √ºber den Computer im Spiel spielbar.

Bugs: Mir sind nur kleinere Soundbugs aufgefallen. In zwei Situationen wurde die Hintergrundmusik unangenehm laut und √ºberdeckte die Dialoge. Manchmal brechen Charaktere ihre Dialoge ohne ersichtlichen Grund ab, aber das ist mir in der ganzen Zeit vielleicht drei oder vier mal aufgefallen. Kein Beinbruch.
Au√üerdem wurde im Intro ein Satz zu fr√ºh abgespielt und dann an der korrekten Stelle wiederholt. War ein unsch√∂ner Einstieg ins Spiel, aber danach lief alles ganz normal weiter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058860432', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1578256140}
review:
Im Prinzip werden hier alle W√ºnsche erf√ºllt, denn das Spiel l√§sst sich mittels dr√ºcken von "F1" von der Remastered Edition in die klassische Pixel-Version mit original Interface, etc. jederzeit nahtlos umstellen!

Ihr bekommt somit das klassische Spiel und die grafisch √ºberarbeitete Version! Besser geht es nicht...
Im √úbrigen mochte ich erst die "neue" Grafik nicht, aber am Ende dachte ich... Wow, klasse umgesetzt!! Man muss sich daran gew√∂hnen und dann freut man sich, dass dieser Klassiker SO nochmal umgesetzt wurde!

Ich hatte das Spiel damals als Disketten-Version und sp√§ter als CD-Version, welche noch immer im Original-Karton im Schrank steht. :) Demnach hatte ich das Spiel recht schnell durch, weil ich mich einfach an sehr viele Stellen und Abl√§ufe erinnert habe.

Ich empfehle jedem der das Spiel schon kennt, es einfach zu spielen und (falls man ein Achievement-J√§ger ist) es sp√§ter nochmal durchzuspielen. Der zweite Run sollte innerhalb 1-1,5 Stunden erledigt sein (je nachdem ob man im "Minigame" l√§nger braucht). Run 1 und Run 2 haben bei mir zusammen 9 Stunden gedauert.

F√ºr alle die das Spiel nicht kennen, kann ich Day Of The Tentacle voll und ganz empfehlen, wenn man ein Point n Klick bzw. Adventure-Fan ist. Das Spiel gibt sehr viele Hinweise, die einem auch wenn man mal verzeifelt ist absolut weiterhelfen und es nicht n√∂tig ist einen Walkthrough zu lesen!

Nur bitte... als Tipp! Schaut euch die Achievements NICHT an, bevor ihr das Spiel beendet habt - denn diese sind durch die Bilder ein √ºbler Spoiler!! Beendet das Spiel ganz normal und nehmt euch nicht den Spielspa√ü... im Zweifelsfall hilft das Prinzip "verwende alles mit allem" wenn die "Logik" im Kopf mal versagt! ;)

Nach meinen ersten Run hatte ich 7 Achievements offen... habt kein schlechtes Gewissen, wenn ihr diese noch mit dem Guide holt, denn auf 3 St√ºck davon k√∂nnt ihr im Prinzip nicht von alleine kommen! Die anderen 4 St√ºck hab ich einfach verpasst, weil ich gleich "richtig" gedacht hab und somit die falsche L√∂sung nicht angewendet oder diese nicht mehr m√∂glich war. Wie gesagt... ein zweiter Run dauert max. 1,5 Stunden (die trotzdem Spa√ü machen!).

Ansonsten besticht Day Of The Tentacle durch verr√ºckte Grafik, tolle Story, Humor und komplexem L√∂sungsweg (von der Idee her). Eine klare 10 von 10 und absolut sein Geld wert!

Wenn jetzt noch "Sam & Max" als Remastered Edition mit Achievements kommen w√ºrde, w√§r's ein Traum!!

review:
Day of the tentacle ist ein wundervolles Spiel (beachtet meine Spielzeit nicht, da ich eigentlich meine Platin auf der Ps4 schon habe und damals auch die normale Version immer gezockt habe). Ein klassisches click and point adventure, was man von damals noch kennt wie bsp. Monkey island, Maniac, usw.
Wer ein Sprung in die Vergangenheit wagen will, sollte hiermit anfangen. 
Die Musik, als auch der Still ist einfach die pure Zuckerglasur. Kann ich jeden nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450301278', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1577364849}
review: What can I say that has not been said about this game already? I grew up playing this and other Lucasart/Sierra games from that era so they have a special place in my gamer-heart, so trying to be objective might prove hard! Nevertheless this game provides a lot of funny memorable moments that you just dont see in videogames any more, thanks to the style of the developers involved. Its an "easy" game to play, but does require you to think things through, as well as pay a lot of attention to its details, or else you will get stuck wondering around. Still, as long as your on top of your mental game, this game will make you laugh out loud and give you memories for life. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286908061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1575662962}
review: Ce jeu de style "point and click" est la suite de maniac mansion. Ce qui rend le jeu int√©ressant c'est que les objets trouv√©s dans une √©poque peuvent servir dans une autre. De plus, l'humour est toujours aussi pr√©sent.  J'ai appr√©ci√© les petites am√©liorations qui ont √©t√© apport√©es au niveau de l'interface. Toujours un plaisir de jouer et rejouer √† ce grand classique. Thumb up !

review:
[Quote][b]Per altre recensioni segui üëç il nostro [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34310167]Curatore in lingua inglese[/url] e il [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40165899]Curatore in lingua italiana[/url].[/b][/Quote]

Il caro vecchio Day of The Tentacle, gioco che mi riporta alla mia infanzia, ora rifatto con la grafica migliorata.
Divertente come non mai, battute esilaranti e interazioni da morire dal ridere, oltretutto molto facile da platinare, lo consiglio a tutti coloro che vogliono passare qualche ora a divertirsi senza troppe pretese.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986697530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1500816666}
review: It is so easy for an adventure game to go astray, especially one with as complicated of a premise as Day of the Tentacle. DotT takes place in one central location with 3 characters stuck in 3 different periods of history that can exchange inventory items between each other. The fact that this game turned out playable let alone one of the greatest adventures ever made is a miracle. DotT is peak Lucasarts and this remaster gives it the treatment it deserves. Funny, wacky, and filled with clever puzzles that are a joy to figure out.

Dieses Spiel geht mir, seit meinen"jungen Jahren", nicht mehr aus dem Kopf.
Durchgeknallt, schr√§g, schwarzer Humor. Einfach gro√üartig!!!!
Selbst nach all den Jahren dr√ºcke ich immer wieder mal auf "Installieren" und ab geht die verr√ºckte Fahrt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037426359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1575208278}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031135822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1575060252}
review:
Gro√üartig!
Jetzt musste ich 26 Jahre warten bis ich DOTT endlich durch gespielt habe! Das warten hat sich aber gelohnt! Ich hatte eine Menge Spa√ü und konnte zus√§tzlich in alten Erinnerungen schwelgen!
Als das Spiel raus kam war ich  13. Gespielt habe ich es mit meinem √§lteren Bruder. Damals war das ja fast noch ein Kampf mit der Steuerung. Au√üerdem gab es L√∂sungen(shilfen) nicht irgendwo online (wo wir ran kamen). Damals gab es √ºber einen Freund, der einen Freund hat, dessen Bekannter jemanden kennt, der... die... kannte damals jemanden ...  aus irgendeiner Computer-Zeitschrift gerade mal eine Fotokopie mit einer mehr der weniger guten L√∂sungsbeschreibung. So war es bei uns zumindest bei Monkey Island (hab ich damals schon durch bekommen. Aber muss eigentlich auch dringend noch mal sein!). Bei DOTT gab es die L√∂sung bei uns leider nicht. Und ich muss zugeben, ohne Hilfe w√§re ich auf das ein oder andere nicht so schnell gekommen! Trotzdem war ich erstaunt, dass das ein oder andere von damals tats√§chlich h√§ngen geblieben ist.
Klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr alle die solche Spiele noch mit 10 Disketten auf einem DOS-PC gespielt haben und auch f√ºr alle anderen Fans von Point-and-Click Adventures! 
(Aber erst Monkey Island und Indianer Jones durch spielen!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198093227644', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1678555828}
review:
Game's just good ol' nostalgia and glad it's got remaster now, plus you can even play Maniac Mansion while in DOTT. So basically 2 games in one, what an awesome deal and nostalgia flowing. 

But the main problem in remaster that ruins all the joy and nostalgia is the music...
Yep goddamn music dies out whenever feels like it during game and even in idling, wow....
Also sometimes loops some depending on cutscenes, endlessly and that's just goddamn dissapointment. Contacted Double Fine on site and email to fix the problem, but guess there isn't fix and just abandoned game with no new patch to fix goddamn music issue. No music playing = kills the nostalgia mood to continue playing
Another Double Fine mess, end of discussion!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971030586', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1572755421}
review:
I played this as a child, still offline, with no availability to online walkthroughs or guides, it was an utter blast and getting to replay this with renewed graphics and audio felt just as good as it did in my childhood. The remastered version does include the ability to easily switch back to the original graphics and sound, but I can hardly recommend that unless you are a giant pixel enthusiast.  

This version also includes developer commentary, which as far as I recall was not available in the original.

Overall, if you feel like having a laugh at some zaney madness or reliving that zaney madness through vastly improved graphics and audio, then, I highly recommend this game.

420 out of 69.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975748594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1479656557}
review: This game is somewhat hard for me to recommend, although I am not quite sure why. It‚Äôs obviously a classic and beloved by many people. Nostalgia alone can‚Äôt be the secret to its enduring popularity, because I am old enough to have played ‚ÄúDotT‚Äù way back in the day as well. It wasn‚Äôt one of my favorite point-and-click adventures back then either, but given LucasArts‚Äô track record of churning out masterpieces in the 1990s, I wanted to give the remastered version another try. Perhaps the specific kind of humor and the characters just never really resonated with me all that much. It still strikes me as one of the weirder and more eccentric adventure games of that era. But the game undoubtedly does have its moments and the use of time travel makes for some fun interactions and creative plot beats. The remake did a good job of bringing the game back, so I will give it that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025286003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 691, 'last_played': 1565752951}
review: A fun little game, even has manic mansion within the game itself. It's standard adventure game from the 90's. The updated stuff is a good edition.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968699211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 397, 'last_played': 1574658088}
review:
Perfect remaster. If you played it back in the day, its just the way you remember it. And if you're new to it and looking for a good point and click game, this is one of the best.

The main reason I call this remaster perfect, is that you can switch between the remastered version and the original look/sound just by hitting F1. Great to hear the old songs, and see how it used to look, then switching over and seeing the uncompressed greatness.

In the "remastered" mode,  you can hold Shift and see all interactive objects, making it a little easier. Excellent for kids, great for adults. An endless classic for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392780792', 'num_games_owned': 1441, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1569408059}
review:
It was an ok experience for me. Started to get stuck on the puzzles around halfway of the game. Finished it with a guide after that. Some of the achievements are pretty hard to get because they are pretty well hidden and would either require hours of trying or refering to a guide. 

Buy this only if you really love playing old school Point & Click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980065327', 'num_games_owned': 1413, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1568968866}
review:
Step one. Find plans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437708451', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 662, 'last_played': 1597228780}
review:
Este juego es, sinceramente, la mejor aventura gr√°fica de Lucasarts que he jugado en mi vida. Gracias a DoubleFine por remasterizarlo.

Pros:
-Una banda sonora impecable (excepto por una canci√≥n que esta dise√±ada para ser mala)
-Unos gr√°ficos hermosos tanto en el modo cl√°sico como en el remasterizado.
-Unos puzles muy inteligentes y originales.
-Unos di√°logos muy divertidos e ingeniosos.
-Los logros son bastante interesantes y te invitan a conseguirlos todos

Contras:
-Se te puede hacer un poco corto
-Hay objetos que no usas para nada pero te dejan cogerlos igualmente (el tapacubos del futuro)
-El hecho de que tengas que enviarle los objetos que necesites a otro personaje antes de cambiar a este se puede hacer un poco tedioso.

Nota: 89/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198045783578', 'num_games_owned': 1383, 'num_reviews': 409, 'playtime_forever': 808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 808, 'last_played': 1568445841}
review: Yeah this is still a classic and its one of the best remastering of any game I've seen yet.  The modern textures are really well done and the revamped music is the best anyone could hope for.  You still have 90's Lucasart puzzles to deal with and with no hint system still at that.  Your mileage will vary if you can put up with that or not unfortunately, probably best to avoid if this is your first adventure game, but good for veterans.

review:
It's a good remaster of a very old adventure game. It was very memorable for me when I was younger, but these days I suppose I want something with a bit more substance story-wise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123430465', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1562128226}
review:
Not really much to say on this one, beyond the fact that it's a classic point-and-click adventure game, if a bit short.

I could talk about my late Uncle, who introduced me to this game, and how he passed earlier this year. About what a fantastic person he was, and how our family was shook by his sudden passing. How this game reminds me of him, and how much I miss him.

But most people don't want to read about that in a review for a game about an evil time-traveling purple tentacle.

8/10 for it's actual quality.
10/10 for it's sentimental meaning to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091853591', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1566742960}
review: It seems to me this one is for people who have already played the older game. Nostalgia is literally the only thing this game has to offer. I was not familiar with any of this game's history. Given that, I just picked it up because good reviews, but as a few people have already pointed out, if you judge this game by modern standards and ignore the historically roots of this game, you probably won't like it. The voice acting is terrible and the puzzles are just fine.

Do Not play this game if:

author: {'steamid': '76561198030643073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1563330635}
review:
Day of the Tentacle has some of the most personality I've ever seen from a point and click adventure, and while it holds up fantastic to the sparse amount of titles in the genre we see now a days, its puzzles and logic are sloppy at times.

The game starts out with a simple premise: take control of three characters in tandem across the past, present, and future to prevent an evil tentacle monster from taking over the world. None of the characters are particuarely likable, but they, much like the world they inhabit, are all written with large amount of personality. The devil is in the details however, as the writing shines the most with the sheer number of little interactions you can find when attempting to use items or interact between characters. It's a level of polish and thoroughness you just don't see. 

Second to this, the game play is slightly uneven.  This is not to say it is bad, but there were certain times I got lost and it became unclear what I really should be doing. You would miss the smallest interaction or prerequisite action and it didn't really feel fluid. When it works it works though. There are times when your objective is clear and you are pulling your resources across the time lines to solve it, but be prepared to use a guide on occasion and then ask yourself how you were meant to figure that out. 

As an addendum to the game play, the three timelines seems conceptually neat, but it is somewhat overused. A mechanic exists that lets you swap items almost at will. Physically using something like a time capsule to send items to the future and playing around with the actual timeline is criminally underused. There were only 4 times that I counted where you make such interactions, and only one of those felt substantial where it physically changes the world around you. The time travel elements are mostly for story and flavor more so than puzzle solving, which is slightly disapointing. 

The game looks great, with what look to be hand drawn animations for much of what happens. The music is serviceable. I can't say I have strong opinions one way or the other. 

Overall, I think this game is great, but I'm not so sure it rises to a level that I could recommend it to people who aren't fans of the genre. If you generally don't'like these games; stay away. If you do or you haven't played something like this, then I would highly recommend it. 

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198050198462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1345, 'last_played': 1577757964}
review:
[h1] Tag der Entt√§uschung [/h1]

[u] Warum Day of the Tentacle kein zeitloser Klassiker ist [/u]

Es mag am √Ñlterwerden liegen, aber ich ertrage die alberne Story, die absurde Adventure-Logik, die schr√§gen Figuren (von Charakteren kann man nicht sprechen, eher von einer Freak-Show von gewollt auf komisch getrimmten Klischee-Karikaturen), die windschiefe, bonbonbunte Comicgrafik, √ºberhaupt den ganzen, √§u√üerst infantilen Humor des Spiels nicht mehr so gut.

Als Kind/Jugendlicher habe ich die [u] Lucasarts-Adventures [/u] geliebt, habe aber das originale DotT zu seiner Erscheinungszeit nie gespielt. Es kann also sein, dass ich DotT zu unrecht f√ºr etwas kritisiere, was man den Lucasarts-Adventures allgemein zum Vorwurf machen sollte; aber in meiner Erinnerung waren die ersten drei Monkey Islands oder Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade dennoch witziger, h√ºbscher, die R√§tsel wenn nicht logischer, so doch immerhin teilweise interessanter und lustiger, die Figuren und Spielwelt lebendiger und abwechslungsreicher, der Soundtrack vielf√§ltiger, liebevoller und einpr√§gsamer, mit einem Wort: diese Spiele waren einfach besser als DotT.

Dabei kann man Double Fine f√ºr ihre [u] Remastered-Version [/u] kaum einen Vorwurf machen: Ich habe zwar fast ausschlie√ülich die Klassik-Variante gespielt (die auch problemlos funktioniert hat), meine kurzen Eindr√ºcke von Grafik, Sound und Technik der Neuauflage legen aber nahe, dass Double Fine einen ordentlichen bis guten Job gemacht hat, die Bonusmaterialien sind okay, die spielmechanischen Anpassungen und Komfortfunktionen sinnvoll und zeitgem√§√ü. Das Problem ist eindeutig das Original.

Manche [u] Klassiker [/u] spielen sich (wenn auch technisch veraltet) immer noch genauso hervorragend wie zu ihrer Erscheinungszeit, bei anderen l√§sst sich wenigstens erahnen, warum sie fr√ºher einmal als bahnbrechend galten (und wenn es nur die Grafik war) bzw. was sie dem Medium Spiel an Neuem hinzugef√ºgt haben. DotT aber geh√∂rt zu denjenigen Titeln, bei denen man sich heute fragt, wie sie jemals herausragende Wertungen kassieren und zu Klassikern ihres Genres erhoben werden konnten. Sicher, die Unterteilung in drei parallele Handlungs- auf drei unterschiedlichen Zeitebenen (mit entsprechender Interdependenz von R√§tseln und Handlungsoptionen) ist ganz nett, bereichert aber die absurde R√§tsel-Logik letztendlich nur geringf√ºgig und sorgt zudem f√ºr unn√∂tiges, l√§stiges Hin- und Herlaufen, damit man Gegenst√§nde von festen Punkten aus per Klosp√ºlung (ja, auf diesem Niveau bewegt sich der Humor des Spiels fast durchgehend!) in andere Zeitebenen transportieren kann (was sicher einfacher zu l√∂sen gewesen w√§re). Und weil sich das Spiel dadurch auf einen einzigen Handlungsort mit mehreren R√§umen (wenn auch zu unterschiedlichen Zeiten) beschr√§nkt, wirkt es auch noch redundanter und abwechslungs√§rmer, Items dagegen k√∂nnen gleichzeitig in vielen R√§umen ausprobiert werden, die L√∂sungen f√ºr R√§tsel sind weniger offensichtlich und damit insgesamt l√§stiger (nicht herausfordernder).

[u] Fazit: [/u]

Wer DotT fr√ºher schon gespielt und geliebt hat und dieses Erlebnis noch einmal wiederholen m√∂chte, der kann ruhig zum Remastered greifen. Allen anderen rate ich eher dazu, sich unter aktuelleren Titeln umzusehen: mit besseren Geschichten, interessanteren Gameplay-Mechaniken (oder, wenn sie schon kein besseres Gameplay sich ausdenken k√∂nnen, dann immerhin ganz darauf verzichten wie die "Walking Simulatoren" und sich auf ihre eigentlichen St√§rken konzentrieren) oder schlichtweg subtilerem Humor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448984535', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1562871446}
review:
Day of a the Tentacle is a Lucas Arts masterpiece and the remastered edition brings it up to speed to today‚Äôs graphics. While the voice-acting and audio still does feel a little dated, this is still a solid adventure game, even for today‚Äôs standards. Going into this, I was afraid the game‚Äôs puzzles might have the dreaded ‚Äúmoon logic‚Äù issue older adventure games had. I remember struggling with those as a kid. But I‚Äôm glad to say that, for the most part, it avoids this problem.

However, I couldn‚Äôt beat it guide-free unfortunately, as there were still a couple of puzzles I had to use the walkthrough because of the ambiguous nature of the puzzle.

Still, I just had to consult a walkthrough only once during my entire playthrough and that‚Äôs a good thing. The game‚Äôs puzzles are not breezy, mind you. You will still need to use your noggin and they will stretch you but never to the point of frustration if you play close attention. There will be a couple of puzzles here and there that might stump you but don‚Äôt let that deter you from playing this game.

The wacky humour in the game comes from the typical old-school Lucas Arts Monkey Island-esque writing. I loved the cheeky dialogue from the beginning to the end. Laverne‚Äôs section in the future is easily the funniest in the game though all the absurd puzzles are quirky, sure to draw at least a mental chuckle.

If you like adventure games, don‚Äôt skip Day of the Tentacle. It‚Äôs a gem that still is very much worth playing in 2019.

Final verdict: 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984554624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1696017909}
review:
A masterpiece in its time, this game first graced my screen when I was at primary school. Its stuck around in the collective memories of me, my brother and many of our friends and here it is remastered for modern times.
I absolutely loved the original and doublefine have done a stellar job with the update, showing much love for the original material.
If you like the idea of time travelling nerds, mad scientists and mutant megalomaniac tentacles, then this is the game for you.
Unconvinced? Try it, you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824517887', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1562779915}
review:
I've played this game back in the 90s as a kid. Didn't understand a single word of English language and got some pirated version from my dad as purchasing was not possible here back in the days. I really loved the art style and I've played it over and over as I grew up understanding more and more of it. 
It became some kind of a ritual for me to finish this game, as well as Monkey Island 2: LeChuck's Revenge, at least once a year. Now I'm 33, I've played it at least 40 times and I just did it again, but it was my first time to play it as a remaster and I freaking LOVED IT! This here is one of the best games EVER MADE!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971003262', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1688286774}
review:
I have the original on CD somewhere, along with a lot of other Lucasarts classic adventures - Sam n Max hit the road, Monkey island 1 & 2 (though that CD was lent to a friend and he never returned it!), and (although they're not as 'classic' to me) Full Throttle and The Dig. 

I never completed it when I got it, and being pre-ScummVM I had all kinds of problems getting audio to work properly. I ended up giving in on it for a long time (until I discovered ScummVM and tried again). The remaster manages to change just enough to "look better" without changing the art style at all. Nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068332490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1493597629}
review:
Ich habe damals schon das erste Day of the Tentacle gespielt (so mit Drehscheibe als Kopierschutz und Midi-Sound) und damals war es schon Kult. Heute auf modernen PCs und Laptops hat es nichts von seinem Charm verloren. Nat√ºrlich kann es grafisch nicht mit den neuen Highend gerenderten Spielen mithalten, hat aber eine sch√∂nere Comicgrafik als die meisten neuen Spiele die so auf den Markt kommen.

Auch der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist perfekt, nicht zu schwer, aber auch nicht zu einfach. Man muss schon manchmal ein bischen gr√ºbeln. Daf√ºr verzichtet das Spiel auf nervige Laufwege, die die Spielzeit k√ºnstlich erh√∂hen sollen.

Ich kann dieses Spiel nur jedem Adventurefan ans Herz lesen. Ein absolutes MUSS
