author: {'steamid': '76561198046755024', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1562014525}
review:
Having been born in the late 90's and growing up without access to good computers, I had never even heard of this game until youtuber Yogscast Sips started a playthrough of this remaster.

Upon discovery, I wondered where a game like this had been all these years.

To say it is witty is an understatement. The game has such brilliant cartoon zaniness written into it; it really is a shame that the series didn't get a cartoon back in the day. I still find myself reminiscing on my favorite moments and jokes.

Although the puzzles can can be somewhat strange or difficult at times, I still highly recommend this game.

review:
One of the best point-and-click adventures ever, if you liked Thimbleweed Park or played any adventures from the 90's, this is a must have.
- funky art style
- great humor and puzzles
- both classic and remastered versions
- includes the original Maniac Mansion ('use' the computer on Eddie's room)

If you don't like solving puzzles using items and dialogues, you're missing out

It's funny, I love the designs (you can choose the old ones or the remastered one) and the weird look in people's eyes when they hear the title without knowing anything about this game.

GL, HF !

author: {'steamid': '76561198090641945', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1549759733}
review:
All right, this is gonna be the easiest review I've ever done in my whole life.

1) Open your favorite browser
2) Browse with your favorite search engine
3) Type "Best Graphic Adventures of All Time"
4) Hit Enter
5) Navigate through the results.

You will find this title in almost all the lists made by sites of up to a minimum reputation (maybe is not at Tito's Blog).
And besides, this title will be at the top in more than half of them.

So it really doesn't matter what I think of it
it really doesn't matter what you think of it
it really doesn't matter what ppl who gives thumbs down thinks of it

This title was, is, and will be, one of the greatest graphic adventure of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027056885', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1554669826}
review: DOTT is a really classic game - one of the first games I ever played as a kid and was one of my favourite games for a long time. Wen I played it back then, it was on a floppy disk so I was really glad to hear it was being remastered so I could revisit it once more. This game is really quirky with a really original concept, funny writing, great characters. It can be challenging at times to work out how to progress, with 3 different periods of time to work between but I was able to beat it as a kid so It's definitely doable. The remaster is done really well too - I love that they kept the option to play in the original graphics and switch at any time.

review: I never played the original, but of course heard much about it. I can only say: I love it! True enough there are some puzzles that are pretty much impossible to solve if you're not either a Point & Click-veteran and or have endless patience with trying every single interaction on every single object, but there are quite a few guides out there that only give hints. And with one of these I had a great time - the humour and charme still works great after all these years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142696065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1638023046}
review:
‚ÄûDay of the Tentacle Remastered‚Äú, kurz ‚ÄûDotTR‚Äú, ist das Remake des von Lucas Arts entwickelten und 1993 ver√∂ffentlichten ‚ÄûDay of the Tentacle‚Äú. Das Spiel ist ein Adventure-Point & Click-Spiel und das Remake wurde von Double Fine Studios entwickelt und vom gleichnamigen Publisher am 22. M√§rz 2016 zu einem Vollpreis (VP) von 14,99‚Ç¨ ver√∂ffentlicht.

Umfang 
Die Remastered Version beinhaltet die komplette Story von ‚ÄûDotT‚Äú in neuer HD-Grafik, in der man die Welt mit den drei Helden Bernhard, Hoagie und Laverne retten muss, da Purpur Tentakel durch das Abwasser (Matschmaschine) komplett durchgedreht ist. Das wollen sie mithilfe der von Dr. Fred geschaffenen Zeitmaschine so schnell wie es geht tun, wenn da nicht etwas schiefgelaufen w√§re. Hoagie ist 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit, Laverne 200 Jahre in der Zukunft und Bernhard in der Gegenwart ist. Hoagie und Laverne m√ºssen irgendwie zur√ºckgeholt werden, und das ist das mehr oder weniger schwierige R√§tsel, grob zusammengefasst.

Die Story dauert, je nach Spielweise und L√∂sen der R√§tsel, um die 2-7 Stunden. Die R√§tsel sind mehr oder weniger schwierig. Besonders sticht das √úbergeben von Items √ºber das Chron-O-John heraus, was das Spiel um einiges anspruchsvoller macht. 

Es gibt jede Menge Easter Eggs und Anspielungen. Ein besonderes Easter Egg ist das komplett spielbare ‚ÄûManiac Mansion‚Äú, der zeitliche Vorl√§ufer von ‚ÄûDotT‚Äú, den man bei Ed Edison am Computer spielen kann.

Au√üerdem gibt es noch Bonus-Inhalte, wie Entwicklerkommentare und Konzeptzeichnungen, die man ebenso sich anh√∂ren und anschauen kann.

Great point and click game. Love the 90's humour! One issue that I faced was that the left-click didn't work a couple of times when I was playing Hoagie BUT I used the SCROLL WHEEL to complete the actions that were required (so it is still playable). I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS GAME FOR YOUNG CHILDREN because of the theme of animal abuse that is required for some achievements.  

9/10

Um dia ele captura tr√™s pessoas e coloca uma em cada m√°quina e os envia para diferentes √©pocas, um para o futuro, um para o passado e o outro continuou no presente.

O objetivo do jogo √© fazer os tr√™s se encontrarem novamente, mas n√£o pense que por ser um jogo de anima√ß√£o, no estilo Point and Click eu √© f√°cil.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980283507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1559333443}
review: Compared with Full Throttle Remastered, Day of the Tentacle Remastered truly shines. A lot of the tweaks made in Full Throttle did not make a great deal of difference as it was quite well mastered originally. DOTT however really needed the remaster it got. The graphics are far better, the sound is fantastic and nothing is lost in the process the game is perfect to the original. They even left in the Maniac Mansion portion of the game and if I remember rightly the DOS version did not have a save feature for MM, this one does which means 90s nostalgia kids like me who did not play MM can finally link the references between MM and DOTT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111049310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 951, 'last_played': 1561666433}
review:
I loved the fact that this remastered edition retained the aesthetic of the original [spoiler](as opposed to the new version of "The Secret of Monkey Island" for instance)[/spoiler] because that was what made me fall in love with the game back when it came out. 

Now with the hand-drawn art this gem is also easy on the eyes so there is infinite re-playability value (I play it every few years after I half-forget the riddles/puzzles)!

And the sound is amazing too! Sometimes I just let it play in the background and just enjoy the music. But my favorite is Laverne's voice ("Yoohoo! Mr Tentacle guy!") and the cartoony sound effects.

review:
Recuerdo cuando lo jugu√© por primera vez cuando sali√≥ a la venta por el a√±o 1993 o 1994, sus gr√°ficos en ese tiempo s√≠ que se disfrutaban, todo lo que venia del mundo del pc se miraba con asombro, y este juego, al jugarlo, no solo fue eso, si no entretenci√≥n pura junto a los amigos.

Hoy lo encuentro con mejoras gr√°ficas, pero sigue siendo el mismo, tan entretenido como siempre, no pude evitar mostr√°rselos a mis hijos y todos lo jugaron a su manera y lo terminaron, ahora paso a ser un juego no solo a gusto m√≠o, si no de ellos, y s√© que recordaran esto en muchos a√±os m√°s, si me hubieran preguntado cuando lo jugu√© por primera vez que mis hijos lo jugar√≠an despu√©s, no lo habr√≠a cre√≠do :D.

Recomiendo este juego a todos en el grupo familiar, es entretenido, f√°cil de entender, si todav√≠a no lo juegas dale una oportunidad, no solo 5 minutos, si no una media hora y veras que no te despegaras de el despu√©s.

review: I played this game when it first came out.  It always held a special place in my heart.  Me and my cousin were huge maniac mansion fans.  I never knew they remastered it.  SO MUCH FUN!  I don't really recommend it if you didn't play it as a child, but for us old gamers it is a trip down memory lane you need to take.  Only took 3 hours to do the entire game, but it all came back to me pretty quick....

L√†, on a des √©nigmes par couches, un cheminement non lin√©aire, il y a un vrai boulot sur les fausses pistes et si on r√©fl√©chit bien, on finit par trouver la solution √† un moment ou √† un autre. Enfin, l'histoire et les personnage sont d√©biles √† souhait et on rit tr√®s souvent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046685379', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1555016027}
review:
This one is for the ages. If you've been in PC gaming (or gaming in geneal) for as long as me you'll know the swet nostalgia pixel art brings forth. Back when times were simpler, games were longer and required some creative thinking.

When I die i want a list of all the gems I've played engraved on my tombstone. This is one of them. It's going to stay im my Steam library forever. One day the kids of my kids are going to play it and say: Who tought of this BS?! I won't care. I'll be dead with a smile on my face :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198072398496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1560095555}
review: Excellent game all-around. The puzzles can be quite challenging at times, but most of the time they are quite fair. That being said, a few puzzles seem unfair either because they are dated or because its solution may not seem logical at first. I did have to resort to looking for the answer to a few puzzles online, but I must say that if you play this game without any help it will be much more enjoyable. The characters and humor are spot on and I found myself laughing so hard my chest hurt. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who loves puzzle games or the wacky humor of LucasArts games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970898141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 184, 'last_played': 1555293913}
review: Having played this game about 1,000 times from when it first released to now because my father worked at a software store that gifted him copies of random DOS/Windows 95 era games, to growing up and buying the PS4 remastered edition, to going back and buying the same exact thing but on Steam recently just because I finally have a functional computer again and I cannot recommend this game enough. I might be a little bias with it being one of my earliest roots, but the storytelling is a perfect balance of well-written and hilarious humor combined with very clever puzzles. It's one of the few games where I've memorized every last pixel and to this day and as of being 30 years old now writing a review, it is still in my top 5 games of all time. This remastered edition is everything I had ever hoped for, and quite possibly one of the best remasters ever made. Beautiful hand-drawn imagery, a commentary, achievements, trading cards, etc. Just a friggin' blast to play let alone it has a full version of Maniac Mansion (also amazing) within the game. Worth every penny and then some.

author: {'steamid': '76561198809516436', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1304, 'last_played': 1654810158}
review: I finally played this game after 26 years of trying. I first tried to play it c. 1993 on my uncle's PC but it kept crashing, then I bought it around 2004, but my PC had Windows XP and wouldn't run it. And finally, after remembering it existed, I searched the Steam store and found this beautifully remastered edition. After all this time, I wasn't disappointed. I loved it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198186339670', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 810, 'last_played': 1553929822}
review:
I had never finished a point-and-click before tackling DOTT, I always found the puzzles too obscure and gameplay boring, but a friend recommended this game, so I gave it a shot. 

Holy cow is this a complete package. The writing is funny. The puzzles actually make sense (!!!!!) and are fun to solve. The style and graphics are gloriously cartoony. The remastering done by Double Fine is excellent, the new graphics really run with the goof-factor and some much-needed quality of life improvements were added.

I would really recommend this to everyone. Even if point-and-clicks never tickled your fancy, give this one a go, you will be pleasantly surprised. I would even recommend going full completionist of the achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140589637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 1108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1632222185}
review:
[Rating: 8/10]
Now *this* is the way you remaster a game! A very entertaining point-and-click adventure that captures the charm of the original with fully updated graphics, audio and interface.

[Pros]
+ Good quality visuals.
+ Good voice acting and humorous script.
+ Clever and consistently challenging puzzles.
+ Good use of the time-travel mechanic.
+ Includes a playable version of the original Maniac Mansion!

[Cons]
- No fast travel, so traversing the map can be tedious at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999636217', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1548327834}
review:
Day of the Tentacle es una aventura gr√°fica cl√°sica (point and click).

Se trata de un juegazo entretenido, ingenioso, divertido... que adem√°s ha sido perfectamente remasterizado, con gr√°ficos y sonido actualizados. Para gozo de los nost√°lgicos, tambi√©n podemos cambiar a "modo retro" y ver el juego como el original, con p√≠xeles como garbanzos y el men√∫ de opciones en la parte inferior de la ventana. 

Bajo mi punto de vista es una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas a las que he jugado, todo el mundo deber√≠a jugar alguna vez en su vida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195092609', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1552756605}
review:
[code]Dieses Review wurde im Rahmen des TDR-Game-Review-Marathons geschrieben. Zwei Gewinner des Gewinnspiels d√ºrfen sich eines der im M√§rz reviewten Spiele aussuchen. Mehr dazu zu findet ihr [url=https://tdr-gaming.de/board/index.php?thread/557-game-review-marathon-gewinnspiel/] HIER [/url] [/code]

‚ÄûDay of the Tentacle Remastered‚Äú, kurz ‚ÄûDotTR‚Äú, ist das Remake des von LucasArts entwickelten und 1993 ver√∂ffentlichten ‚ÄûDay of the Tentacle‚Äú. Das Spiel ist ein Adventure-Point & Click-Spiel und das Remake wurde von Double Fine Studios entwickelt und vom gleichnamigen Publisher am 22. M√§rz 2016 zu einem Vollpreis (VP) von 14,99‚Ç¨ ver√∂ffentlicht.

[b] Umfang [/b]
Die Remastered Version beinhaltet die komplette Story von ‚ÄûDotT‚Äú in neuer HD-Grafik, in der man die Welt mit den drei Helden Bernhard, Hoagie und Laverne retten muss, da Purpur Tentakel durch das Abwasser (Matschmaschine) komplett durchgedreht ist. Das wollen sie mithilfe der von Dr. Fred geschaffenen Zeitmaschine so schnell wie es geht tun, wenn da nicht etwas schiefgelaufen w√§re. Hoagie ist 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit, Laverne 200 Jahre in der Zukunft und Bernhard in der Gegenwart ist. Hoagie und Laverne m√ºssen irgendwie zur√ºckgeholt werden, und das ist das mehr oder weniger schwierige R√§tsel, grob zusammengefasst.

Die Story dauert, je nach Spielweise und L√∂sen der R√§tsel, um die 2-7 Stunden. Die R√§tsel sind mehr oder weniger schwierig. Besonders sticht das √úbergeben von Items √ºber das Chron-O-John heraus, was das Spiel um einiges anspruchsvoller macht. 

Es gibt jede Menge Easter Eggs und Anspielungen. Ein besonderes Easter Egg ist das komplett spielbare ‚ÄûManiac Mansion‚Äú, der zeitliche Vorl√§ufer von ‚ÄûDotT‚Äú, den man bei Ed Edison am Computer spielen kann.

Au√üerdem gibt es noch Bonus-Inhalte, wie Entwicklerkommentare und Konzeptzeichnungen, die man ebenso sich anh√∂ren und anschauen kann.

[b] Grafik [/b]
Die HD-Grafik unterscheidet sich nicht gro√ü zu der Alten von 1993, au√üer, dass eben die Texturen nun HD-Texturen besitzen, was aber meiner Meinung nach den Charme der alten Version beibeh√§lt. Die Animationen hingegen wurden nicht gro√ü aufgefrischt, sie sehen dennoch sehr gut aus.

Ich pers√∂nlich bin ein gro√üer Freund der selbstgezeichneten Grafikelemente und Charaktere, fand aber, dass es teilweise schon zu √ºberdreht war. Das ‚Äû√ºberdreht‚Äú ist im Sinne von zu rund gemeint.

Wer aber genau das nicht mag, kann auch den klassischen Grafikstil ausw√§hlen, was ich sehr sch√∂n finde.

[b] Spielspa√ü [/b]
Die ausgefallenen Dialoge mit s√§mtlichen Anspielungen und Easter Eggs bieten in Kombination mit den schweren R√§tseln sehr viel Spa√ü. Schwierig wird es nur, wenn man auf die vorhandene Spielhilfe angewiesen ist, weil das R√§tsel zu schwierig ist, aber die ‚ÄûHilfe‚Äú total am Ziel vorbeif√ºhrt. Somit sind sie teilweise unn√∂tig und muss auf eine Komplettl√∂sung zur√ºckgreifen.

Besonders stechen aber die zeitlichen Paradox heraus, weil sich die Handlungen in der Vergangenheit bei Hoagie, sich auf die Zukunft bei Laverne und die Gegenwart bei Bernhard auswirken.

[b] Musik [/b]
Jeder kennt ihn, jeder will ihn: den legend√§ren ‚ÄûDotT‚Äú-Soundtrack. Die Musik passt einfach wunderbar und ich denke, dass ich dazu auch nicht mehr sagen muss.

[b] Sound [/b]
Jeder Charakter hat eine unverkennbare Stimme, und das macht ‚ÄûDotT‚Äú einfach aus. Was ich aber bem√§ngeln muss, ist die Sprachausgabe f√ºr die deutsche Version, die verh√§ltnism√§√üig zu modernen P&C-Spielen eher m√§√üig ist.

Daf√ºr sind aber die Soundeffekte wunderbar gew√§hlt und verbessern die Atmosph√§re.

[b] Preis-Leistung [/b]
F√ºr 14,99‚Ç¨ erh√§lt man die klassische Version von ‚ÄûDotT‚Äú mit Remake und ‚ÄûManiac Mansion‚Äú als Easteregg. Daf√ºr ist die Spieldauer recht kurz f√ºr den Preis, weshalb ein Preis von um die 10‚Ç¨ angemessener w√§re.

[b] Fazit [/b]
Ein P&C-Klassiker, den jeder schon einmal gespielt haben sollte!

[b] Kurzfassung [/b]
Umfang: 9/10
Grafik: 8,5/10
Spielspa√ü: 9/10
Musik: 10/10
Sound: 8/10
Preis-Leistung: 7/10

Endwertung: 84/100

author: {'steamid': '76561198405901859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1608069162}
review:
The past
This was the first video/computer game I ever played. I remember booting up the olde Micron back in the 90's and enjoying every glorious  campy minute of the game, although I never was able to finish it as a kid-I just enjoyed the story and the voice acting. This shaped my very twisted sense of humor.

Fast forward to the present
I stumbled upon this game and knew I must purchase and finish the game I started. This was every bit as enjoyable as an adult as it was as kid. The puzzles are fantastic with that delightful twisted humor (i only had to cheat to look up one puzzle since it made no sense at all, stupid rain...). The voice acting and style hold up. This is a true masterpiece of the genre. Highly recommended.

The future
Will you play this game? You should.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366990274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1530033905}
review:
A whimsical classic point and click adventure with updated graphics.

Pros:
-challenging puzzles that are satisfying to solve
-the art style of the remastered graphics and gameplay make it feel like you're playing through a cartoon
-the time travel aspect leads to interesting solutions to puzzles
-interesting characters and story

Cons
-the puzzles can be difficult or convoluted at times

Point and clicks are a bit of a niche genre but if they're your thing, I highly recomend this one.

review:
One of the great classics of point-and-click games and in the remastered version also really easy on the eye with the graphics - than the retro version.
The game is full of small jokes and has a good portion of black humor. It is not that hard to understand and solve and gives a good amount of hints - otherwise the community or even all the lets-plays can help.
All in all a good game that gives you a fair share of laughs, riddles and surprises.

review: Played this so much as a kid that I could complete it on auto pilot and still adore it. Other than Curse of Monkey Island this is the best looking of all the Lucasarts adventure games - even before the remaster. It's probably the funniest of them aside from Sam & Max. Best story out of them all. Great characters enlivened by great voice acting. Stone cold classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082228987', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1572723836}
review:
Probably one of the best investigative/puzzle solving games i've ever played. It's filled with refrences and fun little objects and interactions.
Altough this game is preeetty good, i feel like its a game you play in one go or over the course of a few consecutive sessions, my experience with the game is its very confusing since i played it over a longer period of time so if you do it like me taking massive breaks in between sessions you wont really know where to go in game and you will feel lost

i give it an overall 7/10.
since its filled with many puzzle's to solve but in time becomes very much the same and you need to play it in one go

author: {'steamid': '76561198061314668', 'num_games_owned': 1279, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1506019144}
review:
El D√≠a del Tent√°culo fue de las primeras aventuras gr√°ficas que jugu√© y la que con un simple disquette me hizo enamorarme del arte de LucasArts.
Desde entonces, la rom ha ido conmigo de ordenador en ordenador hasta que comenc√© a tener problemas de compatibilidad y... ¬°Tach√°n! Day of the Tentacle Remastered :)

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Si te gustan las aventuras gr√°ficas, este juego cumple toooodas las caracter√≠sticas de una buena aventura gr√°fica.
- Puedes alternar entre los gr√°ficos antiguos y los remasterizados con un simple bot√≥n, 10/10 para nost√°lgicos.
- Puedes activar los comentarios de los desarrolladores durante el juego.
- En el men√∫, hay un apartado que contiene bocetos durante la creaci√≥n del juego que es genial.
- Igual que en la versi√≥n original, puedes jugar al Maniac Mansion en un ordenador dentro del propio juego (aunque este sin remasterizar)... 2 aventuras en 1 :D
- Tiene sistema de logros, lo cual hace que cuando te lo has pasado una primera vez te pique el gusanillo de ver qu√© has podido olvidar probar para tener el 100%.

Y √∫ltimo PRO y m√°s importante... ABSURDEZ. LucasArts se caracteriza por hacer aventuras gr√°ficas en las que se combina a la perfecci√≥n lo absurdo con lo obvio, plante√°ndote ese tipo de cosas que hacen que cuando las descubres te des un golpe en la frente y digas '¬°Aaanda, pues claro!'

[h1]Contra:[/h1]
- No soy partidiaria de que la industria del videojuego lleve desde hace unos a√±os (acentu√°ndose este 2018) bas√°ndose en remasterizar o relanzar juegos antiguos, con lo cual ser√≠a la √∫nica pega que sacar√≠a a esta versi√≥n Remastered... Aunque es cierto que han a√±adido much√≠simo contenido y han hecho un buen√≠simo trabajo logrando que mucha gente que en su d√≠a se lo perdi√≥ pueda apreciar un juego de este calibre.


Recomendado 10/10 al precio completo. Ya si lo encuentras rebajado sea el porcentaje que sea, ni lo dudes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202516767', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1558804075}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is a sequel to one of the first games of the long-forgotten genre of point-and-clickers. Compared to Maniac Mansion, this game is more linear on how you do things, though that doesn't take away the fact that it's quite filled with unique and creative moments that'll leave you enjoying every single moment it has to offer rather than wanting to skip every cutscene. The only thing that I would say is crappy about this game is that there's moments in which you can get stuck for hours trying to guess what the heck you're supposed to do to advance to the next moment; though that's something that most Point-and-Clickers have. and once you finally find out what you're supposed to do, you really end up feeling proud of yourself. Overall, I'd say you should give it a show once you get the chance. 
 
Oh, and as a little bonus; you can play the original Maniac Mansion within the game, so you pretty much get two games in one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025704994', 'num_games_owned': 2343, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1545704484}
review: The original game was amazing, and this was the best remaster one could wish to have (and you can even play it with original graphics and enable developer commentary). The graphics look amazing and you can run it even on a very old computer (I rain it on an 8-year old laptop but a modern monitor). Two thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017977574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 524, 'last_played': 1546079975}
review:
E' incredibile, ma dopo tanti anni questo gioco mi ha riproposto le stesse atmosfere e intuizioni del tempo. Il rifacimento grafico e di interfaccia non snaturano il gioco ma lo impreziosiscono. La storia articolata e accattivante regge tutt'ora e l'aggiunta dei numerosi achievements nascosti offrono un grado di sfida in pi√π per chi ha giocato il titolo decenni fa.
Se amavate le vecchie avventure grafiche della lucasarts non potete fare a mano di giocarlo o rigiocarlo. Inoltre il commento degli autori aggiungono particolari per veri maniaci.
Non ho provato a giocare a Maniac Mansion contenuto nel pc al terzo piano, un gioco d'altri tempi, con difficolt√† d'altri tempi, sicuramente per i fans pi√π accaniti.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972427734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1545085256}
review:
By far the weakest of the "classic" adventure games, it's plagued by the worst examples of "moon logic" I've ever seen, and an overwhelming inventory of crap to mess around with just makes it a frustrating, boring and tedious experience. I'd only bother with this game if you're a serious fan of the genre, and only then if you've already played Monkey Island 1&2, Grim Fandango and all of the Deponia games.

If you've just finished Monkey Island and want more, go play Deponia and its sequels: the games are hilarious and far more interesting than this.

review: Das Spiel ist ein absoluter Klassiker. Dank des Remake hat es ein Grafikupdate bekommen das man auf Wunsch auch deaktivieren kann. F√ºr Fans von Point and Click Spielen ein absolutes Muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972542072', 'num_games_owned': 963, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1517786567}
review:
When you're as old as I am, you sometime see games and think "ooh... I remember hearing about that, its cheap, I'll give it a go."

then you play it and its ok, but you wonder what all the fuss was about. Ok, so it was probably innovative, but that doesn't mean its still valid now. I'd say that if you're nostalgic for this game and want to play it again, then ok. Otherwise, I'd leave it to the old people to reminisce about and find something more interesting to do. 

The game itself is a point and click that includes all that I hate about point and click adventures (so I should probably stop picking them up... I never learn) which is that while 30% of the puzzles are understandable, 70% are just plain stupid, random and supposedly funny. If you're impatient like me, you end up getting a guide to follow, and go "uhhh... I'd never have thought of that." But it gets old quickly. I don't think I even bothered playing this to the end.   The only benefit you get nowerdays is that atleast they show you what you can interact with on the screen, rather than clicking on every pixel hoping it does something.

You'd have more fun watching a season of cartoons on Netflix, to be honest. If you enjoy utter confusion go with it.

I think I might have got this in a bundle, so not exactly free, but I... ugh I don't remember where I got this. 
Who cares anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058186682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1518457157}

author: {'steamid': '76561198401249251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1043, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1620526832}
review:
Meiner Meinung nach der H√∂hepunkt der klassischen LucasArts-Adventure (die ich allesamt empfehlen kann!). Die Story ist (beinahe) zeitlos (haha) und die Remastered Version bringt das Game technisch ins 21. Jahrhundert.
Ein Muss f√ºr alle, die sich auch nur ansatzweise f√ºr Adventures interessieren!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461537', 'num_games_owned': 2391, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1608663253}
review:
Lucas Arts was known back in the day for making good adventure games, and this was one of their best. And while the original still holds up fairly well today this release is a great example of how to remaster a game perfectly - beautiful and modern but still completely faithful to the original.

The game is a humour-dense adventure about time travel in which you concurrently play as 3 friends trapped in 3 different time periods - the 18th century, with the founding father deciding how to establish their new country, the early 90's "today", where it's just slightly too late to stop a mutated evil genius tentacle from overthrowing the world, and the 22nd century future where humans are nothing more than pets for their tentacle overlords - who need to find a way to get back to yesterday so that they can stop the tentacle from mutating into an evil genius in the first place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1582937838}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is an absolute gem for anyone who loves classic adventure games. This remastered version of the 1993 LucasArts game retains all of the charm and humor of the original while updating the graphics and interface to modern standards.

The game tells the story of three friends who are suddenly transported through time in an effort to prevent a power-hungry tentacle from taking over the world. The comedic writing is top-notch, with plenty of memorable characters and situations that will have you laughing out loud. The voice acting is also excellent, with each character brought to life by a talented cast.

But it's not just the writing and humor that make Day of the Tentacle so great. The puzzles are challenging but fair, requiring you to think creatively and use objects in unexpected ways. Each character has their own unique abilities that you'll need to utilize in order to progress, which keeps things interesting and varied.

Of course, the remastered graphics are a major improvement over the original, with crisp, colorful visuals that do justice to the game's zany world. The updated interface is also a welcome addition, making it easier to navigate the game and interact with objects.

But what really sets Day of the Tentacle Remastered apart is its attention to detail and respect for the original game. You can switch back and forth between the remastered and original graphics at any time, and the developers have included concept art, developer commentary, and other bonus features that give you a behind-the-scenes look at the game's creation.

Overall, Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a masterpiece of a game that any fan of classic adventure games should play. It's funny, challenging, and full of heart, with a level of polish and care that is all too rare in modern games. If you're looking for a game that will make you laugh and think, look no further than Day of the Tentacle Remastered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198231262176', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1538316695}
review:
This is like a travel back to childhood again as I loved the game when I played it as a kid with my brother. It didn't loose any of its previous charm it held when i was a child, so I feel very nostalgic about it.

Even today it's easily up to par with other point & click games, it's fully voiced with fun dialogues/monologues and great humor, quirky/nerdy but lovable characters and lots of things to interact with.

Overall this is one of the most fun point & click games I played growing up in the era when this sort of games were first introduced.

review:
Dieses Spiel habe ich fr√ºher im Original (also die nicht Remastered-Version) so oft gespielt.
Es war einfach sch√∂n mit (fast)allen Gegenst√§nden auf verschiedener Art und Weise zu interagieren, und genau das ist in der Remastered Version ein negativ Punkt f√ºr mich. 

Wo sind all diese Interaktionen?
Wieso kann ich beispielsweise nicht mehr mit T√ºren reden? (Ist doch egal ob es Sinn macht oder nicht, f√ºr mich z√§hlt einfach die m√∂glichkeit dies machen zu k√∂nnen und herrauszufinden ob sich vielleicht etwas lustiges dahinter verbirgt.)

Ich mag die Remastered Version fast genauso wie das Original von damals aber ich muss sagen, all die Interaktions m√∂glichkeiten die einem geboten wurden wo man selber noch herrausfinden konnte was man alles mit dem aktuellen Gegenstand machen konnte, fehlen mir einfach.

W√§re diese Option wieder gegeben w√ºrde das Spiel wieder Perfekt sein.
Ich empfehle es nat√ºrlich trotzdem weil die Story dahinter und vor allem der Humor supi ist.

review: You can just tell from watching the intro how well pollished this rematser is.  A timeless claassic that will enthrall anyone who has a sense of humor and can think creatively.  Over my life i have played thousands of computer games.  And this easily fits into my top 10 of all time.  A masterpiece in story telling, design and execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031781241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1642424726}
review:
Day of the Tentacle (DotT) is a timeless classic old school LucasArts game. Another classic to check out is Full Throttle. DotT is a point and click story full of fantastic art work, fun characters and humourous story. 

An eccentric scientist/inventor engineers a pair of tentacle creatures as laboratory helpers. One of them drinks some waste sludge from the laboratory and mutates a pair of arms. With his new appendages he successfully takes over the world in the future. Three hapless roommates help save the world by travelling through time to stop the tentacle overlord but the time machines malfunction. One is sent to the ye old past, one the distant future and one is stuck in the present. The three work together to foil the tentacle menace and avert a tentacle takeover.

Collect random items in each timeline and figure out how to use them to advance the story. Like I said, the artwork is fantastic, the characters are amusing and there is plenty of humour throughout the game. Just a fun story game.

Also includes the original pixel side-scroller Maniac Mansion as an in game Easter egg.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998597672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1541640698}

review: Just... a visual feast of cartoon style. A sincere vertical slice of the 90s. The actual puzzles are a bit bonkers at times, so don't feel guilty alt-tabbing to a walkthrough at every step of the way; you'll have just as much fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046729068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1541805147}
review:
Overall, I think the game was good. Though, I don't have the patience and peace of mind to resist searching up a guide. The story is engaging and the characters are like old cartoon characters. Their odd personalities make them human and comical at times. 

Personally I liked this game, because it was nostalgic in as way. It's sort of old art style and point-and-click feel. However, how to accomplish the goal in the game is not clear and is very open ended. Instead of some point-and-click games where you have a small environment and a tightly grouped sequence, so you'll eventually keep moving on after 20 - 30 minutes. This game presents you with a near infinite array of options, while some might be obvious and clear. Other decisions are not and this can trap you on the same/multiple problems at a time. Going in to the game, it's important to remember a few things if you want to play the game and not search up a guide. 

[olist]
[*] Shift in all rooms - This is a key that highlights all interactable elements and is very usefull
[*] check everything and always exhaust all the options - This might be tedious, but for those new to the game like me. I struggled with missing over maybe some blatant options. 
[*] Have patience - I love the story of the game, but it might have went too slowly for me. If you want to not use a guide, then you should probably have a few hours on your hand to just struggle through.
[*] ALWAYS TALK TO THE MUMMY - This may or may not be good advice, but the mummy is sort of like a hidden hint box the developers put into the game. Though, they also serve other purposes and are insignificant to the general story. They sometimes can help you figure out how to progress.
[olist]

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1540853107}
review:
Das Spiel ist sehr gut.

Es ist die aufwendig √ºberarbeitete Version eines Point-&-Click-Klassikers aus dem Jahr 1993, die aber nicht nur f√ºr Nostalgiker interessant ist. Ich kannte das Originalspiel nicht und f√ºhlte mich doch gut unterhalten.

Der verr√ºckte Wissensschaftler Dr. Fred Edison hat zwei Tentakel (so eine Art lebende Gummih√ºte) erschaffen, eines gr√ºn, eines purpur. Letzteres strebt nach einem kleinen "Ungl√ºck" nun nach der Weltherrschaft. Edison fesselt beide; der gr√ºne bittet nun seine Freunde um Hilfe.

Diese Freunde sind Bernard (Physiker), Hoagie (Heavy-Meatal-Roadie) und Laverne (Medizinstudentin). Doch Bernard befreit auch das purpurne Tentakel, welches weiterhin ja  die Menschheit unterwerfen will. Das muss verhindert werden.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1551934259

Durch eine weitere Panne mit Dr. Fred's Zeitmaschine ger√§t Hoagie 200 Jahre in die Vergangenheit (USA z.Zt. der Verfassungsv√§ter), Lavern 200 Jahre in die Zukunft (Tentakel beherrschen die Welt). Alle befinden sich in einer Variante derselben Umgebung in und um dieser Mansion.

Das Spiel ist sehr frei spielbar, d.h. man kann jederzeit zwischen den drei spielbaren Charakteren (Bernard, Hoagie, Laverne) wechseln und alle R√§umlichkeiten (fast) immer erreichen. Die Struktur in der Geschichte entsteht dadurch, dass durch geeignete Handlungsabl√§ufe sich neue M√∂glichkeiten und Objekte ergeben. Das ist geradezu genial gemacht, d.h. es ist immer einsichtig, warum was wohl wie gemacht werden sollte. Minispiele gibt es keine.

Besonderen Reiz bietet der (notwendige) Austausch von Objekten (meist, aber nicht nur per Zeitmaschine) unter den drei Akteuren. Interessant ist auch, dass es manchmal mehrere m√∂gliche Handlungsabl√§ufe gibt, die letzlich zwar aufs gleiche hinauslaufen, aber bewirken k√∂nnen, dass gewisse Dinge eher f√ºh oder eher sp√§t erledigt werden m√ºssen.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1551936020

Das Gameplay des Spieles, nun in der Remastered Version auf modernen Stand gehievt, ist auch heute noch beeindruckend clever. Nur selten musste ich wirklich ins pure Raten verfallen (was dann meist eher meine Schuld war) und nur einmal fand ich es etwas gemein (aber clever).

Das originale Day of the Tentacle, in das man jederzeit per Tastendruck umschalten kann, ist die Fortsetzung von Maniac Mansion. Dieses Spiel kann man an einem im Spiel vorkommenden Computer selbst noch einmal (in orginaler Form) spielen.

Das habe ich aber gelassen, denn die Steuerung ist (nach heutigen Ma√üst√§ben) bei beiden Spielen veraltet. Dennoch sehr interessant, dass es diesen Einblick erm√∂glicht.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1551934708

Die Grafik (der Remastered Version) ist gut. Die Figuren und Hintergr√ºnde wurden alle neue gezeichnet. Sie sind immer noch im Comicstil und gut animiert. Der Stil ist einer, bei der es keine rechten Winkel gibt, was alles etwas surreal wirken l√§sst. Der Aufwand, weil doch alles unmittelbar in die originale Version umschaltbar ist, muss enorm gewesen sein.

Der Sound wurde auch komplett neu geschaffen. Ganz toll ist, dass die Sprecher auch auf Deutsch sind.

Die Steuerung ist gr√∂√ütenteils gut und einfach. Meist braucht man nur eine Maus. Statt mit Verben und Objekten Handlungsanweisungen zusammensetzen zu m√ºssen (Original), kann man nunObjekte anklicken und es √∂ffnet sich ein Kontextmen√º mit den Handlungsoptionen.

Worauf ich Dummerchen erst sp√§t gekommen bin (ein Tipp w√§re hilfreich gewesen) ist, dass man Objekte direkt im Men√º √ºbergeben kann und sie nicht erst explizit in die Zeitmaschine legen muss, was die Sache ja tats√§chlich sehr beschleunigt.

Einzig negativ war (bei der Steuerung), dass Bereiche in der stark rechten Bildschirmh√§lfte (ca. 20%) (auch im Men√º) manchmal nicht mehr korrekt mit der Maus ansteuerbar waren. Mit etwas hin und her ging es dann meistens irgendwie. Manchmal schien mir, es l√§ge auch an der Position der handelnden Figur, bin mir aber nicht sicher.

Es gibt sehr viele Errungenschaften, von denen einige nur durch besondere Handlungen (Scherze u.√§.) freigeschaltet werden, was zu einem erneuten Durchspielen und Entdecken anregt.

Pro & Contra:

+ Sehr gutes Gameplay
+ Aufwendiges Remastering
+ Sprecher auch auf Deutsch

- Der direkte Austausch zwischen den Personen im Men√º ist nicht erkl√§rt
- Mauszeiger funktioniert nicht immer korrekt

Wertung: 10/10

Das Spiel hat mich wirklich positiv √ºberrascht. Egal ob man nostalgische Erinnerungen hat oder nicht, kann diese runderneuerte Version wohl fast jeden P&C-Fan begeistern.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142054178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1540505291}
review: This is a classic in its genre, and deservedly so. The only thing I don't like about it is that you constantlty have to go back to the toilets in order to share items between characters: it makes puzzles unnecessarily tedious and time-consuming, as you're trying to figure out which item should be used in which time period. If the characters had shared inventory at all times, this game would be perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093299328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1539982785}
review:
This classic point-and-click game by Tim Schafer along with other talented people is considered to be one of the best point-and-click games ever made by many game journalists and other related media. It can be quite challenging at times, in the traditional Lucas Arts-fashion. 

This remaster is made in a very accurately. It doesn't add much, but rather refines already existing graphics to be more clear. I don't think that there is anything else to wish from this kind of product, really.

The game was fun and charming with clever puzzles, and it is no wonder why it is a classic. I wouldn't necessarily put it on top of the Grim Fandango or Longest Journey or many others of my favorite point-and-clicks on my personal list, but it is still very recommendable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088271559', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1539327553}
review:
A fun and historic point and click adventure game featuring some pretty quirky characters and A LOT of out of the box thinking to solve the puzzles. The game itself has fairly slow pacing in which you have to use just about everything at your disposal including dimes you pick up off the ground, context clues, and just about ever action available to you in order to solve environmental puzzles such as convincing george washington to chop down a cherry tree.

It features an exceptionally interesting mechanic involving time travel in which three characters get placed at separate points in time and you have to pass some of the items you pick up in the game to other characters through the time travel device. This game will really test your out of the box thinking and if you do play it, I'd highly recommend trying to solve each and every puzzle on your own before looking at a guide. Because some of the solutions are just absurdly funny and when you use the guide to figure it out, it takes a lot away from the satisfaction of watching the goofy and unique characters utilize their environment in the wackiest of ways.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040037265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 469, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1522289751}
review:
[code]Puedes ver m√°s rese√±as como esta en la mentor√≠a [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34129733/][u]PIXEL 404[/u][/url][/code]

[h1]Esta rese√±a no contiene spoilers[/h1]

Ser√≠a bastante complicado decidir cu√°l aventura gr√°fica de corte c√≥mico ocupa el primer puesto a la mejor de todas. En principio hay tres t√≠tulos que pueden luchar por este puesto: The Secret of Monkey Island, Monkey 2: Le Chuck's Revenge y este Day of the Tentacle.

Si le preguntas a la gente, cada cual tendr√° su opini√≥n propia sobre cu√°l le gusta m√°s de estas tres, pero una cosa es segura: todos te dir√°n que las tres se encuentran en el top.

No es de extra√±ar, por tanto, que Double Fine hiciera finalmente un remaster de este juego despu√©s de hacer lo propio con los dos primeros de la saga Monkey Island.

Para los que no lo sepan, hay que indicar que este Day of the Tentacle es una "segunda parte" de otro juego llamado Maniac Mansion, pero no hace falta en absoluto jugar al primero para disfrutar de esta aventura ya que son totalmente independientes, m√°s all√° de conocerse los personajes por lo acaecido en la primera aventura.

Particularmente, he de admitir que cuando acab√© este juego en su d√≠a, con la versi√≥n original, ten√≠a m√°s que claro que la saga Monkey Island era bastante mejor y m√°s graciosa. Pero una vez que he finalizado este remaster de Day of the Tentacle, con m√°s edad y mayor madurez, ya no lo tengo tan claro ni mucho menos.

Porque si hubiera que resumir este juego en una sola palabra, esta seria: Inteligente. Sin duda, este juego hace acopio de ciertas caracter√≠sticas que eran √∫nicas en el mundo de las aventuras gr√°ficas por aquel entonces cuando sali√≥ a la venta, y hoy en d√≠a me atrever√≠a a decir.

Para empezar el argumento es simplemente magistral y alocado. Un tent√°culo p√∫rpura bebe aguas residuales que el exc√©ntrico Dr. Fred de la mansi√≥n est√° arrojando al r√≠o que hay detr√°s de su casa, y eso hace que se vuelva loco y quiera conquistar el mundo. 

Si ya esta premisa es demencial, no lo es menos la soluci√≥n que ofrece el majadero del Dr. Fred: viajar al pasado para parar los vertidos y que de este modo el tent√°culo p√∫rpura no pueda beberlos. El problema es que algo sale mal y sus tres personajes son enviados a diferentes periodos de la historia americana: el presente, el pasado y el futuro.

Esta complejidad es simplemente maravillosa, ya que cada personajes tendr√° que buscarse la vida para conseguir los diferentes objetos necesarios para reparar la m√°quina, volver al presente dos de ellos y conseguir detener al tent√°culo p√∫rpura en el pasado.

Para ello, el juego crea un sistema de intercambio de objetos entre los tres personajes, pero no solo eso, sino que resoluciones llevadas a cabo en el pasado afectar√°n al presente y al futuro, y lo mismo ocurre desde el presente al futuro. Y todo ello ser√° absolutamente necesario para resolver determinadas situaciones dadas en el juego, cada una en su √©poca determinada.

Esto que podr√≠a parecer algo con cierta complejidad desmesurada para el jugador est√° implementado magistralmente, con puzles realmente l√≥gicos y muy inteligentes que provocan que realmente nos planteemos las cosas "m√°s all√° del presente" cuando pensamos en cu√°l acci√≥n llevar a cabo o qu√© objeto podr√≠a funcionar en qu√© situaci√≥n. Es simplemente magn√≠fico, y yo particularmente no he encontrado otro juego que ofrezca mayor nivel de profundidad a la hora de presentar sus puzles y sus resoluciones pertinentes.

Adem√°s de esto, el argumento en s√≠ mismo mientras se desarrolla la historia es realmente divertido, creando situaciones descacharrantes que a buen seguro te arrancar√°n m√°s de una carcajada. Tanto por las situaciones dadas como las que provocar√°s en el espacio-tiempo y que afectaran al resto de personajes del juego, para bien y para mal.

Sin lugar a dudas, este Day of the Tentacle es una obra magistral de las aventuras gr√°ficas y deber√≠a ser disfrutado por todo fan de este g√©nero. Esperemos que alg√∫n d√≠a decidan sacar una nueva aventura de estos tres aut√©nticos friquis para deleite de todos nosotros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974933037', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1487111691}
review:
[h1]I FEEL LIKE I COULD... TAKE ON THE WORLD![/h1]
[b]1993[/b]: anno in cui esce il seguito "ufficiale" del grande [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] (prima avventura punta e clicca di mamma Lucasfilm, creata nel 1987 da Ron Gilbert e Gary Winnick).
Con una trama che ruota attorno ai viaggi del tempo di 3 scapestrati ragazzi e un susseguirsi di siparietti comici, DOTT √® sicuramente una delle migliori avventure Lucas mai fatte... anche se qualcuno trova il tempo di lamentarsi per certi enigmi non proprio facilissimi (mi vengono in mente il calesse e la chiave nascosta).
[b]2016[/b]: anno in cui la [i]Doublefine[/i] di Tim Schafer decide di sfruttare l'effetto amarcord per fare qualche soldo extra. Fortunatamente questa Remastered dimostra un certo amore per il gioco originale ed √® anni luce avanti a quel [i]Monkey Island Special Edition[/i] del 2009 (velo pietoso).

Sicuramente non si poteva chiedere di pi√π a chi ha rimodernato la grafica di questo DOTTR. Certo, sarebbe stato bello qualche frame in pi√π rispetto alle vecchie animazioni, ma dovendo far funzionare tutto come un "abito" al di sopra dell'intelaiatura originale, era proprio impossibile (esattamente come per tutti i giochi che, con la pressione di un tasto, tornano alle precedenti versioni).
La possibilit√† di cambiare l'interfaccia e le musiche con una versione pi√π moderna √® probabilmente superficiale, ma a qualcuno potrebbe non dispiacere. A me basta poter ascoltare nuovamente quei vecchi suoni digitalizzati e l'irraggiungibile sistema IMUSE... Se poi facciamo conto che all'interno del gioco √® presente anche il [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] originale, questa versione diventa un MUST per chiunque. [b];-)[/b]

[b]VOTO: 9/10[/b]

review: Without question a classic.  There's no end to the moon logic, so don't feel bad about going to a walkthrough when stuck.  The humor in this game has held up throughout the decades as well.  If you're into adventure games, especially ones that are tonally extremely looney tunes, here's a great one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043909081', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1698876310}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is one of the most downright ingeninesly designed adventure games I'd ever played. It also helps that the art-style is unique and a pleasure to look at - even now, with all the characters having really singular and distinct designs, and idiosyncratic personalities. I'd say that - personally - I find this to be the best LucasArts adventure title. Up against Monkey Island, Full Throttle, The Dig, Loom and Indiana Jones - I honestly think Day of the Tentacle is one of the best, if not THE best. 

The game is a sequel (kinda) to Maniac Mansion, and follows the out-of-the-ordinary adventures of one the original characters - Bernard, alongside his two allies Laverne and Hoagie. Bernard is a dork - almost to the degree of a cartoon, as Hoagie is in his slow dimwitted response to the world around him and Laverne's unnervingly hyper-analytical and just downright creepy nature.
The game opens outisde Dr. Edisons Hotel\House abomination with Pruple and Green Tentacle outside an out-flow pipe with Purple debating on drinking the run off.. for.. some reason.
The run off mutates him and gives him arms - thus inspiring him to run-off to conquer the world.
The kicker is, he can.
Later that day (I assume) a letter arrives from Green at the Apartment of whom our Heroes share and details the events, and brings to light Dr. Ed's intention to kill both Tentacles Bernard springs into action and declares his intent to retrun as the others relunctently join. 
After you arrive - you split up and begin the adventure proper. 
I'm not going to delve too deeply into the story - as that's pretty much 95% of the game.

All I'm going to say is - it only gets better from there. The dry and Hanna Barbara inspired structure and pacing the writing - not to mention the 'pacing' of the jokes' is all enough to keep ya wanting to play. 
The game's best strength is it's writing - the dry humor is excellent and the overacted cartoony stuff is kept in pace and is executed perfectly, never getting grating or outstaying it's welcome when it leans on the heavy or the cartoon side of things. It keeps a good balance.

The puzzle design leads behind the writing in the fact that it RUNS with the time travel plot as you sift items from one character to another to progress, and how things will change between each 'Day' or time period to reflect past or future actions. Not only is it just good design to keep things consistant, it's also good signposting for how to progress. The game isn't cheap on hints and the Remastered options allow you to use one - or switch it off if you wanna play old school. 
The actual puzzles the first time around definetly made me stop and look over my notes but was nothing TOO difficult, with that being said I really do recommend you play without the hint system, as the actual hint's themselves are too much like a walkthrough in how blatently they tell you how to progress. Theres no moon logic at play here. Theres really not any pixel hunting either, which is - again a plus.

The actual 'Remaster' is servicable, but I don't really dig the 'smooth' look to everything. Nothing really has definition and everything looks 'blobby' and flat, one of the first things I swapped was the visuals. I feel the game's artstyle is actually hampered by the way this game looks - as opposed to Full Throttle where things were totally redrawn in greater fidelity. Here it looks like a filter, it looks cheap. The music and sound revamps are servicable enough but I opted for the classic music and sound setup as well. The new interface is also servicable but the verb menu is still more than adaquete. I felt as though the newer interface was more intended for the PS4\Vita versions of the game, but still, it's an option for those that want it (which I'm not knocking, I'm glad that it's an option to swap the features around - that's a total plus from me).

The game hasn't lost it's shine, it's funny, it's fun and it's memorable all on top of that. Totally, absolutely recommended - even at it's original price.

review: Un bon remaster o√π l'on retrouve le gameplay et les r√©pliques cinglantes des diff√©rents protagonistes, chacun dans leur propre registre. Un point'n click aussi loufoque que bien ficel√©, digne des opus Lucas Arts cette epoque (90's). A jouer de toute urgence pour les non connaisseurs !

author: {'steamid': '76561198017168358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1535822892}
review:
How did I pick this up: Got it on sale. Already played this back when I was a teen and got it for the nostalgia value. This was the first Point-and-Click Adventure game that I was able to finish (got stuck real bad on the Monkey Island Series).

Pros: The remastered edition definitely made Day of the Tentacle up-to-date in terms of graphics and other quality of life improvements - such as the shift button. It highlights the "interactive" objects in the scene, which lessens the typical Point-and-Click adventure game routine of hovering the mouse inch by inch throughout the scene.

Also appreciated the addition of achievements - I stumbled upon one when I was stuck (yeah yeah like a noob, lol) and combined every item in my inventory.

Cons:
As I mentioned before, the highlighting takes a bit of the challenge in the game.

There are a few bonus content in the form of developer commentary and concept art, but aside from that, there's nothing much added to the original.

Conclusion: For the old fans - get it on sale, well worth the replay. For new / younger gamers wanting to wet their feet in Point-and-Click Adventures, Day of the Tentacle Remastered is definitely a must buy, even at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198197803871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1534104171}
review:
How can anyone give this game a thumbs down? The game itself needs no further explanation, you MUST know this and if you really, really dont and are at least a tiny winy bit into point and click-adventures: do yourself a favour and buy this masterpiece!

Yes, this is a "remaster" and today this is unfortunately very often a bad thing - luckily not with this one! Double Fine has done a great job and they kept all their work on the remastered absolutely keen to the original. You can switch through the original art style and the remastered at any given time during the game, as well as with the original sound. They also implemented a commentary-voiceover which is something i really like (normally you only get this in movies). Plus they did NOT change anything from the original synchronization of all of the caracters (not only the main ones). Sound is polished up in a very good way, kudos for that!

The achievements of this game arent very hard to get, so it's no wonder this is actually my first steam-game where i got all of the achievements with almost no effort ^^ Still it's fun as hell. There's no way you cannot recommend this game to a Point and Click-fan!

author: {'steamid': '76561198200201969', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1534974306}

author: {'steamid': '76561198054344322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1684280725}
review: A LucasArts classic! I was glad to see this point-and-click made available again! Highly recommend it. One part of the game features an Easter egg in which you can play the original Maniac Mansion. Unlike Sierra titles, you cannot die. You also cannot make the game unwinnable. However, in LucasArts games the puzzles are infamously difficult and will have you wandering about. This one, however, features fun cartoony zaniness that makes up for it. You switch between the whitebread Bernard, the metalhead Hoagie, and the college-obsessed LaVerne as they are sent back in time to prevent the mutated Purple Tentacle from conquering the world. However, due to a malfunction the three are accidentally sent to different parts of history.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085029499', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1533495664}
review:
Como encari√±ado de juegos como Simon the Sorcerer de Adventure Soft el cual disfrut√© de peque√±o en primer ordenador y de sagas como Monkey Island que jugu√© de m√°s adolescente gracias a Scumm, siempre me qued√≥ en el tintero jugar a Day of Tentacle ya que en Scumm siempre se me quedaba trabado justo al comenzar tras el video de inicio. Finalmente, he podido cumplir este deseo gracias al Remastered (el cual le ha sentado muy bien) a este maravilloso juego.

Si bien es verdad que los a√±os le han pasado factura dado que los chistes que en su momento pod√≠an hacer gracia ahora quedan algo desangelados, su estilo point-and-click siempre ha sido una debilidad para mi, con puzzles que desaf√≠an a toda l√≥gica en algunos momentos y donde terminas uniendo todo como un maldito obseso como quien busca encajar una pieza de puzzle donde no cabe. Day of the Tentacle plantea una historia que si bien no tiene excesiva profundidad te permite vagar por diferentes tiempos y comprobar como los puzzles tienen repercusi√≥n en el tiempo teniendo que echar mano de sus tres personajes (Bernard, Laverne y Hoagie) para alcanzar la meta final y plantar cara al mal√©volo y conquistador Tent√°culo P√∫rpura. Personalmente me lo he pasado como un ni√±o tirando absolutamente de nostalgia y maravill√°ndome de esta historia que si quiz√° no es tan genial como la de la saga Monkey Island si es bastante disfrutable con este tr√≠o que a cada quien es m√°s tonto que el anterior.

Para los que nunca se hayan aventurado con un point-and-click podr√≠an sentirse decepcionados por el hecho de que es un juego para nost√°lgicos y amantes del g√©nero que disfrutan de algo complicado con puzzles desafiantes y que te hacen perder el sentido l√≥gico en algunas ocasiones. Pero si eres alguien que ya conoc√≠a la industria de LucasArts y como yo no tuviste la oportunidad de jugarlo, es un buen momento para hacerlo teniendo la oportunidad de jugarlo en formato cl√°sico o en la versi√≥n remasterizada, ambas sumamente bellas en mi opini√≥n.

Me ha encantado y seguramente como he hecho con todos termine rejug√°ndolo en alg√∫n momento de mi vida y recomend√°ndolo a aquellos que busquen rememorar sus √©pocas m√°s juveniles. Dicho esto, agradecer el trabajo de Double Fine que nos han permitido volver a nuestra ni√±ez por unas horas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021087888', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1533216309}
review:
The case with The Day of the Tentacle is that while Monkey Island, and especially Monkey Island 2, were always better known, all the adventure game fans I've been in touch with agreed that The Day of the Tentacle was the best point-and-clicker of all time. I've played some good ones lately, particularly from Wadjet Eye Games, like Technobabylon or the Blackwell bundle, but Day of the Tentacle is still the best goofy, funny point-and-click adventure game ever made. If not just flat out the best overall.

And it's not just nostalgia talking. It's even one of the best cartoons ever made. If you're serious about your point-and-clicker collection, do get the game and play it through. It's been so long since I haven't known all the puzzles by heart, so some might be difficult, but still - it's number 1 deservedly.

As was the case with the original you get a copy of the first Maniac Mansion game available as a game-within-a-game playable through an in-game computer. So it's two purchases in one. That's not remastered, which is a shame, but the Day of the Tentacle remaster is pretty great. I'd still recommend using the classic verb-inventory interface as some puzzles might give you trouble due to fiddly handling of the new interface.

Anyhow, great game, timeless classic, fork the money over and enjoy even just having it in your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198151097535', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1533086731}
review:
[h1]Eine abgedrehte Zeitreise-Knobelei...[/h1] 

[b][u]Die Neuauflage eines Kultspiels...[/u][/b]
"Day of the Tentacle" ist ein echter Klassiker, der sich heute noch mit vielen modernen Adventures messen kann. Zusammen mit drei Freunde versuchst du ein b√∂ses, lila Mutantententakel daran zu hindern, die Weltherrschaft an sich zu rei√üen. 

Die R√§tsel sind super durchdacht. Mit viel Humor und einer tollen Soundkulisse t√ºftelt man sich so durch das Point & Click Abenteuer. W√§hrenddessen kann der Spieler sogar jederzeit zwischen den Modi "Klassisch" und "Remastered" wechseln. So kann die Grafik, der Ton und die Benutzeroberfl√§che verschieden miteinander kombinieren werden. Der absolute Wahnsinn!

Du magst Abenteuer? Stehst auf Point & Click Spiele? Liebst pixel Klassiker oder doch lieber HD Versionen? Hast eine Menge Humor? [b]Super, dann ist "Day of the Tentacle Remastered" ein absolutes MUST HAVE f√ºr dich![/b] Ich w√ºnsche viel Spa√ü beim Spielen! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197964624484', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1530304790}
review:
Excellent blast-from-the-past, point-and-click adventure bristling with corny jokes and humour. I played the original and he remastered version stays true to it with just some nice updated visuals, but without losing that lovely cartoony style that helped make the game what it was. For those who loved the original and want to play it again, you'll not be disappointed. For those who have no idea what this game is, read on...

Day of the Tentacle is a point-and-click adventure/puzzle game. You find objects, pick them up, then somewhere in the game you will have to find a use for them. Half the puzzle is figuring out inventive and funny ways of using said items. The story goes that a mad professor created two cute tentacle creatures, one of which decides to take over the world after drinking some toxic sludge (probably what we know as "Energy Drinks" today...) and turning evil. And he succeeds...but in the future!  You control 3 characters, one each transported to the past, present and future via a time-toilet and have to figure out a way of preventing Purple Tentacle from taking over the world. Things you do in one time zone can have an effect on the others and items can be flushed down the chrono-crapper where they might be more useful - or even different items. You have to think about what might happen to an item from the past for example, if its somehow transported 400 years into the future. Solving puzzles often requires you to look at problems from a different angle and imagine the most ridiculous or corny ways of using some of the items. I'd give you some examples but don't want to give any spoilers away!

The game is based around humour. The kind of pie-in-the-face humour that fits in so well with the cartoon style graphics. The voices and characters are amazing (and original too if I remember correctly). It took me around 6 hours to complete the game, but I could remember so much of it from playing it back in the 90's and I also had my viewers on the stream helping me out. If you are new to this game expect to get a lot more time out of it and also be stumped by some of the puzzles - but they will feel so rewarding when you finally figure it out! 

Highly recommended, especially if its on sale!

Take a look at my walkthrough below if you get stuck or want a little more of an idea of how the game works, but be warned, it does contain spoilers and show me solving all the puzzles.

https://youtu.be/ycl9OZ_a-Z0?list=PLXSzfKMEeeg6VIW0YOxcLh2UdlgS_YHic

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198026401875', 'num_games_owned': 1540, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1599470864}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is one of my top five favorite games, though I'm a bit biased as I've been playing it since I was a kid - to the point where I could easily write you a detailed walkthrough from memory. So when I say DOTT Remastered is a most welcome improvement, you can take that to the bank.

DOTT is a point-and-click adventure from the giant pixels era of Lucasarts's glory days. If you've played either of the first two Monkey Islands, you know what to expect. You use a series of verbs and inventory items and navigate dialogue trees to puzzle your way around and save the world.

The story is zany, which is to be expected with the project lead being Tim Schafer, the mind behind Psychonauts and Grim Fandango. Sometime after the events of Maniac Mansion, Bernard (the sole returning playable character) receives a letter from his old MM acquaintance Green Tentacle, warning that the evil Purple Tentacle is going to use his newly grown arms to take over the world. Bernard sets off with his two college roommates, Hoagie and Laverne, to once again investigate the mansion and stop a purple menace from achieving total global domination.

After reaching the mansion, the three students are sent back in time in port-a-potties by the mad scientist Dr. Fred to turn off his Sludge-O-Matic (a machine built solely to vomit toxic waste into the nearby river) before Purple Tentacle can drink from it and develop his mutations. Things go wrong, however, stranding the roadie Hoagie 200 years in the past during a meeting of the Continental Congress, the slightly deranged med student Laverne 200 years in the future after the Tentacles have already taken over, and plopping all-around nerd Bernard right back where he started: the present. Now all three must work together across time to reunite and reach yesterday alive.

As you may have noticed, one of the greatest strengths of Day of the Tentacle is its humor. Everything winds up being the set-up or punchline for some joke. Dialogue trees often feature branches which all lead to the same place, but simply allow the player to say what amuses them the most. A friend of mine asked me the other day what the funniest game I've ever played is. And while I've been giving it some thought, I've found myself very hard-pressed to come up with anything that could beat out Day of the Tentacle.

Of course, this may lead to some puzzles being almost too joking in nature to make immediate sense. Everything has some understandable form of logic attached, and there are always clues as to what you should do. But I can almost guarantee you'll become stuck at some point. That said, getting stuck on a puzzle isn't a big problem, as a good deal of the game is open to you as soon as you finish the intro sequence. Day of the Tentacle is very non-linear for a point-and-click, so when you are stuck on something, there's probably plenty else that you can go do in the meantime.

Of course, DOTT isn't comedy with no substance. The game can be downright [i]ingenious[/i], and you'll feel very clever for solving certain problems. It is worth noting that some jokes and puzzles in the past do rely on American history, but luckily the devs were wise enough to provide enough context and hints to get you through even if you're not up on your George Washington mythology.

Now to discuss what the remaster brings to the table.

I had this profound moment when the first screenshots were released. The first shot was of the original visuals. And they looked great! Just as I'd remembered them. Such a fittingly strange art style. Then I looked at the next screenshot, of the same scene presented in the remastered graphics. And it looked just as good. Not much difference at all, in fact. What was the point, if it was such a small upgrade? Then I looked back at the first image. And it looked like absolute [i]garbage[/i].

That's the best way I could possibly explain the remastered visuals.

Outside of that, this remaster was clearly built using the Monkey Island Special Editions as a base. Structurally, it's very similar, with any differences being mostly small improvements. Monkey Island SE included both the ability to switch between the classic and modern art, and an action wheel in place of the verb menu. Monkey 2 SE added the option to use the brand new voices with the voiceless classic game, and to listen to commentary tracks featuring the original creators on certain scenes. Day of the Tentacle includes all of the above, and goes one further with the classic/modern options.

In DOTT Remastered, you can choose between old or new graphics, and you can choose between classic or remastered sounds. You can also choose between the verb bar or action wheel and the original or updated music, and you can set each of these four things independantly of each other. Want classic sounds and inventory with the newer music and art? You're covered. You can even set them to "automatic" so that if you switch between visuals mid-game, that setting will always change to match. A very nice touch with these options is that using the verb bar with the updated visuals will give you a sleeker, updated bar, while using the action wheel with the classic visuals will result in appropriately pixelated icons.

The most important difference between the wheel and the bar is that the bar gives you a persistent list of verbs and inventory items. Since you have so many options available, it cuts down on the practice of trying everything on everything when you don't know what to do. Unless you have a lot of time on your hands, you'll have to actually know what you want to do to solve a puzzle. On the other hand, the wheel shows you only those verbs and items that can be used with whatever you wish to interact with, making for an easier, quicker playthrough for rookie adventurers. I definitely prefer the verb bar, but then I'm also in love with parsers which require you to type out what it is you intend to do, so obviously not everybody's going to agree with me here.

You'll unlock concept art as you progress through the game, if that's your bag, along with various achievements that were somehow a welcome addition. They encouraged me to try things I'd somehow never done before, adding to the freshness of this fresh playthrough.

A minor gripe I had was that I used to be able to use the arrow keys to move the cursor around when I was feeling especially lazy, but that's been removed in this version. A less minor gripe was that while playing with both voices and subtitles on, they were usually really out of sync with each other. Messing with the subtitle speed did improve things greatly, but I still had to deal with the odd line that flitted by too quickly.

I also didn't like the way the commentary tracks would just cut off if I left the room they were tied to, with no way to fast forward back to where I left off if I went back in to try again. This meant that I found myself just sitting and listening in many rooms that I had no further business in at the moment. But at least the commentary is fascinating enough to make up for it. Well worth the price of admission for an old fan.

Some of the new audio just wasn't doing it for me. The music seemed to have been quieted down while at the same time sounding overdone like the Monkey Island 2 SE music. And I noticed that several sound effects lost their bass along the way. The good news is that anybody who hasn't played the game before will never notice. And, thanks to those mix-and-match settings I mentioned, I can just play through the game with my precious old-school sounds and shut up. Everybody's happy!

Though ever-so-slightly dated, I couldn't possibly recommend this game enough to fans of graphic point-and-click adventures young or old. There's a reason Day of the Tentacle so often features on lists of the best point-and-clicks of all time. It's quality from start to finish, and it just may be the best of them all.

In my eyes, it certainly is.
