author: {'steamid': '76561197971039128', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1531593517}
review:
A classic Point n' Click adventure game from LucasArts, remastered with updated graphics and UI that keep true to the original aesthetic, and new tunes (retro audio and visuals can be switched to at any time).  Fair warning that the game does not include a hint system, be prepared to have a guide or spend a lot of time clicking on items and verb combinations and seeing what works.  Classic adventure gameplay!

The humor is odd, even for a game set in the 90s.  The talky jokes at first seem lame because of the voice acting, but after envisioning as subtitles the jokes are EXACTLY as I remember these classic LucasArts games.  You have three playable characters existing in three time periods that can be switched to at any moment, with the goal to change the past to prevent the evil Purple Tentacle from taking over the world.  Puzzles can be quite clever, often involving one action as a character in the past to manipulate an event for a character in the future.

As an avid fan of the Monkey Island series this game really hit my nostalgia button.  It's pretty much peak LucasArts adventure gaming and should be checked out for any fan of the style.  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991011889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1465729779}
review:
[h1]Allgemein[/h1]

"Day of the Tentacle" wurde 1993 ver√∂ffentlicht, damit ist es √§lter als viele Spieler. Das 2D Abenteuer ist ein klassisches Point-and-Click Adventure. 

[b][i]Pro:[/i][/b]

Die aktuelle Remastered Version unterscheidet sich kaum vom Original und f√ºr alle Gamer √ú30 bringt sie sicherlich Erinnerungen zur√ºck. Das Spiel ist aber nicht nur etwas f√ºr wei√ühaarige Greise. Die Comic-Grafik, der abgedrehte Humor und die schr√§gen R√§tsel kommen auch heute noch gut an. 

Das Spiel ist insgesamt vergleichbar mit den aktuellen South-Park-Titeln, selbst der Humor ist √§hnlich. Fans der South-Park-Spiele werden sich bei "Day oft he Tentacle" nicht langweilen.

[b][i]Kontra:[/i][/b]

Eine kleine Warnung an Leute mit wenig Geduld: Die R√§tsel sind teilweise sehr anspruchsvoll! Schon damals, im letzten Jahrtausend, wurden L√∂sungshefte angeboten. Online sind die L√∂sungen heute kostenlos leicht zu finden. Wenn man selbst nicht weiter wei√ü, muss man eben die L√∂sung online suchen (das unterscheidet "Day oft the Tentacle" nicht von aktuellen Point and Click-Spielen). Wer mit nicht intuitiven R√§tseln √ºberfordert ist oder Sarkasmus f√ºr ein Tiroler K√§se-Mus h√§lt, sollte die Finger von diesem Spiel lassen. 

Dass das Spiel schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel hat, merkt man besonders beim Sound, den m√ºssen j√ºngere Spieler ertragen k√∂nnen.

[h1]Zusammengefasst[/h1]

Das Spiel ist ein Meilenstein der Videospielgeschichte und f√ºr echte Gamer eigentlich ein Teil der Allgemeinbildung. Auch heute noch lohnt sich der Kauf und das kann man, aus meiner Sicht, sonst von keinem anderen Spiel aus dem Jahr 1993 sagen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048695648', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1531155424}
review:
Uno de los cl√°sicos de las aventuras gr√°ficas que ten√≠a pendiente. Tim Schafer y su paso por los videojuegos es maravilloso, solo recordar juegos de este mismo se√±or, como Grim Fandango, me da una idea de la calidad que tienen las obras que dirige.

La animaci√≥n es sencillamente maravillosa, el estilo art√≠stico es √∫nico y el humor est√° en todas partes (as√≠ como las referencias al cine, los videojuegos, etc.).

Vale la pena darle una oportunidad a estas grandes obras una vez en la vida, sobre todo si te gusta este medio, porque de aqu√≠ surgieron un mont√≥n de conceptos que hoy en d√≠a se toman en cuenta para desarrollar un videojuego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043110160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1556336487}
review:
A remastering done right. One of the best point-and-click adventure games ever made. Well worth playing even today.

Some of the cultural references and jokes are dated; and a few puzzles are harder or less intuitive as our home applicances have changed over time. But the pacing of the narrative, the temporal puzzles and distinct characters (within the limits of 1990s game budgets) are all exceptional.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964851886', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1530180461}
review: Great game and well worth playing, graphics are great and the puzzles aren't as crazy as some of the other lucas arts games. Well worth picking up and playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173517226', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1530239423}
review:
A short, but fun game. 

It might be an older game, but the updated graphics really do a ncie job modernising the game.  And for what it's worth, the writing and jokes haven't lost too much of their punch. 

The game can be a little difficult at times, the puzzles aren't your standard fair.  But in context of the absurdity of the game, they make sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078182908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1530171797}
review:
So, this is the remastered Version of one of the Lucas Arts Masterpieces. In my list it's in the same line as Monkey Island I+II and The Legend of Kyrandia 2. 

What stands out is that you have three parallel characters to play:
Hoagie - in the past
Bernard - in presence
Laverne - in future

So, anything you do in those times affects the future time. There are hilarious but even somewhat "educational" or better:
hilariously educational puzzles to solve. The best thing is: They all make sense somewhow. I remember back when I played it my first time I would go to bed chewing how to solve a puzzle, wake up and have the solution for it xD

Also it was one of the first adventures that had complete voice-over. My computer would crash when I turned it on because it had not a 100% compatible Soundblaster Card although otherwise marketed :D So I had to wait years until I could play it on ScummVM to listen to it.

See, I played A LOT of the old school Point-and-Click Adventures back in the days as that was my childhood.
I never liked the later classics like Myst or Lighthouse as I hate those old-type 3D render graphics. What Lucas Arts Adventures made stand out was their unique type of humor along with hilarious puzzles and beautiful graphics(now known as "Pixel-Art"?).

After classics started to re-emerge as Special Editions like Monkey Island, Grim Fandango, Full Throttle and of course DOTT- I saw people at forums complaining that 25 year old games should be free... I mean... serious?

Since the late 90s I played those games again and again through ScummVM on WinOS, PSP or other Handhelds and finally Android.
I always wished there would be some sort of modern remake so you could play it on big screens... and here it is. More beautiful than ever.
Sure, they also changed the input controlls of which old-skoolers like me need some time to get into it but that's ok.

I'd call these games timeless- especially with the now HD Graphics and new controlls they're wonderfully playable.

Coming back to the people that say 25+ year old games shouldn't cost anything:
There is already a generation that doesn't know these games and probably wouldn't go through the hassle of pixelated graphics on 32" screens but now can.

Get, play and enjoy them! There simply aren't any Point and Click Adventures of this type anymore.
The only thing I regret from the bottom of my heart is the feeling of playing this game the first time of my life again. But I do remember ... <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198072674293', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1530036773}
review:
Ein Meilenstein der Videospielgeschichte. Es ist mit Abstand das beste Puzzle-Andventure Game, auch wenn dies nur die Remasterd Version des Originals von 1993 ist hat das Spiel noch immer Eigenschaften und Charakterz√ºge denen es heutigen Spielen fehlt. Die Geschichte die in dem Spiel erz√§hlt wird ist erste Sahne auch wenn das Spiel bei einmaligem durchspielen nur eine Zeit von 3-5 Stunden beansprucht, jenachdem wie schnell man die einzelnen Punkte l√∂sen kann. Im Spiel selbst sind die Charakter, Stimmen, Synchro und Grafik sehr gelungen f√ºr eine Remaster-Version eines Spieles. Man bezahlt also 5‚Ç¨ f√ºr einen echten Klassiker vergangener Tage.

Fazit: Wenn man auch nur Ansatzweise an dem Ursprung von Videospielen (vorallem Adventure Games) interessiert ist sollte man sich dieses Spiel auf jeden Fall aneigenen.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198083355719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1529194689}
review:
C'est un plaisir de retrouver ce point and click mythique que je n'avais pas eu l'occasion de jouer s√©rieusement √† l'√©poque, n'ayant pu y jouer que chez un aml quelques heures. J'ai donc fait le jeu dans son enti√®ret√© sans aucune aide ext√©rieure et malgr√© les quelques moments de gal√®re √† tourner en rond, le plaisir est toujours pr√©sent. Les √©nigmes ont du sens, l'humour est omnipr√©sent et j'en ai retir√© beaucoup de satisfactfion.

On pourrait regretter une interface qui a vieilli un peu, notamment au moment de passer les objets d'un personnage √† un autre (ou alors j'ai manqu√© un raccourci).

Dans l'ensemble, je le conseille √† toute personne patiente aimant les √©nigmes et l'humour absurde. Sachez toutefois que l'int√©r√™t du jeu est quasi nul s'il est jou√© avec une soluce sous le nez (c'est √©vident mais sait-on jamais...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198150601647', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1529795996}
review:
I bought this game because the nostalgic vibe this game gave me when looking at trailers and i bought it during the summer sale for less than $5.00, but it was'nt what i really wanted. Taking into consideation that this is a remasted, the visuals look pretty good considering this game origianlly was released back in the 1990s. As most comments say, this is just a click game and trying to solve small puzzles. The characters are very engaging, but i wasnt fully satisfy with the game. Some of the puzzles are actually difficult in figuring out what to dobecause theres not that many leads and I eneded up following a walkthrough to figure out what to do. 

Nevertheless, would i recommend this to a friend? Maybe, I wasnt fully satisfy, but maybe it was my fault for expecting something out of an old game. I will say no just because I did find it annoying that I have to look at a walkthrough at times because the puzzles got too difficult.

review:
Wow, what a delightful little game.

It's an adventure game so no shame in having to hit the interwebs if, say, the keys were behind the door and you had to walk into the room and then close the door behind you to see them, but overall I got through it with minimal crying for help and had a blast.  It's nice to be reminded that despite his post-Psychonauts productions, Tim Schafer is still one of the greats.

review: I played this game as a kid and it was as funny as I remembered it to be. The remastered version is a great improvement to the visual and audio, they also cleaned up the hud which looks better.

Very fun game to play espeically if you want something short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198342275395', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1569355743}
review: Day of the Tentacle, es ist einfach nur Kult wie die ganzen alten Spiele von Lucas Arts. Egal ob es sich um Monkey Island oder ZacMcKracken handelt. Die R√§tsel, wenn man Sie nicht kennt sind vielleicht etwas schwer aber mit ein bisschen Gedult und vorallem "LESEN" der Gespr√§che, um was es geht klappt das auch ohne Sorgen. Nostalgie pur, die ich selbst mittels ScummVM auf dem Handy habe und ich kann selbst nach Jahren immer noch lachen. Mittels dem F1 Button kann man √ºbrigens die Grafik umstellen auf die alte Zeit. Kurz gesagt, es ist ein muss f√ºr jeden Adventure Fan, das Geld sicher angelegt und der Spa√üfaktor ist einfach Klasse. Die neue Grafik und der neue Sound machen die Remastered Edition zu einem farbenfrohen und liebevollen Erlebniss, das man gerne wiederholt zu spielen (selbst wenn man nur die Errungenschaften bekommen m√∂chte) die ganzen alten Lucas Arts Aventures sind alle Zeitlos, egal ob es sich um Monkey Island und die anderen Teile handelt. Wer gerne in Erinnerungen schwelgt, der ist hier richtig aufgehoben :) ich hab¬¥s sogar auf meinem Smartphone in ScumVM laufen und spiele es unterwegs ab und an :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198123194404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1709566857}
review:
Okay, da ich nun auch dieses Spiel mit Freuden beendet habe, kann ich mich auch zu dessen wirklicher Qualit√§t √§u√üern.
Mir fiel als erstes die Liebe zum Detail auf, so erinnert die Grafik stark an die alten Cartoons wie Scooby Doo, so gef√§llt mir die altbackene Grafik des Originals genauso gut wie die neu aufgesetzte  Grafik des Remasters (wobei man nicht wirklich altbacken sagen kann, da der Retro Look, √§hnlich wie bei Sam and Max: Hit the Road ziemlich zeitlos wirkt), wobei das klassische Spiel eindeutig vom Retro-Charme lebt. 
Das Spielprinzip ist einfach erkl√§rt und schnell verinnerlicht, wenn man noch nie ein Point 'n Click Adventure gespielt haben sollte, f√ºr die anderen wie gewohnt: Alles einsammeln, was nicht niet- und -nagelfest ist und im Verlaufe des Games clever kombinieren, sodass man voranschreitet, neue Items bekommt und irgendwann den Abspann des Spiels erblickt. Was dabei wichtig ist: DIESES SPIEL HAT ES R√ÑTSELTECHNISCH IN SICH!!!
Nun komm ich auf den Sound zu sprechen. Dieser hat sich im Vergleich zum Original nur qualit√§tsbedingt ver√§ndert, ansonsten hat man immer noch "die guten, alten Launemacher" am Start.
Lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: DIeses Spiel ist f√ºr jedermann ein Muss, der sich als kultivierter Videospielkenner bezeichnen will, aber auch f√ºr die, die nichts mit dem Point 'n Click Genre am Hut haben, wer es also (noch) nicht hat: KAUFEN, KAUFEN, KAUFEN!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977158883', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 634, 'last_played': 1558818919}
review:
[H1][b]AN√ÅLISIS DE "DAY OF THE TENTACLE REMASTERED":[/b][/H1]

Producto obviamente enfocado a los nost√°ligicos que disfrutamos con el cl√°sico hay√° por el 93, aunque tambi√©n lo recomendar√≠a para los que no pudieron jugarlo en su d√≠a y quieran conocer una de las aventuras gr√°ficas cl√°sicas estilo "point & clic" m√°s m√≠ticas de todos los tiempos. 

Se trata de un remaster genialmente realizado: se ha redibujado todo el apartado art√≠sitco a mano en alta resoluci√≥n, respetando 100% los dise√±os originales y pudiendo jugar en alta resoluci√≥n, habiendo remasterizado tambi√©n los efectos sonoros y la m√∫sica. Lo mejor de todo es que podremos disfrutar del cl√°sico tal y como lo conoc√≠amos pulsando una sola tecla, pudiendo disfrutar tambi√©n del aspecto gr√°fico, interfaz y sonidos originales.

Aparte se han a√±adido logros como uno de los principales alicientes para hacerlo m√°s rejugable, cromos y sistema de guardado de la partida en la nube.

Tambi√©n se ha incluido arte conceptual e incluye la opci√≥n de escuchar comentarios de los creadores.

Os dejo mi lista de pros y contras:

[H1][b]PROS:[/b][/H1]

- Un ejemplo de c√≥mo hay que remasterizar un juego cl√°sico

- Muy entretenido

- Remaster 100% fiel al original

- Posibilidad de cambiar al modo cl√°sico tal y como lo conoc√≠amos pulsando solo una tecla

- Una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas de todos los tiempos, un cl√°sico

- Los di√°logos son divertid√≠simos, muchas risas aseguradas

- El carisma de los personajes

- Traducido al espa√±ol

- La m√∫sica y los sonidos tambi√©n han sido remasterizados

- Posibilidad de jugarlo con mando (aunque mucho mejor con rat√≥n como toda la vida)

- Incluye Maniac Mansion completo

- El surrealista argumento, simplemente genial

- Tiene logros Steam

- El hecho de tener logros lo hace m√°s rejugable

- Incluye bocetos extra

- Incluye comentarios del director

- Tiene sistema de guardado de la partida en la nube

- Tiene cromos Steam

- Se puede encontrar a muy buen precio en √©pocas de ofertas


[H1][b]CONTRAS:[/b][/H1]

- Algunos fallos en la traducci√≥n

- A veces el juego se bloquea en la transici√≥n del modo cl√°sico y el remasterizado

- Maniac Mansion est√° completamente en ingl√©s, no ha sido traducido como el resto del juego

- Algunos puzzles se hacen complicados de solucionar sin ayuda de una gu√≠a

[H1]Conclusi√≥n:[/H1] ‚Äã

Un ejemplo de c√≥mo se deben hacer las cosas, genial remasterizaci√≥n del cl√°sico m√°s de 20 a√±os desde su lanzamiento. Har√° las delicias de los nost√°lgicos y es una muy buena opci√≥n para los que no lo disfrutaron en su d√≠a. Si te gustan las aventuras gr√°ficas cl√°sicas c√≥mpralo s√≠ o s√≠. Adem√°s incluye dentro Maniac Mansion totalmente jugable (y con un par de logros, eso s√≠, en ingl√©s).

Duraci√≥n: He tardado en torno a unas 8 horas, aunque esto puede variar bastante dependiendo de la habilidad que tengamos en este tipo de aventuras gr√°ficas.

Si mi an√°lisis te ha gustado o te ha servido de ayuda, agradecer√≠a que dejaras un voto positivo para que pueda llegar a m√°s gente. ¬°Gracias por leerme! No dud√©is en dejar vuestros comentarios o dudas, responder√© lo antes posible. 

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34246137-Raziel_BPN]>>>¬øQuieres jugar gastando poco dinero? ¬°haz clic aqu√≠ para seguir mi p√°gina de mentor si quieres ver mis an√°lisis de juegos gratuitos, baratos o en oferta!<<<[/url]

review:
En lila tentakel, som jobbar som labbassistent till doktor Fred Edison (galen vetenskapsman), dricker lite giftigt avfall som sl√§ppts ut ur laboratoriet och utvecklar armar, ut√∂kad intelligens och en stark lust att er√∂vra v√§rlden. Han f√•ngas in f√∂r att oskadligg√∂ras av doktorn, tillsammans med sin gr√∂ne beskedlige tentakelbroder. Men brodern, som inte vill bli tillintetgjord, skickar sin kvicka hamster till en gammal v√§n efter hj√§lp. V√§nnen, Bernard, √§r en stereotypiskt lagd allm√§nn√∂rd som delar hus med en l√§karstudent (Laverne) och en r√•ddare (Hoagie). De far till laboratoriet, som ligger i k√§llaren till ett sjaskigt motell, missf√∂rst√•r situationen och sl√§pper √•ter ut den lila tentakeln i v√§rlden. Nu finns det bara ett s√§tt att r√§dda situationen f√∂r m√§nskligheten, och det √§r att resa en dag tillbaka i tiden f√∂r att g√∂ra det gjorda ogjort, men komplikationer uppst√•r d√• vissa besparingar i konstruktionen gjort tidsmaskinen mindre tillf√∂rlitlig. S√• kan √§ventyret b√∂rja.

Day of the Tentacle Remastered √§r ett √§ventyrsspel av ‚Äúden gamla skolan‚Äù d√§r man pekar och klickar sig fram f√∂r att l√∂sa problem p√• mer eller mindre l√•ngs√∂kta s√§tt. Originalspelet sl√§pptes f√∂r n√§stan precis tjugofem √•r sedan, och man m√•ste s√§ga att det var stilbildande och nyskapande n√§r ‚Äúden gamla skolan‚Äù var ung och fr√§sch. Omarbetningen och moderniseringen har varit varsam. Spelet ser betydligt modernare ut och l√•ter betydligt b√§ttre, men annars k√§nns det tillr√§ckligt bak√•tstr√§vande f√∂r att nostalgin ska f√• sitt. Spelet r√∂r sig fram√•t med en godmodig humor, men en del av standardklyschorna har helt klart √•ldrats. Detsamma g√§ller sj√§lva pusslen, som ju √§r hj√§rtat i den h√§r typen av spel. M√•nga av l√∂sningarna k√§nns v√§ldigt l√•ngs√∂kta, och har inga egentliga ledtr√•dar. Man f√•r helt enkelt prova sig fram genom √§ventyret. Exempelvis sitter en sk√§mtspya fast i taket i rummet d√§r spelet inleds och man vet att den kommer att beh√∂vas till n√•got n√•gon g√•ng under spelet, men hur man ska f√• ner den ([spoiler]ljudligt bombardemang[/spoiler]) och vad den ska anv√§ndas till ([spoiler]framtida t√§vlingsfusk[/spoiler]) finns det inga som helst sk√§l att kunna lista ut i f√∂rv√§g. Det h√§r √§r f√∂rvisso ett klagom√•l p√• hela genren och inte p√• just Day of the Tentacle Remastered, och det √§r mer en k√§lla till frustration i spelandet √§n ett klagom√•l. author: {'steamid': '76561198401970277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1542879144}
review: Within two minutes of starting this game my brother and I were nervously laughing at the sheer cringeworthiness of it all. But it quickly became apparant that this aura of awkwardness and cringe was entirely intentional, and once we accepted that, this game became quite a delight. I can't help but think of how fun it must have been for the voice actors and animators to make this game. But aside from its quirky and hammy aesthetic, Day of the Tentacle Remastered really is a solid point-and-click adventure game. It's difficulty is nothing to scoff at, yet for the most part all of your needed actions make sense in the given universe. The time travel mechanic especially makes for some unique puzzles that left me with a good sense of accomplishment when I realized the answers. Granted, at the moment of writing this review, I am somewhat stuck as to what to do next. However, this can just as easily be chopped up to my own lack of perception as it can be blamed on any lack of intuitiveness in the game. Overall, it's a fun romp and a good laugh. Well done, Double Fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993516952', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1526707907}
review: Fantastic adv game that plays like a silly child's cartoon, a la Looney Tunes. Smart puzzles, very interesting time travel mechanics and jokes galore. Should you get stuck, there are plenty of lenient hint sites around, but definitely give it an honest go before you give in.

review:
√Ñu√üerst geduldige und verst√§ndnisvolle Spieler, die √ºber allerlei technisch Veraltetes hinwegsehen k√∂nnen, Spa√ü an purem Point-and-Click finden k√∂nnen und sich von konterintuitivsten R√§tseln nicht abschrecken lassen, die k√∂nnten tats√§chlich viel Spa√ü an diesem Spiel finden.

Wer sich unter "Remastered" ein wenig mehr erwartet wie prim√§r blo√üe Aufh√ºbschung, sich bei Point-and-Click intuitiv l√∂sbare R√§tsel w√ºnscht, auf deren L√∂sung sich auch eigenst√§ndig kommen l√§sst und mit technisch veraltetem Gameplay noch niemals wirklich warm geworden ist, der sollte die Finger von diesem Titel lassen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198094432643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1525664478}
review:
A classic point-and-click adventure game, though some of the puzzles are on the silly side if that isn't your bag.

Pros:
+ light-hearted slapstick humour
+ imaginative, if paradoxical, time-travel puzzles
+ select from updated artwork, or classic pixel version
+ different menu systems available (dial/verb menu)
+ now includes Save/Load options for the original Maniac Mansion (a deterrent to playing MM in the original version of DotT)

Cons:
- the remastered animations have a strange quality to them that I can't put into words... not as fond of the remastered cutscenes compared to the originals
- sometimes the captions can't keep up with the audio, especially in Remastered mode
- "." skips text but not animations
- some of the animations seem stilted (Bernard takes far too long to react to successfully getting the cigar)

I do still like DotT best of the original LucasArts titles, and it belongs in the library of every point-and-click connoisseur. Definitely pick it up during a sale if you can!

author: {'steamid': '76561197991845568', 'num_games_owned': 2241, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1525303831}
review:
Last time I played this game was something like 20 years ago and I remembered it fondly.
Original looked fine and it was good sprite work, but this remaster looks even better in my opinion - it shows the cartoon style even better. And if you hate it, you can go back to original without issue, but in 1440p this remaster looks gorgeous.
Humor is great in this game and it is somewhat random, just like other LucasArts classics - and so are the puzzles. 
[spoiler]But personally, I like Sam and Max Hit the Road more and found it funnier, but that's my opinion ;)[/spoiler]
There is not much to say, really, because the game is as fun as it was, plays great, and it looks even better. What's not to like?
If you never played it and like point and click games, this game should be somewhere near top of your list to play, because you miss out on classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993680740', 'num_games_owned': 807, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 6165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6112, 'last_played': 1706574524}
review:
My [url=http://cheesetalks.net/porting_dott.php]previous article[/url] on my experiences with working on Day of the Tentacle Remastered cover a lot of my own history with the game, but don't dive deep into my feelings about the remastered edition itself - after all, the game was more or less finished before I came onboard and I had plenty of time to play through it before I started working on it.

Re-creating low fidelity assets with greater detail removes a degree of ambiguity that different players invariably fill with different impressions. To one person, a few pixels here, might be interpreted as a smooth shape, while to another, the pixel edges define something more jagged - are the ends of Laverne's fingers square or rounded? Are outlines fixed or varying width?

Interpreting a low fidelity work at a higher resolution is daunting work, and having now done a little of that sort of work myself, I can appreciate the potentially conflicting sense of opportunity and responsibility that that represents. I can also appreciate that the very act of removing that ambiguity will generally alienate or disappoint whatever portion of the low fidelity version's userbase didn't have interpretations that align with the higher resolution version.

With that in mind, I feel that Day of the Tentacle Remastered does a decent job. It embraces the original game's cartoon influences and for the most part maintains the original colour palette. There are a few stylistic inconsistencies (for example, some of the moon-lit trees in the intro cutscene have a smooth gradient on them, while others have discrete bands of colour) and less-faithful interpretations of small details (such as Bernard's mouth during the intro cutscene), but on the whole, it's pretty solid.

The remastered UI lets the game's visuals take up the full screen and presents interaction verbs as a radial interface instead of the Sam & Max Hit the Road/late Sierra adventure style cycling interaction cursor. From a usability perspective, the wheel is great, but it hides verbs that don't trigger unique responses/actions - something that feels like it reduces the possibility space that the verb bar originally represented, drawing attention to puzzle solutions that were originally a little less obvious and making hidden dialogue more discoverable. On one hand, I feel like this is a bit of a loss, as it feels like it affects the game's pacing and reduces periods of uncertainty during which players might reflect on the story and their actions. On the other hand, Day of the Tentacle was the first LucasArts game to feature a contextual hint system (presented as "meanwhile" cut aways when enough time has passed without the player making progress on a certain puzzle) and was full of cues and shortcuts to reduce friction, and maybe this is a natural progression of that - it just takes things a little too far for my tastes.

Building on the options available in the Monkey Island 2 Special Edition (upon which DotT Remastered's codebase is based), Day of the Tentacle Remastered lets players to toggle new and old music, UI and graphics independently - something that seems to be one of its most appreciated features as it allows existing players to start with the game they love and add the bits they like without bringing the bits they don't, and allows new players to interactively explore and compare what's new and what's not.

It's still the game I know and love, but the one feature that I would have really liked to have had in the game would have been an option to review commentary tracks/review which ones still hadn't been found/listened to before. Without some hints on where to look, commentary tracks attached to obscure places can be easily missed, and that's a bit of a shame.

When I play, I usually go with remastered graphics and UI with original music. I'm not sure how much of it is nostalgia and how much of it is taste, but there's something about the original MIDI that resonates more with me. That said, I still can't hear the bird fall in the opening cutscene without feeling a sense of [url=http://cheesetalks.net/porting_dott.php#foot4]dread[/url] and [url=https://twitter.com/ValiantCheese/status/751269403623174144]panic[/url].

[i]This was originally written as part of [url=http://cheesetalks.net/gamesRoundup2016.php]a retrospective[/url] on games I finished in 2016.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198091094817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1529471220}
review:
This is one of my favorite games of all time.  I still have the box, CD and the little book.  Used to use an emulator to play it after computers got too high and mighty to run it so was VERY excited to see it on Steam. It's a point and click game with a good story and very funny dialog.  Lucas Arts made a lot of funny titles back in the day...this is one of the best.

Side note:  I don't recommend using emulators...they put real stress on the CPU!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974065567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1478273982}
review: One of my child hood games, spent many months trying to complete it. I never had Internet to look up walk through.... Or thought about it at least... Basically didn't cheat. It was fun trying many different options to try to solve puzzles and the glee you got when you did it write, often treated to a funny crazy cut scene.... Or in game event. Usually puzzles are logical, but the characters and story are wacky and crazy.... Just a fun enjoyable well put together game. This enhanced edition is great and doesn't lose any of its charm!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072298009', 'num_games_owned': 4503, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 2642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2642, 'last_played': 1507093238}
review:
Just like the original game, the original unchanged "Maniac Mansion" can be played on the computer in the room upstairs, so buying this game technically gets you both games, however the original is not remastered.

Classic Game, redone with updated graphics, audio, and voice acting.  Has the ability to switch between new and old style layouts just like other remastered LucasArts games.  Has commentaries that can be turned on, but play automatically over the current audio and could contain spoilers, so recommended to have them off unless you'e played the game before.  I missed this one when it came out so I had to turn this feature off.  Great game however, you control 3 different players at once (similar to Maniac Mansion and Thimbleweed Park).

------------------------------
Control Scheme I Used:
Keyboard and Mouse, point and click after all

------------------------------
Worth the current price (CDN$ 16.99)? If you're a fan of the genre for sure.
What I actually paid: $10.19

------------------------------
Completionist Review: 
DLC Achievements: No DLC.
Rating: Standard Adventure Game Style... a few random things.
Can be completed in one run: Yes
Chapter Select: Will need multiple save files, or a complete replay.
Did I need/use a guide? Probably for 1-2 achievements only.

This is no different than any other adventure game from LucasArts or other companies in terms of completion, most story related with a few others thrown in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975895891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 425, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1521505282}
review:
Ich habe das Original damals nicht gespielt, aber hab mich sehr gefreut, dass ich es als Remaster nachholen w√ºrde k√∂nnen. Man muss nicht erw√§hnen, dass es als Remaster an sich gelungen ist, aber das wusste ich ja vorher schon. Die Frage war haupts√§chlich, ob das Spiel denn gut ist. Die, f√ºr mich, wichtigsten Punkte im Folgenden:

1. Ich bin zwar kein Fan von Zeitreise-Stories, aber ich konnte bei Day of the Tentacle spielerisch sehr gut damit leben, weil das verschicken von Items in Zukunft/Gegenwart sehr angenehm gel√∂st wurde, sodass alles sehr flott geht ohne st√§ndig die gleichen Wege zur√ºcklegen zu m√ºssen, blo√ü um etwas auszuprobieren. 

2. Die R√§tsel sind die meiste Zeit gut l√∂sbar, da man durch entsprechende Dialogzeilen oder Beschreibungen von Hotspots schnell merkt, ob und was man machen k√∂nnte um das Problem zu l√∂sen. Es gibt zwar ein paar R√§tsel, deren L√∂sung nicht ganz so einfach ist, aber das meiste sollte f√ºr die aufmerksamen Spieler zu l√∂sen sein. Ist auch hilfreich, dass die Welt nicht zu vollgestopft ist mit unn√ºtzen Hotspots und der Bildschirm immer sehr √ºbersichtlich ist.

3. Die Story und Humor sind wohl Geschmackssache. Den Ansatz mit dem Tentakel fand ich zwar nett, aber die Charakt√§re und den Humor, da konnte ich dem Spiel nicht soviel abgewinnen. Es war okay, aber f√ºr mich an dieser Stelle in den Erinnerungen wohl √ºberbewertet. Au√üer dem Tentakel wird bei mir nicht viel h√§ngenbleiben von dem Spiel.


Fazit: Ich habe das Spiel zwar gerne nachgeholt, aber sehe es auch nicht als totales "Must-Have" der Videospielgeschichte. Lucasarts hatte st√§rkere Adventure. Wer aber zumindest ein Point and Click sucht, dass vor allem Comedy bieten will, dann kann man ruhig bei Day of the Tentacle sofort zuschlagen.

review:
Ya termin√© este juego en la ps4 - regalo del psPlus - y, aunque lo termin√©, no me ha convencido de todo.

No me ha gustado el sentido del humor y los puzzles eran - por lo menos para mi - demasiado complicados y extra√±os como para ser capaz de completar el juego sin ayuda de una gu√≠a para bastantes partes.

El juego es un remake de otro m√°s antiguo - de hecho en el propio juego puedes cambiar al estilo visual de la √©poca y jugar de forma completa al juego anterior a este a trav√©s de una m√°quina arcade - as√≠ que el humor del juego se puede explicar por ese detalle.

No es mal juego, pero a mi no me gustado nada por complicado y una historia poco llamativa que no me incitaba a continuar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036851146', 'num_games_owned': 1742, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1600970022}
review:
[b]This is game is completely weird. I love it![/b]

This is a classic point'n'click adventure stacked with a bunch of nonsense and hella weird riddles.
Some of the hints the protagonists give you are pretty strait forward while sometimes you have to think pretty far outside the box. The main plot point is that you and your friends have to save the world from an evil, mutated tentacle by traveling through time. You can operate in different timelines, change the future and send items to your friends to solve their puzzles, which is a neat feature.

Completing the whole story took me around 4.5 hours. But I gotta mention that I googled twice. First time I just screwed to use a VCR, because last time I used one was ten years ago. The second time I just couldn't see the wood for the trees. I had the item I needed right since the start and was just not able to combine the right components.

After eight hours I managed to get all achievements in the game and find all the secret dialogues and easter eggs. And believe me, the game is full of such. Brilliant character design, nice art style and neat story telling.

[i]If you like hard point'n'clicks, you gotta play this![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002555075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1520880444}
review:
Mein erster Gedanke war: "Und noch ein weiteres unn√∂tiges Remake..!" 

Hier habe ich mich aber definitiv get√§uscht. Im Gegensatz zum Remake von Monkey Island 1 z.B. ist die Steuerung dieses Mal sehr gut gelungen. Schaltet man Ingame dann mal mittels F1 auf den alten Stil um, sieht man dass das Spiel doch schon ein paar J√§hrchen auf dem Buckel hat. :p 

An der Story selber wurde nat√ºrlich nichts ver√§ndert und die schaffbaren Steam Achievements haben mich motiviert einfach mal einen DOTT Day einzulegen! :) Von mir gibt es, vor allem bei den derzeitigen "Angebotspreisen" eine ganz klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr Liebhaber des Originals!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994947653', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1520710778}
review: An old adventure game classic that has been wonderfully remastered to make it more palatable to a modern audience. Still holds up surprisingly well from when I last played it (20+ years ago). Would recommend to fans of the adventure gaming genre, or anyone thinking about trying one out (this isn't quite as impenetrable as Monkey Island).

author: {'steamid': '76561198807033432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1521044075}
review: I played this back in '93 and was immediately hooked. It was my first love of point-and-click adventure games. But I wondered if it would hold up in 2018. I was seriously very pleasantly surprised. There are certainly some elements that date this game, but overall, the creativity, writing, humor, and clever puzzles make this game hold up incredibly well. You can tell a ton of thought and detail went into it, and that's felt throughout. I recently played a bit of Broken Age and longed for the heydays of LucasArts. It just didn't compare. DOTT is where the inspiration lies. And this set the stage for the great Grim Fandango. Also, this is an excellent remastering. Loved the updated graphics and sound. And I was able to suppress their voices, which was good, because I preferred to read their dialogue and imagine their voices for myself. I'm looking forward to checking out the commentary!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036770967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1527942467}
review: Soo good. Such an awesome game from back in the day and really well remastered. I only wish i could wipe my memory clean and play it all over again not knowing what to do

author: {'steamid': '76561198413987657', 'num_games_owned': 3035, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1558005648}
review:
Advance warning, this review is written partially with nostalgia glasses as I played this and other Lucas Arts games back in the day <3 I had the remaster on my Steam wishlist and won it on Steam Gifts. I immediately binged on the HD remaster and then replayed it again with pixel graphics and commentary on. <3

Day of the Tentacle is a quirky game with bizarre (not just for the 90s) humour, and at times even crazier puzzle solutions. You really gotta think out of the box here to move forward sometimes. In this Point & Click Adventure, you have to prevent/undo Tentacle World Domination! (And no, this has NOTHING to do with certain Japanese animation. They're not that kind of tentacles.) With Hoagie stuck in the past and Laverne stuck in the future after your world saving effort went awry the first try, all characters have to work together to reunite in the present and try for a second time. By changing subtle details in the past, consequences will appear in present and future... Whether you let a hamster endure a century through unconventional means or let a mummy win a beauty pageant, there's whimsical fun in all corners of this adventure, including the dialogue options.

If you played this game before, the improved graphics, commentary and the steam achievements and cards just made it a whole lot better. If you haven't played this game before [strike]what's wrong with you[/strike] then you've been missing out on something hilarious. This cult classic is a must-have in any game library and a piece of gaming history (more info on that in the commentary, should you decide to play it with that on).

author: {'steamid': '76561198020912848', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1467410102}
review:
I loved this game as a child. I still love it as an adult. If you've never played what I would consider to be the best in the lucas arts style point and click adventure genre, then get this game. The characters are interesting, the story laugh out loud funny, and the puzzles are just the right balance of logic and wackiness the genre is built from. The added developer commentary was a nice extra and I enjoyed listening to it on my second playthrough.
The only downside was just how memorable this game was for me since I played it back on my first computer in the 90s, I could recall the vast majority of the solutions to the puzzles so there wasn't much challenge this time around. It was however an awesome nostalgia trip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198401836024', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1518468343}
review:
Hola. Antes que nada, quiero que entiendas que estas comprando.
A la hora de definir un juego, podemos decir que es un metodo de entretenimiento que baila entre "Narrativa" e "Interacci√≥n". Ambas, como regla, son ejes paralelos. Es decir, en ning√∫n momento podr√°n cruzarse, ya que cuando agregas narrativa, restas de interacci√≥n (Para poner un ejemplo, yo como desarrollador quiero que tu personaje hable con tal persona, para as√≠ destrabar una side quest, te estoy mandando por una narrativa, pues tendr√°s la interacci√≥n unicamente con el personaje al que yo te doy permiso).
Day of the Tentacle, se caracteriza por ofrecer la interacci√≥n como tarjeta principal, y deja la narrativa dentro de lo m√°s basico. Una aventura gr√°fica, comparable con los conocidisimos " Elije tu Propia Aventura", pero en formato digital. 
A grandes rasgos, uno puede limitarse a decir " Es bueno", otros dir√°n " Es malo".
Yo te dir√©, compralo. Es un hito en la historia de los videojuegos por un motivo, y no creo que puedas comprender dicha facultad limitandote a leer los analisis. Animate, pues como m√≠nimo tendr√°s la oportunidad de reirte mucho.

review: Per chi conosce Maniac Mansion e ha la passione per le avventure grafiche del periodo d‚Äôoro, The Day Of the  Tentacle √® un must irrinunciabile, da godersi in versione originale oppure nella fantastica versione aggiornata nella grafica e nelle musiche di gioco. review:
Never played the original version of the game but I preferred playing this in the classic view. Simple point & click game to solve puzzles to progress through the storyline.

Interesting idea of using three controllable characters where you are able to give items to one another that can be found in their respective worlds. So it makes you wonder which character needs that specific item and you must send it to the other person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198393817448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1517853174}
review:
Ho rigiocato a Day of the Tentacle dopo un bel po' di anni e devo dire che la versione Remastered √® perfettamente identica alla controparte classica nei contenuti, ma con grafica ed audio completamente rinnovati. Peccato per il mancato doppiaggio in italiano (il doppiaggio √® solo in inglese). L'interfaccia "azioni/inventario" √® stata migliorata e resa funzionale ai fini dell'utilizzo del mouse; a mio avviso, tale interfaccia √® migliore di quella presente nella Special Edition di The Secret of Monkey Island.
Il gioco √® la classica avventura "demenziale" punta e clicca della LucasArts, molto godibile nella trama e con enigmi di difficolt√† medio/alta. Il gioco dura poche ore, ma va considerato che per l'epoca (1993) era pi√π che sufficiente.
[spoiler]NOTA: Nelle vesti di Bernard, √® possibile giocare alla versione integrale di Maniac Mansion (capitolo antecedente Day of the Tentacle, ambientato cinque anni prima) utilizzando il personal computer che si trova nella stanza di Ed. Il gioco √® completamente in inglese.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198132323578', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1517432809}
review:
Jeu tout simplement culte et divinement barr√©. J‚Äôai longuement lorgn√© dessus, avant qu‚Äôun ami d√©cide de tr√®s gentiment me l‚Äôoffrir. Apr√®s avoir dress√© une statue √† son effigie pour cette superbe d√©couverte, il m‚Äôa fallu trouver quelques mots pour pouvoir en faire une review sur Steam.

Disons que le jeu vaut absolument le d√©tour pour son ambiance et son sc√©nario, compl√®tement d√©cal√©, dont les √©nigmes ne r√©pondent qu‚Äô√† la logique m√™me des devs‚Äô (M‚Äôenfin, faire dormir un ch‚Äôval pour r√©cup√©rer son dentier, peindre un arbre en rouge pour berner le grand Washington, etc.). Bref, il a fallu √©norm√©ment de courage et de patience pour les joueurs de l‚Äô√©poque qui sont parvenu √† terminer le jeu sans utiliser de soluce. Je dois avouer avoir craqu√© par moment et m‚Äô√™tre tap√© sur le cr√¢ne lorsque j‚Äôai d√©couvert comment r√©soudre une √©nigme sur laquelle je bloquais depuis quelques heures. 

Autrement, le jeu est √† essayer de toute urgence si vous √™tes friand des sc√©narios qui sortent de l‚Äôordinaire. Les personnages sont attachants, gr√¢ce √† des dessins et animations fid√®les √† leur personnalit√©. Parcourir le futur avec Laverne √©tait un r√©gal, d√©couvrir le pass√© en compagnie d‚ÄôHoagie et des p√®res fondateurs l'√©tait tout autant. J'ai un peu moins appr√©ci√© le personnage de Bernard et ses p√©r√©grinations, beaucoup plus classiques malgr√© la pr√©sence de la famille du Dr. Fred.

P√©tit b√©mol aussi pour la font utilis√©e pour les textes. Faite main, certes mais pas tr√®s lisible par moment. Il m'a fallu un temps d'adaptation avant de ne plus √™tre g√™n√© lorsque je lisais. 

Tordant, barr√© et culte. Trois mots qui d√©finissent finalement tr√®s bien cette aventure Schaffer et Grossman.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061686401', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1488168731}
review:
A hilarious point and click adventure game that received critical acclaim back in 1993. In [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i], you play as three teens who must work together through different time periods to thwart the plans of an evil tentacle. You'll do this by finding items and solving puzzles, all through humorous dialogue while enjoying the colorful cartoon visuals.

This remastered version allows you to switch between the original graphics and the updated visuals at the press of a button. There is also a developer commentary track as well as the ability to view old concept art. In addition to all of this, the original Maniac Mansion game is an unlockable, so you're basically getting two games for the price of one.

Everything about this game is a blast, as I genuinely can not think of any real downsides. [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] is a must play for fans of point and click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960420790', 'num_games_owned': 1549, 'num_reviews': 399, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1516468186}
review:
Good game. I played every other Lucas Arts adventure aside from this!

I always thought DOTT looked a bit rubbish compared to Indy4 or Monkey Island 2. Looking at it now, in hindsight, I suspect it's due to the way they downscaled the art for DOTT. If they'd only waited a few years they could have relesed it on the same SCUMM engine Monkey Island 3 was released on and I imagine it would have been fabulous.

So this remake is a welcome improvement (though I'm not totally sold on the way the HD art is presented)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031534770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 963, 'last_played': 1515967812}
review:
I've played this game for the first time in 2017. So I'm not influenced by any nostalgia. And it's now my favorite point'n click. You can switch any time between the three heroes, in their own path, to help them travel back in time. You can tell the guy had fun writing this delirious game. It's humoristic from start to end, through all enigmas, all dialogues, all situations. Strangely, there's kind of logic in all these puzzles, but it's still make you laugh when you find the solution.
It's hard, very hard, not predictable but I've never got annoyed and always felt the answer was close. You can find all of them by cleverness, without help of coincidence.
In this genre, it's clearly a masterpiece, a must-have game without any discussion about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148894348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1515955007}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080226932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1516015898}
review:
Depuis le temps que j'en entendais parler, il fallait bien que je me lance un jour. Et franchement, aucun regret.

Les animations sont magnifiques, les dialogues (et donc l'humour) juste g√©niaux, et la difficult√© juste comme il faut. Bravo LucasArt : d√©j√† que je consid√©rais Monkey Island et Grim Fandango comme des chefs d'oeuvre, tu n'as d√©cid√©ment pas fini de me surprendre (oui, j'ai d√©couvert le jeu un peu tard) !

Je dois quand m√™me avouer avoir bien tourn√© pour pouvoir avancer un petit peu, et certaines √©nigmes sont vraiment capillotract√©es (il faut aussi dire que j'ai mis trois ans √† comprendre la v√©ritable utilit√© des toilettes, j'en dis pas plus).

Bref, j'ai ador√© et je recommande √† 100%. Mention sp√©ciale pour le hamster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031001936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1463532334}
review:
This is another example of a classic point and click game done well. As a spin off from Maniac Mansion, I was skeptical when I first played this game years ago that it would try to be a fun game, but ultimately would fall flat. I was pleasantly surprised. Set in the same world as the original Maniac Mansion, the game thrusts three characters into chaos as one goes into the past, one into the future, and one stays in the present. All three of them must work through puzzles and finding items to get everyone back into the same time. Chopping down trees, spitting out dentures, and getting electrocuted by a kite are all adventures to be had, and in a hilarious way. The items needed to be used together or to complete puzzles are used in logical ways. There are few combinations that may seem frustrating, but they are few and far between. There are no random combinations that do not make sense. The game does not have a hint system and there are a few puzzles that will take a lengthy amount of time to figure out. Or you can check a guide. 

There are wonderful characters, such as the American founding fathers, who constantly fight with each other, the purple and green tentacles, Dr. Fred, and the main three characters you will play, Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne. The story and events that happen are consistently funny and never forced.

The graphics work perfectly for a zany, laugh out loud, silly story. The music is equally great as well as the solid voice acting. This is still an outstanding game from the 90's that will have you laughing and wish there were more games like it.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198165959236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1515717481}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048038590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 367, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 482, 'last_played': 1544138228}
review:
Day of the Tentacle,..wer kennt diesen Klassiker aus dem Hause Lucas Arts nicht? Naja gut, jeder der nicht das Gl√ºck hatte in den 80ern oder 90ern gro√ügeworden zu sein und somit eines der besten Adventure-Spiele spielen konnte, die jemals erschienen sind. Zusammen mit Monkey Island, Sam und Max Hit the Road oder Full Throttle geh√∂rt dieses Spiel eindeutig an die Spitze der Adventurespiele. Diese Version ist eine Remastered-Version mit sch√∂n aufgebesserten Originaltexturen sodass das Spiel in heutiger Optik erscheint.

Der Spieler √ºbernimmt in diesen Adventure die Kontrolle √ºber drei Protagonisten die unterschiedlicher nicht sein k√∂nnen. Zum einen haben wir Bernard, einen augenscheinlichen Nerd, dann Laverne die durchgeknallte Blonde im Bunde und Hoagie, einen Rowdie wie er im Buche steht. Diese drei leben zusammen in einer WG, bis eines Tages ein Hamster vor der T√ºr steht mit einem Brief f√ºr Bernard. So f√§ngt das Abenteuer an,...welches im Verlaufe der Geschichte dazu f√ºhrt, dass man Automaten knackt, absolut gegen den Tierschutz verst√∂√üt, den Vereinigten Staaten eine neue Flagge schenkt, unsagbare Dinge mit einer Mumie anstellt und mal eben 2 Millionen im Teleshopping verpratzt und viele viele andere Dinge anstellt die abseits jeglichen gesunden Menschenverstandes liegt. Und warum? Um die Menschheit zu retten!

Ich habe das Spiel damals in der Originalversion schon geliebt und bin sehr zufrieden mit dieser Remastered-Version. Einziger Nachteil ist, dass das Spiel in mehreren Zwischensequenzen einen Bug hat und ohne die √úberspringen-Funktion das Spiel nicht weitergeht, wodurch es unm√∂glich wird die letzten beiden Achievements zu erlangen. Wenn man nicht unbedingt die Achievements haben muss ist dieses Spiel auf jeden Fall empfehlenswert und nat√ºrlich f√ºr alle Fans der Adventure-Szene die diesen Klassiker zuvor noch nie gespielt haben.

Nachtrag: Die beiden letzten Achievements kann man im Fenstermodus erhalten, da im Fenstermodus die Zwischensequenzen nicht stehen bleiben, so habe ich es jedenfalls jetzt geschafft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045195484', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1508972481}
review: If, like me, you fondly remember the hinjinks of Maniac Mansion, then you will enjoy this game. It is much more plot driven than Maniac Mansion, but the humor and item flexibility is still there. Also, you can play Maniac Mansion on a console on the second floor of this game (so Maniac Mansion is basically included with this game). This game is more linear though. The controllable characters are set, and there is only one way to beat the game. Still a lot of fun though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139965182', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1518507427}
review: If you dig "Classic" point and click adventure games, such as Monkey Island, you will love this game.  If you haven't played games like this, you wil be hooked.  This game features great humor, and puzzles that don't hold you hand too much.  You can even play Maniac Mansion (the prequel to this game).  Worth the money and has pretty decent replay ability.

review:
Ten√≠a que pillarlo porque era un cl√°sico y porque as√≠ mi librer√≠a parece m√°s cool. No change.

review: Una maravillosa obra maestra de la mano de Lucasart. Icono del g√©nero de la aventura gr√°fica, que vino al mundo en 1993 gracias a Dave Grossman y Tim Schafer, entre otros.  Personajes carism√°ticos, di√°logos desternillantes, situaciones peculiares ,cuando menos surrealistas, con viajes en el tiempo incluidos. M√∫ltiples referencias a otros videojuegos y obras cinematogr√°ficas de la √©poca que podr√°s indentificar si est√°s atento . Si te gustan las aventuras gr√°ficas de principio de los a√±os 90 y todav√≠a no lo conoces, este es sin duda TU JUEGO. A la hora de disfrutar de √©l dispones de la opci√≥n m√°s pixelada y original, permitiendo que tu tambi√©n puedas transportante en el tiempo,  o la remasterizaci√≥n con una calidad gr√°fica m√°s contempor√°nea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079507138', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1710224994}
review:
10/I0

 was already excited when this was first announced. Day of the Tentacle is one of the games i played the most when i was a kid. And seeing it being remastered and just the fact that i was able to play one of the games from my childhood filled my heart with so much glee. 

I was blown away seeing how the animation and style was made much smoother, the interface is much easier to use and the ound being balanced out made reliving this much more worth it. 

And guess what, if you miss the old classic sprites and classic interface of old style point-and-click games? well with the press of a button, BAM!, you can now play in the classic style.

review:
Ein Klassiker aus dem Jahre 1993.
Einfach lustige Charakter Spr√ºche ect. :)
Ein sehr kniffliges Spiel wenn man gut ist und es zb. schonmal gespielt hat hat man es in 1 2h durch (Abz√ºglich von zwischen sequnzen und Dialogen dann so an die 3 4h) und sollte man nicht so gut durchkomme sind bis zu 8h Spielspa√ü drinne. Es ist ein must Have und sollte auf jedenfall mal gespielt worden sein :) Nostalgie f√ºr die Kids von Damals eine spanendes Erlebnis f√ºr die j√ºngeren unter Euch. Um die Nostalgie zu erh√∂hen kann man von der Remastereden Version auf die alte Grafik mit einem Knopfdruck umschalten GEIL!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967876062', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1514189494}
review:
The Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a cute little game and quite humorous.  I remembered when it originally came out and heard it was a fun adventure game, but I never got it or other great games like The Seceret of Monkey Island, etc because I've never really been into adventure style games.  However, when I saw the remastered edition on Steam and for a decent sale price, I decided to pick it up and at least try to experience it.

It's good.  

The main recurring complaint I've seen about the remastered edition is that the voice acting was bad and that it should have been updated or something.  I think this is kind of B.S. because I think people have gotten a little spoiled and used to modern games where game companies pay high priced actors to come in and do voices.  Day of the Tentacle came out in a different era of games production.  In early games most voice acting was done in-house by developers and such.  With that in mind, I actually enjoyed the voice acting.   I am actually glad they didn't re-do Laverne's lines with a new voice because once I got use to her, she was the most interesting.  I felt Laverne was very funny and fit with the personality in how she physically moves throughout the game.  Hogie was also quite funny as well.  Some of the jokes are a little dated, but overall still quite good.  The tentacles were all enjoyable too.

The story had a neat little premise and overall I am glad finally I picked up Day of the Tentacle Remastered. 

Thanks for the fun.

*edited spelling*

author: {'steamid': '76561197972925219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1514407184}
review: Un cl√°sico de Lucas Art al que siempre quize jugar, tuve la ocasi√≥n en estos d√≠as y me gusto. Este juego formo parte de la √©poca dorada de las aventuras gr√°ficas all√° por los a√±os de Monkey Island, Broken Sword, etc y que los m√°s viejos del lugar recordar√°n con nostalgia. review:
Juvenile "humor", if it was meant as an attempt at humor.
Didn't bother to "remaster" the voices, which sound like they were just done by whoever was nearby rather than anyone with talent.
No particularly clever puzzles.
Doesn't even come with the good version of Maniac Mansion from the NES, it's their ugly deformed-graphics beta version they released on floppy disk.
The people who made this are clearly completely useless without Nintendo backing them.

A hist√≥ria √© memor√°vel, os personagens s√£o carism√°ticos e o humor √© √°cido, se est√° procurando um jogo engra√ßado esse √© com certeza uma boa escolha. Quanto √† remasteriza√ß√£o, os gr√°ficos est√£o muito bonitos e o √°udio com uma qualidade excelente. Ainda √© poss√≠vel jogar a vers√£o original ao pressionar F1. author: {'steamid': '76561197971256349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1496221463}
review:
What a heap of crap.  Yes I did have it on CD-ROM, yes we are talking in the mid ninties.

Nostalgia got the best of me, so I decided to "have another go" some 20 years later.  

What a huge mistake that was.  My memories of this game were obviously, so very wrong.  It is a sad piece of crap!   
Illogical puzzles, to much toing and froing.  The jokes are more cringeworthy than any Jake Paul video.

Maniac mansion, the predecessor to this game.  Far, far, far superior, so superior, you could not get something that is more superior than what Maniac Mansion to DOT.  

I revisisted that one too btw.  (I remember having it on about 4 x 3.5" floppys for the amiga.) 

Download this heap of crap from abandonia or some free sight.  Play it for five seconds, relise I have saved you money!!!.

Your welcome!

author: {'steamid': '76561198115808199', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1527277910}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046578845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1482430839}
review:
I really recommend it. Great remake of an awesome old fashion game. I really hope that they remake Maniac Mansion.

For old fashion gamers it is a game worth to buy. You can choose to enjoy the new graphics, play with the game or even play the old Maniac Mansion. It is a very nostalgic and fun experience. For people who is less familiar with this kind of games it can be either an amazing experience or a frustrating one. I know that old fashion 'adventure games' have a very specific logic (try every conversation, touch everything and try to combine every object) and I understand that before enjoying this kind of games you need to understand it. But if you accept this 'game logic' it really becomes an enjoyable game. 
I really recommend it. Great remake of an awesome old fashion game. I really hope that they remake Maniac Mansion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 592, 'last_played': 1512922643}
review:
A time traveling point and click adventure where you control three different people in three different times trying to prevent an uprising by the Purple Tentacle. The puzzles are well designed and the humor is great, especially if you‚Äôve played a lot of adventure games in the past, as there are a lot of call backs. 

On the other hand, it isn‚Äôt very long. That said, it is worth picking up.

One last note, you can transport items through time by dragging them from one inventory and dropping them on the other two characters. This is much faster than the using items on the Chronotron and the only way to get Master Plumber in a reasonable amount of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970460797', 'num_games_owned': 974, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1466958984}

author: {'steamid': '76561197992913445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1512881235}
review:
I loved the cartoon style.  The pace was a bit slow compared to an actual cartoon.  But it was ruined by the unintuitive leaps of logic the game requires you to make to solve the puzzles.  Basically, you might have to try one of the 20 objects in your inventory with any of 100 random things in the environment.  How am I supposed to know to combine a squirrel with a battery?  They may have been focused on selling access to their hint phone line line back in the day.
If you do play it, do yourself a favor and have this walkthrough playing off to the side to refer to in case you get stuck...which will happen every 5 minutes.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eW283uY3sLI
(Remember, YouTube shortcuts are > to speed up and right arrow to skip forward 5 seconds.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970773304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 169, 'last_played': 1500419259}
review:
Grandpa: Hey Kids!
Kids: Hey Grandpa!
Grandpa: Do you wann know what games we played back in the 1990's?
Kids: Yay. (obvious lie)
Grandpa: We called them Point and Click Adventures. It was called Point and Click Adventures because we had to point at a certain spot on the screen and click it and it was very adventurous to find the exact pixel because we had no internet to google its location...
Kids: Whats a Pixel Grandpa?
Grandpa: Back in my days pixels where everywhere.
Kids: Even in Shooters?
Grandpa: Exspecially in Shooters!
Kids: What did those pixels do?
Grandpa: They annoyed us whenever they could. But then 3DFX Grafic accelerrators where invented and hexed us with thier voodoo (ultrapun).
Grandpa:... ...
Grandpa: Now that I think about it, that was about the same time when Point and Click Adventures suddenly dissapeared. I guess so cause it became to hard to point at the exact pixel and click it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311566279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1511469286}
review: Played this game so many times as a kid and it's just as much fun now. Fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027205841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1516227443}
review:
To me this is the best point and click adventure of all time. I played it numerous times before and now while playing remastered version I must say it haven't lost any of the old charm.

Story, characters and puzzles are all funny and even silly. Some puzzles could seem difficult and illogical but figuring those out becomes very rewarding and funny experience because they have some silly logic that at the end just makes sense! Rare games are able to accomplish that.

Day of the Tentacle was one of the games that drawn me to the game industry. I was never fortunate enough to work on a real point and click adventure, but it's still an inspiration for characters, puzzles, dialogues... but also is an example of a great product which has equal quality of all game elements throughout the whole game. This, again, is something rare games are able to achieve.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997208286', 'num_games_owned': 1575, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1606593396}

author: {'steamid': '76561198314739827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1626850454}
review: This was always one of my favorite games as a kid. Back in the day when you played games, it was mostly console gaming - playing good games on the PC were uncommon. But one day I got this game, and how the gaming landscape changed for me! Fully-animated characters and cutscenes with voice-acting (on the CD-ROM version), puzzles that wracked your brain, and time travel to boot! I played the original "Maniac Mansion" for PC (and now you can too!) but this was such a wonderful sequel. I was delighted to find out this game got a remastered treatment, as newer (WinXP or above) systems won't really play the original anymore. This game should be played at least once to be appreciated, and is enjoyable for anyone regardless of their age.

A feladv√°nyok olykor nem k√∂nny≈±ek, de a legt√∂bb esetben logikusak. A remaster min≈ës√©gi munka, megmaradt az eredeti audiovizu√°lis vil√°g, csak a min≈ës√©ge lett korszer≈±. review:
I loved the original game back in the old days, this remastered version is exactly the same but with better graphics and optional commentary.  Puzzles are fun, especially with the time-travel aspect to consider, and story/dialog is funny!

I recommend to anyone who remembers the game and wants to relive the experience on modern hardware or to anyone who may have missed out (or wasn't born yet) looking for the perfect example of the best adventure games.

review:
One of the best (and funniest) adventure games of all times - now with improved graphics.
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197972001726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1567073890}
review:
Ein Klassiker aus meiner Jugend bekommt eine Neuauflage? Klar, dass ich dieses Spiel haben musste. Und ich wurde nicht entt√§uscht, denn das Spiel wurde 1:1 √ºbernommen und lediglich optisch und akustisch ansprechend modernisiert. 
F√ºr alle, die es nicht kennen: Day of the Tentacle ist ein Point&Click Adventure aus den 90ern, als dieses Genre Hochkonjunktur hatte und Lucasarts die Meisterschaft darin errungen hatte. Es ist der Nachfolger zu Maniac Mansion und kommt im √ºberdrehten Comic-Look daher. 
Die Story ist dabei herrlich bl√∂dsinnig: ein lila Tentakel - "Purpur" genannt - trinkt einen Schluck verseuchtes Wasser und mutiert zu einem Super-Tentakel mit Armen, das die Welt beherrschen will.
Dr. Fred, der das Desaster ausgel√∂st hat, schickt die Freunde Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne mit je einer zur Zeitmaschine umgebauten Toilette in die Vergangenheit, um das Problem r√ºckg√§ngig zu machen. Dummerweise explodiert der Diamant, mit dem die Maschine betrieben wird und Hoagie landet in der Kolonialzeit, Bernard bleibt in der Gegenwart und Laverne landet in einer fernen, von Tentakeln beherrschten Zukunft. 
Das Ziel ist es nun, die Freunde wieder zusammenzubringen: Bernard muss einen neuen Diamanten besorgen, Hoagie braucht eine Stromquelle und Laverne hat in der Zukunft ganz eigene Probleme. 
Der Clou: man spielt alle drei Charaktere (bzw. zun√§chst nur Hoagie und Bernard) und kann gefundene Gegenst√§nde durch die Toiletten in die jeweils andere Zeit sp√ºlen. Hoagies Aktionen in der Vergangenheit wirken sich dabei direkt auf die anderen Zeitlinien aus, wodurch dort bestimmte Probleme umgangen werden k√∂nnen. 
Die R√§tsel sind allesamt logisch und durch die Dialoge mit den unz√§hligen Figuren bekommt man teils recht eindeutige Hinweise zur L√∂sung. Da aber von Beginn an die meisten Areale begehbar sind, ist es gar nicht so einfach, die ganzen M√∂glichkeiten im Blick zu behalten. Schnell hat man einen wichtigen Ort vergessen oder einen offensichtlichen Gegenstand √ºbersehen. Hinzu kommt noch das Tauschen der Gegenst√§nde √ºber die Zeiten hinweg. Somit geh√∂rt DotT trotz aller Logik definitiv zu den anspruchsvolleren Titeln. 
Der Humor ist aber einzigartig, die Figuren herrlich schr√§g und die Ideen wunderbar originell. Nur ein paar Stichworte f√ºr Kenner: Linksh√§nder-Hammer, Ozo der Clown, die Mumie, George Washington, die Steuerfahnder, entkoffeinierter Kaffee, tiefgek√ºhlter Hamster...
Zur Technik: die Grafik ist nun hochaufgel√∂st und das Bild wurde auf Breitbild angepasst, indem die Men√ºleiste und das Inevntar am unteren Bildrand weggefallen bzw. ausgeblendet wurde. Zus√§tzlich wurden ein paar subtile Effekte, wie Unschr√§fe, Schatten und andere Details eingef√ºgt.
Die Soundeffekte wurden an einigen Stellen aufgepeppt, entsprechen aber sonst weitgehend dem Original. Die deutsche Sprachausgabe wurde 1:1 √ºbernommen, klingt dabei nicht so professionell, wie es in modernen Grafik-Adventures heutzutage √ºblich ist (z.B. in Edna bricht aus), aber die Frage ist, ob das h√§tte sein m√ºssen, denn f√ºr den Kenner muss es der O-Ton sein, schlie√ülich kommt dadurch ein St√ºck der alte Charme zustande.
Das Interface ist nun kontextbasiert und bietet √ºber ein Kreismen√º die g√§ngigsten Funktionen an. Unz√§hlige Steam Errungenschaften runden das ganze schlie√ülich ab. 
Fazit: nach fast 25 Jahren hat es mir wahnsinnig Spa√ü gemacht, dieses Spiel erneut zu zocken und trotz diverser Vorkenntnisse dauerte es gut f√ºnf Stunden bis zum Abspann, da eben nicht mehr alles gel√§ufig war. F√ºr Anf√§nger sicher eine harte Nuss, aber immer fair und l√∂sbar. Die einzige Strafe, die man bekommt, wenn man nicht optimal spielt, ist das Laufen von Umwegen.
Daumen hoch und ich hoffe, dass dieses Remake Schule macht und auch die anderen Klassiker, wie Indiana Jones 4 oder The Dig eine Remastered Version erhalten. Ich w√ºrde jedenfalls sofort zuschlagen...

review:
Here's why I think this game should be nominated for a steam award in 2017:

The whole point of this game is for everybody to work together in order to be able to come home.  Teamwork is the complete opposite of conflict.  The fact that the game has an INSNAE sense of humour furthers it's point.  If you want to play a game that is non-violent, yet provides a GREAT cranial workout, this game is a must!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960594988', 'num_games_owned': 778, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1621344368}
review:
Day of the Tentacle habe ich vor vielen Jahren; das m√ºsste etwa 1995 gewesen sein, mit und bei meinen Freunden in der Nachbarschaft als 12 j√§hriger J√ºngling zum ersten mal spielen d√ºrfen. Bereits den Vorg√§nger Maniac Mansion habe ich gespielt,  allerdings nicht ann√§hernd so intensiv und bewusst wahrgenommen, wie seinen Nachfolger.
F√ºr mich ist DOTT daher der absolute Inbegriff des Point and Click Genres. 
Damals wie Heute bin ich vor allem von der witzigen, verr√ºckt-verdrehten und raffinierten Storyline sowie den liebevollen handgezeichneten Grafiken begeistert. 
Die Kombination aus abswechslungsreicher Story, sch√∂nen Grafiken, witzigen Dialogen und einem herausforderndem Schwierigkeitsgrad machen es zu einem ganz besonderen Spiel.
Was aktuelle Point and Click Games angeht, bin ich nicht mehr up to Date, allerdings w√ºrde ich dennoch pauschal behaupten, dass sich die DOTT-Remastered Edition heutzutage nicht zu verstecken braucht.
Die Grafik kann auf den OldSql Look umgestellt werden, was alle Nostalgiker, die es damals schon gezockt haben, analog zum Spiel auf eine Zeitreise der ganz besonderen Art schicken d√ºrfte.
Die neuen Grafiken sind allerdings sehr gut gelungen, kaum ver√§ndert und treffen den Charme der damiligen Zeit perfekt.
Zum Inhalt selbst m√∂chte ich garkeine gro√üartigen Worte verlieren.  
Man muss sich einfach selbst auf diese Zeitreise begeben! 

Ganz klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr Jung und Alt. F√ºr R√ºckkehrer und Neueinsteiger!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960304071', 'num_games_owned': 2778, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1697374539}
review:
Ich habe DOTT damals 1993 mit 11 Jahren nach Installation mehrerer Disketten zum ersten Mal gespielt und lieben gelernt. 
Ein absoluter Klassiker und ein Muss f√ºr jeden Fan des Point & Click Adventures. 
Ich m√∂chte in meinem Review einfach auf nichts eingehen weil ich nichts spoilern m√∂chte. DOTT muss man einfach spielen und selbst erleben. 
DoubleFin hat mit dieser Remastered Version alles richtig gemacht und durch die vielen Ausbesserungen hat das Spiel absolut nichts an Charme verloren. Absolut zu empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091489118', 'num_games_owned': 2272, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1605381295}
review:
There are few games that manage to traverse time, few that manage to stay current, regardless of the developments of each generation. These are games that captivate the imagination and manage to attract even those hostile to the genre. Day of the tentacle is such a game, filled with overinflated, amazingly funny and memorable characters.

It is both an adventure game and a movie at the same time and its filled with truly funny moments and clever puzzles that will stay with you for the rest of your life.

The story is absolutely hilarious and so over the top that you cant help but want to see it through to the end. The remastered version graphics are simply great and I doubt it will ever need to be remastered again, but even in its original incarnation it would still be a great game. Play it, love it, finsih it :)
