author: {'steamid': '76561197994571616', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1510979397}
review:
Si en los 90 te encandilaron las aventuras gr√°ficas de Lucas Arts, no dejes pasar la oportunidad de revivir El d√≠a del Tent√°culo con unos gr√°ficos redibujados para estar adaptados a los tiempos de hoy pero sin perder su esencia. Resulta m√°s c√≥modo el men√∫ de acciones nuevo que el de verbos de toda la vida, y el inventario se oculta, dejando mas pantalla para ver el escenario.
Tienes la opci√≥n de jugar al juego tal y como era en su origen, alternando entre la versi√≥n cl√°sica y la remasterizada pulsando F1. Muy recomendable el jugar escuchando los comentarios de los creadores del juego, que si bien est√°n en ingl√©s, se muestran traducidos en unos subtitulos que salen en la parte superior de la pantalla,
Como en las aventuras gr√°ficas de la √©poca, tiene puzzles con los que puedes atascarte sin saber qu√© te falta o qu√© objetos utilizar sobre qu√© parte del escenario. Eso si, ¬°¬°sin llegar al extremo del puzzle de la cabra del Broken Sword!!
En aquella √©poca no era extra√±o tener que recurrir a amigos o incluso a escribir a una revista de videojuegos pidiendo ayuda. Hoy en d√≠a, si te atascas no hace falta pasarlo tan mal. Consultas una gu√≠a para ese puzzle y sigues adelante. No te sientas mal por ello, y si alguien se r√≠e de ti, r√©tale a un duelo de insultos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046169569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1558803672}
review:
"Mutierte Tentakel wollen die Weltherrschaft √ºbernehmen und durch eine Zeitreise soll dies verhindert werden. Allerdings schl√§gt der Versuch fehl und so landen zwei der drei Hauptprotagonisten 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit bzw. 200 Jahre in der Zukunft. Somit sind sie darauf angewiesen sich durch Austausch diverser Untensilien, die sie durch ihre Zeitreise-Toiletten in die verschieden Epochen schicken k√∂nnen, und durch Beeinflussung ihres Umfeldes und Ausnutzen der vierten Dimension einander zu helfen, um die mutierten Tentakel aufzuhalten!"

Day of the Tentacle Remastered schafft es nicht nur, das Original mit seinem Charme und Witz unverf√§lscht aber dezent aufpoliert in das 21. Jahrhundert zu bef√∂rdern, sondern vielmehr auch jenen, die das Spiel im Original nicht gespielt haben, den Eindruck eines modernen und lustigen Adventures zu vermitteln. Mit seiner √ºberarbeiteten comicartigen Optik und dem zeitlosen Humor, wei√ü das Spiel voll zu √ºberzeugen. Gerade zum Angebotspreis sollte sich kein Point & Click - Fan diese Perle entgehen lassen. Ein erster Spieldurchgang dauert gesch√§tzt ca. 4 - 6 Stunden, aber wer das Spiel bereits kennt, wird eher 2 - 3 Stunden f√ºr einen Spieldurchgang ben√∂tigen. Allerdings k√∂nnen sich Errungenschaften-Sammler ohne Komplettl√∂sung auf einige Stunden mehr einstellen. Das Spiel ist √§u√üerst linear, aber ein gewisser Wiederspielwert ist den Errungenschaften, der tollen Optik und dem interessanten, wenn auch nicht allzu realistischen Zeitreise-Setting zu verdanken.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999627735', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1511644218}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Special Edition is a classic point and click adventure game originally created by Tim Schaefer for Lucas Arts. It is an enhanced version of the original game that sees completely redrawn graphics that replace the originals.

Pros:
The game has a cartoon art style as well as animation that is meticulously detailed without taking shortcuts like reusing frames when a unique one would work better. The game also plays like a cartoon as well, with the same silliness and gags that you would expect from a classic episode of Loony Tunes.
The major unique gameplay mechanic in DOTT is time travel, which lends much more depth to puzzles. Instead of dealing with one linear feeling storyline, there are 3 different time periods that interact with each other making for more unique gameplay and allows you to attempt many different puzzles in parallel which can interact with each other through the passing of time.
DOTT's puzzles are a bit more out there than your typical adventure game flair, but while they'll leave you scratching your head, when you solve them, you wont just feel accomplished, but it will also be hilarious.

Completely new re-drawn graphics:
In order to update the game for modern hardware, the graphics have been entirely re-drawn from scratch for HD displays. This makes for a much improved experience in the graphical department that sees a classic improved for modern use. Luckily the new graphics still exude the excellence of the original, meaning there is no loss of quality or feeling of the game.

Cons:
There is no in-game hint system to help them when they run into the few unintuitive puzzles, meaning the player will either have to tough it out, or consult an online guide. Both of which can be immersion breaking and disrupts the flow of enjoyment of the game.


Most of the puzzles in the game make sense, with item combinations that one can usually think about coming to a useful conclusion. But some of the puzzles take this a step too far and are not as logical in their conclusions, this can be frustrating for the player and may turn some people off of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153402206', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1683033017}
review:
[h1]Back to the day of adventure gaming[/h1]

[b]If you are an old gamer:[/b] This remake will take you back to the days of SCUMM. The days of two floppys and no hd computers where you used one floppy for DOS and one floppy for Maniac Mansion or Monkey Island.

[b]If you are a young gamer:[/b] You will experience a good old classic adventure game on a modern system and you will have a lot of fun.

[b]What does this game have to offer:[/b]

[list]
  [*] Entertaining story
  [*] Good humor (nothing your kids can't see, rated Teen for a few references but compared to today's TV this is super safe)
  [*] Great animations, cartoonish style. It was awesome back in the day!
  [*] The ability to switch between modern graphics and classic pixel graphics
  [*] Good voice acting & sounds
  [*] Classic point & click adventure
[/list]

If you are a fan of adventure games or want to see what all the hype was about back in the 90's then get Day of the Tentacle!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985640680', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1485688485}
review:
Mein allerliebstes Adventure...im neuen Gewand. Absolut Klasse wie Double Fine diese alte Spieleperle restauriert hat.

Kaufen,kaufen,kaufen....

author: {'steamid': '76561198294982069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1460432930}
review:
This was my favourite game in my youth. I've played it many times and have never tired of it.

It's fun, smart, interesting, well-paced, with good amusing puzzles. The best of the best of "Point and Click" games.

This new version prettys up the image and keeps the original recorded dialogue (which is great).

One downside, however, is that sometimes items aren't placed correctly within the 3 dimensional space. This is only mildly distracting and many may not even notice (except maybe now that you've read this!). A small quibble.

Great job, and thank you for bringing this game back!

author: {'steamid': '76561198003235908', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1911, 'last_played': 1558985962}
review:
The original was an amazing game, and this remake has allowed a new generation of gamers to experience the slapstick silliness and humor of this work of art. Is it perfect? No, but so many parts of the game are so memorable that they overshadowed the annoyances like illogical solutions or missing items.

Highest recommendation in the 'adventure' category.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101825184', 'num_games_owned': 1130, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1511028155}
review:
Jeu bourr√© d'humour, Day of the Tentacle est un jeu tr√®s r√©ussi.

N'ayant pas jou√© √† la premi√®re version du jeu, je trouve le remastered tr√®s r√©ussi (on peut switcher rapidement d'une version du jeu √† l'autre) et plus facile √† prendre en main pour un non habitu√© de ce type de jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970007557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1511139834}
review: Oh goodness. What a fantastic game. I played Maniac Mansion a long time ago on the NES. It was a brutally difficult but fun adventure game, I remember replaying it over and over again trying to find out what I missed. Adventure games back then had such odd solutions for puzzles that often you couldn't think it through and instead you had to try every single possible combination on everything. Day of the Tentacle, the sequel to Maniac Mansion, is no different. It is difficult but thoroughly entertaining. The game has aged well when playing even the old version. The new HD version offered with the remastered version doesn't just boast smoother and sharper graphics, but also an improved soundtrack and developer commentary. It has a wonderfully ridiculous story, interesting characters and top notch voice overs. It is quite difficult so before giving up on certain parts within the game I recommend looking up solutions online because some of them are so obscure you probably wouldn't be able to figure them out on your own. If you are a fan of adventure games or maybe used to be and are considering giving them a try again, Day of the Tentacle is a must buy.

review:
Das Spiel "Day of the Tentacle" war schon damals Kult. Die Szenen und Spielinhalte sind lustig umgesetzt und es bietet paar Stunden R√§tselspa√ü. Wer das Spiel nochmal erleben m√∂chte f√ºr den ist die Remastered Version genau das Richtige. author: {'steamid': '76561198052570888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1510490036}
review:
Cette version de "Day Of The Tentacle" (DOTT) est un remaster du jeu sorti originalement sur PC en 1993 qui lui-m√™me est la suite du jeu "Maniac Mansion" sorti en 1988 (!). On y retrouve le personnage de Bernard qui, accompagn√© par deux amis Hoogie et Laverne, devra sauver l'humanit√© de l'emprise des tentacules, le tout dans un monde aux graphismes cartoonesques. 
L'humour et les anachronismes sont omnipr√©sents dans cette aventure qui se d√©roule simultan√©ment dans trois p√©riodes temporelles : le pr√©sent, le pass√© colonial et un futur dystopique. On y rencontrera au passage toutes sortes de personnages : des arch√©types excentriques, des tentacules anthropomorphiques et m√™me des personnages historiques effront√©s.
Le gameplay et les graphismes (liss√©s) ont √©t√© modifi√©s de mani√®re √† davantage coller aux standards actuels mais il est toujours possible de passer en mode "original" et de jouer au jeu comme il y a 25 ans. 
La difficult√© est sans doute moins relev√©e que dans son pr√©d√©cesseur mais on passe tout de m√™me un tr√®s bon moment. Comptez environ 5h pour terminer le jeu en ligne droite mais largement plus si vous vous attardez sur tous les dialogues et les r√©f√©rences cach√©es ici ou l√† (mon temps de jeu est bien inf√©rieur car j'avais d√©j√† termin√© le jeu sur iOS).
Quelques petits bugs sont parfois pr√©sents (notamment des d√©calages entre les sous-titres et le son/les animations) mais ces rares inconv√©nients ne doivent pas vous emp√™cher de foncer sur ce grand classique du jeu vid√©o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243443620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1510032489}
review:
Classic Lucasarts title from when they ruled the genre. It's funny, has a wonderful cartoon aesthetic, entertaining puzzles and everyone looking to buy it already knows all this. It's a masterpiece you should force your kids to play while they can still appreciate old games.

The remastered edition unfortunately does no justice to the artstyle. It may just be nostalgia glasses, but it really put me off - fortunately you can switch right back to pixel art. Everything else works seamlessly.

review: My favourite title of the ye olde LucasArts classics. It's not so easy to make me laugh, but it's impossible not to chuckle at the American flag redesign and other such unexpected consequences of time travel. The well-written protagonist trio are likeable characters and fit perfectly in this fun little story. Well worth the money and I spent a surprising number of hours with the game. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026999552', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1510035456}
review: A point-n-click puzzle classic. While they require a fair bit of experimentation -- as all puzzles in such game did in that era -- the puzzles aren't TOO random, and make sense once you finally figure them out. If you played Grim Fandango, I found Grim Fandango's puzzles to make less sense, overall. The humour is too American-cartoon-like cheesy, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964641301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1485323268}
review:
When you think about classic adventure games, you simply can't forget this title. I can still remember the first time I've played, where you still had to use that code card to avoid piracy. Well, not only that. Since back in the day there wasn't internet available, whenever you'd get stuck in a certain part of the game, you had two options: Find a magazine with some hints, or find a friend that could help you out. 

Ok, things changed, now everything is so much easier and it was really refreshing to play that game again. I was really surprised to find out that I remembered how to solve almost every puzzle in the game (only got stuck in a couple of parts). The story is cool, the characters are really funny, the music and sound effects are great too. The graphics are still pretty much the same, and I don't think that it's a bad thing at all. 

Yeah, since the original game is so old, there's no better way to describe it than with memories and nostalgia. Either way, I still think that new players who are into the adventure genre can have a lot of fun while playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994971393', 'num_games_owned': 2927, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1509662189}
review:
A very cute adventure game. I never played the original, so I was coming into this with no expectations or nostalgia. I would say that it stands up well to modern adventure game design, and the few rough spots it has are more than made up for by the very unusual characters and amusing dialog.

Rough spots: The animations and dialog can be a bit tediously slow. I don't know if this is an intentional nod to the source material, but I found it a little annoying to wait for tentacles to jump across the screen just so that dialog could continue.

Some of the solutions were pretty out there. But they were at least able to make fun of themselves for it ("You Call That A Hint" achievement). But some of the solutions involved more "try everything in my inventory on every possible target" attempts than I would normally like.

Cool spots: As stated, the characters are very interesting and amusing. But it also uses a very clever "three-state" configuration for most puzzles in the game, where you have to interact with the puzzle from the perspective of each of your three characters in order to solve it. Those were quite fun to play. Also, their game-within-the-game was surprisingly well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991638297', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1509558582}
review:
[b]My rating:[/b] 9/10
Based on: one full playthrough

[b]Full disclosure:[/b] I played and enjoyed the MS-DOS original around the turn of the century on my first home PC along with its predecessor embedded inside, Maniac Mansion, which I previously played on my Commodore 64 a decade or so back.

[b]Pros:[/b]

(+) nutty storyline involving 3 playable characters (clever but awkward nerd Bernard, lazy but wise-cracking roadie fatso Hoagie and loopy but sassy Laverne) stranded in 3 distinct time periods (the present, the colonial past and the dystopian future) trying to stop a purple tentacle monster hell bent on world domination
(+) a varied cast of supporting characters including quirky archetypes, cheeky historical figures and anthropomorphic tentacles
(+) unique time travel, inventory sharing and character switching mechanics involving high-end, state-of-the-art porta-potties
(+) freedom to explore the interconnected time periods (worlds)
(+) the wickedly irreverent and hilarious writing by the supreme LucasArts trio of Dave Grossman, Tim Schafer and Gary Winnick, ranging from potty jokes and clever easter eggs to high-brow references, delivered through the remastered, deliberately cartoonish voice acting
(+) wacky, often slapstick humour and animations reminiscent of classic cartoons with the original hand-drawn art style by the masters Peter Chan and Larry Ahern redone completely, but respectfully and beautifully in high resolution and with full widescreen support
(+) the properly goofy SFX and music are a blast from the past, but hold up splendidly, especially remastered
(+) the classic point-and-click controls improved by substituting the original unintuitive SCUMM command syntax with a streamlined radial selection menu
(+) logically sound puzzles with only a few verging on the absurd, their solving aided a bit by some easily missable hints hidden in cutscenes, conversations and throw-away lines
(+) you can switch back and forth between the original and the remaster at the press of a button
(+) the first Maniac Mansion is still playable in-game, a feature unheard-of in 1993, but imitated many times since
(+) newly introduced Steam achievements make for thorough exploration and manic experimentation
(+) vast concept art gallery and extensive developers‚Äô commentary by Schafer, Grossman, Chan and Ahern, along with the composers Peter McConnell and Clint Bajakian
(+) perfectly playable with a mouse and keyboard, but analogue controllers are also supported
(+) expanded language options: English, French, Italian, German and Spanish interface and subtitles options, but only English and German audio
(+) another fine and masterful remaster from Double Fine overall worth paying through the suction cup for (all puns intended)

[b]Cons:[/b]

(‚àí) developers‚Äô commentary sometimes plays on top of the on-screen dialogue, which makes it confusing to hear
(‚àí) infrequent, but annoying stops in character dialogue delivery while waiting for the subtitles to catch up
(‚àí) some background dithering and low-framerate animations are more noticeable on a modern widescreen monitor
(‚àí) occasional textual mistakes in developers' commentary subtitles (not enough proof-reading?)
(‚àí) the first Manic Mansion playable in-game has not been remastered, only updated with a new menu, including a save/load/resume feature
(‚àí) minimal hand holding (some easily missable hints can be gleaned from cutscenes or conversations, but there‚Äôs no journal nor check-lists to remind you)
(‚àí) some of the more complex and multi-step puzzles may throw you for a (time) loop
(‚àí) not nearly enough tentacles for hentai enthusiasts ;-)

[u]Check out my reviews of other Double Fine‚Äôs games:[/u]
[url=steamcommunity.com/id/CamAddLess/recommended/232790/]Broken Age[/url]
[url=steamcommunity.com/id/CamAddLess/recommended/225260/]Br√ºtal Legend[/url]

review: Point and click adventure games used to be the kings of the PC Gaming mountain, and this game shows exactly why. Don't expect any white-knuckle action or tense moments--this game is for those who love lateral thinking and quirky story telling.  If you've never experienced it, now is the time. It's the best paced Lucas Arts adventure game and its puzzles never get so obtuse as to need a guide. And it's funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035822222', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1509317900}
review:
Another LucasArts classic point-and-click adventure, and a good one, to say the least! If you are a fan of LucasArts games, you need no reviews for this one, but if you find this game on a sale or Steam recommends it to you, here are a few things worth noting before you try it and rate it negatively.

1. Humorous point-and-click adventures from LucasArts are known for their quite silly logic in terms of combining items and using them on the environment. Often you have to think very out of the box to progress further. Or just force your way by trying each and every item in the inventory on eveything until it works. This gets a lot easier the more you play such games, but be warned.

2. LucasArts adventures often have quite a lot of puns to real world events and phenomenae, and also many hidden references to their previous products, like Monkey Island series or Grim Fandango. So many in-game jokes might not be funny for you at all.

3. The general way LucasArts point-and-click adventures are built is that at the beginning of the game you have a task that seems to be quite easy to complete, but the whole game consists of an enormous amount of silly obstacles preventing you from completing that task. Say, at the beginning of the game you might just need to cut a rope, but you won't be able to find or craft anything that is able to cut the rope until the very end of the game. Which makes most of the fun, of course.

Hope this helps you to judge this great game honestly, and I really enjoy you would have as much fun while completing it as I did.

Reconozco que me gana tambi√©n por el v√≠nculo sentimental de ser un chaval que se aficionaba a los ordenadores cuando aparecieron pero esta destaca por el nivel de gr√°ficos, sonidos, humor, nivel de los puzzles, originalidad en la historia...

Esta versi√≥n remasterizada es justo lo que necesitaba aquella vieja aventura que he jugado en multitud de ocasiones en emuladores. Un lavado de cara de los gr√°ficos y el control para que no chirr√≠e en los tiempos actuales.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980796094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1509051160}
review:
I played the original. I had a rush of nostalgia. Then I pressed F1, which - in real time - switches from the modern look to the original 4:3 640x480 look with countable pixels. My memory of the game's original look should have never come back. 

The point and click adventure is one of the best of its genre. That means three things:
- It looks great with its humor fitting toonish visuals.
- It has a funny and very strange story, that is compelling to follow through. It has timetravel and mutations!
- Most importantly, it has rather logical puzzles or well implemented hints through "meanwhile"-cutscenes or commentaries on different things with few exceptions. That means depending on your awareness you probably don't need a walkthrough.

Play it, it is rightfully a classic! 

Follow my curator at http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28337205-Fair-Minded-Witness/?appid=680310

PS: George Washington and Harold the Pet have the same face. Noticed?

author: {'steamid': '76561198028724797', 'num_games_owned': 1480, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1509008362}
review:
Voto: 8/10 

Questo gioco √® un regalo di mio fratello. Avevo l'originale ma √® successo qualcosa di brutto: https://videogamegeek.com/geeklist/231309/item/5700790#item5700790 

La versione rimasterizzata √® tanto buona quanto l'originale, la grafica aggiornata ricostruisce perfettamente quella vecchia (molto pi√π di quella in monkey 1 e 2). L'ho apprezzato davvero tanto. 

Come sempre si pu√≤ passare alla vecchia versione del gioco semplicemente premendo un tasto. 

L'unico problema che ho avuto √® inerente ai sottotitoli e alla voce, che non combaciava e causava lunghe pause nella seconda met√† del gioco. Ma per fortuna c'√® un tasto speciale (il punto) che si pu√≤ premere per saltare un dialogo, quindi in qualche modo il problema  √® gestibile. 

Non ricordavo la maggior parte degli enigmi (ci ho giocato nel 1994 o '95!) quindi mi sono divertito a raccapezzarmici da capo! 

Molto consigliato! ^^

+ Grafica perfettamente rimasterizzata

author: {'steamid': '76561198002790851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1509006205}
review:
Ein gutes Spiel aber warum trotzdem einen Daumen nach unten?

Ich besitze das Originalspiel, welches unter SCUMM auch heute noch einwandfrei funktioniert, wenn ich also 15‚Ç¨ in ein Remake investiere muss es sich folglich auch lohnen, leider hat es sich f√ºr mich nicht gelohnt ;(
1. Die Story des Spiels ist identisch mit dem Original, alle Konservationen sind identisch, also rechtfertigt die Story alleine nicht den Kauf des Remakes.
2. Die Grafik wurde klar verbessert, sieht zwar ab und zu so aus als wurde einfach der 4xBR-Filter angewendet aber dennoch eine Bereicherung f√ºr das Spiel.
3. Musik und Soundeffekte wurdem angeblich verbessert aber neue Sounds und Musikst√ºcke wurden nicht implementiert. Eine gro√üe √Ñnderung erfuhr die Tonspur: Hier haben ein paar Laien sehr unprofessionell ihre Stimmen den einzelnen Protagonisten geliehen, dabei haben durchaus auch einzelne Sprecher mehrere Charaktere synchronisiert. Alle Stimmen kommen irgendwie unmotiviert und lustlos r√ºber.

F√ºr mich sieht das Spiel so aus, als h√§tten es ein paar Hobbyprogrammierer in ihrere Freizeit erstellt. Daran ist nat√ºrlich nichts verwerfliches und ich ziehe meinen Hut f√ºr dieses Engagement aber ein Preis jenseits der 5‚Ç¨ halte ich f√ºr dieses Spiel, deren Programmierer den gr√∂√üten Teil, also die Stroy, einfach kopiert haben, f√ºr √ºberteuert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040485548', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1655371964}
review:
If you like Point and Click adventure games then this is a great one to play, even if you haven't played a Point and Click before then this is a great game to start with.

 ‚Ä¢ The cartoony visuals are great, if you prefer playing it in the original pixaly visuals then that's an option as well.
 ‚Ä¢ The characters are lovable, they certainly won't bore you with their oblivious minds and goofy antics.
 ‚Ä¢ The story isn't too long, but it isn't too short either. If you know exactly what you gotta do then you can beat this game in less than an hour.
 ‚Ä¢ You can get every achievement in a single run, considering if you know what you gotta do.
 ‚Ä¢ There were some times playing this game where I got stumped and had to use a guide, the game is simple but it does have it's moments where you're like "Ah! There we go!"

It's one of the more lasting Point and Clicks out there, but if you played it once there isn't really a reason to go back other than cleaning up some achievements or nostalgia.
7/10 -  Good game for your first Point and Click that isn't TellTale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995424732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1483500712}

author: {'steamid': '76561198025484337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1514666598}
review:
Viele haben es schon geschrieben: Tolles (und in der Historie wichtiges) Spiel. die R√§tsel, Dialoge und die verbesserte Grafik sind schon ne schicke Sache.
Doch warum gebe ich ein Daumen runter? 
Bei mir ist das Spiel extrem verbuggt. 
Es ist mir w√§hrend des Intros einfach stehen geblieben, jedoch l√§uft dann dennoch die tolle Musik im Hintergrund. 
Dachte am Anfang "hm... vielleicht irgendein Problem beim Installieren".

Erstmal Fehler korrektur gemacht und nix gefunden. dann nochmal installiert und es lief... jedoch nicht lange: Obwohl ich jetzt 3/4 des Spiels druch bin, ist pl√∂tzlich der gleiche Fehler passiert. Ein Raum verlassen und dann war nix mehr zu sehen. Jedoch lief wieder die Musik. Dies ist einfach nur Schade, da dies komplett aus dem Spiel haut und man somit immer angst haben muss, dass es im n√§chsten Raum wieder einfriert. Jetzt k√∂nnte man sagen, dass es vielleicht meckern auf hohen nivau ist, da doch die Speicherst√§nde automatisch bei jeden erfolg doch dann vorhanden sind. Dies ist leider nicht der Fall bzw. wird es ausgew√§hlt, darf man gern raten, was ich sehe und h√∂re... 

Also funktionieren nur die selbst erstellten Speicherst√§nde und bei jeden Gang zu speichern ist echt nervig und da Spiele ich doch lieber die CD aus den 90iger. 

Falls dieses Problem gefixt wird, kann man das Spiel nat√ºrlich eine 9 von 10 geben und definitiv weiter empfehlen.
Ich freue mich schon, wenn die ganzen Indiana Jones Teile remastered werden

author: {'steamid': '76561197992552621', 'num_games_owned': 501, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1527437918}
review:
I was really impressed by Day of the Tentacle. Typically I usually find point and click adventure games to have obtuse puzzles   which halt progress, and I was able to complete this game on my own without any outside help. 

There are a ton of puzzles in this game but they seem smaller, more modualr. There was never a point where I couldnt do   something else if I couldnt figure out what I was doing wrong. Alo there are a ton of items so if you get stuck you can try new combinations or talk to non player charecters for possible hints through conversation. 

Which isnt to say there arent frusterating parts. The game still uses cartoon logic and some things might not make sense right away. But through taking breaks and trying new things I was able to finish the game and that contrubited to my enjoyment of it. 

Also the game Maniac Mansion is available inside Day of the Tentacle as an Easter Egg. I played that game a long time ago on NES and while it hasnt aged as well it is a really nice touch for a trip down memory lane. I recommend this game if you are a fan of the genre or as a jumping on point if you havent played a point and click adventure game before.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971267030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1477804763}
review:
[i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i] is a great way to revisit the golden ages of adventure games. As a game in its own right, it employs roughly the right level of moon logic to be charming while avoiding most of the big pitfalls of insane adventure game puzzles. And as a remaster, it's one of the best around.

What makes [i]DotT[/i] largely unique among adventure games is its extremely loose structure. You're free to jump between three characters & time periods, and there's never a shortage of puzzles available & solveable at any one time. So while you might have no idea what to do with the smarmy horse blocking a doorway, you can set it aside for later rather than having to sit there hunting for pixels or trying every noun+verb combination in the game. And in service of that, the overwhelming majority of puzzles will mention key hints every time you revisit them rather than expecting you to remember a single line of dialog you came across hours prior. The end result is that the game skips along at a brisk pace and never punishes you for having forgotten to put the cereal bowl in you car's glove compartment 12 hours prior, or whatever.

In terms of the remaster, I waffle a bit on the quality of the new graphics - they can be a little flat and Flash game-looking in places. But you're able to freely toggle between the new and old graphics to compare and contrast, and frankly the biggest factor seems to be that the old pixel art was better about suggesting detail that wasn't actually there. IE, it's a faithful translation, even if it's not necessarily always an upgrade. The audio likewise can be toggled between old and new, and there's some developer commentary sprinkled in as well.

Bottom line, if you're looking to try out classic adventure games, this is the first I'd recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055963083', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1502901336}
review:
1. I do not share the halcyon memories of playing these old adventure games w/ many in my peer group. I played them, yes. I had fun for sure but they do not exactly reach the highest heights of refined gameplay. Once I got done microwaving the hamster or telling the text parser to go fuck itself, I always just got frustrated at the trial and error halfway through and either cheated or quit.


2. I still do that.


3. For what it's worth, if you do have halcyon memories of playing these games, this remastered version of The Day of the Tentacle really gets it right. They smooth out the pixelated graphics and bring in brighter, more vibrant colors. They updated the compressed, cruddy sounding audio w/ a clearer, modern sound. There's controller support. That's it. It is still the same game just presented w/ a bit more polish.


4. I can see how someone might find the humor in this game charming but I don't believe anyone who says they think it is actually funny. I smiled a few times but never laughed.


5. The setup here is a tentacle drinks a bunch of toxic waste and takes over the world. A mad scientists recruits a stoner, a nerd and a ditz to travel through time and fix things. This is could maybe be the plot of a straight-to-VHS movie full of post-rehab 80s brat packers. Like I said, this game is not actually funny.


6. The way this game works is you solve puzzles by clicking on things until it's time to stop clicking on things.


7. I'm not going to say there aren't some clever puzzles here but I'm also not gonna say you don't  have to sometimes just do some random-ass bullshit to figure stuff out. Or use a walkthrough. This game is a quarter century old, you won't be the first person who cheated.


8. The voice acting was done in 1993. God help us.


9. One actor who does a bad impression of Woody Allen and uses it to voice both some random nerdy guy and John Hancock. I will admit, that was one of the things I smiled at in the game. Of course, I did not laugh because this game is not actually funny.


10. Early on, your characters get split up between three time periods. You can easily send items to other time periods using a time traveling porta-john. You can also leave things some place in the past and have them be there in the future, normally changed to some degree. This turns the whole game into one giant puzzle made of sub-puzzles you need to puzzle through.


11. While number 10, sounds good on the surface, the execution of this idea is problematical. For starters, some items are available way out of context and way before you need them. Combine this w/ some of the goofy, not-actually-funny puzzle solutions and you wind up w/ a lot of Day of the Tentacle being needlessly obtuse and frustrating. This being said, this frustration is at least tempered by the fact that you can not put yourself in a situation where you cannot finish the game. Believe it or not, in some of these old adventure games, you could get yourself in a failure state where you couldn't win and the game didn't even have the courtesy to tell you that.


12. This is the golden age of this type of game in some people's minds. I don't get it.


13. So yeah, at its heart, at this point in time, this is really a nostalgia trip or a history lesson depending how old you are or how much attention you were paying in the nineties. If you are after either of things, absolutely, you should play Day of the Tentacle. If you are looking for the most fun way to spend a few hours of your time, don't play a decades old adventure game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189216245', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1558815141}

review: A ce jour, le meilleur Point 'n' Click r√©tro auquel j'ai jou√©. Un humour bien ficel√©, des √©nigmes super bien pens√©es et ce, sur trois time-lines diff√©rentes. Franchement... y'a rien √† redire. Ce jeu m√©rite clairement son titre de classique !

author: {'steamid': '76561197962099132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1507393864}
review:
Day of the Tentacle, das ist Point-and-Click-Klamauk vom Feinsten. Aus den Tiefen der Neunziger hat Double Fine Productions eines der gro√üartigsten Adventures dieser Zeit gekramt und dem ganzen einen aktuellen Anstrich verpasst. Dazu noch eine etwas komfortablere Steuerung und fertig ist die Remastered Edition. 

Das Spiel: 

Day of the Tentacle ist ein ganz klassisches P&C-Abenteuer. Man steuert per Maus die Charaktere Bernhard, Hoagie und Laverne. Knifflig dabei vor allem, dass man die drei simultan steuern kann und muss. Dabei m√ºssen teilweise auch Gegenst√§nde untereinander ausgetauscht werden, was am Anfang nicht gleich g√§nzlich offensichtlich ist.
Aber zur√ºck zum eigentlichen Thema... 
Worum geht es eigentlich?
Schnell erz√§hlt ist folgendes passiert:
Purpur Tentakel hat von Doktor Freds (verr√ºckter Wissenschaftler) Matschmaschine kontaminiertes Wasser getrunken, hat dadurch zwei Arme bekommen sowie Allmachts-/Weltherrschaftsfantasien. Um ihn aufzuhalten, wollen der Nerd Bernhard, der √ºbergewichtige Hardrocker Hoagie und die selbstzerst√∂rerische Lavern mit Doktor Freds Hilfe und dem Chrono-Jon in die Vergangenheit reisen, um das zu verhindern. Weil Doktor Fred allerdings einen billigen Industriediamanten f√ºr seine Maschine verwendet hat, geht der Plan geh√∂rig schief. Bernhard bleibt in der Gegenwart, Hoagie reist versehentlich 200 Jahre in der Zeit zur√ºck zu den amerikanischen Gr√ºndungsv√§tern und Ben Franklin, w√§hrend Lavern 200 Jahre in die Zukunft verfrachtet wird, in der die Tentakel die Welt beherrschen und Menschen als Haustiere halten. Und diesen Schlamassel muss man als Spieler nun wieder gerade r√ºcken.

Klingt ganz sch√∂n verr√ºckt? 
Genau das ist es. Neben derben Witzen und lustigen L√∂sungswegen ist das Spiel ein abgedreht verr√ºcktes Abenteuer, das riesigen Spa√ü macht. Durch die erneuerte Steuerung geht vieles au√üerdem schneller von der Hand als im Original. F√ºr Leute, die das Originial gespielt haben, sind als kleiner Zusatz zahlreiche versteckte Steamerrungenschaften integriert, die es freizuschalten gilt. Um die 100% zu erreichen ist schon einiges Ausprobieren notwendig.
Die R√§tsel sind durchaus knifflig und aufgrund der drei verschiedenen Erz√§hlstr√§nge, die aber paralell gespielt werden k√∂nnen, nicht immer gleich zu durchschauen. Frust kommt dennoch selten auf, denn f√ºr ann√§hernd jeden "bescheuerten" L√∂sungsversuch, wird man mit einem kruden Kommentar oder Aktion der Charaktere "belohnt". So macht selbst das planlose Klicken und herumkombinieren irgendwie Spa√ü. 

Sound und Videoqualit√§t sind deutlich aufgeh√ºbscht und angepasst, wobei das eigentlich auch reine Kosmetik ist, die das Spiel eigentlich nicht brauchte. Es ist  einfach ein Point and Click Adventure, das durch seinen verr√ºckten Ansatz und die durchgeknallte Story lebt und genau dort seine St√§rken hat. 

Insgesamt?

Ich bin dennoch froh gewesen, dass es noch einmal aus den Tiefen der Vergangenheit gebuddelt und entstaubt wurde. Denn auf diese Weise bin ich nach etlichen Jahren ein zweites Mal in den Genuss eines absolut lustigen, abwechslungsreichen Klassikers gekommen. Die Spielzeit war zwar aufgrund der Vorerfahrung wesentlich k√ºrzer, aber es hat einfach Spa√ü gemacht und darauf kommt es doch am Ende haupts√§chlich an.
Darum gebe ich auch guten Gewissens eine Empfehlung f√ºr diesen aufgeh√ºbschten Genre-Klassiker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050442719', 'num_games_owned': 596, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1507085642}
review:
If you look at the positive reviews for this game, you'll see a LOT of them reference the fact that they played this game when it first came out.  I'm not saying that nobody trying this out in the modern day will like it, but I am saying that most will probably not.  I think there is a serious case of nostalgia-goggles here.

I went into this game not knowing much about it.  I just knew that it's considered one of the great classic point-and-clicks, and I've enjoyed quite a few P&C so thought I should try it.

What I found was a heap of terrible voice acting, writing that didn't come together into anything coherent, and humor that would probably fall flat for anyone over the age of eight.  Things like "haha, that nerd's pants are pulled up too high" and "haha, that guy tripped and fell!"

If this game were new today, it would be ripped to shreds by any critics, and then promptly forgotten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034939130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1493130373}

author: {'steamid': '76561198035913360', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1479933478}
review:
7.9/10

Double Fine has a good reputation for creating fun games with lots of laughs and good dialogue. Day of the Tentacle is no exception.

Losely following Maniac Mansion, this game let's you explore the vast mansion of Dr. Fred again, but this time in multiple time-periods to prevent an evil tentacle from enslaving the entire world. You do this by controlling 3 teenagers with their own personalities and quirks, spending most of your time solving puzzles or interacting with the goody characters. If you have played the Monkey Island games or Grim Fandango you shold feel right at home especially with this remaster.

What's so good about this game is that most of the time the only thing controling the pacing is you, the player. If you get stuck it's often solved by talking or interacting with most of your environment and you should be able to figure out the way to progress forward. And exploring is fun, often rewarding with great dialogue and a couple of jokes.

Also worth mentioning that the entire first game, Maniac Mansion, is fully playable within this game! Two great games for the price of one!

If you like fun point and click-adventures, give this game a buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016487911', 'num_games_owned': 1972, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1506545229}
review:
This is one of the classic point and click adventures from back in the day. For anyone who has some nostalgia for the game, then this game is a no brainer. It has been lovingly remastered. They have updated the user interface as well as the graphics. It is intuitive and easy to play, unlike the original Maniac Mansion game which is included and can be played inside this game. It certainly made me appreciate the new user interface.  And made me wonder how I ever played the original Maniac Mansion game without going mad! 

The game is wacky and fun and has some great writing in it. If you don't cheat and look up the solutions, then it will take you some time. It is always best to sleep on some of the puzzles. And the writing is so good that you want to try every dialogue option anyway, just to hear all the jokes. There was only a couple of places where I was really stumped more by the user interface than by the puzzle itself. One time I didn't get the dialogue I needed and another time Bernard would not use an item. But quitting the game and trying again later I solved the puzzle straight away even though in my head I was trying the exact same thing. The game only bugged out once, which is good for a double fine game. The game would let me move my character but I could not interact with any objects or other characters. I could not even get to the menu to quit the game. 

If you have never played the game, and want to try a point a click adventure, then this is a good fun choice. It looks and sounds good, the user interface is intuitive. The remastering makes it feel pretty modern, I only hit those 2 puzzles that felt clunky and frustrating, and unlike most of the original point and click games, there are no totally impossible, totally stupid puzzles/solutions. You are NOT forced to click every object on every other object in every location like some games.

review:
¬øComo podria describirse este juego?

Yo siempre lo he calificado como una obra maestra, en el momento cumbre de las aventuras gr√°ficas, es cierto que no es excesivamente largo, pero si lo suficientemente complejo para tenerte entretenido n√∫merosas horas. La aventura tiene un gran arte el cual se ha mejorado sustancialmente con esta remasterizaci√≥n.

A diferencia de las remasterizaciones de monkey island 1 y 2, las cuales tenian un control pesimo, un arte no acorde y encima el modo "antiguo" no estaba ni traducido, est√° es todo lo contrario. Lo primero la remasterizaci√≥n es el mismo juego pero con los gr√°ficos acordes a d√≠a de hoy (el pixelado de las animaciones ya no se ve, si no que es dibujo del bueno), Lo segundo, el control no ha empeorado y es totalmente digno de una aventura gr√°fica y lo tercero si pones el modo antiguo sigues teniendo el juego en Espa√±ol.

¬øHay alguna cosa mala?

Bien aparte de que el juego solo esta traducido y no doblado, el juego incluye una aventura de maniac mansi√≥n (el primer juego de la saga) el cual se activa ejecutando el pc. Esta aventura gr√°fica extra la cual es muy buena (aunque muy dificil, pero tiene varios caminos para realizarla), tiene el problema de que no se ha traducido, (es decir esta en ingles) y tampoco ha recibido remasterizaci√≥n. Hubiese estado bien que al menos hubiese estado traducida.

Recomendablep ara todos aquellos que amen este tipo de juegos. No defraudar√°.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1505419538}
review:
This is a great point and click adventure game. It's got all thats needed:

+ Good voice acting and dialogue
+ Puzzles that are not necessarily easy, but that have sensible solutions once you work them out
+ A wide world to explore
+ A funny story with interesting characters
+ A unique twist that makes it different to other games (in this case the multi-character puzzle solving)

In addition, it's also very nice to see:

+ Controller support
+ The very fluid in game comparison between remastered and classic versions

I'm actually not sure there's anything bad I could say about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975149085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1502977947}
review: This is Day of the Tentacle, just as I remember it. The graphics are exactly as I remember them in my mind, only sharper and higher resolution than a 386 with a 14" CRT can do. Unfortunately, I still remembered most of the solutions to the puzzles, so I only spent about 4 hours in this fun wacky world. Highly recommended if well drawn crazy cartoon characters in a world of madness sounds appealing to you, and you don't mind a few "moonlogic" puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080028990', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1707621029}
review:
If Grim Fandango was the zenith of Lucasarts Adventure games, then Day of the Tentacle was surely where they began to hit their stride. This was about the time when they started moving from the awkward SCUMM system of the early Monkey Island games, became confident in their humour, gained a distinct art style (and I do mean art), and finally added voices. Glorious, glorious voices.

I've had three versions of DotT. I'd played the original version on floppies. I'd played the CD-ROM versions. I, at some point, downloaded a copy of it to run on SCUMMVM, first on my laptop, then on my phone. And now I have the Remastered version. Is it worth it?

Well, I got it on sale for USD 3.00, which seems about right. Obviously, the graphics are a lot better. No more pixels, no more jagged edges, everything looks like a hand-drawn image. The animations are unchanged, so everything still moves at 10 frames. There are achievements (one of which is very annoying, and I'll have to play through again to get it). There is now a menu, which is very nice, with the save menu being through a floppy drive, and looking like a DOS interface (which I love). There is a developer commentary, which while enlightening, isn't as great as the one for Grim Fandango.

Get DotT:R if you're a completionist, or you want to see what a real adventure game was like back in the day. It's not highly recommended, the way that Grim Fandango was, but it's good for a few laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191355649', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1503866616}
review:
Day of the Tentacle¬†(originally released in 1993) is a game that I had not played before this remastered version. However the beautiful animation that was almost like a 90‚Äôs cartoon come to life and the silly humor were more than enough to keep me hooked from beginning to end. I‚Äôll come right out and say it, I had to use a walkthrough for this game. Some of the puzzles were incredibly tough and I have no shame in throwing that out there. It did not take away from my overall enjoyment of the game though, in fact I liked it so much that I have changed my laptop wallpaper to the one offered by the official site for the game.

I think The Well-Red Mage said it best when he described the humor in this game as ‚ÄúDad Jokes‚Äù. They make you laugh and cringe at the same time, which is not the type of humor everybody is into so be aware that things do get quite a bit cheesy.
 
So onto the game, you play as a group of three that find themselves in quite the perilous situations. Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne are palling around with a bit of a mad scientist named Dr. Fred Edison. This lands them a trip in the time machine to three separate destinations (one of which being the present) and from there it is time to point and click adventure your way back to the present day with all characters and defeat the tentacle foes!

So what is it with these tentacles? Well there is an evil purple tentacle and a chill green tentacle who wants nothing to do with Purple‚Äôs world domination plot. Green calls in a favor to Bernard to stop Dr. Fred from putting him down along with Purple, thus allowing Purple to escape and getting the lot of them into the whole situation.

Day of the Tentacle is the sequel to Maniac Mansion,¬†a game that I haven‚Äôt played through entirely but I really enjoyed the bit that I did play. The amazing part about my time playing Maniac Mansion? It happened right there on Day of the Tentacle Remastered!

The full game is available on an in-game computer and I was hooked all the way until I got very stuck and decided I should get back to the main game. I am not sure if this was a feature in the original before the remaster, but I thought that was an incredible addition to the game. I actually didn‚Äôt even know that Day of the Tentacle¬†was a sequel at all until doing some research after completing the game. I did notice the subtle similarities between the games and assumed there had to be some sort of connection between the two.

There is some really cool functionality with the three characters being in different times in Day of the Tentacle,¬†you are able to send objects back and forth between the times as you desire and objects you get in one time may be necessary to move on in the other. Hoagie finds himself back in colonial times with the nation‚Äôs founding fathers among other characters and figures, Bernard is in the present with Dr. Fred, and Laverne is in the dystopian future with the tentacle overlords. It is easy to swap back and forth between the three by a simple click on the picture of the character in your items menu....



To read the full review please visit here https://thewellredmage.com/2017/09/05/day-of-the-tentacle-remastered/

And be sure to follow on IG, Twitter & FB @SublimeReviews or just follow my blog at http://www.sublimereviews.wordpress.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198107892313', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1496855450}
review:
Well, well, well..... Look what we have here!

This game is the kinda game that makes you laugh anytime when it can. It's perfectly made in any sense: Hilarious story, lovable characters (by the times i write this i even have the steam name Purple Tentacle, thats how much I love this game),
great music/soundtrack and easter eggs everywhere! It's a cult classic point and click adventure game by any sense.

My first playthrough toke me 6.9 hours, BUT it doesn't mean it's a short game (mainly because I used some help. Shame on me). This was also the first game where i got all the achievements (I don't buy/play  trash achievement hunter games) and it toke me 10.3 hour to do it (I got lot from the first playthrough), also it's preaty easy to speed run (I tried it myself but when i finished with like 55 mins and checked whats the best time, I stoped it)

So this game is one of the best Point and Click adventure game (along with Monkey Island)
For me it's easily a [b]9.5/10.0[/b]
[b]It's a game that everyone who likes point and click adventure games even just a little bit should play once (or 3-4-5 times)[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198064139415', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1504553436}
review:
Empfehlenswert: Ja (pers√∂nliche Wertung: 9/10)

Errungenschaften: Ja (Einige sind schwer zu bekommen)

Positiv:
- Abgedrehte Zeitreisestory
- Humorvolle Texte
- Grafik einfach gehalten
- Gutes Point & Click - Adventure

Negativ:
- Musik mit der Zeit nervig

Fazit:
Dies ist eines der abgedrehtesten Spiele die ich je gespielt habe. Jahrelang wurde es mir empfohlen. Jetzt habe ich es mir mal angenommen und bin absolut nicht entt√§uscht. An so vielen Stellen musste ich herzhaft lachen. Besonders wie √ºbel dem Hamster zugespielt wird ist herrlich. Geschichte findet in diesem Spiel auch statt. Man trifft auf historische Pers√∂nlichkeiten, wie George Washington oder Benjamin Franklin (Warnung nebenbei: So sch√∂n es auch inszeniert ist - es ist nicht so geschehen). Die Grafik ist in diesem Spiel einfach gehalten. Es handelt sich hierbei um einen Zeichentrickstil, welcher liebevolle Details aufweist. Die Musik kann mit der Zeit nervig sein, kann aber auch leiser gemacht werden. Die gesprochenen Texte sind humorvoll gestrickt und wirklich gut zu verstehen, es sei denn die Musik ist zu laut. Ich kann mich nur dem anschlie√üen was mir gesagt wurde: Empfehlenswert f√ºr jeden der Mal eine Packung Humor braucht!!!!

review: There is a reason that Lucasarts owned the point and click genre for so long, this is one of the reasons. Not as good as (say) the Monkey Island series, but you can't go wrong with a game like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016365353', 'num_games_owned': 1032, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1503527313}
review:
Che dire: la mia infanzia √® legata a doppio filo alle avventure grafiche made in Lucas e Day Of The Tentacle √®, senza girarci troppo intorno, una delle migliori, nonch√© sul podio delle mie preferite.
Ho sempre adorato lo stile esagerato, i personaggi folli, gli enigmi strampalati ed al limite della logica ([spoiler]il carro ed il sapone...[/spoiler]) e gli intrighi spazio-temporali; rigiocare questa remastered √® stato come farsi un giro, da adulti, nel parchetto sotto casa dove, da bambini, si trascorrevano le giornate in assoluta spensieratezza, provando felicit√†, nostalgia e malinconia in ordine sparso.

Cheers...a tentacolo verde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088380930', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 131, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1503387273}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is the sequel to the acclaimed Maniac Mansion. At first you might be saying "Why play the sequel, if I haven't played the original?", well the game Maniac Mansion is playable within the gameplay of the sequel. Once you are able to control Bernard freely in the mansion to go to the third floor, and enter the room on the right and access the computer where you will immediately be able to play and save Maniac Mansion in its' entirety. If you want to know the whole back story to the prior events of Day of the Tentacle then this is a nessacary side quest to focus on. So let's first talk about Maniac Mansion before talking about the sequel. Maniac Mansion was an adventure game from LucasArts, the plot consists of a meteor crash landing next to the mansion owned by the macabre Edison family(no relation to Thomas Edison). The head of the household Dr. Fred Edison came into contact with the meteor and tried to examine it for scientific purposes. The meteor was not your average shooting star as it has hypnotic powers that put Dr. Fred into a trance and now has the urge to take over the world. 20 years later, Dr. Fred kidnapped a college girl named Sandy as a means to conduct his experiment in taking over the world. Sandy's boyfriend Dave Miller tracks down his girlfriend's whereabouts at the Edison Mansion with two friends of his for back-up knowing his girlfriend was abducted by a mad man and that the rescue attempt will be dangerous. The mansion itself is a big place to cover ground there are many locked rooms and the presence of the Edison family members and their pets which are two large disembodied tentacles. With various items to obtain and many secret passage ways and rooms to discover, Dave will most likely succeed in saving Sandy and try to put an end to the master plan of hypnotised Dr. Fred. 

Maniac Mansion was an innovating adventure game for its time as it was the first game to utilize in the SCUMM game engine. A type of game engine that would be used in the much of the later LucasArts games, where the command options consist of give, use, talk, push, etc. Directed by Ron Gilbert who would go on to creating the Monkey Island games and additional staff work done by Tim Schaffer who was just starting in the computer game business at the time this game went into production. The game took two years to make and drew heavy inspiration from B movies and horror genre films for the basis of the story. This was a game that requires trial and error, as anyone playing it for the first time might mess up at first but will get better as you play it. There are multiple endings to the game, and with a selection of a few different characters to help out Dave, its a mix and match option that offers plenty of possibilities. Since the sequel features Bernard, it's recommended to have Bernard in the party to create continuity. The game was cool for offering more than other adventure games had at the time of its release. 

Now to finally talk about the sequel, Day of the Tentacle. The game is set five years after the events of the original game. The game starts off with one of the pet tentacles own by the Edisons(In this case the Purple Tentacle) drinks sludge that's been polluting the river by the Edison Mansion. Purple Tentacle began to grow small flapper arms, intelligence, and the urge to dominate the world. Dr. Fred tries to rid of this problem by killing both of the tentacles so that way the world will be sparred from deranged tentacles. Green Tentacle sends a plea for help via mail to his friend Bernard, knowing he will save him and his purple brother. Bernard receives the letter from his green friend and agrees with himself that he must comply to the plea of help. But that also means he must return to the mansion, a place he'd hope he would never have to revisit again. So after recruiting his roommates Laverne the crazed medical student and Hoagie the roadie travel to the mansion to set the tentacles free. They made things worse as Purple Tentacle escapes to continue his conquest. Because Purple Tentacle is smarter and quicker than an average human it would be impossible to foil his world domination plans. Which is why Dr. Fred cooks up a plan by sending Laverne, Bernard, & Hoagie back in time via three time traveling porta-potties to the day before Purple Tentacle drank the sludge to prevent the incident from ever happening in the first place. The plan goes abust when the fake diamond instead of a real one used for the power source breaks down the time machines. Bernard ends up where he last lifted off while Hoagie is stuck in the colonial times 200 years in the past and Laverne is stuck in the 22nd Century where tentacles have already taken over most of the planet. Bernard much help his friends by sending items through time to help his friends power up their own individual porta-potties in order to travel back to the past and stop Purple Tentacle once and for all. They must hurry as Purple Tentacle quickly rises in power as the game progresses. 

This sequel was better than the original game in contrast with the plot and gameplay. This time around you only play as three default characters with Bernard being the only protagnogist from Maniac Mansion to return. The gameplay is more linear meaning no matter what you do the out come remains the same. The art style was improved as it looked like an interactive cartoon on par with the earlier Humongous Games and the first Sam & Max game. It was one of the earliest LucasArts games to feature voice acting, something that wasn't too common for computers games to offer at the time. The game was Tim Schafer's first time directing along with Dave Grossman who later directed the second Bone game from Telltale and wrote for the the first two Monkey Island games. The characters were all great and the humor is right up there with the Monkey Island games. Anyone who loves the Monkey Island games will love the Maniac Mansion Duology games. These games played an important role for both adventure genre games and future LucasArts games a like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212769343', 'num_games_owned': 466, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1503534370}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

The Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game.

+ Interesting plot
+ Odd sense of humor
- Hard to figure out

[h1]Review[/h1]

The Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game. In this game you control Bernard, Hoagie and Laverne to stop the Purple tentacle who is trying to take over the world.

In order to stop plans of world domination you will have to go back one day to the past but things don't go so well and each of your controllable characters get to different points in time: past, present and future. You can switch characters and you will have send items through time in order to beat the game.

The game has a odd but creative sense of humor that takes advantage of the different time lines. Interestingly the characters you find in the past have descendants of the future that somewhat preserve their personalities. Some characters are historical figures. The graphical style is wacky cartoon styled and fits the game plot.

The main issue with this game is that it is very hard to figure out what to do. The puzzles often don't really have much logic and sometimes lacks tips entirely so you may end up brute forcing by attempting every possible action or reading a walk-through. This is somewhat typical of these kinds of games but you will see what I mean if you try to beat the game.

The game also includes Maniac Mansion so it's actually two games in one. In fact Day of the Tentacle is considered to be Maniac Mansion 2.

I did enjoy the game for what it is even though the puzzles are very hard to figure out so I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085725324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 740, 'last_played': 1502058773}
review:
SUBTITLES: Press + (not sure if it works with the number pad one) until the speed of the subtitles is ok to you!!! 
Of course, - slows them down.

The default is so slow it misses whole last sentences of each speech, and using . to skip the dialogue one risks missing further sentences from the same "unit" that can be important hints.

Nice game, but had to use "Universal Hint System" website several times even when I knew what I wanted to achieve.
It's Lucasarts so you can't die, etc. so no stress. The 3 parallel timelines gives it nice mechanics/ideas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010012994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1502056050}
review:
This was surprisingly as fun as it was when I first played it back in the 90's!

The only down side was having played the original release, which nearly brought me to tears trying to work out the what worked with what to get the desired results/progress, I remembered quite a lot of it meaning it was less of an adventure but a lot of nostalgia. Maniac Mansion in-game-game is still fun also (classic graphics).

Worth a play if you like and have the patience for simple adventure problem solving games, or enjoyed the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025745213', 'num_games_owned': 1305, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 527, 'last_played': 1502036006}
review:
[b] Cl√°sico atemporal  [/b]

Un trabajo de remasterizaci√≥n sobresaliente que si pudiera resumir en sus aspectos [u]positivos[/u] ser√≠a : 
 [list]
[*] Muy buena adaptaci√≥n de los controles. Ahora es cuando te das cuenta que los de 1993 eran un engorro
[*] Genial banda sonora y efectos de sonido
[*] Gr√°ficos muy bien remasterizados conservando el encanto cartoon intacto
[*] Buena traducci√≥n
[*] Volver a jugar al Maniac Mansion original desde el ordenador de Weird Edison
[*] Comentarios de los creadores muy interesantes
[*] SIgue siendo igual de divertido que en 1993
[/list]
¬ø Y en el lado [u]negativo[/u] ? Pues poca cosa, por poner algo : 
[list]
[*] Las animaciones podr√≠an haber estado algo mejor hechas que en 1993. Son demasiado fieles y bruscas.
[*] Lo mismo que en 1993, es demasiado corto ! Te quedas con ganas de m√°s
[*] Algunos logros son un poco absurdos y obligan a jugar una segunda vuelta en modo speedrun (e.g. Apreciaci√≥n musical)
[*] Los 3 anteriores son estupideces, [b]COMPRA ESTA JOYA[/b]
[/list]

En resumen, un gran trabajo de Double Fine. Quiz√°s no guste a todo el mundo (nuevas generaciones), pero los viejos rockeros lo disfrutar√°n a lo grande con un atisbo de lagrimas en los ojos. Para saborearlo de verdad hab√≠a que haber estado ah√≠ en 1993 con tus diskettes de 3 1/2,  jugando en un 386 a otros cl√°sicazos como Sam & Max, Monkey 1 (VGA) , Legend Of Kyrandia de Westwood, etc... 

Recomendado al 200%. Un 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252118904', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 593, 'last_played': 1501488466}
review:
Day of the Tentacle offers a quite unique experience playing with 3 characters simultaneously. New graphics are solid and true to the original game. The sound is pretty much the same. To sum up, it's pretty much the same game.
I'd consider it a good buy for nostalgic fans and for the adventure gamers alike. The game is fun and humorous now as it was back in '99 when I first completed it as an 11 year old. It's maybe even more humorous now that I am older.

There aren't many negative aspects to it and I'll adress all I have encountered. 
The game may be short for hardcore adventure gamers since you can complete it under 10 hours of gametime. Also, there are a few glitches of music stopping while alt+tabbing and subtitles lagging behind sound but nothing game breaking in my opinion since all of the issues can easily be fixed by saving the game, exiting then loading.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081029343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1664128441}
review:
This game brings back so many great childhood memories. It may be basic compared with todays games but you can't beat a good point click puzzle classic.

Upon starting the game your immediately drawn into the story, it doesnt take long to understand what the plot is and what your goal is. The dialogue is smart and witty with various references....(mainly to star wars).
For those new to the game the puzzles can be a little tricky to solve and you may be left with very little guidance on which items are needed and where. However, a bit of common sense and sometimes a dark sense of humour is all thats needed to solve certain situations.

The remastered version is fantastic, with the ability to alternate from the classic/remastered appearance with the click of a button during gameplay. Interesting commentary adds to the history of how the game was developed for those interested. The artwork is what pulled me into the game originally and with the smoother graphics i've fallen in love with it all over again.

This game is great for old fans and new ones. This is definately a biased review with nostagic influence although I don't care, I'd recommend this to anyone who want's to kill some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007428578', 'num_games_owned': 1809, 'num_reviews': 382, 'playtime_forever': 493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1501691187}
review:
This game is a brilliant classic point and click game. Its also another great remaster from Double Fine who I thought also did a brilliant job with their Grim Fandango remaster.

Day of the Tentacle gives you control of 3 characters. One in the past, one in the present and one in the future. You can pass items between characters via the toilet in a portaloo time machine (dont ask). Other than that its pretty standard point and click gameplay but this game offers a lot of challenging puzzles to solve. I loved the humour and zany characters and ths is what makes it stand out.

The remaster has been masterfully done. The game has had all its animation redone and modernised as well as the sound and music. I hadn't played the original but you can switch to the original style with the press of a button and this really highlights the improvements. It's also possible to play the entirety of Maniac Mansion, the prequel of DotT, wihin the game.

There are a couple downsides. Some of the solutions are really out there and can be very difficult to figure out. Also very occasionaly I had problems with the sound where the music would randomly cut out though this would be fixed on moving to another room.

Overall this is a brilliant game and if your a fan of the point and click genre then this is worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067321382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1501545623}
review:
Questo titolo, uscito negli anni 90, l'ho giocato da adolescente. Nel 2016 lo portano in una versione remastered e non potevo non prenderlo. Un divertentissimo gioco punta e clicca, come ci ha sempre abituati la LucasArts. Nei panni di un nerd, un metallaro ed una studentessa di medicina con la testa per aria, dovremo fermare i piani diabolici di tentacolo Viola, diventato cattivo a causa di certe scorie. La particolarit√† di questo titolo sta nel fatto che i nostri protagonisti saranno sbalzati in epoche diverse e dovranno, tra loro, interagire cambiando la storia e cercando di passarsi le cose utili attraverso le rispettive macchine del tempo (dei gabinetti). Un gioco adatto a tutte le et√†. La grafica √® bella, in stile cartoon. Le musiche godibili. Gli enigmi non sempre facili, ma sicuramente divertenti. Forse, conoscendo la storia americana, si apprezzerebbe addirittura meglio questo titolo in quanto i riferimenti a personaggi storici √® continua. Inoltre, fanno capolino diversi camei di altri personaggi di Lucas apparsi nelle varie avventure. Se vi piacciono le avventure grafiche in vecchio stile, vi consiglio questo gioco. E vi consiglio, ovviamente, tutti gli altri giochi della LucasArts.  
P. S. All'interno del gioco stesso, c'√® un modo per giocare al titolo precedente della serie (completamente indipendente e slegato da questo, sia chiaro), Maniac Mansion. 

Voto personale: 8

author: {'steamid': '76561198172392767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2, 'last_played': 1501286209}
review:
Very mixed feelings on whether or not to recommend that one. It's not really about what's in the game but more about whether or not you want updated graphics or not.

There are new features, like skipping dialogue and button press = highlighting of objects you can interact with, but other than that and the updated graphics it's still the same game as the classic.

You can toggle the in-game graphics between the new and the old design flawlessly at all times but then also lack some of the features tied to the new graphics and their engine. Art-wise the design is a flawless improvement of the classic.

Mentionable issues others had are crashes and freezes which I can't verify as I didn't have a single issue like that up to the point of completing the game. What issue I encountered was merely noticing that if you enable not just audio but also the display of the text spoken that there are most often mismatches or delay issues with the text.

So... if you just disable the text and leave the audio on that won't be an issue.
Size-wise this remake is rather large, compared to the slim, old classic, playable with ScummVM: 2.65 GB of the remake compared to ~140 MB of the classic.

Your choice whether or not and what you want to pay for better graphics and a few new features.
I'm gonna give it a thumbs up because it's well done aside from that one issue I had, even though it happens throughout the game. The new features and good controls allow to compensate for that, imo.

The major conflict is more about the remake vs the classic with ScummVM and available for free.
Just wait for a discount if you're sceptical.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093402962', 'num_games_owned': 433, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1558904315}
review:
Man what a blast from the past. We kids got it in ~1997 on a second-hand PC and spent weeks discovering every single clickable thing in the present-day mansion. I managed to recall quite a few tricks during this playthrough 20 years later. We used to always get stuck at a point where the game asked us to insert something from 'the manual'. I've always thought it was some kind of old school DRM. Was it actually? I found out online now that the feature was only in the 'non-talking' version and it was basically a combination lock with 4 * 4 * 2 * 2 * 2 * 2 = 256 possibilities (you had to mess around with croutons and stuff). I managed to accidentally crack it once during my childhood, but then lost the savegame : ( So you could say I had this game on hold for 2 decades.

DOTT is a classic not unlike the Monkey Island games. Great plot, writing and lots and lots of warm humour. The puzzles are quite tough and if I hadn't had my memories and I admit, 3 little peeks in the walkthrough, it would have probably taken me something like a day instead of 4 hours to complete.

The remastered version also features developers' commentary and Maniac Mansion as a game-within-a-game, but I didn't bother with those since the original game was largely unexplored territory for me and I didn't need any extra nostalgia to spice things up. But those may be really interesting for people who have DOTT memorized backwards.

They don't often make complex games any more. As I said, without cheating DOTT is a bit difficult to figure out and millennials will probably have trouble attention span wise. But if you're on a mission to play through, say, 100 essential video games, DOTT definitely has to be on that list.

review: I was surprised that the game was more for adults than children. It's like Sam and Max except a little more tame. The puzzles can be seriously hard. There were a few times that I needed to use a guide or find hints because I was clueless. I'm happy with the difficulty. It gave me a challenge rather than being a complete cake walk. One hint that I would like to have known is that the game will try to use all the game mechanics that it offers you. The pushing, pulling, closing doors, etc are all used in the game. Don't overlook them like I did.
