author: {'steamid': '76561198015878999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1500037308}
review: Day of the Tentacle is without a doubt my favourite game EVER. I used to play all the Graphic Adventures that were out back in the day, and when DOTT came out it blew my mind away - and it's up to this days that the hilarious humour, the cartoony graphics (remastered now!), the ingenious puzzles, the great characters, the witty dialogues, the music, the animations, and EVERYTHING in between, stand out as what a "Point n' Click" game should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993488562', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1499940100}
review:
When I look at a remake of an old classic game, I always wonder 2 things. 1) How many of the positive reviews are pure nostalgia? And 2) How buggy is this remake?
Well, I had tons of fun playing this remake, and I had never played the old version, so it's not all nostalgia. And I experienced no bugs at all. 

The game's not perfect. Some of the puzzle solutions don't make much sense, so that can be frustrating. The setting is a little dated, and the characters are shallow dated stereotypes. But... 

It's a ton of fun. A very funny, quirky game. A lot of the puzzles are straightforward and fun to figure out. It's fun to figure out how to change the past to affect the future. The game in one word: Fun.

This game is a must have for people who like quirky humorous games, and classic 90s style point and click adventures.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997432749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1498621181}
review:
A remake must make the good aspects of the game better and eliminate problems with the game.  At the same time, it needs the authenticity of being the original game (in contrast to a reboot).

Dott remastered does improve on graphics.  It also improves on the adventure game "menu" (talk, look, take) by elimating its living place at the bottom of the screen to make the game full screen. 

What would have been nice is an improvement on some of the other things.  There were some awkward pauses in transitioning in and out of cut scenes that were kept.  It would have been nice to see mouths match the speech too, which makes itself more obvious than before with the sharper graphics.  It also would have been nice for some improvement on the backgrounds now that everything is not pixelated (at least beyond the Jar-Jar Binks photo (love it by-the-way!) hidden in the past.)  After playing Ducktales Remastered, Dott Remastered feels more like Dott "Updated."  And that is a good thing if you want to play a classic Lucas Arts game on your new machine.  

In conclusion, the title "remastered" is a bit of a misnomer, but breathing life into a classic adventure game is nice to see.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045600', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 1038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1586456731}
review:
Okay so I haven't played this game in twenty years but I'm surprised by how much I remembered.  

First of all, this is one of the best adventure games I've ever played because it's hilarious and offers a decent challenge especially when compared to modern ones.  The characters are interesting and I liked it better than the original.  What's cool is that it offers the original game as well so if you missed out on both of these you don't have to worry anymore. 

As for the remastered features, I like the graphics and they help you out when it comes to seeing what items can be used in the game.  It's much clearer than the original pixellated game.  I also think the sound is terrific and I didn't notice anything different.  

The price was a little steep when I bought it, however, since it doesn't take too long to beat.  I would recommend waiting until it goes on sale.  

If you enjoy Adventure games, you cannot go wrong with this one.  It puts anything that Telltale does to shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040791464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1499545615}
review:
Une version remasteris√© d'assez bonne facture. Les musiques n'ont pas √©t√© "d√©natur√©". La nouvelle interface (au revoir la liste de verbes) peu surprendre et laisse sa place pour quelques chose de plus intiutif.. (pens√© pour une manette PS4! -lol-).

Jeune c'√©tait un de mes click and play pr√©f√©r√©s, r√©sultat je l'ai fini extr√©mement vite, y compris avec l'ensemble des succ√©s (qui ne demandent pas de faire des "choses absolument improbables" il faut le dire).. Comme quoi j'ai du y jouer bien plus que je m'en souvenais.
Moralit√©, il est clair que mon avis ne sera pas obj√©ctif.
Je vais tout de m√™me essayer de le diviser en deux temps.

Cot√© nostalgie, √©vid√©ment le service est l√†.. On a une version remasteris√© correcte, des nouveaux th√®mes presque identique (qui crachent moins), le "swap" des tentacules qui saute √† chang√© malheureusement...Mais on peu de toute mani√®re jouer avec l'anciennes bande son, ind√©pendament de anciens d√©cors etc. C'est extr√©mement appr√©ciable. Le fait de pouvoir changer la version d'une simple touche en temps r√©el, aussi.
De m√™me, chose EXTREMEMENT appr√©ciable pour tout Fans du jeu: les commentaires audios !

Cot√©s jeu du genre, d'une part on est l√† face √† un des classique parmis les classiques, sans doute le plus r√©ussi sous le moteur SCUMM (pour le jeu de mot: "ordure/pourriture").
L'humour tr√®s pr√©sent est une marque de fabrique de Lucasart. On peu dire que c'est tout de m√™me assez r√©ussis, et reste intemporel... (En fait il n'y qu'une seul blague qui devrait √™tre "incompr√©hensible", une faisant r√©f√©rence √† Helms qui est "vexx√©" par la candidature de Pourpre*).
Les √©nigmens restent extr√©mement logique, les solutions des manoeuvres "complexe" toujours souffl√© et induite par les discusions. Il n'y a pas d'actions absurde √† effectuer sans raisons, comme on peu parfois en voire dans certains Point and click de cette √©poque.

Un immanquable pour ceux qui ne s'y serrait jamais test√© et appr√©cie les jeux du genre.

Un gros b√©mol tout de fois... Le Prix... Hors solde steam 15‚Ç¨ pour un jeux qui √† pratiquement 25 ans est un prix abusif, que le lifting ne justifient absolument pas (ce soins fait bondir le jeu √† 2.5Giga pour un jeu pesant √† l'origine 15 m√©ga -version disquette-, autant dire qu'on parle d'une optimisation "√† l'arrache") et s'ins√®rre dans le banditisme assum√© de Lucasart qui n'h√©site d'ailleurs pas √† nous revendre √† 7‚Ç¨ des jeux de la m√™me √©poque non remasteris√© avec en "bonus"... la perte de la version fran√ßaise !(on pensera aux Indiana Jones par exemple).

Si le jeu reste exc√©lent le rapport qualit√©/prix n'y est pas. 
Bien que Lucasart est toujours refus√© de d√©clarer ses logiciels "abandonwear", exigeant de tirer profit de jeux qui n'√©taient plus commercialis√©, on parle d'un jeu qui √©tait gratuit jusqu'√† pr√©sent (pas "l√©gament" certes, mais il aurat fallu attendre 20 ans pour une r√©√©dition, ceci est une autre question), comme la plupart des jeux qui ont un bon quart de si√®cle, le "remasteur" ne vos clairement pas vos 15‚Ç¨. Nous sommes toujours ici dans des logiques d√©plorable visant √† maximiser des profits √† moindre co√ªt.

Pour r√©sumer, je donne un avis positif g√©n√©ral. L'ayant achet√© en solde, je suis tr√®s largement satisfait de mon achat, le jeu en lui-m√™me est excp√©tionnel.
Mais 15‚Ç¨ pour un patch graphique, c'est du vol.

*Jesse Helms √©tait un s√©nateur ultra-r√©actionnaire. Farouche d√©fenseurs de la s√©gr√©gation raciale (il avait vot√© contre le civil right acts), sa nostalgie raciste l'avait pouss√© √† s'opposer √† l'√©tablissement du Martin Luther King Day -jour f√©ri√©- en cumulant plus de deux semaines d'obstructions acharn√©s. Il s'√©tait oppos√© d√©but 90 au fait qu'on soigne les malades du sida. Le titre en anglais est plus claire, Pourpre candidate √† √™tre Vice-Pr√©sident des Usa investi par le partis r√©publicains, Helms est donc "vexx√©".

review:
no need to write something about the game XD

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1499529699}
review:
Day of the Tentacle, both the original and the remake, looks really nice and sounds pretty good (if quite a bit outdated by today's standards). But most importantly, it tries to keep things fresh and creative from start to finish. There are no repeated puzzles, no tedium (don't forget you can transfer items between characters from the inventory itself), 3 characters actually interacting with each other and helping each other solve puzzles and a simple but fun story.

There are also infamously poorly conveyed puzzles, a bit too much focus on purely american history and in-jokes and the game does have a very, and I mean VERY strong focus specifically on puzzle solving, not on story and adventuring. Which is pretty much the main reason why I never cared much about Day of the Tentacle. But even with that, revisiting it now I cannot ignore just how well made and creative that game is. It's full of puzzles to solve, most of them actually make perfect sense and at the same time they're actually funny. So I'm not surprised people still hold it as a good example of what a puzzle focused comedic adventure game should be about. It's truly timeless (no pun intended).

author: {'steamid': '76561198395254963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1652994742}
review:
Inprescindible jugar a este juego. Sin duda uno de los refentes de su g√©nero.
Revivir las aventuras de estos tres amigos a trav√©s del tiempo en su lucha contra el malvado tentaculo p√∫rpura no tiene precio. La remasterizacion es espectacular. Los graficos se han actualizado de una manera maravillosa sin perder la escencia del original, la m√∫sica se ha llevado a otro nivel y poder escuchar los desternillantes comentarios de los creadores te da una nueva visi√≥n de este juego que nunca pasa de moda.

Adem√°s, si no te convence el nuevo estilo o quieres volver a sentir el original tienes la opci√≥n de configurarlo a tu gusto.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198315514704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1508469758}
review:
Extremely fun, one of the first games in a long time I've actually been childishly excited to come back to. Finally figuring out the answer to a puzzle youve been struggling with is a great feeling, and the bizzare yet clever solutions never failed to make me laugh. The original pixel work and art design was amazing, and the remastered keeps the style of the original while adding in just enough detail to give it a modern appeal. I loved the characters, the ridiculous scenarios, and the intrinsic rewards of feeling smart, or feeling stupid but relieved when I finally realized how the answer was right in front of me.
I would very much reccomend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198174279502', 'num_games_owned': 618, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 416, 'last_played': 1499350986}
review:
La remasterizaci√≥n hace que el juego sea m√°s atractivo y fluido, algo casi imprescindible para que sea jugable en la actualidad. De hecho, la mejor parte de la remasterizaci√≥n no es el apartado gr√°fico o las voces (que, sin duda, son una mejora m√°s que notable en la experiencia) sino los cambios en el inventario, la interfaz y los men√∫s.

En cuanto al contenido, he de decir que me esperaba algo m√°s: habiendo jugado otras aventuras gr√°ficas, creo que algunos puzzles son demasiado dif√≠ciles por lo absurdos que resultan y las pocas pistas que el juego ofrece (no la mayor√≠a pero s√≠ hay alguno en concreto, quiz√° en funci√≥n del orden de resoluci√≥n de los enigmas). Sin embargo, la idea y el dise√±o de personajes me resulta muy divertida si nos paramos a pensar en que el juego original fue lanzado en 1993.

Es un juego recomendable, sobre todo para aquellos que disfrutamos de rememorar tiempos pasados del mundo de los videojuegos (tanto por cuestiones de edad como por motivos de inter√©s en la historia del videojuego). En la actualidad, sin embargo, se puede disfrutar de otras aventuras gr√°ficas m√°s interesantes para mi gusto (aunque quiz√° menos absurdas, todo sea dicho). Para m√≠ un 7/10, porque la remasterizaci√≥n es buena.

review:
as point and click games go this one is one of the better ones

I have found I'm not huge on point and click games but even I can see this one is better than a lot of other ones as other then voicework that sounds like 2 people doing all the different voices, and a slowish walk speed there really wasn't anything that I could fault this game with as the puzzles had solutions that made sense and it had an interesting giving premise

author: {'steamid': '76561197968981432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1711212544}
review:
As with many i played the original game back then, and finished it a couple of times.
Today i played it again, the remastered version. What a great edition!

Switching back and forth between classic and new edition made it clear to me that this new release really is an upgrade for current times.

I remembered some things, but also had to think really well about how to progress in the game.
I am sure i will finish it again soon, i will not look for a walkthrough.

It is not as hard as Maniac Mansion, but still a very good point and click adventure with a lot of humor and a nice story.

Hope that one day Steam will release more remastered point and click adventures, like Maniac Mansion i.e.

review: Le sc√©nario est bon. Fun, loufoque √† souhait, j'ai beaucoup appr√©ci√©. Par contre, le format point and click, c'est clairement pas pour moi, qui n'y ait pas jou√© durant mon enfance. C'est tout simplement obsol√®te. Le choix des verbes est lourd, quelle que soit la m√©thode (liste en bas ou roue), les personnages prennent des plombes √† se d√©placer vers chaque petit truc que tu cliques, et avec la quantit√© d'aller-retours n√©cessaires, √ßa en devient chiant. On ajoute √† √ßa le coup classique des trucs √† faire parfois capillotract√©s. Plus le fait que dans ce jeu, t'as trois personnages et donc trois lieux, avec possibilit√© de passer les objets d'un lieu √† l'autre, pour encore plus de temps pass√© √† utiliser tous les objets sur un endroit au cas o√π y en aurait un qui marchait. M'enfin bon, je me plains, je me plains, √ßa n'a pas √©t√© une exp√©rience d√©sagr√©able pour autant et je lui accorde quand m√™me un 7/10... ceux qui lui mettraient plus sont sans doute des dinosaures nostalgiques du point and click.

review:
Absolutely fantastic game, absolutely fantastic remaster.
While the game is relatively short, if you know what you're doing, that doesn't stop the fact that this game is hilarious and very interesting. They did a great job on this remaster, with improved art, music, and even sound effects. There are loads of achievements, and even though it took me 3 hours to get all of them, it's quite fun seeing an achievement pop every time you do something relatively smart.

Get this on a sale for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254257458', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1562884036}
review:
Probably one of the finest games of its genre ever created.

Having been a massive fan of this game, Full Throttle, Discworld 1, 2 and Noir, Monkey Island etc; I was delighted when it was remastered with updated graphics. The game is every bit of funny as it's always been and one of the best things that's ever been created.

I'd love for Double Fine or Tell Tale Games to do a sequel to this one day though it's probably a stretch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992357930', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1498739809}
review:
A very unique graphic adventure game, the story and plot are just as ridiculous as the name and you'll have no problem wondering what the hell is going on most of the time, but believe me; 99% of the time you'll be wondering what is going to happen next. This game involves the three main characters; Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne, as well as the supporting cast of Doctor Fred and his family members and associates. Honestly the storyline is just crazy enough to make you want to find out what happens next, despite the fact that you may have no idea what might happen, the solutions in this game are almost always a bit out of the box.

I got this on the Steam Summer Sale of 2017 because I've been feeling a certain craving for adventure games, and I ended up completing it as soon as it finished downloading. I stayed up until eight in the morning just to see what all the fuss was about. It's an amazing game and at the moment it seems silly to pass up on buying it for less than four dollars, this Remastered version of a game is one of the best I've ever seen, it even allows you to switch seamlessly between the old version and the new version (This includes the sound files and the graphics). Even though I didn't play this in its original form, just being able to play it as it was meant to be was incredible and despite today's standards for graphics and sounds I found a very real sense of charm in both the original design and the new one, the latter being very faithful to the former to a precision I didn't think would be possible.

Give it a go, the story is as ridiculous as it sounds and that is a good thing, this is a very good example of a graphic adventure game. It even includes the full version of Maniac Mansion within the game, I've yet to try it but since I've beat the main game I'll definitely be trying that since this Steam version includes many achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152692495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1498545423}
review:
Ok, so I know that negative reviews on popular games don‚Äôt fare well with the communities, but I‚Äôve got to type how I felt about a game.

Day of the Tentacle is the sequel Manic Mansion (that can be found and played in game) in which you play as three characters, who have to use a time machine to stop a tentacle from taking over the world. After using the machine two of the characters have found themselves trap 200 years in the past and future while the third must get the machine working again. This version is a graphically updated version that can be reverted back to the original with the press of a button.

I like point and click games, I don‚Äôt love them, but I like them. Some are hit or miss depending on how well they were made and with a Lucas Arts game I‚Äôve found to expect a good game. However, this game just didn‚Äôt feel that great to me. There wasn‚Äôt much in the way of interactions, there were only a few characters to talk to, must of which were just annoying, and the humor that is usually found in a game like this wasn‚Äôt very funny. 

As for the puzzles, I always get frustrated when playing a point and click puzzle games, but with this I was actually getting angry with a few puzzles in this game. I did like the concept of the puzzles, having three maps which you must solve puzzles and find objects to send to other character, but there was some poor execution to some of these puzzles. To explain, there are some background objects that you can view, but just a few, only enough to disguise a couple items as useless background objects early in the game only for them to be a critical item later. While this may seem like a normal thing for the style of game, it doesn‚Äôt fit well with how solvable most of the other puzzles are. There is even one puzzle that is unsolvable unless you just happen to stand around long enough or get lucky enough to see an idle-animation of one of the NPCs.

With the amount of frustration, flat Humor, and in my opinion, a not to good story. I can‚Äôt really give this game a good recommendation. I can recommend others remastered Lucas Arts games like The Secret of Monkey Island, Monkey Island 2, The Dig, and (Also by Double Fine and personal favorite) Grim Fandango.

review:
Pros:
Creative, funny, interesting, challenging, terrific graphics.
Loved the surprise mentions: Star Wars, Star Trek, Deponia, etc., wished there had been some ET (need to phone home?).
Voices were not too annoying (though the girls voice was right on the edge). Also noticed she walked just like the crazy version of _____ (can't remember her name - the one in braids) from Deponia.

Cons:
Just wish they had also included a map the characters could use to jump locations. There is a LOT of traveling back and forth. 
Also, any kind of hint, objective, or journal to use would have been super helpful as it was a lot to remember jumping back and forth from three characters and three time periods.

Overall fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010841112', 'num_games_owned': 1077, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 106, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1711815494}
review:
Another LucasArts classic, remastered by Double Fine Productions, Day of the Tentacle is still probably the greatest point-and-click adventure game ever made. In this sequel to Maniac Mansion (which is also included within this game itself), three moronic college students travel through time to save the world from an army of evil tentacles taking over, and somehow fluke their way into doing just that, despite their overwhelming levels of ineptitude.

The humour still holds up for a game made in the mid-90's, the voice acting is still on the nose, the music is excellent, the puzzles while weird do for the most part make some quirky sense (except that damn making it rain puzzle), the art is good. It's still the original Day of the Tentacle, which was an amazingly good game, and one that actually still holds up, unlike the Monkey Island series.

The remastered edition doesn't actually add a great deal to the excellent original game; the updated graphics actually seem to lose something versus the original pixel art, but graphics modes can be switched between the two on the fly, meaning the player can pick which they prefer. The developer commentary is also rather basic; despite bringing together several LucasArts alumni, they don't have a great deal to say about the game

But it has achievements, and we all know that's what really matters, right? Right?

Day of the Tentacle Remastered can be found for sale by itself, or also in the very low priced Double Fine Bundle, which also includes Psychonauts (Amazing), Costume Quest 1 (pretty fun), Stacking (fairly good), Iron Brigade (uninvolving), Brutal Legend (weird), Broken Age (underwhelming), Grim Fandango Remastered (amazing), Hack 'n' Slash (decent), Spacebase DF-9 (very under featured and dull) and Full Throttle Remasted (really good), which I think works out to be a pretty good deal!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972089994', 'num_games_owned': 1804, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1644850540}
review:
Best adventure game of all time IMO. Perfectly integrates clever puzzles, humor and plot. Not much else to add -- it's a classic.

Regarding this remaster, it's generally very good. The voice quality is superb relative to the original, and the graphics are much sharper. DOTT was a game that really bumped up against the old 320x200 VGA resolution. VGA didn't work very well for cartoony graphics, and the move to modern high-res has done wonders for the looks of the game.

At the same time, it's not perfect. Had DOTT been made today, the graphics would have been sharper and involved more detail. Instead, the detail that's in the game is just what was barely visible in the VGA version -- they didn't want to taint it by adding more. This results in a game that looks very good to people who remember the original and is clearly the best version of that game we remember, but isn't particularly impressive graphically to newcomers. There's no easy answer here though: had they added more detail to the graphics, purists would be complaining.

All in all, it's a terrific game. If you've never played it, you should, and if you have played it, this is the best version there is.

Recuerdo haberlo jugado extensamente all√° por los noventas con un amigo, y en cada escena y cada di√°logo nos destornillabamos de la risa.
 
Por supuesto, lo que resultaba gracioso en hace 20 a√±os puede que no causa la misma gracia. Muchas bromas ‚Äúya se han visto‚Äù mucho (El efecto ‚ÄúSeinfeld Is Unfunny‚Äù), pero lo sostienen sus retos y rompecabezas bien construidos, su ingenio y un super talento art√≠stico a todo lo que daban 16 bits y el m√°ximo talento de LucasArts.

review:
[b]***RECOMMENED***[/b]

I bought this game from humble bundle for around $1.

I got this game for nostalgia and it was just as fun playing it now like it was 20 years ago. The graphics are amazing.
It's pretty decent for an old point and click game.

[b][u]Narration [/u][/b] - 6/10
[b][u]Graphics [/u][/b] - 10/10
[b][u]Story [/u][/b] - 8/10
[b][u]Music [/u][/b] - 6/10
[b][u]Game Duration [/u][/b] - 7/10
[b][u]Game Difficulty [/u][/b] - 9/10
[b][u]Game Achievement Difficutly [/u][/b] - 9/10

If you do buy it, try your hardest not to google/cheat the game. Its pretty difficult.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981560091', 'num_games_owned': 3897, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1520641846}
review:
Aaah the classic - brings back a LOT of nostalgia.
To be clear this is THE PREMIER point and click game, period.

Great story with engaging puzzles which will challenge you. 

Game can be played at your own pace, but best done with a clear head (for the puzzle solving).

(Also reviewed by me via the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/HeadachesandMigraines]Headache & Migraine Gaming Group[/url])

author: {'steamid': '76561198021263677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1497628678}
review:
I didn't play this in its original form, so this was a new experience for me.

Bleh.  There is nothing about the style of this game that appeals to me.  The art is garish, the characters are ugly, uninteresting caricatures, and the worst sin of all - it's not even slightly amusing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999753053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1640072413}
review: Bottom line, this is a great game.  The BEST adventure game. The humor is great without being sophmoric, and the puzzles are hard enough to challenge without being too obtuse.  Granted I played the original, and remember having to step away from the game when I was unable to find a way forward, but that just made the solutions that much sweeter.  I didn't have as much trouble this time around, in spite of having a lot fewer brain cells working.  I still remembered most of the solutions 20+ years on as the puzzles were that good.  Give it try without a walkthrough...it builds character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015845005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1497376441}
review: I was never a big point and click fan, the only one I honestly ever played was Pajama Sam when I was really young at a friend's house. So I decided to pick this and up see how these games hold up. I have to say I was delighted to see how well this game aged. The only noticeable thing that didn't age well is the audio even in the remaster. I can only describe it as clunky sounding. However, I would not let that dissuade you because it really is a great game even if you're not riding on the wave of nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960461306', 'num_games_owned': 696, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1497225865}
review:
I was big into adventure games when I was younger (King's Quest era), but don't have the patience for them anymore. Somehow, I missed this game back in the day, despite loving Maniac Mansion. Even though I haven't been able to get through an adventure game in a decade, I finally gave this one a try and couldn't put it down.

Some of the puzzles are kind of out there, but none are truly random. I managed to beat it without having to look anything up, and I'm pretty dense. Several of the harder puzzles are hilariously rewarding when you figure them out. Highly recommended.

Protip: you can press "." to skip a line of dialog. Voice acting is great and funny, but sometimes you just want to move things along. You can miss an achievemnt that way, though, if you care about that sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165063939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1476300902}
review:
Great shot to the past!
I remembered almost ALL of the hundred hours I played it growing up. Finishing this game without any kind of FAQ or Walkthrough was one of the best feelings in my teen years (at least in the gaming area).
I bought it out of nostalgia, but I'm glad. The achievos helped me find a lot of secrets. And also the walkthroughs helps a lot. 
It was a GREAT game when I was growing up and it STILL is a great game nowadays

author: {'steamid': '76561197993862065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 75, 'last_played': 1592741046}
review:
A bit too slap-dash for my tastes, but has the complete Maniac Mansion game as an easter egg

TL;DR If you want to play a classic SCUMM game with updated graphics, and don't mind the Looney Tunes plot, then get this on discount.

The whole game feels like you're trapped in an episode of Pinky and the Brain (1993 all over again!) It's alot sillier than it's predecessor was (Maniac Mansion). The very cartoonish take on viewing perspective heightens the atmosphere. I got this game mainly for the easter egg (a complete version of Maniac Mansion hidden on a computer in the game). If you've played the recent Thimbleweed Park, you can see its origins in the two games.

The puzzles are supposedly the best part of DotTR, although I can't say I'm a huge fan. The remastered artwork is quite nice, even if I'm not too keen on the cartoonish style. It's tough to feel empathy for the main characters, as the plot and such are just so crazy from the outset. But I got this at 50% off, and felt I got my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023973716', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1485464297}

author: {'steamid': '76561198271711524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1497183463}
review: I found dialog to be extremely childish, tiring and generally boring. If there were no walkthroughs on the internet I would probably have never finished this game. Some puzzles and tasks lack logic and can be accomplished only by random clicking and guessing. I would not even recommend this to the youngsters as there are plenty of more fun and brain-engaging games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021655143', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1497036228}
review:
From my past childhood, this game is just great.

If you like old EA Adventures this game is for you. It brings newly remastered graphics but the game has also a mode to change to the old school style. I personally played all game in the remastered mode and now I am playing again with author¬¥s comments and old graphics which is great to get all details of the game production. 

Such great experience!

There is nothing bad to talk about this game. This is the right choose for those which enjoy old school adventures!

author: {'steamid': '76561198000625849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1494453788}
review: This game is great! A couple of the puzzles are a bit unfair, but generally the game follows a sort of slapstick cartoon logic that's satisfying to figure out. Streamlined controls and updated graphics also help reduce potential headaches. If you want a clever game that makes you feel clever for playing it, this is a winner.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966882693', 'num_games_owned': 3109, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1496649070}
review: A great looking remaster of a classic point and click adventure game. People who aren't fans of the genre won't have their minds changed by this one, but for anyone who likes this type of game, this is one of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960562354', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 554, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1496894643}
review:
Brings back memories from the mid-90s.  A lot of fun with good humor.  I admit I had to lookup a couple of hints, so it can be challenging at times.  But the puzzles are very well thought out and very creative.

Remastered version looks awesome!  And very cool that you can switch, in real time, to the original graphics.

Very recommended, even if you played and finished it 20 years ago!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1498332880}
review:
I completed the original version many years ago when it first came out. I thought it was great then and replaying it now makes me realize what a classic it is.

Its really hard to do humour in an adventure game, DoTT is really funny. The remastered graphics are great, as is the voice acting. 

So far I'm enjoying this game much more than most of the recent adventure games I've played. I wish the original developers would do a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072129817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 300, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1525328407}
review: A classic LucasArts title with a good graphic remaster. The controls are a bit akward tho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140215971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1496259105}
review: This is the first LucasArts game I've played that isn't related to the Star Wars franchise, and I'm a bit disappointed that I found out so late. Good God, this game is funny as hell, and I couldn't help but smile as I played this. Compared to other adventure games I've played, I'd say this was the most challenging for me because you're controlling three characters, which took some getting used to but made for some really interesting puzzles. But yeah, if you aren't familiar with the non-SW related games from LucasArts, this is a good place to start in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971981173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1497236105}
review:
Some remakes and remasters lack the character and quality of the original game, but this is absolutely not the case with the Day of the Tentacle (DoTT) remaster. It feels fresh 24 years after the original release, and is every bit as fun to play. The original art concept scans are a nice addition and help prove that this version of the game is true to the original design.

If you have never played DoTT, you'll want to buy it and finish it at least once. In addition to DoTT, it includes a non-remastered version of Maniac Mansion within the game.

If you're like me, and had not played DoTT in 20+ years, you can buy it again and it will seem brand new, yet familiar; Even though I can't remember how to solve most of the puzzles, solving them is enjoyable, because, unlike most adventure games, they make sense and don't require the player to resort to hint books or guides. The Steam achievements add even more value. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010335843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1495959054}
review:
Great, classic adventure game, funny story, charming characters. I never played the original so one concern I had going into the game was if the puzzle solutions would be obtuse and frustrating. I'm happy to say I got through most of the game only consulting a walkthrough once or twice for one of the more weird sections of the game (the cat puzzle was not very well relayed to the player unfortunately). So if that's your concern as well you can lay that to rest. But walking around aimlessly for awhile and occasionally wacky solutions are part of the experience and if you hate that then this game won't change your mind. 

In this game you play as three different characters trapped in 3 different eras of the same mansion. You can give each other items and sometimes things you do in the past will affect the future. The point is to power up the time machines and get a diamond to go back to the present. Some of the changes you can make include to the American flag and even the Constitution. Overall a great game and great way to introduce yourself to point and click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960437531', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1461984076}
review:
If you played the original Day of the Tentacle back in the 90s, you owe it to yourself to buy this. Double fine did a great job with this remaster; it's exactly the same game only with updated graphics. Being able to switch between the new and old graphics on the fly is really cool too, makes you think 'wow, were the previous graphics really THAT bad?!'

If you haven't played this before, you'll enjoy it if you're looking for one of the most classic and famous adventure games of all time. It's a great game with lots of humor and imagination, memorable characters, a fun story, and really cool artwork. Some of the puzzles are very difficult to figure out, but you- unlike those of us who played it back in the early 90s- have the internet and google to help you with anything that has you stumped, so you're good to go :p

author: {'steamid': '76561198207898023', 'num_games_owned': 2369, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1495976288}
review:
Let me first start out by saying this is one of my all time favorite games. I got it when it first came out and had to install multiple floppies and use diagrams found in the manual that acted like copy-protection, each time you'd have to fix a diagram in game to match it with one found in the manual, I always liked that. But now with this Remaster the graphics are all the same quality you'd find on a Saturday morning watching old Chuck Jones shows. Everytime I play it sends me back 20 years to when I first fell in love with the SCUMM type games like Sam and Max, Full Throttle, and Day of the Tentacle.
I saw this game go on sale and HAD to get it immediately, if you are unsure of a gift for young or old alike I recommend this game, the puzzles, dialogue, characters, and over all design just scream fun times.

review:
I used to play this game back in the days on my 486 DX2 66. I have no idea how many playthroughs I had, I just know that this game is one of the best of its kind. It's a classic!

I recommend this game to anyone who likes point-and-click-adventures. However, if you are impatient, you should pass on this, since you have to think a lot outside the box in order to solve the puzzles. 

No matter what, this game is a gem and earns a thumbs up!  

Cheers!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032273592', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 817, 'last_played': 1495221237}
review:
Day of The Tentacle is the sequel to Maniac Mansion, the adventure game that kicked off Lucasarts' legendary SCUMM series of games, as well as the game that introduced Tim Shafer of Double Fine.  

The plot is very silly, moreso than its predecessor, and far less dark.  It really feels like a cartoon.  And once you think of things in cartoon logic, the game's puzzles start to make a weird kind of sense.  There's something very Looney Tunes inspired about the game.  

Bernard, one of the optional characters in the original game, has returned to the Edison mansion with some new friends as Purple Tentacle is mutated by toxic waste into a super villain bent on conquering the world.  In this, the Tentacle is successful, enslaving humanity for centuries to come.  Dr. Fred, the villain in the previous game, is now free from his mind control and is just a crazy, senile mad scientist.  In order to stop the reign of the Tentacle, Fred reveals he has been working on a time machine.  Made out of port-a-potties, of course.  

The time jump malfunctions, stranding the three characters in different time periods.  

Bernard, the stereotypical nerd, is stuck in the present.

Hoagie, a roadie, is stuck in colonial America during the drafting of the Constitution. 

Laverne, a crazy, manic medical student, is caught in a future where humans are pets and Tentacles rule.

The gameplay is based around solving puzzles by using items and commands in unusual ways, and sending items back and forth in time.  Sometimes the item you need to solve a puzzle is in another time period, so you have to try stuff out.  For anyone familiar with these kinds of games, this is expected, if this is your first point-and-click adventure, I am sure it could feel tedious.  They can be straightforward, such as "put the videotape in the VCR" or outright insane (chattery teeth to make a fire!).  Again, the game uses weird cartoon logic.  If it would fit in a Bugs Bunny cartoon, it's possible in this game.  

For the most part, it is not an overly difficult game of its kind, but some of the puzzles are unintuitive enough to be frustrating.  I ended up having to look a few of them up.  

As for the Remaster, it's wonderfully done and with the ability to switch between the original and remastered version at will.  Pressing F1 will switch the artstyle between the original pixel art and the new hand-drawn HD version.  The commands and audio can also be changed at will between classic and remastered, as well as optional subtitles.  

The remastered graphics are very well done, though they really bring out the cartoonishness of the game.  There are a few places where the graphics update helps with some frustrating stuff as some objects are indistinct in the original pixel art.  The overhaul matches the original concept art (which is included as a bonus), and so it doesn't seem like a big departure.  

The sounds have all been remastered from the original recordings, as well.  The commands in the original release were underneath the screen, in a list of actions and inventory.  In the Remaster, a dial system like those in later SCUMM games is used (right click on an object and choose a command from a dial).  Like everything else, this can be switched - but using the dial, the game will expand to fullscreen, making it nicer to look at and less cluttered.  It is perfectly playable either way - but the dial looks better.

And as a bonus, the original Maniac Mansion is included as an easter egg - if you can find a PC in the house, you can access the first game.  

Overall, it's another great game in a line of great adventure games from Lucasarts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006679072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1495407132}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036767762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1664427243}
review:
Honestly, DoTT was a fantastic game, and one that got me into adventure gaming, something I had trouble with before. It just did a lot of things right... It went to town on the art, to the point where it was one of the closest things to playing an interactive cartoon at the time, and it also weeded out a lot of the frustrating aspects previous adventure games had... Being one of the first (if not THE first) adventure games to remove game overs completely, cutting out a lot of obnoxious trial and error while also not making the game too easy. The puzzles can still be daunting, though thankfully not as abstruse and nonsensical as the ones in Monkey Island 2. It was essentially the next evolution in adventure gaming, setting the model for many games in the genre that followed.

However, this was all a review of the original game from 1993. How does the remake fare? Wellll honestly, it's pretty average. The upscaled graphics vary in quality, often looking like they simply ran a filter over the original. The voice acting now uses much less compressed versions of the recordings, but it's still the same stilted, awkward acting as before, and many of the animations just haven't aged well.

The thing is, all these faults seem primarily due to the feature to switch between the remastered game and the original game on the fly, which, quite frankly, was a really cool feature when it was introduced in the Monkey Island remaster, but has since become a bit of a worn-out gimmick. Needing to sync the new version of the game completely with the old one just holds back the ability of the developers to give the game the updates it really needs, and I'd have preferred they ditched the remaster/original switching entirely for some reworked animation in the new version, as well as actual timing in the dialogue.

Aside from that, the additions I ended up appeciating the most were the added commentary mode, as well as the new achievements, which (for the most part) encourage players to find little extra touches and bits of dialogue in the game, and that's something the lucasarts developers have always been good at.

I believe this remaster is very worth it for those who haven't played the game before and would like to witness an incredible piece of adventure game history. Those as old as I, who've played the original and enjoyed it back in the day, way want to wait for a sale. That is my verdict!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286498657', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 520, 'last_played': 1501586419}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist ein Spiel, welches ich jedem Fan von Click-Adventures ans Herz legen kann. 
Man kann in dem Spiel zwischen  drei Characteren hin und her wechseln und muss einen Gegenstand nach dem anderen finden. Manche Gegenst√§nde lassen sich dabei kombinieren. Da aber jeder Charakter ein anderes Inventar besitzt, gibt es eine art Teleporter, durch den man die Sachen zwischen den Characteren hin und her schieben kann.
Des weiteren ist die Story total lustig. Man muss die Welt vor den Tentakeln retten und hilft z.B. Benjamin Franklin dabei den Blitzableiter zu erfinden. 
Deshalb kann ich das Spiel nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011233147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1492723662}
review:
Masterful remaster!

I played this game when it first came out in an earlier millennia and loved it so much that I played it over and over again. The nostalgic value of this remaster is pretty damn high for me personally, which means this review will be highly subjective. One thing I think I easily can say in an objective way though is that this remaster is done right. This is how you make a masterful remaster.

Often when you play a remaster of a game that you remember as a vital contribution to your gaming history it does not live up to the way you remember it. This has happened to me on several occasions. This is because your selective memory gives you a vision of how it would look by todays standards, and most games can not live up to that vision. This game though, to my shock, did that to the fullest. They managed to update this game to my visions of the classic based on my selective memory, and that to the fullest. That is simply amazing. I don't think I've ever experienced that with any remastered game before. Bravo to Double Fine!

To this day I could remember most of the gameplay and puzzles from when I played it many years ago, and because of that I kind of breezed through the game this time. But even with the lack of challenge, reliving the experience with this game was a blast. Reciting lines just before they are said and giggling in anticipation of what you know is going to happen when you do certain things. Even the retro game (Maniac Mansion) within the retro game had me excited (Yes, I am so old I can even remember playing that some time before this "sequel"). I had so much fun that I might play this remastered version over and over again like I did with the original way back when.

If you are an old school gamer like me and used to play adventure games you have probably played this before and know what to expect. In fact if you at all played this game at one point or never got to play it the first time around you can not let it pass this time. Play or replay it. It is a must. However, today there is several younger generations that never got to play this, but I bet most of them too have heard about the greats that was LucasArts and the times of point 'n' click adventure games. If you want to experience what every father, uncle or any other older gamer was bragging about, now's your chance to try for yourself. But there is a few things you need to know in advance:

Going through this game for the first time is not going to be as easy as it looks. There are some brain twisting moments in this game and few things are straight forward. Yes, you might also consider several puzzles to be a bit far fetched or illogical, or like us older gamers call it, creative :o). It is not a game with a lot of action and high pulse, though you might experience moments of heavy frustration over not figuring out how to advance the story and welts on your forehead because of facepalms after you figure it out. Though it might seem impossible or unfair at times, the game always hints you in the right direction. You need to pay attention though or you might miss them. The game is cleverly designed that way. Do yourself a favor by trying to use guides or walkthroughs as little as possible. The fulfilment you sit with after getting through this game without help is worth it.

The graphics and artstyle is suitable corny and comedic, well fitting the premise of the game. You'll love the characters, both main and secondary. They are even wonderfully voiced. I even dare you to not laugh out loud playing through this game. There is so much great stuff in here it is impossible not to. Another good thing is that I did not experience a single glitch or bug at all playing through this, something that seems rare lately.

I have to recommend this game to everybody and their mother, father, brother etc. It is that damn good. You owe it to yourself to play this so you know what all the fuzz is about. Even if you should end up not liking it, it would still be worth it. Just for that.

To me it is one of the pinnacles of gaming history and the fact that I enjoyed it as much now after all these years and after all these playthroughs attest that to me it simply is and always will be a masterpiece. That is why I simply have to rate this 10/10.

In fact, I enjoy it so much I feel like I could... TAKE ON THE WORLD!

What are you waiting for.... go get ;o)

Other people migh not share my opinion of this game so it could always be worth reading other reviews....and tell them they are WRONG, and then run to buy it yourself ;o)

Happy gaming :o)

TJ

author: {'steamid': '76561198070389028', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1492989075}
review:
Story-rich, goofy, point-and-click adventure with time travel puzzles. Collect and move items between characters from the past, present, and future to ultimately prevent a hostile tentacle takeover.
 
Has settings to toggle between 1993 version and the remastered version to fit with the demands of modern game graphics + design.

Solid 10+ hours of gameplay; more for those achievement grinders.

Bonus Content: Includes 1987 classic game "Maniac Mansion" within the game. (Precedent to DotT)

author: {'steamid': '76561197974299727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1703814350}
review:
Day of Tentacle is remaster of sequel.  Game involve many puzzle which involve flushing item down shitter.  Event that happen in past can impact future event.  All that is missing is Delorean.

Some people say game look like Polished cartoon but I did not see what Warsaw.  Graphic much better and you can see difference with F1 key.  Sound effect and music not improve as much.

If you like flushing every day item down toilet and microwaving pets then this game is for you.  Number 1 game in Jalalabad on release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011129687', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1489875744}
review:
I played this game as a part of my 52 games in 52 weeks challenge. My review is also on my facebook page https://www.facebook.com/Kayasarcade/


I have never played a Tim Schafer game that I did not like, and DofT is no exception! The humor is on point (..and not something you will see in newer games), I laughed so many times and really enjoyed the easy going story.

For someone that do not know American story that well, it was actually funny to see DofT version of the founding fathers and how they wrote the United States constitution - I didn't learn much, but I had fun!

I remember how much I loved the "Gobliiins" games on the MS-DOS back when I was a little kid. I wish that I could go back in time and play DofT as mini-me, and experienced the LucasArts games and the love i have for them now, back then.
After seeing the remastered and the orginal compared, i really think that Double Fine Productions did a great job - But I would love to try the original, just to enjoy the great pixelwork.

I don't think this will be the last LucasArts game I will be playing in this challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042148145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1492432054}

author: {'steamid': '76561197968406757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1492379090}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered is Maniac Mansion 2.  This is your old-school point and click adventure game, where you play as 3 kids trying to find the things they need to defeat the evil Purple Tentacle (who just was mutated with arms!)

There are some hilarious lines in this game, that could only have been allowed because it was made in the 90s.  Gameplay is very similar to that of the typical 90s adventure games as well.

If you have the patience, this is a classic title for this genre, and highly recommend it.  If not, you can read a review and a walkthrough and have the puzzles told for you, and still enjoyable.

Achivement Quest:  This is an easy 100%, but there are missable achivements which make it scary.  Look up a guide, find the missable achivements, and make sure to look for those along the way.  All achivements can be earned in 1 playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028395313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1491907932}
review:
La migliore avventura grafica di sempre (insieme alla serie di Deponia). Questa versione rimasterizzata √® straordinaria: l'interfaccia √® stata svecchiata e alleggerita in maniera impeccabile (ora l'inventario √® a comparsa). Le immagini sono a tutto schermo e in alta risoluzione. Il gioco mi ha fatto tornare indietro di vent'anni, facendomi assaporare lo stile delle vecchie avventure grafiche. Ringrazio i ragazzi della Double Fine Productions per aver svecchiato questo splendido gioco. Davvero un ottimo lavoro. Consiglio l'acquisto di questo gioco nel periodo degli sconti.

Consiglio: I personaggi possono passarsi gli oggetti direttamente dall'inventario (clikkate sull'oggetto nell'inventario e poi sull'immagine del personaggio destinatario) senza andare necessariamente ogni volta al crono-gabinetto.

Voto: 9

author: {'steamid': '76561198054447980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1698892679}
review:
A very fun and spunky game with an old-school Lucsarts flair. As a bonus, you can even play the original Maniac Mansion in-game!

The puzzles can shift from obvious to pretty conveluted, I"ll admit I had to consult a walkthrough a couple of times. I like how you can seamlessly switch from the old to new version like in the Monkey Island remastered games. One thing I wish theyd add would be an in-game hint system to help you instead of having to go straight to the internet for answers. But if you like point-and-click games, this is right up your alley

review:
Obra maestra absoluta, aunque en contra de la opini√≥n general, bastante por debajo de Monkey Island. Vale mucho la pena, el planteamiento es original, el combinar los tres personajes y las tres √©pocas y por supuesto el sentido del humor. La remasterizaci√≥n est√° bien, aunque queda un poco Tiny Toon, y le resta algo de personalidad. Es un tanto limitado en cuanto a escenarios, pues todo se resume a la mansion en tres √©pocas diferentes, pero est√° muy bien resuelto.

Uno de esos juegos que has de jugar y terminar en tu vida, incluso aunque no te guste el g√©nero.

review: The original game was my first adventure game and you can say it is the easiest adventure by lukasarts. The remastered version is a nice makeover. The audio and grafics are better. There is also an audio commentary of the creators of this game. They tell us how some of the puzzles were created (Let it rain...).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998334516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1490743694}
review:
I last played the game when I was 17 or so. I'm 40 now; this remaster is how I remembered it in my mind's eye. This is a brilliant achievement; the repainted art, the remastered audio from the original voice recordings.. it gives completely new life to this classic. I bought this remaster at first to prepare my adventure muscles for the release of Thimbleweed Park, to get back in the mindset, but I ended up enjoying it immensely on its own. I was pretty happy that I completed it without any hints in 7 hours  - I recalled some puzzle chains from my last playthrough as a teen, but had to rediscover most and got stuck on a few silly things.

Highly, highly recommend if you're a point and click adventure fan; DOTT was the unbeaten high point of this genre and it still is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979434471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1468275628}
review:
This game works in so many ways. I remember playing it back in the day and now having the opportunity to play it again in a modern time machine without losing any bit from the original it's great. The ability  to switch between classic and remastered mode is always a good addition for those nostalgic days when you miss the pixelated graphics.

I definitely recommend this game as one of the classics of adventure games

review:
Brilliant remaster of the classic point-and-click comedy adventure.

Although some of the puzzles are a little esoteric they do all fit together when you figure it out (or look it up). The jokes are still solid and for an old game it really hasn't dated much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053319880', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1492525828}
review:
[h1]*** VERSIONE SINTETICA ***[/h1]
[b]pro[/b]:
[list]
[*] un [i]grande classico[/i] consigliato a chi non ha avuto la fortuna di scoprirlo a suo tempo
[*] il fascino dell'originale √® rimasto intatto negli anni, in una veste rispettosa della tradizione ma con un occhio agli standard attuali
[*] mantenuta la possibilit√† di giocare per intero anche [i]Maniac Mansion[/i]
[/list]

[b]contro[/b]:
[list]
[*] la grafica remastered non sembra andare aldil√† di una ripulita dei pixel
[*] commento degli autori a tratti deludente
[/list]


[h1] *** VERSIONE ESTESA ***
[i]Il giorno quando tentai di colare un tentacolo[/i] [/h1]
Spesso e volentieri quando si recensisce un'avventura grafica (o punta & clicca, a dir si voglia) si cade nel tranello di sbrodolarsi nella sindrome del "Ai miei tempi...", degni del miglior osservatore di cantiere italico. A maggior ragione se si sta parlando di un classico [b]LucasArts[/b] come [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i]...
   Si √® scritto cos√¨ tanto sul mondo delle avventure grafiche che non penso abbiate bisogno della mia opinione in merito. Va da s√® che una remastered ha due ragioni d'esistere:
[list]
[*] dare la possibilit√† a giocatori giovincelli di avvicinarsi a pietre miliari della storia videoludica
[*] far riscoprire ai nostalgici un po' pi√π "datati" una parte della propria giovent√π ludica
[/list]
C'√® da aggiungere che una qualsiasi remastered (soprattutto se si parla di avventure grafiche) ha in s√® una componente fortemente "documentaristica", grazie alla possibilit√† di integrare al gioco ulteriori contenuti bonus, primo fra tutti il commento degli autori.
   L'uscita della remastered di DotT era una delle pi√π attese, quantomento da parte mia: la prospettiva di vedere la grafica cartoonesca in alta definizione era un richiamo irresistibile, e [b]dopo aver goduto del commento degli autori della remastered di Monkey Island 2[/b]... beh diciamo che l'aspettativa aveva completamente stravolto la mia regolare salivazione. Devo ammettere, per√≤, che una volta calatomi nei panni di [i]Bernard, Hoagie e Laverne[/i], la sensazione √® che quell'aspettativa non sia stata del tutto soddisfatta.
   Non del tutto, certo: Effettivamente √® una goduria vedere in una veste del tutto nuova uno dei giochi che ha profondamente segnato la mia giovinezza, sia dal punto di vista meramente ludico che da quello pi√π ampiamente culturale. e Day of the Tentacle si conferma come un'opera invecchiata in maniera ineccepibile. [b] Ma c'√® un ma [/b]. Probabilmente anche due.
   Complice la benevolenza della memoria umana, [i]la veste grafica remastered non mi ha dato la sensazione di meraviglia che un'operazione del genere vorrebbe suscitare[/i] - soprattutto messa a confronto con quella di Monkey Island 2. Nel mio immaginario Day of the Tentacle era come se fosse [b]gi√†[/b] in alta risoluzione. Ovviamente se ci si mette con occhio clinico a paragonare le due versioni, le differenze vengono a galla e sono ben evidenti... eppure non c'√® stata una trasfigurazione sbalorditiva. Il che - si badi bene - non √® data dalla scarsa qualit√† del lavoro svolto dai ragazzi della [b]Double Fine[/b] (basta dare un occhio alla remastered di [i]Grim Fandango[/i]) quanto dal fatto che Day of the Tentacle di per s√® √® invecchiato in maniera splendida.
   Una delusione vera e propria, invece, la ho avuta per quanto riguarda [b]contenuti bonus[/b]. Aldil√† dell'efficace e ben fatta impostazione delle interfacce e soprassedendo sul gradevole art book, dal commento degli autori mi aspettavo molto di pi√π. Troppo pochi gli interventi, e spesso poco incisivi. Ogni tanto ho avuto la percezione non siano riusciti a trovare particolari argomenti da trattare o aneddoti da raccontare - dando un'atmosfera di riempitivo che dispiace. Peccato.

[h1]In sintesi...[/h1]
La mancata sensazione di sorpresa e di riscoperta che manca in questa remastered, da una parte sembra puntare il dito sulla (a volte) legittima critica di [b]"speculazione nostalgica"[/b] che le edizioni [i]remastered/special/enhanced[/i] si portano inevitabilmente dietro; dall'altra non si pu√≤ notare che a volte - e fortunatamente questo √® il caso - [i]non √® l'HR che fa il gioco[/i].

author: {'steamid': '76561198136622158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1491330847}
review:
Overall: This is one of the best games of all time, Great point and click adventure game created by lucas Arts.  Beautifully remastered and easily switchable to normal look simply by pressing F1

Pros: 
-Fun game and really is worth the money
-Its got steam trading cards and achievments

Cons:
-Once you get all achievments and beat the game it really looses its replay value :-( but down the road if you get that itch you have it :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198294995465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1490131660}
review: I first played the original of this game when I was 8 years old, going back 24 years ago now. I enjoyed this just as much the second time through at the age of 31 =). Was super excited to see this was remastered and as always can sometimes assume will be old and not that entertaining but there are so many jokes and scenes which I would not have understood as a kid that found funny today. The best remastered old pc point and click games (my favourites) are those that when you play remastered it seems and feels just like you remembered it, until you turn on the old-style play graphics! Captured the game as I remembered perfectly, great story line, funny and fab quirky characters. Brilliant game that will not burn months of your life but get you thinking outside the box and give you laughs along the way. Thanks for making me feel 8 again! Loved it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067095535', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1556960986}
review:
Ein Haus voller Verr√ºckter, Zeitreisen und ein machthungriger Purpur-Tentakel. Unter Zockern meiner Generation klingelt‚Äòs bei Erw√§hnung genannter Stichpunkte sofort, und wem schon bei der Titel-Abk√ºrzung DOTT augenblicklich der Groschen f√§llt, der bekommt 100 Gummipunkte extra. *g* Nat√ºrlich ist von ‚ÄûDay of the Tentacle‚Äú die Rede, einem DER gro√üen Adventure-Meilensteine √ºberhaupt ‚Äì und zugleich eines der popul√§rsten Genre-Meisterwerke der ehemaligen Kultschmiede Lucas Arts. Ein Must-Have-Titel den man als PCler in den 1990er Jahren einfach haben musste. Jaahaaaa, lang ist‚Äôs her‚Ä¶
Und nun, 23 Jahre sp√§ter, darf auch die neue Generation in den Genuss dieses Klassikers kommen. Tim Schafer, dem geistigen Vater von DOTT, sei Dank. Nach ‚ÄûGrim Fandango‚Äú hat das unter seiner Leitung gef√ºhrte Entwickler-Studio Double Fine Adventures auch hier Hand angelegt und den ergrauten VGA-Hit f√ºrs Full-HD-Zeitalter wieder fit gemacht. Das Resultat, welches sich nunmehr ‚ÄûDOTT ‚Äì Remastered‚Äú nennt, kann sich ohne Frage sehen lassen.

F√ºr all jene die die DOTT-Story noch nicht kennen sollten ‚Äì falls das √ºberhaupt m√∂glich ist-, hier eine kurze Zusammenfassung:
Das geknackte Dreier-Gespann Bernard, Laverne und Hoagie eilt zum Edison-Haus um den durch Dr. Freds eigene Giftbr√ºhe mutierten Purpur-Tentakel aufzuhalten, der mit seinen nachgewachsenen Stummel√§rmchen Welteroberungsambitionen an den Tag legt. Doch weil das Kind l√§ngst in den Brunnen gefallen ist muss die Katastrophe verhindert werden bevor sie passiert. Also gestern. Klar, kriegen wir hin. Denn wie es der Zufall will hat Dr. Fred drei zu Zeitmaschinen umfunktionierte Dixie-Klos im Keller stehen ‚Äì f√ºr nen DeLorian fehlte wohl das Geld *lach* -, ergo schickt er bebrillten Tollpatsch, wirre Medizin-Studentin und korpulenten Rocker auf Zeitreise um die Menschheit vor Purpur zu bewahren. Doch leider geht alles (wie zu erwarten) schief. Hoagie landet 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit, Laverne selbe Zeit in der Zukunft, w√§hrend Bernard weiterhin in der Gegenwart festsitzt. Obgleich zeitlich voneinander getrennt m√ºssen alle Drei alles daran setzen den verursachten Schlamassel wieder zu korrigieren‚Ä¶

Zur Beruhigung aller Alt-Fans:
‚ÄûDOTT- Remastered‚Äú ist kein (!) Komplett-Remake geworden. Die Handlungsabfolge, die R√§tsel(ketten), die Dialoge, nahezu alles was das Ur-Spiel eben so kultig macht ist unangetastet geblieben, das Einzige was Schafer und sein Team an Verbesserungen durchgef√ºhrt haben ist rein kosmetischer Natur zuzuordnen. Der unvergleichliche, comicartige, aber aus heutiger Sicht auch arg grobpixelige Zeichenstil erstrahlt nun messerscharf 1:1 nachgezeichnet und im bildschirmf√ºllenden 16:9-Format, w√§hrend das alte SCUMM-Interface mitsamt Verb-Leiste einem modernen Popup-Men√º weicht. Wer sich zu den Puristen z√§hlt und nicht auf SCUMM verzichten m√∂chte darf dies gl√ºcklicherweise weiterhin nutzen, muss aber dann auch mit einem klassischen 4:3-Bild leben. Gleiches gilt f√ºr die Original-Grafik zu der man ‚Äì wie bei den ‚ÄûMonkey Island‚Äú-Neuauflagen ‚Äì per Tastendruck schnell hin und her switchen kann. Ansonsten gibt es keine nennenswerten Neuerungen. Die Animationsstufen der Charaktere sind weiterhin beschr√§nkt, weshalb die Bewegungen von Bernard und Co. altmodisch, sprich leicht abgehakt aussehen, w√§hrend die knallbunten Hintergr√ºnde in der Regel recht starr bleiben. Daf√ºr erfolgt das horizontale Scrolling - anders als fr√ºher - nunmehr butterweich. 
Richtige Anpassungen lassen sich eher auf der tonalen Ebene herausfiltern. Die neu abgemischte Musik klingt etwas frischer bzw. minimal satter und einzelne Ger√§uscheffekte wurden ausgetauscht, was aber letztendlich nix an der eher sp√§rlichen Soundkulisse gro√üartig √§ndert. Neben der alten, leicht dumpfen Deutsch-Sprachausgabe steht nun auch die englische Tonspur zur Verf√ºgung, welche klar vorzuziehen ist. Zwar nicht ganz auf dem Niveau der Original-Fassung von ‚ÄûSam & Max‚Äú und Co., aber insgesamt doch passender als die deutschen Sprecher. Multilinguale Texte und eine Entwickler-Kommentar-Funktion gibt‚Äôs noch dazu, und das ‚ÄûSpiel im Spiel‚Äú ‚Äì gemeint ist nat√ºrlich der DOTT-Vorg√§nger ‚ÄûManiac Mansion‚Äú ‚Äì ist ebenfalls noch enthalten.

Fazit:
Obwohl es nicht zu meinen pers√∂nlichen Lucas Arts-Favoriten z√§hlt m√∂chte ich ‚ÄûDOTT ‚Äì Remastered‚Äú nicht missen. Auch nach √ºber 20 Jahren mag ich den schrulligen Humor und die besondere R√§tselg√ºte des Originals, die mit √§u√üerst schr√§gen, aber doch streng logischen Einf√§llen daherkommt. Dank an Schafer und Co. daf√ºr dass sie diese nicht wegzudenkende Genre-Perle f√ºr die n√§chsten (mindestens) 20 Jahre liebevoll restauriert und f√ºr nachfolgende Generationen gerettet haben. Nun kann ich das n√§chste Remastered-Projekt ("Full Throttle - Vollgas") kaum abwarten. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198039584690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1457943403}
review:
Los grandes cl√°sicos nunca se olvidan, tarde o temprano vuelven, llegan mejorados pero como no, manteni√©ndose tan vivos y con tanta carisma como los conociamos.

Estamos antes la segunda parte del juego Maniac Mansion, un gran cl√°sico dentro de las aventuras gr√°ficas que all√° por los noventa ya caus√≥ furor, y seguramente, con esta reedici√≥n siga ganando jugadores en los siguientes 20 a√±os.

El argumento gira en torno a tres amigos que tienen que unirse y viajar al pasado para evitar que un tent√°culo p√∫rpura mutado controle el mundo en un mundo que se nos muestra al m√°s puro ‚Äúdibujo animado‚Äù. Todo esto plagado de un humor por doquier, y grandes momentos para recodar.

El sistema de juego utiliza el cl√°sico point and click, en el que pincharemos sobre la pantalla para que nuestros personajes se muevan por el escenario. Como en toda aventura gr√°fica, las ideas m√°s descabelladas y alocadas ser√°n las que marquen el avance la historia. El sentido com√∫n no te ser√° √∫til, tendr√°n que darle al coco para pensar una idea loca, y que har√≠an nuestros personajes para resolver cada puzle que nos encontremos. 

Una parte que hace interesante el t√≠tulo es como juego con el tiempo. No hago ning√∫n spoiler si os digo que muy pronto cada uno de los tres personajes viajar√°n en el tiempo, bueno‚Ä¶ todos no, Bernard se quedar√° en el presente, pero los otros dos amigos si se ir√°n, uno 200 a√±os al pasado desde la actual fecha, y la chica 200 a√±os al futuro. Lo interesante de esto es que estar√°n en contacto todo el tiempo gracias a las maquinas del Dr. Fred Edison, y cada acciones que hagamos en el tiempo afectar√°n a los momentos sucesores. 

Si te decides por comprar la versi√≥n de consola estas de suerte, porque Day of the Tentacle cuenta con cross-buy y cross-save, para disfrutar de nuestra partida en Playstation 4 a la vez en PS Vita.

Gr√°ficamente el juego ha sido mejorado much√≠simo, con unas ilustraciones en alta resoluci√≥n, pero con la ventaja de seguir teniendo el mismo juego de siempre.
 ¬øNo te llega a gustar el nuevo dise√±o? No importa, si eres de los que no quieren cambios del dise√±o, y simplemente han buscado una excusa para volver a jugarlo, siempre tendr√°s a un toque de bot√≥n (pinchando en PS4 en la pantalla t√°ctil) y as√≠ de sencillo pasaremos de vista moderna a vista cl√°sica.

Un nuevo a√±adido, aunque ya estamos acostumbrado a ello con las remasterizaciones de otros juegos, es la inclusi√≥n de logros. Un aliciente m√°s para los amantes de los trofeos, y para los coleccionistas de juegos completados.

El apartado sonoro tambi√©n ha sido mejorado, brind√°ndonos la oportunidad de escoger la m√∫sica de esta nueva edici√≥n o de su antigua. Y no solo eso, contamos con el juego con todos los textos en castellano, que ser√° m√°s que esplendido para disfrutar plenamente de las graciosas conversaciones entre personajes. Respecto al audio no hemos tenido tanta suerte pero bueno, no se puede pedir todo. Si no te queda suficiente con todo esto, encima el juego cuenta con la posibilidad de habilitar al comienzo los comentarios de los creadores originales.

Si has le√≠do este an√°lisis es porque te gustan las aventuras gr√°ficas, y en tal caso tanto si lo jugaste hace m√°s de veinte a√±os como si no, este juego se convierte en un indispensable al tenemos todo. Disfrutable en versi√≥n cl√°sica o remasterizada, logros, diversi√≥n, entretenimiento y sobre todo mucho humor.

M√°s en: creativefuturegames(doc)com

author: {'steamid': '76561197978625167', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1661983373}
review:
Zeitreise in der Videospielgeschichte!
Wenn man einen Spieleklassiker wie Day of the Tentacle √ºberarbeitet und neuver√∂ffentlicht, kann man damit zwei Gruppen ansprechen: Jene, die damals bereits das Spiel liebten und ihre Sentimentalit√§t mit einer den modernen Standards weitm√∂glichst angepassten Version ausleben wollen, und jene, die das Spiel bei der ersten Ver√∂ffentlichung aus verschiedensten Gr√ºnden nicht gespielt haben und sich wom√∂glich nicht auf den damaligen Standard einlassen k√∂nnen oder wollen. Das Design des Spiels wirkt auf mich wie die Blaupause f√ºr weite Teile der kommerziellen ‚ÄûNerdkultur‚Äú, wie ich sie kenne: bunt, √ºberstilisierte Proportionen, charmant √ºberzeichnete Charaktere. Der Humor schwankt zwischen wirklich clever und grenzenlos stumpf. Die Idee, dass Purpur-Tentakel nun, da ihm dank giftm√ºllverschmutztem Wasser Arme gewachsen sind, die Weltherrschaft an sich rei√üen m√∂chte und drei Hauptprotagonisten, die zwar alle nur denkbaren Klischees erf√ºllen, aber dennoch irgendwie sympathisch sind, ihn nun v√∂llig plan- und ahnungslos stoppen sollen.
