author: {'steamid': '76561198080365533', 'num_games_owned': 732, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1489120438}
review:
If you experience audio stattering on Windows 10, run the game in Windows 8 compatibility mode.

============================================

Old classic. Super funny story. Stylish graphics. Extraordinary voice acting.

While controls are remastered, they are still fundamentally point and click (i.e. designed with philosophy different from today's in mind), and can get confusing or even misleading at times.

Don't feel bad if you have to consult guides now and then, because the game can be cryptic at times.

8 out of 10, excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994000906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 800, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1489082156}
review: I think in some ways if a point and click has a part that no human could reasonably guess without a walkthrough then it's kind of an automatic F and this game has a couple of those. But I'm unreasonably hard on these Cherished Classics I guess. The graphics have certainly aged well and it's a good example of how to do everything right with a remaster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014622873', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1488842623}
review: Day of the tentacle, le p√®re fondateur des point and click modernes, revient dans une version (l√©g√®rement) retravaill√©e ! Je viens juste de le finir √† nouveau et quel bonheur ! Le jeu est toujours aussi fun et retords apr√®s toutes ces ann√©es ! Pour ceux qui ne connaissent pas et qui ne sont pas allergiques aux point & click, sachez que ce jeu est absolument indispensable ! Tout y est formidable : l'humour potache, la direction unique tr√®s inspir√©e o√π tout est dessin√© de travers, les animations √† la Tex Avery, l'aventure qui fait penser aux meilleurs moments de Retour vers le futur, les situations et les personnages, plus loufoques les uns que les autres. Bref, un gigantesque moment de bonheur √† passer en compagnie du docteur Fred - savant compl√®tement fou, de Bernard l'intello, de Hoagie le rockeur gras du bide et de Laverne l'apprentie chirurgienne √† tendances sadiques. Quant √† la version 'Remastered' propos√©e, celle-ci n'apporte que de menus ajouts, mais sympathiques : possibilit√© de passer de la version d'origine en gros pixels avec l'interface et la musique de l'√©poque vers la version remasteris√©e en appuyant sur la touche F1, sauvegarde automatique, succ√®s et bonus d√©bloqu√©s quand on avance dans le jeu. La version Remasteris√©e consiste en un passage √† la HD respectant parfaitement le style d'origine avec support des √©crans larges, et sans le menu en bas de l'√©cran, remplac√© par un menu contextuel en cercle apparaissant quand on clique sur bouton droit de la souris. Je trouve que le lissage graphique est sympathique, m√™me s'il fait dispara√Ætre compl√®tement le pixel-art d'origine. Cela dit, on peut switcher quand on veut entre la version d'origine et la nouvelle donc rien de grave √† ce niveau-l√†. La musique remasteris√©e, quant √† elle, est de l'ordre du sympathique √©galement, mais n'est pas fofolle non plus. Un synth√©tiseur plus r√©cent a √©t√© utilis√© pour faire le rendu des musiques. Il n'y a pas eu de vraie r√©orchestration √† proprement parler. Sinon, tout est l√†, y compris l'int√©gralit√© du jeu 'Maniac Mansion', jouable directement dans un des ordinateurs du jeu (ce qui √©tait incroyable pour l'√©poque). Bon, je me suis un peu √©tal√©, mais vous l'aurez compris : ce jeu est l√©gendaire de par son g√©nie et je pense sinc√®rement que tout gamer normalement constitu√© devrait l'avoir fini au moins un fois dans sa vie. Ah oui, une derni√®re chose : √©vitez d'utiliser une soluce si possible : les accomplissements n'en seront que plus jouissifs !

author: {'steamid': '76561198064445036', 'num_games_owned': 1449, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1488129577}
review:
Was ist Day of the Tentacle? Dazu m√∂chte ich erstmal sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel als Kind nie gespielt habe und dadurch keine Nostalgie f√ºr dieses Spiel habe, was meines erachtens in solchen Review sogar recht positiv ist. Also was ist nun Day of the Tentacle, ein Point and Click Adventure welchen vollen guter Idee, Witz, Charme, kreativen R√§tseln, tollen Charakteren und noch so viel anderen gro√üartigen Dingen steckt. Dieses Spiel ist 24 Jahre alt, das ist fast ein viertel Jahrhundert und es ist immernoch so unglaublich gut und viel besser als alles was derzeit erscheint. Jeder der Intresse an Videospielen hat sollte dieses Meisterwerk spielen weil es so viel richtig macht und zeigt warum dieses Genre damals so gro√ü war. Aber um was geht es? Ihr m√ºsst die Welt retten und habt dazu 3 Charktere welche jeweils 200 Jahre von einader entfernt agieren. Die Steuerung ist gut, die Ratsel sind gut L√∂sbar, es hat eine gute Vertonung und Unterh√§lt einen sehr. Kauft es euch!!!!


kommt auch aus den 90ern:http://www.twitch.tv/thebenjaminkendrick

author: {'steamid': '76561197965046644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1464832953}
review:
A return to a good classic click adventure that I grew up with. If you like click adventures with some interesting puzzles along with humor then I recommend playing this. Now this game is also sort of sequel/spin off of Manic Mansion and don't worry if you haven't played Manic Mansion because you can play the game within Day of the Tentacle in it's glory old graphics (hint it's ingame and hard to miss). 

Now all we need is Full Throttle

author: {'steamid': '76561198012203940', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 432, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1488183516}
review: Rigiocato a distanza di tanti, tanti anni, questa splendida avventura punta e clicca rimane sempre un capolavoro, a maggior ragione con questa versione rimasterizzata. La storia √® fuori di testa in tutto e per tutto, fantastica e ispirata, con continui momenti di umorismo pi√π o meno velato. Gli enigmi non sono particolarmente complicati, magari bisogna ragionare e tentare un po' di soluzioni ma si possono fare piuttosto velocemente tutti; il gameplay, anche per la sua et√†, √® quanto di pi√π classico si possa avere. Il lavoro di rimasterizzazione √® poi sopraffino, con grafica, audio e interfaccia totalmente riviste, pur restando molto fedeli all'originale e con la possibilit√† di scegliere la versione preferita in ogni momento. Da divorare il prima possibile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033857334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1488075250}
review:
This game was one of the first titles I've played from Lucas Arts. I remember being very little (around 10) and not understanding english at all. But I struggled for a significant amount of time trying to figure out what to do. And I failed of course.

The game has a very cool mechanic where you need to alternate between the three characters to solve the puzzles (and save the world!). The story is very interesting, with smart lines and awesome characters. I am glad they did a remaster version so I could play today and be able to finish the game. This version turned out to be very good, like all the other remasters Double Fine did.

I recomend this game to all fans of adventure games and especially Lucas Arts games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086492066', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1526779116}
review: One of the absolute finest adventures I have ever taken part in, and a viable contender for my favorite game of all time. The remaster is brilliant and seamless, and the characters and puzzles all retain their beautifully quirky charm. If you are an avid point and click adventurer who has never played this masterpiece, or you've never enjoyed a point and click before, this is one of the greatest games ever made, and you are absolutely, 100% missing out if you don't have it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054674251', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1487553571}
review:
Incredibly charming point and click adventure with loads of great 90s humor. It's almost like playing a 90s cartoon. 

The logic puzzles are only arbitrary a couple of times (the horse, of course), and otherwise make lots of sense as long as you talk to people and pay attention to your surroundings.

I'm no big fan of point and clicks, and I'd still recommend people take a swing at this game. And it's frequently on sale, to boot!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018576932', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1487295892}
review:
Day of Tentacle Remastered est un difficile Point & Click. Difficile par le fait que ses √©nigmes sont tr√®s tricky : √† la diff√©rence d'un autre P&C, ici vous √™tes plong√©(e) dans une histoire loufoque √† base de voyage dans le temps et de tentacules prenant vie. Par cons√©quent, la logique du jeu se veut √† l'image de son univers : d√©jant√©e.

J'avoue avoir eu recours plusieurs fois √† des guides tant certaines actions √† r√©aliser √©tant tir√©es par les cheveux. Cela dit, l'humour est bien pr√©sent, et des r√©f√©rences feront sans nul doute sourire.

Un bon jeu dans l'ensemble, dans lequel il convient de prendre son temps et surtout, de r√©fl√©chir plus ou moins logiquement. Dur√©e de vie variant selon les joueurs, avec une rejouabilit√© √©ventuelle pour les chasseurs de succ√®s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072659138', 'num_games_owned': 1693, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1487202485}
review:
This game is classic and as funny as I've remembered from the old days. The remastered version is very good - the hand-drawn graphics are pretty, voice acting is really good and the interface has been updated to match more modern trend for point'n'click adventure games. All in all I had a great time living through this adventure once more. I finished the game in a single sitting. Score: 7/10 (+1 if you know the original)

pros:
- some inventive puzzles
- the idea of 3 parallel time flows in the same place (the past affecting the future)
- beautiful graphics
- very decent voice acting

cons:
- animations are still very simple
- some puzzles are hardly logical

author: {'steamid': '76561198006176581', 'num_games_owned': 488, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 3654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1678482624}
review:
During the 90's, I seriously missed out. The only reason I knew about LucasArts was because when I was in the 4th grade, there was one computer. On that computer was The Secret of Monkey Island. We each had a turn and as a class we helped each other. How I wish we had had this game.

Pure and simple, this is a classic. I know I would have loved this game in my youth, if I had been able to play it. Seriously, what hasn't been said about this game? This is a must buy for those who are fans of LucasArts and of zany fun and wacky 90's point and click adventures. The characters are wacky and memorable. The game colors just pop. There is a seemless transition between the old and the remaster. I enjoyed taking a look at the original. Maniac Mansion is also here, another LucasArts game I have been unable to play until now! The puzzles will make you think, since this is LucasArts and from the 90's. Speaking of the 90's, I enjoyed all the cultural references and how the game dated itself. I felt like a kid again and I enjoyed the feeling of a game that even though it is old felt very new and reminded me how excited we were during that time of gaming. I know more great times are ahead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960282358', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1486840913}

author: {'steamid': '76561198048964569', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1486677829}
review:
Un remaster un peu "feignant" en ce sens que quitte √† passer en HD, faire des animations fluides en 60 fps aurait encore plus accentu√© l'aspect cartoon. Du coup le jeu a le cul entre deux chaises, et le d√©calage cr√©e chez moi une sorte d'inconfort. Cela dit √ßa reste toujours mieux que de jouer sur la version pixellis√©e !
Je pr√©f√®res les remaster de Monkey Island, qui, m√™me s'il y a eu quelques changements, s'adaptaient vraiment aux techniques d'aujourd'hui. Il aurait √©t√© tout √† fait possible de le faire ici sans garder les saccades.
Et si c'est juste pour la fonction ultra gadget de pouvoir switcher entre l'original et le remaster... bof bof, surtout que MI permettait de le faire sans ce probl√®me.

Autrement le jeu reste un excellent Point & Click mythique et ravira les amateurs du genre, je le recommande donc ne serait-ce que pour √ßa, mais attendez des soldes tout de m√™me : Moi j'ai eu la chance de me le faire offrir, et heureusement parce que j'aurais √©t√© un peu d√©go√ªt√© d'avoir pay√© pour un remaster pas aussi pouss√© que je ne le pensais.

Dialoghi esilaranti, enigmi non sempre facili da risolvere e un pizzico di nostalgia rendono questo gioco un must per i 40enni come me ... ma soprattutto per i pi√π giovani: questi sono i veri giochi!

review: I've been wanting to play this for at least a decade so thanks to the creators for remastering it for current operating systems. The game starts off a little slow but is well worth the time you put in. The art (both original sprites and new artwork) is great and there are laughs throughout. The new analog controls (you can still use point and click controls as well) work very well. Game includes an in game remaster (or the original version) of Maniac Mansion as well. Probably my favorite adventure game outside of the Monkey Island series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093476565', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1486070017}
review:
Da appassionato di avventure grafiche (adoro i primi 2 Broken Sword, The Curse of the Monkey Island, per non parlare del fantastico Grim Fandango), devo ammettere che non avevo mai giocato a Day of the Tentacle e cos√¨ ho approfittato della versione remastered per colmare questa mia lacuna videoludica. Devo dire che ne √® valsa veramente la pena. Ho ritrovato quella soddisfazione e quel piacere che avevo quando giocavo alle avventure succitate, la storia √® simpatica e si fa seguire bene ed in pi√π ci sono stati un paio di spunti ironici che mi hanno fatto morire dalle risate. Gli enigmi non sono semplicissimi, per√≤ nemmeno cos√¨ complicati da rimanerci bloccati giorni, basta un po' di fantasia. Se proprio ci devo trovare qualche difetto, punterei sulla longevit√† (l'ho finito in 7 ore prendendo tutti gli achievement di steam ma si finisce anche in molto meno), e su qualche bug riguardo gli achievement (uno mi ha costretto a rifare met√† gioco per prenderlo). Un must have per gli amanti delle avventure grafiche, ma consiglio di giocarlo a tutti in generale.

Voto 9/10

review: This bring back so much memories..  this game is FUN  with lots of reference to things from that time .  Also has the maniac mansion  which is basically  " day of the tentacle 1" and its canon to the story. To be fair  i beat this game when i was like 10.  is not the hardest game from the old lucas art  graphic adventures that made them famous  i think monkey island is way harder and even maniac mansion.  But still this game is really fun to play probably should grab in a sale  and if you liked the game as a child is an insta buy,  and i dont think the remaster thing is really worth, is just that the improvement in graphics really doesnt make a difference..

author: {'steamid': '76561198119316899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1589494794}
review: This game was the pinacle of my childhood, its the first Lucas Arts/Point and Click game I ever played and still to this day there I things I forget to do - which has kept me on my toes. So to hear see it get the remastered treatment it deserves really made me happy. I especially love that you can switch between the remastered version and the retro version. Real nice touch. The only problem I had was that the audio would skip and it would freeze every now and then. Other wise its as amazing as I remember. If Day of the Tenctacle proves too easy - you can always take a whack at Maniac Mansion (found in Ed Edison's room on the computer.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021009654', 'num_games_owned': 2452, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1485526303}
review:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein Point & Klick Adventure mit Zeitreise Story wundersch√∂n aufgearbeitet und immer noch sehr unterhaltsam.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man spielt mit drei Charakteren abwechselnd in verschiedenen Zeiten. 
Die Geschichte ist das ein Mutierter B√∂ser Tentakel die Welt erobern will, er Reist durch die Zeit um seinen Erfolg zu sichern und drei Helden Reisen ihm nach. Es geht etwas schief und die drei Helden landen in verschiedenen Zeiten, nun m√ºssen sie R√§tsel l√∂sen um die Gegenwart zu retten.
Man spielt in Typischer Point & Klick Manier alle Charaktere wie man es von Lucas Arts gewohnt ist.

Im Spiel gibt es ausserdem noch einen Computer zu finden an dem man Maniac Mansion spielen kann, diese Version ist mit Savegame und alle was dazu geh√∂rt versehen.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Grafik:

Die Grafik ist in der remasterten Fassung ist super √ºberarbeitet, das Original sieht auch sehr gut aus.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Die Musik ist sehr gut gemacht, immer sehr passend.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Die Steuerung sehr gut mit der Maus im Remasterten Teil, es kann aber auch im Scumm Mode gespielt werden.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ sehr gute Grafik
+ gute Steuerung
+ gute Musik
+ sehr gute Deutsche Synchro
+ gute Story
+ guter Deutscher Untertitel
+ Maniac Mansion


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Ein wirklich sehr gutes Point & Klick Adventure, aber LucasArts hat es nun mal wirklich drauf gehabt. Hier stimmt einfach alles, die Charaktere sind Super, die Geschichte ist einfach aber sch√∂n erz√§hlt und es ist f√ºr alle Altersklassen unterhaltbar. Leider etwas kurz geraten mit circa 8 Stunden beim ersten Mal durchspielen.

Aber wenn es mal im Angebot ist f√ºr 75% oder in einem Bundle sollte wirklich mal einen Blick hineinwerfen.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 10/10
Grafik: 10/10
Musik: 10/10
Steuerung: 10/10
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 10/10

review:
Remaster impeccabile. E' rimasto tutto proprio come me lo ricordavo, protagonisti compresi: degli idioti finiti.
Un autentico spasso la storia, i dialoghi, gli enigmi (anche se talvolta non-sense) e le ambientazioni dallo stile grafico cartoonesco. Un "must" da recuperare per chi non avesse mai giocato quest'avventura grafica, adesso non ci sono proprio scuse.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981094693', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1535881411}
review: Remaster of a very funny adventure game with excellent writing and voice acting. The remaster features re-done graphics, music, and UI. While I didn't find those improvements that noteworthy I did really appreciate that you can mix and match a lot of the old/new features (ie, new UI with old graphics). The biggest thing I appreciated was that they've taken the original voice recordings and implemented them into the game at a higher quality. So it's all the same voice acting but at a much higher quality than the original cd-rom version. The playable Maniac Mansion easter egg is still in the game, but that game hasn't been improved in any way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999339665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1458868357}
review:
Supongo que para los que jugamos al D√≠a del Tent√°culo en su d√≠a es f√°cil caer en la nostalgia a la hora de ponernos a hablar de √©l. Lo bueno es que a veces hay t√≠tulos tan v√°lidos que se puede (y debe) hablar de ellos por lo que son y no por c√≥mo los recordamos.

Dejando a un lado aquellas tardes de nocilla delante de la pantalla, lo cierto es que el juego, remasterizaci√≥n gr√°fica aparte, aguanta el tipo de manera sorprendente. El dise√±o de puzzles, divididos en tres personajes e hilos temporales distintos, sigue dando much√≠sima cancha a la hora de experimentar y dar rienda suelta a nuestro pensamiento lateral, que es a fin de cuentas lo que venimos a hacer cuando jugamos a una aventura gr√°fica.

El resto, historia y personajes, son casi el MacGuffin sobre el que se desarrollan las situaciones y resoluciones m√°s disparatadas, con permiso de Sam & Max, de la √©poca dorada de LucasArts.

No hace falta llamar a los recuerdos de infancia para encumbrar juegos de este calibre. Ya lo hacen por s√≠ mismos.

review:
Absolutely marvelous piece of game. Played the original game at the moment, and being able to re-experience it in HD and with improved audio is marvelous. Also, the achievements are creative, force you to play outside of the regular game flow.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970558615', 'num_games_owned': 3397, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1648082042}
review:
F1 to switch to the classical graphics, music(!), and interface...  basically a fully playable version of the original that can be switched anytime (during cutscenes too) to the remaster.   The voices remain unchanged, and provide consistancy in order to enjoy switching versions during play. 

PERFECT remaster of a great game.

Extremely interesting to see the changes to the graphics and hear the changes to the music.  The remastered graphics look great, but switching makes you understand the character, joy, and subtleties of the original.  I personally prefer the original classic graphics and music, but would have a hard time playing through the whole game in that version at this point in time.  Being able to switch makes all the difference.  Brilliant!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994864932', 'num_games_owned': 302, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1479104787}

author: {'steamid': '76561198021012499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1464297760}
review:
One of Lucas Arts's best graphic adventure games with a slightly new coat of paint.  Not much has really changed here.  It's an undeiable classic, but there are two caveats:

1) Be ready for old school adventure game BS.  The game will give you screwface when, after 20 hours of trying to solve the same puzzle, you finally realize what bizarre string of logic you were supposed to follow to solve a puzzle.

2) If you played this game as much as I did back in the day, there really isn't anything new about the experience.

Still, great game for what it is, and what it is is some of the best writing and comedy in an adventure game.  If you like old graphic adventures, you will LOVE this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089052394', 'num_games_owned': 1318, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1484516049}
review:
[h1][b]Day Of The Tentacle Remastered			* 9/10[/b][/h1]

This has always been a MUST I've never been able to play at the times. I was lucky enough to play the first Monkey Island and Sam & Max, but I missed this one, and this remaster is a really great opportunity.

Day Of The Tentacle is a Point & Click adventure with the typical traits of any Lucas arts adventure: Funny story, Humour and silly non-sense situations and characters. On top of that This is a Remaster from Double Fine which can be considered a revived Lucas Arts and responsible for other Remasters and interesting titles (Grim Fandango is a Good Example)
The story begins straight and simple, and maybe it might be worth to know that DOTT is not a first or unique chapter (Even I wasn't aware of that before playing it in these days...), but it's a sequel of Maniac Mansion, one of the very first Lucas Arts games which shares most of the characters with DOTT, especially one of the protagonists: Bernard.

The original DOTT was supposed to have an interface resembling Monkey island, with a large bar below the screen with a list of selectable actions and the inventory. This remaster adopted a different (and in my opinion more modern and efficient) system which recalls the coin from Curse of Monkey island, where you hold the right mouse on an item/character in the environment and a set of available actions appears.

One of the unique aspects of DOTT (already used in Maniac Mansion) is the number of protagonists. You have to control either Bernard, Hoagie (my favorite character XD) and Laverne in different situations. This kind of enhances and complicates the experience by increasing the playtime as the inventory items found around can be shared between characters to solve their own puzzles, so you must keep in mind that you might need another character's item to solve your current riddle.

Graphically there's not much to say, DOTT is a Remaster so it is obviously a more polished hi-res version of the classic game. As usual you can constantly switch the game to the classic and original graphic/interface, just for fun or nostalgia (just like in Monkey island's remasters, always by double fine). Musics are as usual great and they clearly fit in the silly mood of the game.

Noteworthy: inside the game there's a "not-too-hidden" opportunity to play the original Maniac Mansion. Entirely. And it's weird to think this "easter egg" was available in the original DOTT as well... O.o

[h1]+++PROs+++[/h1][list]
[*][b] LUCAS ARTS ADVENTURE.[/b] Another great Lucas Arts adventure available and remastered for modern configurations. Humour, Story and puzzles. Everything in a great mix, now Remastered
[*][b] ORIGINAL CHARACTER SETUP.[/b] This was an interesting setup, you can move each of the three protagonists at any time and share their items in their inventory to solve riddles.
[/list]
[h1]---CONs---[/h1][list]
*[i]coff, coff...[/i]*
[/list]

[i]I played this game on this machine:
Intel Core i7-4970
16Gb RAM DDR3
GeForce GTX 660
Windows 10 Professional x64[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561197980177272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 491, 'last_played': 1483686770}
review:
This is a competent remaster of a fantastic classic game - if you've never played it, or if you have and have the cash to burn -- BUY THIS GAME.

A couple of pointers to make your playing experience a LOT smoother:

- I was having massive graphical and sound problems when playing this game at first, to the point where it was almost unplayable and really dragging down my opinion of the game.  After some desperate Googling I tried something that I haven't had to manually do on any system in nearly ten years and updated my sound drivers.  After that, everything ran smooth as butter, and the sound was just as spectacular as it ever was in the original version.

- Unlike earlier remasters of other LucasArts games such as Grim Fandango or the Monkey Island series, the remastered graphics displayed here are not in fact disappointing garbage.  I played through the whole game twice without having to switch to the classic renderer.

- Huge time saver here that eliminates a possible source of frustration in the game: If you're managing a character's inventory, and want to give an item to a different character, you can just drag and drop the thing right onto that character's portrait to instantly give them that item.  Trading items in this fashion can cut a good half hour off of your final playtime.


So in closing: Great game, great remaster, well worth your time and moolah.  

* Extra special kudos to Double Fine for not f*cking this one up.  Great job, you guys.  We're all rooting for you, truly and sincerely.  Now, be careful delivering Psychonauts 2, we don't want you to accidentally drop it on its head and have it turn out like its brother Spacebase did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039713628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1603579110}
review:
Tras la remasterizaci√≥n de Grim Fandango, el anuncio de la pr√≥xima aventura gr√°fica era algo que estaba casi cantado. El d√≠a del tent√°culo ('Day of The Tentacle' o DOTT en la gloriosa era de MS-DOS), ha conseguido que me quite un par de a√±os mientras recordaba lo bien que uno se lo pasaba jugando a las aventuras gr√°ficas de LucasArts.

La remasterizaci√≥n ha sido muy fidedigna, sin estridencia alguna, y respetando el original en todo momento. A nivel gr√°fico se ha estilizado a√∫n m√°s el aspecto de dibujo animado (consiguiendo un resultado soberbio), y han adaptado los controles a nuevos jugadores que opten por el mando (siempre ser√° mejor el sistema 'point & click').

Como es habitual en este tipo de ediciones que lleva realizando Double Fine, podemos jugar tal y como jugamos en los 90 (con el estilo gr√°fico, el sistema de verbos y m√∫sica original), remasterizado (mejora gr√°fica, un sistema de verbos simplificado y adaptado, am√©n de m√∫sica remasterizada para la ocasi√≥n)... y eso no es todo: podemos jugar con el nuevo lavado de cara y el sistema de verbos original, eligiendo incluso qu√© tipo de m√∫sica queremos escuchar. Este es un punto que es de agradecer, pues da manga ancha (y varias 'configuraciones') para que se adapte a todo tipo de jugador, ya seas de la vieja escuela o un iniciado en este maravilloso mundo de las aventuras gr√°ficas.

Quiz√°s el √∫nico punto negativo sea que el Maniac Mansion que han inclu√≠do (recordemos la publicidad de la propia caja 'un juego dentro de un juego'), est√© localizado s√≥lamente al idioma de Shakespeare y no en castellano, no posibilitando disfrutar de ambas aventuras gr√°ficas por completo, pues recordemos que 'El d√≠a del Tent√°culo' es una secuela directa del Maniac Mansion creada por el genial Ron Gilbert (compa√±ero durante la etapa dorada de LucasArts de Tim Schafer).

Una oportunidad de oro si te gustan las aventuras gr√°ficas o eres seguidor de la edad dorada de LucasArts, y un ejemplo de c√≥mo se ha de mimar y tratar un juego a la hora de pasar por el taller para ser remasterizado. 

Pr√≥xima parada: Full Throttle Remastered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219277139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1558992181}
review: Fun short little classic game from the 90's. Alright story, interesting puzzles, and easy game to achieve 100% only downside I can complain about is that the game doesn't really give you much of an indication what to do, which will probably make you look up a guide because a puzzle or two give you no indication that an action could be done. I wouldn't pay retail for this game but for its sale price you'll get a few hours of fun. Won't be playing this one again anytime soon, as after completing it you'll probably beat it in under an hour if you go for a second playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049020917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1466239935}
review: If you played the original game back on 90's, this game will going to be a link to the past and it will test your memory. I have played this remastered version and I have to admit that this game looks excelent and worked as expected. I was not able to find any particular bug, so I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys the point and click old school genere.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982950280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1545205781}
review:
DOTT Remastered is a polished remake of the original CD version;
The humor is goofy and the puzzles aren't that hard if you can think outside of the box. One of the nice things is that you can customize your HUD and display to play it with the SCUMM interface with the old graphics or just in the remastered style or even a combination of the two.
The transition between the three characters is gradual and adds a nice pace to the game.
As an added bonus just like the original you can play the original Maniac Mansion, something that was a bit of a problem with the old verion on newer machines. The old game on cd played just fine on modern computers but I couldn't play the original.
Very fun game if you like the Lucas Arts adventure style games but not for everybody I guess...

review:
Nach √ºber 20 Jahren durfte ich nun diese Perle des "Point & Click Adventure" nochmal in aufgemotztem Zustand genie√üen, danke daf√ºr. Was soll man dazu sagen? Das Spiel hat seinen Kultstatus nicht grundlos bekommen, absurder Humor und Probleml√∂sungen die sich einem die Maus str√§uben lassen (Benutze Hamnster mit Mikrowelle). 

Nur 4.0h Spielzeit sind zustandegekommen da ich nahezu das ganze Spiel noch im Hinterkopf hatte. Das allein ist f√ºr mich schon eine Qualit√§tsaussage...oder erinnert ihr euch noch an ein schlechtes Spiel vom letztem Jahr?

review: I've been playing Day of the Tentacle since it first came in a stack of floppy disks. The remastered edition is wonderfull and does great justice to the original game. It didnt feel any different; it was just as confortable and funny as 20+ years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282753956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1531847725}
review:
Although already a fan of the original game, I purchased this with an open mind. The plot of the game is story rich, imaginative, funny and challenging. The game is neither too easy or too difficult, and does provide clues here and there, but you need to pay attention so you don't miss them. If you have already played the game in the past, then you will know how much of a legend it is amongst old school gamers, but if this will be your first play through, you are in for a treat if you appreciate old school adventure games. 

The gameplay has changed slightly from the old version, but is not overly complicated - infact it is a time saving way of playing. 

The graphics have been highly polished but other than that, nothing has changed at all (which is brilliant!) 

The game is now compatible with newer PC's without having to mess about with compatability settings or downloading other softare to make it compatible. 

All in all, I am so pleased I purchased the remastered version of this classic game. It absorbs you into the story and you feel you have to complete it in one sitting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062638872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1544457828}

author: {'steamid': '76561198131230522', 'num_games_owned': 585, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1484451806}
review:
What a superb remaster of a legendary game! They haven't messed with the art at all (which was my one gripe with the Secret of Monkey Island remake, good though it was), just brought it up to 21st Century standards. I hope any developers planning on remaking other classic games take note of how well this one has been executed. 

This is one of the best point-&-click adventures ever made, highly recommended and well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045716689', 'num_games_owned': 1047, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1479289565}
review:
This is an adventure game classic. I remember playing this back in the 90s, back when you had to flip through the manual to get through it‚Äôs old-school DRM unless you were cool enough to have it on CD. Oh, and it totally holds up. The remastering is great, and you can toggle between it and the original if you wanted to recapture the old feel. The added commentary isn't very obtrusive if you turn it on, being more a behind the scenes trivia segment for each major puzzle than an overall commentary.

I would totally recommend this game to anyone who likes adventure games, or wants to get into one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960291088', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1483294657}
review:
Fazit f√ºr eilige Leser: Ein alter Adventure Klassiker mit h√ºbsch-aufgebohrter Grafik, viel Slapstick Humor aber ohne zus√§tzliche Hilfen.

Ich habe das Original damals zwar gespielt, aber nie komplett fertig (ich glaub sogar nur ca. 50%). Dadurch kamen anfangs Nostalgie Gef√ºhle auf, die mich auch √ºber ein paar Sackgassen im Spiel hinwegtr√∂sten konnten. Denn wenn man nicht weiterkommt, gibt es leider keine Hilfe oder Tips (wie es z.b. bei Baphomets Fluch der Fall ist). Man kann interagierende Objekte hervorheben mit Shift, das wars an Hilfe.

Die Optik ist in meinen Augen sehr gut gelungen und h√ºbsch umgesetzt. Die M√∂glichkeit mit F1 direkt zur alten Klassik-Optik zu switchen hat mir sehr gut gefallen und ist ein nettes Gimmick.
Es gibt im Verlauf des Spiels auch die M√∂glichkeit auf einem Computer das alte Maniac Manson zu spielen, tolle Idee :)

Die Spielzeit war bei meinem ersten Durchgang mit knapp 7 Stunden angemessen, wobei ich auch teilweise eine Weile gebraucht hab um auf die richtige L√∂sung zu kommen.

Wer die alten LucasArt Adventures gespielt hat, dem kann ich dieses Spiel nur empfehlen. Wer aber schnell die Geduld verliert oder sowieso nicht gern Adventures spielt, der braucht hier kein Geld ausgeben. Es gibt zwar eine detailierte Komplettl√∂sung in den Community Guides, womit man zumidenst von der Story alles erf√§hrt. Aber es ist eben doch ein anderes, viel erhabeneres Gef√ºhl, wenn man nach ewigen rumprobieren selbst auf die L√∂sung kommt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027081774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1483291350}
review: DOTT hat trotz des Alters nicht an Reiz verloren und geh√∂rt immer noch zu den besten Point-and-Click Adventures √ºberhaupt. Grade f√ºr Nostalgiker oder Retro Fans prima: der Maniac Mansion Klassiker als "Spiel-im-Spiel", war fr√ºher zwar auch so, wurde aber auch im Remake √ºbernommen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991468401', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1483260527}
review:
I remember playing this on my parents Apple, it was so slow and stuttered because we only had 8mb of ram LOL.
I later managed to convince my dad to upgrade to 16mb of ram, which probably cost him 10 times more than the game did as ram back then was mad expencive.

I still remember so many solutions to the puzzles in the game even though its been such a long time (I never played it again since that first time when it was released until now).

Took me 7 hours to complete this time, partially du to the loadtimes being waaay faster now compared to back then.

I kept switching between the Classic graphics, and the remastered as I liked both. 
However sometimes I felt like that remastered graphics did't quiet have the quality up to standards, and it almost felt like someone just used trace in Adobe Illustrator and considered it done.

Either way it was great to play through this gem again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056753539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1483348254}
review: I didn't think an old game would be interesting after many years, but it still is. The story hasn't aged a day, and the newer, fancier graphics makes this game great. It also, spoiler alert, has the original game inside this game.

review: Buena reedici√≥n del cl√°sico de Lucas Art. Es un juego m√≠tico, lleno de humor. Lo √∫nico malo que tiene el juego es que no es demasiado largo pero todo lo dem√°s es perfecto. Muy recomendable para comprarlo en oferta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171367954', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1590834817}
review:
This was probably my first pc game back when it came out in 93. Bought it again now on Winter Sale and its worth every penny. The remastering is wonderfull, and the puns, wordplay and geeky humor on this title are just spot on. Not sure how many things were changed in the remastering but the most obvious is navigation, inventory and player management. Unfortunately for me I remembered most of the game so I finished it in under 4 hours. The developer commentary on this as well is something that wow-ed me. Totally worth its 5 euro. Now i need to go see where the rest 20 achievements are hiding.  

Nostalgia aside, i think this puzzle adventure game is one of the best of it's kind, all the way up there with Grim Fandago and other greats. Too bad Lucasasrts didnt follow through after this

author: {'steamid': '76561198083948584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1576961063}

author: {'steamid': '76561198329890859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1693867203}
review:
Day of the Tentical Remastered falls into our love of retro games. Adventure games as a whole have sort of taken a back seat due to their lack of pace and more thoughtful direction of story telling. But where these games may not have fast paced adrenaline shoot 'em ups and car chases, they make up for in both humor, story and puzzels. Day of the Tentical is no exception.

Day of the Tentical Remastered is a reboot that is worth while. All of the graphics have been replaced with beautifully hand drawn sprites, updated music, and with all this, keeping the actual original game intact. On top of this, if you are a stickler for originality, it's as simple as pressing F1 and you can play the game in it's original pixeled glory.

If you're a fan of adventure games, and/or just want to play something that's legitemately funny, I can recommend this whole hartily. If not, and you're looking for some fast paced action, then avoid this, and any classic adventure games at all costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038194451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1584242143}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482854301}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Along with the other LucasArts games I've played from just a wee child to now from Grim Fandango, to Full Throttle, to the Tales from Monkey Island series and this Day of the Tentacle, I will always love the adventure games LucasArts has produced in its hayday. Day of the Tentacle was the third game I played after finishing Grim Fandango and Full Throttle as a child and now thanks to Double Fine Productions, Walt Disney Interactive and Lucasfilm we can now finally have another LucasArts adventure game fully remastered to its former glory

Funnily enough I did not know that Day of the Tentacle is actually a sequel to a previous LucasArts game known as Maniac Mansion and I have personally never played Maniac Mansion

Day of the Tentacle's story is brilliant. From its quirky characters to its lovable cutscenes and funny comedy. and the music (especially in the remastered edition) is absolutely brilliant! The cutscenes are lovable and fun to watch and are brilliantly animated, overall the game is brilliant! 

The puzzles and game progression, although when I was young and I played Day of the Tentacle for the very first time I did not have any walkthroughs or guides, so the puzzles were a bit challenging and can be a bit too awkward for modern-day players or even newcomers to the genre. The game does not help you at all when progressing through and does not hold your hand when your stuck on a puzzle for too long, so be prepared to get stuck here and there, thankfully I remembered most of the stuff! Lucky guys with internet nowadays, you can simply type in walkthroughs for the game!

The remastered version, Double Fine have really done a job well done for remastering this classic. The music is spot-on and digitally remastered. The cutscenes, although not fully converted to HD are very watchable, and the new HUD system they implemented has made it easier for players to play the game. The addition of HD graphics, etc... made the game more stunning than it originally was (and if you want some nostalgia, you can play the game in its original graphics!)

Overall, Day of the Tentacle and its remastered version are simply brilliant and if you are a fan of LucasArts (like me!) or you like adventure games or you want to try something new, then I would highly recommend playing Day of the Tentacle and I hope that Double Fine will continue to remaster these old LucasArts classics!

Although no LucasArts classic adventure game will ever beat Grim Fandango, Day of the Tentacle is still a wonderful and one of my favourite adventure games to play even though nothing beats Grim Fandango, that's a legendary LucasArts classic game!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197970761123', 'num_games_owned': 2960, 'num_reviews': 904, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1482545475}
review:
As a follow up to one of the greatest point and click adventure games of all time, Maniac Mansion, Day of the Tentacle Remastered had a lot to live up to.   Maniac Mansion allowed the player to choose 2 characters from 6 friends to accompany the main character which means it had 20 possible teams to play as.  Day of the Tentacle had a standard 3 character set. 

So does it measure up?  I think it does.  The story of the game is the team is trying to stop the Purple Tentacle that has gotten mutated and decided to take over the world.  The game starts with Bernard (a character from the original game, and a fan favorite) bringing two friends to help stop the Purple Tentacle.  He ends up traveling through time to yesterday and through a problem, the three friends are separated by hundreds of years.   The three friends need to find a way to fix their personal problems, and eventually work together to save the day. 

So how is the game play and puzzles?   Well honestly, that's what really shines.  The remastered version of the game has the ability to choose between hot spots on the screen, which really helps. 

At the same time there's a few puzzles that are hard, but honestly there's nothing that obtuse, and a few that are really clever.  There was a room or two I had to revisit with out realizing it, but overall a lot of the game is quite straight forward.  The puzzles work well and some of them are quite clever.

The story does shine as well, I love the updated characters and new characters for the original game.  It's not overly hilarious, but it's also not trying to be funny all the time.  The puzzles take precedence over the story, and that works.  So don't expect to piss yourself laughing, but you will get a couple really good laughs. 

But wait there's one last thing to mention.  Day of the Tentacle also included the classic Maniac Mansion.  While the remastered didn't improve the classic game, it's still included in this version, which is a fantastic deal. 

Overall I recommend this game as a great example of how an adventure game SHOULD be.  There's not a ton of frustration with it, and the story and areas the game explores are great.   The only thing I could imagine is this is a very American centric game.  There's a few puzzles that likely require a small understanding of American history, or colloquialisms.  It shouldn't ruin the game, but there was one point where I questioned if someone who didn't know a story would be able to solve it.    But still overall? Easy recommend, especially for anyone who is a fan of point and click adventure games.   And bonus points for having multiple different control schemes and the classic game included inside the game?  Hell yeah!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971308505', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1552568846}
review:
I‚Äôve played this game far more offline than steam wants to admit.

After playing ‚ÄúGrim Fandango‚Äù among others, I started to think point and click games weren‚Äôt for me. The characters and story is usually really nice but so many (a minority but many enough) puzzles where illogical or out of nowhere. (I need to point out that I‚Äôm a very logical person and have a easy time with problem solving in general. When I say they are illogical  it‚Äôs not because I just don‚Äôt get it.) Some people say that you ‚Äúneed to know the developers‚Äù for games like ‚ÄúMonkey Island‚Äù (haven‚Äôt played) and ‚ÄúGrim Fandango‚Äù. I call it bull-excrement. 

Either way. This game changed my mind. It‚Äôs not without it‚Äôs annoying parts/puzzles but most of it is logical. It might take you some time and sometimes you will just guess it right rather than figuring it out. When you do however it‚Äôs almost always a ‚ÄúOh, right of course‚Äù-moment. If you‚Äôre being slow they also give you hints in the form ‚Äúfilms‚Äù of npc:s talking.

So the puzzles are good, what else you ask. Well, the animation style is nice on the eye and the humor, if a bit dated, really funny. The story is wacky and completely out there. The characters are amusing and, in a good way, stereotypical. They make fun of the stereotype rather then the people.

If I would mention some negatives. Sometimes it‚Äôs hard to know that you may walk to certain places. I walked back and forth a lot at one occasion before I realized one of the characters could enter a whole new area. The jokes are very American and as earlier mentioned, a bit dated.

I might be a bit bias since I played this as a kid and I haven‚Äôt played that many point and click games but this is still a great game. I‚Äôm not sure I will recommend this in a decade or two since it is dated, I am now however. I pity the fool that doesn‚Äôt get it.  

PS: Works on LINUX!

review:
Mon point'n click pr√©f√©r√©, le meilleur de sa g√©n√©ration, voire le meilleur tout court ?
Aujourd'hui d'autres jeux ont r√©ussi √† l'√©galer (je pense notamment √† la saga des Deponia) mais ils restent rares.

Cette version remast√©ris√©e est une petite merveilles. Les graphismes sont plus fins, tout en conservant le style original. L'aventure est bien s√ªr toujours aussi d√©jant√©e. Elle serait m√™me difficile si je ne le connaissais pas par coeur !

Dommage toutefois qu'ils n'aient pas retravaill√© la traduction de certains textes. Plusieurs blagues tombent √† la trappe et certaines tournures de phrase ne refl√®tent pas ce que veulent vraiment dire les personnages.

Si vous avez la chance de ne jamais avoir connu ce jeu, foncez, c'est une merveille !

author: {'steamid': '76561198074322635', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1506609981}
review:
Day of the Tentacle was the 1st game, I ever played! 
The music, the wacky sayings and colours stayed in my mind to this day... I loved the original game it was a master piece. This game stood the test of time! The remastered version cleans up the game, and it runs really well!
The game is harder than I remembered, but finally beating this game, is a joy! 
This is a true video game, I recommend a walkthru/FAQ for modern day gamers, as these puzzles can be hard, or trial and error. Buy this game, especially if it is on sale!!
I rate this game a 10/10 (My first ever, simply due to the nostalgic elements, great story, and being a timeless classic).

author: {'steamid': '76561197969400198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1481387507}
review:
Really happy to be able to play this again, I have vivid memories of playing this as a child as well as its predecessor Maniac Mansion.

I played Day of the Tentacle again a few years ago using ScummVM and didn't really enjoy it as it didn't look very nice at the time, the remastered version has fixed this with new high resolution artwork.


The commentary option is something which I may use during a future playthrough as it seems like it could be nice.



Play this if you're in the mood for nostalgia, totally recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041371573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1480048673}
review:
I'm one of the very few who disagree with this game's overwhelmingly positive rating.

I didn't think the story was interesting, I didn't care about the characters, and I didn't like the artwork. Simply put, I was bored.

YES I realize that many, many people love this game because they played the original back in the day, and it gives them a sense of nostaligia. And the "remastering" was clearly executed with care and attention.

Yet this game is no classic - it does not stand on its own merits. I've played many better in this genre, both old and modern. Class this as a "nostalgia only" purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010612160', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1552521673}
review:
Point and click based adventure game that you can't die in
Originally released by LucasArts/ Lucasfilm in 1993, (and now called Disney.) as a sequel to Ron Gilbert‚Äôs ground breaking Maniac Mansion, Day of the Tentacle is back in a remastered edition that features all new hand-drawn, high resolution artwork, with remastered audio, music and sound effects.
You can use your joypad in the whole game.

Overall Score 8 of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025647144', 'num_games_owned': 402, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1531427154}
review:
Ayant jou√© √† DotT √† l'√©poque, j'en avais gard√© un excellent souvenir, avec ses graphismes style dessin anim√©, ses √©nigmes √† la fois loufoques et logiques (enfin, plut√¥t, logiques selon l'univers du jeu), avec ce petit grain de sel suppl√©mentaire des interactions entre les diff√©rentes √©poques qui faisait tout le charme de ce point-&-click.

Ce remaster remet cet excellent jeu au go√ªt du jour, et je ne peux que recommander √† ceux qui ne le connaissent pas d'en profiter pour s'y plonger.
Les graphismes avaient plut√¥t bien veillis, ils sont maintenant enti√®rement refaits mais toujours dans le m√™me esprit.
Diff√©rentes interfaces, plus modernes, sont disponibles. Et celle propos√©e par d√©faut simplifiera grandement les choses au nouveau venu, vu qu'en fonction de l'objet choisi, les possibilit√©s d'interactions varient et sont fortement r√©duites - alors que dans le jeu de base, il √©tait possible de combiner toutes les actions avec tous les objets... ce qui faisait un paquet de possibilit√©s.
Et puis enfin, cerises sur le g√¢teau : Maniac Mansion est toujours l√†. Et il est possible de basculer √† n'importe quel moment vers la version d'origine. De petits d√©tails, mais qui font la diff√©rence entre un remaster paresseux, et un de qualit√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999453516', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1480785535}
review:
Sch√∂n das so ein Klassiker es als Remastered Version zur√ºck geschafft hat.

Ein sch√∂nes, lustiges und verr√ºcktes R√§tsel Spiel wo ein Tentakel versucht, nachdem es Arme bekommen hat, die Welt zu erobern!
Wir reisen in die Vergangenheit, Zukunft und bleiben in der Gegenwart.
Hier und da einmal einen Hamster in die Mikrowelle stecken oder die Amerikanischer Flagge in eine Tentakel amerikanische Version ver√§ndern.
Und man kann zwischen Remastered und Classic Version aussuchen und ob man die Kommentare von den Entwicklern h√∂ren will.

Was will man mehr?

8/10 leider sehr kurz, aber immer noch Gut

author: {'steamid': '76561198013648552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1527302080}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057313795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1505919781}
review:
This will take you back in time in the early age of computer gaming when creativity was used to overcome computers limitations. That's a point and click gameplay with a Dr. Emmet Brown's humor twist.
I think only people that played the original game on C: Amiga or Dos PC will be able appreciate the remastered at its full taste.
But if you are curious, jump in this onion-skinned time machine. There's great humor along the way and plus an older game fully playable inside that one. Will you find it ? 80's gems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062288127', 'num_games_owned': 1423, 'num_reviews': 173, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 941, 'last_played': 1480599366}
review:
Very well made remake, includes Maniac Mansion game inside, developers commentary and easy to use controls.

Don't forget you can use hotkeys and quick flush - drag item in inventory to a character portrait.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980650229', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1480431136}
review: I played this the first time round and enjoyed it and it's still as good today. This pre-runner to the Monkey Island franchise stands the test of time. It's distinctive art style now remastered has only improved the experience. It's one downside is the amount of trudging to pass items between characters. That said it doesn't take much away from this brilliant point and click adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961091271', 'num_games_owned': 3953, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1482708664}
review:
This game is exactly like I remember from playing as a kid, only without the pixelated graphics.  Day of the Tentacle comes from the Golden Era of LucasArts gaming.  Back then, everything that LucasArts put out was amazing; awesome stories, great gameplay, and even though some Star Wars games were released (and they were good games), it wasn't just feeding off the Star Wars teat.

If you have never played anything from this era of LucasArts gaming, pick this game up and play it.  You'll be glad you did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974783215', 'num_games_owned': 1706, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1476120712}
review:
It's still as awesome as the first time I played through it. One of the adventure games I completed multiple times, and remember most puzzles by heart. It didn't bother at all, as the game is still as fun as ever, and the humour still works great. 

I would recommend it for any Lucasarts adventure game fans, and fans of point and click -adventures in general.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052938275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1481486942}
review:
Day of the Tentacle war vor √ºber 20 Jahren mein 1tes Adventure das ich gespielt habe.
Da es jetzt Remastered  auf den Markt kam musste ich es einfach wieder Kaufen, da ich dieses Spiel schon damals mehrmals durchgesuchtet habe.

Jetzt zum Spiel selbst:
Die Grafik einfach Spitze (F√ºr alle die gerne die damalige Grafik sehen m√∂chten mann kann auf diese  Umstellen)
Einwandfrei Synchronisiert
Die Spr√ºche sind immer noch Witzig
Die Steuerung ist Leicht, so das sie auch f√ºr Anf√§nger in diesem Genere gut zu verstehen ist
F√ºr alle Erfolge Sammler gibt es auch was zu tun nur  f√ºr den einen oder anderen Erfolg werdet Ihr im Netz nachlesen m√ºssen (Ging mir auch so)

Alles in allem ist das Spiel einfach nur Day of the Tentacle 2.0 mit Besserer Grafik

Klare Kaufempfehlung von meiner Seite !

author: {'steamid': '76561197995959535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1572132556}
review: Essentially the best experience point 'n' click adventure games have to offer, and now it looks even better. And yes, it includes the original Maniac Mansion as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981266534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1470317728}
review:
Was gibt es zu DOTT zu sagen? Es ist eines der ikonischsten Point&Click Adventure die jemals gemacht wurden. Wunderbarer Humor, genial schrullige Charaktere und unglaublich verdrehte Logik die dennoch immer begreifbar ist. In meinen Augen (Ohren) ist selbst die "schlechte" deutsche Sprachausgabe ein Knaller - was an meinen pers√∂nlichen Kindheitserinnerungen liegen mag.

Kurzum: Wer auf Point&Click Adventure steht und es noch nicht kennt: HOLT ES EUCH! JETZT! Wer es damals gespielt hat und es geliebt hat: HOLT ES EUCH! JETZT!

Als Bonus gibt es immer noch die M√∂glichkeit den Klassiker und geistigen Vorg√§nger [b] Maniac Mansion [/b] als Spiel im Spiel zu starten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123400201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1697248664}
review: I owned this game on a laptop that ran Windows 98. I had no idea what I was doing, but it didn't matter. This game was so much fun that running around the house 20 or 30 times to figure things out is still as much fun 40 times later as it originally was. Great buy. Would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034747731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1476574218}
review: Played the original DOS version of this back in the day (still have it on CD actually) and remember it as one of the funniest and best adventure games I ever played.  Decided to pick this up on sale because I wanted to have another crack at it after all these years.  Not at all disappointed.  The game requires you to find creative (and hilarious) solutions to the various problems the characters run into so you need to think outside the box for them.  Just as much fun as I remember and the clean remastered artwork and sound makes it fun to adventure with Bernard, Hoagie and Laverne (especially Hoagie) again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003961350', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1459039342}

11/10, Would push old ladies down the stairs again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054643113', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1676595359}
review:
Ah, a great classic brought back into the world. I enjoied this game when I was younger and enjoy it now. For it's simplicity it's still very amusing.
Controls and story line are easy to follow; however, if you are not one for puzzles and actually using your own brain to solve things then this might not be the game for you. 
This game requires thought and puzzle solving skills. It is full of wonderful quirky humor, hidden things, and amusing narrative. 
I highly reccomend this to anyone who enjoys humor and story driven games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096505105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1590430512}
review:
If you played the game "back in those days", you'll love this edition as well. It's almost the same, but with updated graphics (you can instantly switch back-and-forth between hi-res and low-res).

If you never before seen this game, try it out: it's a classic of the point-n-click adventures, with mostly great (sometimes difficult) puzzles and hilarious humour.

review: Definitely deserves the "Test of Time" award this year. Day of the Tentacle and Sam & Max were my two most played point 'n click adventure games growing up. It's pretty much exactly how I remembered it from the opening score. The updated graphics look great. A true testament to the artwork and art direction. My biggest gripe is the awkward subtitles positioning.

review:
Sehr toll gemachter Remake. Mir gef√§llt, dass man alles auf Original einstellen kann (insbesondere Sound w√§re f√ºr mich unm√∂glich den neuen zu nehmen), aber auch in den Genuss neuer Grafik kommen kann, wenn man damit auch eine f√ºr mich bisher unverst√§ndliche Steuerung hinehmen muss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024191409', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1481596463}
review:
No puedo ser objetivo con este juego. Para m√≠ es, sencillamente, la mejor aventura gr√°fica de todos los tiempos.

Secuela de Maniac Mansion, un hito indiscutible en los videojuegos pero que distaba de ser la aventura gr√°fica perfecta (al fin y al cabo estaba arrancando el g√©nero), en Day of Tentacle nos encontramos con la perfecci√≥n en cuanto a dise√±o. El dise√±o de los puzzles es absolutamente perfecto, jugando con las expectativas del jugador e integrados de una forma tan maravillosa que son simplemente parte de la trama y, sobre todo, memorables.

Los gr√°ficos cartoon no pueden ser m√°s apropiados para una historia de humor absurdo con... ¬°viajes en el tiempo!

Aunque, como he dicho, yo no pueda ser objetivo, creo que cualquier jugador en cualquier √©poca puede pasar horas disfrutando de este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025011697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1479994061}
review:
LucasArts and Sierra games were a mainstay of my early years with computers.  A time where I only was able to fit one game at a time on my hard drive.  Day of The Tentacle (after playing Maniac Mansion on NES) was one of the first CD based talkie games I ever owned.  It quickly ascended the ranks of personal favorite computer games to settle in a top five position among greats like the Space Quest series, Sam and Max Hit The Road, and a few select others.

I am so glad I played it long enough ago that higher education and the real world erased many of the puzzle solutions and plot developments from my mind.  Playing the remaster of DotT immediatly transported me back to sitting in front of the computer in the den trying to figure out where to go next and learning the most innacurate American history possible.

The remastered graphics are amazing and the ability to switch on the fly to the old pixelated look is a great feature.  The music and voice acting made the move over flawlessly and the puzzles are just as head scratching.  Much easier to get a hint now as well with the advent of the modern internet.  Bonus points for Mac support as well.  I played most of the game on a Mac without issue and spent some time playing on PC as well.  Both perform exceptionally.

Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a must play for classic adventure game fans and anyone who wants puzzles that are as far from obvious as you can get.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994117737', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1561659463}
review:
One of the most iconing point&click adventure games from lucas arts. Like with previous remasters from Double fine, you are given a choice to seamlessly switch between original visuals and remastered ones. Similarly you can either switch between original midi sound score and remastered sampled one.  Personally i find of remastered sound with classic visuals and director comentary the most satisfying combination of the available options.  
A no brainer purchase for adventure newcomers and veterans  alike. 

PROS: 
Oldimers will appreciate updated sound and smooth gamplay without of hassle of messing around with either dosbox or scummvm. New players will appreciate timeless cartoonish style, hillarious dialogue and insane puzzles in style of early LA production 

CONS: 
Remastered visuals are somewhat lacking in detail as if original graphics had been just retraced in vector painting app, giving the the visuals feel of a browser flash game. 
Some puzzles may be a bit more challenging than what players are used to in current games. 
A large part of the puzzle design revolves around indirect interaction beween the 3 main protagonists via something akin to message in the bottle mechanic. While ingenious in concept, it can sometimes lead to being stuck for extended periods of time as the necessary interaction is not easy to guess. eaxmple: bernard(present) needs to stick hamster in into icebox so it freezes, so laverne(future) can thaw it and use hamster in solving the puzzle in future

author: {'steamid': '76561198088028789', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1666527766}
review: One of the greatest point and click adventures Lucasfilm Games ever created. I played this game probably 10 times, maybe even more, so there's a replay potential. I really like the overhaul of the remastered edition and that you can always switch back to the original game. The only advice apart from buying this game is not reading any walkthroughs because eventually it's more fun to explore and to find the solution to every riddle on your own (just remember to close every door you see).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008714069', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1480279117}
review:
One of the best point-and-click adventure games of all times gets the remaster it deserves. A remaster that doesn't dumb it down and doesn't "make the gameplay more fluid", but just makes the game playable on newer systems and updates the beautiful graphics. Even better, if you are the sort of purist who thinks only the original is worthy, you can always change the graphics back to the pixelated glory of the early '90s and it will seem like you never skipped a beat. 

The use of time travel as game mechanics is one of the coolest ways in which the story and the mechanics of a game come together to create something greater than the sum of its parts. Some of the best puzzles in video
game history can be found here and only a handful of them will seem frustrating or illogical. 

The only bad thing I can say about it, really, is that there seems to be a small, yet irritating, bug where after playing for a while, a random audio effects will begin looping every few seconds. This makes the game extremely annoying to play, but can be solved by quitting and restarting the game. It happened to me 3 or 4 times during my playthrough, making it something more than just a freak occurrence. 

An absolute gem, for both old and new players!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052888510', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1480267623}
review:
This is one of the games of the old days that I still like to return to every now and then. Together with its nephew Monkey Island this one brings speech to the point-and-click adventures of Bernard and his friends. I am still hoping for a remake of the even older Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders game, another game of that age that will still work now.

The interface to this revamped version requires some getting used to if you've grown up with the original ones, but it works good enough. The drawing style is quirky, the animations feel a little jerky but fitting with the time, but that isn't what this game is about. This game is about dialogue, about humour, about getting stuck and trying odd combinations to get through. 

Quite good, a must for the fans of the old days

author: {'steamid': '76561197997377045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1567747514}
review: This was one of the earliest PaC PC games I ever played. Once I realized that Dr. Fred's secret plans were in the basement, I could finally enjoy the real absurdity and hilarity that was the rest of this game. The art style, dialogue, and plot are unique, amusing, and unconventional. Filled with easter eggs and cultural references, I enjoyed exploring every inch of this game. If you find you aren't making progress, you probably aren't being maniacal enough (it's the Maniac Mansion sequel, after all). I definitely recommend this Remastered version, as it contains developer commentary that fans will love. If you're new to DoTT, I'd also recommend playing with the classic graphics (not remastered) if you want an authentic and original experience. 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025570414', 'num_games_owned': 1444, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1480947625}
review: This and Sam and Max Hit the Road were a couple of my favorite games as a kid.  Limited replayability you would think, but I have finished each multiple times (YMMV, when I was a kid I also watched Star Wars at least once a week and it didn't get old).  The humor and the theme/setting are terrific.  If you are a fan of point and click, you need to play this.  If you are not, well, this isn't going to change your mind probably.. watch the cutscenes on YT instead.

review: Impossible pour moi de r√©sister √† la re-d√©couverte du jeu, avec en plus les commentaires des cr√©ateurs. Bref ce jeu a un bon go√ªt de madelaine, et je dirai que c'est aussi son d√©faut, il risque de ne pas forc√©ment plaire aux joueurs qui n'y ont pas jou√© √† l'√©poque car il demande d'accepter le gameplay de l'√©poque justement (essayer toutes les combinaisons d'objets, lire tous les dialogues pour trouver des pistes etc.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197969440738', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1480195564}
review:
There are games, and there are "games".  This is one of those originals that helped shape the face of gaming today, without point and click adventures from Lucasarts, we would still be in the 8-bit stone age (or heading back there it seems....)

Its funny, comical, easy on the eye and a good story to boot.  Dont read a book (just yet...) play one of the best interactive adventures ever made, and pray that the gods see fit to remaster Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis.

Yes, the puzzles sometimes make you think "what where they thinking", but google will help and relax that back in those days, this was the norm - you had to think.......like the strange person who wrote the game, sometimes you got it, sometimes you didnt, but thats not your fault.

I have this game on IOS and GOG and STEAM, thats how good it is!
