author: {'steamid': '76561197995304552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1517066006}
review:
Day of the Tentacle!
Es ist exakt so wie ich das Spiel von damals in Erinnerung hatte - nur eben mit besserem Sound und besserer Grafik - was will man mehr?

Interessant ist, dass ich alle L√∂sungen immernoch auswendig wusste obwohl ich das Spiel 10 Jahre nicht mehr angefasst hatte - manches scheint sich einfach ins Gehirn einzubrennen...

Fazit: Wer es damals mochte und auf der Suche nach einer "Zeitreise" ist kann hier bedenkenlos zuschlagen.
Und wer das Spiel noch nie gespielt hat MUSS eigentlich zuschlagen.

Nebenbemerkung: 2 kleinere Bugs in der Synchronisation sind wohl vorhanden (Sprache wird zu fr√ºh abgespielt in einer Zwischensequenz) aber ansonsten funktioniert das Spiel tadellos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046781319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1464086744}
review:
Old childhood favourite that has stood the test of time! Absolutely fantastic point and click adventure with a good humour! So happy this came to steam, I was getting sick of making the old DOS one on CD work! 

A purely brilliant game for any point and click fan, if you've never been into those kind of games give this a whirl! This along with the discworld series are, in my opinion, some of the best point and clicks out there!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971180301', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1606343022}
review:
If you really don't know this game you probably didn't play any games in the early 90s.

This game is a classic point-and-click adventure, so it's almost entirely controlled with mouse. It is the classic adventure "Maniac Mansion 2: Day of the Tentacle" in a remastered version with higher quality, a reworked GUI and - of course - lots of Steam achievements.

Day of the Tentacle (also called DOTT) originally was conceived by Tim Schafer for LucasArts, which sadly was eventually bought by Disney and closed only recently. In the late 80s and early 90s, LucasArts was THE high quality studio for adventure games, although some competitors such as Westwood managed to make similar great adventures in this style.

I won't go into the details of this game but one thing is very clear: This game is hilarious! The way it tells its story (underlying plot of time travel!) and how you will have to solve puzzles will stick with you for many years. I still managed to play through this game without any help 20 years later.

Recommended: For anyone who enjoys adventure games. In fact, everyone else should also try it on a good sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011667277', 'num_games_owned': 1121, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1811, 'last_played': 1466758768}
review:
Nostalgia canaglia

Fiumi di ricordi nell‚Äôedizione rimasterizzata di Maniac Mansion I nostri lettori pi√π giovani probabilmente non erano nemmeno nati quando, nel 1993, fu pubblicata una delle pietre angolari nell‚Äôindustria videoludica, frutto della creativit√† di una coppia di autentici geni. Day Of The Tentacle, seguito di Maniac Mansion uscito nel 1987 (incluso in una easter egg, anche se non oggetto di revisione), si pu√≤ considerare a giusta ragione come un‚Äôespressione della cultura popolare con la quale sono cresciuti tanti ragazzi (anche italiani) dei primi anni Novanta: un‚Äôopera con cui Tim Schafer e Dave Grossman, i due programmatori principali, sono inconsapevolmente diventati pap√† di una nutrita schiera di avventurieri. A volte ritornano Come ogni capolavoro che si rispetti Day Of The Tentacle non ha conosciuto un enorme successo commerciale: agli esordi ne furono vendute, secondo le stime dello stesso creatore, poco meno di 100.000 copie. La fama crebbe grazie alla critica dell‚Äôepoca e il titolo divenne un vero e proprio cult negli anni a venire, comparendo in cima in pi√π o meno tutte le ‚Äúhall of fame‚Äù che i siti di informazioni videoludica (e non solo) hanno stilato. Le logiche commerciali hanno quindi voluto che anche questo mostro sacro passasse sotto le forche caudine dell‚Äôammodernamento: pratica dannatamente pericolosa che rischia di sacrificare il fascino che una produzione del genere si porta dietro, snaturandosi per incontrare i favori di una platea enormemente pi√π numerose, eterogenea e, ci si passi il termine, meno ‚Äúhardcore‚Äù di quella che oltre vent‚Äôanni fa si destreggiava con la configurazione dell‚Äôautoexec.bat per far partire il file dott.exe dal prompt del DOS. Il fronte della vecchia guardia, alla quale chi scrive appartiene, solitamente √® molto restio a questo tipo di operazioni, ma bisogna ammettere che, nel caso di Day Of The Tentacle Remastered, il lavoro di update si √® saggiamente limitato ad una ridefinizione grafica molto aderente alle idee originali della LucasArts e ad una leggera semplificazione dell‚Äôinterfaccia SCUMM che per√≤ √® rimasta concettualmente invariata. Il risultato √® una copia 1 a 1 del titolo originale: fortunatamente non sono state fatte aggiunte di alcun tipo tanto che, volendo, √® possibile portare a termine il titolo nella venerata e pixellosissima versione anni Novanta - basta premere il tasto F1 per fare un salto indietro nel tempo, proprio come quello di Hoogie, uno dei tre protagonisti del gioco. Preparate i fazzoletti Il futuro dell‚Äôumanit√† √® minacciato dal tentacolo Viola che, dopo aver bevuto dell‚Äôacqua radioattiva, acquista dei superpoteri: viene catturato, assieme al pi√π mite fratello di provetta, dal proprio artefice, lo scienziato pazzo Fred Edison che per evitare la catastrofe decide di eliminare le due creature. In soccorso dell‚Äôindifeso Verdone arriva il maldestro dottor Bern Bernoulli accompagnato da una coppia di assistenti: la psicotica studentessa Lavigne e il summenzionato Hoogie, degno esponente della categoria roadie. Il tentativo di salvataggio non va a buon fine perch√© Viola riesce a fuggire: per fermarlo dai suoi diabolici piani servir√† tornare indietro di un giorno, grazie al prototipo della macchina del tempo appena messo a punto dal buon Edison. Come facilmente prevedibile anche questa mossa non funziona a dovere: mentre Bern rimane ancorato ai giorni nostri, i due ragazzi vengono catapultati 200 anni nel passato (Hoogie) e 200 nel futuro (Lavigne). Il fil rouge che li collega passa attraverso il gabinetto della cabina del tempo. Il giocatore si trover√† quindi a zompare tra un‚Äôepoca e l‚Äôaltra nel tentativo di mettere a posto le cose e di salvare la razza umana. Uno degli aspetti pi√π riusciti di Day Of The Tentacle √® la spiritosissima trama, alla cui stesura ha contribuito anche Ron Gilbert, padre del motore SCUMM e di Monkey Island. I nostri eroi si troveranno spesso in situazioni paradossali cos√¨ come altrettanto assurdi, ma non per questo privi di logica, sono i numerosi enigmi la cui risoluzione fa proseguire nella trama. I tre protagonisti dovranno aiutarsi a vicenda gettando oggetti apparentemente insignificanti nello sciacquone: cos√¨ capiter√† che la pubblicit√† di un‚Äôaspirapolvere finir√† con l‚Äôinfluenzare la costituzione americana, rendendo in futuro un diritto di tutti il possesso dell‚Äôelettrodomestico, il che torner√† particolarmente utile nello scenario di Lavigne. Il livello di sfida √® piuttosto interessante per chi si avvicina al titolo per la prima volta: naturalmente un po‚Äô meno per chi ricorda a menadito ogni passaggio del gioco, considerando che, come detto, si tratta di una fedele replica dell‚Äôoriginale. Nonostante il peso degli anni tutto funziona ancora a meraviglia: usando la nuova interfaccia utente, cliccando sugli oggetti compare un men√π radiale in cui si pu√≤ scegliere solo tra le azioni effettivamente disponibili per quel tipo di oggetto (ad esempio non si pu√≤ parlare con una lavatrice, azione che nella vecchia release era invece contemplata). Questa impostazione rende la navigazione al passo coi tempi e permette allo stesso tempo di utilizzare anche l‚Äôereticissimo joypad (il titolo √® infatti previsto anche per PlayStation 4 e PlayStation Vita). Old but gold Per fornire nuova linfa vitale al suo capolavoro Double Fine si √® affidata a Yujin Keim che ha avuto la benedizione di Peter Chan e Larry Ahern, i due disegnatori originali: il risultato √® davvero encomiabile, perch√© l‚Äôartista ha rispettato fedelmente i bozzetti del 1993, riproducendo in alta definizione quello che un tempo si poteva solamente immaginare. Merita ancora un plauso la possibilit√† di saltare, in tempo reale, da una versione all‚Äôaltra mediante la pressione di un tasto, giusto per ricordarsi come si giocava una volta e a che punto sono arrivate le moderne tecnologie. Anche la colonna sonora √® stata rimasterizzata e si integra perfettamente con la veste grafica proprio come lo faceva all‚Äôepoca. La possibilit√† di attivare i commenti dei programmatori, inoltre, √® una graditissima opzione che aggiunge un tocco di rigiocabilit√† ad un titolo che richieder√† circa una decina di ore per essere portato ai titoli di coda. Kommento Il grande Vincenzo Beretta, caporedattore della storica rivista PCZeta, sosteneva che nessun gioco pu√≤ meritare il massimo alla sua uscita: √® necessario che trascorrano gli anni e che il tempo ne certifichi un‚Äôeccellenza che all‚Äôatto della pubblicazione non pu√≤ essere pienamente compresa. Mai come in questo caso √® quindi giusto tributare con una votazione ad honorem uno dei titoli pi√π importanti della storia dei videogame, degnamente riportato al passo con i tempi da un‚Äôottima rivisitazione tecnica che rimane fedele alle idee dei geniali ideatori di Day of the Tentacle, esempio, per certi versi pi√π raggiunto, di creativit√†, originalit√†, umorismo e divertimento.

Grab it while it's in the sale I guess.

Hauska peli jos p√§√§see yli pelin puzzlejen logiikasta. Seikkailupelien pelaajille pakko-ostos. Mukana mahdollisuus vaihtaa grafiikan tasoa lennosta F1 n√§pp√§imell√§.

review:
Perfekte Neuauflage des Lucasart Klassikers! Es hat wieder so richtig Spa√ü gemacht die alten R√§tsel noch einmal anzugehen. Der schr√§ge Humor war ja schon damals legen.... warte es kommt gleich... D√ÑR!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005764031', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1469384384}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ist ein klassisches Adventure-Spiel aus den fr√ºhen 90ern: es gl√§nzt mit einer phantasievollen Story, einmaligen Charakteren und jede Menge Witz und Charm -- aber wer das Spiel genie√üen will muss sich auch auf eine gute Portion Pixel-Jagen und Adventure-Spiel-Logik einlassen.

Nichtsdestotrotz, Day of the Tentacle ein echter Klassiker aus der goldenen Zeit der Adventure Spiele, und diesen Status hat es sich redlich verdient. Mit der Maus und den klassischen Aktions-Verben und Inventar-Quadraten navigiert man drei steuerbare Charaktere durch drei unterschiedliche Epochen - die Gr√ºnderzeit der Vereinigten Staaten, die Gegenwart, und die nahe Zukunft -, um dem tyrannischen Violett-Tentakel die Weltherrschaft zu entrei√üen. Dabei spielt es keine Rolle, ob man gerade den Gr√ºnderv√§tern einen Streich spielt oder eine alte Frau die Treppe herunterst√∂√üt, das Spiel wirkt immer wie aus einem Guss; selbstverst√§ndlich gibt es √ºberall R√§tsel zu l√∂sen, aber diese werden als Teil der Welt und Geschichte pr√§sentiert.

Meine Meinung zu Day of the Tentacle ist dabei sicher stark durch Nostalgie und Jugenderinnerungen beeinflusst, aber wer nicht Point&Click-Adventures allgemein ablehnt oder beim Spielen grunds√§tzlich auf Spannung und Nervenkitzel aus ist, der wird an Day of the Tentacle seine wahre Freunde haben.

Fazit: bedenkenlose Empfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980184704', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1512760966}
review:
Eines der gro√üartigsten Adventures √ºberhaupt (solange man nicht nur auf bier-ernste Adventures steht). Abgesehen von seinem einzigartigen Humor tragen die Zeit-R√§tsel zu seinem zeitlosen Charm bei (Wortspiel gewollt).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998021860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1478532541}
review:
[h1]DOTT, das perfekte Remake .. [i]und Gummikotze[/i][/h1]

Wenn man im Herzen ein wahrer Gamer ist, und besonders wenn man auf Meilensteine der Geschichte der Videospiele steht, dann muss man "Day of the Tentacle" einfach gespielt haben!

Dies eigentlich schon vor 20 Jahren, und das mehrmals hintereinander. Inklusive des retro Vorg√§ngers "Maniac Mansion", welchen man sogar komplett als Spiel-im-Spiel bei DOTT finden und zocken kann. Nun, leider hat nicht jeder das Gl√ºck in den 90' gro√ü geworden zu sein, aber daf√ºr gibt es jetzt diese geniale Remastered Edition. Kindheitserinnerungen pur! Und auch heute noch wird es Erstspielern, sowie Fans von Point and Click‚Äú-Adventure Games, gro√üe Freude bereiten k√∂nnen.

DOTT war neben Monkey Island eines meiner ersten Adventure Games und auch heute kann ich noch sagen: "Absoluter Pflichtkauf!" Besonders wenn man das geniale R√§tseldesign, die herrlich abstruse Story und die abgedrehten Charaktere einmal selbst erleben m√∂chte und auch sollte. DOTT geh√∂rt einfach in jede Spielesammlung! Und auch nach 20 Jahren muss sich immer noch jeder B√∂sewicht mit dem Purpur-Tentakel messen. ^^

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=643197392

review: Un classico sempre bellissimo. Difficile e frustrante in molti punti, richiede pazienza e inventiva. Le avventure grafiche odierne non sono cos√¨ belle!

author: {'steamid': '76561197983541394', 'num_games_owned': 574, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1613336486}
review:
Probably the greatest game of all times! I played this through at least twice back in the 90s, as it is quite perfect in all categories: Character design, voice recording, comic graphics, story and humour. The remastered version is amazing and takes the game into the future, and it doesn't even need a Chron-O-John for that! ;)
If you never had the chance to play this, do it right now! This version includes the possibility to switch between the old graphics and UI and the remastered version seamlessly while you are playing, so you can go back and forth and compare them or just enjoy the "back in the days" feeling.

author: {'steamid': '76561198123726975', 'num_games_owned': 3536, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1482017153}
review:
Endlich wieder da!

Damals in jungen Jahren  noch als Escom Bundle geholt und seit her mein liebstes Spiel im Bereich Point to Click.

Es ist kein Day of Tentacle 2, aber man merkt deutlich, wo hier noch gearbeitet wurde. Viele ehemals nicht vertonte Textpassagen wurden nach-vertont und als kleiner Bonus wird sogar noch der Wechsel von HD in die Retro Grafik angeboten, obgleich diese mir noch zu optimiert vorkommt. Sogar die alte Retro Steuerung ist in dieser Ansicht verf√ºgbar.
Die Stimmen selbst sind nah am Original, aber doch merklich anders -  jedoch nicht schlechter... oder lag es doch nur an den damals schlechteren Boxen?? 

Alles im allen einfach wieder sch√∂n sich in das Chaos zu st√ºrzen. Wer es noch nicht kennen sollte, es ist eindeutig eine Kaufempfehlung.

Performance ist technisch sauber umgesetzt. Habe es auf einem alten Laptop mit einem AMD E 250 und Linux spielen k√∂nnen :)

Ich bin noch nicht bis zum Automaten im Spiel, aber ich bin gespannt auf die Umsetzung von Maniac Mansion. Bisher eine gelungene, solide √úberarbeitung. Einzig zu kritisieren ist die Voreinstellung der Entwicklerdokumentation, die im ersten Moment das Intro ruiniert, wenn man sehns√ºchtig darauf wartet ins Spiel einzutauchen. Ein kleines Symbol im Spiel zum de- und aktivieren w√§re mir lieber gewesen als daf√ºr immer ins Men√º zu m√ºssen.


Bleibt nur zu hoffen, dass es vielleicht doch irgendwann den 2ten Teil geben wird....

author: {'steamid': '76561198038754455', 'num_games_owned': 2410, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1479916768}
review:
¬øQu√© hace que un juego sea rejugable?
La mayor√≠a de las veces lo importante es que tengas diferentes opciones dentro del juego, que te lleven por diferentes caminos... en algunos casos con diferente final. Est√°n tambi√©n aquellos donde la adicci√≥n que produce la jugabilidad hace que lo juegues una y otra vez. No es el caso de "Day of the tentacle". Entonces... qu√© es lo que lo hace rejugable? Muy simple, en mi caso particular es la nostalgia, que va m√°s alla del juego, es eso que viene por a√±adidura y qu√© esta fuera de lo que pensaron los desarrolladores: El recuerdo de lo que te gener√≥ cuando lo jugaste por primera vez.
 Y es que Day of the tentacle tiene eso y mucho m√°s. Es uno de los mejores juego que he jugado, la historia es muy divertida y es un cl√°sico de los juegos point & click, incluso en los 90, donde era la √©poca dorada de este tipo de juegos.

 As√≠ que si sos un veterano como yo, no podes dejar de compr√°rtelo y jugarlo nuevamente, y si nunca lo jugaste no podes perd√©rtelo.
 Incluso para los m√°s nost√°lgicos, dentro del juego pod√©s jugar al Maniac Mansion original (no al Maniac Mansion 2 que es este, sino al primer juego de la saga)

author: {'steamid': '76561197979215168', 'num_games_owned': 8053, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1477339630}
review:
What is "Day of the Tentacle Remastered"?

It is the classical adventure "Maniac Mansion 2: Day of the Tentacle" in a remastered version with higher quality and a load of Steam achievements, but also a reworked GUI.

As the game is a classical adventure, it is controlled almost entirely with the mouse. As I knew the game already and had finished it in 2011 for the first time over the course of a few days, I just rushed through the Steam version to get the achievements, so my time should not be an indicator for the time with "normal" play.

The game originally was conceived by Tim Schafer for LucasArts, which sadly was eventually bought by Disney and closed only recently. In the late 1980s and early 1990s, LucasArts was THE high quality studio for adventure games, although some competitors such as Westwood (Legend of Kyrandia) managed to make similarly great adventures in this style.

There is a comic style to the entire game, and it is comedic in nature with an underlying plot of time travel. Purple Tentacle is a purple tentacle (thanks, Captain Obvious!) who drinks industrial waste water and then aspires to conquer the world. The three anti-heroes to stop him are teenagers: A crazy girl, a nerd and their overweight friend.

The game includes its predecessor, Maniac Mansion, entirely to be accessed via an ingame computer. Following however the story of this game, Purple Tentacle becomes the leader of the world in a tentacle ridden future where humans are held as pets. With a time machine, two anti-heroes land in different stages of history, while the other one stays in the present. Arriving near a few founding fathers of the United States of America, ready to sign the Declaration of Independence, the past has to be altered to provide means in the future to fight against the tentacle oppression. Thanks to the flush technology of the time machine, almost all items can simply be sent to each time period, so the three characters can use them as they please.

As the plot advances, it becomes clear that this lovable game still is one of the best adventures of all time, deserving very well its plalce in - of course! - history.

The downside is that the voice actors don't sound very professional at too many times. In fact, if anything about this game is to be criticized, it is this point. Maybe a new set of voice actors would have improved the game, with options to switch between the voice sets, just as there are options to switch between the new and old graphics.

Recommended: For anyone who enjoys adventure games. In fact, everyone else also should try it on a good sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982183684', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1495985555}
review:
DOTT pour les intimes, ou tout simplement l'un des meilleurs jeux d'aventure point'n click de tous les temps. Le jeu introduisait √† l'√©poque des graphismes √† tomber, de nouvelles m√©caniques de gameplay autour des trois personnages √† travers le temps, ainsi qu'une ambiance totalement d√©jant√©e et bourr√©e de r√©f√©rences/caricatures. C'est l'un des jeux auxquels j'ai le plus jou√© √©tant jeune, comme tous les LucasArts sur lesquels j'ai pass√© des moments extraordinaires, et √ßa a √©t√© un vrai plaisir d'y rejouer √† nouveau en version modernis√©.

Alors il faut quand m√™me √™tre honn√™te, cette version Remastered, qui fera d√©couvrir un classique absolu √† un nouveau public, aurait pu b√©n√©ficier d'un peu plus d'efforts de la part de Double Fine. M√™me si la base technique √©tait excellente √† l'√©poque, quand on a fait, refait et rerefait la version d'origine (merci ScummVM), on a pas mal l'impression de se retrouver devant un filtre HD du logiciel sus-mentionn√©, aussi bien fichu soit-il. C'est principalement ce qui a fait que je ne me suis pas jet√© dessus d√®s sa sortie, ayant √©t√© un peu refroidi par les trailers. Ah, et on a droit √† quelques bugs aussi qui n'√©taient pas du tout dans le jeu d'origine, notamment sur les musiques qui par endroit se perdent ou r√©p√®tent en boucle quelques secondes.

Mais au final, ce serait un crime de passer √† c√¥t√©, pour tout fan de point'n click qui n'y aurait pas encore jou√©.

-gute Sprachausgabe

und als letzter Punkt: der Vorg√§nger "Maniac Mansion" l√§sst sich auch noch spielen.

F√ºr jeden Point & Click Adventure Fan ein absolutes Must Have und eine ganz klare Kaufempfehlung, wenn
auch nicht zum Vollpreis.Aber im Sale auf jeden Fall.

review:
Ce jeu est intemporel, et le remaster bonifie encore plus l'exp√©rience. Graphiquement parlant, les d√©cors style cartoons font mouches. Ceux qui l'ont vu tourner chez moi ont appr√©ci√© ce qu'ils ont vu.
Le jeu est juste trop hilarant et d√©bile, avec 3 personnages controllables totalement loufoques dont on appr√©cie la compagnie.
Si je devais citer un d√©faut, je dirais la dur√©e de vie (8hrs la 1√®re partie, 2hrs pour la deuxi√®me partie)
On a l'un des meilleurs point-and-click de fa√ßon certaine, probablement le meilleur mais c'est mon opinion.
Bon courage et bon jeu.

review:
The game is actually still as great as I remembered it from way back when I first laid my eyes on the Edisons. I still haven‚Äôt compared the remastered version with the original version that I kept over all these years‚ÄîI‚Äôd have to take the old 80468 DX2 66 down from the attic and install it there.

However, this edition really transmits all the fun I had back when I was a teenager with his first computer, which is meant as a very big appraisal for the job Doublefine did here. Both thumbs up! The Far Cry 3, Fallout IV, and GTA V kids of today don‚Äôt know what they‚Äôve missed‚Äîthis game should be made mandatory.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061628494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1480560893}
review:
Like many other reviewers, I'd like to say that I remember Day of the Tentacle (DOTT) from my childhood. Unfortunately (fortunately?), I'm too old to say that without lying. However, I can say that I remember the game from my (earlier) adulthood, which means I'm not too old to recall playing it.

It was nice to hear that they were doing a re-master of this game since I had been thinking of trying to get my CD copies to work on a modern computer. This made that task a lot easier. Now I could finally introduce my daughter to this fun and funny game. Unfortunately, after a short period of time she declared that the game was boring and had bad graphics. Then she went back to playing Undertale.

If you enjoy adventure games with a sense of humour and you're not a 13 year old girl prone to ironic statements regarding graphic quality, I definitely recommend Day of the Tentacle. Plus you're actually getting two games in one since, like the original, it also includes Maniac Mansion, the game that came before DOTT. You just have to find it...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970371124', 'num_games_owned': 1539, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1662255837}
review: This game is an utter classic. I play the original at least once a year on average. Everything is on point. This remaster does a fantastic job of updating the game while keeping everything that made the original amazing. You can also still play Maniac Mansion inside the game, just like the original, if you know where to look! Perhaps Ed knows?

author: {'steamid': '76561198042160756', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1687757544}
review:
Sigue siendo Day of the Tentacle, una de las aventuras gr√°ficas m√°s divertidas que, al igual que la mayor√≠a de LucasArts, tiene la virtud de que aunque no consigas avanzar, los chascarrillos que mete en sus di√°logo hace que no se haga frustrante dar vueltas para seguir buscando la clave para continuar.

Como versi√≥n remasterizada deja un poco que desear el hecho de que los gr√°ficos mejorados sean simplemente pasar los originales por un "filtro de emulador" y que todo parezcan manchurrones de color, pero lo compensa el hecho de poder cambiar a los gr√°ficos originales en cualquier momento y la pista de comentarios de los desarrolladores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011337140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1488710833}
review:
It's a great product of a past, sadly, era during which point and click adventure games ruled supreme.
And while the game isn't the best of the best, it's definitely up there with all the other great games of its time.
Plus, it aged extremely well and still holds up to scrutiny.
Though, while the graphics in this updated version are nice looking, they weren't what I'd call mind blowing.
That is not an issue however, as this is still one of those rare must-play games for everyone.
If you're a fan of the genre itself, do yourself a solid and pick this one up even if you weren't part of the pc gaming scene during the glorious golden age of adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989405827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1629116733}
review:
A milestone in adventure history. The successor to Maniac Mansion, which you can play as a game in this game, is a  masterpiece, with a great sense of humor.
The remastered version brings you this classic in a new modern look. Solve puzzles, think out of the box, enjoy a great vocal acting (both englisch [b]and[/b] german).

I'm a fan of both Maniac Mansion and Day of the Tentacle ever since, and being able to enjoy this game again brings back great memories. But this game is not only for those who liked to play it back in the times, it's still one of the best adventure games available. And it runs great on Linux/SteamOS! You probably know whom you have to thank for this ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197975942793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1467286021}
review:
This game is pure Awesomnes. 
I have played it many years ago and to me, it was one of the best (if not the best) point and click adventure. 
Sadly, those old versions wont play propperly on a modern PC. 

But then they made this Remastered. And what they made. Its nerly perfect. They put everything good of the original and remade it with new graphics. Thats all we wanted, that all they needed to do. 

If you love Point and Click Adventures, BUY IT. 
If you love DOTT, BUY IT! 
If you havent played stuff like this, screw you! BUY IT and start with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990235484', 'num_games_owned': 1044, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1621020500}
review:
I remember first getting this game for Christmas as part of the original "Lucasarts Archive" collection, which had Sam and Max Hit the Road, Fate of Atlantis, and a bunch of demos.  At the time (I was ten, maybe eleven?) Sam and Max was by far my favorite, but over time that has become...Day of the Tentacle.  Let's be honest, if you're even looking at this you've probably already played the game in the past, so I'll touch on just a few key points.

1) The remastered graphics is probably the best balance between keeping the old style while cleaning things up for the "modern player."  Things don't change radically - really, at all - between the original and new style, which is more than Secret of Monkey Island can say.  Having played this almost annually for twenty years, I think I now prefer the updated graphics.

2) The developer's commentary is great.  I mostly play this on muscle memory (without being cognizant of it in the game), so the commentary on its own would freshen things up.  However, the fact that most of the original team (key players at least) were available makes this worth listening to on its own.  Say what you will about Tim Schaffer, he knows how to keep discussions interesting AND educational.

3)  The new controls are good, definitely streamlined, but I think this is one case where I prefer the fake "freedom" of the original SCUMM verbs.  Still, if you don't care about such things the new controls are very intuitive.

4)  You can no longer access Laverne from the start.  The commentary explains why, and although it's not how it was designed in the original I actually think it's a good call.  You couldn't do anything anyway...but at this point it's probably only going to be appreciated by new players.

IF you've played the original and still own it, this is definitely a must buy.  For those who - shocking - have not played the original, this is definitely the version to get.  Without a doubt my vote for standing the "test of time."

author: {'steamid': '76561197961384956', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1612640918}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991592861', 'num_games_owned': 1378, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1515763280}
review:
PROS:
A technically competent remaster
Possibly the best old-school quest game ever released
Just like in the original, you get Maniac Mansion too

CONS:
On the graphical side, it barely looks better than the original game running on ScummVM
The references in the jokes are quite dated by now

10/10 would freeze a hamster for a hundred years before putting it into a microwave

author: {'steamid': '76561197999334292', 'num_games_owned': 3580, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1468739973}
review:
Not much can be said about this game that hasn't been said hundreds of times before.
It's a remaster of a classic 90's 'Point n Click' adventure game, written by some of the funniest people in the business.

The good:
+ Remastered graphics
+ Updated interface
+ Switch between the original and updated graphics at any time
+ High quality audio
+ It's a very funny game
+ You'll get stuck, but the puzzles aren't so hard you won't figure it out eventually.
+ Achievements

The bad:
+ The updated interface takes a bit of getting used too.
+ It's not as challenging as I remember

The ugly:
+ Nothing. The game is brilliant and 100% recommended if you like Point n Click adventure games. If you don't, and you're curious, this is definitely the one to start with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052646641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1605480592}
review: The original version of this game is one of the first PC games I ever played (It was an A: drive diskette back then) and I absolutely adored it. Sadly, I lost my manuel, and no longer have a diskette drive (Yes diskette, floppies were larger, and floppy and B: drive. Trust me, I was there. I was 4 or 5, but I was there.) So I thought I'd lost this game forever, when lo and behold they remastered it! The best part is, they remade it the way my imagination saw it the first time, so it  holds up perfect to my nostalgic memories!!! I still love this ridiculously funny crazy game so much!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970917047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1548777848}
review:
Back in the day, during the golden age of point and click, I had two lucas arts games that I loved, the first was sam & max hit the road, and the second was Day of the Tentacle.  Both games have completly bonkers puzzles that need solving, which is something that is seriously lacking in todays point and click games (with the exception of Deponia) that give it that extra challenge and Laugh out Loud moments.

the remaster has smoother edges on its textures, but I actually prefer some of the classic audio more than the remaster audio.  and there's plenty of acheviments to keep you playing, and many of the achievments are not story related and easy to miss (something for your next playthrough me thinks)

it's also worth mentioning that this game has its prequel game 'Manic Manision' as a playable mini game within the game (just like the original DOTT did)

author: {'steamid': '76561198117815599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1479795324}
review: One of my favorite games from childhood. The graphical update is nice. The commentary and concept art are interesting for fans. The puzzles and humor still hold up well! I'm proud that I remembered the puzzles well enough to get through it without looking up solutions. It's really a great game. Recommended for first-timers and those looking for a nostalgia trip.

review: I never played this game originally but playing it for the first time 23 years after it originally came out and it doesn't feel dated. The remastered art, sound, and UI does help it feel modern, but I think the original version is perfectly playable. The remade UI also accommodates controller usage while still working well with the mouse. I was also surprised by the humor in this game, which despite its age, is very good and timeless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088954250', 'num_games_owned': 498, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1468008049}
review:
One of the best Point&Click-Adventures of all time, back and better than ever!
Works like a charm on modern operating systems without the need for emulation software.
If you are at least somewhat into the genre and haven't played DotT yet, I suggest you do so immediately!
One of my favorite features of this game: You can play the original, complete Maniac Mansion ingame!

author: {'steamid': '76561197974076417', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1706987526}
review:
In 1994 when I was seven years old I went over to the house of a girl I was desperately in love with. On her family computer was a game. I didn't recognize it, but I love the art style. She moved the mouse and clicked on, "Look at" in the bottom menu, then clicked on a door. The character walked over to the door and said, "Bitchin'." We laughed. 

I moved away a few months later and thought about her and that game for years. When I went to computer stores I would search through the game ailse for a game that looked like what she was playing. A few years later I finally found the game in a Lucas Arts adventure pack. It was called, "Day of the Tentacle." I bought it, played it, loved it, and thought of the girl I once loved. 

Today point and click adventure games are still my favorite genre and Day of the Tentacle is the best of them all.

review: Jogo cl√°ssico, simplesmente genial. Muitos puzzles de quebrar a cabe√ßa, e um humor genial. Vale muito a pena jog√°-lo, mesmo sendo um point¬¥n click antigo, eu volta e meia estou reinstalando ele para jogar de novo. Humor e divers√£o garantidos. Compre e seja feliz.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997833021', 'num_games_owned': 2810, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1479934485}
review:
Si hablamos de aventuras cl√°sicas, sin duda una de ellas es Day of the Tentacle. Esta versi√≥n remasterizada nos vuelve a traer, para deleite de nuestros ojos, al trio de h√©roes en su af√°n por derrotar al villano tent√°culo morado. Hay que jugarlo para apreciarlo en toda su dimensi√≥n.

La remasterizaci√≥n creo que es un gran acierto. Mantiene el estilo de dibujo original, tan s√≥lo le han dado un lavado de cara. Y no a√±adiendo pol√≠gonos o simple potencia gr√°fica, al ser una aventura antigua con im√°genes art√≠sticas 2D han rehecho de cero todas las im√°genes. El resultado es muy bueno, aunque tambi√©n es verdad que la aventura original ocupaba unos pocos disquetes de 1.44 MB y ¬°¬°¬°ahora son casi 3.00 GB!!!  :D
(1.00 GB = 1024 MB)

Una nota importante es que, al igual que en la versi√≥n original, dentro del juego hay otro juego completo: ¬°Maniac Mansion! Este Day of the Tentacle es como la segunda parte. As√≠ que para quienes no probaron la primera bien puedes hacerlo como parte de esta aventura.

Disfrutad de esta joya atemporal.

Nota: Imprescindible  9/10

Es ist teilweise richtig bockschwer die Zusammenh√§nge zwischen den Zeitebenen zu erkennen um in der Story voranzukommen, aber Spa√ü macht es allemal. Die Remastered Version sieht gro√üartig aus und man kann mit einem Klick zwischen alter Pixel- und neuer Grafik wechseln. F√ºr mich ist es das Beste Adventure aller Zeiten 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040720768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1482032260}
review:
Uno de mis juegos favoritos. Por lejos uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado. Los a√±os simplemente no pasan para el.
Day of Tentacle es una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas, llena de humor tonto (ese del bueno), puzzles (muy variados), buenos personajes y un dise√±o artistico muy agradable.
Para los que gustan de los juegos de aventuras y no lo han jugado, esta es una obra de arte a la que jugar por lo menos una vez antes de morir. 
Para los que ya la han jugado, esta versi√≥n te permite jugar la versi√≥n original en pantalla completa en los SO modernos.
Son unas 4 horitas de juego para aquellos que ya pasamos este t√≠tulo anta√±o y muchas m√°s horas de diversi√≥n para los que nunca la han jugado.
Esta versi√≥n para Steam viene con logros que te haran descubrir cosas ocultas que quiz√°s cuando jugaras la versi√≥n original no notaras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122874857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1479936862}
review: Puesta al d√≠a de la mejor aventura gr√°fica de la historia. As√≠, sin m√°s. ¬øPor qu√©? Porque estando a la altura de otras como Monkey Island 1 y 2, Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, Grim Fangando o The Longest Journey, esta tiene algo que las dem√°s no tienen: puzles transtemporales. Y eso es iniagulable. Y deber√≠a ganar el premio Steam al juego con mejor sentido del humor. Jugadlo y juzgad por vosotros mismos. Eso s√≠, de f√°cil no tiene nada.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013169719', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1545174505}
review: Double Fine did a surprisingly good job transferring this LucasArts classic to high definition. If you have never played DOTT before, it's a best way to do it today. It's one of the funniest point-and-click adventure titles which has successfully stood the test of time. You won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009399963', 'num_games_owned': 2231, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1669218539}
review:
One of the best point & click adventure games, now in both the original form and a new remastered look with sharp HD visuals, remastered audio, music and sound effects and much more! In this superb version you can experience the game in a new perspective with the developers commentary (including Tim Schafer, Dave Grossman, Larry Ahern, Peter Chan, Peter McConnell and Clint Bajakian), there are also concept arts, achievements, full controller support (although a mouse is the way!) and steam trading cards.

Everything looks great and it's really refreshing playing it again with the new graphics and all the additions, the game is still a blast to play, I love the story, the amazing art, all the funny scenes and great characters, it's really a recommended game for everyone (unless you really don't like to read much, then point & click games are probably not your cup of tea)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198048937538', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1513105935}

L'un des meilleurs point'n'click, on g√®re trois personnage en m√™me et c'est assez bien foutu pour ne pas √™tre trop dur sans √™tre compl√®tement facile. review: Day of the Tentacle Remastered does a fantastic job of updating a true classic of point-and-click adventures. It manages to retain everything that was funny about the original game, and possibly (possibly...) even improve on it. The hand-drawn-style graphics are beautiful, the redone music is suitably unobtrusive, and you can always go back to Classic mode if you prefer. My only fault, and I'm splitting hairs here, is that the voice acting in the newly dubbed dialogue is a little lacklustre at times (though mostly it's still pretty good. 10/10, ten out of tentacle...

review:
Essa foi uma √≥tima remasteriza√ß√£o de um grande cl√°ssico point n click dos anos 90. 

Hist√≥ria simples, divertida e com personagens muito engra√ßados. 

Para quem n√£o conhece o jogo essa √© uma grande oportunidade. Para quem j√° conhece e quer reviver a experi√™ncia do jeito que era antes, tem a possibilidade de trocar os gr√°ficos originais/remasterizados em tempo real.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990127367', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1593710919}
review:
A faithful recreation of the original classic game. If you're a Lucas Arts/DOTT/point-n-click fan, this is for you - improved audio quality, reworked score and better interfacing bring the game neatly to the 21st century without sacrificing any of the original game's feel and genius.

The high-definition graphics mode will be hit or miss depending on who's asked: Others will definitely prefer the original VGA graphics over the squeaky-clean remastered backgrounds, and I personally felt the character sprites conversion was sloppy and rushed and didn't do the originals justice. It didn't affect the experience otherwise and it was a good call from Double Fine to include the choice - I'm sure there's plenty of people out there who will think the new sprites fit the wonky overall art style of the game. Still more than happy to give this a big fat thumbs up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993292474', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1479611492}
review:
:-/

I'm in the minority, it seems, but this game is ... terrible.  It's a classic case of "figure out what the designer wants you to do" -- down to the fiddly details of exactly what order you click on the relevant objects.

(puzzle spoiler in next paragraph)

For example, at one point I needed to wake someone up by giving them coffee.  I had coffee, but they were asleep, so I needed to use a funnel to make sure I didn't spill it.  (Already absurd.)  So I "use" the coffee "with" the funnel and I'm told "I can't do that, I might spill it."  ... Okay, I guess I'm not doing this right?  Nope!  Needed to use the funnel on the guy first, then use the coffee on the funnel.

(end spoiler)

If you're yearning for a classic, give this a go, I guess.  Otherwise skip it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160427703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1479406656}
review:
Parto col dire che non avevo mai giocato il gioco originale e come rimasterizzazione ci sta tanto, premendo il tast f1 si pu√≤ switchare alla modalita "retr√≤" e dato che ho completato il gioco in modalit√† rimasterizzata l'ho rigiocato in modalit√† retr√≤.
Qui siamo all'apoteosi delle avventure grafiche, gli enigmi mettono seriamente alla prova la proria intelligenza e la propria fantasia .Day of the tentacle √® il seguito di un'altra avventura grafica storica "Maniac Mansion" che sar√† possibile giocare interamente come ester egg nel pc di pazzo ed edison , non vi preoccupate i richiami a Maniac Mansion sono veramente pochi e poco significativi
PRO:
-Rimasterizzazione fatta come si deve al contrario di altre ....
-Enigmi molto divertinte 
-Comicit√† e carisma dei personaggi 
-Achievement molto belli da scoprire e divertenti da fare
-Possibilit√† di giocare Maniac Mansion
CONTRO:
-Di negativo non c'√® quasi nulla tranne un paio di volte che si √® leggermente buggata la grafica
-Avrei gradito un sistema di suggerimenti per i neofiti, anche senza ci si arriva alle soluzioni ma posso immaginare che qualcuno si precluda dal giocare questo capolavoro per la complessit√† degli enigmi

VOTO: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198071076154', 'num_games_owned': 754, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1479563741}
review: I was two years old when this classic point 'n' click adventure released and after more than 20 years I got the chance to enjoy the adventure of Bernard, Laverne, and Hoagie. It's no wonder that so many people have fond memories of this game,  in gameplay and humour Day of the Tentacle hasn't aged a day. It's quite an experience to control three protagonists through three different timelines including interconnected puzzles. I felt great triumph every time I reached the solution to a complex task, not to mention the joy thanks to the great characters and writing. I recommend this game without hesitation to anyone who is interested in good old adventure games!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960830998', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 610, 'last_played': 1481336019}
review:
10 / 10 - A perfect remaster of the perfect point and click adventure.

Comes with Developers commentary - a real time toggle choice between the original version and remastered - and the crem de la creme - It includes the authentic CD version of Maniac Mansion as an ingame extra, fully playable with its own save slots .

In my view this is the very best of Lucas Arts, and its a cleverer , more streamlined experience than the revered Monkey Island.

The mechanics are great, all the puzzles are fair and the jokes and dialogue are just as strong as they were in the 90's - very little is dated.

Well worth the asking price, I feel a little guilty I got as part of a bundle, I hope Double Fine are getting the revenue they deserver for this!!!

I'll keep wishing for more remasters of all the SCUMM games - Especially that bike one I , ah "Full Throttle" - that'd be great!.

Oh and by the way America - Jefferson brings up a great argument for the turkey instead of the Eagle as the US national symbol! And it's spot on!

Ok. time to mosey on to Grim Fandango remastered!

author: {'steamid': '76561198081340622', 'num_games_owned': 5267, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1589817818}
review:
There are hundreds of hilarious gags and memorable scenes in this game that still stick in my mind even 20+ years after finishing it for the last time. That's how you differentiate a good ol' game from an absolute, must-have classic. Its influence over the point & click adventure genre was priceless, too.
Plus, time travel-based logic puzzles. 'Nuff said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065951775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1591916810}
review:
Man, the nostalgia hit so hard when playing this. The updated graphics were a really nice touch. They were drawn directly over the old graphis so it's pretty much the exact same, only nicer looking and in widescreen. You can also switch betwen the original and new graphics at any time by presing F1. Plus I like haveing the action wheel as opposed to the action bar in the original. 
Seriously, if you like point-and-click adventure games and you've never played Day of the Tentacle before, I suggest you treat yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027013569', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 435, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1479044293}
review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

La version remasteris√©e est agr√©able : musique, graphisme, et surtout, plus besoin d'utiliser les actions en allant les chercher en bas de l'√©cran - elles sont accessibles directement sur chaque objet/personnage avec lequel on peut interagir.

Pour les nostalgiques, √ßa reste DoTT. Donc excellent, g√©nial, et autres superlatifs.

Pour les autres, ceux qui n'y ont pas jou√© quand il est sorti... c'est plus difficile de le conseiller. Alors oui, il y a de l'humour un peu partout, des jeux de mots, ... mais honn√™tement les 3/4 des puzzles sont insolubles de fa√ßon "logique". Apr√®s, si vous aimez tout essayer, tout combiner avec tout... alors allez-y. Ou alors, vous allez sortir le walkthrough bien trop souvent. SInon, il y a de bien meilleurs Point & Click qui sont sortis depuis !

[h1]Rejouabilit√©, achievements[/h1]

Ca reste un point&click lin√©aire - on peut jouer les personnages dans n'importe quel ordre, mais le r√©sultat est toujours identique.

Les achievements qui obligent √† refaire le jeu en entier si vous avez oubli√© un truc : vraiment, c'est compl√®tement stupide, il faudrait arr√™ter avec ce genre l√†...

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Non conseill√©, sauf si vous y avez jou√© √† l'√©poque et avez appr√©ci√©, dans ce cas foncez :).

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente, je n'ai rencontr√© aucun probl√®me.

OS: Linux Mint 18 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i5 3570K OC@4.5Ghz, Nvidia 670GTX, 16GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125145161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1527275306}
review:
Schon als Kind war ich ein gro√üer Fan dieses Spiels! Zig Male habe ich mir den PC meines Vaters geklaut und meine Freude mit dem Point-and-Click-Adventure gehabt!
Umso mehr habe ich mich gefreut, als von einer Remastered Edition des Spiels die Rede war! So l√§sst sich das Spiel deutlich einfacher und bequemer auf neueren Rechnern spielen.

Der Hilferuf eines guten Freundes l√§sst den nerdigen Bernard, die Medizinstudentin Laverne und den 
Heavy-Metal-Freak Hoagie sofort zur Hilfe eilen. Wie sich herausstellt, ist einer der beiden von dem verr√ºckten Wissenschaftler Dr. Fred Edison erschaffenen Tentakel b√∂se geworden und versucht nun die Welt zu erobern und die Menschheit zu versklaven.
Die einzige M√∂glichkeit den b√∂sen Purpur-Tentakel aufzuhalten ist die Maschine abzuschalten, durch deren Abwasser der Tentakel b√∂se geworden ist.
Doch leider geht die Zeitreisemission ein wenig schief: Hoagie landet mal eben 200 Jahre in der Vergangenheit, w√§hrend Laverne 200 Jahre in die Zukunft bef√∂rdert wird. Nur Bernard kommt wieder genau dort hinaus, wo er gestartet ist.
Daraufhin entbrennt eine Schnitzeljagt in drei verschiedenen Zeiten, um die Menschheit vor dem Untergang zu bewahren und um Bernards Freunde wieder zur√ºck in ihre eigene Zeit zu holen.

Day of the Tentacle ist einfach ein Klassiker, den man gespielt haben muss. Der Humor ist genial und die R√§tsel, die sogar die Zeitepochen √ºberschreiten, sind einfallsreich und gut gemacht!
Auch die Remastered Edition kann sich sehen lassen (selbst nach kurzer Zeit schon! :D)! Auch, wenn die Bedienung des Spiels ein wenig anders ist, als im Original, f√ºhlt es sich immer noch genauso wie der Klassiker an! Und das in seeehr schickem HD. :D
Ich finde, das Spiel ist ein absolutes Muss f√ºr jeden, der Computerspiele mag!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033995360', 'num_games_owned': 2161, 'num_reviews': 441, 'playtime_forever': 780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1478591260}
review:
Comme trop de jeux de son temps, et encore plus lorsqu'ils √©taient sign√©s du sceau LucasArts, Day of the Tentacle est un [i]point & click[/i] aux √©nigmes parfaitement farfelues - et ce n'est pas un compliment. M√™me si la touche shift, utilis√©e comme la barre espace d'un Daedalic, nous simplifiera le travail en faisant briller certains √©l√©ments du d√©cor avec lesquels interagir, on passera le gros du gameplay √† essayer al√©atoirement un objet sur un autre, √† matraquer sa souris d'encore plus de clics que si l'on jouait √† un [i]hack & slash[/i]. Issu d'une √©poque o√π on confondait la difficult√© et l'absurdit√©, o√π l'on √©tait heureux de gaspiller des heures sur une √©nigme d√©pourvue de logique parce qu'elle allait nous faire durer plus longtemps le seul jeu que maman nous ach√®terait pour ce trimestre, Day of the Tentacle est une aventure que beaucoup feront semblant d'adorer, puis ils se reporteront sur Grim Fandango qui est encore plus [i]hype[/i]. Oui, celui qui s'est longtemps fait qualifier de "meilleur jeu du monde" n'est qu'une imposture. Sans √™tre le pire rejeton du catalogue Californien en la mati√®re, il abuse des solutions fantasques pour des probl√®mes simples. Pas le graal qu'il promet √™tre aux habitu√©s du jeu d'√©nigmes, certainement pas non plus la meilleure des occasions de s'initier au genre, il est [i]juste[/i] un tr√®s bon jeu d'aventure de la famille LucasArts, qui en a toutes les qualit√©s et tous les d√©fauts. Comme une belle bouteille de Bordeaux, il ne d√©voilera son ar√¥me qu'aux initi√©s et aux plus patients. Les autres le traverseront en [i]let's play[/i] ou le liront en [i]walkthrough[/i].

Puisqu'il n'est que rarement logique (mais √ßa lui arrive), Day of the Tentacle n'est pas plus une promenade de sant√© qu'un Fate of Atlantis. Il l'est m√™me moins. Celui-l√† a en effet la particularit√© d'√™tre un sacr√© foutoir avec une progression non lin√©aire qui peut vite perdre le pauvre gus qui aurait le malheur de croire en sa bonne √©toile. Les trois personnages jouables, dispers√©s aux trois √©poques d'un m√™me lieu, s'√©changent des objets et observent les effets de leurs actions d'un si√®cle √† l'autre. On jongle entre les enfants pour r√©soudre les √©nigmes dans l'ordre de notre choix, quitte √† tout faire de travers ou abandonner des pistes √† mi-chemin. Quel bordeI. Mais n'allez pas croire que jouer √† Day of the Tentacle n'est pas un plaisir : il est l'un de ces jeux qui procurent un sentiment d'accomplissement rare, m√™me s'il r√©compensera plus souvent la chance et l'exasp√©ration que le flair. Il suffit d'√™tre t√©m√©raire et r√©sign√©.

En tant que remake, Day of the Tentacle Remaster est un sans-faute. La mise √† jour graphique ne trahit pas le style de la premi√®re √©dition et un nouveau menu contextuel en all√®ge les interactions. Quant aux nostalgiques et aux fous qui ont envie de d√©couvrir cette exp√©dition telle qu'elle a √©t√© jou√©e par les premiers aventuriers, Double Fine leur donne la possibilit√© de basculer √† tout instant sur le jeu original, ses pixels et son interface SCUMM. Les commentaires audio finiront de rassasier les fans les plus ob√®ses ; aussi le premier jeu de la s√©rie, Maniac Mansion, est-il inclus en bonus.

Derri√®re un humour souvent gras et absurde (dans le mauvais sens du terme), Tim Schafer et sa bande ont tout de m√™me r√©ussi √† nous raconter quelques bonnes blagues qui sont dr√¥les pour de vrai, glisser quelques jeux de mot bien sentis, des p√©rip√©ties au ridicule si jusqu'au-boutiste qu'elles ne peuvent que d√©clencher le rire. Cette histoire de voyage temporel est un bon pr√©texte pour s'amuser avec des figures historiques, parodier les meilleurs romans d'anticipation ou encore provoquer des paradoxes en pagaille. C'est un voyage en Idiotie, une fresque color√©e mais cradingue, une exp√©rience dont on se souviendra longtemps, la m√©moire garnie d'assez de bons souvenirs pour en att√©nuer les mauvais. Day of the Tentacle est pareil √† une grosse tartine de gazole avec, sous trois couches de carburant, une fine peau de confiture : √ßa vaut le coup de se d√©go√ªter pour en arriver jusqu'au coeur. On l'appr√©ciera d'autant plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158905982', 'num_games_owned': 10695, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1561560070}
review:
La continuacion de Maniac Mansion traida por el capo de Tim Schafer por hacer cosas copadas como Monkey Island, que hicieron a los de LucasArts que se mearan de risa con sus boludeces le dieron pie para hacer otra joyita "Day of the Tentacle"

Toda la historia hace pie en el viejo Maniac Mansion, pero solo para tomar impulso, el doctor Fred estaba esperimentando y tiro porqueria al rio donde combirtio al tentaculo morado en un pibe re jodido y con dos brazos, y para variar el mas boludo de los protagonista lo deja libre.
Junto con nuestro nerd Bernard, viajan dos chabones mas, uno es Hoagie, el gordo metalero y la otra desequilibrada mental es Laverne una mezcla entre la sobrina del Inspector Gadget y Carlitos Tevez. 
Con esto contamos con 3 lineas de tiempo diferentes, cuando las letrinas fallan y dejan a Hoagie 200 a√±os en el pasado y a Laverne 200 a√±os en el futuro, y desde el presente Bernardo tiene que enviar huevadas para ayudar a sus amigotes para que puedan alterar la historia sin problemas.
Como si fuera Marty Mcfly, Hoagie tiene que cambiar la historia Yankee como alterar la constitucion, cambiar dentaduras para alterar el futuro y asi ayudar Laverne  que tiene que usar todo lo que le mandan del pasado para safarse de un mundo conquistado por los tentaculos.
Lo loco de esto es la linea de tiempo como Volver al Futuro que le pone una onda muy interesante.

Esta version trae un nuevo cambio visual que se hace notar, el audio esta muy bien mejorado y ademas comentamos con los comentarios de los desarrolladores.

Pasaron muchos a√±os y estos juegos estan desapareciendo con la nueva generacion de pibes que quieren todo lindo y a 1000 fps, estos eran juegos FORRRO. Por suerte hay remasterizaciones copadas como estas que te permiten resucitar estas joyitas del pasado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077203157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1477952219}
review:
I've played through this game about 5 times since the 90s and I've always really enjoyed it. The voice acting, humour and original art style were always delightful. The puzzles are mostly logical and it strikes and maintains a good balance of being challenging but not frustrating (there are no puzzles that come to mind that made me mad once I figured out the solution).

The update is mostly excellent, with clearer audio, and remastered music, as well as an old-style/new-style hotkey to toggle between the two (much like the Monkey Island SE games). All the original visuals and audio are still accessible this way. I flipped back a few times to watch certain animations throughout the game. For those familiar with the original, you may notice a few changes in the sound effects - nothing major, but you can get accustomed to the sound of tentacle suckers on the ground and overweight hotel guests falling off beds so it could be marginally jarring for purists in that respect.

The new verb wheel frees up a lot of screen space and, once you get used to it, works well. I slightly prefer the verb coin of Full Throttle/CoMI or the 'click through' style from Sam & Max, and the DotT's new one can get a little busy, but it's really not a detractor from the experience.

My only actual gripe (and it's a minor one) is with the new visuals. The classic LucasArts pixelated style was amazing at the time but this update could be considered *too faithful* in some respects. Things sometimes feel a little too simple - we have higher definition, but we really just get smoother lines with very little in the way of increased detail. This is especially noticeable on the main characters (as opposed to the backgrounds), which feel a little 'traced' at times and almost lose something stylistically from what the limited original artwork implied. This approach is understandable considering the exactness of the graphics toggle feature and the new artwork essentially being an overlay. While it was offputting at the very beginning, this became less of a concern as time went on and I got back into the story.

It's very hard to make a great game bad and, with this update, I can't say that's the case. It's extremely faithful to the original and still thoroughly lovable. There aren't too many games that have such well-written comedy and so few advenures where you seldom feel like you're doing busywork to fill time.

All-in-all, I'd strongly recommend this title as solid nostalgia for veterans or a hilarious new experience for the uninitiated. I'm extremely glad that this title has been brought up to modern standards so all its excellent qualities can be enjoyed by a younger generation (and not be lost to those who would have balked at the original, now 'retro', graphics). It really, really holds up, by any standards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198339619462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1478156837}
review:
Day of the Tentacle Remastered brings me back to the days of playing this game at my friend's house in the early 90's so naturally I'm a bit biased. With that being said, this remaster has been done tastefully so newcomers will be able to get into the game while at the same time it's able to satisfy old fans as it doesn't nix anything from the original version. All of the tiny details in the art evoke a sense of wonder and warmth, not to mention it's chock full of easter eggs. The remaster allows for the same excitement one felt yesteryear after initially booting this game up and admiring the graphics to still be there. As an added bonus there is an option to change everything back to the original graphics as well if that's more your speed so this package is truly the best of both worlds. 

Day of the Tentacle was so ahead of the times. There is a switching mechanic which allows you to alternate between three different characters who can interact and share items with each other to solve certain puzzles throughout the adventure. The characters are all completely different and equally loveable archetypes of American youth. My favorite character is Hoagie; a heavy-set Heavy rocker kid as he just screams Wayne's World to me.

My only gripe with the game is that a few of the puzzles are a bit illogical and ignore common sense however I urge you to not use a guide as it will taint the experience. Luckily these situations are few and far between and the quirky universe the game is set in allow for one to not mind back tracking a bit more than they should need to. If you want a wonderful game to play on a rainy day which will make you smile like a little kid again do yourself a favor and purchase Day of the Tentacle Remastered. You can feel the love oozing out of every aspect of both the original production and remastering. Mission accomplished Lucas Arts/Double Fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964135658', 'num_games_owned': 3837, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1580567593}
review:
A√±oranza de otros tiempos diferentes en las que la idea era comerse mas la cabeza y pegar menos tiros. Simplemente estoy encantado de volver a revivir esta experiencia que en su √©poca me encant√≥, con graficos muy mejorados y jugabilidad cambiada (si no conoceis el original, simplemente pulsar F1).

 En mi opini√≥n es una de esas peque√±as joyas que me encanta tener en mi lista para poder revivirla cuando me apetece, la historia es entretenida, muy divertida y una cosa que siempre me llam√≥ mucho la atenci√≥n lo bien conectada que est√° entre si, es decir, todo lo que hagamos tiene su sentido y su reacci√≥n, no le ocurre como a otras aventuras graficas en las que empiezas a hacer una serie de tareas y tienes que parar casi inexplicablemente por razones que casi ni las entiendes, todos los actos que hacemos son muy intuitivos y tienen su efecto muy bien argumentado.

 Es una de esas peque√±as grandes historias que a mi me atraparon de peque√±o, y aun siendo cortita, entre 4 a 5 horas de juego, a veces toca comerse mucho la cabeza y siempre es entretenida ali√±ada con humor, personajes estrafalarios y unos graficos muy divertidos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986618829', 'num_games_owned': 2977, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1659544031}
review:
Una de las aventuras gr√°ficas cl√°sicas mejor valoradas, de la escuela de LucasArts que di√≥ tantas alegr√≠as en la √©poca de los 80's y 90's a los que adoramos este g√©nero.

Se trata de la continuaci√≥n del juego Maniac Mansion (1987), si nunca lo jugamos estaremos un poco perdidos al no conocer las relaciones previas entre los personajes y su contexto, pero no es necesario para nada, de hecho el juego se esfuerza en mostrar detalles que nos hagan comprender todo con algo de profundidad. La historia es surrealista y c√≥mica a cada paso, va avanzando y alternando acciones en varios momentos del tiempo, afectando unas a otras, eso da mucho juego y es b√°sicamente la esencia de la trama, as√≠ hay momentos que rozan el absurdo mezclados con otros que nos dejan pensativos, incluso podemos jugar a su precursor, Maniac Mansion desde un PC de la mansi√≥n. La variedad de situaciones, puzzles y objetos a utilizar es bastante grande, los di√°logos bastante divertidos e incluso hay un momento que lo caracteriza como aventura (al igual que Monkey Island se caracter√≠za por su batalla de insultos).

Adem√°s esta versi√≥n remasterizada es pr√°cicamente perfecta, respeta al 100% al original, incluye un renovado aspecto gr√°fico adaptado al formato panor√°mico, una banda sonora m√°s instrumental y un sistema de control m√°s intuitivo que adem√°s evita perder espacio de pantalla (el famoso men√∫ SCUMM) y permite jugar con mando, incluso los logros est√°n bien integrados, se puede poner todo como era originalmente o mezclar por ejemplo el audio nuevo con los viejos gr√°ficos, adem√°s incluye comentarios de sus creadores y una opci√≥n marca la posici√≥n de objetos para los menos pacientes. 

En definitiva, es mi aventura gr√°fica favorita y eso que he jugado a muchas, me alegr√≥ mucho saber que saldr√≠a remasterizada para Steam y he disfrutado al revivir cada escena, simplemente me parece perfecta a todos los niveles, hecha con un esmero enorme y que sin duda marc√≥ una √©poca y es parte de la historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068508408', 'num_games_owned': 558, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1596425600}
review:
This game was my favorite point and click games in the 90s, and having found the remastered on sale I said why not.

The game plays fine, the new graphics are nice, though the old ones are rendered *better* by scummvm than this game... no point in filtering them I guess since there is better anyway.

I tried the new wheel thing, but it didn't feel right to me, especially with having to send items to other characters all the time, so I kept the old trusted bar instead,

The game is still DOTT, nothing changed about it, the intro even still has Lucas Arts instead of Double Fine, which makes me wonder how much work they really *improved* in this. It would have been nice to get some form of new content similarly to Broken Sword DC.

My main issue (which has nothing to do with the devs) is that I remember pretty much everything, so it took me about 3 hours to finish. I wish I didn't remember most of the solutions but I do :/ I guess I replayed it on scummvm too often :)

Overall, I still love DOTT, but it's not that much better than on scummvm...

Recommendation:
- If you've never played DOTT before, this is very very fine!
- If you have the original DOTT, get this on sale or stick to scummvm.

The game played well in Linux with Mesa drivers (radeonsi).

El juego es bueno,como lo fu√© anta√±o,pero por el precio que tiene sin descuento,tendr√≠a que tener cambios sustanciales.Que conste...es la segunda parte de otro juego cl√°sico(maniac mansion)por lo menos puedes jugarlo dentro de este juego en un pc a poco de comenzar (solo en ingl√©s)

Este juego lo viv√≠ hace a√±os cuando era una enana y rejugarlo ahora en versi√≥n remasterizada es una pasada. La historia est√° llena de humor, de di√°logos estramb√≥ticos con personajes peculiares y la est√©tica del juego parece sacada de un viaje a manos de un tripi. Lo recomiendo 100%!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197980483936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1478058355}
review:
Great remake, but not a lot here for people who have already played through the original release, I remembered about 90% of the puzzles. Although I received this discounted in a bundle so I'm not entirely complaining, great nostalgia trip.

However if you've never played DoTT, or if you've never played a point and click before, this is a must have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995284950', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1542728815}
review:
Bought this game from the Day of the Dev Humble Bundle.

What can i say to Day of the Tentacle Remastered? It's one of my favorite point and click adventure from the 90ies and the improved graphic made it look really pretty.
Also, i'm glad they gave us the option to use the old UI because i'm not a big fan of the tooltips on the mouse cursor when i pass over interactive objects, so that's a big plus.

If you want crazy humor and even crazier puzzle solving, this game is a must buy.

Can't wait for Full Throttle Remastered next year, if this is the quality i won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198195599785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1653340736}
review:
So I bought and finished DotT on Sunday and I must say it was a superb experience visiting it again after some years.

They did an awesome job remastering the game and I must say it greatly improves the original experience. I played DotT several times before over the years, but this version is my favorite. The new art style is gorgeous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274508951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1476823512}
review:
This is a charming point and click adventure game.
The story is great, the characters and voice acting is amazing. Funny and witty dialogues to your hearts content!
With the remastered version you are able to play the game with creators' commemts as well as revamped graphics, which are gorgeous. The art style is diffinatly unique and memorable. 
Puzzels are fun to solve and although I had to look up guides at more than one point I never though the puzzels were unfair.
Plus you can play Manic mansion the prequel to TDOTT. 2 games for the price of 1!

review: What a treat!!! I was so floored to find a remastered version of the best videogame ever made. The graphics are beautiful and the humor is as funny as ever! Even my kids are hooked. This has been and always will be, the game that I will judge all others by. I so wish that the team would get together again and give us a part 3. Gosh, I would love to see what Bernard, Laverne and Hoagie have been up to lately. This is a trip down memory lane that I would recommend over and over again! LOVE!!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1476543847}
review:
Grand classique des point&click du d√©but des ann√©es 90, le jeu est pr√©sent√© ici en version remasteris√©e.
On retrouve les graphiques cartoonesques, l'humour et les √©nigmes qui permettent encore aujourd'hui de passer un bon moment.
On contr√¥le trois personnages qui se retrouvent dans le m√™me lieu √† trois √©poques diff√©rentes. On peut √† tout moment changer de personnage (et donc l'√©poque) et donner des objets de notre inventaire √† nos deux autres camarades.
Pas de grande difficult√©, les √©nigmes sont assez logiques si on est bien attentif. Certains dialogues donnent des indices sur ce qu'il faut faire.

Un must-have pour les amateurs du genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067788711', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1693071149}
review:
Una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas de todos los tiempos. La disfrut√© muchisimo cuando la jugu√© por primera vez hace ya 20 a√±os y la sigo disfrutando hoy en d√≠a.

Un cl√°sico inoxidable esencial para la biblioteca de los amantes del genero y una excelente puerta de entrada para quienes nunca probaron juegos de este tipo!

author: {'steamid': '76561198285995361', 'num_games_owned': 1009, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1476210802}
review: The game is fantastic. It was fantastic when it was first released, and I am one of the old dudes that used to play that version for the first time. The remastered version is brilliant. The option to play from remastered to original with one *click*, is also great, since it brings back that feeling of 90s. As for the full price, I don't get it. 15 euros? Thanks for all the great stuff you have done to an already wonderfull game, but 15euros is a lot. At least this is my opinion. [b] Add to wishlist, and wait for a sale![/b] Then buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964165856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1503244231}
review:
From the pages of the US Gold product catalogue 1994-1995:

Get to grips with Day of the Tentacle(TM)

Inspired by the cartoon styles of Chuck Jones and Maurice Noble, Day of the Tentacle (TM) is the sequel to Maniac Mansion - and it's like notheing else you've ever seen, heard, or played. In one zany adventure you've got bizarre interwoven plots, a liberal dose of outrageous humour, snazzy graphics and a hundred way-out sound effects. Plus that essential element in any big-time arcade adventure - brain busting puzzles. And when you're travelling through time, the paradoxical shenanigans are endless... Or is that beginning-less?

Down at Maniac Mansion, Dr. Fred is cooking up trouble. His beloved Purple Tentacle has gotten hold of some of the mutagenic pollutants oozing out of the doctor's lab. What's more, it's grown arms, not to mention thoughts of global domination.
Enter Bernard, Hoagie, and Laverne - mankind's last chance. In the space of a single night they relese the Tentacle by mistake and spend 400 years timetravelling on the Chron-O-John to save humanity. Day of the Tentacle. It's going to grip you the second you press 'play'.
