author: {'steamid': '76561198029240214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1643999776}
review:
Ich will jetzt echt nicht der Arsch sein, aber ich muss auch mal was Negatives loswerden.

Zun√§chst einmal: Ich liebe dieses Spiel. Ich hab es vor 20 Jahren ebenfalls schon mit einem Schulfreund gespielt, und es hat mich sofort gefesselt.

Aber leider haut hier was mit STEAM nicht richtig hin - jedenfalls in meiner Version nicht. Die Zwischensequenzen scheinen alle verbuggt zu sein oder mit Delay abgespielt zu werden. Die Spielfiguren wiederholen manche W√∂rter mehrmals hintereinander, bis sich das Delay gelegt hat.

Gleich am Anfang gibt es diese Szene, wo der Hamster an der T√ºr ist und Laverne und Hoagie die T√ºr √∂ffnen. Eigentlich m√ºsste zuerst Laverne was sagen und dann Hoagie, der vorschl√§gt, dem Hamster den Kopf abzubei√üen. Bei mir war zuerst zu h√∂ren, wie Hoagie den Kopf-abbei√üen-Vorschlag macht, dann erst sagt Laverne ihren Satz, und dann sagt Hoagie denselben Satz mit dem Kopf abbei√üen noch mal. 

Ich habe das Spiel trotzdem gestartet und hatte schon im Vorspann, wo die 3 mit dem Pickup fahren, das Gef√ºhl, dass das Spiel h√§ngen bleibt bzw. Tonausf√§lle hat.

Dann hab ich bis dahin gespielt, wo der Diamant zerbricht und der Prof. Leonard auffordert, nach den Unterlagen zu suchen. Die Musik lief dann noch weiter, aber das Spiel ist total abgest√ºrzt.

Also ich hab kein Plan, ob das an STEAM liegt, aber bei mir scheint das Game total verbuggt zu sein bzw. mit den Anforderungen nicht zurecht zu kommen. Vielleicht starte ich es nachher noch mal in der "nicht remasterten" Version. Mal gucken, ob das was bringt.

Aber wenn das dann immer noch so im Arsch ist, dann war das rausgeworfenes Geld. 

Bei wem es funktioniert: Ihr Gl√ºcklichen! :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198049701098', 'num_games_owned': 3699, 'num_reviews': 832, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1475934148}
review:
The early 90's were a great time for what we now consider as classic point and click games; the retro pixelated artwork, the high level of difficulty, the need for personal critical thinking and complex problem solving. Some didn't become quite as famous as others, leaving them to fall into the void of cult-classic status, remembered by their appreciative yet relatively small fanbase. Such can be said about Day of the Tentacle, a zany point and click adventure game from LucasArts from 1993, now Remastered with smooth high-definition art and sound thanks to Double Fine Productions.

For those who're already familiar with the game, I'll go ahead and start out with the Remastered stuff. The artwork is all hand-drawn; it looks fantastic, and it's very smooth. The color is extremely vibrant, and the gradients transition so much better thanks to how far technology has come within the last two-plus decades. Not to mention the wonderful use of lighting and angles that really make the artwork stand out above many other point and click games. The interface has also been updated to modern standards, and it's much more user-friendly than the old one. You have the option to transition from the original graphics, and sound, to the Remastered ones all throughout the game; one can even mix and match if they so desire, old graphics/new sounds or new graphics/old sounds. There's also a developer commentary available to those who're interested, and bonus content in the main menu. It's an incredibly solid Remaster, in functionality, performance, and design. I noticed that some people in the review section had problems with the audio, such as stuttering or other characters voices playing. I believe that the last patch, noted as June 1st, 2016, took care of these problems as I didn't experience any audio issues whatsoever. 

Day of the Tentacle is a sequel to another highly favorable point and click LucasArts game, Maniac Mansion. At the start of the game a scene occurs where two Tentacles, Green and Purple, are standing beside a radiated river. Purple Tentacle decides to take a sip of the toxic sludge coming out from the sewers, and he begins to mutate; a mutation so inconceivable and horrific at that... he grows... arms. In his new superior form, Purple Tentacle turns into an evil genius and begins scheming to have his army of Tentacles to take over the world. One of the main characters, Bernard, is friends with Green Tentacle, who lets Bernard know of Purple Tentacle's intents. Bernard gathers his two best friends, Hoagie and Laverne, in an effort to stop the evil plot.

What follows are events of wacky cartoon mayhem and eccentric wit. The dialogue and actions of the characters are absolutely hilarious, garnering more than a few laugh-out-loud moments from me personally; which I must say is hard to achieve, I'm more of a chuckler/internal laugher. Bernard is your typical know-it-all nerd, Hoagie is a heavy metal roadie, and Laverne is just out of her mind. You'll even get to interact with the founding fathers quite a bit, and the Tentacles are as memorable as they are priceless. Beyond question, it's an adventure that you really must seek for yourself.

Probably the only downfall that one could find about Day of the Tentacle are some of its nonsensical puzzle solutions. This again stems from the 90's era of point and click gameplay, though, and it's to be expected from a title that originally launched so long ago. A guide is highly recommended, as the game really is extremely cryptic with some of its puzzles. There are also dialogue conundrums that can sometimes only be solved by performing an event and then going to talk to the person again. However, some people still like their games mystifying and complex, so if you're one of those self-punishing loonies, you'll absolutely enjoy this game in its entirety.

Whether or not you played Day of the Tentacle back in 1993, you'll absolutely love this absurd, unpredictable, humorous experience. It's one of those classic games that are up there with Grim Fandago in the "you shouldn't miss this" category. Double Fine Productions have done a bang-up job on this Remaster, and they've presented in a way that lets the original design shine through, while also making it obvious that the remake was crafted by them; if only all recent remastered editions were this good. While $16.99 CAD is pretty steep for a 4 hour adventure, grabbing this game on sale for half off is a great idea.

[h1]Rating: [b]5.0/5.0[/b] - An astonishing achievement, this game must be played.[/h1]
The Horror Network [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/28221963/]Curator[/url] | [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thehorrornetwork]Group[/url] Click for Gore

review:
[h1]Day of the Tentacle[/h1] (FSK 0 Jahre) ist eines meiner beliebtesten Adventures !!! 
Das gilt f√ºr das Original (1993) genauso wie f√ºr diese Remasterte Neuauflage.Selbst "Maniac Mansion" (Der erste Teil der in den 80gern f√ºr den Commodore 64 "C64" erschinen ist l√§√üt sich an einem Computer im Spiel spielen "Game in Game".

Die Story rund um Zeitreisen ist herrlich verr√ºckt und die Dialoge verspr√ºhen immer noch den typischen "Humor" wer hier nicht zumindest ein bisschen schmunzeln muss, ist innerlich tot.

Die Designer haben es geschafft, f√ºr die beklopptesten R√§tsel erschreckend logische L√∂sungswege zu erfinden. 
Die Erkenntnis ist fast sogar ein bisschen be√§ngstigend das der Bl√∂dsinn den man mit Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne in Gegenwart, Vergangenheit und Zukunft anstellt oft einen Sinn ergibt!

Ich hoffe das es in Zukunft auch mal eine Remastered version von "Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders" gibt.

Das Spiel ist bei Steam jetzt schon zum zweiten mal (mindestens) im 50% Angebot, 7,49 ‚Ç¨ ist f√ºr den Spa√ü geschenkt. 


Viel Spa√ü beim Spielen

author: {'steamid': '76561197986410992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 189, 'last_played': 1474324401}
review:
La entrada original pod√©is encontrarla en

https://thepastisnow.net/2016/09/20/maniac-mansion-el-dia-del-tentaculo-purpura-contra-todos/ 

Este juegazo de LucasArts de 1993 es la segunda parte del m√≠tico Maniac Mansion (1987), gracias a Double Fine, 23 a√±os despu√©s, podemos volver a jugarlo en una edici√≥n remasterizada, desde Marzo de 2016, que adem√°s nos permite ir cambiando al juego original simplemente pulsando un bot√≥n.

¬°Estos locos Edison nos han vuelto a liar! Verde ha escrito a su amigo Bernard (ese friki que parece Steve Urkel versi√≥n blanco) porque P√∫rpura, ha bebido agua contaminada y esto ha provocado el crecimiento de un par de brazos y un plan para conquistar el mundo!

¬°P√∫rpura se ha vuelto loco y ha escapado!

En  este ordenador puedes jugar a Maniac Mansion 1.

Este t√≠tulo sali√≥ durante una √©poca conocida como ‚Äúla √©poca dorada de las aventuras gr√°ficas‚Äù de la mano de Dave Grossman y Tim Schafer (qui√©n adem√°s es el fundador de Double Fine) y utiliza un sistema de verbos a trav√©s de los cuales ejecutamos acciones para ir desarrollando el juego. Este sistema, se llama SCUMM que son las siglas de  Script Creation Utility for Maniac Mansion ya que se desarroll√≥ para la primera parte de Manic Mansion.

Bernard era uno de los compa√±eros de Dave en la primera aventura en la mansi√≥n de los Edison.
Bernard, acompa√±ado de sus amigos Hoagie y Lavergne, se dispondr√° entonces a detener a P√∫rpura en su loco plan. El profesor Edison, creador de los tent√°culos, les enviar√° al pasado para detener a P√∫rpura antes de que beba el agua contaminada.

Hasta aqu√≠ parece muy f√°cil, montar en la Cron-O-Letrina (con ese nombre, no hubiera accedido JAM√ÅS) volver un d√≠a en el tiempo y acabar con ese renacuajo, pero‚Ä¶ algo sale mal y acaba cada uno en una √©poca diferente de la mansi√≥n, pasado, presente y futuro.

Este detalle es lo que realmente me llam√≥ la atenci√≥n de El d√≠a del tent√°culo, como las acciones que hacemos en las diferentes √©pocas tienen repercusi√≥n, detalles como talar un √°rbol para que desaparezca en el futuro o dar un mapa de anatom√≠a tentacular a Betsy Ross (que teji√≥ la bandera de Estados Unidos).

La Mansi√≥n Edison recogi√≥ grandes momentos hist√≥ricos.
 
Con un humor muy √°cido que te har√° re√≠r a carcajadas en tu silla comentario a comentario, situaciones incre√≠bles y gui√±os con grandes sagas de LucasArts/LucasFilm que te seguir√°n por todo el juego (desde Star Wars a Sam & Max, pasando por Monkey Island) consigue hacer que te intereses por cada l√≠nea de texto de cada personaje.

Las animaciones son muy buenas, est√©tica Cartoon, muy similar a Sam & Max, llenas de vida y color, con mucha sensaci√≥n de movimiento, consiguiendo sumergirte en el juego. Al arrancar la edici√≥n Remastered, es curioso que te da la sensaci√≥n de que el juego era as√≠, y no ha envejecido, cuando cambi√© a la versi√≥n original, pude comprobar que el juego no hab√≠a envejecido nada pero que nada mal.

Aqu√≠ os dejo algunas im√°genes en comparativa sobre la versi√≥n original y la versi√≥n Remastered, algunos de vosotros me hab√©is pedido que indique donde se pueden obtener los juegos o como jugarlos hoy en d√≠a, pues bien, este juego esta disponible en Steam en su versi√≥n remastered, y en la misma se puede alternar con la versi√≥n original.

Da igual que versi√≥n juegues, un ejercito de tent√°culos p√∫rpura va a conquistar tu ordenador.
Hace poco, encontr√© unos Alemanes, que est√°n desarrollando una secuela Return of the tentacle, que espero que aunque sea en ingl√©s, podamos probarlo con nuestros propios tent√°culos con nuestras propias manos.

En definitiva, es una aventura gr√°fica cl√°sica point and click en la que hablaremos con much√≠simos personajes y acumularemos muchos objetos que utilizaremos entre s√≠ y con el entorno (algunos nunca sabremos que utilidad tienen).

Vale vale, salid ah√≠ y jugadlo si a√∫n no lo hab√©is hecho!
 
¬øY tu? ¬øConseguiste librar al mundo del malvado plan del tent√°culo p√∫rpura?

¬°¬°¬°Nos vemos pronto!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327809', 'num_games_owned': 1111, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 476, 'last_played': 1474842955}
review:
This is my first time playing through Day of Tentacle so I can‚Äôt truly compare it to the original entirely, but the remastering looks real good to me. Double Fine even added some modern conveniences such as a hotspot button.

Now I‚Äôm usually not a fan of old school adventure game puzzles, even in old school adventure games I adore such as Longest Journey and Gabriel Knight 1 I had to keep going back to guides because I hated some of the puzzles. Day of the Tentacle surprised me in that I only had to use a guide towards the very end, most of the puzzles make sense, and if even they don‚Äôt the game gives you some hints if you explore enough to help you along. The only really bad part is one piece of pixel hunting, but if you use the hotspot button you should be fine. (I didn‚Äôt, so that‚Äôs why I hit a brick wall) It‚Äôs almost like a modern adventure game in that the game‚Äôs puzzles don‚Äôt actively hate you and fit with what you‚Äôre doing. The time travel conceit makes the puzzle solving fun and the game is quite funny. It‚Äôs overall a real good game that still holds up more than twenty years later.

review: A great game that brings back a lot of memories.  If you have some spare time, you should definitely give this game a try, because hey, who doesn't want to fight against evil tentacles that are trying to take over the world in their spare time?  It is nothing spectacular, no eye popping graphis, no ear numbing music, no larger-than-life-kill-every-alien-and-demon action - it is just a straight forward honest and quality adventure game.  I'm glad they brought this game back remastered because even just about an hour into the game I'm having a great time clicking on every possible dialogue with George Washington, Ben Franklin, and other well known Founding Fathers. Well worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017327922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5066, 'last_played': 1711150221}
review:
[h1]A brief overview...[/h1]
[b]Goal:[/b] To stop an evil triangle from taking over the world.
[b]Method:[/b] Travel back in time to the day before so that you can stop the triangle from becoming evil in the first place. However, the majority of the story revolves around blowing a large sum of money on a shopping channel product, and finding sources of electricity that you can plug toilets into.
[b]Heroes:[/b] The true heroes of this game are a metalhead who has zero book smarts, a trainee doctor who cannot be trusted with her own scalpel, and that nerd from the first game who used to be a coward. This trio receives help along the way from an ex-villain mad scientist, the founding fathers, a hamster and a dead guy.
[b]Events:[/b] This game lets you rob a vending machine, strike up conversations with historical figures, break out of jail, play numerous practical jokes on people, set off a fire alarm, throw a dead man down the stairs, throw a live woman down the stairs, cause it to rain at your own will, have way too much fun in a beauty pageant, and seek revenge on an inflatable clown.

[h1]... and now, let's get serious![/h1]
Day of the Tentacle is my favourite game of all time, so I guess ever since this remaster was announced I've had something of a positivity bias towards it. Why do I love the game so much? Wow... where do I start? The game is set in a cartoon world with fitting art and music, where slapstick humour is abundant. It is one of the few games that truly makes me feel like I am "playing" a cartoon. Combine that with everything you can expect from a LucasArts adventure game (y'know, stealing various items, getting creative with how you use items together, doing terrible things to NPCs just to get closer to your goal), and you are in for a treat.
Despite its Saturday Morning Cartoon setting, the puzzles are actually logical and very well thought out. What really makes the puzzles special in this game is its time travel element; most of the game deals with the three protagonists separated from each other in different time periods. Hoagie is stranded way back in colonial times, Laverne has ended up in a tentacle-ruled future, and Bernard is back in the present (well, the '90s). Naturally, your actions in one time period could have a direct effect on a later one. For example, Hoagie can change a significant part of American history in order to make Laverne's life (four hundred years later) much easier. See where I'm going with this?
Like I've already said, the graphics and music fit the game's cartoon atmosphere wonderfully. Even the original version of the game is fully voice acted (well, the CD-ROM version... those voiceover files wouldn't fit on the floppy disk version!) and that was a big deal back in 1993. The voice acting is done to a professional standard, and stars Richard Sanders (from WKRP in Cincinnati) as Bernard. Sound effects are typically cartoony, dialogue is well written, it's great fun exploring the mansion in three different moments in time (which is very well designed), and the characters are just amazing. I love them all.
Oh, and get this... the original Maniac Mansion (DOTT's prequel) is included and fully playable. So you're basically getting two awesome adventure games for the price of one.

[h1]What's new in the remaster?[/h1]
Those pixelly graphics from the '90s have all been redrawn - but not redesigned - so they look exactly as you remember them, except much cleaner! This has allowed artists to pay certain attention to detail that couldn't be done back when working with so few pixels; signs and other items have additional text on them now. One of my personal favourites is what the sign above the lobby door says. Also, smoother panning when the screen scrolls. Music has been digitally remastered too, for a more modern sound. Higher quality sound effects are in place, and the original, uncompressed voice over recordings have been used. The interface has been remastered too, and you can now play the game with a verb dial that has excluded the verbs considered "useless" on the item you are interacting with.
However, if you want to see the old graphics, hear the old music, or use the old interface, all of those options are there too! Unlike other remasters and special editions I've played, this one has a much more customizable experience. You don't have to use all the original settings at once or all the remastered settings; instead you can mix and match. You might want to see the new graphics, but hear the old music. Or perhaps you want pixel graphics while using the new verb dial. You can select each setting separately, letting you play exactly how you want.
When playing for your first time, you will unlock concept art as you progress further into the game and enter more and more scenes. Developer commentary is available; when starting a new game, you will be asked whether you want commentary on or off, but you can toggle it at any time in the main menu too. The Steam version also includes a great set of achievements, as well as trading cards and all the perks that come with those. Also, as can be expected in any modern computer game... [i]autosave[/i].
The first Maniac Mansion is playable like it's always been, but instead of the C64 version included with the original release of DOTT, the remaster includes the Amiga version, so the graphics and audio are notably better quality.
For newcomers, controls are displayed at the start of the game, and can also be found on the options screen (something the original didn't really have). Back when the game was first released, you were expected to read the manual. Or not. Whichever came first.

[h1]The final verdict...[/h1]
Am I recommending this game? Of [i]course[/i] I am! The only nitpick I could come up with originally was that the new sounds aren't as funny as the originals, but since then they have added an option to play with the original sound effects. The punches are punchier. The clown honk is sharper. Hoagie's belch is funny again. Awesome! And that's not all. Remastered graphics that make the game more appealing to a contemporary audience without losing the original's charm, concept art and developer commentary for the hardcore fans, and perhaps most importantly, an accessible way for new customers to get their hands on the awesomeness that is Day of the Tentacle.

[b]An excellent remaster of a most excellent game![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198015507927', 'num_games_owned': 2059, 'num_reviews': 346, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1495907956}
review:
[url=http://fabereview.blogspot.it/2016/09/maniac-mansion-deluxe.html]Recensione  Maniac Mansion Deluxe[/url]

Seguito di Maniac mansion, Day of the tentacle ci dovr√† far visita di nuovo alla famiglia Edison e alla loro casa.
Prima di tutto si, potete giocarvelo tranquillamente anche senza aver giocato a Maniac mansion (ci saranno poche frasi dove ci riporteranno all'altro gioco.)

[b]A livello personale √® il mio punta e clicca preferito.[/b]
Mi √® sempre piaciuto l'argomento del viaggio nel tempo, e vedere che in questo gioco si pu√≤ stare contemporaneamente nel passato, presente e futuro, l'ho trovato geniale.
A livello di gameplay √® abbastanza complicato, sia per gli enigmi/rompicapo demenziali tipici di Ron Gilbert, sia per il fatto che dovremmo usare 3 personaggi diversi e farci passare gli oggetti di continuo.
Comunque una cosa √® certa, non sar√† difficile come Maniac mansion (essendo uscito pure anni dopo): qui non si potr√† morire.

[b]Per quanto riguarda la trama del gioco[/b] √® abbastanza simpatica: Il tentacolo viola (apparso precedentemente in Maniac Mansion),  beve dei rifiuti tossici di una macchina, facendoli cresce delle braccia e facendolo diventare intelligente cos√¨ tanto da voler conquistare il mondo.
Il nostro compito sar√† quello di tornare indietro nel tempo di un giorno spegnendo la macchina che produce i rifiuti tossici. Ovviamente la macchina del tempo del dottor fred avr√† dei problemi, e invece che farli tornare indietro di un giorno i nostri protagonisti li faranno viaggiare nel passato e nel futuro (l'altro personaggio √® rimasto nel presente).
Quindi il nostro scopo principale del gioco sar√† quello di far funzionare le macchine del tempo.

C'√® subito da precisare che la grafica √® molto cartoonesca, i colori sono molto accessi, e momenti di comicit√† non macheranno. Esattamente l'opposto dell'atmosfera di Maniac mansion.
C'√® anche da dire che qua  l'unico protagonista che compare √® solo il secchione Bernard, gli altri due personaggi che lo accompagneranno non si sono mai visti nel gioco precedente.

Ora passiamo al piatto forte del gioco, ovvero [b]"La remastered".[/b]

Non mi garba molto l'idea delle remastered dei giochi, su alcune sono d'accordo ma sinceramente su day of tentacle... potevano evitare.
Non lo sto dicendo perch√® hanno fatto un brutto lavoro, ma perch√® con tutte le loro avventure grafiche che avevano potevano concentrarci su giochi un po' pi√π vecchi.
Comunque il cambiamento principale √® la grafica, l'hanno migliorata non mettendola a pixel, ed hanno fatto un buon lavoro.
Hanno rimasterizzato pure la soundtrack e pure li hanno fatto un lavoro pi√π che buono.
Ma sopratutto per gli appassionati del gioco ci saranno i commenti degli sviluppatori, sono veramente tantissimi e anche molto interessanti.

[b]Conclusione:[/b] Il gioco in questione come ho scritto prima √® la mia avventura grafica preferita, quindi vi consiglio di giocarla se siete appassionati del genere (anche se penso che ormai la conoscano quasi tutti).

[b]Voto 9/10[/b]

PS: [b]come nella vecchia versione sar√† possibile giocare all'originale maniac mansion.[/b] Purtroppo la lingua √® solo in inglese.
[b]Per giocarvelo in italiano provate a scaricarvi la versione classica o la deluxe su internet.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198164382571', 'num_games_owned': 1104, 'num_reviews': 422, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1473268081}
review:
Le monde (des amateurs de point'n'click) se divise en deux cat√©gories : d'un c√¥t√©, ceux qui ne jurent que par [i][b]Day of the Tentacle[/b][/i] ; de l'autre, ceux qui n'y ont jamais jou√©.

Je vais √™tre honn√™te, je n'ai pas fait l'original ([i]pas lyncher, piti√©...[/i]). En g√©n√©ral, tout remast√©ris√©s qu'ils soient, ces anciens jeux accusent leur √¢ge, surtout quand on les compare aux productions actuelles. Et pourtant... ce [i][b]Day of the Tentacle[/b][/i]-l√† - un papi de presque 25 ans, pardonnez du peu ! - n'a pas √† rougir de sa performance. Loin s'en faut ! En l'√©tat, il n'a rien √† envier aux point'n'click r√©cents. Autant dire que cette version est un franc succ√®s.

Difficile de lui trouver des d√©fauts : un gameplay certes basique pour le genre (qui a toutefois le m√©rite d'√©viter les lourdeurs), des graphismes tr√®s propres, une bande son excellente, le tout dans un univers compl√®tement d√©jant√©. Qui plaira sans nul doute aux amateurs de [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/214340][i][b]Deponia[/b][/i][/url] et autres [url=http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198164382571/recommended/255320][i][b]Edna & Harvey[/b][/i][/url]. Rien qu'un b√©mol : ici ou l√†, quelques probl√®mes infimes ([i]non, pas le pouce vers le bas, piti√©...[/i]) de synchro textes/dialogues, avec des pauses dans l'un dues √† la lenteur de l'autre. Anecdotique, en somme.

Bref, en ce qui me concerne, cette version remasteris√©e confirme le statut culte de [i][b]Day of the Tentacle[/b][/i]. Si vous non plus ne vous √©tiez pas encore pench√© sur son cas, sachez qu'il n'est jamais trop tard...

[h1]Verdict : ‚àû/5 - A sa place au panth√©on des jeux vid√©os ![/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197968322528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1472331697}
review:
Ich habe damals beide Versionen, die auf Diskette bei der nur das Intro Sprachausgabe hatte und auch die CD-ROM mit kompletter Sprachausgabe gespielt und besitze heute noch die CD-ROM mit Orignalverpackung.

DOTT ist ein Klassiker, der in keiner Sammlung fehlen sollte und bestimmt auch heutigen Generationen viel Freude beim L√∂sen der R√§tsel bereiten wird.

Absolute Kaufempfehlung! Es macht noch immer Spa√ü Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne durch Dr. Fred's Haus und die verschiedenen Zeitepochen zu dirigieren. 
Die aufpolierte Grafik der Remastered Version tut dem ganzen keinen Abbruch und wenn man m√∂chte, dann kann man die Grafik auch umschalten und Retro genie√üen. Das Gimmick, am Computer das Original Maniac Mansion zu spielen, ist noch immer enthalten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969031618', 'num_games_owned': 743, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 705, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1472837972}
review:
Big Schafer fan, but I had the guilt of never having played the original of this.

So I had the pleasure of enjoying this fantastic remaster with lots of effort put into it. 100% of the artwork has been redone, and the interface changes as opposed to the old monkey island style are ones that I much prefer.

Obviously this game is a fantastic classic adventure game with a nice little twist on the traditional conventions. Also: Funny dialogue, clever puzzles (but not too obscure), good music, and a good length.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045831583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1472647273}
review:
I used to play this game all the time as a child, but it's a sad thing you're urged to buy a digital copy; because with every new Windows release, the amount of old games you can play decreases.

Nevertheless, I'm a loyal fan.

When I started playing the game, the first thing I noticed is that the "HD remake" was not worth it. The pixelated artwork has a charm that the, honestly, cheaply redrawn HD images do not. It looks like it was drawn with Adobe Flash, and I was disappointed to see they didn't even bother to make the mouth movements fit the dialogue or improved the animations to make the new style fit. What was the point of making a remastered version. The remastered music was pleasant to listen to, though.

Anyway, I ended up playing the whole game in classic style, like you're supposed to, but even that didn't seem to be without flaws. I don't know if it's because I played this on a laptop; but certain musical cues and melodies were messed up. I know the game starts a certain melody line based on the scene playing, it looked like the digital transfer didn't go too well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056756001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1467760233}
review:
Per chi lo conosce non c'√® nulla da dire, questa Remaster √® uguale all'originale, con grafica migliore e funzionante sui sistemi moderni.
Per chi non lo conosce: √® un gioco divertente e fantasioso. Gli enigmi non sono difficili ma questo non toglie nulla al divertimento. C'√® la possibilit√† di giocare a Maniac Mansion, in inglese, con tanto di salvataggi. Approfittate e giocateli entrembi.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

For those who know him there is nothing to say, this Remaster is equal to the original, with better graphics and running on modern systems.
For those who do not know: it is a fun and imaginative play. The puzzles are not difficult but this does not detract from the fun. There is the opportunity to play Maniac Mansion, in English. You'll play both.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071986424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1603476139}
review: √® un'opera realizzata in maniera estremamente intelligente, e che ha senso di esistere: propone una grafica completamente rinnovata, cos√¨ come un‚Äôinterfaccia grafica pi√π moderna e un audio rimasterizzato. Nonostante ci√≤, il titolo permette una flessibilit√† totale in tutti i suoi aspetti, consentendo combinazioni ardite tra la versione originale e quella moderna. Sul fronte del gameplay, c‚Äô√® poco da dire: a pi√π di 20 anni di distanza, il titolo proposto da Double Fine riesce ancora a divertire, risultando impegnativo, complesso, e capace di proporre una vera sfida. La narrativa, d‚Äôaltra parte, presenta una delle storie pi√π spassose e divertenti mai viste nel genere, risultando ancora oggi veramente godibile. Considerati tutti questi aspetti, dunque, non possiamo che consigliare l‚Äôacquisto di questa edizione sia ai nostalgici, che alle nuove leve: Day of The Tentacle, lo ribadiamo ancora una volta, √® invecchiato veramente bene.

review: "Day of the Tentacle Remastered" is a very nice updating of a fine point & click adventure game.  It's a good game with some decent humor.  The only issue I had with it is that it didn't give me the last Achievement I needed for a 100% Achievement rate (even though I did it correctly):  Music Appreciation Award.  I had to do a fast run-through (about an hour and a half) to finally get it.  But, other than that, everthing was great.  It took me a bit over 9 hours for my first run-through.  So, I'd say to wait for it to be priced at $9.99 or less to buy it.  Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024982599', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1470360911}
review:
Played this game for the first time after hearing it hailed as a classic, and it deserves it -- it holds up fantastically. From the very start it's designed to get you comfortable with all the mechanics and solving away. While the solutions to puzzles may not always make the most sense, they are all hilarious. Don't read a walkthrough without trying everything first! It's worth it for the gags.

Also, unlike other 'remastered' games, this one is a REAL remastering. All the animations and backgrounds seemed to be redrawn manually to really capture the cartoony spirit. And as usual for LucasArts, the characters and voice acting are top notch. The quintessential nerd, easygoing roadie, and unhinged medical student make a great cast for this time travel adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976277892', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 459, 'last_played': 1459094829}
review:
Hach, das Spiel war Nostalgie pur! Lang, lang ist es her als ich irgendwann 1993 als junger kleiner Bub das Original spielte. Als gro√üer Fan der Lucasfilm / LucasArts Adventures habe ich seinerzeit nat√ºrlich deren erstes Adventure Maniac Mansion und den genialen Nachfolger Day of the Tentacle gespielt. Das war damals ein echt gro√ües Ding - sogar mit Sprachausgabe (ein Novum) ;)

Jetzt habe ich mich nochmals durch das Anwesen gek√§mpft und hatte viele sch√∂ne Momente, die mich an fr√ºher erinnerten. Allerdings musste ich auch ganz sch√∂n knobeln, da ich mich an die R√§tsel im Detail eigentlich gar nicht mehr erinnern konnte. Und da ich aber den verdrehten Stil von LucasArts noch kannte, bin ich auch ganz gut weitergekommen. Wer nicht viel um die Ecke denkt, bleibt hier und da vielleicht ein wenig h√§ngen. Die R√§tsel sind zwar im Prinzip nachvollziehbar, aber eben auch recht abgedreht. 

Aber heutzutage ist das ja kein Problem mehr. Wer will kann ja im Internet nachschauen, solchen Luxus gab es damals noch nicht. Und ich habe mir wirklich √∂fters die Haare gerauft, weil ich einfach nicht weiterkam. :) Empfehlen w√ºrde ich habe nicht nachzuschauen, da sonst der Flair der R√§tzel ein wenig verblast.

Technisch ist das Spiel nett gemacht, meiner Meinung nach ein zeitloser Comic Stil. Es sieht stimmig und atmosph√§risch aus (typischer LucasArts-Stil), der Sound ist ok, die Sprachausgabe klingt allerdings doch ein wenig aufgesetzt und (unter heutiger Betrachtung) teilweise nicht gut. Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle wunderbar spielbar und sieht nicht aus wie ein Spiel aus der Mottenkiste. Als netten Gag kann man - wie auch schon bei den beiden neuen Versionen von Monkey Island - jederzeit mit F1 zur alten Originalgrafik (inkl. der ganzen typischen SCUMM-Verben) umschalten. Das gef√§llt - und alle j√ºngeren Spieler k√∂nnen mal sehen, welche Grafik wir damals gefeiert haben... :)

Jedem LucasArts-Fan kann man das Spiel wohl blind empfehlen. Meiner Meinung nach ist es aber auch komplett losgel√∂st davon wunderbar spielbar und einfach auch heute noch ein gutes Adventure.

Meine Wertung: 
Grafik: 8/10
Sound: 6/10
Umfang: 7/10
Atmosph√§re: 10/10

review: I played this when it came out in the 90s and liked (not loved)it. But I remember then that I had to rely on a friend and a walkthrough to figure out a lot of the very random actions. Turns out I got older and that randomness is less fun. Still good humour and excellent 80s-ness, just less fun to play than I remembered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076200619', 'num_games_owned': 1699, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1469005846}
review:
I have very fond memories about Day of the Tentacle (DotT), back in the DOS days, Lucasarts was my favourite games company, their adventures were the best and their Star Wars games are pretty legendary in their own right. DotT is one of those games that was released when PC gained its status as superiour gaming platform. All previous adventures games still got released on multiple platforms (think Amiga etc), but not this one. It was also released on CDROM and the whole game features voice acting, pretty big deal back in the day.

And so, with rose tinted glasses I started playing this game, would it still be as good as I remembered it? Or would it turn out to be one of those classics that didn't age well, like a fine wine turning into vinegar. Well I can assure you, that none of the magic is lost. The game is still very much fun today, everything still stands, it only lost some of its freshness, but that was to be expected as it's a remaster that stays 100% faithfull to the original.

I'm also very happy that they did not change any of the graphics. When I learned that the Monkey Island series were rereleased, I was excited. Until I saw it at a friend of mine, that is when disappointment set in. They changed the graphics and the new graphics just didn't do it for me, in fact they were a big turn-off. If you never played the game before, you probably would have no issue with it, but the problem for me was that they changed too much. You could still play the original graphics, but what is the point of that? You could just as easily use ScummVM then.
This is not the case with DotT, the graphics have been retained. To be honest, the graphics had been retained as how I remembered them. There is a big difference, how we remember things is not how they really were, it's just our minds that make the memory more beautiful than it really is. In this case the remastered graphics just look like the originals with 100x Anti-Aliasing applied on them.

I was able to quickly finish the game as I still remembered a lot and the things i forgot were quickly figured out. You should not read any guides, as this will increase the enjoyment of an adventure game, the whole point is to figure these things out after all.

This game had a big impact on me as a youngster, I forgot how many things in the game I picked up in my vocabulairy and still use, though i completely forgot where they came from - this game!

Take this as you will, some guy has fond memories of an old game, the remastered version of said game is also liked by him. Does this mean it's a great game or that the guy is senile? That's up for you to decide when you're GOING BACK TO THE MANSION!

The game works flawlessly on SteamOS/Linux, the default Steam Controller setup is a bit weird, but ofcourse you can change it to your liking. Streams to the Steam Link without problems (great way to play the game btw).

author: {'steamid': '76561197971314809', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1589837952}
review:
I played this game in the 90s when I was budding gamer, and I have fond memories. I grabbed this game for $8.99 the other day basically for nostalgia. I wasn't sure if I'd actually like the game again - would I find it too silly? too easy? plain boring? BUT, it is actually a fun little puzzle game. I was cruising along for a while, half playing the game and half strolling down memory lane, and then I actually got stuck. I'll admit I've had to use google a couple times. Some of the puzzles actually make you think. My advice: click on EVERYTHING. Pick up ALL objects. Listen to what the people are saying - they often drop hints. Go back and re-explore areas - it's easy to overlook something that you thought was meaningless. As for the remaster side of things - it's perfect. The new graphics are how I remember the game looking back when graphics weren't superduperHD. The new controls are simple and easy, and the new sound is good.

All in all, this is a good remaster of a classic game. If you played this game in the 90s, I *definitely* recommend getting this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034498865', 'num_games_owned': 621, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1597502745}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game that is just amazing.

Storyline.Our story begins as 2 tentacles Green and Purple both are free from Dr Fred Edison and now planning a new life for  eachother however when purple tentacle jumps into comtaminated water he mutats and begins his plan to conquer the world its at this point Dr fred recaptures them and ties them up in his lab but Green sends a letter to Bernard for help Bernard with the help of his friends Leverne and Hoagie race towards the edison mansion once there they split up and Bernard releases both tentacles but Purple escapes. Dr Fred uses his Chron-o-John to teleport Bernard and his friends to the day before to turn off his sludge O matic machine which was responcable for purple's transformation however Dr freds fake diamond breaks trapping Leverne 200 years in the future and Hoagie 200 years in the past now its up to a unlikely truce between Dr fred and Bernard to get his friends back and stopping Purple tentacle from enslaveing the human race and conquering the world.

Gameplay.Its a classic point and click adventure where Bernard must collect items and share items with Hoagie and Leverne in order to progress combinding items and solving dialogue and phisical puzzles.

Graphics.The graphics in the game are great this remasterd version of a early ninties game is amazing it really feels like you're playing a saturday cartoon.

Sound and voice acting.Top class the sounds and the dialogue between the various charecters will leave you laughing theres is so many funny moments to mention truely a masterpiece.

Pro's.Great gameplay
         Great voice acting and sound
         Great graphics 
         Fun charecters and setting

Con's Sadly the game ends and wish its was longer


Conclusion.Should you buy this game yes if you love fun adventure games with a great story fun charecters and plenty of laughs then buy this if you dont enjoy these kind of games you are either new to gaming and missing out go get it.

Rating.9.5 out of 10

Trading card are avalible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974858281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1477327598}
review:
Great job DoubleFine remastering and porting the game to several platforms, including Linux. The remaster is extremely faithful of the original from mid 90s. It runs very smooth and it is as enjoyable as it was when I played this game for the first time more than 20 years ago.

I really wish the Double Fine guys would also remaster the Monkey Island saga (1 and 2 mainly), but I guess this is a bit too much daydreaming :)

Buy the game if you played it in your childhood. Buy the game if you haven't. You can't skip such a classic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071231587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1468589884}
review:
This one is really a must get. Normally I am a bit ambivalent about re-Makes of game classics, but this one is done quite nicely. It completely retains the original atmosphere by just redrawing the original game with a better quality (unlike the very questionable re-makes of the Monkey Island Series). 
If you never played the game back in the day and want to get into late 80's/early 90's point and click adventures, this one is it. (The steam achievements don't hurt either.) 
For those of you who haven't played the original, the story line is quite witty (although some of the jokes might escape the non-US-american players, making the puzzles a bit weird at times).

author: {'steamid': '76561197995140922', 'num_games_owned': 1409, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1468500957}
review: Sometimes, all that's needed to make an old thing good again is a bit of the ol' spit shine, and credit where it's due to Tim Schafer and Double Fine Productions for doing just that with the comical click adventure Day of the Tentacle. It was a whole lot of fun back then (the original game came out when I was a teenager) to explore the silly world they developed and I couldn't help but be amused at the myriad things you end up doing, such as getting revenge on a punch clown, seeing what really happened to Benjamin Franklin, and finding out your greatest ally in the future died thousands of years ago (trust me, everything is funnier than it sounds in-game). Plus you'll be pleased to know Day of the Tentacle's easter egg has been preserved here, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058878811', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1468001722}
review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel letzte Woche zum ersten Mal gespielt und war direkt hin und weg. 
Als Aufgabe habe ich mir gesetzt das Spiel ohne Komplettl√∂sung oder Hilfe zu spielen, um ein √§hnliches Erlebnis zu haben wie das, von dem viele berichten, die dieses Spiel in ihrer Kindheit gespielt haben.
Manche R√§tsel sind wirklich SEHR abgedroschen und ich habe auch Nachts im Bett immer √ºberlegt, wie ich denn nur die n√§chste Situation l√∂sen k√∂nnte - diese Erfahrung macht einfach Spa√ü.
Die Dialoge sind hevorragend geschrieben und ins deutsche √ºbersetzt worden. Auch die deutsche Sprachausgabe kann man gut anlassen. Wenn man Englisch sehr gut versteht, kann man auch auf Englisch spielen, aber es gibt einige Wortspiele, die man mit nur durchschnittlichen Englischkentnissen nicht versteht. Beide Ausgaben sind gut.

(Vorsicht, Spoiler): 
Zu guter letzt muss ich noch sagen, dass ich am Ende dann doch etwas hing, weil ich einfach nicht auf die Idee kam, wie man die Plastikkotze von der Decke bekommt. Die Musikanlage hatte ich zwar angemacht und davon ging sie ja halb ab, aber ich dachte ich m√ºsste irgendeinen Besenstil finden oder die Brechstange mit dem Kaugummi an irgendein anderes Item kleben, damit ich sie von der Decke kratzen kann. Ich wusste genau, was ich mit der Plastikkotze anfangen wollte, aber nicht, wie ich sie bekommen k√∂nnte. Da musste ich dann doch nachschauen :D 
Ich habe allerdings auch im Original-Modus gespielt, hatte also alle Aktionen immer verf√ºgbar und keine ausgew√§hlten Aktionen, wenn man ein Item angeklickt hat. Vielleicht h√§tte mir das geholfen, die Box umzusto√üen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974810113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1631653015}
review:
Bueno, que tengo que decir sobre este juego.

Sin duda, una obra maestra por parte de la que fue la antigua Lucas Arts.

Tema a parte, hablando sobre los gr√°ficos de la remasterizaci√≥n, puedo decir que actualmente los emuladores pueden dar unos gr√°ficos y efectos muy buenos, por tanto en este punto el juego no gana mucho. Ya en su √©poca este juego ten√≠a muy buenos gr√°ficos.
Respecto al sonido, yo lo jugu√© en versi√≥n original para MSDOS hace mucho, mucho mucho, mucho tiempo, entonces solo puedo decir que la m√∫sica es exactamente igual y los mejores efectos se consegu√≠an usando un controlador Sound Blaster Pro/16, por lo que todos aquellos que configuraban Adlib con MSDOS, perd√≠an calidad y efectos.
Pero b√°iscamente conserva los mismos, exactamente igual que con el juego original.

Es de gradecer que a diferencia del original, obviamente por norma general en todos los juegos de la √©poca, no hubiera voces en los personajes, y fuera todo con subt√≠tulos. Esto es lo que han a√±adido de nuevo.

Un punto adem√°s positivo es que conserva el hecho de que se pueda jugar al original Maniac Mansion (desde el Pc en la habitaci√≥n del hijo de Fred Edison en el presente), una caracter√≠stica que presentaba el juego original de anta√±o, pero totalmente en ingl√©s.
Por tanto, t√©cnicamente no compras un juego remasterizado, sino uno remasterizado y otro original, puesto que la versi√≥n de Maniac Mansion incrustada es la misma que la original salvando el sonido, que "simula" el sonido de Pc Speaker (solo que se oye por los altavoces de windows, por supuesto).

En cualquier caso, es un juego 100% recomendado para los amantes de aventuras gr√°ficas, tanto de hoy como de ayer.
Espero que saquen una remasterizaci√≥n de juegos como Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis, o The Last Crusade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082836719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1465305466}
review: This is how remakes should be made! I know it's different from the original, but it doesn't make me pay any attention to that. The graphics are smoother versions of the originals, with all the great hand-drawn quality and no gimmicks, and the modernized controls make playing easier and give more room to the art. Really loved this game when it first came out, really love the Remastered version now. I highly recommend whether you've played the original for days or not at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133301700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1669375116}
review:
This is one of the very best games in video game history.
I played it in my childhood and now played it again after 20 years or so. Still remembered all the the things and managed to get from start to end in under 5 houres. Usually - if you are new to this game - you probably need more than 40 houres playtime to get to the end.
Btw. there are also possibilities of playing the old 1993 version of the game via Dosbox or ScummVM. But: those few Euros it costs on steam are completely worth this new version of the game. It has very pretty reworked graphics not giving up the original style.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983794856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1468154752}
review:
Getting this remastered version of Day of the Tentacle is worth it. Not only have the backgrounds and sprites been redrawn to more closely resemble Peter Chan's original drawings and paintings, but the nutjobs working on this actually dug up all the audio tapes containing the voicework, re-digitalized them in higher quality, and then sliced and re-organized them and put them back into the game. Crazy. As in most of these Remastered game editions, you can switch to the old pixely graphics by pressing F1, which also switches you to more classical midi tunes instead of the slightly smoother music you get now.

My favorite addition, though, are the commentaries by the original team working on Day of the Tentacle. You'll get insight in how the game was made, and especially how they had to wrestle with the limitations forced on them by PC technology of the era.

It's a very lovingly done project, and while Day of the Tentacle isn't even my favorite Lucasarts adventure, I really enjoyed revisiting it like this. And if you're wondering, you can still play the entirety of Maniac Mansion inside this game!

review: Einfach geiles Remastered, wer das Spiel noch von fr√ºher kennt  wird hier nix vermissen sondern einfach nur Spa√ü haben so wie es damals war alles ist gleich nur die Grafik und die Steuerung wurde verbessert aber man kann auch zur alten Grafik und Steuerung zur√ºck schalten. author: {'steamid': '76561198060185354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1467834866}
review:
Was gibt es √ºber DotT noch viel zu sagen?
Das Spiel selbst ist ein wohlbekannter Klassiker mit sehr witziger Handlung und liebevoll gezeichneten Grafiken. Die zu l√∂senden Aufgaben k√∂nnen dann und wann etwas knifflig sein, insbesondere f√ºr √§ltere Veteranen stellen sie aber kein gro√ües Problem dar.
Die aufgeh√ºbschte Neufassung ist sehr gut gelungen. Trotz aufpolierter Grafik geht der Charme der Orginalgrafiken nicht verloren. Und wer dann und wann doch Sehnsucht nach dem Orginial-Feeling versp√ºrt, kann ja im laufenden Spiel einfach umschalten. Das ist zwar nett, f√ºr mich aber ziemlich unn√∂tig gewesen. :-D Ein n√ºtzliches neues Feature hingegen ist die M√∂glichkeit, anklickbare Bereiche sichtbar zu machen, indem man Shift gedr√ºckt h√§lt. Das erh√∂ht die Spielbarkeit doch ungemein, da man nicht mehr den ganzen Schirm absuchen muss. Die √ºberarbeitete Maussteuerung bei der man die m√∂glichen Aktionen nach einem Rechtsklick ausw√§hlen kann, ist auch gut umgesetzt und entspricht gewohntem Standard.
Wie in der Originalfassung kann man auch wieder ManiacMansion spielen. Dort wurde allerdings au√üer dem Speicher-Men√º nichts ver√§ndert, so dass der Unterschied zu DotT auf die Grafiken und den Spielkomfort bezogen noch gr√∂√üer ausf√§llt als fr√ºher. Ich denke, man muss schon alter Veteran sein, um sich diese nette Pixelschlacht noch einmal anzutun. :-D
Nettes neues Beiwerk sind die Achievements, die teilweise auf die ein oder andere Text-Perle hinweisen.

Alles in allem gibt es von mir f√ºr das kurzweilige (und auch leider viel zu kurze) Spiel eine klare Kaufempfehlung. Jeder, der witzige Click&Point-Adventures mag, sollte DotT haben!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093050932', 'num_games_owned': 1598, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1523643547}
review: Ho giocato a questo gioco sul mio Pentium 100, qualcosa tipo 20 o pi√π anni fa. Sino ad allora conoscevo solo giochi arcade o platform, per me fu una vera e popria rivoluzione. Mi si apr√¨ un intero universo con le avventure gafiche targate LucasArts -pace all'anima sua- tanto che ancora oggi rimane, per me, la migliore software house per questo tipo di giochi. Ho comprato la versione remastered praticamente al day 1, fiducioso anche del fatto che √® stato pubblicato da Double Fine. E non sono stato deluso. La DF ha fatto un lavoro magistrale, riportando il feeling del vecchio gioco alla perfezione. Spesso nei remastering viene fatto un lavoro dozzinale o vengono apportate modifiche che rendono il gioco troppo diverso dall'originale a livello di controlli, impedendo ai vecchi giocatori di ritrovare il feeling originale. Non √® questo il caso: anche se il sistema di comandi √® stato sostituito dal men√π a scomparsa, la giocabilit√† rimane pari all'originale. Anzi sono stati apportati parecchi miglioramenti: risoluzione grafica adatta ai PC odierni ma senza perdere lo stile cartonesco dell'originle, miglioramento dei men√π principali ed introduzione di contenuti extra ecc ecc. Credo di non sbagliare se consiglio a tutti i nostalgici di comprare questo gioco, √® davvero il miglior modo per godersi una vecchia gloria del passato senza dover fare i conti con i contorni pixelati e le distorsioni dell'adattamento per i monitor odierni della versione originale per ScummVM.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023055120', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1467684325}
review:
Simply a classic. While it doesn't skirt all the pitfalls of classic era adventure games (some moon logic, a few confusing answers, and lots of backtracking), it contains so much charm that it's easy to forgive its few shortcomings.

The writing is fantastic, voice acting sublime and the whole romp is simply enjoyable. You can bang it out in a day, maybe two, depending on how stuck you get. But if you enjoy adventure games at all, this deserves a play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020848508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1626385377}
review:
Ah la la, Day of the Tentacle, un classique incroyable de Lucasarts que je viens seulement de faire, en fait je n'ai pas beaucoup jou√© √† ce genre de jeu √©tant un peu trop jeune √† l'√©poque, ce genre de jeux n'√©tait d√©j√† plus √† la mode dans les ann√©es 2000, et oui j'√©tais jeune dans les ann√©es 2000 et je n'ai pas connu le Club Doroth√©e ou certaines autres merveilleuses choses mais il y avait quand m√™me Digimon, Pok√©mon et les jeux vid√©os pour se rattraper ! Souvenez-vous de la trilogie du Samedi sur M6 ? Ou de la Nintendo 64 ou les jeux ne d√©marraient pas s'il y avait de la poussi√®re dans la cartouche, d'Ocarina of Time et de son Open World (quoiqu'un peu vide du aux limitations cartouches mais passons), etc... 
Et je comprends tr√®s bien pourquoi ce jeu est devenu culte et a rendu Lucasarts ultra c√©l√®bre, tout a la classe, les graphismes sont incroyables et m√™me si simplistes, ultra vivants, avec des couleurs ultra intenses, on a vraiment l'impression de participer √† un cartoon interactif de la belle √©poque de la Warner, les Bugs Bunny, Bip Bip et Coyote, Sylvestre et Titi m√®nent l'enqu√™te, etc... ou m√™me les vieux Nickelodeon comme Hey! Arnold ou les Razmokets, etc...
La musique est elle aussi assez sympas quoique le MIDI ne m'excite plus trop en 2016 !
Des dialogues incroyables avec un niveau d'√©criture dingue, des √©nigmes compl√©tement barr√©es, j'en ai eu ras le bol assez rapidement, j'ai du utiliser une solution assez rapidement pour ne pas rester bloquer comme un con pendant 1000 ans. Un doublage incroyable et un humour devenu culte ! Petit d√©faut cependant, la fin qui selon moi aurait m√©rit√© bien plus d'attention, assez exp√©ditive et un jeu trop court !
Pour ce qui est de ce Remaster, tous ne se valent pas, mon coups de coeur va pour ceux de Square Enix, les Kingdom Hearts ont d'excellent remasters pour ne citer qu'eux ! J'aime aussi les remasters de la s√©rie Sly de la PS2 ! 
La musique est toujours la m√™me, mais les graphismes passent mieux en HD m√™me si Double Fine a eu la main un peu forte sur les filtres graphiques, du beau travail ! 
Jouez-y ! C'est un ordre ! Un des meilleurs jeux de tous les temps ! Peut-√™tre un peu trop overrated √† mon go√ªt ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198167255699', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1467996085}
review:
I absolutely loved this game when it first came out, I played it many times over the years, I've played it so many times over the years that when I purchased the remastered version I pretty much knew what I doing all the way through the game! It's not just one game though as you get to play Maniac Mansion too (a game I loved on the NES) 
This game is full of nostalgia for me as it probably is for anyone that played it back in the 90's. For anyone who hasn't played it BUY IT, it's a great point and click, although the game is slightly short (but that might be due to how many times I played it when I was younger) it's well worth the money. 
Buy it and you'll love it =]

author: {'steamid': '76561198024619791', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1559053744}
review:
A very fun cartoon adventure game.
It's a little short but there's enough there to kill an afternoon and to want to play through again to grab all of the achievements.
Might need a walkthrough on the first playthrough but try not to rely on one too heavily so you can still solve all of the puzzles for yourself and enjoy it more thoroughly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989202049', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 221, 'last_played': 1523491643}
review:
Awesome game!  This is a game I have gone back to several times over the years and it was always one of my favourites growing up!  Thank you for the trip down memory lane.

Double fine did an awesome job on the remastering of this game, and it's very interesting switching back and forth between the original while you play through - quite the transformation!  The game looks great and has never played better!

Very excited to hear that they are also remastering Full throttle (Another AMAZING game!!!).  I hope Sam and Max hit the road get's some attention as well in the future!

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198315536606', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1510023071}
review:
I've always loved DotT and this remastering is amazing. The graphics are so fun! If you want, you can always go back to Original mode and see just how much the difference is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012662812', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1679758432}
review:
I have waited ages for this game to get the special edition treatment.  I spent ages on ebay looking for the original cd-rom version which i played many years ago.  Trying to play the cd version on my windows pc was a bit of a challenge without a program to simulate the os for the game.

I remember playing this game when it was 6 or 7 3 1/2" disc back in the 90s.

So to find this old classic on steam was great news to me.  No more trying to install floppies or using a extra program to get it to run.

So having not played this game for many years, I have to say it is still good, but the game is the same as the old one, apart from sharper looking graphics.  So after a 5 break since I last played this game.  It took me 3 hours to complete, this was pretty good considering I was playing the game from memory and not looking up the walk throughs.

I think the graphics on the special edition are sharper, but I don't think they are new drawings compared to Monkey Island Lechucks Revenge.

I don't know what this is going to do to the value of my cd version of the game as DOTT was pretty rare and difficult to find, so being available on steam will probably mean peope will no longer be after the physical version.

What I do miss about the game is the copy protection quiz, something where you had to make a battery up to match the page in the 16 page manual.

I just wondering if they are going to do, Sam and Max hit the road and Full throttle special edition, both which i have on the original cd-rom somewhere

author: {'steamid': '76561198080265345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1463335122}
review: Really fun game to play, and nice to look at. I enjoyed it very much. It made me happy :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053855195', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1466767701}
review: One of the greatest point and click adventures games is back. It is short and sweet. I finished in one day (it took about 10 hours of actual game time to finish), but it felt the pefect length. The puzzles were not too easy or too tough. The voice acting is still hiliours after all these years. Pretty much everything that came out of Hoogie's mouth made me smile in not laugh outloud. The worst part about this game is that its going to be another year until Double Fine puts out Full Throttle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285237609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1465084057}
review: Very entertaining puzzle

author: {'steamid': '76561198080123161', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1467327765}
review:
For someone who really dislikes Point & Click games I liked this game overall. Since everyone was praising this classic and I never got to play it nor was interested in playing it, I struggled with buying it. In the end, I had some friggin frustrating moments , some facepalm moments and some moments, where I thought my game was broken and I was supposed to start over, which wasnt really the case, I was just stupid. The END.

I really like the voice acting (Played in english) the german subtitles, just for the heck of it, sucked. The translation was completely off, made no sense and sometimes even left out whole sentences.

Its nice to switch between the old and new graphic but for new people, the new graphic settings is pretty much the way to go! (especially the gameplay is way easier this way)
Overall, I enjoyed it. Tho it has no replay value for me personally but maybe for others.
Only reason for a replay are the achievements and some more dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965856467', 'num_games_owned': 933, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1467285701}
review: Hace m√°s de 20 a√±os ya disfrut√© jugando a esta grandisima aventura gr√°fica. Ahora con esta edici√≥n remastered he vuelto a disfrutar como un ni√±o reviviendo toda la aventura con gr√°ficos mejorados (de vez en cuando le daba a F1 para ver el aspecto del original por curiosidad). Habia puzzles de los que me acordaba y otros que me han atascado mucho, que ni me sonaban pero imagino que todo es exactamente igual que el original, claro. Al final lo he completado sin mirar ninguna guia, como debe de ser. A veces te desesperas pero ya forma parte de este tipo de juegos. Lo recomiendo mucho tanto a los que lo jugaron en su momento como a los que no. ¬°Es una aventura m√≠tica e imprecindible!

review:

Leider konnte ich mich noch weitesgehend an das Original erinnern, sodass ich weitesgehend fl√ºssig durch die Story "geschlittert" bin. Die graphische Aufarbeitung ist aber gro√üartig gemacht und wer das Original nicht kennt und auf Point&Click steht, f√ºr den ist dieser Titel ein MUSS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118281813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1466975495}
review:
[h1]DOTT[/h1]
Zu Day of the Tentacle braucht man ja nicht allzu viel sagen.

Das Remaster ist meiner Meinung nach sehr gut umgesetzt worden. Grafik, Sound und Steuerung sind aufgeh√ºbscht, verbessert bzw. vereinfacht worden. 
Alte Haudegen, die sich aber nicht mit der aufgeh√ºbschten Grafik, verbesserten Sound oder der vereinfachten Steuerung anfreunden k√∂nnen... Kein Problem! Einfach F1 dr√ºcken und schwups, macht man eine Zeitreise nach 1993 und kann DOTT mit Original Grafik, Original Sound und Original Steuerung genie√üen. Toll!

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Genau so und nicht anders muss ein Remaster aussehen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198281409829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1706090364}
review:
I first played this game when I was a child and couldn't figure it out and had my brother help me. I remember installing it on the family PC with about six floppy discs! 

I waited for a long time for this remastered version to become available and I wasn't disappointed. I love this game. Even if it's not a nostalgic trip for you, it's so much fun and so odd that you can play it loads of times and still love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996921477', 'num_games_owned': 1249, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1613862601}
review:
In meiner Kindheit habe ich regelm√§√üig die Lucas Arts Point & Click Abenteuer gespielt. Indiana Jones, Monkey Island, Vollgas und nat√ºrlich auch Day of the Tentacle, welches zu meinen lieblings Spielen geh√∂rte. Der Humor in den Lucas Arts Titeln ist unvergleichlich und gibt es kein zweites Mal. Das Remake entspricht dem Original, nur eben das es grafisch aufpoliert wurde. Wer es nostalgisch mag, kann aber auch im Spiel auf die klassische Version umschalten. Man bekommt also die Neue und alte Version in einem. 

Auch positiv ist, das hier die deutsche Sprachausgabe vorhanden ist. Viele Hersteller verzichten ja inzwischen darauf, obwohl es diese im original Spiel gab. 

Wer das Spiel noch nicht kennt, sollte es sich auf alle F√§lle anschauen, es ist jeden Cent wert!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993735213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1466776597}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093511478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 235, 'last_played': 1555880275}
review:
This is an absolutely fantastic game! Believe it or not, this was the first game I ever played when I was about 3 years old (yes, I was really that young!) on the Windows 3.5 systems, and playing this again triggered good memories about the game which started it all off for me! 

The new generation of gamers need to try this, never mind your Call of Duty bollocks. This game will make you think!!

10/10

review: Really happy to played this game again. Great remake. I hope they will (re)make more oldies like this. author: {'steamid': '76561197970312142', 'num_games_owned': 1116, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1479999633}
review:
[h1] Review Day of the Tentacle Remastered [/h1]

Hach, das Spiel war Nostalgie pur! Lang, lang ist es her als ich irgendwann 1993 als junger Erwachsener das Original spielte. Als gro√üer Fan der Lucasfilm / LucasArts Adventures habe ich seinerzeit nat√ºrlich deren erstes Adventure Maniac Mansion und den genialen Nachfolger Day of the Tentacle gespielt. Das war damals ein echt gro√ües Ding - sogar mit Sprachausgabe (ein Novum) ;)

Jetzt habe ich mich nochmals durch das Anwesen gek√§mpft und hatte viele sch√∂ne Momente, die mich an fr√ºher erinnerten. Allerdings musste ich auch ganz sch√∂n knobeln, da ich mich an die R√§tsel im Detail eigentlich gar nicht mehr erinnern konnte. Und da ich aber den verdrehten Stil von LucasArts noch kannte, bin ich auch ganz gut weitergekommen. Wer nicht viel um die Ecke denkt, bleibt hier und da vielleicht ein wenig h√§ngen. Die R√§tsel sind zwar im Prinzip nachvollziehbar, aber eben auch recht abgedreht. 

Aber heutzutage ist das ja kein Problem mehr. Wer will kann ja im Internet nachschauen, solchen Luxus gab es damals noch nicht. Und ich habe mir wirklich √∂fters die Haare gerauft, weil ich einfach nicht weiter kam. :)

Technisch ist das Spiel nett gemacht, wenn auch keine Offenbarung. Es sieht stimmig und atmosph√§risch aus (typischer LucasArts-Stil), der Sound ist ok, die Sprachausgabe klingt allerdings doch ein wenig aufgesetzt und (unter heutiger Betrachtung) teilweise nicht gut. Insgesamt ist Day of the Tentacle wunderbar spielbar und sieht nicht aus wie ein Spiel aus der Mottenkiste. Als netten Gag kann man - wie auch schon bei den beiden neuen Versionen von Monkey Island - jederzeit mit F1 zur alten Originalgrafik (inkl. der ganzen typischen SCUMM-Verben) umschalten. Das gef√§llt - und alle j√ºngeren Spieler k√∂nnen mal sehen, welche Grafik wir damals gefeiert haben... :)

Jedem LucasArts-Fan kann man das Spiel wohl blind empfehlen. Meiner Meinung nach ist es aber auch komplett losgel√∂st davon wunderbar spielbar und einfach auch heute noch ein gutes Adventure.

[b] Meine Wertung: [/b]
Grafik: 7/10
Sound: 5/10
Umfang: 8/10
Atmosph√§re: 10/10

[b] Spielspa√ü: 87% [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983436072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1559707267}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060821109', 'num_games_owned': 1214, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1460109487}
review:
A fantastic remastering of my all-time favorite point-and-click adventure game. A significant portion of my youthful gaming time was spent on LucasArts and Sierra adventure games, but DOTT was always my favorite and this version is stellar. The updated art is fantastic, the sound quality is solid, and everything ran well. I will absolutely continue to buy all of the remasters of old LucasArts adventure games if they maintain the quality that is present here and in the Monkey Island remasters.

So what if you don't have a nostalgic love of this game from 20 years ago or even a love of point-and-click adventure games? You should still play it. If for nothing else, the story and characters are entertaining enough to warrant a playthrough. Most of the jokes still made me laugh and it's just a fun world to be in.

highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063519158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1464806035}
review:
A perfect remaster for an old classic point and click game that has not lost nor its humous nor its cartoonist charm and, despite being over 20 years old appears, thanks to this remastered version, fresher and more enjoyable than lots of recent titles.
Perhaps a bit quick to solve and finish (but was it because it was not the first time I faced the different puzzles, and reminded well despite the past time?), however how pleasant to deal again with this cartoon story full of humour and funny little puzzles to solve‚Ä¶
If you played it in its original version, and remember you enjoyed it, well I would say that it is well worth the money to replay and remind the joy of it through a worthy remastered interface; and if you didn‚Äôt, don‚Äôt hesitate to try it and face with the ‚Äúhard duty‚Äù to save the world from an insane tentacle, when being characters‚Ä¶ well‚Ä¶ far from usual heroes‚Ä¶!

you also get a second game Maniac Mansion .hey we heard you like playing adventure games so we putted a adventure game in your adventure game so now you can play a adventure game while your playing a adventure game. but just so its said Maniac Mansion is one of those older first types of adventure games type so its harder and got some dead ends if you do something wrong but don't worry there are no dead ends in the main game Day of the Tentacle. but there are diffrent endings on Maniac Mansion and you can choose characters in Maniac Mansion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117869991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1465287721}
review:
A nostalgic trip with updated graphics. Played this back in the DOS-era, and it was marvellous. It's still great, although for different reasons (grasp of English and various references was a bit weaker then I reckon).

The puzzles are, for the most part, suitably coherent. There're some that seem way off base, but I guess YMMV. The humor is excellent, but that is to be expected.

I wish they did more of these games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138837554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1465138218}
review:
Ich erinnere mich daran wie ich als Kind viele Stunden mit diesem Spiel verbracht habe um alle Puzzle zu l√∂sen. Weswegen es mich sehr √ºberrascht hat, dass ich nach √ºber zwanzig jahren nur vier Stunden gebraucht habe, und dass pbwohl ich mir noch Zeit gelassen habe um mir die meisten Dialoge, die ich immer noch sehr witzig finde, zu lesen. Nat√ºrlich konnte ich mich auch noch an die meisten R√§tsel erinnern, was das ganze erheblich beschleunigt haben d√ºrfte.

In meiner Erinnerung sah die Grafik damals so gut aus wie die in der remastered Version, aber im direkten Vergleich ist der Unterschied doch enorm. 
Eine gro√üe Verbesserung ist, dass das Eingeben des Codes aus dem Handbuch entf√§lt. Vielleicht kam mir die Spielzeit damals deshalb so viel l√§nger vor.
Die Sprachausgabe ist zwar etwas h√∂lzern, was bei einer deutschen Synchro leider keine Seltenheit ist, aber die Stimmen an sich sind sehr passend und vor allem Dr. Fred klingt genau so wie ich es mir vorgestellt habe.

Nur f√ºr eine nostalgische Reise in die Vergangenheit (hehe), sind die 14,99‚Ç¨ doch recht teuer, finde ich, aber wenn es im Angebot ist w√ºrde ich den Kauf schon empfehlen. Immerhin bekommt man auch noch Maniac Mansion dazu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978266558', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1568221616}
review:
I went in to this game a little skeptical since I'd never player it at release and the design in some older adventure games has aged poorly. Turns out this is actually the masterpiece that everyone has always said it is, no nostalgia required!

After a short intro the game opens up a dozen rooms that can be explored in the past, present, and future. Most of the items in your inventory can be sent across time periods to solve puzzles, while others are done by taking actions in the past that change the future. It's easy to make forward progress and everything is rewarded with beautiful cartoony animations. The amount of detail in the visuals and audio must have been insanely expensive at the time and is a rare treat.

My biggest gripe is that eventually you'll hit the wall of not being able to make progress with no hint system or obvious direction. Why do you read a boring book to a horse to make it fall asleep? Maybe there's a joke or reference there I'm missing, but it doesn't seem to make any sense without looking it up. It's also annoying, and hopefully not intentional, that the game has 3 different sets of false teeth that could be interchangeable, but are all used for completely different solutions.

The UI overhaul works great and really streamlines problems with the old verb system. And of course you can flip between the old and new at any time to compare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036517709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1610806882}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007020521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1465134166}
review:
Played the original back in the 90s. This is perfect. I also like the F1 graphics render option so it looks exactly like it did in the 90s. I might play it though like that after this first play through, but I'm currently likely the updated graphics.

The puzzles maybe not to some peoples liking as some of them aren't logical but they are all funny and maybe because I remember most of them from back in the day, it holds a nostalgia feel.

I still say this is a must buy but it holds more to me and the people that played it back in the 90s than it might to new players.

TIP- Listen to the dialogue throughout as it will give you hints on solving the puzzles.
