author: {'steamid': '76561198044983093', 'num_games_owned': 2355, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1464965893}
review:
[h1]A perfect remaster for a nearly perfect adventure game[/h1]

This game was formative for me. Not only was it the first adventure game I played, it also introduced me to a lot of American cultural staples. And its humour helped shape mine.

DOTT is a sort-of-sequel to Maniac Mansion, an older game (which is playable inside DOTT, by the way!). Friends Bernard, Laverne and Hoagie must travel back in time - courtesy of a shoddy time machine by Dr Fred - to prevent Purple Tentacle from gaining super intelligence (and arms!) and conquering the world. Instead, our three protagonists are accidentally scattered across time - far past, present and far future - and have to both rescue themselves and accomplish their original goal.
That's a summary of the silly premise, and the game is just as silly.

How that translates in terms of gameplay is that you have three playable characters occupying the same space - a motel where the events of the game take place - but at different periods in history. You control all three, solving puzzles, sometimes affecting the future, and sending items back and forth among them via the time machine.
This all makes your typical point-and-click puzzle solving a bit more interesting, as you need to think about what all three characters need and remember what items and NPCs and puzzles each version of the motel contains.

As for this modern remaster, I'm very happy to say they did an excellent job. It is basically how we imagine the original version in our minds. The music is also remastered, but I prefer the original. Lucky for everyone, the original art and music (and interface) are included and can be mixed and matched at will. I played modern art & interface with original music.

[b]What I enjoyed[/b]
[list]
[*]Triple the playable characters, triple the puzzles, triple the inventory, etc.
[*]Cartoony, funny, and not obnoxious (you hear that, Deponia?)
[*]The remastered art is excellent, making the whole game widescreen and crisp looking.
[*]The new radial action menu is a huge improvement on the old action bar, allowing for faster play while keeping the variety of options that give you all sorts of fun dialogue.
[/list]
[b]What I didn't like[/b]
[list]
[*]This being an early 90s adventure game, the puzzles can be nonsensical sometimes - you have to apply "comedy logic" to some of them, which can get frustrating.
[*]All the things you have to do across all the characters can get a bit overwhelming sometimes and you might forget what to do next. I'd suggest playing this game in as few sessions as possible, because you will forget stuff otherwise. Maybe take notes.
[/list]

I just relived a piece of my childhood, and it was just as good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007240790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1615881762}
review:
I cannot believe my good fortune that this game popped up on my screen the moment I logged into Steam today. This (and LucasArts' Indiana Jones: The Fate of Atlantis) was my favorite DOS game of all time back in the 90's so I bought this immediately. I'm pretty sure I still have the original CD lying around somewhere. If I find it, i'll upload it in the Artwork section for the game.

Needless to say, nostalgia can be a cruel mistress, especially nostalgia from 3 decades ago. Not so in the case of LucasArts DOS games. His company's products were always ahead of their time. I personally feel that the cartoonish graphics of this game still hold up today (and they did a great job with the remastering!), and from what I remember, the puzzles in this game were not only challenging (not impossibly so) but there was a lot to do and figure out. And they were [i]interesting[/i] puzzles. I still remember how it took me forever to figure out how to get the fake rubber barf off the ceiling. Awesome! I now had fake barf in my possession! Now what do I do with that!? xD

The voice acting was also superb. Instead of always using the bland, "I can't do that." or "That won't work." kind of line when trying to figure out object combinations and placements, you are greeted with lines like, "My therapist told me I'm not allowed to play with sharp objects." followed by maniacal guffawing. These are the kinds of things that stick with you and add so much charm to this game.

So, the basics:

[quote]This game is the sequal to the 1987 game Maniac Mansion and takes place 5 years after the events of the first game. It is a single-player point-and-click adventure that originally came out in 1993. You do not need to have played the first game in order to enjoy or understand the events in this one.

Plot:

There are two living, breathing tentacles that are wandering around. Purple Tentacle ends up drinking some radioactive sludge that mutates him into having arms so he feels he can now take over the world. His brother, Green Tentacle, tries to stop him and ends up having to contact the mad scientist that lives in the mansion. Once the three main protagonists arive on the scene, the mad scientist asks for their help and convinces them to get into Port-O-Potty time machines to prevent Purple Tentacle from drinking the sludge in the first place.

Something goes terribly wrong and the three main protagonists get sent to three different points in time. The "Dude Brah", named Hoagie, gets sent about 200 years into the past to colonial America times, Bernard stays in the present and the deranged medical student, Laverne, gets sent about 200 years into the future where the world is now controlled by the evil Purple Tentacle's rule and humanity has been enslaved. All three have to work together, yet separately, in order to help each other out by sending objects back and forth to each other through the Port-O-Potty time machines. In doing so, they are not  only trying to get back to their own original timeline but also trying to prevent Purple Tentacle from taking over the world,[/quote]

The premise sounds silly but it's such a fun romp through an interactive Saturday Morning Cartoon where the humor from the 90's was at it's best (There's also a computer in the mad scientist's room where you can play the original 1987 Maniac Mansion on it, right inside this game. I do so hope they kept that in this remastered version).

This game is absolutely worth the full asking price. But if you see it on sale, snatch it up in a heartbeat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132826449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1484412111}
review:
[b][h1]Meine Review zu "Day of the Tentacle Remastered"[/h1][/b]

[b][u]Vorwort[/u][/b]
Day of the Tentacle habe ich bereits in meiner Kindheit sehr geliebt. Als ich dann erfur, dass es ein Remake geben wird war ich nat√ºrlich voller Vorfreude. Nat√ºrlich hatte ich auch bedenken, da nicht jedes Remake gut ist (Bsp.: Monkey Island 1 und 2 Special Edition: Die Spiele kann man zwar in der Retro und in der neuen Version spielen, jedoch wurde die Retro Version nicht √ºbersetzt und die Grafik der √ºberarbeiteten Version ist sehr gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig). 
Jedoch sind alle meine Bedenken unbegr√ºndet. Ich bin vom Remake begeistert!

[b][u]√úber das Spiel[/u][/b]
Day of The Tentacle ist der zweite Teil der klassischen Point & Click Reihe "Maniac Mansion" von Lucas Arts. Das Spiel punktet mit sehr viel Humor und einigen Easter Eggs. Zudem befinden wir uns in der Bekannten Pension aus Teil 1 und es gibt bekannte Charakter (Spielbare: Bernard, Nicht Spielbare: Dr. Fred, seine Frau Schwester Edna und sein Sohn Ed Edison). In diesem Remake dieses Spieles kann man zwischen der Retro Version und der neuen HD Version mit der F1 Taste wechseln. Zudem gibt es nun auch Entwicklerkommentare.

[b][u]Story[/u][/b]
Dr. Fred Edison hat die Chemikalien seiner Matsch Maschine in den Fluss vor dessen Pension gesch√ºttet. Purpur Tentakel (ein von Fred Edison erschaffenes Tentakelwesen) trinkt diese Chemikalien und Mutiert zu einem b√∂sen Wesen, dass die Weltherrschaft an sich rei√üen will. Aus diesem Grund will Dr. Fred die Tentakel (auch den guten Gr√ºn Tentakel) t√∂ten.
Bernard, Laverne und Hoagie, die gemeinsam in einer WG wohnen, erfahren davon durch einen Brief von Gr√ºn Tentakel. Zu dritt fahren sie zu Dr. Fred's Pension um die Tentakel zu befreien. Doch durch das Befreien flieht Purpur und schmiedet Pl√§ne f√ºr die Weltherrschaft.
Damit Purpur Tentakel erst gar nicht diese Chemikalien trinken kann, werden die 3 in die Vergangenheit teleportiert um zu verhindern, dass die Chemikalie in den Fluss gesch√ºttet wird. Doch bei der Zeitreise geht einiges schief und ein witziges Abenteuer beginnt...

[b][u]Steuerung[/u][/b]
Je nachdem ob man die Klassische oder die neue Variante spielt ist die Steuerung etwas anders. In der klassischen Variante befindet sich links unten die Interaktionsbox, rechts unten das Inventar. In der HD Version befindet sich das Inventar unten links, wenn man mit der Maus in die linke Ecke des Bildschirms f√§hrt. Eine Interaktionsbox gibt es hier nicht mehr. Mit dem Mausrad w√§hlt man zwischen den verschiedenen Interaktionen und mit der linken Maustaste f√ºhrt man diese aus.

[b][u]R√§tsel[/u][/b]
An den R√§tseln wurde in der HD Version nichts ge√§ndert. Dies finde ich pers√∂nlich sehr gut. Die R√§tsel sind im Grunde einfach bis knifflig. Im Spielverlauf muss man ab zwischendurch Objekte unter den Charakteren tauschen. Dies geht einfach in dem man das Chron-O-John benutzt oder das Objekt mit dem Bild des jeweiligen Charakters benutzt.


[b][u]Musik und Sound[/u][/b]
Die bekannte Musik des Klassikers ist geblieben, wurde nur etwas √ºberarbeitet. Im Men√º kann man ausw√§hlen ob man die Musik des Remakes oder die klassische Musik w√§hlen will, oder jeweils die Musik des Spieles will. W√§hlt man automatisch so hat man die jeweilige passende Musik der Versionen. 
Zudem wurde auch die alte, deutsche Synchro beibehalten. Dies ist f√ºr mich ein gro√üer Pluspunkt.

[b][u]Grafik[/u][/b]
Auch das Spiel- und das Charakterdesign des Spieles wurde beibehalten. Lediglich wurde die klassische Pixelgrafik aufgefrischt und in ein modernes HD Design ver√§ndert. So bleibt auch in der HD Version der Erkennungswert des Spieles erhalten.

[b][u]Fazit[/u][/b]
Bis auf die HD Grafik, der etwas bearbeiteten Musik und der etwas umgestellten Steuerung in der HD Version wurde an dem Spiel nicht viel ver√§ndert, auch die alte Synchro wurde beibehalten. Die R√§tsel sollten jedem Nostalgiker noch gut bekannt sein. Allgemein sind die R√§tsel nicht sehr schwierig.
F√ºr alle Nostalgiker, die das Originalspiel auf den neuen Rechnern nicht mehr spielen k√∂nnen ist das Spiel ein Pflichtkauf. Aber auch Neueinsteiger des Point & Click Genres, die z. B. die Daedalic Spiele lieben werden bei diesem Remake viel Spa√ü haben!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164151349', 'num_games_owned': 2681, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1054, 'last_played': 1464505073}
review:
[h1]An old classic that's fresher than lots of today's titles.[/h1]

[i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] first launched in 1993. I remember, because I was a teenager then and couldn't play it as my PC didn't meet the minimum requirements! This was actually the sequel to an earlier game, [i]Maniac Mansion[/i], which was released in 1987. I played [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] a few years after it came out, but did not complete it as the game's movement and controls were just too dated and clunky for me (even back then) to be bothered with. 

Playing [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] is not at all necessary in order to enjoy [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i], though those who have will definitely find greater connection to the game's characters, especially the Edison family.

23 years later, [i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i] is essentially the same as it was before, but with sleeker graphics and a more modernised interface. While the story hasn't changed, it surprisingly (or not) hasn't aged one bit either - tentacle mutates and seeks to conquer the world, and only you (and your friends) can stop him! Though straightforward, the game's charm is in its various amusing time travel locations and the weird and wonderful characters you meet along the way. This is a prime example of where [i]"it's all about the journey, not the destination."[/i]


[h1]Yays![/h1]

+ Vibrant, colourful, hi-res cartoon-style graphics.
+ Well-designed rooms, locations and scenery.
+ Fully voiced, with good voice acting for the most part. (The guy who plays Dr Fred is awesome.)
+ Interesting, memorable characters.
+ Fun, amusing story.
+ Wacky humour.
+ Clear goals.
+ Cool easter eggs. (Under "achievements".)
+ Contains a free game ([i]Maniac Mansion[/i])!
+ Puzzles are mostly enjoyable and require some creative thinking.
+ Many gameplay hours.
+ Trading cards.

[h1]Nays.[/h1]

- [url=steamcommunity.com/app/388210/discussions/0/392184522713202518/]Audio starts stuttering[/url] after a while, due to memory problems.
- Achievements remain hidden, even after the game is completed, so you can't see what you're missing.
- Some puzzles have illogical or nonsensical solutions.
- Bugs: e.g. When looking at one of the items, Laverne's voice sounds when Bernard speaks.
- No mouse command to fast-forward dialogue; instead, you have to press "." which is really inconvenient, especially when the whole point of a point-n-click game is to [i]not[/i] have to use your keyboard!
- Some counter-intuitive puzzle set-ups: E.g. For the videotape puzzle, a button which looks like the "STOP" button, is actually the "RECORD" button. Anyone who's ever used a VCR or tape recorder would know that the square symbol denotes "STOP", while the round button denotes "RECORD". 
- Hoagie's periodic belches sound absolutely disgusting!


[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

This was a hugely enjoyable experience from start to finish. Though the nostalgia factor played a part in my case, even if you've never heard of the [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] series, as long as you count yourself a point-n-click adventure game fan, this is a must-play because it just gets so many things right. Add to that the timeless plot and wacky characters, and you have yourself a game that will play just as fresh & new decades down the road.


[table]
    [tr]
        [td][u]Disclaimer:[/u] [i]Game played for free, with many thanks to my dear friend [url=steamcommunity.com/id/kflorence]KFlo[/url]. :)[/i][/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561197968300492', 'num_games_owned': 783, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1463870845}

Playtime: ~ 4h (used a guide when stuck)
Enjoyment: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980905652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2252, 'last_played': 1503910719}
review:
Odd. This remaster looks just like how I remember the DOTT game I played more than twenty years ago, which is just really nice, cartoony and hilarious. 

Using the F1 key to switch between the old and the new isn't really fair to the old game, because in those days I was playing on a 14" CRT with a resolution of 800x600 probably and every other game was looking just as crappy. My eyes and ears were also much more technologically advanced in those days, my eyes had build-in supersampling and morpological anti-aliasing.. And my ears were able to compensate totally for any missing sounds (even Baldurs Gate was fully voiced in my experience). 

Still the same old game and actually pretty short. 

Worst part are some of the achievements, that are much less about happy Adventuring and a hell of a lot more about obnoxious mischievous gaming. 

Still, it's bloody hilarious.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728166', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1464149807}
review:
[h1]Double Fine's remastered edition of [url=store.steampowered.com/app/388210/]Day of the Tentacle[/url] is all about preserving the integrity of the original version rather than offering a creative reinterpretation. Unlike the first two Monkey Island remakes, which boasted new backgrounds and updated art direction, this version remains largely intact, if only in sharper resolution.[/h1]

It is a pure pleasure to rediscover the cheerful and silly world of the game. With over two decades since my first playthrough I've forgotten most puzzle solutions and dialogues. Everything holds perfectly well today. The humor and story are unblemished, and while the game is clearly a product of its time it should still appeal to both newcomers and nostalgic old-timers.

The more creative puzzles are almost always sensible. You'll spend the first chunk of the game mainly exploring the three different time periods and then start putting things together, working on multiple concurrent threads until the big finale. Just the right amount of hints are given through dialogues to guide players. Moreover, you can't mess up or fail so playing is always an enjoyable and stress-free experience.

One of the game's main strengths is offering a substantial amount of diversity within the same location only by adding or removing 200 years. The plot introduces more than one ingenious way to swap or transport items from the different time periods and everything is just generally well conceived.

The three main characters are obviously controlled by an omniscient being (the player) since they collaborate closely without ever communicating directly with each other, often performing actions that make no sense in their specific timeline except for those on the receiving end hundreds of years apart. The game's wholly implausible setting and absurd scenario are all part of its charm.

LucasArts' original interface has always been messy, with its over-abundant action verbs that failed to add any proper value to the gameplay. For instance, there is never any need for both Open and Close commands as contextually only one of the two will ever make sense, if it were not for the game's insistence on crafting plausible sentences. This made sense in the early days of adventure gaming when players actually had to type out full commands on the keyboard, and it was a good solution in its time but it feels awkwardly dated by today's standards. I wish Double Fine had made more of an effort to streamline the UI, though its new action dial interface is imperfectly sufficient I suppose.

If I were to be picky, I'd mention some of the animation cells were poorly uprezed, with subtle alpha channel issues visible around some character edges or other animated parts. Not all background details appear lovingly hand-painted, revealing some skewed or hard edges that were not intentional in the source art, and places where the classic's limited color palette now show signs of age. The new art trades a bit of pixelated grittiness in favor of clean flat shading. The game still looks fantastic nonetheless and it is especially great to be able to finally enjoy it full screen and without the immense list of cluttered words at the bottom.

The makeover's new hot spot highlight system does not work on animated objects. It feels like a rushed job.

Day of the Tentacle was and remains one of my favorite adventure games. I still have the original odd pyramid-shaped box accumulating dust in my collection, and I'm definitely happy that Double Fine gave me an excellent reason to revisit this timeless classic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967363630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1464043198}
review:
A very weird realization just occured to me. When I was younger I thought the pixel-y graphics of the original DOTT looked as good as they look in this new Remastered edition, and every time I hit F1 I'm stunned to see how antiquated the graphics and audio are in comparison. [i]Trippy, man.[/i]

This fresh coat of paint is a welcome addition to an already perfect game. It's the exact same hilarious and zany romp I fell in love with back in 93, only prettier. I have never encountered another adventure game that I can recommend more than this. As Hoagie would say, "B itchin."

If you're an point-and-click adventure gamer that's never played Day of the Tentacle, shame on you. 

Writing a review was imperative, but now I know that I must go...[b]BACK TO THE MANSION!![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197991339675', 'num_games_owned': 1676, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1464630842}
review:
Que se puede decir de la mejor aventura grafica de todos los tiempos?? Recomendable? No. Imprescindible.
Para cualquier amante de los videojuegos es un deber obligado jugarlo.
Se ha realizado un trabajo impecable en la remasterizacion. A diferencia de Grim Fandango, con DOTT sientes que realmente estas jugando a un juego actual, pudiendo cambiar del menu clasico de acciones, a otras opciones mas actuales.
Fue uno de mis primeros juegos...y aun habiendolo jugado un millon de veces a lo largo del tiempo, lo he disfrutado como el primer dia.

C:\>
C:\>cd dott
C:\>DOTT\
C:\>DOTT\cd dott.exe

author: {'steamid': '76561197973923344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1463741571}
review: The puzzles aren't exactly intuitive but it's oozing charm and fun and brings back a lot of fond memories of the old LucasArts adventure games.  It's especially fun to seamlessly switch between remastered and original graphics/music.  A very fun game that doesn't outlive its welcome or feel needlessly padded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085415145', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1463322574}
review:
Otra clasica aventura grafica de los buenos tiempos de lucas arts. Graficos 2D, dialogos "inpasables", e inventario patoso, son algunos rastros aun presentes en la remasterizacion de las incomodas formulas usadas en las obras antiguas, pero a diferencia de la remasterizacion de Grim fandango en esta si contamos con la reescalacion a 1080 en pantalla completa y un sistema de pistas mas "practico".

El titulo en si es una historia sin casi que ningun sentido ni conclusion satisfactoria, solo un monton de personajes extra√±os que puedes hacer interactuar de distintas manera, lo cual, a la vieja Lucas arts se le daba muy bien. 

El dia del Tentaculo es 8 Superior.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981066391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1463441289}
review:
It appears as if Double Fine hasn't put as much work into this remastered version as there is in e.g. the remastered Monkey Island. The sound is not changed that much from the CDROM version, and the graphics look like it's a filter over the original pixel art. Having said that, I still recommend anyone to buy this game. It was gorgeous already in it's original version, and it's one of the best games mankind will ever know. The characters and dialogues are funny as hell and all puzzles make sense.

You haven't truly lived until you beat this game at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023003980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1584848592}
review: Brings back so many great memories.  This time I am trying to beat the game without a walk through!  I love how you can switch back to the old graphics on the fly and the game is just as funny as it was back in the day.  It's a great remaster and only $15.  What are you waiting for?  Get it!

review: This is one of those games that takes people who plays it back into the 90s feel. I am refering to those who grew up with this game. Love the remake of the graphics. Even have bonus content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970604668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1583029997}
review:
What can I say, if you are reading this you probably already know what Day of the Tentacle is and you just want to know if this is a faithful remaster.

I can safely answer YES, yes it is.  This is a great remastered version of the game which looks beautiful and the new control system works really well, however if you want to play it the way nature intended you can switch back to the old artwork and game controls effortlessly.

If you love this game you should buy this remastered version if only for the ease of playing it on a modern computer without the assistance of a third party application

author: {'steamid': '76561198070300093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1601569951}

author: {'steamid': '76561198081294899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1463392865}
review:
So one of my all-time favourite games got a remastered edition.
Is the return to a vectorized mansion worth it, for beginners and fans?

The story: You have to save the world from evil purple tentacle - as three different characters. However, while using time machines two of the group get stranded in the past and future by accident and they have to return to present first.

The original game from 1993 can be called one of the best adventure games ever made. It combined wonderful cartoonish graphics, great puzzles, loveable funny characters, wonderful music, a lot of humour and an amusing time travel story into one. 
The reboot does pretty much the same thing.
To be honest: Hardly anything has changed. There is no "Wow!" effect like in other remakes like "Ducktales Remastered". However, I am going to point out the differences...

The first change you notice is - of course - the graphics, now sharp and vectorized. This really looks great and makes the game look a bit more cartoonish without taking away the charme of the original graphics.
Also the music and sound effects seemed to have a little make-over. 
The voices are the same as in the original, so there is no re-recording.

But do the changes please you?
As I said, the vectorized graphics are very fine.
But when it comes to the sound effects I wished there was a bit more effort put into it. They seem to be selected lazily out of a small sound library. For instance: The same sound effect is used for a reception bell and a ray gun. In some sequences random cartoon sound effects, if they fit at all or not, were put in. You may find this funny but I felt that this could be done better and more careful. Also, in sequences when characters laugh or scream there's still silence which is weird in a remake/reboot.
But that's nitpicking, to be honest.

The gameplay is fine and easy enough. The difference is that there's no text field at the bottom with verbs anymore ("Use", "Look", "Talk to"...). Instead you can either use the keyboard or mouse (or both) to control the game. A click on something/somebody with the right mouse button for example shows you the actions you can do here. A pop up menu at the bottom shows you your intenvory and the other characters (time periods) to switch to.

The other differences is the bonus material: an audio commentary track starring the makers of the game (like Tim Schafer), the option to switch to original/remastered graphics, beautiful concept art from 1992, 58 achievements and Steam trading cards.
They are all nice and if you play through the game you should get most of the achievements since they're often connected to puzzles you have to solve anyway. 

Since I am German and there are probably other German-speaking users reading this: There's also the option to change to a German audio track. However, personally I prefer the English one. The German has some good chosen voices but others just don't fit, for instance Bernard (the voice actor sounds way too handsome and uninterested as Bernard, sorry). Also I'm not quite satisfied with the German subtitles. They seem to be just wrong sometimes like the translator wasn't paying attention. Here are some examples:
"awesome" -> "schrecklich" (terrible)
"sushi platter" -> "Sushi-Teig" (sushi batter)
"beef jerky" -> "Bonbons" (candies)
"That's gross!" -> "Das ist toll!" (That's great!)
So if you're German and can at least understand the English audio track then you are definitely on the inside track.

So, does "Day of the Tentacle Remastered" pay off? 
I say: Yes. It's still damn funny and entertaining, a heartwarming return to the mansion.
If you are a fan already you will certainly feel the same and also discover the bonus material and try to get all achievements.
If you have never experienced "DOTT" this is a great opportunity to try out this classic that has aged very well (including the prequel "Maniac Mansion" from 1987 which can be played inside this game!). But prepare for some sophisticated puzzles which force you to think laterally pretty much all the time. However, it's not frustrating and lots of puzzles themselves were designed in a funny way, too.

Grab your Chron-O-John and have a good time! Or three.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970404577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 385, 'last_played': 1463319179}
review:
One of my favourite games of all time. An excellent adventure game from early 90s, now remastered.

The new art style is spot-on, yet very true to its original design. The humour is still the same; clever, funny and not too over-the-top. The soundtrack still is a sweet nectar to your ears. And like the graphics, you can change it between the original and the remastered, whenever you want with a push of a button. That's pretty sweet, if you want to experience the best of both worlds. Overall, Day of the Tentacle Remastered is very well done and very entertaining, like the original back in the day. Highly recommended for all adventure game fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304165738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1479773838}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986360343', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 866, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1463310694}
review:
[b]"Well, what possible harm could one insane, mutant tentacle do?"[/b]

Beside taking over the world? Not much, but it sure is enough to get our protagonists (the nerdy Bernard, the wanna-be-rockstar Hoagie and the not-so-attractive Laverne) contact Dr. Fred Edison for a solution. 3 mobile toilets serve as time machines to take them back to yesterday where they can turn off a machine that causes pollution and is responsible for making the tentacle creatures grow hands. 

[b]"I  think I've made myself totally clear, Step one: Find Plans, Step two: Save World, Step three: Get out of my house! Let's get cracking!"[/b]

Sounds simple, but in reality, it is not! The time machines all malfunction and while Bernard finds himself in the present Hoagie meets the American Founding Fathers back in colonial times and Laverne finds herself in a tentacle-infested future where human beings are considered no more than pets.

I like how you get to explore the same mansion / inn in 3 different times. While the objects / pieces of furniture / inhabitants are different, the layout / design remain the same. In fact, it's funny how you have the same grandfather clock in all locations and you get to see the mummy guy with all three of them. The goal is, naturally, to reverse the mess caused by Edison's faulty "science experiment" so that our heroes can meet once more to go back in time again!

[b]"Bernard, float over here so I can punch you!"[/b]

I wholeheartedly agree! But LucasArts we'll not get a punch since they teamed up with Double Fine Productions to release this game once more but more than 20 years later. Similarly to the Monkey Island remastered editions they got rid of the bottom part of the screen which listed all the actions we could do (and covered a major portion of the display) and thanks to the greater resolution we do not find any pixelated characters / objects any more. I like how we can quickly change between the classic and the remastered render on the go by pressing F1.

Beside the graphical and audio enhancements we can turn on the developer commentaries. From time to time a pop-up tells us to press a button so that we can hear what they want to say: sometimes it's lots of factual information on the development and the technological limitations they had back then, at other times they compliment each other for the jokes / cutscenes / music and crack some jokes themselves. I preferred the latter to the technological mumbo-jumbo.

[b]"We may not live to see yesterday..."[/b]

Well, we get to see lots of achievements - some are very well hidden. The game forces you to look at all things and converse with all characters. Since many of these are missable you'll surely come back for a 2nd or even for a 3rd round. Oh, and in case you did not know: Day of The Tentacle is the sequel to Maniac Mansion, another oldie but goldie from LucasArts. In Bernard's storyline you can find a working PC and using it allows you to play this game! What a nice gesture and homage! And also what an annoying achievement hidden right there...

With the Monkey Island, Grim Fandango and Day of The Tentacle remastered I just need them to finish Full Throttle as well as Indiana Jones The Fate of Atlantis. There's no better pastime than replaying the classic point-and-click games on modern PCs!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967020518', 'num_games_owned': 1017, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1558824929}
review:
[H1]It's Day of the Tentacle (DOTT) for a new generation.[/H1] What this means is you get glorious HD graphics, not the tiny half screen with real estate taken up by the interactions and inventory menu, but full (wide) screen, not upscaled, but spanking new hand drawn, combined with fantastic sounding, high quality remastered audio. And for the couch gamers, full game controller support to play on your large screen TV.

The game itself needs little introduction, being one of the best among it's peers during the golden era of adventure gaming. If you've played it originally in the past, you'll remember it fondly, if you haven't, you'll get to that point after playing it. This should be in the library of anyone who enjoys point and click adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970237665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1480501412}
review: A classic point and click game well worth the money to replay, it has lost none of its charm or humour.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978997366', 'num_games_owned': 1469, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1675719545}
review: When I was a kid, I once had a demo for this game and wanted to get it ever since. I have to say, after playing through, getting all of the achievements, laughing my ass off constantly, and just smiling throughout the game, the wait was totally worth it. This is one of the best adventure games of all time, and it just shows. I love everything this game does, and I totally want older Sierra and LucasArts games to be done in this remastered style. You can also play this game's predecessor, Maniac Mansion, fully to completion, which I think is a really good touch. The fact that Les Nessman from WKRP In Cincinnati is the voice of Bernard is just a plus. I wholeheartedly recommend this game if you enjoy humor or adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971186165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1475335703}
review:
Ayssss... que hermosos recuerdos de mi infancia me trae este juego! Junto con la saga Monkey Island y otros similares de la desaparecida Lucas Arts...

Maniac Mansion y su secuela Day of the Tentacle marcaron a una generaci√≥n de ni√±os y adolescentes que nos iniciabamos por aquel entonces en el mundo de los videojuegos...

Si perteneces a aquella √©poca y jugaste a este juego, te encantar√° el remake! 

Afortunadamente en esta ocasi√≥n el remake es de verdad. Igual que se hizo con los dos primeros Monkey Island, el remake ha implicado el redise√±o de todos los graficos del juego escena por escena, personaje por personaje, animacion por animaci√≥n... se ha vuelto a grabar la banda sonora, voces de los personajes (solo en ingl√©s), etc. 

Esto no suced√≠a con otros remakes de clasicos como Grim Fandango... en cuyo caso se limitaron a ofrecer el mismo juego pero poniendole un marco al rededor de la pantalla para pasar de una resolucion de 840x600 a una panoramica... vamos, nada! 

En este caso todo se ha redibujado y se agradece aunque ya de por si los graficos de la epoca para aquel entonces estaban muy bien :)

En resumen, si eres un nostalgico de la √©poca este juego no puede faltar en tu colecci√≥n... y si no eres un nostalgico igualmente te invito a jugarlo, seguro que te encantar√°! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198041984970', 'num_games_owned': 1267, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1463069875}
review:
[i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] est l'un des jeux cultes de toute une g√©n√©ration. Comme pour un bon film, on le relance r√©guli√®rement sans peur de se lasser. Il est tellement ancr√© en moi que j'ai la solution des √©nigmes encore en t√™te bien qu'elles soient parfois tr√®s tordues.

Le remaster est excellent (il contient par ailleurs les graphismes d'origines comme pour les deux premiers [i]Monkey Island[/i]) et il est extraordinairement fid√®le et respecteux du jeu sorti en 1993 (contrairement √† [i]Monkey Island[/i]). On ne peut que saluer le travail accompli avec amour par Double Fine qui permettra de faire d√©couvrir le jeu √† une nouvelle g√©n√©ration ou de le red√©couvrir avec un plaisir non dissimul√©.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974684590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1464908248}
review:
The concept-art is burner! <3
The game itself... its Day of the tentacle, including Maniac Mansion, simply.

Fullscreen is nice and the menuhandling is very easy. Languages of voice and subtitles are configurable separately. 
They did a good work with the remake, but since I am nostalgic, I think the original pixel-graphics still have more "character". Same as with the Monkey Island remake back then. At least the new DOTT-design is much closer to the original.

DOTT is  very easy to play, since its a new-age puzzle, what means you cant die or do anything wrong (beside missing an achievement). 
If you never played Maniac Mansion and are curious what feeling it was to play an adventure back in the past, then you should give it a try. The handling may confuse you a little bit, but hey; thats how it was back then. But attention: in the old adventures like Maniac Mansion it IS possible to f*ck up the whole game by doing something wrong or even die! ;) 

Over the years it may be the fourth time I buy this game. If you never played it, you can easily spend 10 ‚Ç¨/$ for it. Its worth the money.
If you played and payed the game already, I would really think this over, if you want to spent 10 or even more  ‚Ç¨/$ again for a STEAM-game (if its worth to you to buy steam-bound games at all).

So, have fun meeting the Edison-Family (again)! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991695936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1577999488}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is one of the absolut highlights in Point&Click adventure gaming. The remastered version is absolutely true to the original (you can switch back and forth between the graphics) and it even contains the full version of Maniac Mansion, that autosaves whenever you exit it, so you can actually play it on the side. In a nutshell, you get 2 absolute classics of adventure gaming for the price of one.

If you are remotely interested in adventures, this game is a must buy. It has by far one of the best stories of any adventure out there, is essentlially consistent, super funny and the riddles are sometimes wacky, but always fair. An absolute must buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971206154', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1528225692}
review:
Foi meu 1o Adventure! Levei quase 1 ano para termina-lo. N√£o entendia quase nada de ingl√™s e fui estudando para entender as os textos e o que deveria fazer para passar de um determinado ponto.
Naquela √©poca n√£o existia walkthrough igual hoje. Tinha que terminar na ra√ßa.
Quando joguei , n√£o tinha o famoso "Kit Multimedia" com CDROM e Placa de Som. Consegui jogar apenas a vers√£o sem Voz, acho que tinha 14 disquetes para instalar o jogo .

author: {'steamid': '76561198010015996', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1657456896}
review:
"Whoa, The Pony Express."
"Ted is red, see Red Ted."
"Step one: find plans. Step two: save world. Step three: get out of my house!"
"Bernard, float over here so I can punch you."
"You know what they say: "If you want to save the world, you have to push a few old ladies down the stairs."

author: {'steamid': '76561197993461965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1585121474}
review:
This game was the first game I;ve ever played in my life. 

I used to go to my best friend house back in the day, we were just kids, and so, he had 3 games, Fury 3, Barbie modeling (his sister game) and DOTT.

Back then we didn't know any English at all, still that didnt stop us to play this masterpiece. 

The feeling of solving a puzzle was something I cannot erase from my memories. I actually remember pretty well when we solved the left hand statue puzzle, we were happy as fuck. 

I remember how badly we wanted to get Laverne out of the three, sadly we never ended the game due to being so difficult and the lack of language. 

In 2010, I solved the game by myself with the ScummVM Version, I felt so good beating the game without any guide or similar, took me a week, but it was totally worth it.

And now 2016, the Remastered version was released.'

Insta buy for me.

10/10, One of the best games of the gold era of adventure games, when devs got  inpired and let their imagination flow into their creations. (nowadays its all copy of the copy of the copy aka: Cod)

A must have in your steam collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051833438', 'num_games_owned': 6279, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1461377050}
review:
[b] Day of the Tentacle Remastered is a rerelease of one of the most beloved Point & Click Adventures ever created. [/b]

[h1]For my full review, please visit[/h1] [url=http://feedmepixels.com/day-of-the-tentacle/] Feed Me Pixels[/url]

The Remastered Day of the Tentacle has kept everything the fans loved about the original; the story, the voice overs, the music and even the animal cruelty! Giving us the same product we appreciated in 1993. Improvements were made to the graphics, the audio quality, the interface and commentary from some of the developers was added as a bonus. For those who hate all forms of change, good and bad; the game can be played with the original pixelated graphics, the verb bar, and slightly fuzzier audio.[spoiler]Even the Easter Eggs are still there.[/spoiler] 

[h1]Pros: [/h1]
[list]
[*] Beautiful art
[*] Satisfying gameplay
[*] Hilarious voice acting
[*] Excellent plot and engaging story
[*] Available over numerous platforms
[*] Added commentary for the chronically curious
[*] Smoothed out graphics and Audio that preserved the original
[*] Oh how we missed you DoTT (it's still there underneath it all, the same game)
[/list]
[h1]Cons: [/h1]
[list]
[*] Limited replay value
[*] New players can get stuck (no hint system)
[*] [strike]May not be available on Xbox for a while to come[/strike]
[/list]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1]Overall score: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†[/h1][/th]
        [th][h1]8.5/10[/h1][/th]
    [/tr]

review:
Gro√üartiges Remaster, die neu gezeichneten 2D Sprites sehen wirklich knackig und frisch aus, sind aber dennoch orginalgetreu zur alten Pixelgrafik. Ebenfalls super ist, das Quasi alles beim alten geblieben ist, alle alten R√§tsel sind geblieben ohne noch irgend einen extra schnick schnack einzubauen welcher nicht an die Qualit√§t der Orginalr√§tsel ran kommen w√ºrde, auch toll dass man die alte Syncro drinnen gelassen hat und man eine Neuvertonung in Frage gekommen ist (auch wenn man manchmal ein Rauschen bei manchen Soundfiles h√∂ren konnte, etwas mehr Sound restaurierung h√§tte nicht geschadet), Musik wurde zwar neu eingespielt, aber wie auch bei der Grafik wurde darauf geachtet dass es orginalgetreu bleibt, ich musste manchmal sogar zur Orginal version hin und her switchen (was auch mit nur einem Tastendruck m√∂glich ist, super!) um √ºberhaupt einen Unterschied rauszuh√∂ren zu k√∂nnen.

Allgemein habe ich zwar das Spiel in der Orginalfassung schon vor gut 5 Jahren durchgespielt, aber in der Zeit sind mir bis auf ein paar basic R√§tsel und kniffe doch nur recht wenig im Kopf geblieben, sodass ich f√ºr das gesammte Spiel gut 5 Stunden brauchte, h√§tte ich das nicht gehabt w√§ren es bestimmt 7 daraus geworden, und f√ºr das sind die 15‚Ç¨ es auf jedenfall wert! Kann es nur an jedem weiter empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962853797', 'num_games_owned': 390, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1462766715}
review:
First off, I am thrilled this game exists, so thank you for that. When I saw that Double Fine had plans to remake some of the old LucasArts games, this one was at the top of my list.

To date, I have played both of the Double Fine remakes (Grim Fandango and this game) and I would say that because of the original format of the game, this one has aged much better. Even with updated graphics, Grim felt a bit dated and I didn't feel the remastered version added much for me having played through the original multiple times. This game, however, I feel has greatly benefited from being remastered, much like the Monkey Island series games. The sound is crisp and clear, the scenes are beautiful and more detailed than they were before. Basically, the game has retained all the awesome of the original with the added benefit of being visually and aurally more appealing.

Bottom line, if you like point and click adventure games centered around fascinating, humorous and quirky story lines with a little bit of time travel and historical fiction mixed in, you won't want to miss this one. And if you're just feeling nostalgic for another playthrough, there is enough added value from the remastering to make the game really come to life again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124588163', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1462734174}
review: Yes, finally. Another early 90s Point & Click, that has been Remastered by Double Fine. This Game is awesome in every way you look at it. They nailed the cartoony Style, funny Characters and ridiculous Animations. Puzzles are insanely hard, you will probably need a Guide to experience the Story. This is the prime example, that the Games back then were better than they are today. You can tell right away, this Game has been made with Passion. It is a similar Remaster that has been made for the Monkey Island Series. Im happy that the Remaster didnt change that much from the Original and sticked by its Lore. If your a total Nerd, you can get DOS Box and play it how it originally was. Hopefully we have more of these coming up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082249063', 'num_games_owned': 662, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1461465329}
review:
[b]If you think I missed something in my review feel free to tell me [/b]

[h1] Day of the Tentacle Remastered [/h1] 

Day of the Tentacle Remastered is an adventure game that was originally released June 25, 1993 and now it has come back in a beautiful way. I will add a TL;DR at the end.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] 

In Day of the Tentacle you manage three different characters alongside three different timelines. Your actions will affect the future and you will be using items across the centuries to slowly advance through the game, and stop a maniacal purple tentacle who is going to take over the world and enslave humanity. 

The game has you go back and forth between different locations and slowly advance through the plot. Day of the Tentacle has plenty of humour to keep your attention, and contains a rather long playthrough for someone who has not had the opportunity to play the original.

Within the game there is a developer commentary to allows people to actually hear the developers comment upon the game as you play through it (although it does cut off the natural game so I did not use it).

[h1] Graphics/Sounds[/h1] 

Something to love about this version of Day of the Tentacle is that you have the ability to switch between the classic music and graphics or the remastered version. The remastered version has done a great job of polishing the graphics. The animations of characters doing certain objectives and the music make the game seem nostalgic and cartoonish making you appreciate how a game, even though it originally was released so long ago, is better than most adventure games we have today.

[h1] Pros/Cons[/h1] 

[b] Pros [/b] 

+ Long playthrough with enjoyable dialogue 
+ Option for remastered or classic version
+ Interesting plot and objectives
+ Three different and unique characters and three different periods of time
+ Colorful characters
+ Humorous 

[b] Cons [/b] 

- Text delay within cutscenes in certain areas (Text cannot catch up to voice)
- Slight graphical glitch (Only seen once though)

[h1] Final Thoughts[/h1] 

I am not part of the nostalgic group who played this game when it was first released however I can easily say that this game is a true achievement as an adventure game. Day of the Tentacle holds quite a long playthrough for one clueless such as myself and  I love the comedy, all the different characters, the villains, the dialogue, it's simply a good adventure game, and sadly we do not see vey much of those these days.

[h1] TL;DR[/h1] 

If you played this game in 1993 I would urge getting the remastered version if you have not already. If you never played the game, and like adventure games with comedy, try the game out. You will not regret it. There are even star wars jokes within it, there is no other way to say it than this is a beautiful game that has been remastered to shine again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054961915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1530370370}
review:
Well over a decade ago, a friend and I were chatting about this game and how cool it would be if someone released a touched up version of it. We're both huge fans of the game and have played it on numerous occasions. To say that I was excited that Day of the Tentacle Remastered was being released would be an understatement.

The graphics and sound have been enhanced quite nicely, but remain faithful to the original. You have the option to switch between the HD and classic looks, so anyone who feels ultra-nostalgic can play with the original VGA interface.

Yes, it includes the original Maniac Mansion easter egg; I haven't tackled it myself, so I can't really comment, but it's there.

For fans of the original, this is definitely a worthwhile purchase.

If you've never played Day of the Tentacle, but are into adventure / quest games, then I highly recommend that you give this a try. It's charming, funny and has quite a few brilliantly thought out puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972097915', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1458821093}
review:
For those wanting to relive the classic experience then this is a blast from the past and well worth playing. Also of note that Maniac Mansion is still available from the PC in the present with Bernard.

For new players do not expect the same humour as the Monkey Island games. It can be frustrating until you see how obvious some of the puzzles are! Stick with it and try not to abuse a walkthough when the going gets tough!

8/10 - Limited replay value but the Achievements will keep me going for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029093963', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 151, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1473593451}
review:
I  heard people saying this was better then grim fandango. Grim fandago was the only lucas arts game I had played ...  And the only  point and click game i played beside this is the fantastic the longest journey, but  i never imagined this game to be as good if not even better as those two and while a direct comparsion to the longest journet is hard i will simply say this game is very good.

Pros:
- Brilliant Sountrack
- Great humor ( perhaps even better then Grim Fandango)
- Great story
- Intersting Characters
- Puzzles 
- Art/Graphical Style

Cons: 
-i dont have any.


Lastly while the puzzles is sometimes very hard , when you figure them out they atlleast makes more sense then that of grim fandago so while i would probably give Grim fandango  close to 10/10. This game is certainly 10/10. 

If you have read this far go out and buy it , and if you get stuck dont be afraid to use some small help because the game is after my point of view very hard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013467388', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1553488441}
review:
Brividi! Emozioni! Non ci sono altre parole per descrivere quello che, per me, √® stato un gradito ritorno all'infanzia, al mio primo videogame mai affrontato da solo, durante i primi anni delle elementari! (in realt√† ci sarebbero i giochi per Commodore 64, ma ero ancora molto piccolo, attento osservatore delle gesta videoludiche dei miei genitori, e quindi non contano!)

Sul gioco, spendo poche parole: s√¨, si tratta di un'avventura grafica nuda e cruda, un pezzo da 90 del periodo d'oro Lucasarts, e s√¨, si tratta di un demenziale delirio dall'inizio alla fine, tra scienziati caffeinomani, vecchiette buttate gi√π dalle scale, mummie concorsiste, e chi pi√π ne ha pi√π ne metta. 

I pi√π critici sono soliti obiettare che il pinnacolo narrativo Lucas sia ben altrove (The Dig, Grim Fandango...), ma √® proprio questo il punto: Day Of The Tentacle, al contrario di molte sue imitazioni, non inganna il giocatore con false e trombonesche promesse, ma lo invita attraverso una lunga commedia surreale a sfondo fantascientifico dai tempi comici pressoch√© perfetti. Giocare per credere: vi sfido a non ridere alle cadute di Bernard mentre cerca di salvare il dottor Fred, o ai commenti al vetriolo di Benjamin Franklin sul quoziente intellettivo di Hoagie (anche se in realt√† tutto il lavoro di scrittura andrebbe premiato per freschezza e inventiva).

Il lavoro di restyling ha saputo ridare ulteriore giovinezza a un titolo comunque immortale: i fondali e i personaggi si presentano ora in tutto il loro decompresso splendore, nel pieno rispetto delle intenzioni originali degli autori. Se prima i pixel sembravano solo suggerire il mood cartoonesco dell'insieme, ora di suggestioni non c'√® pi√π bisogno: eccolo, questo pseudo-cartone Warner, che prorompe in tutta la sua potenza umoristica!

Discreto ed essenziale il lavoro svolto sul fronte del sonoro: anzich√© arricchire il corredo audio con una colonna sonora registrata con strumenti acustici, o comunque con delle librerie sonore pi√π moderne, i ragazzi di Double Fine si sono limitati a riprendere e rimasterizzare le musiche MIDI originali (quelle che adoperano i vecchi soundbank della Roland, se non vado errato). Non che il risultato finale sia malvagio, ma sarebbe stato interessante assistere a un lavoro di riammodernamento pi√π ambizioso anche su questo fronte.

Il doppiaggio riprende, decompressi, i file audio dei voice talent originali in tutta la loro chiarezza cristallina. A tutte le lamentele di coloro che avrebbero voluto un doppiaggio in italiano, dico: meglio cos√¨! Piuttosto che ritrovarsi con delle interpretazioni macchiettistiche e imbarazzanti (e, per piacere, non tiriamo fuori la storiella dei "migliori doppiatori del mondo", perch√© √® un ritornello che non funziona pi√π), tanto meglio riavere, nella sua qualit√† primigenia, il doppiato originale che, pur non essendo eccezionale, √® pi√π che funzionale alla natura caricaturale del gioco.

Non posso che concludere con un perentorio "prendetelo!". Prendetelo, e non ve ne pentirete. Chi l'ha gi√† affrontato, avr√† modo di rivivere un titolo fondamentale del passato videoludico in una nuova, sgargiante veste, che annulla e supera le limitazioni tecniche proprie della tecnologia dei primi anni '90. Chi, invece, ancora non l'ha fatto, avr√† la fortuna e l'onore di incontrare una gemma, un piccolo capolavoro, e di esperire un gameplay forse a prima vista lento, ma appagante e in grado di divertire, e di conoscere altres√¨ una logica di ideazione videoludica ben diversa da quella di oggi, quando poche persone, chiuse in una stanza, potevano partorire, con pochissimi mezzi, titoli in grado di fare la storia, mentre programmazione e scrittura andavano tranquillamente di pari passo, mano nella mano.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044622421', 'num_games_owned': 1536, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1596578477}
review:
Quien no recuerda esta aventura gr√°fica de Lucas Art en 1993?
Creo que es de las Aventuras gr√°ficas que m√°s me engancharon en su momento.
Hay que admitir que han hecho un gran trabajo de remasterizaci√≥n, el √∫nico problema que le veo es que a veces se cortan las voces y ves correr los subt√≠tulos.
La gran ventaja que tenemos es que en realidad tenemos los dos juegos, tanto el "original" de 1993 y la versi√≥n remasterizada.
El juego se me hizo corto. Me lo acab√© en apenas cuatro horas, l√≥gicamente porque me acordaba de la mayoria de las cosas que hab√≠a que hacer, no como 1993 que me tuve que estujar el cerebro y quedarme atascado durante dias. Pero en esta ocasi√≥n, dos horas por d√≠a han llegado.
Si eres un nost√°lgico como yo de este tipo de juegos, no lo dudes. Tendr√°s horas de entretenimiento y de ejercitar la mente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097661429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1667058651}
review:
I can understand why people may not understand why Day of the Tentacle gets all the praise it gets,it's actually pretty simple,see I got it because the original was part of my childhood and it really shows how this game still stands up today as not much of it has been changed apart from the aethestic and verbs,I mean if you want to play it how it originally looked like it there's the option for that,the reason people may not like this game is because of the fact that it's well short but in a way that gives alot of memorable moments and characters I mean none of the characters are forgettable and how you solve puzzles are actually pretty creative and amusing,if you love games from the 90's like some of the Sierra games and/or the first two seasons of the Sam and Max games then you'll definatly enjoy this plus it's short and sweet and it never feels stale,I beat I've finished it like 4 times in a row and I didn't get bored of it once...and not many games are able to do that so my verdict:

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197964432768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1688761525}
review:
This game is one of the timeless classics brought back to live, I grew up with this stuff and have pretty much played and completed all the Lucas Arts Adventure games as it is.

Bringing Day of the Tentacle back to life was and is a good idea, they kept it like the original and also feature two modes, complete oldschool and renewed GFX with sharp corners and so on and so forth.

If you played the game back in the early 90ish then it is worth to play it again for nostalgic and reasons to that they made games back then that they can not today, if new to games from that period I would recommend it as well as it stand out and is a very original and amazing game, though some of the jokes and the likes remain from the 90ish and before either way it is an experience.

I will have to give it 10 out of 10 stars for keeping it original, being able to play it oldschool as well as a more modern port to it so one has a choice as well as a crazy universe that only LA could do back in the day and to point out that most games today really has no edge to competete with what games used to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977220078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1460290528}
review:
One of the imortal classics. Awesome game if you like puzzleadventures. 
Its also a good game if you want to try an adventuregame for the first time. The puzzels are mostley logical ;)

- The new art is nice and build on the old style, it feels natural very fast.
- You also got 2 types of mouse-controls to choose from, after trying for 5 minutes i changed back to the old classic, but that is just me.
- I like the commentary, but i wish there was more. Feels rushed.
- I experienced 1 bug, when the mummy wins the contest the game sort of froze, but i could move the mouse and access the main menu without problems, so i just loaded the autosave, and everything vent fine :)

Good game! Buy it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025137198', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1460282979}
review:
I played the 'original' version of DOTT years back, and always remembered how great of a time I had playing it. Things that have always stood out is the art style, the writing in general, and the voice ating (*perfectly* cast voice actors) -- and just how amazingly all these different elements fuse together. 

This new remastered version sounds a lot better, looks a lot better -- and has all the charm that everyone remembers.
If they had an animated series that looked like this game & had its same soul...I would watch it in a second. This coming from a guy who doesn't watch TV at all!  

While this is technically a sequel to Maniac Mansion, you do not need to have played the original Maniac Mansion in order to enjoy this game. As the ultimate 'extra', however, the entire first game is 'BUILT-IN' to this one -- you find an old 'computer' in the game, which gives you acesss to it. Thus, you have the option of revisiting the first game in the series, if you so choose. I did play & finish that game years and years ago on the original NES, and while I remember really enjoying it, the story I do not recall -- but I did not feel at all lost playing Day of the Tentacle. 

Overall, I can't recommend this game any more highly. It really is one of the high-points (if not the highest) in the Adventure Game genre, and stands apart from the rest in all the ways it oozes with charm -- enough ooze to sprout two tentacle arms!

author: {'steamid': '76561198278639899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1459694843}
review: Le jeux est tr√®s fidel √† la version originale. Les graphique mis √† jours rendent le jeux fort ineresant. Il est toujours possible de jouer √† Maniac Mension. L'histoire demeure la m√™me. Refaire ce jeux 20 ans plus tard permet de se souvenir de beaucoup d'√©l√©ment √† trouver, bien heureusement pour le plaisir, pour d'autre notre m√©moire fait d√©fault. Je donne un 10/10 pour le remastered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072182182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1460177232}
review:
This game is brilliant!  I feel like I can state this with greater authority than most of the gushing reviewers since this is my first time ever playing it (the rose-tinted lenses of nostalgia can make us say crazy things, after all).  I'm so happy I never had this game as a kid; I just would have ruined it by using a walkthrough or a hintbook.  Do yourself a favor and solve all the puzzles on your own!  They're pretty fair (there's no absurd Monkey Island 2 crap going on here) and hints are dropped everywhere.

[i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i] looks great, sounds great and plays great -- and it's guaranteed to make you smile!  It's essentially a 23 year-old game, but it's worth every bit of the asking price and then some.  A real classic in every regard!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058118718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1460310866}

He jugado muchos de este genero y por lejos es el que m√°s me gusta. El poder jugar con 3 personajes al mismo tiempo, interactuar con ellos y los items atraves del tiempo le da un toque √∫nico.

Lo jugar√≠a por horas y mil veces! Los dialogos son entretenidos, el humor √∫nico. Lo recomiendo un mill√≥n de veces y un par m√°s :D

Disfrutenlo :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197961661819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1460166019}
review:
Das Spiel war ja schon l√§nger angek√ºndigt, daher freut es mich umso mehr es nun endlich in den H√§nden halten zu k√∂nnen. Da werden echt Kindheitserinnerungen wahr. Habe sogar noch da Original hier zu Hause auf CD. 
Die Remastered Version ist recht gut gelungen, wenn auch ein paar Bugs enthalten sind.
Ich konnte zum Beispiel ohne den Linksh√§nder Hammer zu haben schon den Hammer benutzen und die Zwillinge haben gewechselt. Dann h√§tte ich heute den ganzen Tag nach einer Errungenschaft den Sound daf√ºr alle paar Sekunden vorgespielt bekommen.
Die gr√∂√üte H√ºrde jedoch war das Spiel √ºberhaupt zu starten. Bekam immer wieder einen Crash direkt beim Start. Bei mir hat nur ein Update der Grafikkartentreiber geholfen.
Auf alle F√§lle ist das Spiel zu empfehlen, auch wenn ich immer noch auf den in der Schlussszene angek√ºndigte Fortsetzung hoffe ;-) 5 Sterne Minimum.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006779144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1460155482}
review:
Que decir de esta grandios√≠sima joya atemporal???

Yo que disfrut√© de todos los t√≠tulos de la √©poca dorada de Lucasarts y sus aventuras gr√°ficas, tengo que reconocer que no dud√© en pillarme las ediciones especiales remasterizadas de los Monkeys 1 y 2. Y me encantaron por el hecho de tener los comentarios de los desarrolladores...

Este sigue el mismo patr√≥n... Y si eres como yo seguramente has seguido el mismo patr√≥n:
[olist]
    [*]Te pasas el juego entero con gr√°ficos remasterizados cambiando con el F1 varias veces para hacer la obligada comparativa entre nostalgia y renueve.
    [*]Una vez te los has pasado entero, vuelves a jugarlo con los comentarios de los desarrolladores activados para enterarte de todas las cositas que hab√≠a detr√°s de esta gran joya.
    [*]Y si todav√≠a te quedan ganas, vuelves a pas√°rtelo en un SPEED RUN para intentar conseguir todos los logros haciendo cosas que recordabas de la primera vez que lo jugaste (como meter al hamster en el microondas como en el MANIAC MANSION original.
[/olist]

Sin lugar a dudas, recomendad√≠simo. NOSTALGIA RULES!!!!!

√âpico es decir poco. Jam√°s olvidar√© mis primeras carcajadas hablando con George Washington y su dentadura postiza que le dimos de repuesto... BUARNS!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995369485', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1459968167}
review: One of the better point and click adventure games, its a far better remaster than Grim Fandago. I did get stuck after the 50% mark, at which point I needed a walk through (probably lost all my brain cells). Some puzzles are very out of logic and can be solved by luck or by trial and error, other puzzles can be frustrating, but a good number of them are smart. I still prefer the Tales of Monkey Island or Hector series over this, but I recommend it to Adventure fans looking for a funny game that lets you push old ladies down the stairs. Oh and checkout Tales of MI and Hector while you're at it, thanks.

review: If you like point-and-click adventure games, and silly humour, this game is for you. I played DoTT as a kid, and am so happy to see it get a Remastered release, it's still really fun. The puzzles in the game are not too outrageous an obscure, but can still leave you scratching your head. If you know what to do, have played the game before, or are just super smart, you'll be able to get through the game pretty quick. That being said, it's well worth it to take your time and just enjoy the world of DoTT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028207956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1459709205}
review:
Avventura punta-e-clicca classica ma rivisitata in modo ottimo, consigliata per tutti quelli che non ci hanno mai giocato ed in particolare per tutti quelli che hanno giocato con Maniac Mansion (uscito ai tempi del Commodore64) di cui questo √® il seguito.
La difficolt√† non √® eccessiva ma il fatto di dover passare gli oggetti da un personaggio all'altro rende la soluzione un po' pi√π impegnativa, rispetto all versione originale non occorre andare ai gabinetti per passarseli ma basta trascinarli nell'icona del personaggio dentro l'inventario.
La grafica √® stata sistemata in modo eccellente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018711867', 'num_games_owned': 3355, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1459678117}
review:
It's amazing to see how well the game holds up after all these years. The remaster  is done as it should be, it doesn't touch the gameplay but updates everything else. Better sound, better graphics and a more fluid control. 

The game itself is a brilliant, wonderfully weird tale of time travel, tentacles and absurd gags and it is still as funny as it was 20 years ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001597265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1465686501}
review:
Oh man. Such a great game, a remastered version of an old classic wich stands amongst the games i enjoyed the most. The remastered version is absolutely beautiful, and if you prefer the old nostalgic experience you can switch between each on the fly with f-1. 

Pro's: 
* Remastered version is beautiful and stays extremely faithfull to the original. 
* Classic version's graphiqs are available.
* Great voice acting, as with the cd-rom version of the game.
* Game holds up well to the test of time. Even without the nostalgia goggles, this is a great game.
* Classic maniac mansion game available from within the game.
* Smart puzzles and humor.
* Charming.

Negatives: 

* Game is short if you know what to do.
* Might be expansive to people who are not aware of the game from back in the days. If that is the case, wait for a sale if you must.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971495933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1459012263}
review: Well, I guess there isn't much to say. It's Day of the Tentacle - one of the best and funniest adventure games ever made, remastered. Might not be as enjoyable to totally new players but I've liked it since the original release 1993. The remake is a solid homage to the classic. It even has in-built Maniac Mansion in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985827660', 'num_games_owned': 1670, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1644440129}
review:
One of my favorite games of my childhood, and a great example of how a remastered game should be. It also includes Maniac Mansion (my all time favorite adventure game), but unfortunately unremastered and without save game option (you must use different saves in DOTT in order to have more than one MM saved state, a real shame considering that MM has four different endings depending on what kids you choose and/or what you do ingame). Anyway, the point is that they did a great job remastering this masterpiece and worth every penny it costs. Thank you Double Fine, from the bottom of my heart.

EDIT: I just realized that they've fixed the MM savegame system issue. Now are separate things, so MM saves no longer depend on DOTT saves. Better yet, now you have multiple-save slots plus the autosave system. Now it's just... PERFECT.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276738663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1459023197}

Nach knapp drei Stunden spielen war ich durch. Geschockt war ich denn ich hab nicht mitbekommen wie die Zeit vergangen ist. Alles in allem wurde hier etwas richtig gutes gemacht, ein altes Klassiker-Spiel, was man einfach haben muss, neu aufgesetzt ohne das Ver√§nderungen vorgenommen wurden oder "Verbesserungen", die den Flair zerst√∂ren w√ºrden. Die 10‚Ç¨ ist das Spiel auf jeden fall wert! review: Nost√°lgicos y amantes de las aventuras gr√°ficas, poder volver a disfrutar de este juegazo pero a un nivel gr√°fico un poco m√°s acorde con el d√≠a de hoy es una gozada. Y para aquellos que no lo jugaron, es una buena oportunidad para conocer un juego que rompi√≥ moldes dentro del g√©nero. Adem√°s, si eres de los que prefer√≠an la versi√≥n antigua, s√≥lo con pulsar una tecla durante el juego, cambias entre ambas versiones.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972364092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1460899562}
review:
DOTT is probably one of Lucasarts' finest adventures. I have so many fond memories of playing this game way back in the day on my dad's PC.

So, how is the remastered version, you wonder? In one word: perfect. I like the remastered art and the improved music (basically better instrument samples). The art is in a higher resolution and keeps all of the design and style of the originals art intact. This is nothing like the Monkey Island 1 and 2 remasters. The optional commentary is interesting and integrated well into the game. As was promised, you really can mix and match options to play the game in the way you prefer. Want the old graphics, interface and sound? No problem!

I heartily recommend DOTT Remastered. This is how you remaster a classic adventure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011263543', 'num_games_owned': 2351, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 461, 'last_played': 1459988302}
review:
TIm shaffer and Ron gilbert are two of my favorite people of all time. The great lucas arts Point click adventure games from this generation will always hold a dear place in my heart. This is a wonderful remastering of a fantastic adventure that is sure to make you laugh and be extremely confused. I highly reccomend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971168490', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1459442099}
review:
For me the original Day of the Tentacle (sometimes called Manic Mansion 2) was the best point and click adventure game of the 90's; with the second best being Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis or the Curse of Monkey Island, or wait Beneath a Steel Sky was great too.. man there were so many great games in the 90's.  

Much of the plot and steps needed in the puzzles came flooding back as soon as I started playing, but for those not aware or familiar with the original should expect mind bending puzzles but a good and enjoyable time with a lot of laughs.  
The game doesn't hold your hand like modern titles.  You'll need to think on wild tangents.. How to get George Washington to cut down a kumkuat tree for you?.. of course paint it red, he likes cutting down cherry trees (apparently).

This remastered version of the game is faithful to the original even down to the playable version of Maniac Mansion hidden inside.  I never completed the "enhanced" PC version of Maniac Mansion which I got for a birthday in the late 80's; but during my DotT playthough have finally completed it. 

You could probably still find walkthroughs of the game online if needed and blast your way though the entire game in 2 hours.  But I'd say stay clear of the walkthroughs unless you get completely stuck.  It took me about 7 hours to complete DotT and Manic Mansion.

This trip down memory lane was easily worth the price of the game, but even for new players I would recommend it.

More fun than a jump-suit full of weasels. 9/10
