author: {'steamid': '76561198003272012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1709415391}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is a great point and click game made by LucasArts. It fits into the same category of the original Monkey Island series. The remake is extremely great, especially the graphics. If you enjoyed the special edition of Monkey Island then this game I would highly recommend. Here is a list about the characteristics of the remake.

A. Gameplay - The gameplay is exactly the same as original. A puzzle to solve, decide what you need to get or do. Try to execute your decision, works or doesn't work.
B. Death - LucasArts games usually don't allow you to die like a first person shooter. If you don't solve the puzzle that fast, then no big deal. Just try something different with the item or action.
C. Humor - There is much humor in this game that ranges from the 90s, silly actions in some spots, and ridiculous dialogue.
D. Time - This game can be won in a single day or less if you already know how to solve the puzzles. I played it hundreds of times when I was a kid so remembering the puzzles from the past made me win the game in about 1 day. If you are new and have a difficult time or if you hit a roadblock you can save and come back.
E. Graphics - The remake turns the pixelated look into a great cartoon feel. The cartoon feel is smooth and nice.
F. Achievements - The remake has some silly achievements that you can get. Some of them just make you laugh.

Overall, the remake is great. I may be a tad biased because I loved this game as a kid but for the newer generation of players it can still be a laugh. Some jokes the younger generation may not get but it is still great fun.

review: I have such positive nostalgia for this game. It was one of the first PC games I ever played when I was a kid and getting to play it again 20 years later is so special to me. Everything is just how I remembered it; the updated art looks great! My illustraion instructor from my school actually helped remaster some of the animations which is pretty cool. I love the Monkey Island references; those were something I didn't pick up on when I was younger, even though I later went on to play that seires. If you don't like story /puzzle driven point and click adventure games, this may not be your thing but I love love love this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990262691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1586754564}
review:
"Viajes por el tiempo, cient√≠ficos locos, tent√°culos, hamsters criogenizados, los padres de la patria, tres personajes jugables; Day of the Tentacle (DoTT a partir de ahora) lo tiene todo.

Esta es la continuaci√≥n de Maniac Mansion, la aventura gr√°fica creada por Ron Gilbert y Gary Winnick en 1987. Cinco a√±os despu√©s fueron Dave Grossman y Tim Schafer quienes tomaron la posta y cambiaron radicalmente la esencia de la saga.

En Maniac Mansion pod√≠amos elegir a los personajes; en DoTT ya est√°n preseleccionados, algo que permiti√≥ a los escritores poder crear una historia mucho m√°s desarrollada y sin igual.

Pero ya basta de comparar, hablemos de DoTT haciendo de cuenta que estamos en 1993...."

Review completa en: http://www.checkpointvg.com/?page_id=7787

Dann ein Tag sp√§ter war hier in Steam die Remstered Edition .
Ich wusste nicht das es Remaster wird deso Gl√ºcklicher war ich das ich das gesehen habe also nicht lange √ºberlegt und sofort zugelegt.
Auch wenn fast 10 Jahre her ist als ich das Spiel gespielt habe war ich begeisert und f√ºhlt mich direkt woll mit diesen Spiel ,dieses Alte Gef√ºhl von fr√ºheren Zeiten und doch alles so neu und aufgefrischt das ich garnicht aufh√∂ren konnte dieses Spiel zu spielen. Ich war so begeistert wieviele Erinnerungen mir wieder ins Gehirn gekommen sind und dann wieviel ich mich noch Erinnern kann wieviele Kombination mir noch bekannt waren und trotzdem gabs paar Sachen wo ich doch bisschen nachdenken musste. author: {'steamid': '76561197972271628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 523, 'last_played': 1666060241}
review:
Threw my wallet at the screen immediately when I saw this. That didn't do anything, so I entered my Paypal information and that seemed to do the trick.

The remastered visuals and music are lovely and totally faithful to the original, and when you hit F1 it changes the game back to its classic pixelated soundblaster goodness (which I still prefer).  It's exactly as I remember it when I was a prepubescent child, only now the sound doesn't skip like crazy and I didn't have to install six floppy disks.  The additional commentary is also enjoyable to listen to and gives a lot of incite on the development of this legendary title.

As for the game itself?  It's a classic.  It's what put Tim Schafer on the map, and one of the best point n' click adventure games ever made, right up there with Gabriel Knight, Fate of Atlantas, Monkey Island, Kings/Space/Police Quests, The Longest Journey, etc.  It's brilliant, and this is the best version yet.  I did, however, run into one bug where the music wasn't playing correctly during the final moments of the game.  Hopefully they'll fix that.  Otherwise, it was problem free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004698064', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1462824618}
review:
Video Review = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wjS_CUBJa6I

There are only two games that I have played and beat more times that I can count and that‚Äôs Max Payne & Day of the Tentacle. My gaming life was started in Atari 8-bit computers, but was groomed with IBM PCs and Lucasfilm & Lucasarts adventure games. Lucas arts adventure games were the main games I played growing up and they shaped my sense of humor and critical thinking skills. Day of the Tentacle is my favorite Lucas arts adventure game and this Remaster is PERFECT.

OVERALL

As far as this I‚Äôm concerned in terms of this REMASTER - it is ABSOLUTELY PERFECT. It does what I absolutely love about Remasters and think they all should include this. At any time you can switch back to the original Graphics, music, and sound with a push of a button. Why I particularly love this Remaster as well is because it doesn‚Äôt overdo or redo things to a distasteful amount - It‚Äôs updated the artwork, smoothing out the pixels, and making Day of the Tentacle Look FANTASTIC in HD. I didn‚Äôt particularly enjoy what the Special Edition Monkey Island games did - It kind of lost the original artwork for new artwork - 

The increased resolution improves Peter Chan‚Äôs amazing artwork and design and I have to give a big shout out to the lead artist on Day of the Tentacle which is Peter Chan - His artwork and design give Day of the Tentacle it‚Äôs mood and voice is you will. I love the quirky angles. and twists and the use of color - I cannot explain it, it‚Äôs just perfection.

GAMEPLAY

The gameplay simplifies the old the point and click verb style with removing the verbs and inventory from the screen to just show your cursor and you right click to bring up a radial dial all the available options for you to interact with an object. This simplifies the thought process to a degree; by showing you the available actions for something, but it‚Äôs a much quicker way to play and I imagine great for consoles- However - I also thought not seeing your inventory on screen all the time made thinking about puzzles a little harder if you didn‚Äôt know what to do whereas seeing the items on screen might help you realize you have a solution for something.

Luckily you can mix and match the art, verb and inventory style, and music anyway you like in the options so you can have the Old point and click verb style with the new HD artwork. I didn‚Äôt realize this until I had already played through the standard remaster and this made me even more happy than before, because while I played through the standard settings to experience the remaster, in the future I‚Äôll probably play with old music, old verbs, and new artwork just because I‚Äôm an old school guy. 

You still can play the original Maniac Mansion on the commodore 64 computer inside of weird Ed Edison‚Äôs room - you can quit anytime and it will autosave your progress. So you‚Äôre getting two games for the price of one here.

MUSIC:

Now in my personal opinion I don‚Äôt really like the new ‚Äúremastered‚Äù music - I feel like it was a transfer of re-allocating midi instruments and not for the better. Maybe I‚Äôm partial to the original, but I just found many times enjoying the original music and also feeling that it was more subtle, less in your face, and worked with the cartoon style and imuse system better. The best way I can give you an example is the difference between how Green Tentacles band sounds when you listen to his track in the video above.

As far as sound effects go, I believe nothing has changed there except bitrate perhaps. And Hat‚Äôs off to the voice actors and voice director Tamlynn Barra for making quality voice acting for a 1993 video game. Do you know how long it took other companies to get good voice acting? (Think Final Fantasy X)

Ultimately I am so happy with this Remaster and I highly Recommend to everyone - even if you haven‚Äôt heard of played it before or even wondered what an adventure game is since they kind of went away, but have been coming back. Play it! Just play it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117526307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1533764683}
review:
WARNING!!! If you are looking for a boring, short, and overall stinky to the senses game, look much further! This game is NOT FOR YOU!!! 

"Day of the Tentacle Remastered" Is a ginuine, classic point and click adventure game with a pizzazz no other game can achieve. This is how you remake a classic game! You can even switch mid game between classic visuals, gameplay, and sound at the push of a button! It's like you are playing a cartoon, only it involves deep puzzles, and hilarious characters that don't come with your modern cartoon / game package. I felt like I had played for HOURS (In a good way), moping that the game was probably almost over, only to find out I was only 9% through the game! And may I tell you, I know I will be enjoying more hours on end attempting to 100% this game! Now all I want is a DLC soundtrack, and I'd be set for life!

-PixelDough

review: 5 Stunden Spielzeit (Mit gro√üz√ºgigen Pausen) und schon ist es vorbei. Und es war jeden einzelnen Cent Wert. Meine G√ºte, als ich h√∂rte das das Spiel als Remastered Version rauskommt habe ich mich wie Bolle gefreut. 1993 hatte ich nicht mal einen eigenen Rechner. Zocken war noch g√§nzlich unbekannt f√ºr mich und durch einen Zufall kam ich an die M√∂glichkeit in einem Club das spielen zu d√ºrfen. Erst Jahre danach fing ich wirklich an zu "zocken" aber dieses Spiel war definitiv mein Einstieg. Das Remake ist super gelungen und ich muss zugeben, das ich nicht mehr alle L√∂sungswege kannte. Um so mehr hats Spass gemacht und im neuen HD-Look ist es supersch√∂n anzuschauen. Die R√§tsel teils Knifflig die Stimmen und die Stimmung hervorragend. Ich war direkt wieder bei 1993. Super Point and Click und noch immer Zeitgem√§√ü. Wers kennt, sollte super in alten Zeiten schwelgen k√∂nnen. Wers nicht kennt...Viel Spass (Den werdet Ihr sicher haben). Klare Kaufempfehlung und das nicht nur aus Nostalgiegr√ºnden :)

review:
Apr√®s avoir termin√© le jeu on se rend compte qu'il a plut√¥t bien vieilli et ce remaster lui fait honneur.

Pour ceux qui n'√©taient pas n√©s √† l'√©poque il s'agit d'un jeu d'aventure point & click assez loufoque o√π l'on doit emp√™cher une tentacule pourpre qui a bu de l'eau contamin√©e de conqu√©rir le monde. 

Le dessin tr√®s cartoonesque a √©t√© refait et y'a pas un putain de gros pixel qui tra√Æne. C'est du superbe boulot. Le jeu est aussi d√©sormais en plein √©cran alors qu'avant 1/3 de celui-ci √©tait bouff√© par l'interface. On peut donc profiter des d√©cors et des animations en plein √©cran. Les musiques ont √©t√© √©galement r√©arrang√©es.

Mais ce qui fait surtout plaisir c'est qu'on peut ne pas profiter des graphismes refaits d'un clic de souris, ou m√™me de profiter de la musique MIDI d'√©poque plut√¥t que de celle r√©orchestr√©e, et √ßa c'est bon. ON peut personnaliser osn exp√©rience.

A √ßa on rajoute les commentaires des d√©veloppeurs, qui m√™me s'ils sont pas forc√©ment toujours bien trouv√©s ni int√©ressants, rajoutent une petite couche sympa pour les curieux.

Bref, que du bon si vous √™tes nostalgique ou amateur de point and click :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053172119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1459188460}
review:
Outstanding!

Pros:
- Great classic with a clever plot and lots of bizarre and fun puzzles
- The new graphics are awesome and absolutely true to the original
- The audio quality is much better than in the original
- AWESOME controller support with a radial dial for selecting verbs! Even works with a PS4 controller :)
- Hamster in the microwave

Cons (all minor):
- Could be longer
- A few puzzles seem a little far-fetched
- The music is a little annoying at times

Verdict:
Absolutely worth it even if you've played the original several times. And seriously: I think it actually plays better with a controller and I really hope other devs learn from this great example for usability!
Oh, and don't worry about that hamster ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011775329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1467540274}
review:
Un remaster honn√™te du grand classique de Lucas Art. Passage au 16/9, graphismes retravaill√©s en vectoriel, nouvelle bande originale et interface repens√©e... de quoi justifier largement les 15 euros demand√©es. Un simple passage de la nouvelle version √† l'ancienne via la touche F1 permet de prendre conscience du chemin parcouru.
La dur√©e de vie est par contre assez courte, n'utilisez la soluce qu'en cas de bloquage s√©v√®re (1 ou 2 passages vraiment tir√©s par les cheveux) sous peine de g√¢cher le plaisir.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970178020', 'num_games_owned': 355, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1496964717}
review:
This game plays exactly like the Special Edition Monkey Islands.  I would not be surprised if DF wasn't using the same code-base to support this game.  This is all very good because Monkey Island 1/2 SE were fantastic.  This version retains the feature of being able to switch between the classic and enhanced versions of the game which is a must have for me.

DOTT is one of the products of Lucasarts' golden age of PC gaming.  I can't recommend this game enough, I had so much fun playing it when I was a kid (and Maniac Mansion that's also included).  The commentary feature is great too because it's just wonderful to hear what the constraints where when they developed this game...  Orson Welles once said: "The enemy of art is the absence of limitations" and that holds very true to these older PC games.

The only criticism I have is that the new art is vectorized, but fortunately stays true to the original material (Monkey Island 1 SE took too many artistic liberties, imo).  I'm a much bigger fan of pixel art so it would have been nice to see the pixel graphics updated, but that would have obviously been much more work.  This game will probably play better on a mobile device so you may want to wait for that, but this version is still fantastic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963160817', 'num_games_owned': 932, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1479925489}

S‚Äôil y a de petit d√©faut ici ou l√† il en reste une tr√®s bonne exp√©rience qui ravira sans nul doute les connaisseurs du jeu, aussi bien que les nouveaux joueurs. Sans oublier la disponibilit√© de commentaires audio qui nous permettra d‚Äôen savoir plus sur la conception du jeu par ses cr√©ateurs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991382476', 'num_games_owned': 928, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 666, 'last_played': 1459159544}
review:
Un bijou.Tout simplement g√©nial... 
J'en attendais pas moins d'un jeu culte made in Lucas Art...Je n'avais pas eu l'occasion d'y jouer lors de sa sortie en 1993 mais autant dire que le premier jour de sa pr√©commande, j'ai saut√© dessus. 

Oblig√© de faire le parall√®le avec Grim Fandango, un P&C qui nous propulse dans une aventure originale, surprenante, loufoque et terriblement dr√¥le. La refonte graphique est sublime, la patte cartoonesque et les animations sont tip top. Un vrai travail de mise au go√ªt du jour qui n'a rien √† envier aux jeux d'aujourd'hui (je pense √† ceux de Daedalic). 
D'un seul clic, on peut revenir √† la version originale, ce qui est fort plaisant. Comme GF, il y a √©galement la possibilit√© d'√©couter les commentaires des d√©veloppeurs en cours de jeu. La bande-son colle tr√®s bien √† l'ambiance g√©n√©rale et aux diverses situations, cela-dit, en passant par curiosit√© √† la version originale, je dois dire que la bande-son 8bit a plus de charme. 

Comme l'on pouvait s'y attendre les √©nigmes sont loufoques, tr√®s loufoques. Parfois √† la limite de la logique. M'enfin, pourquoi devraient-elles √™tre logiques quand le spitch, lui, fait intervenir des voyages dans le temps via des cabines de chiottes et des tentacules gluantes g√©antes qui veulent conqu√©rir le monde et r√©duire en esclavage l'humanit√©? Non, le truc, c'est que honn√™tement, j'ai parfois √©t√© bloqu√© sur des casses-t√™tes qui ont mis ma patience √† rude √©preuve. Mais globalement, le jeu est moins compliqu√© qu'un Grim Fandango. 

D'un point de vu personnel, j'ai bien aim√© l'ambiance mais j'ai moins accroch√© que celle de grim Fandango. Les personnages sont moins charismatiques (Manny Calavera et Glottis <3) 

Mais tr√®s franchement, c'est un jeu √† avoir dans sa biblioth√®que et sans h√©sitation, j'ai envie de le classer dans mes jeux d'aventures pr√©f√©r√©s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111932813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1458854175}
review:
[h1]Pas grand chose √† reprocher √† ce portage d'un Point&Click d'anthologie...[/h1]

Comme ‚ÄúGrim Fandango‚Äù l'ann√©e derni√®re, Double Fine continue sur sa lanc√©e des remasterisations des perles perdues.
Comme ‚ÄúGrim Fandango‚Äù l'ann√©e derni√®re, si on peut critiquer le c√¥t√© paresseux de la d√©marche, force est de constater que √ß√† fait plaisir quand m√™me, surtout qu'il est quasiment impossible de pouvoir jouer √† ‚ÄúDay of the Tentacle‚Äù(DotT) par des moyens l√©gaux de nos jours...

[b]Et puis surtout parce qu'il n'a pas pris une ride![/b]

Concr√®tement, tous les plans ont √©t√© redessin√©s pour offrir au jeu une [b]meilleure r√©solution[/b](ce qui √©vitera √† tout le monde de se d√©truire les yeux) [b]tout en gardant les animations de l'√©poque[/b]. Si certains trouveront le tout quand m√™me ‚Äúcheap‚Äù, √ß√† aurait √©t√© dommage de trahir la direction artistique de l'√©poque en proposant un rendu qui ne fait pas l'unanimit√©. Son style cartoon de toute fa√ßon donne un r√©sultat qui passe tr√®s bien, et c'est un tr√®s bon choix de leur part, bon point.
[b]L'interface a √©t√© revu √©galement[/b]; un clique droit sur un √©l√©ment o√π on peut interagir vous donne toutes les options possibles(les dr√¥les et celles qui marchent). √á√† rend la chose plus lisible, √ß√† fera moins peur aux n√©ophytes, √ß√† laisse plus de place pour admirer les dessins... c'est tout bon.
Au pire, les puristes pourront toujours avoir le rendu et l'interface de l'√©poque simplement en appuyant sur F1... donc tout le monde est content!

Techniquement on a l√† un portage de qualit√© qui permet de justifi√© le prix pour le travail fournis et permettra au nouvelles g√©n√©ration de se lancer dans ce P&C tordus au possible qui reste un des plus estim√© du genre encore aujourd'hui.

Le pitch de DotT annonce la couleur: le professeur Fred balance des d√©chets toxiques dans la rivi√®re, qui vont faire pousser des bras √† un de ses sbires, tentacule violette, et qui va se mettre en route pour conqu√©rir le monde. Malgr√© l'avertissement de l'autre sbire tentacule verte, le mal est fait et la seule mani√®re d'arr√™ter tentacule violette est de retourner dans le pass√©. Le professeur Fred va donc envoyer 3 acolytes Bernard, Hoagie et Laverne dans le pass√© par l'interm√©diaire de chiottes temporelles... et √©videmment √ß√† va pas se passer comme pr√©vu:
-Hoagie est envoy√© au temps de Georges Washington et Ben Franklin lors de la conception de la constitution am√©ricaine
-Bernard reviens dans le pr√©sent
-Laverne est envoy√©e dans le futur un temps o√π les tentacules contr√¥lent le monde.
Parviendront ils a r√©tablir la situation, √† revenir √† la bonne √©poque pour arr√™ter tentacule violette et sauver le monde?

A la question ‚ÄúDotT est il difficile?‚Äù, la r√©ponse est ‚Äúoui et pas qu'un peu!‚Äù.
[b]Les √©nigmes sont √† l'image du pitch du jeu, tordues, loufoques mais inoubliables.[/b]
Si on consid√®re que le joueur contr√¥le les 3 lascars, sur 3 √©poques diff√©rentes, qu'il peut envoyer la majorit√© des objets de l'inventaire √† chaque personnage par l'interm√©diaire des Chrono'WC(en tirant la chasse bien sur... des chasses d'eau temporelles, comme dans la vrai vie), et que les √©nigmes sont particuli√®rement absurdes dans leur r√©solution, on tient un P&C de haute tenue qui va mettre votre patience et votre logique √† mal.
Je vous encouragerait bien √† le faire sans solution si je ne l'avais fait moi m√™me(la premi√®re fois y a plus de dix ans et m√™me ici pour ce remastered... je l'admets, je suis faible...), mais la satisfaction une fois r√©solue sera d'autant plus grande pour vous.
[b]C'est tellement tordu que √ß√† en devient g√©nial[/b], ce qu'il faut retenir!

Deux consolations pour les novices:
-les objets avec lesquels on peut interagir peuvent √™tre mis en surbrillance en appuyant sur ‚Äútab‚Äù
-pas besoin de revenir aux toilettes pour faire passer un objet √† un des 3 larrons(se fait automatiquement depuis l'inventaire en faisant un glisser/d√©poser sur le personnage cible)
Personnellement, je trouve √ß√† tr√®s bien! √á√† r√©duit au moins les chances d'√™tre coinc√© pour un manque d‚Äôinattention, pas la chose la plus passionnante dans un P&C.

Si on ajoute l'ajout de commentaires audio, d'un support manette qui marche pas mal, de succ√®s plut√¥t marrant √† trouver et d'√©bauches √† d√©bloquer, on tient un portage de haute tenue auquel [b]il serait b√™te de passer √† c√¥t√© si on est fan du genre[/b] ou si on veut d√©couvrir parmi la cr√®me de la cr√®me des jeux d'aventure Lucas Arts.

[h1][u]TL;DR:[/u][/h1]

+ Un P&C d'anthologie...
+ ...remodeler graphiquement et au niveau sonore sans trahir la DA originale.
+ bon choix d'interface
+ pouvant √™tre jouer √† la manette
+ des ajouts pour une plus grande accessibilit√©...
+ ‚Ä¶ sans un syst√®me d'aide qui ruine tout
+ Sous titres en fran√ßais et en pas mal de langues

- quelques rares bugs sonores h√©rit√©s de l'original
- aurait √©t√© bien de pouvoir r√©attribuer les touches

review: Just as I remembered, but without pixelated graphics (though that you can switch to the original at any time is a nice touch). In addition there's developers commentary and a set of achievements added from the original. Just perfect example how a remake should be done.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992136251', 'num_games_owned': 1422, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1501743940}
review:
Day of the Tentacle continues to be one of the best PC games of all time. All the graphics are redone but you can switch back and forth between the old and new graphics and interface at any point. 
Perfect starting point for people wanting to play adventure games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980692110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1669641749}
review:
Day of the Tentacle ( or dott if you like) 

A fun  point and click game that   became very popular  in the  90s.

Yor job is to stop a insane tentacle from taking over the world, and   to complete this , you need to  play as three  Kids which  is stuck in different  time periodes.
Bernard :   a nerdy geek  whick happens to get back to the present day Mansion
Hoagie:  a fat rocker that is sent back to the days when George Washington were the president of the USA 
Laverne:  A " strange " girl  which is being sent to the future

This  Review is short, but it  some how  sums up the game  fast ..  I  Would strongly recommend this game for  new players and  veterans.  And for the best  experience,  it is best played with a mouse and a keyboard. 

10\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009910977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1477179855}
review:
Hier mein Review zu Day of the Tentacle Remastered.

Eins vorab...

F√ºr alle die dieses Spiel schon damals gespielt haben:
Keine Angst, es wurde nichts ver√§ndert ;)

Wie der Titel schon sagt ist es ein Remake eines, meiner Meinung nach, besten Spieleklassiker √ºberhaupt.

Das Spiel wurde komplett original belassen. 

Die einzigen 2 √Ñnderungen sind:

1. Die Grafik wurde auf ein Augenfreundliches Niveau geschraubt. Aber der Grafikstil wurde beibehalten. Des besteht auch die M√∂glichkeit in Originalgrafik zu spielen.

2. Man kann Entwicklerkommentare dazu schalten, aber ich denke dass ist eher f√ºr Fans von damals interessant.

Zum Spiel selbst:

Da ich nicht spoilern m√∂chte, kann ich nur sagen: absolute Empfehlung.
Das Spiel ist liebevoll und detailreich gestaltet. Auch die Charaktere passen einfach ins Spiel, mit ihren lustigen Spr√ºchen und Gesten. Auch das "R√§tseldesign" macht Lust auf mehr.

F√ºr alle die dieses Spiel nicht von fr√ºher kennen....gebt dem Spiel eine Chance, es hat es verdient weiter gespielt zu werden :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197971017985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1459111913}
review:
Comme pour Monkey Island, Double Fine nous gratifie d'une version remasteris√©e de qualit√©.

Pas la peine de s'√©terniser sur le scenario, le gameplay, etc.. c'est exactement le m√™me jeu que dans les ann√©es 90, √† la frame pr√®s, √† la note pr√®s, et √† la ligne de dialogue pr√®s. Toujours aussi dr√¥le et d√©glingu√©, toujours aussi bien foutu, avec son histoire de voyage dans le temps menant les 3 principaux protagonistes √† interargir malgr√© leur s√©paration de 200 ans chacun.

N√©anmoins, les graphismes en haute r√©solution et les musiques remasteris√©es pourraient presque le faire passer pour une production r√©cente. Par ailleurs, comme pour les pr√©cit√©s remake, on peut passer √† volont√© de la version classique √† la version remasteris√©e pour constater le travail effectu√©, √ßa se fait en transition douce, c'est tr√®s sympa.
L'interface fonctionne bien, c'est tr√®s propre, et il n'y a aucun bug √† d√©plorer.

C'est donc une tr√®s bonne occasion de d√©couvrir (ou de red√©couvrir) un immense classique : l'un des tous meilleurs de l'√¢ge d'or du point'n'click (et personnellement, mon pr√©f√©r√© avec Monkey Island 2).
Et pour ceux qui comme moi le connaissent encore par coeur... et bien √ßa vaut le coup quand m√™me :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198009040518', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1663740312}
review:
I had this game originally on my 386 with no CDROM when I was around 8-10 years of age.  I remember it taking forever to install via the floppy disks.  When it finally finished, I had reallocated memory by creating a boot disk.  When the intro sequence started up I was blown away.   I was drawn in by the cartoon effects and music.  I must admit though, it being my adventure game it did take me a while to get the games intro sequence to continue as I didn't know how to properly use the verb Pull on the Clock.  I had to ask a buddy at school how they did it while not admitting to them that I had spent more than 2 hours trying to get it.  lol.  Once I opened up the rest of the game, I was entranced by the story, humor, sound effects, and wacky puzzles.  I learned that vinegar is created from wine via my dad.  I found uses to my Looney Tune knowledge to solve puzzles (Pepe le Pew).  I was enamoured by the all the options to talk with the great Uncle Ted.  I think this game is the reason I love all time travel games now.  

So, when I found the chance to by a remastered version of this game I jumped at it.  This game helped shape my gaming childhood.  I was estatic that I could change the graphics mode from remastered to original.  All the puzzles play the same, so if you remember them the play through will be a quick one.  I turned on commentary and learned alot about how the game was made.  Also, in the floppy version, which the commentary mentions there is only voice in the initial opening sequence in the lobby.  So, hearing all the voices of everyone to include Harold made my day.  

To sum it up, this wacky, beautiful, and awesome game will get your mind going for a short bit.  As a fan of this game and point/click adventure games, I would had bought this at any price.  However, for someone new to this I would wait for a sale, as I think $14.99 is too much for a game this short.  

That all being said though, this game is on my top 3 list of the greatest games ever made.  

Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198162390461', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1488353278}
review:
This game was iconic for me, growing up.  It's wrapped up in my childhood memories, along with the original Monkey Island series, Leisure Suit Larry, Indiana Jones and The fate of Atlantis, and the awesome Kings Quest series.   I could only play it staying at a relatives, twice a year, as we didn't have a PC man enough to run such a game!  Over the years, I have searched for it, hoping it may have surfaced to transport me back to my youth, so you can't even imagine my excitement, to find, 23 years later, that it was available on Steam!!
I love the puzzles, the dialogue, and the characters, and the remastered version is as amazing as it always was, although slightly more polished.  
I can't recommend this game highly enough, as it's always been a favourite of mine.  The only downpoint, for me, is that it isn't longer.  I can complete it pretty quickly, and am then snapped back to reality, mid 30's, four kids, blah blah blah.  But, anyway, classic game brought back to life, and I can't thank Lucasarts enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035368463', 'num_games_owned': 2149, 'num_reviews': 266, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1705597533}
review:
An excellent remaster of an adventure game classic.
They kept the same art style like the original DOS version and even managed to keep the original voices from the CD version, only with more high quality.
And of course, the game is still packed with plenty of humor and time travelling hijinks that you'd expect from a LucasArts game at the time it came out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960283998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1458839023}
review:
This is my favourite adventure game of all time. Not only does it have the amazing comedy you'd excpect from a LucasArts adventure game, it also has great characters and somewhat ridiculous puzzles and the greatest puzzle mechanic of all, Time.
The thing that sets this apart from all the other classic era of LucasArts adventure games is the scale of it all. Instead of you wandering from one puzzle area to the next this one uses the same layout of a single house but in three different eras of time. It makes for complex puzzles using time but also a great way to shift focus if you get stuck. 
Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074470086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1459088185}
review: Yes

author: {'steamid': '76561197977257109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1459086036}
review:
Fantastic game! If you never had a chance to play the original and you enjoy adventure games then this is an essential purchase. Double Fine have done an excellent job with the remaster, including a lot of interesting commentary and improved visuals, dialogue and music.

The only bug I encountered was when changing the render mode during cutscenes. Sometimes I would be stuck in classic mode and unable to revert back to the remastered version afterwards, resorting to loading a save to fix the issue. This was a minor thing though.

Overall, definitely worth the money. There's no hint system like the Monkey Island remasters and the puzzles can be quite tough at times, but I don't consider this a negative. Pick it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044949746', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 819, 'last_played': 1459550343}
review:
This is perfect. Way better than the Monkey Island Special Editions. 
This actually preserves the art style of the original game while updating it for modern PCs. 

Plus it even includes the original Manic Mansion as an easter egg. 

I hope all the old Lucas Arts adventure games get remastered like this. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971355045', 'num_games_owned': 975, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1459019037}
review:
[b]On the quality of the remake[/b]
This is a good exaple on how to remake a classic.
Redrawn graphics, remastered sound, and more modernised user interface, while the gameplay itself remains unchanged. And if you're a purist, you can switch everything back to the way things were back in 1993 - original pixel art, unremasterd soundtrack and traditional SCUMM(tm) interface are included for good measure too.

About the new artwork, my main gripe is that they didn't add additional animation frames - seeing high-resolution cartoons with such stiff movement is a bit weird. On the plus side, the game now looks very faithful to [url=http://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/scale_small/0/4938/609071-day_of_the_tentacle_box_front_6534x8205.jpg]the original box art[/url], something that just wasn't possible 23 years ago.

[b]On the game itself[/b]
So, how does this game hold up, 2 decades later ? This is one of the most well-known point & click adventures from the '90s after all...
The good news is that after all those years, it still shows why it's a classic. It offers a non-linear approach to puzzles, plenty of funny jokes, an insane plot and a lot of hints towards the more illogical puzzles if you're willing to explore, experiment, and pay attention to details.
Yep, illogical puzzles. But this game is illogical in a consist way, so it could be said to run on it's own internal logic instead. Explore everywhere, get hint in one place of the game, apply the hint elsewhere, get unexpected, and probably hilarious effect. 
Or when you know what effect to achieve, find items you need where you would not expect them at first, and put them to use.

[b]Bottom line[/b]
If you're a fan of point & click adventures, you should own Day of the Tentacle.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974755995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1458999890}
review:
Damals, in grauer Vorzeit, anno 1993, kam ich das erste mal in den Genuss von Day of the Tentacle- kurz DOTT. Es war f√ºr mich das erste Adventure, und viele weitere sollten folgen. Dennoch ist DOTT f√ºr mich eines der besten Adventures aller Zeiten! 

Die Story rund um machthungrige Tentakel und Zeitreisen ist wirklich verr√ºckt, die Dialoge herrlich humorvoll und die Modernisierung ist sehr gelungen. An dieser Stelle vielen Dank an Double Fine- great work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006227562', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1650820022}
review:
√âste es quiz√°s el mejor juego de aventura tipo Point-and-click que se ha hecho nunca (con el permiso de Monkey Island 1 y 2). 100% recomendado, claro!!

Aunque advierto que mi opini√≥n puede estar muy sesgada, ya que me considero fan incondicional del juego desde que lo jugu√© por all√° el 1996, cuando era ni√±o. Lo habr√© jugado como unas 8-10 veces (sin contar esta versi√≥n remasterizada): en PC 486, en Win9x, en iOS jail-break, en ScummVM (en modo original y en modo subida de resoluci√≥n juntando p√≠xeles para hacer que se vea "menos" pixelado), etc.

El juego es divertido, intuitivo y no tan largo como los Monkey, lo que para mi lo hace mejor que estos dos. La est√©tica es atractiva, los di√°logos son divertidos, los puzzles son suficientemente intuitivos como para no estancarse demasiado, los personajes son √∫nicos, la historia es hilarante y la conexi√≥n entre el pasado, presente y futuro es sublime, ¬øqu√© m√°s se puede pedir a una aventura point&click?

En esta versi√≥n remasterizada, han hecho exactamente lo que ten√≠an que hacer: respetar al 100% el original, adaptando los gr√°ficos a las pantallas HD, pero manteniendo exactamente la misma est√©tica (tipo de dibujo) que el original, la cual, a pesar de sus p√≠xeles, segu√≠a siendo aceptable hoy en d√≠a. El sistema de verbos original ha sido cambiado (se puede activar el modo original) por la t√≠pica ruleta para facilitar la vida a los que juegan con mando (consolas), pero sinceramente, eso permite ver la pantalla al 100% y es mucho m√°s √°gil a la hora de interactuar con el entorno. El acceso al inventario es muy r√°pido y sencillo, no cansa.

Para mencionar alguna pega, podr√≠an haberse currado versiones orquestadas de la m√∫sica y doblajes en otros idiomas, pero supongo que no se puede tener todo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964839663', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1459040523}
review:
Wonderful version of one of the greatest games ever. The graphics have been masterfully remastered, including subpixel scrolling for an ultra-smooth experience. The voices have been re-sampled from the original DAT recordings and are crystal clear. You can switch between the original presentation and the remastered one anywhere with a single keypress. Technically this version is perfect.

If forced to critique anything about the game, it would have to be the subtitle sync which seems slightly off, with longer sentences staying on screen long after they've been uttered. A subtitle speed slider would solve this.

Highly recommended.

review:
C'est le vieux fan de la premi√®re heure qui parle : 
[h1]Si vous avez conserv√© la version CD du jeu, inutile d'acheter celle-ci, elle n'apporte rien.[/h1]

Ce sont les musiques originales, les bruitages originaux, les animations originales (avec m√™me les lags originaux), l'interface originale et m√™me les couleurs originales. Pas de nouveau doublage, pas de vue √©largie, aucun re-design, pas de compatibilit√© Linux...

Vous avez ici le r√©sultat de l'installation de votre vieux jeu DOTT sur un [url=http://scummvm.org/]ScummVM[/url] avec des graphismes liss√©s, un mode "cadran" et des commentaires, la compatibilit√© en moins. 

Rien √† voir avec les versions remasteris√©es de Monkey Island. Je suis terriblement d√©√ßu.

Ceci dit, rien n'est retir√© √† l'excellent jeu original. Si vous d√©couvrez le titre et appr√©ciez le genre, l'achat est incontournable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116939136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1572519660}
review:
[h1]9/10 If you‚Äôre going to buy only one adventure game this year, make it [i]Day of the Tentacle[/i][/h1]

Purple Tentacle grew arms and with his new found mobility, is set on conquering earth - the advent of the age of tentacles. Bernard, Laverne, and Hoagie revisit the mansion to stop him when one of them gets transported 200 years into the past, the other 200 years into the future and one stays in the present. Though in different epochs, the three have to work together to save the human race from slavery and possible total annihilation.

[i][strike]Maniac Mansion[/strike] Day of the Tentacle[/i] (Lucas Arts 1993, Double Fine 2016), also known as DotT, is my all-time favourite point & click adventure game. I played both the German as well as American version of this game so often, that I can rush through this game in no-time. Needless to say, I had high hopes & fears for its remaster.

[h1]About the Game[/h1]
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=651719523

[i]Day of the Tentacle[/i] takes place a couple of years after the events of [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] (Lucas Arts 1987), which was the first [i]‚Äùreal‚Äù[/i] point & click adventure, thanks to the SCUMM engine. No longer did players have to type in verbs, but verbs to intereact with the game environment were given to them through the engine. In DotT players not only get to play with a refined version of the engine, they also get to play in a game that‚Äôs superior to [i]The Secret of Monkey Island[/i] and [i]Monkey Island 2: LeChuck‚Äôs Revenge[/i] in both story telling, pacing, puzzle design, as well as teaching players game mechanics.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=651719339

Similar to [i]Maniac Mansion[/i] (MM), players get to control three protagonists, although the roster of playable characters has been trimmed down drastically. Unlike in MM, there are no longer multiple ways to beating the game, nor is there a way to die or fail. The overall maps are a lot smaller than in previous Lucas Arts adventure games, streamlining the puzzle solving process. It‚Äôs clear how much more experienced with the genre the developers were at this point as opposed to the first games (cf. my Monkey Island reviews). While in the remasters of both [i]Monkey Island 1 & 2[/i], I preferred using the old look, simply because it was easier for me to operate the menu and handle my items, in this game, I mostly used the new design as I was finally able to navigate through the options and items properly.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=651718249

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

So to anyone asking themselves whether or not they should get this game. If there‚Äôs only one adventure game that you‚Äôre going to get this year, make it either [i]Grim Fandango[/i] or [i]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/i]. They‚Äôre that good.

[b][u]Hey there.[/u][/b] If you like my writing or my occasional interviews with developers, why not follow my Steam curation over at [url= https://store.steampowered.com/curator/8839524-Gaos-Corner/]Gao‚Äôs Corner[/url] to keep up to date?

review:

Una obra maestra en la que pensaba que la remasterizaci√≥n le sentaria m√°s mal que mejor y que por el contrario, a mi parecer, no empa√±a para nada su legado. De hecho se agradece poder jugarlo en pantallas en formato panoramico,  con sus logros y con sus rewards en forma de ilustraciones originales y los comentarios del autor. 

Despues de copiar el pu√±ado de disquettes en los que venia hace veinte a√±os, por ser joven y biso√±o, adquirirlo ahora es algo que de alg√∫n modo tenia pendiente y a lo que no me podia resistir. Rejugarlo por enesima vez sigue siendo igual de hilarante y adictivo, una autentica joya.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006602199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1458946588}
review:
If you're not familiar with Day of the Tentacle (DoTT) already, the best way to describe it is as the love child of Adult Swim and modern Telltale Games like Tales from the Borderlands. Day of the Tentacle is also one of the most important adventure games ever made, and for good reason. 

Even without the nostalgia-filtered lenses, Day of the Tentacle stands as one of cleverest and funniest games I've ever played. The writing is filled with quirky charm, and the puzzles strike a perfect balance between cartoon logic, humor, and absurdity--even if they stump you for a bit, save the walkthrough until you're *really* stuck, because there's a lot of excitement and laughs in figuring the puzzles out yourself. The remaster is absolutely visually gorgeous and should be the standard that all remasters are held to; the sound is similarly spectacular and the voice acting is tremendous. 

The only two reasons NOT to get this game are: 1) If you hate adventure games, because DotT is basically just collecting items, manipulating them, and talking to people; and 2) If you're really strapped for cash, because, while I think the price is very reasonable, some people might complain that <10 hrs of content for the price is steep. 

But, seriously, if neither of the above apply, buy this game and start playing now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026067943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1459874628}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994901844', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1709836882}
review:
Before I say anything like "I really wanted to like this" I must confess to being on of THOSE people who apparently couldnt adjust to modern times.

I tried to play the remastered way but the "cutout" filter effect from photoshop was a major turnoff. The "remastered" soundtrack also and dont get me started on how the unintuitive interface got even more destroyed by the ugly new font. All I can say is "Thank god for the option to play it like it was intended".

These were my major issues and it seems to me that the things I wanted just wasnt there in this remake. To bring some perspective to the issues I mentioned I might add that I absolutely adored the remakes of Monkey Island, especially the graphics and the sound (not the interface). This remake is another beast however.

DotT is however still one of the best adventure games around so Im gonna give it a thumbs up nonetheless. The final judgement is however based on the original (and I do own the original in a box), nothing in this so called "remake effort" would get a thumbs up from me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970798686', 'num_games_owned': 495, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1467814414}
review:
J'ai toujours aim√© ce jeu √† l'√©poque, et le travail fait pour le remasteriser est tout simplement merveilleux. Il est toujours possible de switcher en mode non masteris√© √† tout moment en appuyant sur F1, on reviens √† l'√©cran 4:3 pix√©lis√© original du jeu avec les sons originaux et le panneau des actions en bas. 

C'est un immense fun de red√©couvrir ce grand classic, encore le fun d'y jouer, avec des graphiques pas pixelis√©s et des musiques d'excellente sonorit√©. Tr√®s heureux de mon achat, et merci √©norm√©ment d'avoir remasteris√© ce bon classique !

author: {'steamid': '76561198135148925', 'num_games_owned': 400, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1459377320}
review:
Als erstes m√∂chte ich sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel damals schon gespielt habe. Es war mit unter mein erstes Spiel in meiner Laufbahn als PC-Spieler. 

F√ºr alle die sich den Review ersparen wollen, hier die erste Stunde Playtime.

https://youtu.be/P449LxiHfzw

Day of the Tentacle ist ein Point and Click Adventure das noch immer mit den heutigen Titeln wie Deponia locker mithalten kann. (F√ºr Point and Click Adventure Fans ist die Deponia Reihe zu empfehlen)
Es sieht super aus ( Remastered = Grafik √ºberarbeitet aber Story gleich geblieben).
Das UI (Userinterface) ist √ºberarbeitet und wesentlich nutzerfreundlicher als die Urfassung.
Kleine Ungenauigkeiten ( KEINE BUGS/FEHLER) sind aus Nostalgiegr√ºnden weiter enthalten. Darunter f√§llt zum Beispiel die nicht vorhandene Synchronit√§t der Sprachausgabe ( Es ist minimal aber erkl√§rt durch Entwickler Kommentare)
Die Entwicklerkommentare sind sehr interessant und unterhaltsam. Ich pers√∂nlich habe diese deaktiviert, da diese f√ºr ein Let's Play eher st√∂rend sind!

F√ºr alle Retrofans ist gesagt, dass man Ingame die Grafik wechseln kann zwischen Oldschool und neuer Grafik. Wirklich lustig sich die Szenen anzuschauen und zu vergleichen :)

Allem in Allem ist es Lohnenswert dieses Spiel noch einmal zu spielen!
Grafik 10/10
Story 10/10 (wie schon immer)
Fun-Faktor 10/10 (Sofern man auf diese Art von Humor steht)
Preis-Leistungsverh√§ltnis 8/10 (Wenn man es schon gespielt hat)

Von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

review: Day of the Tentacle ist √ºberraschend frisch geblieben! author: {'steamid': '76561197970324465', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1499530174}
review:
Ein geniales Adventure aus dem Hause Lucas Arts (R.I.P). Ich habe damals schon die Urversion als Disketten gehabt und war von dem Witz und dem Flair einfach total angetan. Jeder der sich f√ºr Point & Click Adventures interessiert MUSS dieses Spiel einfach haben.

Die Remasterd Version bringt dieses Spiel nochmal ein St√ºck in die Zukunft, wobei die alte Grafik auch einfach schon Kult ist. 

Ich kann dieses Game nur jeden ans Herz legen !! Es hat mich wieder voll in alten Zeiten schwelgen lassen und daf√ºr danke ich den Publisher und dem Team.

If you never played DOTT before, here a few recommendations:

review:
Qu'est ce que j'ai bien fait d'avoir attendu ce remaster pour y jouer. Je ne vois vraiment pas ce qu'on pourrait repprocher √† cette version, elle est juste parfaite. On a l'impression de jouer √† un jeu sorti hier.
J'ai ador√© notamment le niveau de difficult√©, juste ce qu'il faut et en prenant son temps sans l'aide de soluce, c'est un r√©gal. Il est bien moins dur que "grim fandango".
Pour le reste, il m√©rite compl√®tement son titre de jeu culte. Je l'ai ador√© et pourtant je ne suis pas une fan de loufoquerie en ce qui concerne les jeux d'aventure, pr√©f√©rant de loin les ambiances plus dramatiques.
Donc foncez, il faut le d√©couvrir ou le red√©couvrir. Il m√©rite une place bien au chaud  indispensable dans toute biblioth√®que de jeux qui se respecte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004095553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1458844206}
review:
I'm about 20 years too late to write a fresh review of DOTT. It's probably one of Lucas Arts' finest point & clicks - genuinly funny, awesome sound design and a tremendous Chuck Jonesque art direction.

If you have never played the original, buy it RIGHT NOW.

If you have already completed the game, some questions are in order:
-Do you enjoy developer commentaries ?
-Do you like "HD" grafix ?
-Do you care about achievements ?

If you have a majority of "no", it might be wise to just stick to your old copy. Because those are the main perks of this versions.

The only real drawback of this remastered is the stupid "continue" system for the original Maniac Mansion. You can't save and only resume the current game. So if you're stuck in a a dead end, might as well restart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975775250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1544189650}
review:
Da gusto volver a los viejos tiempos en uno de los mejores t√≠tulos y con mejor historia que he jugado en mi vida.
Volvemos a ponernos en la piel de Bernard Bernoulli, el tipico nerd de pelicula, Hoagie, un rockero tipico de la √©poca y Laverne,... supuestamente una enfermera pero yo no me dejar√≠a poner por sus manos... para salvar el mundo de una de las craciones del Dr. Fred, el tent√°culo morado.

Quiz√°s echo en falta un avance en la historia m√°s que una versi√≥n remastered, pero ahora que han vuelto a trabajar con el creador original del juego para remasterizarlo, quiz√°s veamos en el futuro un nuevo t√≠tulo para ver que ocurre con el la familia Edison.

Adem√°s, como muchos sabr√©is, podremos disfrutar del primer t√≠tulo de la saga - "Maniac Mansion" dentro del juego y en versi√≥n original. Adem√°s de poder jugar a este √∫ltimo t√≠tulo en su versi√≥n original tambi√©n (Pixelada).

Echo en falta que adhieran al juego los audios del juego extra√≠dos.

Si quer√©is vivir una verdadera aventura gr√°fica de anta√±o, con mucho humor y estrujaros el cerebro para resolver los complicados puzles, este es el mejor t√≠tulo que podr√©is comprar este 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000427083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1458943607}
review: Arguably one of the greatest adventure games ever made, Day of the Tentacle receives the remaster treatment with beautiful HD graphics, upgraded music quality, and a new intuitive interface, but still retains the original light-hearted charm and humor.  Rendering can also be switched on-the-fly between the remastered version and the original pixelated classic.  The puzzles themselves are straightforward, with the occasional stumper.  Experienced adventure gamers will breeze through this fairly quickly, but this classic is not to be missed, especially if you haven't played it before. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993188898', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1458880796}
review: My childhood is back, and it's in HD! I played the original over and over back in the day...a lot of the humor slipped past my 5-6 year old mind at the time, so playing it again now is like meeting an old friend again after years apart, and that friend's sense of humor has gotten darker/dirtier in all the right ways. Nostalgia factor aside...well, it's not even really a factor. It's just the icing on the cake which is this awesome, funny, smart game. Definitely recommended, and absolutely appreciated!

author: {'steamid': '76561197982136987', 'num_games_owned': 652, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 227, 'last_played': 1458865185}
review:
Nach all den Jahren endlich mal wieder!

Ohne ScummVM oder sonstige Hilfsmittel einen der gr√∂√üten Klassiker und vor allem eines der gro√üartigsten Spiele der Kindheit mal wieder spielen. Wie schon bei Grim Fandango Remastered ohne zu z√∂gern zugegriffen und es keine Sekunde bereut! Auch wenn ich tats√§chlich noch alle R√§tsel auswendig kannte und dementsprechend recht fix durch war, ist mir allein die Nostalgie die 14,99‚Ç¨ wert.

Was soll man gro√ü sagen? Es ist das klassische Point-and-klick-Adventure mit aufgeh√ºbschter Grafik und nachbearbeiteten Soundeffekten. In der √ºberarbeiteten Version hat man allerdings nicht mehr die alten Verben am unteren Bildschirmrand wie "Nimm", "Ziehe", "Rede" usw, sondern es werden kontextsensitiv passende Verben mit einem Klick der rechten Maustaste in einem Kreismen√º angezeigt. Diese Neuerung mag man nun mehr oder weniger sinnvoll finden, st√∂rend ist sie jedenfalls nicht.

Am Ende kann man das Spiel sowohl f√ºr denjenigen empfehlen, der diesen Klassiker damals schon liebte, als auch f√ºr den neuen Spieler, der ihn nachholen m√∂chte oder einfach auf verr√ºckten Humor steht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029026209', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1676066847}
review:
Still one of the best adventure games of all times, and the new graphics are quite nice. Definitely nice to play through that one again :)

I didn't really like the new control style for playing with a mouse, so I switched back to the traditional controls. Later tried with a controller and the new control style is better for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007759830', 'num_games_owned': 3051, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1547395468}
review:
[h1]Ich habe den Key zu Reviewzwecken vom Entwickler erhalten was jedoch nicht meine Meinung beeinflusst[/h1]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Bei Day of the Tentacle handelt es sich um eine Neuauflage des 1993 erschienenen gleichnamigen Spieles von Lucas Arts.
Day of the Tentacle war der Nachfolger des Spieles "Maniac Mansion"
Im Spiel selber wurde nichts ge√§ndert, jedenfalls ist mir nichts aufgefallen, ausser das die Grafik verbessert wurde und es eine Sprachausgabe gibt. Trotz der Grafikverbesserung hat das Spiel seinen alten Charme und das Grafikkonzept behalten.
Im Grundlegenden handelt es sich hierbei um einen der wirklich guten vorreiter der Point and Click Adventures und wie die neueren Vertreter Deponia oder Unwritten Tales besticht es nicht nur mit guten R√§tseln sondern auch mit Humor und Einfallsreichtum. Bei Day of the Tentacle handelt es sich um eines der Spiele die sich selbst nicht so ernst nehmen und bei denen man fast durchgehend nicht nur um eine Ecke sondern um mehrere denken muss.
Man spielt gesamt 3 Charaktere welche durch die Zeit geschickt werden um ein mutiertes Tentakel aufzuhalten, doch durch einen Fehler in der Zeitmaschine werden alle Charaktere in verschiedene Zeiten geschickt (Vergangenheit, Gegenwart, Zukunft).
Alle 3 Zeiten spielen am gleichen Ort doch sehen ausser vom Aufbau her grundlegend verschieden aus.
Das Ziel ist es nun alle Charaktere wieder in die Gegenwart - 1 Tag zu bringen um das Tentakel aufzuhalten und die Mutation zu verhindern.

[h1]Positiv[/h1]
- Einer der besten Klassiker endlich auf PC
- Steam Errungenschaften
- Verbesserte Grafik
- Sprachausgabe
- Spielablauf selbst wurde vom Klassiker beibehalten
- l√§uft fl√ºssig und fehlerfrei

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
- Stimmen gefallen mir teils nicht so ganz
- Das Hauptmen√º finde ich h√§sslich

[h1]Negativ[/h1]
- Es gibt zwar ein Tutorial aber das finde ich etwas un√ºbersichtlich
- Es gibt sehr viele Konzeptzeichnungen, hier w√§re eine Kachelansich besser gewesen als das man weit √ºber 100 zeichnungen mit einem Pfeil weiter klicken muss.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Ich spielte das originale Day of the Tentacle damals auf meinem 486er Rechner und es begeisterte mich von der ersten Minute an. ich spielte es damals ca 10 x durch was mir jetzt leider zum Nachteil wurde da ich in dieser fantastischen Neuauflage leider viele der R√§tsel/L√∂sungen bereits kannte und nach ca 3h durch war. trotzdem begeisterte mich das Spiel ein weiteres mal so das ich es bei Key erhalt direkt installierte und auf einmal direkt durchspielte.
Day of the Tentakel war damals ein Diamant im Spielehimmel und ist es jetzt genauso wie fr√ºher.
Klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr alle Fans dieses Genres.

Wenn euch diese Review gefallen hat, dann folgt unserem Reviewprogramm
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/-German_Gamer_Community-

author: {'steamid': '76561198017392185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1458685501}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is een van de klassieke 'point and click adventure games' die ik elke paar jaar opnieuw speel , vanwege de grappige dialogen en leuke puzzels. Met de komst van ScummVM zijn veel van deze klassiekers zonder problemen te spelen en kun je diverse filters (HQ3 is mijn favoriet) gebruiken om de oude graphics er wat minder retro uit te laten zien. Dus wat heeft deze versie aan het origineel toe te voegen? Een heleboel:
- het hele spel is opnieuw getekend in breedbeeld en met scherpere tekeningen die trouw zijn aan de originele schetsen komen
- de stemmen zijn opnieuw gedigitaliseerd en klinken kraakhelder
- verbeterde besturing, een handig menu voor je rechter muisknop en ook speelbaar met een gamepad
- audiocommentaar van onder meer Tim Schafer en Peter Chan
- ruim 50 achievements 
- verbeterde muziek, zonder de beperkingen van het origineel voor een voller en mooier geluid
- een groot aantal originele schetsen die gedurende het spelen worden ontgrendeld
Verder blijft het stomweg een van de grappigste spellen in het genre. Ook als je hem, net als ikzelf, al verschillende keren hebt uitgespeeld, hij blijft leuk. En dankzij alle verbeteringen is hij nu n√≥g leuker.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006565858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1601161059}
review:
Easily one of the best Point & Click games of all time. I fondly remember paying this game from my childhood and once I booted it up on my new PC it brought me back to those days. This was my first Point & Click Adventure game as a kid, and I couldn't be happier that they brought it to Steam, remastered. 

Even if you're not the biggest fan of Point & Click Adventure games as I am, I still recommend it, as it's incredibly fun and the puzzles are unlike any other game in the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995208231', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1691228811}
review:
It makes me so happy to have a modern version of a classic game, that doesn't break down upon booting it up. The graphic and sound remasters are amazing and I like the new UI that Double Fine have added into the game.

In regards to the game itself and reliving the good ol' days, as much as I would love to say I remember how to do everything, it's already been proven that I've forgotten so much of DOTT, so much that it's making this playthrough quite enjoyable!

Thank you, Double Fine, for making my wallet perfom a knee jerk payment. I have no regrets picking up this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971782452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1663881504}
review:
Ein Klassiker in einem neuen Glanz.
Schon damals als kleines Kind vor dem Pentium 133 gesehen und die Spielanleitung gesucht um das Password drin zusuche.
Tim Sch√§fer Meisterwerk in einem neuen Glanz und noch dazu, pers√∂nlich Remastered.
Ich bekomme jetzt tr√§nen in den Augen =)
W√§r wirklich hier einen Adventure Klassiker spielen m√∂chte, und noch dazu einer der bekanntesten. Sollte bei diesem Preis aufjedenfall sofort zu schlagen. Wundersch√∂ne und neue Grafik. In der Deutsche Version ist auch der Klassik Stil auf deutsch. Man kann wenn man will auch auf Englischer Sprachausgabe umstellen oder den Klassik Stil mit dem Remastered Sound genauso wie umgekehrt. 
Die Remastered Version in jeder in Sicht gelungen.
Ein Mango hab ich trotzdem zu bem√§ngeln. Auch wie ich dieses Spiel grad nur Abfeiern tuhe.
Ach wenn es damals genial war mit der Deutschen Sprachausgabe. H√§tte man eventuell, daf√ºr hatte man auch genug Zeit, es neu zu Synchronisieren mit Synchronsprecher. Weil ab und zu F√§llt einem schon auf das es nicht mit dem Model zusammenpasst die Synchronisation. Dadurch wirkt es Asychron.
Aber trotzdem gebe ich diesem Spiel seine 95% als Metascore.
Weil Tim Sch√§fer wieder das Kind in mir aufgeweckt hat.

Hier mein Lets Play dazu!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gSoWPu-lf-A&index=2&list=PLArck8g64IhMYjDZ3hxlU-WQij99hsBkn

review:
-14,99‚Ç¨ f√ºr ein Remaster? F*CK yeah! es ist jeden Cent wert!!-
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/25622578/] More in the Retro Curator [/url] 

Ich verneige mich vor diesem Meisterwerk!
So sieht also meine Kindheit in HD aus, immernoch zeitlos...es ist so sch√∂n!!!! :3 

Ich bin sonst kein gro√üer Fan von Remaster, gerade was die √úbers√§ttigung angeht bzw auch was als teueres Spiel verkauft wird obwohl es 1-2 Jahre alt ist. Siehe Redux oder Konsolen Ports (von PS3 auf PS4 etc.). 
ABER
Dieses Remaster ist genau das, was ich seit seeeeeeehr vielen Jahren w√ºnsche, nach dem erst Monkey Island als HD kam. ENDLICH das beste Spiel der Welt wieder auf modernen PC's mit frischem Anstrich (der nicht nur ein wie bei ScumVM einen h√§sslichen HD Eindruck macht.) und das sogar mit wundersch√∂nen Texturen und verdammt ansehnlichen Look. Zudem kann man Sound / Grafik manuell Retro oder Remaster einstellen und mit einen Tastendruck wieder das "alte Spiel" genie√üen. PERFEKT!!!!!!!!!!!!
Maniac Mansion ist nat√ºrlich auch wieder spielbar (allerdings nicht in HD, ist aber v√∂llig okay.)
√úbersichtlichkeit, Bedienung, Bonus Features incl Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten ist nochmal ein sch√∂ner Bonus. All das verleiht es noch den Feinschliff.


Somit ist es rundum perfekt und mal wieder das beste P&C Adventure. :P
Auch Grafikhuren, die das original "abschreckten" k√∂nnen bedenkenlos zuschlagen und es nachholen! Fans des Spiels sowieso!
Ich danke Lucas Arts, Tim Schafer, Dave Grossman und Double Fine f√ºr dieses Goldst√ºck auf modernen PC's / Steam! :)  

 Klare Kaufempfehlung f√ºr ALLE!!!!!!!!!
(Gerne auch mehr alte Retro Spiele auf Steam, Full Throttle - Vollgas, Toonstruck, Bad Tucker, die Larry Reihe gerade Teil 7 und viiiiiiiiiiiele mehr! - von mir aus alle originalen ohne Remaster. Auch wenn Full Throttle schonmal erw√§hnt wurde von Tim Schafer.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197977348173', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1459040535}
review:
Disclaimer: this is my first time playing Day of the Tentacle... and I generally hate point & click games.

This game is fantastic. I was a fan of Maniac Mansion back on NES and bought this game solely to play MM on Steam. (Maniac Mansion, the entire game, is featured in DOTT on a playable in game computer). But as it turns out, I don't want to play MM. I want to play Day of the Tentacle. 

The new interface is reason enough to buy this. It's the best interfact I've ever seen in a point & click game. You can hold Shift and see every single interactive part of the environment. So you won't get stuck for hours wondering what the heck you're supposed to do. And rather than the terrible old method of selecting an action from a menu that takes up half the screen... now you just click right on the object and select your action. And it usually defaults to the most useful action. Amazing interface. The fact that they included the original graphics/sound/interface from DotT really makes you appreciate how polished this new release is.

Just buy it. It's fun and easy to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018586514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1458756183}
review:
I can only say that I have very mixed feelings about this Remake of Day of the Tentacle. 
I literally grew up with the game and when I booted this up, my mind was flooded with inky memories of red mummies and hammer jokes. Ultimately, I have a few critique points: The game looks good until people begin to interact. To keep true to the original sprites and to give you the option to change to "Retro Mode" on the fly, they did not smoothen out the animations or added additinal frames, so many scenes look stiff. Further: The interface has not aged well. This game has always needed some kind of "return to Time Machine" button or a way to send stuff in bulk. I was also a bit annoyed by the way the subtitles work (I speak german as my main language, so I want to read stuff to get it). Sometimes they will stay longer than the speech and ruin the timing of jokes.
But let's ask the question: Is it good? 
And i have to admit it: Yes, this game still holds up. 
Day of the Tentacle manages to use the dreadded inventory-puzzle gameplay to its advantage by giving characters unique voices to explain the objects and an constant onslaught of hints through interaction with the environment and dialogue. It is like a Looney Tunes sketch. It has not aged perfectly but by god, there is something timeless about 3 weirdos being heroic and silly at the same time. Each of the characters has a distinct personality, way of walking and talking. The way the game uses them seriously talking about how the world is about to fall to a purple plunger with arms is hillarious and the ending made me chuckle way longer than it had any right to be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004012305', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1458709805}

STILL. A Lucasarts classic...and it has the full, original Maniac Mansion within the game as a mini-game, so you get two classics in one!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971474111', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1671607084}
review:
Maybe it's because I'm a child of the 80's. Maybe it's because I'm insanely addicted to adventure games. Or maybe it's because this was the catalyst that sparked my love for point and click adventure games, but this game still holds up in my eyes. Sure the jokes may go over the new generation of gamers' heads, but to me this game is still amazing.

This game got me not only inot PAC games, but also hits a special place in my heart as one of the inspiring factors that lead me to become a writer and game designer. The game is very beautifully crafted and if I could shake Tim Schafer's hand and tell him that I would. 

Manaic Mansion was one of those games on the NES that I loved dearly and to hear that this was the sequel to it made it all the better. This game had charm, and tentacles. The only thing I didn't like about the game was the fact that it had to end. 

Thank you Tim Schafer for bringing this classic back into my life and bringing it to a new generation of people who can see where the genre originated from. 

Hint: DO NOT FORGET TO USE ED's COMPUTER: It has the original Maniac Mansion in it!

review:
All my childood, remastered anew, this one was always my favorite adventure game of all time, even if kinda short it still the best, it has all what makes a great adventure game : funniest humor, cartoon style and goofy puzzles, i even like this one more than the monkey island series, thank you devs for filling my childhood with this, i would have never beeing the same guy if it weren't for those great games.

as for this version, it was so cool to play it with the commentary for the devs, gave me another reason to do my yearly playthrough :D

Thank you again all Lucasarts devs and Tim Schafer <3

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081930214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1477580087}
review:

Classic of classic. Here we go again! I could play without looking at the screen!

- ¬øDo you recommend the game?
A: I feel... like I could ... ¬°TAKE ON THE WORLD!
