author: {'steamid': '76561198014817484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1691172987}
review:
This is by far THE best remastered i have played from Double Fine, not that the earlier remakes aren't great I GOT THEM ALL,
but because it was my favorite game back in the day, along with Monkey Island part II wich is also a terrific remastered.
Every single frame is hand drawn and the art is poping out on your screen! wow it is breath taking to play this game 
in this quality...

Also the bonus material is so fun to watch and they put in dozens of unlocks and achievements that you want to unlock.
The menu must be the best that they made so far because it really makes me feel i play a top title and they thought of everything here. The sounds the special effects that they added, the sound stream is fabulous to says the least! 

Anyone who loves Lucas Arts games must have this one in their collection!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040427321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1458811813}
review:
A solid game, well worth the price. The remaster was flawless as far as I could see, and makes a great game even better.
I completed the game in an hour and 30 minutes, but only because I completed it before in 93. However a new player, it may take over 3 hours to complete. Don't pass this classic up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988116430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1631354286}
review:
Day of the Tentacle comes from the heyday of LucasArts when they were lord and master over the point and click adventure game, before the slow slide into "lets do everything Star Wars." I played this when it first came out in 1993 on my 486 with its brand new 16x speed CD ROM and loved it back then. 

I've waited 18 years to reply this game and haven't been disappointed. Nothing has changed except to give the graphics a new polish to meet current displays, so no more jagged pixils. It's all smooth HD graphics from here on it. The sound, music, appearence and humour are all the same. 

It also comes with Steam achievements, in game commentary and as you explore new concept art is unlocked in the main menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965057980', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1703350258}
review:
Klassikko uudessa kuoressa! Uuden version k√§ytt√∂liittym√§ on tehty ehk√§ v√§h√§n hankalan oloisesti, mutta se saattaa olla vain totuttelukysymys. Vaihto uuden ja alkuper√§isen version v√§lill√§ onnistuu lennosta ja toimii hyvin. Mukana tulee my√∂s alkuper√§inen Maniac Mansion.

√Ñl√§ ole tonnikalap√§√§!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005376219', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1458933266}
review:
The original Day of the Tentacle was probably the best point-and-click adventure game in the 90s. After playing the remastered version, I'm glad they stayed true to the graphics and controls while improving on them immensely. They also kept the easter egg where you can play Maniac Mansion, which is DOTT's predecessor game released in 1987.

Do yourself a favour: if you've never played the original, be glad that there's a remastered version that improves upon the original in every aspect and get this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198095201032', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1467377807}
review:
Souvent le point 'n click donn√© en r√©f√©rence lorsqu'on demande le pr√©f√©r√©.

A acheter uniquement si vous voulez y rejouer (ou si vous n'y avez jamais jou√©) et que vous voulez en m√™me temps montrer l'int√©r√™t pour le jeu et donc pour une √©ventuelle suite, un jour ou l'autre (Day of the Tentacle √©tant la suite de "Maniac Mansion"). Ou alors, si comme moi, vous √™tes aussi friands d'anecdotes sur la conception du jeu vu que des commentaires des d√©veloppeurs (sous-titr√©s en fran√ßais) sont disponibles.

Personnellement, je l'avais fini √† l'√©poque et j'ai pris un tr√®s grand plaisir √† y rejouer 23 ans plus tard, m√™me en le finissant d'une traite en quelques heures (j'y avais pas mal jou√© √† l'√©poque donc en gros, je me suis souvenu de 90% des √©nigmes).

La version remastered inclus, tout comme l'original, "Maniac Mansion", jouable sur l'ordinateur de Ed. La version de "Maniac Mansion" est la version "Enhanced" mais n'est pas remast√©ris√© par contre (et en anglais).

author: {'steamid': '76561198047323914', 'num_games_owned': 926, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1656092737}
review: This game made me get into game development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131284284', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1666454111}
review:
This was the first CD-Rom game I played on my old 486!  I bought the Soundblaster 16 with CD Rom just for this game!!!  I spent days configuring an AUTOEXEC.BAT file so that I could boot from a floppy to play this!  (End of trip down memory lane... I hope there are a few others out there who know what a big deal this was!)

The remastered edition is exactly as I remember it, only better!  The story is fantastic and funny, the puzzles are challenging without being overly mindbending and the updates do not change the game at all.  The interface, while completely overhauled, is intuitive and enhances the game over the original, without changing it in any way.  Thank you Tim Shafer, you truly know how to make your followers happy.  I can't wait for Full Throttle!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069060918', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1458692558}
review:
The first pc game I ever played, and probably the only one I can honestly say I haven't played in a couple decades.
Never beat it since me and the other tikes at day care had to share the computer at the time.  Nice to finally close this chapter of my life!

Looking back on it now though I'm surprised I never thought much of the depressed man attempting suicide with a novelty gun, human slavery, stabbing a clown, helping a man break into a stranger's car and microwaving a hamster until it's on the verge of exploding.

I somehow doubt I'd see similar concepts in video games at day-cares nowadays.

Shame too.  I love my dark sense of humour and this stuff is/was hilarious.

Happy trip down memory lane!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961576403', 'num_games_owned': 1375, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1688992728}
review:
G√§be es einen Ehren-Oscar f√ºr Computerspiele, Day of the Tentacle h√§tte ihn sich locker verdient. 23 Jahre hat das Adventure von Tim Schafer (Psychonauts) und Dave Grossman (Telltales Sam & Max) schon auf dem Buckel, doch von Altersschw√§che keine Spur: Die abgedrehte Zeitreise-Knobelei z√§hlt nicht nur zum Besten, was Lucas Arts je hervorgebracht hat, sie kann sich auch heute noch mit vielen modernen Adventures messen. Den Beweis daf√ºr liefert nun Double Fine, die sich von Lucas Arts die Erlaubnis holten, ein HD-Neuauflage des Kultspiels zu produzieren. Die macht zwar wenig neu, begeistert uns im Test aber gerade deshalb so wie in 1993.

Youtube Walkthrough: https://youtu.be/mjwLVaa_jmw

review:

Man wird erstmal 15 Jahre zur√ºck in seine Kindheit/Jugend zur√ºck katapultiert. Einfach der Wahnsinn. Hat irre viel Spa√ü gemacht und wieder viel gelacht. Die meisten L√∂sungsans√§tze kannte ich gar nicht mehr, weshalb es beinahe so wie ein erstes Playthrough war... Na gut, nur beinahe. 

Spiel sieht top aus, Synchro sollte man bereits kennen. Und es gibt einen Classic Spielmode im alten Stil, sowie den remastered Spielmode mit Grafik-Feinschliff. Au√üerdem kann man sich zwischen der "Verben"-Steuerung oder einer Steuerung √° la Sam and Max entscheiden.

Ein KLASSIKER: 10/10

review:
Les jeux Lucasarts des ann√©es 90 sont les meilleurs.

Il y en a pas un qui soit meilleur que l'autre.
Bref Day of the Tentacle est un tr√®s bon jeu et cette version remastered donne un bon coup de jeune √† ce jeu.

Le seul point negatif que j'ai trouv√©, c'est maniac mansion qui n'est qu'en anglais.

Aller, j'attends full throttle remastered et les indiana jones 1,2,3.
Par contre, si full throttle remastered n'est pas en full fran√ßais, je vais √™tre tr√®s d√©√ßu car le doublage √©tait/est tr√®s bon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012450682', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1692120441}
review:
I played and completed this game after its original release in 1993 so was very excited to see it return, and it was just as brilliant as i remembered it! Its a funny, mad and crazy game, the best thing now of course is that you can easily switch between new/old grapics just by pressing a button.

The puzzles are interesting and sometimes require you to think outside the box, while still making some sort of sense

A purple tentacle is trying to take over the world and you and two friends have to try and defeat him with the help of time travelling toilets, whats not to like ??

P.S did i mention how awesome this game is?

author: {'steamid': '76561198043812086', 'num_games_owned': 1888, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1458685582}
review: Gro√üartiges Remake. Es wurde nur gerade so viel verbessert wie n√∂tig war; also die Grafik und der Ton. Die Kombination aus Tastatur-K√ºrzeln und Mausbedienung gef√§llt mir gut. Alles in allem seine fuffzehn Euro wert (f√ºr das Original hab ich damals 99 DM bezahlt).

author: {'steamid': '76561198021700615', 'num_games_owned': 521, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1458940951}

author: {'steamid': '76561198195783869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1586009088}
review:
Day of the Tentacle oder kurz DOTT ist eines der besten Point and Klick Adventure von Lucas Arts und hat einen herrlich schr√§gen Humor. Als ich es im Erscheinungsjahr 1993 von zu Weihnachten f√ºr meinen 486er bekam konnte ich mich nicht losreissen und spielte es ca. 10 mal durch. Mit den Charakteren Bernard, Hoagie und Laverne muss man ja wie bekannt verhindern das Purpur Tentacle die Weltherrschaft √ºbernimmt. Die R√§tsel sind ziemlich leicht wenn man zb. Broken Sword dagegen stellt. 

Die Grafik ist sehr sch√∂n auf den Stand der Dinge gebracht worden und sieht noch immer so liebevoll wie damals aus. Der Bonus in den Spiel ist, das man Entwicklerkommentare und Konzeptbilder bekommt. 
Ich kann dieses Point and Klick Adventure jedem der schon Manic Manson gespielt hat ans Herz legen. 
(Schade das Disney Lucas Arts dicht gemacht hat.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198003497102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1700237229}
review:
One of the funniest games i've ever played and even better; it's an adventure game.
The remake is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990088225', 'num_games_owned': 1145, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1478355880}
review:
A great remaster! 

I loved this game as a kid and I appreciate the love that has gone into this remaster, it feels very polished.

The new artstyle stays very true to the orignal (it just looks like it's been done up for 1080p widescreen although every scene has been redone from scratch) 
With the touch of a button you can change straight back to the original artstyle, I found I was doing this with every new scene I entered just to appreciate what it looked like before compared to now.

The music has been redone as well, I am sure that new players of the game will prefer the new audio but due to nostalgia I prefer the original midi music, luckily you can taylor the game to your needs in the options so you can have the new artstyle with the original music if you like.

I also like that the developers have included original artwork which can be viewed in a gallery, more gets unlocked the further you progress in the game.

As for the actual game/story... It's strange and bizzare (in a good way) it has some very dark humor and you'll meet some great characters along the way, the voice acting is also great. 

This is my 2nd favorite game from Tim Schafer (Number one being Grim Fandango) and I really am happy that he is also bringing out a remaster of Full Throttle next year! I'm having a nostalgia overload with all this :) 

So if you love point and click games then you should love this game... And if this is your first time playing this game, I really do envy you!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198062162831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1458665464}
review:
Das Spiel wurde liebevoll modernisiert und hat nichts von seinem Charme eingeb√º√üt. Die Sprachausgabe ist exzellent und die Steuerung wurde f√ºr Maussteuerung und Gamepad optimiert. Die zuschaltbaren Kommentare der Entwickler bieten einen Blick hinter die Kulissen und lassen sp√ºren, wie viel Spa√ü und Liebe in den vielen Details steckt. 
Ich konnte mich noch an die vollst√§ndige L√∂sung aller R√§tsel erinnern, auch wenn ich das Spiel mindestens 10 Jahre nicht mehr gespielt habe. So originell und eing√§ngig ist die Geschichte, so verschroben die R√§tsel. Ich werde es auf jeden Fall noch mehrfach durchspielen, um all die aberwitzigen Dialoge zu verfolgen und nat√ºrlich werde ich auch noch eine Runde Maniac Mansion spielen. 
Fazit: Besser h√§tte die Hommage an das f√ºr mich beste Adventure aller Zeiten nicht in die Neuzeit √ºbertragen werden k√∂nnen. Viel Spa√ü mit Gummikotze, Stinktierkatze und Mumienspaghettifrisur!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967081751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1630377804}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969859039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1702069066}
review:
Habe mich sehr auf das Spiel gefreut, leider musste ich feststellen, dass der Sound nicht funktioniert. So kann ich keine Kaufempfehlung geben. 
Nach vielen probieren habe ich festgestellt das der Sound nur dann funktioniert wenn das Spiel √ºber Big Picture Modus gestartet wird. So kann ich auch entlich eine klare Empfehlung aussprechen und danke f√ºr die sinnfreien Kommentare, das sieht man wieder ... ach das lass ich hier lieber und schone meine Nerven :-).

review: A fantastic remaster of a blast from the past - for the price it's a very decent remaster at that. The odd visual glitch here and there, but nothing game-breaking. It still has the same style you'd expect from the old game - so don't expect this remaster to be completely modern. It's also really nice that you can switch from remastered to classic without interrupting the gameplay with a swift click of a shortcut (F1) which gets huge points from me! Overall nice music, great quality vocals and SFX - it gets an 8/10 from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993682738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1458666412}
review:
Arguably the finest game in it's genre. The plot is simple, silly and brief, reflecting a more innocent era of vidya.
It's perhaps a little too short for ¬£10 (I clocked at 3 hours, but then I also remembered a lot of the solutions), but it's still a game everybody should play at least once in their lives.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963344822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1458661654}
review:
This is how a Remastered version should be.
Lovely graphics faithful to the original and the sound and music is fantastic. Being able to play along together with dev comments is a nice addition if you have played this game many times before like I have.

To a newcomer I think the price is just right for a timeless adventure game with great production quality.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037721091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 163, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 739, 'last_played': 1527366217}
review:
Como empezar.. Day of the Tentacle es una de las mejores aventuras gr√°ficas de todos los tiempos (con permiso de Monkey Island 2 y Grim Fandango) cuyos personajes, disparatada historia y puzzles lo convirtieron en una aventura irrepetible. 
Ahora de la mano de Double Fine y su creador original llega esta version "Remastered", la cual, como su nombre indica, viene siendo una versi√≥n en HD 1:1 del original.. para lo bueno y para lo malo.

Los sprites y escenarios han sido adaptados en resoluci√≥n y detalle a las HD, moviendose los sprites de los personajes tal cual en la √©poca frame por frame... nada de nuevas animaciones, a√±adido de fluidez de las mismas, remodelados completos ni nada por el estilo ¬øesto es bueno entonces? es estupendo volver a ver este t√≠tulo 23 a√±os despues en unos estupendos HD y adaptado a imagen panor√°mica... pero se siente TAN copiado y pegado a un filtro gr√°fico HD...que al final probablemente si eres de la vieja escuela sigas prefiriendo la magia de la versi√≥n original con sus pixelazos y m√∫sica original. (La nueva versi√≥n musical REMASTERED justo ha remezclado un poco los MIDI y poco mas,quedando bastante lejos de lo que nuestra memoria recordaba).

Aun con todo se trata de una versi√≥n/filtro HD de una gran aventura gr√°fica cl√°sica que los nuevos aventureros no deberian dejar pasar, y respeta el original punto por punto y tramo por tramo. De nuevo hubiera echado en falta un lavado de cara m√°s profundo, modelados y escenarios realmente redise√±ados o actualizados, (que no readaptados en una paleta HD) musica orquestada, etc... pero evidentemente, todo no puede ser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113066687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1458727282}

Il semble aussi y avoir un probl√®me parfois le son saccade.

A cot√© de √ßa c'est toujours un r√©el plaisir, et l'interface remani√©e est vraiment top !

author: {'steamid': '76561198008626275', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1470402593}
review:
A faithful remaster of a cult classic from the 90's. The witty humour and atmosphere of the original carries over seamlessly, and the puzzles are just as 'kick-yourself' clever as they were in '93. You can also tinker with the options to make your playthrough as nostalgic as possible.

They even replaced one of the obscure portraits in the mansion with Jar Jar Binks. I'm sold.

Full Review Here

-

author: {'steamid': '76561198045804563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1458658725}
review:
Day of the Tentacle es una aventura gr√°fica de LucasArts de 1993 protagonizada por Bernard, un nerd experto en electr√≥nica que aparece como personaje seleccionable en Maniac Mansion; Laverne, una estudiante de medicina algo exc√©ntrica y Hoagie, un rockero pasota. Los tres reciben una carta del Tent√°culo Verde pidi√©ndoles ayuda para frenar los oscuros planes de dominaci√≥n del Tent√°culo P√∫rpura, quien ha perdido la cordura despu√©s de beber agua contaminada. Los tres amigos tendr√°n que viajar por el presente, pasado y futuro para salvar a la humanidad.

La historia de Day of the Tentacle es sencillamente genial y sorprende lo bien hilada que est√° con los puzles y el uso de tres personajes dentro del universo del juego, sobre todo si tenemos en cuenta que estamos ante un juego de 1993. Los personajes y di√°logos no te dejan indiferente, tenemos un mont√≥n de tipos raros y de frases ocurrentes que puedes soltar alegremente sin miedo a que te corten la cabeza, porque no podemos decir lo mismo en Maniac Mansion, ¬øverdad? Recuerdo que al terminar algunos puzles que implicaban hablar con personaje y utilizar objetos a trav√©s del tiempo flipaba, jam√°s me hab√≠a enfrentado a un aventura donde tuviera que dar tantos pasos para hacer ‚Äúalgo‚Äù sin caer en el aburrimiento. Antes de Day of the Tentacle acumulabas objetos para usarlos una o varias veces en un lugar concreto a corto plazo sin experimentar una evoluci√≥n tan significativa.

Sin duda, Day of the Tentacle es uno de esos juegos realmente bien hechos que a pesar del paso de los a√±os siempre sorprende algo de su desarrollo y, ahora, con esta Remasterizaci√≥n, los nuevos aventureros van a pasar un mont√≥n de momentos divertidos a trav√©s de tres √©pocas resolviendo puzles, hablando con curiosos personajes y viviendo aventuras contra tent√°culos malvados.
Est√°s ante un pedazo de historia del videojuego. Disfr√∫talo.

[url=http://lafortalezadelechuck.com/analisis/analisis-day-of-the-tentacle-remastered/]AN√ÅLISIS COMPLETO EN LA FORTALEZA DE LECHUCK[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198067029377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1458880406}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is a point and click adventure game with the humor and charm that is characteristic of its creator, Tim Schafer.  The style of gameplay and puzzle solving in this game were a staple of my childhood and they bring back a rush of nostalgia.  The dialogue is clever and funny.  The puzzles are intuitive and well-thought out.  And the art gives me the feeling that I am exploring a 1990's cartoon.

In summary, if you would like be filled with warm and fuzzy feelings (in a socially appropriate manner) and have lots of laughs along the way then play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000757304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1584362996}
review:
Day of the Tentacle is my favorite game of all time.  As a kid, I invested hours, days, weeks obsessing over the story as told by my 386 IBM with 4MB of RAM!  Maniac Mansion, Sierra quest games, and other Lucas Arts adventure titles are close to my heart as well.  What a day to be alive to see DOTT remastered!  As a fan, the commentary is fantastic, and the concept art is infinitely entertaining to explore.

That all being said, I‚Äôm a bit disappointed in the updated art and animation quality.  The lackluster, vector look comes off as lazy interpretation of the source art.  And because of this, I often find myself playing with the original, pixelated graphics.  Which is fine by me.

Although the new art didn‚Äôt impress me, I have to commend the team putting the time and effort into rereleasing this amazing game.  I‚Äôm jealous of the new generation of gamers that get to experience Day of the Tentacle for the first time!

author: {'steamid': '76561198006098952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1458864322}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046434571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1659910915}
review:
It's a given that Day of the Tentacle is one of my favorite games considering that my Steam name is Purple Tentacle (as of right now). I was a huge fan of Maniac Mansion, so my excitement was  palpable when they originally announced that Day of the Tentacle was being released as a sequel. PCs had just started using that new fangled technology called CD-ROMs which allowed them to make a "talkie" version of the game, which was mindblowing at the time. Fortunately, the game lived up to the hype, as it's one of the most revered adventure games ever written. It's a mix of weird b-sci-fi horror with plenty of humor packed into puzzles which fall inbetween not impossibly difficult, yet not so obvious that the challenge is lacking.

Now, as far as the Remastered aspect is concerned, Double Fine has done a fantastic job! A number of people were skeptical that the game was just put through a filter (like you'd find in the Lucas-Arts based emulator SCUMMVM), but after playing the game, I can say that this is not the case. There's a number of little details added that those filters can't add. On top of which, there are a number of little additions that add even more humor to the game, such as being able to read the actual letter Green Tentacle sent to Bernard. There's also some editions to the sound, such as an improved soundtrack (I kind of like the charm of the original, but that might just be nostalgia talking). The original was General MIDI, although I'm not sure what the new version falls under (prerecorded synth? I dunno.).

Finally, there's some nice bonuses like developer's commentary, concept artwork, and I even enjoy the various hidden achivements that come from messing around in game. The UI is also improved, allowing for full screen presentation. I'm currently using the Steam Controller with it, and it feels natural.

All in all, a really well done version of the game! Finally happy to have an official rerelease of the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995369044', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1659333872}

Bisher habe ich es nur die erste halbe Stunde gespielt, aber es gef√§llt mir schon sehr gut genau mein Humor und wirklich liebevoll ins 21. Jahrhundert portiert.

Wer sich einen kleinen Einblick verschaffen will, kann sich gern mein Video ansehen:

author: {'steamid': '76561197964702528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1458718012}
review:
As good as it was years ago, and then some!

Keep in mind that this game contains a fair bit of 90s pop culture so newer audiences may not pick up on everything. 

If you've never played a point-n-click before this is a great starting point, as well as one of the best point-n-click adventures of all time.

Pros:
Maniac Mansion!
Optional Remastered Soundtrack
Commentary
Great improved visuals
Plays well with a controller
On-the-fly graphics change settings like Monkey Island 1 and 2


Cons:
Some of the original sound effects are no longer present and have been replaced

author: {'steamid': '76561197969340468', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1458662029}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=So0IQoyTWT4

[h1]Overview[/h1]

A letter comes to Bernard‚Äôs home with a request from help from his good friend, Green Tentacle. Bernard once went to The Mansion to rescue a friend five years ago, but it looks like it‚Äôs time for him to go‚Ä¶ ‚ÄúBACK TO THE MANSION.‚Äù Bernard returns to the Mansion to free his friend, but he also makes the mistake of releasing the clinically insane Purple Tentacle. Purple Tentacle had drink of the sewage flooding into the water below the Mansion. He was already pretty crazy but now he‚Äôs grown arms and vows to take over the world. 

The Mad Scientist, Dr. Fred, comes up with a scheme to easily recover Purple Tentacle. It involves sending Bernard and his two friends, Hoagie, and Laverne back in time to stop Purple from drinking from the sewage. He sends the three back in time but somehow skimped on one vital component of the Time Machine‚Ä¶ the power source. The Imitation Diamond blows which sends Hoagie to the Past and Laverne to the Future. Bernard must now discover a way to stop Purple Tentacle and also rescue Laverne and Hoagie in the process. 

[h1]Visuals[/h1]

Since this is a remaster, let's get right into what's changed from the original. The first thing we'll notice is the upscale to wide-screen and beautiful 1080p. Second, we'll notice the distinct upgrade of the character models and the environments. Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle always had beautiful visuals, but now it looks like a cartoon come to life. 

One of the biggest differences from the original is the complete overhaul of the interaction system. The interactive words have been removed from the UI and replaced with a selection wheel. It's a lot easier than dragging the mouse down to a slew of words to interact with an object you've already clicked on. It also cleans up the lower half of the screen to allow us more access to the glorious visuals. The sound has been greatly improved when compared to the classic version. The midi tracks were completely remastered and the voice work is much clearer. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

A couple of slice of life changes didn't make it into the remaster. Mainly, that you can't interact with a new item once the characters begin walking to a new area. You have to wait for Bernard and is friends to finish walking before selecting something new. Secondly, there are a few sounds that haven't been updated in the Remaster. There is a room with a snoring man and Bernard even comments on how loud it is, but the sound doesn't exist in the game. It's a little bit of a nag but it happens in enough places that it's noticeable. 

Nothing has been altered much in the form of gameplay from the classic release. It's still a wonderfully designed adventure title with absolutely hilarious cutscenes accompanying every puzzle. Just be warned that it's still as much of a classic adventure game as it has ever been. Most of the puzzles are fairly easy to figure out but there are some really obscure hints for some others. 

Day of the Tentacle is not solely to blame for this. A lot of classic titles like these give a hint once and expect you to remember what that person said even hours later in the game. These moments happen quite often and since Day of the Tentacle is fairly open ended. You'll find yourself with tons of items and no idea how to use them. Some hints are also incredibly vague, like the mention of a car wash bringing rain that happens in the future. However, the actual car(t) washing needs to happen in the past. At least the design team pokes fun at these hints with achievements regarding some of the more insane hints. 

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

The best thing about Day of the Tentacle has always been the hilarious script and interaction with the various characters. The jokes still stand up well for this day and age as I found myself chuckling from the multitude of interactions with the cast. I couldn't help but laugh at teeth chattering George Washington and the constant updates on Purple Tentacles' rise to power. For all the upgrades that the remaster performs, it definitely didn't need any in the humor and story department. 

Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle Remastered looks amazing, sounds amazing, and has a hilarious storyline to keep the gameplay moving forward. It can also be slightly ambiguous puzzle wise but we're all in luck that the game is old enough to have tons of guides available. This is one of those games that makes me miss the Lucasarts that used to make these awesome games. 

Day of the Tentacle is one of those games that innovated the adventure genre. It‚Äôs funny that this game from 1993 has more ground-breaking measures than a lot of adventure games released in 2016.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048085449', 'num_games_owned': 1092, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1458746852}
review:
https://youtu.be/BwRonlg8mDM
[i]Game:[/i] Day of the Tentacle Remastered
[i]Genre:[/i] Point-and-click Adventure
[i]Developer:[/i] Double Fine Productions
[i]Publisher:[/i] Double Fine Productions
[i][u]Copy supplied by developer[/u][/i]

[b]Day of the Tentacle Remastered[/b] is the remastered version of the classic 1993 LucasArts point-and-click adventure game, developed and published by Double Fine Productions. I grew up playing this game, and is easily one of my all-time favourite adventure games.

[h1]STORY[/h1]
Five years after the events of [i]Maniac Mansion[/i], the evil Purple Tentacle drinks toxic sludge from a river behind Dr. Fred's laboratory. He grows a pair of arms, develop vastly increased intelligence and a thirst for global domination. Now it's up to Bernard Bernoulli and his friends Laverne and Hoagie to go back to the mansion of the crazy Edisons to stop the tentacle from taking over the world. Dr. Fred sends them back in time with a time machine, which doesn't work, and now the three friends are stuck in the past, present, and future.
This is one of the most classic premises for what many consider to be LucasArts' finest game: a fun, enjoyable, easy to follow story full of hilarious jokes, great visual gags and many references and easter eggs to other games. However, I wouldn't be surprised if many new gamers (and damn do I feel old writing this) won't find this story funny and find it kind of bad.

[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]
The new, updated graphics look spectacular: in every room every single detail has remained untouched, and the animations and characters have never looked better.
Also, just like in the remastered versions of the first two [i]Monkey Island[/i] games, you can seamlessly change the game from its new look to the old-school SCUMM interface, giving that extra nostalgic feel and taking us back to our childhood.

[h1]GAMEPLAY[/h1]
When playing with the new graphics, a wheel opens up every time you click on an object, for a better and more accessible experience for gamepad users. However, I found it very easy to misclick your actions, and I often found myself using an object instead of examining it. Thankfully, there is always the classic and reliable SCUMM interface as well as keyboard shortcuts that make everything easier.
The main feature that makes the gameplay more interesting compared to most other point-and-click games, is that you can send different items to the characters through your time machine/toilet, and changing something in the past shows its consequences in the future. Even for todays standards, it's a pretty cool mechanic.

[h1]CHALLENGE[/h1]
As much as I love this game, I can't deny that it is not easy. It is actually very much a frustrating experience, just like with most LucasArts games: most of the puzzles require some incredibly weird and downright ideotic thinking, and I am not ashamed at admitting that I had to look up a walkthrough on more than one occasion out of sheer desperation. But, thankfully, there is the possibility to highlight every usable item in each room, so at least there isn't pixel-hunting.

[h1]SOUND[/h1]
The original voice acting and sound effects all come back with a bang, while the soundtrack has been remastered, and most of the tracks are better than in the original. I highly recommend buying it if you can!

[h1]REPLAYABILITY[/h1]
While there are a lot of concept arts and achievements to unlock (and not all story related), the game doesn't really offer much new when you play it again.

Overall, this is a great remastered version of one of the best and funniest adventure games of all time. Highly recommended to old-school gamers and fans of the original.

[h1]Story: 8.5
Graphics: 9.5
Gameplay: 8.5
Challenge: 8
Sound: 9
Replayability: 6.5

[b]ENJOYMENT: 8.5
FRUSTRATION: 8[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002761589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1458869371}
review:
This game was a huge part of my childhood, as were other Lucasarts adventure games, so it's difficult to be unbiased. I'll try my best though.

A trip to Wikipedia or Google will tell you how influential this game was at the time and its importance to the point and click adventure, so I won't waste time with that. The remaster really does well in capturing the art and music style of the original game without deviating too far and is quite suitable. Eliminating the original 'verb and inventory' interface at the bottom of the screen dedicates more space to the actual game which is a plus, as it holds up quite well even on large screens.

Point-and-clicks might not be as prominent in the current generation (aside from Telltale games) but give it a try if the style of gameplay is something you're interested in. Might not be for everyone, but if you're looking for a humourous game with over-the-top characters, look no further.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011861037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1475481476}
review:
Video Version: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qQOxJEqkLBA

Review code was provided by the developer.

Before I get into the full review, I need you to understand that Day of the Tentacle is a game from my childhood.  My parents would sit at the computer with my brothers and I all huddled around a CRT monitor yelling at mom to try different combinations of items or click on certain things, in an excited way, not a mean way.  The nostalgia is huge here for me, just like it was for Monkey Island.  However, this also means that because the game is important to me, I‚Äôm holding Double Fine to a high standard.

Day of the Tentacle from a story perspective is ridiculous.  Dr. Fred Edison appears first in the game Maniac Mansion, along with some of his family and tentacles that he had created which were in that game, devoid of any personality.  DoTT, being a sequel to Maniac Mansion revolves around Purple and Green tentacle.  Purple drinks some toxic sludge from the back of Edison‚Äôs house and becomes evil, even growing these cute little T‚Äôrex arms and he then goes on to take over the world.

This is the pure essence of a point and click adventure game.  You pick up items deemed pick-up-able by the devs and rub them together with other objects in hopes of combining logic and dumb luck to stumble on what the devs were thinking at the time.  For those who have never played a game like Day of the Tentacle, these types of games are based on inventory management and progression through the story comes down to using the right item in the right circumstance.  And to keep with the design consistency we‚Äôve seen since the Monkey Island and Grim Fandango remasters, you can hotswap back and forth between the original and remastered versions by pressing F1.

You play as three characters in the same world area but separated by time.  Bernard, the stereotypical pocket protector geek in the present, Hoagie the rotund metal head 200 years in the past and Laverne the utterly bonkers girl 200 years in the future.  And the entire game revolves around Dr. Fred Edisons mansion, how it looked during those various time periods and how actions in each era cause changes in the other times.  For example, Fred has two identical twin ancestors who are only distinguishable because one is right handed and the other left.  By swapping out a right handed hammer for a left handed hammer, see?  I told you it was ridiculous, you can make a statue that is in the present day mansion swap right and left arm positions, a rather important change.

And one of the beautiful pieces of the design is that unlike many other point and clicks, Day of the Tentacle offers a significant portion of the game that is non-linear.  Controlling three characters in three separate eras allows for a fair bit of player discretion and while the ultimate actions are all the same, for the most part you will often have somewhere else you can go solve a puzzle if your current task is proving difficult.

The puzzles in the game is identical to the original.  What is new is a complete rebuild of all of the graphical assets.  Double Fine did a very good job of sticking to the essence of what made the art style so effective and fun in this game.  It remains stylized but updated to match current day computer expectations as far as a cartoon look for a video game.  The characters are goofy looking, intentionally so and very little in the world involves right angles, and just looks enjoyably wacky as a result.

They have also rebuilt the user interface.  The original Day of the Tentacle used a bottom section of the screen to contain your inventory, the action words you would use to interact with the world and also the character swap buttons.  You can use that original style UI as they did redo the visuals if you want, or you can use the new UI that was added which puts your inventory into a hover to open button in the bottom left of the screen.  This new UI also lets you right click on items and choose actions from a dial.  It is just as effective but frees up significant screen space that was previously unused for game art.

In addition to the graphical side, unless I miss my mark, the audio has been remastered.  The voices and some of the sound effects are the same, but the quality scaled up from the original recordings.  New music has been added in place of the original audio as well, with rerecorded versions of songs and a number of other sound assets.
Beyond the remastered art and music, they‚Äôve also includes some nice bonus material in the form of concept art that unlocks as you play and developer commentary which can be turned on and listened to while playing.  Both of these are nice little features for the nostalgia buffs and also perhaps for budding game developers who enjoy seeing behind the curtain of the finished product.

As far as game options, there is little to speak of.  You can select fullscreen, change music, voice and sound effects independently.  You can also select the original or remastered art and music if you wish inside the options as well as swapping between the bar or dial UI.  They included a controls screen that has all of your non-rebindable key controls.  It does support controllers which while awkward, isn‚Äôt ultimately a problem because very little in the game is time sensitive requiring fast reactions.  There is one section with Ben Franklin that could cause controller players some trouble, but by the time you get to that bit, you should be pretty comfortable with the controller interface.

What is my conclusion?  All in all, much like the new Monkey Island versions, Day of the Tentacle Remastered is an extremely faithful rebuild of a classic point and click adventure game.  There is nothing here that made me question any design choices that they went with.  It looks great, is still a blast to play through and for those of us who have played it before, hits all of the right nostalgia buttons.  If you enjoy point and clicks, this needs to be in your game library.  If you‚Äôre not sure, it is an excellent example of one of the most popular genres of games in the early 90s and is a great experience in that regard as well.  Though, if you‚Äôre young enough to have never used a VHS tape in your life, you may want to google what SP and EP related to VCRs mean.  It will save you some pain.
